Reviews.Title: “Great update”
Reviews.Author: Jaybee1972
Reviews.Content: With the Reno almost done, the lobby and rooms are great / bathroom was very small and I hate that there is no minibar just a fridge - this needs to be fixed it's crazy. Wireless is ok and I'll return

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: LuciArlingtonHeights
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is in a terrific location, but the lobby is very overcrowded. Rooms are fairly large for a city location, and the beds are very comfortable. One thing that you should know if you are planning on keeping bags with the bell captain upon check-out - there is a $2 per bag fee. I believe this to be rather distasteful, since it is a coutresy at check-in when they do not have a room ready for you.

Reviews.Title: “execellent to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: Stephen S
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and execellent area for stay. Hotel needs to improve on having a much bigger choice of foods - too many politically correct foods at hotel!! Employees are execellent. No swimming pool at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Sportsfan1179
Reviews.Content: Another Big East tournament weekend... Rooms on the small side.. as soon as you enter the room one bed was right there. There was a refridgerator in the room but although it was on (warm in back) it never really got cold. There were also some weird power outages,.. as if we had blown a fuse? It was interesting for my friend in the shower at the time. Beds not really comfortable and pillows were awful, fluffy until you laid down then nothing to them..It is convenient location for the the train etc but but more of a business hotel.. Next time I'm in NYC I'll probably stay closer to times square.. bright spot Jillian at front desk was great! as were other front desk personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Jalapenomom
Reviews.Content: Next door to Grand Central Station, getting around the city is very easy from this location. Concierge staff is great. Check in service, after you wait through the lines, is ok. We were offered our choice of a view or space. We opted for view, but should have said space. We expected the room to be small, so that was no surprise. The bathroom was a shock. When placing the toilet someone should have tried to sit down! We are average sized people and the entire left side of our bodies were completely shoved against the vanity unless we sat sideways with our feet in the tub. Unless you like feather pillows, bring your own!

Reviews.Title: “As always...this hotel is THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: ritaNovato
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 delightful days here for about the 10th time in the last 20 years. Just completed a fab remodel...My room was at the very end of hall and wow, when I opened the door I was blown away by the way it was decorated! Hotel is next to Grand Central, pleasant walk to museums, pier, park...and a new improved Times Square...as a shopper...I was in Heaven when I discovered a Forever 21 in Times Square...which had 3 or 4 floors...and was open 'till 2:00 am :) Had every meal on property and loved every server and dish I ordered!!!

Reviews.Title: “an expensive disappointment”
Reviews.Author: cherylrf
Reviews.Content: Very "hip, tecno, modern" hotel but not a place to go to relax. Just turning on the lights or adjusting the automatic shades was a challance. NO way to leave a night light on unless you cosider 5 green dots of light a night light. Can't even crack the closet door open because when you turn off lights they all go off. No clock in room, just an alarm that you must set but the directions didn't match the device. After paying for the room, additional charge for internet ($19.95 per day)

Reviews.Title: “Good value right next to grand central station!”
Reviews.Author: Peteshell12
Reviews.Content: Rooms are modern and clean. Breakfast is also very tasty. The only criticism I have is that the foyer gets really busy at times with functions, so it doesn't feel like its a private hotel at times. That being said the location is convenient and right near grand central station and the Chrysler building.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: HannahBee123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a girls getaway to New York City. We got a good rate through hotels.com. Overall, I was very impressed with this hotel. It is very centrally located and right next to Grand Central Station -- making subway travel very convenient. Many sights are within walking distance, and almost everything accessible by a $7 or less cab fare. The lobby is always buzzing with hotel guests and decorated with modern decor. Self-service kiosks made check-in a breeze. Our room was a king room located on the 17th floor. The elevators could be a long wait sometimes, but it wasn't too bad. The room was nicely appointed with a low sitting bed, a modern chair (not comfy), and a flat screen TV. We were happy with the size of the room (considering this is NYC). The bathroom was small, and the sink was awkwardly placed with a tiny, tiny bowl. You would get very wet trying to wash your face! But all in all, a great room and a good value. The staff were very accommodating and helpful. Everything we asked for was promptly delivered. We were even allowed to check-in early and check-out late.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and location - but little else”
Reviews.Author: Robert L
Reviews.Content: The best that can be said for the Grand Hyatt is the location. Being on 42nd Street and right next to Grand Central Station makes it excellent for sightseers and other visitors to New York. The issues with the hotel are minor, but numerous, so they cumulative affect was notable. The lobby area was, between 8am and 11pm, swamped with large parties of visitors either waiting to be picked up or generally chatting. This made moving down the one set of escalators to street level a constant battle (the stairs were closed for repairs). And having to break through the packs of smokers standing outside of the main door was a real issue. It ended up as a daily battle. It became even worse when factoring in the number of guests arriving with suitcases. The large groups of smokers also resulted in the lobby and bar area smelling like an ash tray as second hand smoke wafted in. Another issue was having to queue for over 40 minutes to leave luggage on the day of checkout. The lack of space in the lobby and lack of porters meant that the queue snaked around the lobby area. And then we were confronted with having to pay $2 before the porters would accept a piece of 'left' luggage. I suspect that they charge for 'left' luggage because the service is so bad that they can't rely on tips. The 'market place' area was also limited. After paying for a cup of tea we were then told they they were out of tea. It seems incredible that the central food outlet in a hotel this big was so poorly managed and stocked. The final issue was with the room. Whilst the king size bed was good, the bathroom was incredibly small - I'm not sure larger people could squeeze into the gap in which the toilet was located and I had difficulty reaching the toilet paper that was located behind the toilet. The final issue with the room was the interconnecting door. There was no sound proofing and I had to listen to my neighbours at all hours - just talking - fortunately!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Billytay
Reviews.Content: Just got back from four days in the Big Apple staying with Wife and two friends at the Grand Hyatt. We had a packkge organised through BA who recommended the GH and it was the perfect location for getting out to see the main attractions such as Top of the Rock , Statue of Liberty and Times Square . Its right by Lexington Avene and Grand Central Station so also great for getting around and shopping . We stayed on the exceutive floor which was well worth the extra for unlimited drinks and snacks at anytime and a super breakfast all included . Take a good pair of shoes and plenty of dollars and you will have a great time .

Reviews.Title: “Please stay anywhere else, motel 6 would be great!”
Reviews.Author: shanespice
Reviews.Content: We checked in thinking it would be a great hotel and we were told it was right off broadway. It is actually several blocks from broadway. We checked in at 4pm and was told they were upgrading us to a king suite. We were excited until we realized that this meant we were going to have one king bed and two rollaways for our 4 adults. We figured we could deal with that. At midnight when we returned, we had a single rollaway and when we called for another we were told we were only allowed one per room. After arguing with them we were told we would get one right away. At 1am we called again and finally got one. No pillow, one sheet, no blanket, and no blanket for the other rollaway. We asked for blankets and after another epic wait, we were told they had no more. We were exhausted and tired of arguing with them. The next day we left a note hoping for some blankets but they never came by to clean the room so obviously did not get the note. When we called again they sent us a few sheets (after another epic wait). I don't feel like I am unreasonable on my hotel requests, a nice warm bed that is in my room when I arrive is not a lot to ask for. I suppose that was too much to ask for at this place. As I said before, the motel 6 would be great by comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt- Location, Location, Location, and Comfort Too”
Reviews.Author: BWeissman
Reviews.Content: Close friend treated us to a night here for a girls weekend in NYC. Near lots of what we travel to NYC for, especially the shopping. Short cab ride to the theater district, Metropolitan Museum of Art and Madison Ave. shopping, a huge plus for four women wanting to do a lot in two days. Nice lobby. Check- in was automatic with a kiosk type stand like those used in airports. Room was small but very clean, with two double beds. Beds comfortable. Housekeeping was efficient; on a busy Saturday we called for extra pillows and towels and got them about ten minutes later. Did not use restaurants or room service.

Reviews.Title: “For Hyatt Rewards junkies only”
Reviews.Author: emma123
Reviews.Content: Located on busy 42nd street in the middle of everything, this huge conference/tour group hotel thrums with people coming and going. Having recently undergone a massive remodel to compete wirh hipper hotels, the lobby decor is grand and stark in black, whites and grays. Impressive sculptures are photo op worthy and tourists of every nationality wait patiently for their chance. The rooms are fine for NYC hotel standards - meaning sleek and small. My room had a queen-sized bed, not a king, for example, and no view to speak of. But i was there on business and really only needed to sleep there, which I did well, thanks to the comfortable bed and zero noise. The bar and restaurant are perfectly good if you don't feel like venturing out, but obviously there are hundreds of restaurants within 10 minutes walk. Another perk is a 24-hour market in the lobby, although there also is a Duane Reade drug store/food market right next door. As someone who has stayed in dozens of NYC hotels, I chose the Hyatt this time to boost my rewards points and it was just fine. If you don't care about the points, there are so many other options.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel location”
Reviews.Author: ManiBagga
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location... nice lobby... No problems here.. rooms are nice... Updated decor.. Recommended... Only 1 tiny bad feedback... housekeeping is a little sloppy...but nothing to bad...

Reviews.Title: “Lots of upgrades in remodeled rooms”
Reviews.Author: GHamp23
Reviews.Content: This is one of my go to spots while staying in NYC. Grand Central, with access to all subway lines, is right below it so you can take a subway to the office or activities versus wasting time in traffic in a cab. It is also a nice pleasant walk to catch a show on the West side. The remodeled rooms are very relaxing. Plus there is a fantastic gym with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tara P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in mid-town Manhattan, and right above Grand Central Station. In terms of being in the center of the action, and easy to get around from, it is excellent. Rooms are OK.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Grand”
Reviews.Author: JJTravlr
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient, but otherwise this hotel is very average with lots of kinks to work out. Looks like the lobby has been renovated fairly recently and it is pretty nice, though not very smartly utilized. The hotel lobby shop is convenient and has a good selection of drinks and snacks. The lobby bar is OUTRAGEOUSLY expensive, even by New York standards. I was shocked because it was just an average hotel bar. The rooms are hit or miss. On one occasion, I had a small room with the bed very close to the front door - you could hear every voice or footstep in the hallway. The second time I had a larger room and the noise level was a bit better. Both times the bathrooms were horribly crowded and poorly designed. The glass shelf over the sink prevents you from being able to wash your face and splash water to rinse it. There was very little counter space for toiletries. Both times the heating/cooling system was inadequate. On one stay it was scorching hot warm in the room and it simply wouldn't cool down (this was in the winter!). In the end, I wouldn't stay there again. There are so many business-class hotels in New York and the Grand Hyatt gives me nothing to set itself apart from the pack save the location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with stylish and sizable rooms”
Reviews.Author: SianElin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the Grand Central terminal so convenient for trains and all the restaurants and takeouts. It is also very close to Bryant Square, a New York gem, especially at Christmas when there are stalls selling foods and crafts and an ice rink. It is also only 5 minutes walk from the Empire State and convenient for 5th Ave. The room was very stylish and contemporary with a seating area, fridge, tv and plenty of wardrobe and drawer space. We had a window overlooking the Chrysler Building. The staff were polite, welcoming and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Still good, but not as pleasant as previous stays”
Reviews.Author: cyberluddite
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt New York is pretty much my default choice of places to stay in Manhattan, and I've stayed there several times and always been pleased. Having said that, my last stay there was probably my least pleasant one, and there were some glitches. First, upon arriving at about 9:00 pm on a Tuesday night, I was informed that class of the room I had booked well in advance--one with a king bed--was not available, and that I would have to take one with two double beds instead. Because double beds tend to be 6' long and I'm 6'4", it isn't comfortable for me to sleep in a bed in which my feet hang over the edge--which is why I reserved a king--so I objected to this. The desk clerk did accomodate me, and moved some other unlucky guest's reservation from a king to double beds, and gave me their reservation instead. Upon arriving at my room (on one of the lowest guest room floors--the 14th, if I recall correctly), I was disappointed to see that it was much smaller than the rooms I had been given in the past (though still pretty spacious by typical Manhattan hotel standards), and that dit had only one tiny window facing the center of the hotel that was always in shadows, so even at high noon there was no natural lighting and the room was extremely dark without all the lights turned on. But worse, there was a distinct cigarette smell, despite the room being on a non-smoking floor. I went down to the front desk to notify them of this--not so much to complain as to let them know that the smell was there when I arrived so that nobody accused ME of the being the one to smoke in the room, and the desk clerk apologized and said that he could probably move me to another room the next day, but not that night. He also gave me a $60 food credit to the hotel restaurant for the inconvenience, which was nice, so I enjoyed a nice dinner. The next morning, the smoke smell seemed to be gone, so I didn't ask to be moved. But when I arrived back at the room that night, the smell was back--and that was the pattern the next couple of days of my stay, too. I assume that there is a smoking floor/room directly above or below that one, and the smell seeps in at night when there's been enough smoking on that floor throughout the day, and dissipates overnight when people are sleeping and not smoking. Otherwise, the room was as comfortable and quiet and I have come to expect from this hotel, and as always, you can't beat the location and nearby amenities. Though this wasn't the best stay I've had here, I think this was an abberration, and I won't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “At The Crossroads of the World”
Reviews.Author: LSK09
Reviews.Content: The newly renovated Grand Hyatt above Grand Central Station in New York City is a very exciting place to stay. The lobby is always very crowded with a huge group of hotel guests, business conference attendees, etc. Last week school children from across the globe attended a model United Nations at this hotel and the lobby was filled with diverse middle school children all dressed in suit and tie or dress and hose, beautifully behaved and very excited to be there. The rooms are small to average, pleasingly renovated and extremely comfortable and quiet. I enjoyed my stay immensely and will surely be back because the location, right above Grand Central Station, is superb for travel and the dining choices and shopping are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Beautiful Indoor Areas”
Reviews.Author: PleaseDoStare
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at the Grand Hyatt! Everything was so accessible since Grand Central Station is your neighbor. There are many restaurants within walking distance or you can always catch a cab at the front. The place just got remodeled so, it is brand spanking new. The rooms where spacious, comfy, and even had walk in closets (a girls dream come true). The shampoo & conditioner & lotion they provide are the best and they smell amazing as well (cucumber scented). The rooms have a mini fridge and a great blowdryer! Overall pleasant, hassle free experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - good value”
Reviews.Author: BobG499
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in hypo-allergenic room. Excellent choice if you have allergy problems. Housekeeping staff need to stock this type of room with non-scent toiletries!!! Busy, large hotel, good service, many facilities, great location next to Grand Central train terminal and Chrysler building. Fantastic breakfast/lunch choices in train station but good food choices in hotel too. Easy walk to Broadway or 5th avenue shopping in good weather but also right at subway stop too for access to whole city. Rooms very small and disappointing if you have stayed at any Grand Hyatt international locations and especially tiny compared to Asian city locations but this is New York and hotel caters to business traveller. Beds very good, room quiet, windows open a little bit if required and rooms have all necessary features such as safe, large TV, etc. I thought it was good value for a New York hotel and will stay again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good but some suggestions to make it even better”
Reviews.Author: eTurboNews
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt New York several times. The new Grand Club is very nice, the breakfast selection for the complimentary continental breakfast is good. The gym on the top floor is nice if you're just wanted a hick work. It would be nicer to add a jacuzzi, steam room or perhaps a pool, but this s Manhattan. I stayed t several different rooms before, but this time my room was not really designed for a business traveler. I would have loved to have a desk with a phone and convenient plugs for my computer. As with many other hotels, the Internet system does not allow to access our own server to send emails, so I had to call tech support every day to open up my IP. Tis is not a specific Hyatt problem, but a provider issue. The staff was helpful. I would have loved to have a minibar or at least some bottled water at night, but again this is not Singapore, Dubai or London . It's New York and the substandard US hotels get away with these days compared to the rest of the world. Overall I enjoyed my stay, can't complaint about this excellent location in the center of the Big Apple

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: michaelthornton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a trip to NY for the new year holidays ('06/'07). The hotel location is excellent for sight seeing and travelling the subway system. The rooms are a good size for NY and are nicely appointed with comfortable beds. We stayed on their executive floor for a few dollars more, and it really is worth the extra money. There is a concierge on this floor that can help with all matters and there is also a small dining area with snacks, drinks and other foods that are complimentary which is great to have while on a busy holiday. To be honest I was not expecting much from this hotel but was pleasantly surprised by it and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice people and great location”
Reviews.Author: Hitman777
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, right next to grand central station. The staff was very friendly and accommidating. The beds are a little small, but we had never been to NY City before so maybe all hotel rooms are like that. The restaurant was good, we ate breakfast there every morning. There was a small problem with an article of clothing that had been stuffed down in a couch that my daughter found by accident, but the manager came up to the room to discard the item and made it right with us. All in all we had a great stay there and would rec commend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved”
Reviews.Author: Thomas M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in the past and it was always shabby. They have renovated it and the rooms are much nicer. Public spaces are better as well. Worth re-trying if you were disappointed in previous stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sniderjennifer
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 loved this hotel. It's clean, upscale, and close to all that Manhattan has to offer. We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: POOLIEJOOLIE
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Hyatt and we were very impressed. Despite check-in not being until 4pm the hotel allowed us to check in at 2 which was great after a long flight. We had a very comfortable twin room on the 31st floor. I cannot comment on the restaurant facilities in the hotel but we can recommend the 24 hour "Market" store in the foyer for snacks and hot drinks. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: minicooperdad
Reviews.Content: Right near Grand Central Station in NYC on the East Side. Ultra modern hotel, almost too modern. The room was a little cramped and the bathroom even more so. The sink was so small you could hardly shave without creating a swamp on the floor. Even so, comfortable room with a big TV. View from my room was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Big convention experience”
Reviews.Author: Tishinha
Reviews.Content: I don't have any real complaints about this hotel but it is not one I would choose to stay in again. Too big and too many people! The rooms are large and comfortable with very comfortable beds. But then they ruin it with a sink which has the bathroom ledge sticking so far out over it your hit your head when you brush your teeth! Other niggles, no coffee machine, no mini bar (but a fridge if you want to shop outside), expensive very limited room service menu. I know some of these complaints may seem petty, after all the 24/7 quality of NY food shopping is on your doorstep. But after a long flight, on business trip it just wasn't what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - not impressive- but services....”
Reviews.Author: 111Florin
Reviews.Content: Nice, elegant hotel. But a very rude service. I asked to support me for some tickets and direction and they asked me to reserve by myself. Unpleasant experience. On top of everything they put me to pay for keeping my luggage after the check-out (the first time ever in 25 years of traveling around the world) and also they taxed me for keeping my Amazon orders for 16 hours... Incredible and rude

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, needed a facelift”
Reviews.Author: Loves2TravelALOT_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a large structure next to Grand Central station. Its very modern and sleek looking but the room I had was tiny. The bathroom was so small that I can't imagine if a large person tried to use it how they would fit . The toilet paper holder was behind the toilet so it required a contorted effort to get the paper. The closet was quite large but I'd guess the square footage of the room to be about 175. The carpet was pulling up and the hallway carpet stained. I asked another person who was on business there if their room was bigger and I was told the same of that persons room. One the second night, a group of loud partygoers was returning to their rooms at 1:00 AM, and I could hear all of their loud laughter and hallway talk. Not a quiet place. I stayed two nights and came back to my room the second day to find a note indicating that due to plumbing fixes needed at Grand Central, the hot water would not be in service from 10PM until 6AM the following day. Wow, all this for the bargain price of $320 a night? When I checked out, I mentioned the inconvenience of no hot water and asked for some relief on the bill. It was obvious many customers must have mentioned it because they quickly gave me the internet free for the two days, a value of $35.00 and seemed relieved I didn't ask for more. Fair? You decide. I've stayed at the Hilton, Times Square before and it was much nicer- bigger, cleaner room.

Reviews.Title: “Location Key for Family of 4”
Reviews.Author: sddk31
Reviews.Content: It's situated next to Grand Central Station so all of the attractions were 2-3 subway rides away. The hotel beds and rooms were great. We had the 2 queen bed room on the club level. We didn't get the club access for additional $$ but might have been worth it if you like hotel breakfasts. We opted for going to the food level at Grand Central which had plenty of good food.

Reviews.Title: “Was Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: TravelerIntrepid
Reviews.Content: Was not impressed, expected a higher standard especially given previous experience with the Grand Hyatt in Tokyo and the recent renovation work done Service: -When checking in, was told that we were going to get two double bed as per requested when our booking was actually specifically for a king bed -Was informed that there would be no hot water between 10pm-6am... really? Rooms: -rooms are pretty small -electrical switches are too fancy (touch sensor based) and don't work well -doors are really thin and you can hear everything outside. Everything. -Walls are really thin so you can hear your neighbors. Others: -Walking into the hotel isn't a great feeling, area is too busy with lower quality retail on the ground floor near the entrance -hard to get a cab given proximity to grand central station -on the plus side, the bed was comfortable Would not come back

Reviews.Title: “Great Nyc hotel”
Reviews.Author: Violet1236
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights with family and had a great experience. The hotel is newly updated, rooms are clean, gym large with new equipment and the staff is friendly. The location is central and easy to get around anywhere. We would highly recommend and would return as the rate was reasonable for Nyc ($200). We have stayed at 5 star hotels in Nyc but it will cost you 100-120 percent more($450-$500), for the rate and quality really a great comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, inconsistent service, ridiculous fees”
Reviews.Author: davismaximus
Reviews.Content: The good: nice layout to the room (superior queen) made it feel like there was an entry space, a living space, and a bed space, even though there it's really just a rectangle with a divider. Not to mention a nice view, at least where we were (26th floor). Staff who were physically *inside* the hotel were efficient and polite (front desk, housekeeping, security). But ... The bad stuff that (more than?) cancels out the good: (1) the $17/night fee for STANDARD internet access is already a bit steep, but here's something unwelcome and novel: $2 charge PER ITEM that you want to store at the bell desk. we found this out when we checked out and wanted to go for lunch then retrieve our bags. So, um, $8 *plus* tip to store our bags for an hour? This doesn't even make sense from the hotel's point of view ... it discourages people from checking out early and encourages them to use their room as storage space, when the hotel *could* be turning the room over instead. (2) The doormen were *unbelievably* bad. They chatted with each other and did nothing as my wife and I struggled to get 3 large suitcases through two sets of doors. one of them even saw me giving him a dirty look. well, the dirty look must have worked too well - obviously he figured out I planned to give him zero tip, because when two cabs arrived,one unloading and the other empty to pick us up, they rushed to help the passengers unloading (I suppose they thought it wasn't too late to get a tip from them) and left us (I have a bad back) to load 3 large suitcases into a cab. Really classy. If management is reading this, you should fire the two guys who were working today, Wednesday March 14, at noon. Especially the white guy with grey hair. (3) You can hear everything going on in the room above you. Very little top-bottom sound insulation. Ergh.

Reviews.Title: “nicely updated”
Reviews.Author: lonereignger
Reviews.Content: I remember when i first stayed here decades ago and it was really a very expensive "Trump Dump" . over the years Hyatt and Trump have come to some terms about Trump's exclusive access to the Hyatt brand, which means Hyatt is investing a lot of money in NYC hotel properties, mostly under the new Andaz label. but the Grand Hyatt can now live up to its name to some degree with updated rooms even if the lobby is too dark for my tastes. the new check-in kiosks help you avoid long lines checking in or out, too.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in NY”
Reviews.Author: IvinkaBrno
Reviews.Content: +fantastic location +very trendy +comfy bed +iphone speakers for playing music +nice food in the hotel restaurant -it's very big hotel and doen't feel very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded Suite”
Reviews.Author: alexonboard
Reviews.Content: When we stayed here in February we were able to use upgrade vouchers to get one of the large suites which was well worth it. The room was very large (with a bar, dining room, living room, two bathrooms, and bedroom). The service was great and was overall a wonderful place to spend the weekend. It is worth the upgrade coupons to use at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located for leisure and business”
Reviews.Author: NYCJanet
Reviews.Content: I'm a Manhattanite, so when choosing a hotel for out-of-town my parents to spend a long weekend, I began searching for a well-located, upscale, modern, affordable, and friendly hotel. The Hyatt is adjacent to Grand Central Station on E.42nd Street at Park Ave. Grand Central has a beautiful marketplace, shopping, and easy acess to trains and subways. And unlike the 24/7 chaos of the Theatre District streets, the Grand Central area stradles Murray Hill and the Upper East Side. And the 42nd St crosstown bus to the Broadway theatres is right outside the hotel's door. As for the hotel itself, check-in was a breeze, and everyone we encountered, from Reception to Club Room Concierge and Housekeepers we passed in the hallway, was very pleasant and helpful. Appearance-wise, lobby has been nicely renovated, as has the Club Room. My folks stayed on the Club Floor, so I can't speak to the other rooms, but their room was spacious byYC standards (king bed, L-shaped sofa, walk-in closet). The bathroom was small, with a decent shower (no tub). There were no views to speak of, due to the height of surrounding buildings. I imagine there might be better views on uppermost floors, but I chose proximity to the Club Room, which is on 16. Hallway and room decor was a little dated, but passable. My folks loved the Club's breakfast. Unlike other Hyatts I've stayed at in the past, this Hyatt's Club went a little light on the afternoon and evening Club offerings. However, when I brought this to the attention of the Front Desk, they immediately asked what they could do to makethings right - and they did. For a "big box" chain, Hyatt tries hard to to get the personal touch right.

Reviews.Title: “ok but not meet my expectations for a Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: srk3465
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for one night when I was in NYC for a meeting. I was so looking forward to my stay, I had not stayed at this location yet. The lobby is very nice, it is modern looking and attractive though it seemed a little busy. Registration was prompt. However, as a high ranking member of their Gold Passport Program, I was used to asking and receiving upgrades when a better room was available. In this case, I was told that an upgrade was available but for a surcharge. I stood my ground and was then offered the upgrade. Is that policy--to try and get the surcharge? Nevertheless, the upgrade option was rather disappointing, it was 2 rooms but had no desk or work area nor did have a "comfy chair". Instead it had what looked like a kitchenette table with a cushioned bench seat and extra TV. So i switched back to my original room. Again it has a modern decor. Room size was pretty good for NYC and bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was also modern. It was a little small compared to the room itself but still functional and fine. My gripes: 1) Why boast to have flat screen HD TV's when all of the TV channels are in regular analog? The picture is actually worse when you try to use an HD TV without HD channels 2) The set up could have used a little more practical design. The desk area has a single outlet and one of the receptacles was taken up by the lamp. The night table also had one outlet and one of the receptacles was taken up by the Ihome clock radio plug which unfortunately obscured the other receptacle. This was not very conducive to the current times where everyone has electronics and is need of places for charging. 3) Personally, I believe the decor is too modern. While I like contemporary design, the furniture is no longer comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: ChatVoyageur
Reviews.Content: Last year I stayed at this hotel and I didn't feel comfortable at all (I have a review about it). But this year when my company booked again a room at the Hyatt, I could see how much this hotel had been improved with the refurbishment. My room wasn't too big, but was so comfy! It was nicely painted with warm colors. The bathroom size has not changed, is as tiny as it was before the refurbishment, but it has been totally renewed. The shower with sliding glass door is a hit, because old shower curtains in hotels usually get really dirty. What I missed in my bathroom were the amenities, I just had soap and toothpaste. If you can have breakfast at the hotel, just do it! You won't regret! The service is very good, very polite and attentive waiters.

Reviews.Title: “Sloppy”
Reviews.Author: lillesand25
Reviews.Content: As others have noted the lobby is spectacular. There are lots of elevators, so it's never a long wait to get to your floor. I reserved a newly upgraded room, and the first one I was sent to was barely vacuumed or cleaned, including the closet which had layers of dust in it. It was also relatively close to the ice machine which was pretty loud. I requested another room, which was better, however there was still hair from other guests on the bathroom floor and the carpet was pretty dusty. Disappointing for a hotel of this caliber. Suprising also for this level of hotel that there was no bottled water in the room, coffee, tea, kettle, or even a shower cap. As other reviewers mentioned, the little market downstairs while friendly is super-over priced, and you'd be better off going to GCS or other small cafes for light meals. The location can't be beat though.

Reviews.Title: “1st stay at NYC Grand Hyatt, we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: JzmnS
Reviews.Content: We visit NYC often, and usually stay closer to Times Square, and Central Park. This time, we got a great online deal through Orbitz for what we originally planned as a one night stay. We changed our minds and stayed the entire weekend. Check in was a breeze and we were given a Grand King room on the 26th floor, away from the elevators, and at the end of the hallway. Our room was a nice size (we've paid more for much less space ... it is New York after all), with a sitting area featuring a sofa, table and chair perfect for a spreading out some work papers and a laptop. We had a roomy closet, and a very comfortable bed, the kind you love sinking into after a day out in the city. Nice touch having room lighting and temperature controls built into the headboard, along with individual reading lights. Two windows looked out onto other buildings, but that wasn't a problem. (We only looked out to check sky for weather anyway.) The bathroom was clean, and yes as others will say, a bit on the smallish side. The sink is a little hard to get to, with the shelf directly above it. Shower was good size, with adjustable/sliding showerhead. Shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, hairdryer and toothpaste were provided. Would we have liked a coffee maker in our room? Yes, but coffee was available (as well as many other food items) in the downstairs 24/7 "market". We really appreciated the market, when we got caught in rain walking back from a show and grabbed some steaming hot chocolate and some sweets before heading to our room. Our original plan was to stay for only one night, see a show and go. We asked the front desk what it would cost to stay an additional night and it was only $20 more than our rate, and we could stay in the same room. Still a bargain! The Hyatt was running a limited time sale on rooms, and we were able to take advantage of that. (Not bad at all, considering the Orbitz rate was no longer available ... in fact, it jumped back up another $100.) The staff were very friendly and helpful. We went online ourselves and purchased tickets for another show, after consulting with the concierge for suggestions. Hotel brokers can be a bit pricey, so we didn't go that route. The location of the Grand Hyatt is great, right next to Grand Central Station. The Oyster Bar is in the station, just a few turns down a hallway and that alone can be the one single reason to stay here ... proximity to this wonderful place. We walked to the two different theaters with no problem, and in less time than we expected. This was a theater weekend, so sightseeing or shopping weren't our focus but given that, if we wanted to see sights, the Hyatt's location is very convenient. We'll definitely stay here again! I gave 4 stars, as we didn't use or visit any of the other hotel amenities ... fitness center, pool, or even visit the bar or restaurant. Next time :)!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: chicag0gal22
Reviews.Content: I visited with my husband for a long weekend. Being at Grand Central Station made the trip wonderful. The reception area was confusing to just about everyone with no order or clear place to line up. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The lighting and the control pad for the lighting was wonderful. The worst inconvenience was the shower. It took almost as long for the water to heat up as it took me to take the actual shower. Since the dial for temperature control was not obvious, expect a 5 minute delay to the start of your first shower. The elevators were reasonable and the public space in the lobby is beautiful but not comfortable or ample for the people using the space. The fitness center was awesome, clean with everything you need. There was an attendant on duty during peak hours. This hotel should be ashamed of the price gouging in their take away market in the lobby. $7.50 for a bagel that you have to toast yourself is offensive, There is no free wifi in the lobby and the daily charge for wifi is $12.95 or $16.95. In this day and age these type of charges are not cool. In Grand Central Station there is both a market and a food court. Get your meals in the restaurant area as the selection is great and the prices are fair. Go out the Hyatt door to GCS. When you get thru the second set of doors take a left then take the first right and take the escalator down to the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MSLondonuk
Reviews.Content: Room cleaning hasn t been very well performed so there was hair in the bath and dust on the furniture. bathroom was very small with a crappy bath - lack of complementary items such as shower gel, sleepers, pads, cotton buds, shower cap... no kettle or bottle of water hairdryer cable too short so you need to squirm yourself in order to dry your hair no free internet access in the room no international TV channel ice machine in the corridor very noisy so it can be heard from inside the room breakfast very expensive considering what is offered and the quality: Scrambled eggs = $22, 3 french toasts (almost burnt) = $17 served with a little pot of fake butter and the equivalent of one large spoon of jam (no choice of jam) which was not enough for the 3 toasts. last day, leaving luggage at the concierge for the day I was charged $4 for 1 piece of luggage (when picking it back to go to the airport, I saw a board indicating the price per item was $2... but since you have to pay by cash, you cannot raise the point...) don t expect any customer service. it is like the railway station which is just next to it. People are coming in and out so the staff doesn t really care nor has a customer centric approach.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom design very poor”
Reviews.Author: JimS48
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very busy hotel. I had a modernized room but I think the architect had never stayed in a hotel before. The bathroom was disappointing. The hand basin was hidden by a very wide ledge above it. The taps were actually under the ledge and the lever to lower the plug was almost impossible to find. Half the basin was hidden by the protruding ledge and the whole counter top was set 3 inches too low. It was a long way to bend down. My room had motion detector lighting. Very avant garde but if I sat at the desk for 20 minutes working on my computer, the lighting seemed to think the room was empty and closed down. Stand up, walk around and the lighting came on again. Over my 5 day stay, my electronic room key failed three times. Each time the staff were very apologetic but what a pain. And finally, on my last day the steam heating used by the hotel which comes from Grand Central Station was shut down for maintenance from 10pm until 6am so there was no hot water in my room. I was given 12 hours notice of this inconvenience but it was still inconvenient! I used the Executive Lounge on the 16th floor. Nice location. Adequate continental breakfast. Nice staff. My bill had a duplicate charge on it which was reversed without question - but it should not happen

Reviews.Title: “What a Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Lauren6166
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt in Dubai a few years ago and had such a fantastic experience that we didn't hesitate to book our Christmas holiday at the New York Hyatt. We were a party of 9 all travelling together. The hotel was perfectly situated right on 42nd Ave, yards from Grand Central Station. On arrival the hotel was ok, not as grand as I'd expected but ok. At checkin it emerged that we had been put on different floors despite my request that we all be close to each other. Eventually this was resolved and they managed to find us a floor where we could all be together. The first thing I noticed was that there were no tea and coffee making facilities in any of the rooms, the second was the smell of damp in all 3 rooms, The rooms were ok, not as clean as I would have hoped for and thankfully there was no sign of bed bugs - we did look, the bed was really comfy though. The staff in the hotel Market Place food area weren't very friendly and didn't seem too keen to heat up the baby's food when we asked. I certainly wouldn't reccommend eating there or stopping for a coffee, their chicken nuggets were $2 each (gasp) and when we asked for 2 for the baby, we were told that ther minimum we could buy was 5, $10 for 5 chicken nuggetts! Prior to arrival I called the Hotel restaurant to book our Christmas meal and was told (quite abruptly) that they were too busy to take my booking there and then but that it would be ok to book when we arrived. The day after we arrived we went down to the restaurant to book, only to be told that they were fully booked, but if we went back on Christmas Eve they would find us a table, we did this only to be told that they were full and couldn't sit us for dinner, at this point I was really peed off and in no uncertain terms, made my feelings known. Low and behold they managed to conjour up a table for 9. To be honest come Christmas day I wished we hadn't bothered, the lunch was the worst meal I've ever had in a hotel/restaurant. Not a sprout in site, no parsnips and believe it or not, no roast potatoes. On our plate we had a piece of goose on top of some stuffing with a portion of braised red cabbage to the side and gravy, no colour to the meal apart from brown. Pudding was sticky toffee pudding and ice cream. 2 of our party were vegetarians and there wasn't even a veggie option available, we had to ask for pasta with tomato sauce so they had something to eat. Twice the maid service entered our room in the morning before 8am waking us up to clean the room. I couldn't believe, it before 8 am? We also had an incident where someone entered my son's room while we were out, put his case on ythe bed and rumaged through it, nothing was stolen and the hotel couldn't find a record of an entry to their room. The corridors are quite dirty and food trays are left outside rooms for days, the carpets need hoovering more often as well. Finally, the hotel actually charges $2 per case, if you want to store your baggage there after checkout, they didn't charge in Dubai. I do plan to go back to New York, and while this hotel is ok, I wouldn't go back. There are too many hotels left to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anniepie123
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend here and found the Grand Hyatt to be an excellent location for getting around NYC. The Hotel is right next to Grand Central Station where we came into from Conneticut. The check in was very easy and they let us move into our room at 12 noon because the room was ready. The room size is adequate and looks newly renovated. The bathrooms are quite small but we were on the go so it was no big deal. Beds were comfortable. The price was very affordable for NYC. I highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt is good for a visit”
Reviews.Author: ESIreland
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is a fine faculity and is particularly well set up for the business traveller. Location is good and the service and facilities are good.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: N A
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, quite large by NYC standards, with great amenities, recently remodeled. Can't beat the Grand Central location. Small quibbles: the shelf in the bathroom protruded significantly over the sink, making it challenging to brush teeth or wash faces; instructions for setting the alarm clock bore no resemblance to the buttons on either the clock/radio or the remote for it; and no wastebasket (or room for one) in the bathroom. But the huge room, newer fixtures and furniture made it a winner. I'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvmybasset
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed my stay here. The room was HUGE and clean. recently remodeled hotel. Perfect location, great views, and staff was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: haakonks
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night at the Grand Hyatt New York. This was my first stay here since they finished renovations, and I have to say I really liked the result! Arrived the hotel early at 10 am in the morning, and did not expect to be able to check in so early, but the hotel had a room ready, and I was upgraded from a Grand King room to a Grand Deluxe King, staff in the reception was very friendly. The room was nice and pretty large by New York standard, and everything was clean. As a Hyatt Gold Pass Diamond member I also had access to the Grand Club on the 16th floor which also has been refurbished, and had a good selection. Late check-out was also not a problem, had the room until 2 pm. Overall it was an excellent stay, to bad it was only for one night. Will defiantly be back here next time I am in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt at Grand Central, NYC”
Reviews.Author: NiKalita
Reviews.Content: We chose the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central for its location. It is pretty much in the middle of Manhattan and handy for Grand Central station - you don't even leave the building. Although it is neat and modern up to and including the lobby, it is showing signs of age inside. Furnishings are rather dark and a bit old-fashioned and the lighting is muted. We asked for a roll-away bed for or seven year old; it was so large that there was barely space left to move about the room. Fortunately this did not bother us too much as we mainly used the room to wash and sleep. Although we were not high up, there was no external noise. Neighbors could be heard rarely. Staff attitude was generally good and occasionally exceptional. A few things niggled: I was not notified of mail deliveries; I phoned to ask a written message to be delivered to my wife and it did not happen; internet access is around 16USD per day and is not free in the lobby; the room service menu is average (macaroni cheese, that famous comfort food, was not good) and there was a 20 minute queue for breakfast. Reservations were advised for the latter. In that time I bought a good breakfast in Grand Central and brought it back to our room. Would I go there again? For the location, yes. I can take or leave the rest.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, remodeled rooms, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: CheerGator84
Reviews.Content: Positive experience: welcoming staff, despite a late check in, good size room (for NYC), helpful concierge & extremely convenient. Stayed in a remodeled room on the 34th floor; the hotel was busy because of the Westminster dog show but there were plenty of staff on hand and no problems to report. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: mefcgf21
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt in the past & chose it for the location. It is 5 seconds outside the doors of Grand Central Station. We were traveling via train into GSC w/ 2 yound kids so I thought this would be the perfect location. It was!! The hotel must have been redone since the last time we were there & was quite modern. Check in was a breeze & the room was nicely appointed with a flat screen etc & very clean. I also remember in the past the elevators were really slow. Not this time, they were amazingly fast. My only complaint was they charged $7 to use a wine cork, upon checkout I voiced my concern & they took it off the bill. I would stay here again if the price continues to be competitive. I called the hotel & asked for AAA, Corp rate etc.. Ask for different rates when you book. The restaurant across the street is great for breaksfast its called the Pershing Square.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Baeon
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel if your staying in manhattan this is the hotel to be in, with it's own entrance to grand central station. All the staff are friendly and the hotel and the room could not be cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very modern, dirty”
Reviews.Author: dehenderson
Reviews.Content: I chose the Grand Hyatt on 42nd Street next to Grand Central Station for its location. Booking online, I requested a quiet room and extra down pillows. While the hotel looks nicely updated and modern on the surface, it has flaws. The so-called "quiet" room had a nice view but I heard street noise all night long, including some nut playing bagpipes outside at 11 pm! The "down pillows" I requested were foam. Worse of all, the bathroom door was filthy with hand and fingerprints of many people who had stayed in the room in the past, making me wonder what else in the room had not been properly cleaned. Water pressure is low and hot water for a shower took about 5 minutes. Lastly, the smallish room had a large overhanging floor lamp that got in the way of unpacking, sitting on the couch, watching TV. The A/C unit blew right on the bed, waking me several times during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Paula W
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days in Feb 12 at the Grand Hyatt. Perfect location, walking distance to so many iconic New York sites-Grand Central Station, Empire State, Times Square, Central Park. We walked to most places as we love to see the buildings and all the little shops down the side streets. Great shopping close by (and the beautiful art shop in the Hyatt) and our tour buses left opposite the hotel. The staff at the Hyatt were great, had breakfast there most mornings, staff very friendly and happy to chat - great view of the street. The room was lovely, didn't see them before the refurbishment but very comfortable and roomy for the 2 of us. We didn't here any noise once in our room on 29th floor. This is our second time in NY and would recommend the Hyatt to anyone planning a trip to NY. Look forward to staying there on our next trip

Reviews.Title: “Not what it was.......”
Reviews.Author: johnc3720
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently on business for three nights. Location is great and was perfect location for my business. The room was large for New York with a nice bathroom and tv etc. I was disappointed with room service ad service from staff generally. Would I go back, yes if the price was right if not I would try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern Rooms, Great Regency Club”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan L
Reviews.Content: I love this Hyatt, if only the amount of points I have to use isn't so high! The renovations to the Regency Club are great. Beautiful room great food. The rooms are nice and modern, still tiny bathrooms though! Comfy beds and rooms. Only issue I had was working the sensor lights. I had troulbe figuring them out! haha My GF and I love this place, stayed a few times and would definitely go back. .Staff is warm and friendly (maybe cause I was in the diamond line!) but overall no issues. Location is perfect, Grand Central Station is 50 feet away, would be perfect if you plan to tour the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: backbeat_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 3 nights over the last weekend, and it was a great stay from start to finish. Upon check-in I mentioned that we were in town from England to celebrate my wifes 50th birthday, and we were presented with vouchers for a free breakfast at the hotel for all five of my family, a lovely gesture to start our holiday off. The rooms are superb, ultra modern with very comfortable beds, and we were lucky enough to get a view of the Chrysler Building. The newly refurbished lobby is very classy and impressive, and as so many people have mentioned, is right next to Grand Central Station, with its shops and dining concourse accessable without even going outside. I love photography, so being right next to such a fabulous building was a real bonus. The only slight negative (i had to think hard to find one) was the lifts, as sometimes you had to wait quite a while to get one that wasnt already full to capacity...however there was some kind of dance convention on with hundreds of young girls and there families attending, so its not surprising really. Overall it was a fabulous stay, and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: MrsChan11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt next to grand central station and I must say the location is perfect. Right in the heart of everything. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a standard room which was very nice and clean, we were very impressed with the room until that first night, we heard an awful banging noise. At first i thought it was someone at the door, but realised it was coming from the bathroom, only to realise that it was the ventilater in the bathroom making the noise. So my husband and I didn't have a good nights sleep as it was constantly making this noise every 10 minutes. So in the morning, we went to inform the reception of this and they were very apologetic and offered to move us to another room. So we changed rooms without any hassle and quickly. The room was even bigger as it was for a wheelchair user. The customer service there is superb. I will definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodeling...”
Reviews.Author: demodiva
Reviews.Content: I haven't been to the Grand Hyatt in a few years and they have clearly spent some money remodeling and making the hotel more modern. I stayed for one night on a business trip. Its obviously a central location, easy to access the subway or get a taxi. Nice open lobby, we had a drink at he lobby bar and the bartenders were super friendly and recommended a great place for dinner - Wolfgang's Steak house on Park. The rooms were spacious, modern and comfortable. Check in was a bit slow, they have a "greeter" and some check-in kiosks, but that didn't seem to work for my reservation and the line to check in was long and slow. We did get some free beverage tickets for the markets for the wait which was good, so the clearly recognized that the wait was long. Overall would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “New york baby!!”
Reviews.Author: Will5024
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect slice of NYC!! Your right next to grand central station, & tons of attractions. A short cab ride to times square too! Empire state & the list goes on! the building is amazing & has great history with JFK having given speeches there years ago! The rooms are great and I couldn't fault anything here! They were doing renovations which were obviously somewhat a distraction, but they have to do them sometime, right?? Might be finished by now! But a must-do on the NYC list!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: AdventureGirl2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in early Feb. 2012. Great stay. It is at 42nd and Park, so it is walking distance to pretty much everything in mid-town, and close to theaters. For things beyond - well its attached via an enclosed walkway to the shops of Grand Central Station - so hopping a subway, cab or train is easy and quick. I actually loved that GCS is like its own little city -- or really an indoor mall (it reminded me of the underground in Crystal City, VA except GCS is above ground). It has shops (had to scoop up some shoes at Camuto), restaurants, food court, news stands, gourmet market, etc. Everything you might need w/o having to put a coat on in winter, including a ride to wherever else in NY you want to go via subway or train. Restaurants are good, drinks at the Campbell Apt. v. romantic. I never thought a place I would feel most comfortable in NYC running about would be Grand Central Station! I was a little incredulous that you could be right next to GCS w/o noise as other reviews said, but it is true. We stayed on the club level (I think it was 16th fl) and we never heard a sound from GCS, the street, or other rooms. Very quiet so good night's sleep here. Nothing but good things to say. There was a slight mixup with the room on checking in -- we were told on the phone that our Grand Deluxe King was the room with the wood floors on the website, but were informed that this was not true on check in. They did do some checking and after a bit of hassle put us in the large king with the wood floors afterall. We were very happy about that. It was like a studio apt. with a walk in closet, separate foyer/entry, sitting area, desk area, and bedroom area. We thought it was spacious for NYC and well appointed. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jaydub0425
Reviews.Content: We just go back from two nights at the Grand Hyatt. It's a great location, especially if you arrive/depart via Grand Central. You don't even have to go outside to enter the hotel. We were first given a room that was clearly a smoking room, so had to get that changed. The hotel was apparently recently renovated, so the new room that we got was very modern and clean. Beds were not the most comfortable, but no other complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Head to the Hyatt for a Grand time!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette524
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to stay at this hotel for a number of years and finally, it happened! Now I regret waiting so long to do it! After spending one night in another hotel close by, I was definitely delighted by the room, the decor and the staff. Would I stay there again? You bet!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Crissie-12
Reviews.Content: My daughter and myself have just returned from a 5 night say at the Grand Hyatt. After reading reviews I was slightly concerned but I cannot fault the hotel at all. Its in a fantastic location within walking distance of major attractions and direct access to Grand Central station which is an attraction itself. We checked in using the automated service and were very disappointed with our room due to its gloomy location. We asked for another room and the receptionist was very helpful and although we were 3 hours early for usual check in time she found us a lovely large room with a wonderful view on the 28th floor so it was very quiet. It was light and modern with two double beds. Nothing was too much trouble from any of the staff. They were all extremely helpful and friendly. The concierge gave out good information, very helpful. No coffee machine but when I asked they brought one up straight away no charge. Theres a fridge and safe again no charge like some hotels do. Great shower always hot water. Plenty of toiletries so I dont know how people can complain about that. Who needs them anyway? Good gym although we were too exhausted to use it! Nice cafe around the corner for breakfast and drugstore nearby if you want to fill the fridge with beer, wine,water.The only negatives were the price for internet access although it was free to use for airline check in. Also you have to pay $2 per bag to store your bags if you have a later flight but they are locked away safely. I wouldnt hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone and cant understand anyone who could find fault. We had an amazing holiday and picked up lots of tips from the guides on the hop on hop off bus tours. Not only are they extremely informative about NY they give great tips how to save money and places to visit. Must things to do are visiting Jersey Gardens which is an outlet with loads of designer shops. About 40 minutes bus ride costing about $11 return. Hollister and Abercrombie and Fitch were almost giving stuff away. We bought over 30 items for around £130. We were told of a rooftop bar near the empire state building. It was just amazing with fantastic views opposite the empire. There are heaters and red hooded cloaks to wear. I had a manhatten cocktail, pricey but well worth it because of the whole experience. A great eating place is Ellens Stardust diner. The food was good and the atmosphere fun and unique. All the waiters and waitresses are wannabe performers who all take turn to sing great songs as they dance around the room and entertain you. We had dinner and breakfast there and loved it. Half price tickets for shows are best purchased down at the south shore harbour office as there are no queues like Times Square. Phantom was amazing. Tonys Italian restaurant had the most delicious food we ever tasted and very reasonably priced. They serve platters and they will halve them for two people. Planet Hollywoods were also good for breakfast and dinner. We visited Ground Zero. We booked online first, no charge and saved us having to wait around as you go at a set time. It is very moving and emotional though. The tranquil setting makes it very difficult to imagine the carnage that went on there. Personally I felt it was something I had to do to pay my respects to all who were injured and died there. NY is an amazing place. What a fantastic holiday and this hotel contributed to that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: guitarpsych
Reviews.Content: Let me begin with aspects of the Grand Hyatt that I thought were positive. Our room was very clean and the location is excellent. The gentleman who checked me in was very nice and engaging. He attended the University at Albany where I have taught, so we struck up a nice conversation. The elevators are a major drawback to this Hotel based on the days we stayed. They are slow, small, and there is not enough of them. Several people were catching "up" elevators to eventually go down. Also, the lobby is generally understaffed across the board, frontdesk, bell service,, concierge, snack bar, everything. Unfortunately, would probably not choose this again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but average in overall”
Reviews.Author: JerryOsk
Reviews.Content: Whatever I did there, it costed me extra money. The staff was always too busy to converse with me. Since it was my first time staying at a hotel in New York so I'm not sure if this hotel is a good value by New York standard. But for me it's not worth my hard earned money. And when compared to another Hyatt hotel in Dallas I used to stay, it's quite disappointing. The room was small but clean and comfortable. Nothing to complain about the size because the hotel is located in the middle of Manhattan. My only issue with the room is that it takes too long until hot water come out from the shower. The good sides of the hotel are the location and its stylish design.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for 4 sharing”
Reviews.Author: nelly071
Reviews.Content: We were in NY for a girlie trip, 2 mums with thier 16 year old daughters. This hotel does not charge for children up to 18 so was fantstic value as we had a room with 2 double beds. The staff were exceptional. we were able to check in early, the room was more than large enough, clean with all the facilities expected. the position of the hotel is ideal for the sites, and with its own entrance into Grand Central station, ideal for using the subway. It took 10 minutes to walk to Times Sq. Most guests seem to be business people but considering the number of rooms we found it quiet. A free check in for your flight was also very helpful. We booked well in adbanve and got a good rate. The only down side was Wi Fi was extra, so we just asked at the desk and they were more than happy to look anything up for you. Also most chanels on the tv were pay per view, but we were so tied after our days out this was not a problem. We shopped till we dropped !

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointing stay; we wouldn't give it four stars.”
Reviews.Author: dirtyhumans
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid February with our two children (7 and 6) for two nights. We flew in from Heathrow to JFK and decided to transfer in an iconic yellow cab! This was a flat rate $45 plus tolls and it took about an hour. We pulled up right outside the hotel but the name is on the side walls and can only be seen from further down the road so the cab driver had to direct us! Our first impressions were great, open, airy and smart looking. Thank fully we were not dived on by porters hoping for a tip and we got to take our own bags in which was fine as we had little luggage and didn't want to be tipping already - tight I know but we were on a budget. They have a lots of staff milling around but we did find that they don't offer help you have to ask for it. Self service check in desks which were great but very impersonal and rooms are easy to find. They have several lifts up and we never had a problem with them. We were the 17th floor and overlooking the rear roof so nothing spectacular but it was quiet. Our room. This was our first disappointment. It had a nice tiled area immediately as you walk in with a double wardrobe and full length mirror. Going into the room we had two double beds and a bathroom with a half height bath with shower, toilet and basin. This was great until you started to use things.....the toilet was cracked, there were several large chips out of the bath, there was toothpaste dribbling down the shelf, we had to ask for more towels despite the booking being for four, no tea and coffee making facilities, no bottled water or mini bar, ripped bed linen, dirty decorative cushions, only two pillows per bed, the reading light from one of the beds was missing and the hole had been gaffer taped! The rooms also had touch lights and the night light function didn't work. We booked through lastminute.com and wondered if this was one of their allocated rooms and so you get a bit of a raw deal?! It was a shame as in comparison to a four star in the UK and the Hyatt name we were gutted. Arguably we could have complained and perhaps been allocated a new room but we'd checked in at 2.30pm, dropped our bags in the room and went straight out to explore. All of this was discovered on return at 9pm when we were to tired to think about doing anything. The room was clean and liveable so we just got on with it. The location is fabulous. There are doors from the lobby straight into the passage for grand central station and it's within easy walking distance of Fifth Avenue, Rockefeller Center and Times square. Once you start walking there is so much to see it's hard to stop but this place is huge and if you're a keen walker then navigating and distance is so simple once you get the hang of the streets and avenues. However, the subway is also easy and very cheap; they only sell ten trips, weekly or monthly tickets on the subway. The weekly was $29. We didn't eat in the hotel as breakfast was not included in our tariff but McDonalds was just up the road and Pershing Square was almost opposite and although a little on the expensive side it was nice! The hotel had a mini market in the lobby where you could pick up fruit, water, soda, beer, wine, sandwiches, salads, hot drinks etc at a premium but it's convenient. The hotel charge a $2 fee per bag to hold at the hotel for the day. We travelled back to the airport via a shuttle bus that operates just across the road from the hotel. We paid $46 and it goes every 15 minutes. We bought the tickets directly from the bus company but they can be purchased from the hotel lobby. We also discovered my husband had lost his wallet when we got to the airport security; on contacting the hotel they were extremely unhelpful and we were passed from pillar to post and were very unsympathetic. This also happened when we contacted them on returning to the UK. All in all we enjoyed New York but were disappointed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New York experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip to the Grand Hyatt hotel in New York the Hotel was excellent, despite our concerns the room was spacious and of good quality. The hotel was joined to the the Grand Central station which was a great place to eat and people watch. Visiting Ellanors star dust dinner near time square is a must as the staff burst into song whilst you are being served. We booked through VIrgin Atlantic and could not fault the service from start to finish we enjoyed it so much we have booked to go back again later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and upscale!”
Reviews.Author: Steve M
Reviews.Content: We recently attended a dance convention at the hotel and stayed overnight! What a beautiful hotel and very modern! It's also very clean in the lobby for having literally hundreds and hundreds of people walking thru every minute! The staff checking us in were very friendly and the process was done quite quickly! We liked the idea that you could store your baggage in the lobby (for a fee) until check-in time so you don't have to carry it around NYC with you until you check in. The lines for checking your luggage in the lobby can get overwhelming at times though! We also loved the Market in the lobby, where you can grab a bite to eat or drink. The elevators can be a little confusing since one set only goes up to the 23rd floor. Another set goes beyond, so you need to be aware of which elevator you are boarding. We also liked the fact that it's located right next to Grand Central Terminal, which has many shops and eateries to check out. Also, not far from Times Square! I was a little upset that the ice machine did not work on our floor since the refrigerator was quite small. I also expected there to be a microwave, but there wasn't. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to stay at the Grand Hyatt in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Go to Andaz!”
Reviews.Author: mgd2i
Reviews.Content: The location is the only selling point of this hotel. The customer service is nonexistent. The hotel itself has a very corporate feel to it and just isn't very nice to stay in. The carpets and elevators are pretty dirty and unappealing. We tried to stay here this past weekend. When we arrived our confirmed King room was now two double beds. They refused to honor the reservation (which was a confirmed King as stated in the rate details), and refused to help us with finding another Hyatt in the area. Andaz on the other hand, also part of the Hyatt portfolio, is amazing. We ended up at the Andaz on Wall-Street and it was honestly the best hotel i've stayed in, and I have stayed at Hyatt properties all over the world. There are better hotels in the viscidity but really, go out a little and stay at one of the Andaz hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: en-en
Reviews.Content: ust got back last night from a weekend getaway with my boyfriend for valentines weekend... This hotel was great. The location was the best I could walk out the front door & find everything I needed food, shopping, even a drug store I got a little sick my last day there...My 1st room was very small but after going down stairs & requesting a bigger room being that my boyfriend is 6'5 225lbs and it would be hard for him to get a round that small space we were given... I was given a much nicer room with plenty of space... The beds were nice & comfy I slept like a baby both nights... The bathroom was on small but big enough to serve it's purpose... I had a very nice walk in closet we were able to fit both of our suitcases & shopping bags in it with extra room left over... The TV in the hotel had very bad picture wish they could have fixed it... The hotel staff was very friendly always there to assist with anything you need... A special thanx to Silvia at the front desk she was very helpful & nice...Didn't go eat at the restaurant or go to the bar I heard they were both very over priced so I stayed away. I will stay here again when I visit NYC

Reviews.Title: “Nice... but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: Megsboston
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 friends for a birthday trip over superbowl weekend. All in all we didnt have any major complaints, but it wasn't as nice as I was expecting. The lobby looks impressive but it's not exactly inviting. It's all very modern, but the furniture looks like they borrowed it from an airport. I think they were going for "looks nice but doesn't encourage anyone to linger," in which case, mission accomplished. I've noticed lots of reviews complaining about the speed of the elevators, however we had no problems. There was almost always an elevator waiting for us whenever we hit the button. We were on the 25th floor and had no issues with street noise. Our room was fine, small, but that's to be expected. The facilities staff was very accommodating and agreed to move a small couch for us so that we could fit in a roll away bed. The man who helped us was very nice and eager to please, he even refused to accept a tip. This was a big difference from the guy who checked us in who was clearly annoyed that we didnt use the electronic consoles. He wasn't exactly rude but he certainly wasn't welcoming. He asked why we were here (exact words..) and when I said "it's my birthday" he just handed me the keys. My friend found several suspicious hairs and a few stains on her bed sheets which freaked her out... but she didnt want to complain about them so the hotel never had a chance to fix that issue... does make you wonder how they wash everything though. I'm a platinum member of their rewards club and have spent something like 50 nights at hyatts this year, that plus the fact that this trip was scheduled on my birthday, I sort of expected a little more service. All in all, the facilities guy who moved that couch was the only person who made us feel welcome. This might be because we paid for the room with my rewards points.

Reviews.Title: “A grand hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: Edu-pr
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the hotel. Is near everything in manhattan, we reach the good places on foot or spending a few bucks in taxi. The hotel the decor was recently renovated and its great. This is a hotel to come back

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: jtfnewbern
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, love the neighborhood. It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good points, bad points”
Reviews.Author: Corgipup
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights for a conference, and got a great rate o by booking at the last minute. The room was large, as was the bed (although somewhat furrowed) and the television. But the lighting, as noted by another reviewer, is extremely difficult to figure out, and the thermostat would only go on or off, I was unable to change the high temperature.. The bathroom was fine except the shower had low pressure. The lobby is impressive in a cold, ultra modern way, but the carpets in the elevator and halls were grungy looking. Wifi is $17 per 24 hours, outrageous. Okay, it's New York, but it bugs me that cheaper hotels give you free wifi while the Marriotts and Hyatts hit you with a fee.
