I ordered a Sunday Times for the following morning, but nothing showed up by 8:30 am, and when I asked the guy in charge, he was quite unpleasant and said there were none left. I like the little cafe, and they have good espresso and very nice berries and yoghurt, but they insisted on charging me a buck for a cup of hot water for tea. The location is great, right next to Grand Central, and they have staff hanging out just to helpl. The check out woman was nice too. When I complained about the NY Times incident and the shower and the weird thermostat, I got a $50 rebate. So be a squeaky wheel, is my advice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Figmoe
Reviews.Content: Awesome modern lobby. Quick and easy check in via the front desk. The rooms are very nice, updated, modern,and the size is really large for Manhattan. The location is right next to Grand Central Terminal with easy access to all New York City has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emmytots
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to the Grand Hyatt, NYC. We stayed from boxing day until new years eve. We ordered breakfast the first morning which was really tasty came exactly at the time we specified and the bill was so easy to deal with upon check out, speaking of which they allowed late check out (1pm instead of 11am) for free anything further there would be a charge however I'm unsure of how much the charge was. The hotel was cleaned everyday and we were given new toiletries & towels every day, the room was very spacious with a closet to store cases, iron and ironing board & also a combination safe which you can set yourself. There was temperature control in the room which we didn't actually need as the room was warm enough. We had a view of the street and grand central from our room and the window could open. There is a place to store your luggage upon check out if needed for $2 per bag - although I've never had to pay for this service any where else before I would rather pay $2 than carry my suitcase around all day! There were also some plug sockets in and around the lobby waiting area to charge phone etc which came in handy for us. If you go out the hotel doors to the right and go in the first doors to grand central station take the escalator down to the right - this will take you to the 'shuttle' which is a subway train (there are 4) that only run directly between Times Square and Grand Central which was amazing! We paid $29 for a 7 day unlimited subway pass from which we got our monies worth! This is my 2nd time in NY and I did not use the subway system on my 1st trip as I'm claustrophobic, however the trams are quite big and run so frequently they are rarely too packed to get on, you can get practically anywhere in manhattan in 15 min - journies which would take over an hour by any other means. We got so many things done by travelling via subway and having the shuttle next door was amazing! I can't fault the hotel and would %100 go back it was clean, comfortable, contemporary decor, and brilliant location - we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Modern (sometimes too modern), fresh hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: jsnyder02
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great looking, distinctive modern lobby. Check-in is done at computer kiosk but with human help - modern, efficient, if not a little confusing since most probably aren't used to this. The rooms are generally quite nice -- updated, bright, modern, and the size is really quite decent for Manhattan. The only downside of the rooms are some of the modern touches are too modern. The lighting system is so complex that at one point we asked a hotel employee for help and he came to the conclusion a bulb was probably dead (it wasn't - we figured out the next day how to turn on that lamp and it was fine). Also, the alarm clock is quite puzzling and non-intuitive to operate - not a problem I normally have with alarm clocks. The furniture is nice though, as are the decorations. Fitness room is one of the best I've seen at a hotel - wide variety of equipment, all in good working order and fairly recent models. Location right by Grand Central Terminal is extremely convenient, especially if you are getting around by subway.

Reviews.Title: “almost average”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl13579
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in NYC with my husband and daughter. The hotel staff is very friendly, but a couple snafus along the way. First, we specifically requested a room away from the elevator and were placed directly in front of it. Not really a big deal and the staff quickly moved us. The second room was dark and there were many long black hairs all over the bathroom upon check in. The floor did not seem clean, and you do have to pay for wireless. There is also little security for people coming up the elevators after dark. I got the sense this is more of a business/conference hotel and although the staff was nice it does not make up for the lack of cleaning in my opinion. On the plus side, you are right next to the Grand Central terminal for easy access around the city via Subway. I will most likely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “all for show”
Reviews.Author: frankentrotter
Reviews.Content: I have a strong suspicion this chain of hotel is now owned by Chinese- the reason? It cuts corner on just everything- room has no HD TV, WiFi is NOT free, tub water nozzle is impossible to figure out. In the conference area, the bathroom has NO warm water for washing hands. There isn´t even anything to make hot drinks (coffee, tea) in the room. During the first night, the room downstairs had vacuum noise for at least 30 minutes. The maids are not updated on early-late check out. The hotel decoration is made to look VERY modern, but skims on just about everything on comfort- In conclusion, your dollars are worth more elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient midtown Manhattan location”
Reviews.Author: JBCol
Reviews.Content: Located on East 42nd Street right above Grand Central (and most of the subway lines) this hotel is very accessible to all top Mantattan attractions. My room (a standard King) was recently renovated so it felt very new and modern. Usual amenities, however the alarm clock is part of an iPod speaker gadget so you may need to opt for a wake up call of you aren't tech savvy. Very nice bathroom (June Jacobs toiletries, plus a toothpaste, nice touch!) a seating area and a super comfortable bed. Lights and temp controls built into the headboard were very convenient. Room service and hotel restaurants had excellent food but were pricey (which you should expect in midtown Manhattan) There is also a market in the lobby (Hyatt members get free bottle of water or coffee coupon) which had salads, beverages and other grab and go foods/snacks. Though this is a very large hotel, it felt like a boutique hotel once I stepped off the elevator on my floor. Very quiet and clean. I was very happy with my stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Honey_paw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during between Dec 17 - Dec 22nd. The location is excellent, the staff are really helpful and the rooms are immaculate. It is a hotel in Manhattan so don't expect it to be as large as Windsor Castle (why people moan about room sizes is beyond me anyway :-S), but it's a perfect base for a city trip. I recommend the cheesecake from the market cafe in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: MrWonderfulToronto
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated and it shows! Lovely lobby. We stayed in room 3007 and were told it was an upgrade. NOT! Room was tiny. Nice room but tiny, tiny, tiny, tiny. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and the restaurant was closed which is pretty surprising for a hotel with 1,000+ rooms. Had to settle for bar snacks. Took about 20 - 25 minutes to get car from valet. Everyone was very nice. Heavy security presence makes one feel safe. Would retrun but would forsake the "upgrade"!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LVETOTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: A great location, right on top of Grand Central Station, recently updated, rooms are small, but then again it's NY, and within walking distance of great restaurants, shopping, etc. Eclectic rooms and bar/restaurant on lobby level...Two problems, the light next to the bed flickered all night even when off and behind the credenza, there was a pile of junk showing it had never been cleaned. Also, they could vacuum the halls more than once a week....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but forget about Service.”
Reviews.Author: JLotsos
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, right next to the Grand Central Station and walking distance to Times Square. There is a market right next to the hotel that is open until 9pm that sells great cakes and food. Forget about buying food from the store inside the Hyatt as it is very overpriced. Every hotel we have stayed you usually pay the porter when they have delivered your luggage to your room....but not this hotel! We had to pay the porter to get the luggage into the lobby (with my husbands help) and then we had to pay him again when he delivered our luggage to our room. They were grumpy and nothing was done with a smile but there was no way we couldn't pay him...he followed us until we did. There was no kettle or mini bar in our room and when we asked about a kettle and tea and coffee we were rudely told "We don't offer that sort of service in our hotel". The corridors were quite dirty and needed a good vacuum but thankfully the rooms were quite clean. The only other thing wrong with the room was there was no hot water. The shower was lukewarm. However the rooms were a good size. The only real plus to this hotel was they had a computer that allowed you to print your boarding passes. We enjoyed our time in New York but would not go back to this hotel again. It lacks charm, service and is really only suited for business people who just want a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Aja-Boutique
Reviews.Content: 2 things which makes the hotel to be rated quite hight: perfect Location, easy advanced check in and check out. You can check in day before arrival, upon arrival no need to wait at reception - it can easily be done at electronic check-in counter - this saves time! Rooms need to be improved, maximum 3*, but still quite and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Central Station, New York”
Reviews.Author: dilomo
Reviews.Content: Great location. Hotel connects to Grand Central Station. Terrific Bar & Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “1st trip to New York, 1st class hotel”
Reviews.Author: TomTom1986
Reviews.Content: We only used the hotel as a bse for our holiday and didn't use the restuarant or bar. The rooms though where great and very clean and quiet. The location of the hotel couldn't be more central and for a new comer to the big apple and we found this very helpfull. On the whole though i did find the hotel rates expensive and on returning to New York i have saved a considerable amount by booking else where and not compromising on confort and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection from check in to check out.”
Reviews.Author: metinky
Reviews.Content: From the second the bellman opened the door I felt at ease. I was greeted by another member of the staff who was very attentive. He escorted us to the desk even though it was too early to check in he encouraged us to try. The girl at the desk allowed us to check in early and off to our room we went. Boy were we so surprised when we opened the door, We stood there in awe. The room was immaculate and the the lighting was perfect. Every single person who worked at this hotel was helpful and sincere. I cannot wait to stay here again and again. It couldn't get any better, oh wait, I almost forgot, the location is amazing!! Thanks to Jay at the front desk who allowed us a late check out. see you all soon, MaryLou

Reviews.Title: “clean, excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: edg126
Reviews.Content: Saw a great deal on travelzoo and booked a weekend night for my birthday weekend. It's centrally located right next to grand central station which is great. When checking in they asked if we were here for any special occasion and when I said it was my 30th Jake sent up a bottle of wine and fruit/ cheese platter. The rooms were modern with a small window with an acceptable view of NYC. Like every hotel you can hear people in the hallways but I felt the corridors were short enough that there were limited rooms people had to walk by so it wasn't too bad. It also looks like there is a rooftop patio on maybe the 15th floor that looks like it would be nice to check out in good weather. I tend to book hotels based off of cheapest price, but am quickly becoming a fan of Hyatt, so I might be willing to spend a little more to stay at this brand in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JayBeeDubs
Reviews.Content: Great room, loved the restaurant, loved how close it was to everything. Their concierge staff was incredibly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Donald J
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay here. The cleaning service was very good, tidying our shopping and smiling along the way. It was a fun trip to New York

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: LouiseRK
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here overnight while in New York to attend a party. The location was convenient and the hotel was very nice. Our room was quite large for a New York City hotel. The room was very clean and quiet at night. I would definitely stay here again. The hotel is connected to Grand Central, so you can enter the terminal without even going outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference Spot”
Reviews.Author: Gloria B
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the SCBWI Conference where there were over 1,100 writers and illustrators gathered, and I was amazed that this hotel was able to accommodate such a large crowd for whole group speakers as well as smaller workshops. Everything seemed to flow without a snag. The food at their "New York Central" Restaurant was fantastic! Prices were high, as you would expect in NYC, but the delicious food made it less painful. The location is also prime. All in all, this was an extremely enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, but location can't make up for everything ...”
Reviews.Author: crzzzr
Reviews.Content: Had two double queen rooms here for a week over the busy christmas/new year period. Requested a newly renovated room and received it no problems. Here's a summary of our impressions: 1. Rooms were not very large so not much space available for luggage when more than two in the room 2. New decor is modern minimalist - looks nice but perhaps at the expense of practicality sometimes 3. We were on 14th floor and were not affected by street noise 4. Air Conditioners were noisy 5. Bathroom was very small and difficult to manouvre in. We are small people and found it difficult. 6. Shower was not very hot and sometimes would take a good minute to warm up. It seemed as though the hot water system was underrated. 7. Basin difficult to use due to shelf above it 8. No tea/coffee making facilities in room 9. Charge for internet usage - hotels need to wake up to what the modern world requires - should be free 10. Didn't eat in the hotel once - the restaurant was too expensive for breakfast. Ate at Pershing Square (100 feet up the road) which was a good meal at a reasonable price. 11. Great location with easy access to subway via Grand Central Terminal 12. Mini-market in the hotel was useful but expensive. Better and cheaper options located in Grand Central. Would probably choose somewhere else next time to find better value. I feel that they are relying on their location a little too much.

Reviews.Title: “Hype but nothing to back it up!”
Reviews.Author: PatWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here for 4days. We were in NYC to celebrate his birthday. Because of that, when we checked in we asked about upgrading to the Club Level. The young man at the desk quoted us an extra $100 per night---saying that it was worth because of the breakfast, happy hour with appetizers, etc. He also said he would put us into a really nice room. Well, the room was very small and worse, the sliding doors for the closet were off the track and my husband could not move them back on. He called the desk and they did put us into another room, that was considerably bigger then the first. We were surprised to learn that happy hour didn't include free drinks--infact a glass of cheap wine was $9! On the plus, both the breakfast and appetizers were very nice. We learned on the 2nd day of the trip that the Club was closing the next day. Wish that had been mentioned at the time we checked in!! Needless to say we did not pay for the days when the Club was not available. Although the hotel has recently undergone a massive renovation, it is clear that the "workmanship" is very inadequate. We already found wallpaper coming off in the cornors, paint peeling off the door frame. Service is ok, but not anything special. The location is great, right next to Grand Central Terminal and an easy walk to the Theatre District. I thought the hotel would be special because it is a Grand Hyatt and because of the renovation but it didn't live up to the hype of its ads.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Blondeblueyes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hyatt for four nights in December. After a long haul flight with my 5 year old grandson, daughter and son law we was disappointed to find our two rooms not ready even though it was early evening. It was suggested to us to go to dinner and our rooms will be ready on our return. Not ideal as we couldn't freshen up first. On our return two hours later only one room ready to our amazement. After another wait and a complaint my daughter was given another room option which she took but was not happy as she wanted to be close to me and her son. As for the rooms. Nice, clean and modern. Large comfy bed but had to request a quilt as the bed linen was insufficient for the time of year. It took a second request the next day before it was sorted. Bad points was the bathroom fan was on all the time so after 4 nights it was irritating to say the list. Having no tea/coffee making facilities was very inconvenient especially with a little one and it would of made a huge difference. No free wi fi...again this day and age it should be free and available to guests. No dressing gowns. Good points. Perfect location, fantastic food, clean and modern. Restaurant staff service was excellent to poor depending who was working on the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravellinGuy58
Reviews.Content: Great location by Grand Central station. Hotel restaurants are expensive, especially room service, but no different to other NY hotels. But why complain. There is a fantastic food hall under Grand Central right next door. Great breakfasts for 10 bucks. You can get everywhere from here easily. The rooms are large by NY standards and well kept. Our daughter fell ill, eventually ending up in hospital. The hotel staff were helpful with contact to doctors and extending our stay when they were fully booked. The room service and housekeeping were very considerate.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, Bad Facilities, Very Negative Impression”
Reviews.Author: EricTyson
Reviews.Content: I am a heavy traveler stay more than 200 nights in a hotel every year around the world, of which a big contribution goes to Hyatt chain. I arrived Grand Hyatt New York on 24 January 2012 and am still here today, checking out tomorrow 29 January 2012. I did not know a 2 star hotel could be named Grand Hyatt. I choose Grand Hyatt New York because of my trust to Grand Hyatt brand and I felt betrayed. Took me, as a high ranked Hyatt Goldpassport VIP 20 minutes to line up for check-in, at 21:00 pm, which I find difficult to understand why was there so few staff at front desk. I have requested for 1 King size bed as my usual preference, and was told that was not available. But somehow "magically" a room because available upon request to talk to Duty Manager? The room was however at low floor that receives no sun light, I wonder how many Hyatt Goldpassport VIP was staying that had higher rank than me? The water pressure was extremely low at shower, took twice or trice extra time to wash off soap and shampoo. The location was good but given the fact any hotel located next to a subway station in New York would in fact share similar convinence, so can't really give that much credit. Charging for 1-800 numbers and while asked for an explanation what should such be charged when Hyatt is not being charged, my phone was forwarded to front duck which did not pick up and put through to a voice messsage. Barrowed an umbralla and was asked for room number and "reminded" to bring back otherwise will be charged for umbralla. Very bad experience, will NEVER stay at this hotel again, and advice to those of you are considering, DON'T. And share to news to your caring ones so they don't have to go though this. This is my first review at TripAdvisor, and the motivation is to help other travelers avoid bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, but expensive to eat and drink in hotel”
Reviews.Author: toon77
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Grand Hyatt New York. Fantastic location, adjacent to Grand Central Station. Walkway connects to station from the lobby which is ideal if bad weather outside. The grand central is busy but this does in no way affect the hotel nor does subway train noise. The hotel lobby just finished renovations and is very contempory looking with a black/white/silver type colour scheme. Checked in early 10.30 and room was available ( check in normally 2pm) so very pleased but the room given was occupied when we entered. The receptionist sorted this straight away and automatically credited our account 100 dollars. Given another room overlooking the Chrysler building with two double beds' again very contemporary and comfortable. The only downside was the bathroom. Looked nice but very compact with a small tub((cannot really call it a bath - so small) and the sink has a shelf over it that prevents you from rinsing properly without banging your head. Fabulous toiletries and plentiful towels. Breakfast extremely expensive and so were the cocktails although the bar area very lively and funky looking. Check out 11am but asked to stay until 1.00pm and the hotel obliged without any charge. Staff friendly and accommodating. Porters hailed us a yellow cab outside hotel for airport run but they do offer a hotel car service which is so much more comfortable and stylish (our friends had this)but costs about 85 dollars compared to 65 dollars for the yellow cab. Would stay at the Grand Hyatt if we were to return to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but ridiculously expensive 'extras/food'”
Reviews.Author: nictry
Reviews.Content: Currently staying for a few days and the positives are that it is in a great location, next to Grand Central and central for everything in NYC Room is nice enough, not huge but big enough and comfortable bed, nice bathroom etc. Now for the bad, the pricing for food is outrageous, seriously $65 for breakfast consisting of eggs/bacon, coffee, juice and croissant, daylight robbery comes to mind! Also no free wifi, nope that is $50 for 3 days access, a room service order of chicken wings, fries and a tiny bottle of cola was $60 so basically if you do stay here I suggest not eating at all in the hotel pop a few yes outside to a local cafe and save yourself a fortune! I would add I was here on business but even I was aggrieved at paying these prices

Reviews.Title: “Best in New York”
Reviews.Author: Bawa S
Reviews.Content: I always keep comin back here. Even though i am travelling 5 miles from here every day, this is the best option in NY. Great location and great price. Only downside is no coffee machine in the room, but thats about it. Upgraded rooms, nice size as well. Oh and the best fitness center in a hotel i have seen so far.

Reviews.Title: “Great for huge New York conference-style hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Calvin L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2012 on a business/leisure trip to New York. Would rate 4.5 stars, but not given the option to. Hotel is not new, though recent renovations keep the place fresh. Elevators are old and slow, but the lobby is spacious and contemporary. Great room with a great view - paid less than $200 for some luxury. Front desk staff was very nice - Silvia was very polite and helpful. With a smile too! Not quite as good as a Grand Hyatt would be in Asia, but excellent for such a busy location in New York City. Only real complaint was that housekeeping staff had pulled out the drain stopper (and attached mechanism) in my tub and placed it aside, causing shower clog. Not something I could put back together. The engineer arrived promptly after being called, but took 10 minutes to fix it. Why would housekeeping leave a room in that condition? Shouldn't they clear all problems before allowing guests to enter the room? Virtually everything else, other than that small hiccup, was great. Room was new and clean. They also accommodated my late check-out with no hassles. I'll definitely be coming back. Pros: -Super convenient - can get to Grand Central Terminal without walking outdoors -Just renovated - rooms are clean and new, lobby feels spacious and contemporary -Rooms are clean -Excellent service - from doorman/taxi guy to front desk staff - anticipated my needs and was excellent about providing great service Cons: -Elevators are old and slow -Housekeeping carts were always in the hall, 24/7, cutting into the ambiance and style of the beautiful hallways -Housekeeping staff had no common sense

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, and great location.”
Reviews.Author: junyea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. Pleasing to the eyes. The staff is professional, and you feel awesome. Being next to Grand Central Station was the best. Any location was just a train ride away. Let alone having to tell taxi's my location was the easiest, as everyone knows where Grand Central Station was. The room was a bit on the small side. However, it was clean, fresh, and comfortable. Eateries were close by. Awesome things to see right around the corner. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but so-so rooms”
Reviews.Author: joannafrancis
Reviews.Content: The strength of this hotel is its excellent location--right next to Grand Central station. But our room was a disappointment. It was tiny but we thought that was standard for NY. Turns out we had paid for an upgrade that we never got. The temperature in the roomy was terribly cold even after we turned up the thermostat to 76. The problem was a very drafty window. The water pressure in the shower was not much more than a trickle but worst of all, Internet access was $16/day per device! Overall, the location makes it good if you don't need to spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: cathbluenose
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights back in November before a cruise. I'm familiar with New York having lived there in the past so I needed somewhere reasonable, clean with a good location and heaven forbid - somewhere without bedbugs as it seems to be a USA centric obsession nowadays. Location- can't fault it. I walked to the hotel one evening and saw the backdrop of the Chrysler building lit up behind it- lovely. The hotel itself is HUGE. I was rarely in the hotel as just used it for a base but was more than adequate for my needs. Clean, spacious room, great shower and clean.Check in was straight forward. There was a bell hop on hand immediately to help me with my (vast amount) of luggage. The concierge confirmed two lots of dinner reservations for me (different nights!) without any fuss. I did request non feather pillows and unfortunately the room had feather pillows (I'm allergic) but these again were replaced without a fuss immediately. Overall I found the staff I encountered polite, efficient and very capable of doing exactly what you expect them to do. A few minor quibbles as outlined above but nothing of any interest. I would stay here again if I got the fantastic rate I got this time!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a luxury business hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: eTurboNews
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in New York several times. This time I was lucky to be upgraded to a suite on the 32nd floor. I enjoyed the views, the space, my own dining room table, 2 large HD TV's. My bed was great and had one of the most comfortables bedding I experienced at Hyatt. The check in service was fast and efficient. Having a lightning fast internet connection in the room is great. Like most Hyatt hotel the system does not allow to send emails using your own domain - what is a little bit of a frustration. The location is fantastic. Public transportation to all airports is available right in front of the hotel. The lounge was nice and breakfast was good. The gym was nice for a city hotel. Overall I can recommend the hotel for a stay in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “A Remodeled Hyatt Reasonably Grand”
Reviews.Author: frequentstaydude
Reviews.Content: For Starters The public areas look great and the designers really got this right. They took the old Trump Hyatt Gold gaudy glitz and buried it.In its place is a world class dramatic lobby of today and tomorrow that clearly is in keeping with more of the Grand Hyatt architecture and design tradition more so of Hyatt International standards. Check in Reception Excellent and highly hospitable with can do anything attitude The new and inspired club lounge inside and out is simply sensational looking. It ranks up there with the slickest looking executive lounges I have seen anywhere in the world. In nice weather they even have an outdoor deck to enjoy the offerings outdoors. Brilliant! The silly dead butterflies on display seem odd to me inside the lounge and I'll assume some decorator’s weird idea of what would go well in the new lounge. The club is now located on the 16th floor (previously the 31rst floor) and only there did they do really do a hard renovation to the hallways and immediate areas entering the club. It’s a welcome refresh. It would have been cool to follow through on every floor.....Relocating the lounge on the 31rst floor was a good idea as the elevators are poor and take a considerably long time to get up to that floor. Especially when the hotel has high occupancy. The hotels elevators are looking worse for wear and they are the same small cramped elevators. One would hope they are slated for replacement or refurbishment. The club lounge closes for breakfast at 9:30 AM in the morning For those of us coming from other time zones especially International guests this seems uncaring and insensitive. The breakfast is satisfactory however the hotel should pay more attention to baking quality and variety of offerings as the previously did in the past. Evening offerings are now very minimal also compared to years past. The beverage selection is outstanding Accommodations’ The folks at check in couldn’t have been more hospitable and welcoming They upgraded me to a nice jr suite as a Hyatt Diamond long time guest Unfortunately it was very noisy on a mid level floor facing 42nd street. I liked my room otherwise. The caring good folks here yet upgraded me further to a quieter larger suite where I had a wonderful one night stay overall after moving. I really appreciated the small refrigerator that they now have in every room! The unexpected upside here to the new rooms is though the bed is a platform (not a fan of such beds typically) it appears Hyatt has indeed found a mattress that can disguise how firm the platform bed really is. One gets a satisfactory enough night’s sleep. Housekeeping overall needs a little more attention to detail. It seems that they are rushed to finish their duties leaving some small unattended concerns. Mind you it’s still in the acceptable range The Grand Hyatt New York Executive Club lounge was in years past the Gold standard of club lounge offerings they do need to step up their game less on presentation which is excellent and more on substance. It would bring me back more frequently. Let’s hope for more continued improvement certainly the hotel has been made more desirable.My thanks to the hotel for recognizing Gold Passport members. This is where the hotel still shines Guest Program recognition. The Hyatt may not be the best choice in town but it still remains on my very possible list every time I come into town depending on rate which frequently can be wildly overpriced. The Grand Hyatt is dependable overall and the location can’t be beat. Experiences will widely vary due to size of property and a very different array of room types. While it’s far from a great renovation it’s an adequate one and a hotel after many years is now looking better. The hotels management has changed a number of times over the course of the years. What's great about the hotel is Hyatt finds some remarkable individuals that always seem to care about the customer with or without issues that can arise. Even though challenges remain at this hotel at times I continue to return thanks to the caring team that helps you to forget this is a large convention hotel with 31 floors and over 1000 plus rooms. Just think how hard it must be to manage all guest expectations. They do reasonably well despite the service bumps along the road. Thank You Grand Hyatt for many years of caring service at the end of the day and taking good care of me! Kudos too for being interactive with your customers/customer service online and off! We can be a hard bunch to please :)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, super location”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiNut02760
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for two nights this week. I haven't been here in a while and they have totally redone the lobby. A bit too modern for my taste but not bad. Service checking in was quick and efficient. Concierge was very helpful. I had forgotten a tie and he helped me find a place (across the street - K&G) to find one at a really good price. They've also put in a small market place on the main floor which is nice to get drinks, light snacks, etc. Only one drawback was the hot water took a very long time to come up the first day - so long that I thought at first I was going to have to take a cold shower. Eventually it did come up and it was better the second day. The room was otherwise clean and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Juicy8914
Reviews.Content: Located next to Central station. Walking distance to Park Ave., 5th Ave., Times Square, Rockefeller Center...etc. The room is completely renovated except the carpet is a bit sticky. I love the contemporary headboard décor. Comfy bedding! Great price for a 4 stars hotel. Service quality definitely not deserving 4 stars; I would rate them 2 stars for service. Doorman do not greet to customer. Bell desk’s service was poor. The front desk’s service was average (don’t feel welcome). Other than the service, the facility vs. $$$ is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service but good location”
Reviews.Author: haraldar
Reviews.Content: We entered the room and there was hair in the bath tub and on the toilet seat... The 2nd day they made the rooms but did not empty the rubbish.. Plus there is no mini bar, you have to pay to store your luggage ( that is a first for a 4 stars) and the concierge are not good. Otherwise the size of the room and the deco is nice. But i won t go to the grd hyatt next time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still love the Hyatt, even with the new lobby”
Reviews.Author: busymom48713
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a two night stay and the hotel was wonderful as usual. We love the Grand Hyatt - you really can't beat the location. We've stayed many times in the last few years. On the positive side: Online check-in was a breeze, our room was large, quiet, and clean (we even had a stall shower this time which was a nice surprise), and I love all the wonderful features like touch lighting, flat screen tv, iHome, etc. Oh, and the beds are wonderfully comfortable. Staff members were all pleasant and helpful - from check-in to check-out everyone we encountered was wonderful. Just one thing that I didn't care for: The new lobby - I'm sorry Hyatt, I love you but the new lobby is pretty non-functional. The Jetsons chairs look great but have you noticed that all of the guests have to practically fold in half to get in and out of them, and everyone looks hunched over? I normally love to grab a cup of coffee and a muffin at the Marketplace and sit in the lobby to check my email/messages and get ready for the day - it's something I look forward to usually. I just couldn't do it during this stay. Even the bench seats look great, but again, not very comfortable. They barely come up to my shins - I should have just sat on the floor. I'm hoping that these become accent pieces and the real lobby furniture is still on order?? So, bottom line I still highly recommend the Grand Hyatt to anyone travelling in NY. You can't beat the location, the value, or the staff. You'll have a treat stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: Hotelsnobb
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a girls' weekend in NYC and a great stay at the Hyatt. This hotel is convenient to 5th Ave. shopping (especially Lord & Taylor), good restaurants, and Grand Central Station is right next door! One of the doormen recommended having lunch in Grand Central Station. Great tip! There's actually a food court with dozens of choices, though much more upscale than a typical mall food court. They also have sit down restaurants and some shops...you could spend a few hours there! Check in was quick & easy thanks to Diane, who was superb...very helpful & welcoming! The hotel has recently been renovated and is very sleek & sophisticated. Rooms are modern and chic, yet warm and inviting. I loved the little extra touches like a cozy nap blanket on the bed, extra shelves in the shower for storage, and reading lights on each bed. The bathroom was small (typical in NYC) and could've used a bit more storage & a couple more hooks, but absolutely loved the ultra modern square showerhead..the perfect pressure and amount of water. The closet was a walk in with plenty of storage for bags, shoes, etc. There's a market in the lobby, which not only has drinks, sandwiches, and basics, but hot items, and lots of little extras like Dylan's candy. Very convenient so you don't even have to leave the hotel! Nice trip and will be sure to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Busy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimCity_AU
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of four in an executive suite on holiday in New York. The hotel is very modern with good rooms although the bathroom was very small (but expected as it is NY). Location was the best part of the Grand Hyatt, situated right next to Grand Central Station and within walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building and other major attractions. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, going out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. The lobby was always busy with people as the hotel is very large. This resulted in some long waits for an elevator at peak periods, especially in the morning. Housekeeping were average, sometimes missing a few things such as replacing the toilet roll or making the beds properly. Otherwise we had a good stay here, highly recommend it for the location.

Reviews.Title: “even better!”
Reviews.Author: MarcoBittencourt
Reviews.Content: Second time we choose to stay at the Hyatt New York and this time it's even better after the reform lobby and rooms. Give preference to upper floors because the view is amazing and so you can have breakfast in the hotel, service is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: suga_8
Reviews.Content: right next door to grand central station ,great location.,nice room .the lobby is spectacular ,ice machines on each floor.shampoo n soap changed daily.walking distance to times square .and broadway ,very enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Sallyann B
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for my mums birthday and as it was a special occasion i wanted it to be perfect. This Hotel was in a great location. Just a few minutes walk to Times Square/Broadway and an even shorter walk to 5th Avenue. The hotel staff were also very friendly and polite. I received a free upgrade upon arrival to a kingsize bed which was perfect, also on check out they offered complimentary late check out which was even better! The room was much more spacious than i had anticipated, after hearing the rooms in NYC were usually a little small this in fact was perfect. I had also read a few reviews about the bathroom, i had a new refurbished bathroom and it was very clean with a new style shower. They have a mail room also for those who may need to send packages. The Gym was great and easy to access. I didn't eat in the hotel as i was so eager to explore the area but the restaurant looked great. You have many shops right near the hotel and Grand Central Station is a site to look at! I highly recommend this hotel and i myself will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMMeadows
Reviews.Content: Stayed in December 2011 whilst on holiday for a week with my girlfriend. We had a fantastic time all made easier with the location of the hotel. A lot of tourist attractions were easily accessible by foot, and for those that weren't we used the subway located next door. We had access to the newly renovated grand club which was well worth the money after a long day out sightseeing. We did have a slight issue with the TV in our room but swiftly decided that it wasn't a big problem. The staff were very helpful and did offer a room switch but we decided to stay put as we werent there to watch TV anyhow! It wasn't the first time I'd stayed and it won't be the last! If you're thinking about spending Christmas (or any other time for that matter!) in New York then stay at the Grand Hyatt!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: skinanny
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just recently redone. I could see from the entrance to the lobby have tried very hard to make this a "hip" redo... We were traveling with our grandson who is 14 so when making the reservation I told them I wanted "connecting" not adjoining rooms. Our first room was a joke, so small with no bath tub, our second room that they showed us had a bath tub but it was not connecting, but next door. I took the room with a tub but wasn't happy that our grandson was next door but not ajoining us. The next morning we changed again, this time to two very nice and large rooms that were connecting. The rooms were spacious, the bathrooms were small. They have put electric shades in the bedrooms,one of our rooms it worked fine the second room the shade was broken. We had purposely wanted to be on the concierge floor so we could grab a quick breakfast before heading out for the day. The lounge was fine, but not nearly enough seating for the amount of floors it services, so we were always taking our food back to our room to eat. The location of the hotel is great. It's walking distance to theatre and shopping. Also next door to Grand Central Terminal. Terrific for families there to sight see, as were we.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydFam40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days from Boxing day and after reading the reviews here - we did not have high expectations - and that was lucky! We arrived after 4.30pm and our rooms weren't ready - a large group from a College football team were staying there and they were the priority for the hotel. The rooms are seriously small - but at least they were renovated - but there was no where to put our stuff. The bathrooms are small, but functional. Our room on the 23rd floor had absolutely no natural light - and this was depressing after awhile. The elevators were constantly busy and it was generally chaos in the foyer. I understand that the football team was a priority - but they seem to have spread themselves to thin from a service persepctive. We would not stay here again - even though the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to everything”
Reviews.Author: Alecka
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel.. very big and close to everything. I find it was located right next to really nice shopping spots and also right on top of the subway and it was easy to get around. the hotel itself is very nice.. the lobby is huge and it's a good spot to sit at the bar area and people watch :-) .. The rooms were really nice and the staff and services were nice. I am very picky about cleanliness and it was very clean. The staff was nice, but didn't really go the extra mile but overall it was a nice hotel and a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: Christina B
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located next to (connected to, actually) Grand Central Station, it was very easy to access the subway without even stepping outside. For those who prefer a taxi, you can catch a cab right outside the door. Most importantly for us, the shuttle bus that goes to/from LaGuardia and JFK was literally across the street. It was a simple and cheap way to get to/from the airport. Being connected to Grand Central had a lot of perks, including having several coffee shops and restaurants as well as a food market in the same building. There was a Rite Aid pharmacy and even a MAC Cosmetics in the Grand Central shops as well. The area directly around the hotel had a lot of shopping and a few restaurants and bars. There are more "nightlife" type spots a few blocks north and south of the hotel (not exactly walking distance in the winter, but maybe in the warmer months). The hotel itself was very nice. I booked a Queen room, but when we checked in I asked if we could get upgraded in some way and we quickly received a room with a king size bed and a "view." The view wasn't phenomenal, we could see the reflection of the Chrysler building and I think it was the best we could get in that area. The room was definitely big enough for 2 people. (I was worried after reading how small NYC hotel rooms can be.) The room had a closet, ironing board/iron, small couch and table, iPod docking station/alarm clock, hair dryer, toiletries and toothpaste. The best part was the shower. The shower head was a large square with amazing water pressure and felt like being in a rain shower. Honestly, it was probably the best shower I've used in a hotel in recent memory. The only negative comment I have about this hotel is that on the last night we were there, the front desk accidentally booked someone else in our room and issued him room keys. We were watching TV when he literally walked right in. I called the front desk right away and they were very apologetic and offered to move us to a new room immediately. We declined to move since it was our last night and we didn't want to move all of our stuff, but they did make us new keys and the front desk manager was extremely helpful. Aside from that, we had a great stay. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others. (Note: We booked through Priceline, so we got a cheaper price than if we had booked directly through the hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jandr022
Reviews.Content: We are very picky about hotels and we figured that this would be a standard Hyatt hotel, which are typically nice. However, this hotel really is exceptional. Their renovation is extremely nice, very modern and chic. I would absolutely recommend this particularly in light of the very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Susannah M
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about the hotel is the location which is very central. Long queues at check-in, bad attitude of the staff, bedrooms have the kind of decor where you want to slit your wrists it is so terrible, bathrooms so tiny you practically have to have a shower on the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “What a great new year !”
Reviews.Author: RobTaylor1978
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel Would stay here again This was my third time to New York and beat hotel yet!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our New Year stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: louie193
Reviews.Content: The staff here are so, so helpful. We had two small issues with our room which were resolved within a few hours and we also received complimentary breakfast vouchers. The breakfast was great. The beds are massive and we slept very well! Location is great, there is a cab rank outside and T Square is within walking distance. If you are a coffee person, then ask for a portable coffee machine. There is a 24 hour food place in the lobby but it is quite expensive. Best to find a local Duane Reade! Check- out is 11am but we asked to keep our room until 1pm and there was no extra charge. You can also check- out of your room by computer and can also check-in for flights and print boarding passes. This is all available in the lobby. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff and they should all be praised! We would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but expected more after such a large refuebishment”
Reviews.Author: LolitaSydney
Reviews.Content: Lobby refurbishment is nice. Refurbished rooms are ok, not great. Didnt find the room was clean. Towels were set out for three and we had four in our family. We had to keep asking for towels for four, they would deliver them and take them away again the next day when cleaning the room. Shower barely worked. All we could get was a dribble of water

Reviews.Title: “Great place because of localization”
Reviews.Author: aninhavillela
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good But the most important aspect is the localization in the grand central that we found great considering that in NYC we used subway frequently. The cleaning was good, but as it is a big hotel do not expect a great attention of the staff, but at the same time they are kind and solved our problems. We asked for late check-out and for a hundred dollars we stayed until 6 pm, whitch was perfect because our flight was at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roshy10
Reviews.Content: Stayed 12 nights and have plenty of positive comments to share: Location - Flawless! Could not get a better spot than right in the heart of Midtown. When you first arrive and you spot the Hyatt between the Chrysler building & Grand Central Station you will not be disappointed & instantly fall in love with NYC! Also, much nicer area than getting stuck in the hustle 24/7 of times square hotels. Ultimately, the location is critical as you would spend more time traveling around NYC than sleeping at any hotel. The Grand is ideally located for all the main tourist attractions & the grand central station next door is quite convenient. Bedroom - Modern, comfy bed, clean bathroom (even though i am a shower not a bath man), touch light switches can be annoying at first. Service/Concierge - Danny has been one of the best hotel service staff i have ever had the pleasure of getting assistance from. Plenty of great tips/advice, friendly & all round nice guy. Also the lovely blonde greeter with the kind smile every morning is much appreciated. Only ONE negative aspect.. $10-15 for Wi-Fi access? Come on, you got to be dreaming!! Free wi-fi should be standard at any major 4+ star hotel! Aside from that, our stay at the Grand Hyatt was pleasant, drama/incident-free, and i would definitely come back in any future trip in NYC. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: joeyboy79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a number of times, good sized rooms, good value, centrally located, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: tlovesl1435
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December for the weekend of my birthday and found it to be a very pleasant surprise. We were unsure because it is right outside of Grand Central Station, we thought that it may just be to congested. The rooms were surprisingly very large (most NY hotel rooms are so small) and comfortable. The restaurant and bar on site were very nice and the service was good. The location turned out to be wonderful as we could walk to all Holiday attractions.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: GillianMarinus
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights before embarking on a cruise. Great location and the fact that it is attached to the Grand central station is a bonus! Lots of shops and eateries in the station. So you won't be lost for finding something to eat quickly! Stayed on the 28th floor. The hotel is not known for its great views but we could at least see down onto 42nd Street. The bed was great after an almost 24 hour flight! No tea/coffee facilities though - disappointing! Totally enjoyed our stay and will definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Steraimo
Reviews.Content: location is great, very close to Grand Central and the metro. Rooms are very spacious and service is nice. Concierge was helpful assisting us with tickets for musicals and also suggested nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas and Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: travelbugRNC
Reviews.Content: Read allot of varied comments on this hotel, so I did not know what to expect. Check in was pleasant, arrived before noon, and they stated no rooms where available. But noticed sitting in the lobby for an hour after checking our bags with bellman, they gave keys to other guests. Perhaps since we where not a Frequent Guest member, we did not rate on the list, Hotel room, was updated, small but it is NYC, nice updates, very modern, only complaint the bed lights had been broken and removed. Liked the other lighting style in the room Cafe food service in the lobby had a nice variety, location great. When we checked out had to pay per bag to hold our luggage until a later flight..........

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LorraineH390
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful we used it on our first trip to New york. Massive room 2 double beds very comfortable. Location right beside Grand Central Station. Loved the whole experience would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations complete and great location”
Reviews.Author: Guitariola
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel in August for a December vacation. My original reservation was for two double beds, but when we got to the hotel, they had a shortage on these rooms. They offered to move me to a King with free breakfast at the hotel for the duration of my stay. I found the hotel staff to be very helpful and the proximity to Grand Central and Bryant Park subway stops were great. I would definitely stay at the hotel again and would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Beth A
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel for 5 nights in nov 2010, for thanksgiving. Stunning hotel with grand lobby, also we got upgraded to executive floor, as our room had been given to another of our party, receptionist could not have done anymore also apologising for This inconvenience and sending proseco and strawberry to our room, we did not mind at all but this was delightful and much appreciated. Hotel was in an ideal location for many of the sights and attraction a NY has to offer, I cannot wait to return as this hotel and city is mesmerising. In luv with this hotel and the the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emmytots
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to the Grand Hyatt, NYC. We stayed from boxing day until new years eve. We ordered breakfast the first morning which was really tasty came exactly at the time we specified and the bill was so easy to deal with upon check out, speaking of which they allowed late check out (1pm instead of 11am) for free anything further there would be a charge however I'm unsure of how much the charge was. The hotel was cleaned everyday and we were given new toiletries & towels every day, the room was very spacious with a closet to store cases, iron and ironing board & also a combination safe which you can set yourself. There was temperature control in the room which we didn't actually need as the room was warm enough. We had a view of the street and grand central from our room and the window could open. There is a place to store your luggage upon check out if needed for $2 per bag - although I've never had to pay for this service any where else before I would rather pay $2 than carry my suitcase around all day! There were also some plug sockets in and around the lobby waiting area to charge phone etc which came in handy for us. If you go out the hotel doors to the right and go in the first doors to grand central station take the escalator down to the right - this will take you to the 'shuttle' which is a subway train (there are 4) that only run directly between Times Square and Grand Central which was amazing! We paid $29 for a 7 day unlimited subway pass from which we got our monies worth! This is my 2nd time in NY and I did not use the subway system on my 1st trip as I'm claustrophobic, however the trams are quite big and run so frequently they are rarely too packed to get on, you can get practically anywhere in manhattan in 15 min - journies which would take over an hour by any other means. We got so many things done by travelling via subway and having the shuttle next door was amazing! I can't fault the hotel and would %100 go back it was clean, comfortable, contemporary decor, and brilliant location - we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel but ... Needs to Be 'Completely' No Smoking”
Reviews.Author: flymeaway2
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Grand Hyatt and we visit for 2 + weeks when we do stay. As mentioned the location is excellent. We have also stayed on three occasions at the Helmsley down the street but the bonus of the Hyatt is being directly attached to Grand Central and the metro. Our room had been renovated and updated since our last visit and it was done well. Staff at the front desk when checking in were friendly, accommodating and efficient. Because we were staying 16 nights we were given a larger room which was very much appreciated. My only complaint is that our room at the end of our stay had a cigarette smoke smell coming in through the air vents. Not impressed, I contacted reception + my husband spoke to them. New York has some of, if not the toughest bylaws on smoking in the country. I do not understand why the Grand Hyatt has smoking rooms available for an additional charge. We were told our floor was non smoking. When checking out I mentioned the cigarette smoke in our room again and I was told the guests who were smoking would be charged an additional $250 service charge. Unfortunately, this does not help me. My husband is allergic to cigarette smoke and we experienced four restless and sleepless nights because of the smoke odor in our room. It is not difficult to determine if a guest is smoking in a room and I think management should have been more proactive about speaking to the guests rather than simply dismissing it with a service charge at the end of their stay. Consideration has to be given to the remaining guests on the same floor. I love the Grand Hyatt but I have to say that serious consideration will have to be given for our next visit because cigarette smoke is not acceptable when you are booking what you believe is a non smoking room. A good night's sleep may win out over the convenience of location.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Loud and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Keldo22
Reviews.Content: Part of the fun of staying in New York is finding the Chic, Swank and Odd places to stay. The Hyatt is an expensive average but safe stay. If you want quiet and relaxing after a long day of sighseeing you won't get it here. The building has been renovated but still lacks warmth. I would say even on a Hyatt scale this hotel does not rank as a prime gem. I am sure it is a money maker for the chain though. You will find the Hyatt VERY busy.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, Outstanding Location, Outstanding Price!”
Reviews.Author: StevenParky
Reviews.Content: Hi have just returned here following a Christmas break. We got a great deal for this hotel (£800 pp including BA flights from Heathrow and 5 Nights in Queen Room). We were immediately upgraded on arrival to a King. Location: Located directly in-between Grand Central station (there is actually a concourse from the station directly into the hotel) and also next to the Chrysler building. Also, the drop off / collection for the Newark, JFK or La Guardia shuttles are located over the road. A 10 minute walk from Times Square or Empire State. Inside: Recently refurbished, everywhere is in excellent condition. Staff are very helpful and an electronic check in system if you want to is a quick way to get sorted. There is a nice bar ($8 for a beer) which overhangs the walkway, giving great views of the NYC traffic and Metlife building. Checkout: If you have a later flight and want to see some sights, you can leave your bags at the concierge ($2 per bag) so make sure you get everything into as few as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Central location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Carlosallan13
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Grand Hyatt and it is perfect for getting to everything in New York. We would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: Honu_Ohana
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Grand Hyatt in late December 2011. It's our top choice for several reasons, most notably its convenient location. We walk there from Amtrak Penn Station in under 30 minutes; we can walk to museums and restaurants and work off some of the calories from our restuarant meals, too! :-) It is next to Grand Central Station, and the food market and wine shop there are excellent for picking up snacks or things to take home. The Hyatt has also added a 24-hour market in the lobby, with prices that seemed quite reasonable for NYC ($3 for coffee or hot chocolate). The hotel has been re-done in "current style" which means brushed chrome and dark colors in the lobby. The rooms have also been re-done. Ours was smallish but adequate, with a comfortable king bed and small chaise lounge, flat panel TV, safe, empty small refrigerator. No shower cap, however, but toothpaste was provided. Go figure...guess they expect mostly men! Also no robes, so bring one if you want one. The bed was very comfortable and the room was fairly quiet. You do hear people talking in the hallways so stay away from the elevators if you want a quiet room. Housekeeping was excellent and the employees were friendly and helpful. All in all, not a luxurious or papmering hotel, but a perfectly fine one for a well-located midtown visit to NYC. It's a bit steep in terms of Hyatt points rating for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: PinkFloydActuary
Reviews.Content: I was excited about my first trip to the Big Apple, and there probably wasn't a better situated hotel than the Grand Hyatt. Located right next to Grand Central Station, in a town that is meant for walking, there are so many things to walk to from here. While there, they were renovating the lobby, so it was not the greatest entrance in the world, but I did like the fact that you can check in via kiosks, get your key, and head to your room. The hallways and rooms are in great shape, although the rooms are a little on the small side. The bathrooms are small, but they provide all the basic toiletries. There is also a safe, which always is nice to have. While the view I had wasn't the greatest, I did appreciate that I could leave my room and be in the middle of the action within a few minutes. There's a ton of shopping in Grand Central, and there's standards like CVS just around the corner. The bus to Newark Airport parks just a block away, so transport to the airports are also easily accessed. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel for NYC visit”
Reviews.Author: loujoamk
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel - superb location with easy travel to all areas of the city and . The terminal has an amazing range of shops and dining venues, as well as close proximity to a range of shops, cafes and restaurants, The airport shuttle bus service costs $27 round trip and drops you off at the door (all 3 airports). 5th Avenue is 2 mins away - Times Square ( & Empire State Building) a pleasant 10 min walk.The hotel is beautiful, rooms are spacious and clean / well serviced. We booked room only so I can't comment on meals etc. Staff are polite, helpful and courteous. The concierge service is open from 7am and they are helpful and can arrange reservations etc - they will also advise if you can get a cheaper service elsewhere eg we wanted to do bus tour and concierge told us that on-street sales-people offer best service and value! We were able to leave our bags after check-out for $2 per bag. My only (very small criticism is the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room. A pot of tea costs $12 from room service - there is a vendor in the lobby which does snacks and drinks but the service is very slow and it's also quite expensive. An amazing hotel - I hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Hotel could do better!”
Reviews.Author: Bazzog
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Grand Hyatt with my wife for 4 nights before the christmas holidays. On a short trip to NYC we found the hotel to be very conveniently located above/beside Central Station and within walking of alot of major sites. Subway located within the building for sites further afield, and the bus to JFK airport for our return trip was located directly across the road which was of great convenience. Our room was on the 20th floor and i can only assume from reading other reviews that our room, which although comfortable and quiet was rather compact as was the bathroom. The main problem encountered was concerning information provided by the concierge for a restuarant relatively nearby (or should have been) that we had made a reservation for. We gave him the restuarant name and the area it was in so that he could google and provide us with an exact address. I appreciate that i should have taken the address or number with me but even with this oversight i didnt think it was too much to expect to be provided with accurate information after he had checked on his computer. The end result was we found ourselves a block and several streets away from where we were due to be and with my wife in high heels on a cold freezing night giving me a hard time was aggravation i didnt need!, Eventually after having to seek directions from numerous passers by on several streets, we ended up almost 45 minutes late but luckily we reached our destination and enjoyed our meal. We did not sample food in the hotel but did have a drink one night (a hot whiskey and a beer) which came to about $24 which i thought was a bit OTT, so didnt return. Overall Our stay went well and these gripes are minor compared to what many other people have to deal with regarding hotels. One final tip would be that there is a great cafe nearby on Lexington Ave.(Scotties) that serves up a mean breakfast at very reasonable prices... So good in fact that we ate there each morning, which set us up well for the day ahead(:.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Walt61588
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in December amd it was very nice. Check in was a breeze and the front staff helped us check in easily. The room was nice althought the bathroom had some broken figures and the shower was just ok. Worth staying at due to location and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Grand club is a grand pain!”
Reviews.Author: D C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt New York every New Years for the past 7 years, always on the Regency Club level. The reason we chose this hotel was because of the regency club rooms and the lounge. We've noticed over the years the regency club expand, but not the facilities, so we were delighted when we heard of the renovations. Unfortunately, while the lounge has expanded slightly, the number of people with access seems to have expanded exponentially. This is the first year we were unable to stay on the floor of the club lounge(although we are on the old club floor 31) - it used to be that only people on the club floor had access to the lounge - those were good days! In my opinion the club experience has become pedestrian. I may as well go to time square to get my coffee - I'm sure there will be less people. Other things - door man asked if we needed help with luggage, I said yes, and then he helped the taxi driver get the bags out of the taxi, and left them on the sidewalk for us. The room while nice and roomy does not have a desk. There is a fridge in the cabinet, with nothing in it. The new safe has room for my computer, which is nice. The bathroom is the smallest one of any hotel in which I've stayed. The new closets are nice and roomy. The bed is comfortable and the convenience of having ac and lighting controls next to the bed is a plus. The new geneva sound system does not work. The 42 inch tv is lcd but since there are no digital channels, only analog, all of the channels have a light fuzz. It seems that this will end our New Years eve ritual of staying at the Grand Hyatt. Any suggestions?

Reviews.Title: “Decent for New York, not even close to Hyatt standards worldwide”
Reviews.Author: R V
Reviews.Content: As a Hyatt Diamond member I found this Grand Hyatt to be below the world average for the brand. I purposely select Hyatt wherever I go, as I'm constantly traveling on business around the globe. While 99% of the time I get exactly what I expect from Hyatt hotels, this particular hotel shouldn't bear the Grand Hyatt label. For starters our Club Floor room was not adequately clean, no dedicated checking in facility was available and the Club even charges for beer and wine (a first ever for any Hyatt I have stayed in!). If this location is compared to similar (major cities) facilities in Hong Kong, London, Dubai, Istanbul, Berlin, and numerous others, New York is a poor cousin at best. If loyalty is important to Hyatt, they better do a thorough review of this facility, since I won't likely chose Hyatt on my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “2-week stay turned nightmare”
Reviews.Author: 5shyams
Reviews.Content: I have had good experiences at Hyatt hotels before. This one was a disappointment like nothing I had faced before. This is the reason why this hotel deserved my lowest rating ever: 1. Horribly rude staff. I remember my husband and I wanted to share the tea we took from the little coffee shop downstairs. The tea was complementary for us but we did not want to take another cup hoping to not waste anything. The guy behind the counter replied in a curt manner 'Sir, in this part of the world, nothing comes free of cost. Fork out the money for an additional cup'. I was ok with him not wanting to give us an additional cup, but that kind of remark was unsavory. While my husband brushed it aside as a typical New York sarcasm, I found it offensive. 2. The rooms are stuffy. They should have a better ventilating system in the rooms. I developed a severe allergy due to tiny particles in the air which would often make it difficult to breathe. I complained about it to the management who got the room inspected and casually added 'It happens some times. We will make sure the room is properly cleaned and fumigated'. I dont know what they did but the discomfort continued for the 2 weeks we were in the room. 3. Bad service - I am a vegetarian. Usually wherever I stay, I ask for customized dishes to be made for me. This usually involves replacing the meat in a dish with veggies. I did not expect to be rudely turned down specially in a place which charges you a bomb! I told them 'I am starving and it is snowing outside, so can you send over some plain rice. I will manage with it.' to which I got 'Sorry mam, we do not serve like that. You will have to order something off the menu' I can go on and on about what a horrible experience it was... They pretty much tried their best to ruin my 2-week trip to NYC, a place I had been wanting to visit ever since I got hooked onto to FRIENDS.. Before I conclude, let us not forget the few pluses: 1. The location is great!!! It is convenient to go everywhere in NYC from this location. This was the only reason why we chose this place and I deeply regret that decision! An emphatic NO from me for anyone who is remotely considering this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location by Grand Central and Bryant Park”
Reviews.Author: Terps92
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have stayed here since the completion of the renovations. The lobby appears bigger with a contemporary feel. The staff was welcoming and helpful. They could of done a better job of decorating for the holidays. The new Regency room is beautiful and offers great snacks, hors devours, etc. Unfortunately, alcohol comes with a charge. We stayed in a suite and the accommodations were great. The room was large and comfortable. The gym did not make any changes, but there really was not a need to as it is an above average gym for a hotel. The locations is great and walking distance to Times Square and Bryant Park.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business hotel, reasonable prices for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: EduTravelerMidwest
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the fastest check-in processes I've ever seen. I checked in using my credit card and had a great room within seconds. The hotel is quite large so don't go expecting a quaint boutique experience in Manhattan. It's right by Grand Central so you can take the subway to anywhere you want to go and please do yourself a favor and take the subway in Manhattan - it's part of the experience. I had a meeting at the hotel's restaurant and found the food to be reasonably priced (again, by Manhattan standards, not St. Louis standards) and check-out was extremely efficient as well. The rooms are very clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience Plus”
Reviews.Author: Yesbut
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an entrance within Grand Central Station, so for travelers arriving by train it is the perfect choice. There is also excellent valet service for those arriving by car. Besides the marvelous amenities offered by the hotel itself, you have the unmatched pleasures of the station's shops, restaurants, sights and sounds. To me and my family, Grand Hyatt is absolutely the perfect location for celebrations of all kinds. The hotel offers first-class service, food, and accomodations. It is the third time we've been here, and we've already agreed to return next December. A recent renovation turned this traditional hotel into a super-modern facility. You might wish you had an instruction booklet for turning on the lights, lowering window shades, using bathroom faucets, etc. Industrial pipe clusters hang over your head at breakfast. This is modern so sharp it bites!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Zletsgo
Reviews.Content: Second trip to New York and if I learnt one thing from the first was that although nice to have a great hotel it's the location that's more important in NYC. This being parked on top of Grand Terminal makes it easy to get everywhere, in fact you can avoid the rain completely by dipping down the lobby to the subways without having to go outside. A walk to Times Sq is a nice stroll, less than a mile via Bryant Park (lovely at xmas with stalls and the ice rink). The service we had was good indeed - very friendly by New York standards, booked via expedia the room was bumped to a corner one on the 19th floor by the receptionist, spacious and modern, no tea or coffee facilities but there's a fridge and we received lots of free coffee vouchers for the lounge in reception. Bed was comfy - that's the biggy as you'll spend more time out and about than you will in your hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Grand hyatt New York Nov 2011”
Reviews.Author: MunchkinMoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 3 nights from 26-29th November 2011. It was our first time in New York, and we absolutely loved it! We were checked in by Veronica, who was so welcoming and friendly! We stayed in a room with a fabulous king sized bed and views of the Chrysler building! The towels were changed every day, and the room was kept very well cleaned. The slightly downside was the pillows, they very so big and uncomfortable, but I am quite fussy with things like that and i normally take my own, so I am just being very picky! We loved New York so much we are going back to get married in December 2012! Hopefully if we can find a good deal we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Hyatt New York---not sanitary”
Reviews.Author: Jimbopkim
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt near Grand Central was our favorite hotel, about 25 years ago. Today it's run down, dirty, and dangerous. The staff doesn't speak English well. The renovation has not improved the atmosphere (except the new coffee shop is nice) Anyway, it's a big disappointment. We now live in London and travel to NYC often.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Acer34t
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Grand Level while in town to see the city highlighted for Christmas. Amazing hotel, amazing room. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel staff i ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: DanielOon
Reviews.Content: Thinking that Hyatt is a world renown institution & famed for its reputation & great hospitable service in ASEAN locations. I was truly & genuinely disappointed wt many hotel staff, very cocky, very snobbish, aloof, unfriendly, unapproachable, condescending, obvious racial discriminations toward Asians. Having travelled the whole world, i've never encountered such despicable attitude by a reputable hotel wt such ugly treatmemts especially the concierge white guys & when i collect my lost baggage by that 2 unruly black guys, damn rude. I find staff in Minneapolis & Orlando are so much better & sweet & heavenly than these dumb New Yorkers. i truly give good credit to Danny, the concierge, who has been the most outstandingly helpful, pleasant & resourceful personnel to our 5 day stay. NYC Grand Hyatt has significantly lost all my respects for Hyatt group completely.

Reviews.Title: “Strange place”
Reviews.Author: efghij
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt just after they had finished renovations. We walked in to a very large, brightly lighted lobby and saw directly ahead a Going out of Business Poster in front of a shop off the lobby and also many people perching on backless seats, eating and drinking coffee. A concession selling food and coffee was just beyond the front desk.The first impression was of tackines.
