When we reached our room, booked as a king bed, we found it to be queen; on calling the front desk, we were told the king rooms were booked out, but we might get one for the next night. We had no choice but to agree. We indeed did get a king bed room the next day, but found that the lamp overhanging the couch didn't work, nor did one bed reading light. The electrician came up and solved the first problem with a replacement bulb, but said the bedlight could not be fixed without calling in a carpenter as the wiring was in the wall behind the built-in headboard. He helped us improvise with an overturned wastebasket and table lamp. We noticed that the dirty corridor rugs did not seem to be vacuumed outside our door. Our maid neglected to leave washclothes the second night, in itself not a horrible flaw, however our impression of the place was that there was no attention to detail on the part of the staff. Nor did it appear that management had a very strong interest in happy guests.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt New York City”
Reviews.Author: Chris Y
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt New York City two weeks ago and had an incredible stay! This hotel had a remarkable renovation. We stayed there three years ago and the hotel was amazing, but now, it's just beautiful. The location is great and it's within walking distance to Time Square. The maids are all polite, and the girls that work the front desk are very accommodating. My wife and I booked seats to see the show Memphis, which was amazing, and the concierge at the Hyatt really helped us with our bookings and the restaurant recommendations were amazing. I highly recommend this hotel for it's great location, convenience to shopping, and wonderful accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: mabes1982
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late after a long delayed flight but was checked in and in our room within ten minutes. The chap on the reception desk extremely friendly and even gave us a king size bed rather than a double for free - which was nice! The room was smaller than other hotels I have stayed in but we were out most of the day and evening so didnt really mind! Bed is extremely comfortable, room very clean, fridge and safe in room and a large cupboard with clothes rail in and shelf to store your luggage. Ironing board, iron and hairdryer all provided. All pretty standard for a hotel but after some of the reviews on here I was a little concerned we would be staying in a shoebox with just a bed in it - but gladly not!! There were a few minor points that could be addressed - the plumbing is a bit noisy during the night but didnt wake us up - you just noticed it when you got up. Other than that the hotel was extremely quiet which I was amazed being in a big city. Toilet roll holder is on the wall next to the toilet but its behind you so you have to reach round for it - which in the middle of the night can become a bit frustrating! TV is to the side of the bed rather than in front so you have to sit rather uncomfortably if you want to watch TV in bed. Also would be handy to have a tea and coffee maker in the room. But these are just minor things, did not ruin our stay at all, they are just observations! Staff were very friendly from reception to housekeeping. We had to call maintenance out to look at our shower and they turned up within a few minutes. Turns out it was just us being idiots and not realising how to use it! We didnt eat in the hotel - only used the Market for drinks and snacks so cant comment on the food. We generally ate at Pershing Square which is over the road from the hotel and serves amazing food - the pancakes are to die for. Highly recommended. The location is fantastic, subway just outside, 10 to 15 minute walk (depending on crowds!) to Empire state building, Rockefeller Centre & Times Square. All in all a great stay and would definitely stay here again if/when go back to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but small room, but curiously poor maintenance and lousy TV”
Reviews.Author: MacWilder
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location, as this venerable hotel is immediately adjacent to Grand Central Terminal at 42nd and Lex. The Good: Clean. No visible sign of bedbugs. Fairly recently refurbished rooms. Lots of electric outlets. Pretty good lighting. In-room ironing room and iron. HTML and RGB inputs for TV. Fairly rapid check-in and checkout (although the terminals for self-service don't work properly.) Fairly responsive elevators. Checkout time was extended without trouble. The Bad: Rooms small--many with view only into the adjacent rooms 20 feet away. Low def analog signals for digital TVs resulting in squished, low quality pictures. Some channels like the NBC outlet very snowy. TV Guide hidden in back of book with menus. No in-room coffee brewers. No rack for suitcases. The Strange: Lousy routine maintenance. The sign guiding guests to their room had fallen to the floor, where it remained for at least 24 hours. The fire alarm was not present in the room, leaving only a bracket with cables hanging out. The switch for one of the bedside lamps was shattered. The floor indicator in an elevator was defective.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel can be great, here is how to make sure your stay is good!”
Reviews.Author: AussieBizTraveller
Reviews.Content: Firstly lower expectations from Grand Hyatt hotels elsewhere in the world. This is impersonal and not as good on the service front. Now, here is how to make it a great stay: 1. Book a grand deluxe room on a high floor - note though that all floors say they are 10 floors higher than they are, eg stay on level 16 and it is only level 6. We started on 16 in a deluxe room and asked to be moved that night as it was so noisy from their ballroom. We moved to a GRAND deluxe on level 30 (ie20) and that was brilliant. Big, carpeted, and quiet as a mouse. 2. Don't pay for the Club privileges. They don't even include beer or wine and the food selection in the evening is 2 types of cheese and one hot canapé. Waste of money, you are better off heading out for breakfast and evening drinks as there are tones of places around. 3. Don't do the hotel car to the airport when you leave. They say it will be $65 flat rate as opposed to a taxi which is $45 plus tolls plus tip, but when you get in the hotel car they took us the back way, no freeway. Cheeky way of pocketing the toll money. So, hotel is in a great location, grand deluxe rooms around the 30th floor are great, just please consider the advice above so you have a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: Jpeacott
Reviews.Content: $450 a night and not even a coffee maker in the room. Mildew growing on the shower curtain, stinking up the room. Checkin was a disaster - multiple lines, no signs as to where to wait. It was obvious the hotel cares mre about its new chic bar than the guest experience.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out - they charge extra for everything!!!! Is this just a ripoff?”
Reviews.Author: Dmblue
Reviews.Content: Two examples .my wife and I wanted some wine glasses and corkscrew brought to our room ( in our experience they are usually in the room when you arrive at any decent hotel, but not here!). The Hyatt wanted to charge $38 for delivery!! . My wife and I have iPads,iPhones,computer - in fact 5 wireless devices. There is no free wifi in room so we paid the $16.95 a day to connect to premium service. We then found out this covers only one device - the 5 would cost $85 a day. Buyer beware !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ALANJOHN1962
Reviews.Content: Having just come back from here I must say what a fantastic hotel this is due to the fact it's just been decorated while having a great location. Finally I got a great deal when booking through low cost holidays usa

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great city”
Reviews.Author: SanfordEvans
Reviews.Content: Who could ask for a better location? Right over Grand Central Station, so you have access to the incredible New York City subway system that can take you virtually any place in the five boroughs. You're also a two minute walk to buses going uptown, downtown and crosstown. Grand Central also has two levels filled with food shops and restaurants, priced from very reasonable to not so reasonable, but very delicious. You're also close to literally hundreds of restaurants serving great food and walking distance from the great theaters and shows on Broadway and Lincoln Center. Getting back to the hotel: It's recently been remodeled. The rooms are modern looking and extremely comfortable. And the staff will bend over backwards to accommodate you in every way they can. As for the price, it varies with the season, but the last time I stayed there I found it very reasonable and a real value for the money. You'll leave feeling rested, relaxed and glad you stayed there

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience during Christmas time”
Reviews.Author: Robert T
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to New York for her Christmas gift and really wanted a good experience at the hotel. Room was small which I guess is typical New York, towel rack was falling down and not repaired in three days, tub drain was broke and would not alllow us to take a bath, behind bed was lights and so much dust was on lights that dust would go everywhere. Room staff never emptied the ice bucket.l Check in staff acted rather put off when she found out we used a third party to book the room. Even though I had paper saying I would get a king bed she tried to put me in a room with a double bed. Had to get manager to get the correct room. Ice machine did not work on floor I was on, I would have expected since I was paying over $500 per night that things would have been better

Reviews.Title: “overall ok experience”
Reviews.Author: Wing L
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and 4 days, didn't check in until late at night, but staff was friendly in lobby, because it was newly renovated, the lighting & A/C systems in the room was a little bit difficult to control, it was like a touch/sensor thing and it never works the way you want it to, whenever I want to dim the lights a bit, either nothing happens, or everything is turned off, same thing with the A/C temperature change, it's always easier to crank the temp up than to turn it down. Luggage hold at concierge was $2 per piece, which I find a little bit ridiculous given that I just spent over $700 on my entire stay, I thought they'd be able to do something better than to actually charge their clients. Other than that, location was great, staffs were friendly, but hallway a bit noisy because they do group bookings, and at that time there was a big group of "kids" that came and stayed, they were running in the lobby, in the hallway, just kind of irritated. Also didn't like the fact there was no free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: txhayden09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my university and overall the stay was very nice. The rooms are smaller than most in the US, but that is how NYC is in general. We stayed on the club floor with the lounge that provides free food and drinks througout the day. The lounge is opened most of the day and was very nice since it was really cold in the mornings and we didn't have to go scout a place for breakfast. The staff is friendly, in fact one of the front desk clerks even gave me advice of where to move in NYC (since I was moving to NYC for the summer). The person in charge of helping guests find places to visit or eat did take forever and I ended up going to the front desk and asking on getting directions to a museum. The only problem I had was that the TV was fuzzy, the manager of the hotel came in and looked at it but could not fix it. We were given a $75 credit for the issue and we applied the credit to use the internet since that was not free, like most properties like it. The location is great since its literally right above grand central. We had to go to White Plains one day and we were easily able to get to the Metro North (took only like 10 min to actually get on the train from the lobby). The subway is also really easy to get to as well. However, if you are visiting for the first time, be warned that in the morning and at rush hour it is hectic in this area but that is to be expected. Also, you can walk directly west on 42nd to times square, or take the shuttle from grand central to the times square station. Overall great hotel with a stellar location that makes navigating NYC easy for first time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but good service”
Reviews.Author: JL185
Reviews.Content: I would have reviewed this hotel as average, but the service was wonderful so that bumped it up to Very Good. I stayed with my significant other for our anniversary. The location was great, next to Grand Central. Lobby was also beautiful. We checked into our room, but weren't very pleased with it ... very small (typical for NY though), wallpaper stained and peeling, bathroom walls stained. We went down and spoke with the front desk, who upgraded us to a room with a view that was very clean. They also sent up a free bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries, which I did not expect and was very pleased with! Bed was comfortable, new room was bigger and great. A big improvement. My suggestion if you go and are unhappy with your room - Just ask for a new one! They were very nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Am I a guest or a number?”
Reviews.Author: IndyAcct
Reviews.Content: I nornally like Hyatts but this one frustrated me. The hotel is very cold (colors and attitude, not temp). With automated check in we were here three nights before ever having a hotel employee acknowledge us (at check out... and barely... and after a 15 minute queue.) I understand it is a large convention type hotel, but not exactly any hospitality. Better hotels are able to bridge this gap. Hotel recently remodeled, and rooms were nicely decorated, but we had two basic problems. One, tv picture was very fuzzy. Two, one day copious amounts of smoke came in through the bathroom fan (nasty neighbors I guess.) Ick. Ick. Ick. (On n/s floor). What really ticks me off is the 12.95 per day for internet. This is unacceptable and a blatant rip off. For the rate charged for the room, inclusion of this now basic service is expected. I hate getting nickel and dimed. Also a charge for storing bags... again, usually a basic service I am more than happy to tip for but don't expect having to pay up front. Yes, I know this is NYC but that isn't an excuse. Location is pretty good. Hotel is adjacent to Grand Central Terminal and there is a back passageway so can get to the trains and several subway lines. Also there is a market in GCT. This was very nice. We did lots of exploring by foot and didn't see a lot of hotels with significantly better location. Happy with this. Breakfast at hotel was 60 for two. Yeah, we found better for much better value the other days. My bad, but still rip off for rip off's sake. (Don't get me wrong, I am not cheap, but I can tell when I am being ripped.) Beds very comfy. No complaints there. All in all, this is the first time Hyatt has let me me down. It just... should have been better in a couple of basic ways. You know, any of these little things I could probably overlook if I felt they appreciated my business at least a little. Glad my employer was covering this one :) Oh, and get the TripAdvisor NYC app before you go. This was extremely helpful to our explorations and restaurant choices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovation, but tiny bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: RazzTazz23
Reviews.Content: My first stay at the Grand Hyatt. I was in town for meetings near Bryant Park, so the location was good. The staff was all very friendly and helpful. Check-in and check-out took a few minutes - very fast. The hotel was just updated and the updates are nice and modern. The room I had, the standard cheapest room they sell, was nice. For NY, the room size was fine and it had a small couch and table, a new flat screen tv and a nice sized closet. My only complaint was the bathroom, which was extremely small - basically a 5 x 5 closet. The shower/tub is about 3/4 the size of a full-size standard tub. The toilet is crammed between the sink and the shower. It isn't a very comfortable bathroom. It is up to date with nice tile though. I would stay here again if I got a good price.

Reviews.Title: “A matter of expectations? Maybe...”
Reviews.Author: marciopsiq
Reviews.Content: Due to a longer NYC leisure stay we had to split our discount websites bids and that led us to three final nights at the Hyatt. That said, and also remembering that even discounted prices in NY are high, we were totally disappointed with this property. It is a big Vegas/convention type hotel, but lacking all the Vegas "let's make the client happy policies". I can start by saying that they gave us a room facing a wall f other rooms windows, which made privacy an issue. The room has a good size and new nice decor, but the light and A/C system is a mess and the housekeeping is very poor for a four star, leaving things dusty, forgetting things out of place and leaving behind dirty pieces of linen on the room floor! The hotel forces you to call the room operator just to tell we want our towels to be changed daily: isnt enough to place the towels in the floor like in other hotels? I hate to be forced to save the planet, speciallly when I have payed a lot to spend little time in a hotel! Check in and check out were quick, but the stiff cold concierge has came up with a ridiculous price for a transfer to JFK, totally incredible in comparison with many other times we have used that kind of service in New York. And last but not least, the location in the East side is not so good to move around in Manhattan as it is in the west side of midtown, since the Lexington subway lines are a perpetual crowd in comparison to other subway lines. I have the feeling the Hyatt is a nice eggshell with something not so good waiting for you inside!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom too small”
Reviews.Author: Linda H
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how small the bathroom was. There is a marble shelf above the sink. When you try to wash your face your head hits the shelf and water drips down on your feet. Very irritating. We stayed on the 28th floor which was newley renovated. The toilet paper is against the wall 3 inches from where you are sitting and very difficult to reach. The bathroom smelled of mildew and that bothered me the whole time. We ordered room service and the try sat by our door for almost 2 days as well as the neighbors who had onions and our room smelled of onions for a day. I expected more from the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hopsanjose
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy to access many places, restaurant, subways, bus, etc... We love this hotel and will be back. What an amazing hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Better than average for New York”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: I choose NYC hotels based on location to meetings and have stayed at this property a couple times. I didn't recognize the place as the renovations are quite substantial. The good: location, coupons for water/coffee, the market in the lobby with reasonable (for NY) prices, refrigerator in room, touch-pad lighting, friendly front desk. The not so great: very slow elevators, unimpressive on-site restaurant & while rooms supposedly renovated - seemed well worn already. I debated between 3 & 4 stars & decided the good outweighed the not so good.

Reviews.Title: “Expecting a little more”
Reviews.Author: jongable
Reviews.Content: Travelling in NYC is never inexpensive. My room rate was $420 per night with about another $70 in taxes. This was a special rate for a conference about $100 less than normal. That being said I was hoping for a little better. The hotel lobby is nice, and the e-checkin is a great idea. However, the rooms are VERY small (at least mine was). Even for one adult, the bathroom was very cramped. I have no idea how a married couple can share it. Are there better values in NYC? I am not sure since I do not travel here often enough. So, maybe this smaller room in a great location for about $500-550 per night is good value for you. I was just expecting better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: kd1va
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with our choice of hotel. We were greeted in the lobby by a friendly woman directing us to the registration desk. The registration clerk went out of his way to accommodate our requests for a view and a change of room type. He gave us a great view but when when unable to change room type he provided us complimentary breakfast for each day of our stay. The room was large, comfortable and clean, and the location was great. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and fabulous hotel (let down by one detail)”
Reviews.Author: DeeMooner
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 4 nights from 21st November. We have been to New York many times before and stayed in many other 4 star midtown hotels, however we had picked the Hyatt this year because of its great location. We were a little concerned before we arrived about the renovations, as had seen a few negative reviews on here, but on arrival we were definitely not disappointed! We were met in the lobby and ushered through to check in quickly and easily. The lady who checked us in was much friendlier than anyone who has ever checked us in before in NYC. We were celebrating my mum's 60th birthday and I had let the hotel know, so they immediately wished her happy birthday and had champagne and strwaberries dipped in chocolate sent up to the room! The room itself was beautiful. A standard room, but large, newly refurbished, bright, spacious, with comfy beds and an amazing view of the Chrysler building. Throughout the stay the room was quiet and the hotel was a true haven of peace in the middle of a lot of hustle and bustle! Just what you want in NYC. The location is second to none, much better than Times Sq (in our opinion) as you are nearer to downtown and also out of the bright lights and mayhem of Times Sq, but still only a 5 minute walk away. Grand Central food hall and restaurant complex is downstairs (you don't even have to walk outside to get to it) and there are some great options for food, snacks or coffee in there. So now onto the small detail that let them down. On checkout we queued for at least 35 minutes and didn't move. The queues were astounding. Yes, it was a busy day, but there were empty workdesks where we could have been checked in if there were staff there and the staff who were checking in were chatting away to the people (for 20 + minutes) they were checking in, paying no heed to the growing queue. We nearly missed our bus to the airport because of this! Finally, when I got to the front of the queue, the operative informed me that I had nothing to pay (I knew we hadn't had any extras but always like to hear that on check out). 4 days later on checking my card bill, I had been billed $900 by the hotel. The room had already been paid for in full, so I have spent the past few days liaising with British Airways, who I booked the hotel with. I also called (at my cost) and emailed the hotel and granted they were helpful and said the money would be returned to me as it was their error. But who has $900 spare before Christmas? And it took over 5 days to be retuned...and I am now £10 short due to exchange rates so I am now having to scan in my statement and send over to BA. What a waste of time! To cut a long story short, great hotel and would return for a similar price, but what a shame they couldn't get the basics right.

Reviews.Title: “I urge anybody looking for a great hotel in the centre of New York stay here”
Reviews.Author: Michelle2710
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights over thanksgiving just gone. What an amazing hotel, I cannot recommed it highly enough. This hotel has gone under huge renovations and you can cleary see where. Everything about it is amazing, from the foyer, reception, restaurant and rooms. We had a double room and it was huge, as per usual in America two very big double beds, a walk in wardrobe, big bathroom and a area for sitting this is what they called their standard room. The staff very extremely friendly and helpful nothing was every a bother they could not do enough for you and they were extremely knowledgeable. When I go back to New York this is definetly the first hotel that I will be looking at booking, as for the location it was a Prime location, less than 5 minute walk to the Empire State Building and about 10 min walk to Time Square perfect location. Anybody looking for a great hotel I urge you to stay here, I did not think we would be able to afford to stay here but we got a great deal. Please book this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, Superb Location.”
Reviews.Author: Ant the Cruiser
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 3 nights, Just been fully renovated and that is totally evident. The rooms especially are beautifully decorated and very modern and spacious. I have stayed at numerous 3&4 star hotels in New York, and I have to admit this is the best one I have stayed in. It is located centrally to everything so is a perfect base. I chose to eat out in New York and there are many great eateries within throwing distance away from this hotel, we chose 'Scotty's Diner' as the best spot for breakfast and even evening meals! This place is open 24 hours and is the best New York Diner I have found yet and really friendly and good value, it is only a 5 min walk from this hotel. Overall, definately would recommend this hotel to anyone.. You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kazza59
Reviews.Content: Great location, right next door to Grand Central Station and a few minutes walk to Times Square. The room on the 19th level was fully renovated and very comfortable. There were a few design issues but overall a good experience. Overall room was spacious however the bathroom was tiny, lots of storage space available. We had a few minor issues with the room which the staff were quick to resolve.

Reviews.Title: “Nice refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: rosspenman
Reviews.Content: Good location. Nice inside and rooms are lovely. I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: NellieRose
Reviews.Content: I was a little anxious after booking this hotel as there were a lot of negative reviews...However I am pleased to say the staff on the reception and the concierge were fantastic and nothing was too much trouble! The lobby and renovations were finished and looked stunning! The location is very central and easy to get around from...as it is ajoined to Grand Central, taxis and buses were also available at very reasonable prices...only used the bar a couple of times as it was pricey...did not eat here as again it was pricey and we wanted to explore other places to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Stuart R
Reviews.Content: Visited New York over Thanksgiving weekend. First time for myself but my wife has been to the city a number of times. We were both impressed with the Grand Hyatt, which had been recommended by our travel agent in the UK. We found it clean, modern and well maintained. The check in was hassle free and the facilities excellent. The staff we encountered were very pleasant and helpful, and happy to answer questions and help us with cabs, luggage etc. We would have appreciated coffee making facilities in our room as the trek down to the foyer each morning was a bit tedious. We also had a room with only a shower and after a day trekking up and down the shopping areas a bath would have been terrific. The room was however, clean, well presented and the bed really comfortable. We plan to return to New York next year and the Grand Hyatt will certainly be on our wish list. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for a Large Impersonal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellinghopefully
Reviews.Content: I am not a fan of big chain hotels but this Hyatt has many nice qualities. First, the bed. It is wonderful with high thread count linens and great pillows. The rooms have all been redone and are very modern with nice flat screen tvs. The bathroom is tiny (at least ours was) and not particularly nice. The food is absolutely amazing and they have a marketplace with everything you could want at reasonable prices. Check in and check out were a breeze. And of course the location is amazing-right on top of Grand Central with many shops and great places to eat! If you don't mind staying in a big business hotel, I would highly recommend this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: LoLaIreland
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd stay at Grand Hyatt New York. My 1st in the newly renovated hotel. I thought the lobby was nicer as it was before the renovation. It was more warm and luxurious but now I found it more cold and business like. On check in I thought it didn't have the feel of a hotel more a meeting space maybe this is the look the hotel are going for. But in saying all this it is minor detail as it is still my favourite hotel in New York. Check in was a breeze after a long flight you need an easy check in. Our room was on the 21st floor and we loved the newly renovated rooms really modern and super clean. The bathroom has a fab shower and is so relaxing afer a long day.The beds are amazingly comfortable loved climbing in every night after a long day enjoying NYC. Hotel in best location possible next to Grand Central it even has an adjoining door from the hotel to Grand Central which we never saw before on previous stays..We had breakfast most mornings in Pax a little place when you turn left at hotel and go up like 2 blocks.. Great value breakfast. There is a TGI Friday's 2 blocks up which is great. We are getting married in NYC next year and have the hotel booked for us and some of our guests. The only problem we had was on check out was the queue to store our luggage. It was crazy and no need for it. There didn't seem to be anyone giving out the tickets and storing the luggage for minutes on end which left lots pf people just standing there in a queue far back from the lifts.Not a major deal just thought this could have been avoided. Overall I would highly reccomend this hotel and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy at the Hyatt for Thanksgiving and Black Friday”
Reviews.Author: lassie
Reviews.Content: We arrived at around 6.30pm the day before thanksgiving for our 4 night stay and were met by a lovely big Christmas tree at the bottom of the escalator. The newly decorated lobby is modern and welcoming with plenty of seating for groups meeting up. There was no line at reception and the staff member was excellent. We stopped in past the shop just at the side of the reception to pick up a bottle of water and then headed up to the room. We were delighted with our room on the 33rd floor just off the area in front of the lift. We had 2 large comfortable beds and plenty of room for our luggage and shopping in front of the inter-connecting door. The bathroom was small but stylish however the shower door was very heavy and noisy when it closed. The toiletries were nice and there was a hair dryer for us to use. The room décor was classy and the wooden floor added to the style. We made good use of the safe but did not use the IPOD music system/ charger. The fridge (rather than a mini-bar) was a good plus and there were plenty tv channels. We had a great view from our window and a very comfortable stay. The location was very convenient with transport options at Grand Central terminal which were accessible without even going outside the building. There are lots of options for eating in the area and we walked almost everywhere apart from a couple of subway trips downtown. We only interacted with the lady at reception, snack shop staff and the concierge apart from our room cleaner. We were all impressed at the service we received and would certainly consider using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel will definately be back”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn J
Reviews.Content: My two friend and I stayed in the Grand Hyatt for four nights over thanksgiving. What can I say about this hotel - it is a gem set in New York, I have been fortunate to have stayed in many first class hotels in all corners of the world but this hotel has to be the best yet. We booked Grand Club class which gave us access to a beautiful executive suite and boy was it grand. The facilities in this beautiful lounge were second to none, we had to take photos of the beautiful surrounding as words would not do it justice. The best bit about the Grand Club lounge was the wonderful attendant Roy, he was delightful, so attentive and informative, nothing was too much trouble for him we couldnt praise him enough. The bedrooms were ultra modern and clean and had the most comfortable beds, they were not like your typical hard hotel beds which have you yearning for your own bed, these beds were so comfortable it was a struggle to get out of them. My friends and I have stayed in many well known hotels in New York but we would not consider any other hotel to stay in when we return to New York. This hotel has to be stayed in to be believed.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt New York City”
Reviews.Author: Audrey4774
Reviews.Content: along with a group of 4 friends we have enjoyed a stay in New York's Grand Hyatt Hotel really excellent hotel - we had a club room and the facilities were well worth the extra money excellent breakfast, modern clean rooms all staff really helpful and friendly. Would definately recommend this hotel in New York - the beds were especially comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: annmarie s
Reviews.Content: this is the second year we have stayed there great location staff friendly and helpfull hotel recently refurbished the room we stayed in was lovely the lights were touch activated which was a nice modern touch. the toilet roll holder was rather awkward to reach you had to twist yourself round to reach it. we used the market in hotel for coffee alot as we are big coffee drinkers would be ideal to have the facilities in your room to make your own drinks first thing in the morning had a great stay would stay again if returning to new york

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a prime location!!”
Reviews.Author: Hawkline
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt was a great place to stay. We decided to pay extra for the club room. This meant it included breakfast and pre dinner drinks. Our bedroom was very clean, modern and the beds were very comfortable. They have recently completed their renovation and I must say, it looks lovely. ... The drinks at bar were a little expensive, but this is to be expected from a hotel. All staff, including the doormen were very good. My overall impression left me thinking I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for a whirlwind weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mari962
Reviews.Content: At the last minute, my husband and I decided to take our kids into the city on Thanksgiving Friday. We LOVE Grand Central Station so we decided to stay at the Grand Hyatt, which affords easy access into Grand Central. We were not disappointed. It was pricy but for the price we paid, we got access to the Grand Club, on the 16th floor of the hotel. This is a beautiful indoor and outdoor space- the indoor space contains a beautiful island 'kitchen' area where there is a beautiful continental breakfast served complimentary. In the evening, there is wine and beer available for purchase. The outdoor space was truly an oasis in the middle of midtown. Our room was stylish. The bathroom fixtures are sleek. The dark wooden floor of the room feels luxurious under your feet. Our only complaint was that our bed, which was supposed to be a queen, was very tight- we sleep on a queen at home with no problem. But that was our only issue. Everything else was fabulous. Check in was efficient and friendly. We checked out via a kiosk and that was also smooth. The proximity to Bryant Park/Times Square was wonderful. Our kids LOVED the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Boris072
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. The location was very good, being right next to Grand Central. Rooms have these great 'touch' light switches which make it easy to get find after a late night. Beds were very comfortable. Truly a first class hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, LOUD cleaning staff”
Reviews.Author: Busy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for three nights in order to celebrate a special birthday (November 11-14). We booked it through Hotwire and, I must say, I would never pay the full nightly rate to stay there. During our stay, the renovations were almost finished (they might even be done by now). PROS: *Emmy, Jillian and Evone at Reception were really friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to assist us with all of our questions and needs. *After travelling for 14 hours, we were able to get an early check-in around 12:30-1PM, which we really appreciated. We didn't have to walk around and wait until 4PM to get our room. *Our room had been recently renovated and was very nice. The King bed was really comfortable. *We appreciated the convenience store in the lobby. It's a bit pricey, but it's open 24 hours, so we could always stop by to get something quick to eat or drink when leaving or returning from a great evening. *Location, location, location!!! Next to the Grand Central Terminal, a 10 minute walk to Times Square, 15 minute walk to the Empire State Building... close to everything! CONS: *Charging for wireless Internet access in the room. It seems like these days free Internet access should be a given. If Comfort Inn can do it, why can't the higher end hotels? *No coffee machine in the bedrooms. It would have been nice to have a coffee in bed instead of having to get dressed and get coffee at the store in the lobby. *Housekeeping: -The room wasn't as clean as it could have been. It wasn't horrible, but there was hair in the tub and soap remains in the shower. It seemed like the cleaning staff were in a bit of a rush. We would have expected more from a Hyatt Hotel. -The least enjoyable aspect of our stay was being woken up at 8:30AM on a Saturday morning by the VERY LOUD cleaning staff while they were working. Really not how we wanted to start our day. They seem to have no respect for the guests. All in all, if we could get a good rate, we would go back again and bring some earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Large, Clean, Stylish”
Reviews.Author: Annette T
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt was a great place to stay, right from check in, Michelle I think was her name could not have been sweeter and more accommodating ... We checked in early at 10am and one of our 2 rooms was ready, the second room she assigned ahead so we were close and really made us feel so taken care of! The best coffee in NY is in Grand Central, it's called 'Joe, the Art of Coffee' it's cash only, but the best, in the Graybar passage I think it's called, WORTH a walk downstairs.... Our rooms were modern and super comfortable, great beds, spacious bathrooms, high tech actually! Loved it. The hallways were big and very clean, and well lit, to provide a safe nice environment when you stepped off the elevator at 2 or 3 in the morning. The breakfast at the hotel was delicious! But, pricey... For two of us, eggs, bacon, coffee and juice $70 by the time tip was included, I think I would just go across the road to the diner next time... Also had granola the first morning - really, really good!! The doormen were great and there were always cabs ready to go! Would for sure want to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Eugenwilhelm
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel well in advance and were really fully satisfied. Very conveniently located, quiet rooms, great view from the room ;-) Room was newly remodeled but lobby was not yet finished. Hope it is finished now. Free WIFI would be appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: janemc315
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a flight/travel deal. I chose it due to the central location as I was travelling alone. On the doorstep was Grand Central Station, Park Avenue, 5th Avenue, Bryant Park. So much to do within walking distance (Times Square 10 mins). The hotel itself has just had a remodel and is very impressive. Efficient check-in, good size room with massive bed.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I ever stayed in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Anny H
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my New York trip last Sunday. Stayed at Grand Hyatt New York for 2 nights. This is the best hotel I ever stayed in NYC! Worth of the money! I have stayed at Hilton Manhattan, Double Tree Times Square, Marriott Times Square, and others before, but Grand Hyatt is much better! The room & the bathroom are bigger than many hotel in Manhattan. I love how convenient the location is. Too bad I didn't tell the staff that I came to NYC to celebrate my birthday with my friends! Maybe they would do something special for me :p :-). Definitely I will stay in this hotel again if I come to NY next time!

Reviews.Title: “Crammed room...Is it Hyatt?”
Reviews.Author: ghoshanjan
Reviews.Content: The check in was efficient but entering in the room I had a shock. It was more like a 'Inn' rather than Hyatt. Small, practically windowless, noisy aircon and tiny bath. There was hardly enough space to move around and open the suitcases properly. The room service was pathetic and took at least a reminder and half an hour for anything that I ordered. The basic aminities was also not replenished every day like shampoo and soaps. I would not reccomend anyone to stay here....if they have a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there if you get a good rate!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good overall. I have never had any problems there. The location is great and the rooms are clean and spacious by New York standards. I stayed there a few times and paid around 200/night. If you can get this rate, then stay here!!! Otherwise, there are better hotels in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Living in style”
Reviews.Author: laidbackadventurer
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel that offers excellent service. Proximity is close to many restaurants, bar and stores. Price can be a little high depending on the season but it can also be an excellent bargain if you use priceline or hotwire. Rooms are clean, elegant, modern and well appointed. Concierges are very knowledgeable and helpful. Hotel restaurant is pricy but food is very very good. Their desserts are amazing. Gotta try the sampler!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pilam76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel between August 6-8, 2011. I am a silver elite member of Marriott but I stayed at this hotel due to an exceptional price of $200/night and the proximity of your hotel being located in midtown. I had to write since I had such an exceptional experience from the moment I walked into the door to checkout. Checkin- I tried to check in at 1100am but the line was a bit long about 8 ppl in line, understandable for NYC. I used the self check in kiosk which was quick and easy. It even placed me on the 23rd floor which was phenomenal! Room- The room had two big beds, queen I am guessing. The room had a great view, had a nice couch, flat screen TV, shiny new furniture, nice size bathroom and the best shower head I have ever seen. Not the type of weak shower head I get accustomed to at other hotels. The bed was nice and soft and the hotel was quiet, not noisy or loud. The staff was as pleasant as can be. The stay was so awesome that I am planning another trip to NYC in July 2012 and I will be staying at your hotel all over again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very close to central station”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELCOUNSELLOR_UK
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt. The staff at check in were very welcoming and checked us in very quickly, rooms were of a good size, which in New York is great, lots are only small so I was pleasantly surprised. It is a very busy hotel but you have to be ready for that in New York! would return to the hotel as the location is fantastic, a stones throw from central station making it a great place to explore the city sights.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Scarlet062
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here Sat 22 October 2011 for seven days. Now considering all rooms are vacated by 11am, when we arrived there at 11pm, (12 hours later), our room was still not ready, and we were not the only ones. Then and over the next seven days we witnessed this happening time and time again. Not very professional at all, infact a huge let down, and when you read the rest of the reviews on this website a pattern emerges. There were four of us in our room but we only ever got three towels!!!! Rubbish, absolute rubbish. I could go on and on about this hotel from the rudeness of staff to the unkept corridors that need a really good vacuuming to the sink and bath in the bathroom that needed a good clean. All I am going to say is think very carefully about staying here when there are so many good hotels to choose from in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: NFcycler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two weekend nights in Novemer 2011. We loved the spacious room and the very comfortable king sized bed. We were within walking distance of great theatre and restaurants and Grand Central Terminal, of course. We had a relaxing stay and would certainly like to return for a longer duration.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more but met our needs”
Reviews.Author: Sars34
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights with friends in November 2011 to celebrate birthdays. When we arrived there was still work going on in the lower lobby area. The lobby itself is vast - more like a airport than a hotel - very sleek and minimal with museum like rows of seats. We were quickly checked in and received excellent and friendly service - just what was needed after a hideous long flight. Our rooms (25th Floor) were spacious with 2 queen size beds in each, a small seating area and a small bathroom. The one thing lacking were drawers for storage - there is a decent sized closet with plenty of hanging space but no drawers apart from 2 in the central bedside table, As a consequence I had to keep things in my suitcase on the couch. The shower was great when we got it to work but it was an art trying to work out how to use it and how to get the right temperature. In the UK we're used to having tea and coffee making facilities in hotel rooms and I missed this in the morning - I didn't appreciate having to get up an dressed and go down to the Market to get my first cup of the day. We didn't have breakfast included in our rate so it would be nice to have a coffee / tea maker. We didn't venture to the restaurant / shops during our stay as they're a bit hidden away behind the lobby - we found the shop on the last day and it looked good value compared to others we;d found in the city. We had a drink in the bar - a bit pricy compared to other bars but was fine and service was good, quick and efficient. We got a good rate for the hotel through Expedia (£225 per night) which compared to other hotels was pretty reasonable,. Overall would I stay again? Probably at this price, not if it's more expensive. On the plus side the location is perfect and there';s a great breakfast place right across the road (Pershing Square), rooms are clean and functional. Cons - no wow factor - very corporate; no drinks facilities in room.

Reviews.Title: “Back to design school”
Reviews.Author: Volks79
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in the 22nd floor I think. Stayed in a room with king size bed. I was told that was an upgrade from std. Room was on the small size but adequate. It had a small "couch/seat" next to window and dark purple art on one wall. Not sure what it is about the room but it just makes you NOT want to spend time in it. Again, the room is fine I just can't put my finger on it. Bed was very comfortable and pillows are nice. Nice size lcd TV. The bathroom is very nice but not sure if anyone mentioned that you get wet when turning on the shower since the shower head is on the far end of the bath door.( at least in this unit ) In order to turn on the shower, you need to walk in it, turn the showerhead to face the wall, then step out and then reach in and turn on the water. The designer of this bathroom should go back to school. Staff was nice but did not have too much interaction with them. Lobby is being remodeled but it is setup in a way that it should not bother anyone. Location is great due to subway next door. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Service was either great or very poor, a real shame”
Reviews.Author: Tintin1121
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been newly refurbished, so is more like a modern hotel like a W hotel. Although the very large lobby still makes it feel more like a corporate hotel, which would be about right. Due to he size of the lobby it makes the hotel feel pretty cold and corporate, unlike some o ther hotels. We stayed in a Deluxe room and a tip would be to request a room behind the lifts as these rooms have much larger bathrooms with a double sink. Some of the other rooms have very small bathrooms. The room itself was pretty large, with modern brown colours. The bed was very comfortable and a good size flat screen TV. We had to move rooms because our shower was broken, so when we left for the day we packed our belongings and the hotel said they would have it all taken to the new room when we got back. Some of the poor service we received - we got back after a day sightseeing and there was no record that we should be moved, nothing had been done. They eventually found a room, but did not have a bath as was requested. So went downstairs and again no record of any request. We eventually found a room (without a bath) And said that was fine - service at breakfast was extremely poor, the people were blunt and rude, we requested a spoon for the oatmeal, it never arrived. We requested jam for toast, again never arrived. We had to ask several times for orange juice. It always felt like hard work trying to get anything - the worst part though was seeing the chef who was working the pass (the person that inspects the food before it. Goes out from the kitchen), and we saw him wipe his nose with his hand, and then continue handling food. Now that was a shock and something that I have reported to the hotel. Overall even with the refurb it is a hotel that I would only go to if it was for business and the offices we're really close by. So many better hotels around the area. Unfortunately I will not be returning to this hotel again. ( as a note I have stayed here now about 4 times, and the last 2 has been pretty poor)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: scarecrow1984
Reviews.Content: While the hotel rooms are quite nice inside, the service here is awful. Let me run through the different ways in which the staff DIDN'T make our stay memorable: 1) We arrived at 11pm. Upon checking in, we were told that there was no water available in the rooms for showering as the hotel was connected to Grand Central Station and necessary water works were being carried out there overnight. Why this was happening the night before a long weekend didn't make any sense to me but fine I can understand that this was out of their control. Why then did they not notify me earlier about this? They had all my contact details - surely a mass email would have been better service so customers can make other arrangements IF it was a true inconvenience to them. 2) The person at check-in also mentioned that tap and toilet would be working. We went upstairs and they didn't work. So no ability to wash our face or use the bathroom. Not ideal for someone who has just traveled into town. We called, the lady assured us that we could get another room without too much trouble so I went back down to sort that out. 3) There was a long queue but 1 staff member was standing by himself. I told him the problem and he went to a backoffice for about 5 mins, came back out and told me couldn't help me and that I would have to queue up. He clearly didn't understand that at midnight, after traveling for 5 hours, a customer may be a little tired and cranky at having to change their room. 4) After queuing for 20 mins, I finally reached a front desk agent who immediately apologized and then told me that there were no rooms available. I told him that it was unacceptable to not even have working toilets in our room so he said he'd look again. Lo and behold, he found a room (after 15 mins of tapping on his computer and going to the backoffice to consult with his manager). The impression I got is that the only rooms with water were the more expensive rooms - rooms they were unwilling to give other customers. 5) The next day, after doing a round of shopping, I asked the concierge to have my bags delivered to my room while my wife and I went out for dinner. He gave me a flat "no, it's not the hotel's policy". No apology, no attempt at finding another solution. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again. The staff are genuinely unfriendly and it's a reasonably expensive hotel for terrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda let down...”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie29609
Reviews.Content: Scene: My wife and I left the Andaz 5th Avenue, after a night of extreme luxury, and walked the few blocks to check in to the Grand Hyatt New York. This was a Dream Come True for me. I had imagined the hotel to be awe-inspiring, luscious, modern, yet with a tip o' the hat to the Grand Central Station roots. I don't know WHY I expected I expected what I did...but I did not expect what I got. Backing up, our night at the Grand Hyatt New York was the second of the two free nights we received for getting a Hyatt Visa card. Our two-night trip was a combination Mini-Moon (we got married @ Hyatt Regency Boston...Love them. XOXO) and 40th birthday trip for my wife. We wanted to stay 2 nights a the Grand Hyatt, but it was out of rooms of the class we were eligible for, so we had to "settle" for the Andaz 5th Ave. See my other review. So...I had interacted via social media with the Grand Hyatt folks and learned we could check bags if our room wasn't ready. What social media did NOT mention was the fee ($5 or less) per bag for the bell stand to check a bag. (As an aside, this hotel has the Most Awesomely Responsive social media folks. The social media was, I think, the BEST part of the hotel. But I digress.) We got in line to check in...and there was a line. The lobby, under construction, was PACKED with people.There were two front desk staff, keeping their calm despite the lines of people wanting their attention. Two concierge staff joked with each other and answered questions, sending people either to the bell stand or to the line for the front desk folks. A Diamond Gold Passport Member was ahead of us in line. I know he was a Diamond because he said it a couple of times, frustrated that the desk staff didn't ignore the long line of Not-Diamond people to help him. Fortunately we could get into a room, so, with great anticipation, we entered our slightly upgraded room. Small and dark. That sums it up. Small and dark. We came from Bright, Cheery Andza, where we were treated to snacks and beverages. We were faced with the single bottle of water with that tag that says something like "Drink me!!! We will add $8 to your bill!!). To be more objective, the room was much like those pictured on the website...but darker. There is a little fridge hidden in the lovely new built-in furnishings. The rooms were all just upgraded, so they are spiffy, for small and dark rooms. It felt like a cruise ship cabin, the kind with a balcony, only there was no balcony or ocean. We had been given coupons to get a couple of beverages from the handy 24 hour market. We got water & coffee. Ok, I got coffee. I love good coffee.The coffee was pretty good. Before going to the Grand Hyatt, I had fantasies of exploring every nook and cranny. Once I made it through the crowded lobby, I did not want to see the rest of the hotel. WAY too many people in a smallish space for my liking. The Good News: My yearning to go to the Grandest of Hyatts, the Grand Hyatt in New York, has been satisfied. The Bad News: I expected more. After the trip, the nice social media people tweeted me, wishing us a safe trip home. I suspect the Grand Hyatt social media people were hanging out at the Andaz, instead of the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “"Just OK" is not enough for a luxury hotel - and the Hyatt is not even "ok".”
Reviews.Author: MSeattle1970
Reviews.Content: Picked the hotel because close to business location for the day and usually "Hyatt" delivers modern value. Just coming from a business trip to China and staying in 4 & 5 star hotels there; the contrast coudn't be greater. This is Hyatt has sure nothing "Grand". Checkin was done "in person" and after waiting in line for (it felt like) an eternity, the VERY friendly and helpful lady checked me in and answered questions I had for my stay and the area. She was GREAT and very friendly. Truely mae me feel welcome. Only issue were all the people in line behind me who didn't get to check in because of the limited staff. The room itself ( "premium"???) is sparse. no work desk; no bathrope, no slipper. No ammenities like nail file or cotton buds. No stocked minibar or complimentary drinking water... But... they charge over $30 for internet access. Per device! per day! Having 3 mobile devices this alone would be a "deal killer" for my next NYC stay. Loud in the room, noise form the hallway is like the doors are made from paper. remote for the radio next to the bed? didn't work .. (so I took the battery out in the morning and put the remote (and battery) on the nightstand for the maid to fix. Found it at the same place in the evening... still not working. The two glasses provided in the room? Not even looking clean... But getting better... tonight (at 10 pm) they turned of the water supply for "urgent repairs". No offer to change rooms... some some bottled water to brush teeth was offered. What to do after the workout .... ? get to bed without a shower...? And not be able to flush the toilett until the morning...? come on... you can't rent such a room (and sure not on these rates). There are definetly MUCH better options in NY; especially if paying over $300 per night and booking in advance. And for sure the last time I picked the Hyatt here.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: trvlr888
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel at least eight times over the past ~10 years; it looks like it's been renovated recently (and is still undergoing lobby renovations). The location is fantastic with wonderful options for transit, dining and shopping nearby. The rooms and decor are, to me, a bit odd. The theme seems to be "futuristic Japanese". I don't love the weird lighting controls; a simple on/off switch is easier. Also, the toilet is so loud when it flushes that it will definitely wake up anyone sleeping. I was here with a conference this time and paid a special rate of about $350, pretax. It's fine b/c my company was covering it but I don't think it's worth it if I had been traveling for personal reasons. The check in process is automated (no people involved, touch screens). The lobby was under (loud) construction during the day. So not terrible but not great.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: travelmommy028
Reviews.Content: Once again I used Priceline and lucked up! I could not have asked for a better location. The hotel lobby is still under renovation, however it was not a problem. The staff was very friendly even called us to tell us our room was ready while we strolled the city! The room was huge, and clean. The bathroom is small but served its purpose. Now , the BEST part, its attached to Grand Central . We were a minutes walk to anywhere in the city! Grand Central is so pretty, so take time to explore inside . Also a Magnolia Bakery and Juniors is downstairs! Love their cheesecake! It was a perfect mini vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Impractical renovations.”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl09
Reviews.Content: Surely the design team did not try out the room. While the rooms look cool, I will look elsewhere on my next trip to Manhatten. We had a large group stay here and these comments were the general consensus of the group: 1-When you use the sink you either get your feet wet or hit your head. 2-The bathroom lighting is dreary at best. 3-There is no make up mirror so the poor lighting just adds to a lady's frustration. 4-The toilet paper holder almost guarantees the paper flys off with each use. 5-And yes, the bathrooms are tiny, even by NY standards. 6-The switches for the lights and shades are a challenge, and again the lighting in the room is poor. 7-The clock was visible only when the lights were off. 8-the bell staff was very helpful. 9-Good gym. 10-Well stocked store for quick food and drinks on the main level. In the restaurant I watched a busboy (man) take a used napkin from the just departed guest to dust off the table (Note I do not say clean the table, or use a spray to wipe it down), and then he proceeded to set it for the next guest. Needless to say. we never ate there again. Use your purell.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position In New York and Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndyBaker65
Reviews.Content: Just got back from New York after visiting for the first time. Hotel had just been refurbished- 24 Hour "market" on Reception so you can get Coffee/Tea and snacks as well as Wine & Beer. 5 Minutes walk from 5th Avenue. 10 minutes walk from Times Square. 15 minutes walk to Empire State Building. Cabs are always outside. We had a party of 7 and it worked out cheaper though to book a Limo from Airport to Hotel and back again. Would definately stay here again- excellent service from all staff.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review after renovations”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTim
Reviews.Content: Nice style to the new rooms. Clean, comfortable and very modern. But as sometimes happens with this kind of refurbishment, form can win out over function. Drawer space is limited, the switches for the lights and shades are puzzling at best, and the time on the alarm clock was visible only when the lights were off (?!). Elevators continue to be a bit of an issue during busy times -- they are small and move slowly, and it's not unusual to have to wait, especially if you're on one of the lower floors served by that bank of elevators and it's the morning rush hour. Overall, though, a perfectly fine hotel, with efficient service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice refurbished rooms”
Reviews.Author: Seven64
Reviews.Content: I had not stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a number of years, but was very please to find out that the rooms had been refurbished. They are now very comfortable, modern and clean. Lobby is in the process of being refurbished, so should be in excellent condition soon. Used gym, which had state of the art equipment and quite large. I will definitely return on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient , busy, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: waitey67
Reviews.Content: Not impressed To be told on arrival at 11pm at night that the room you had booked 9 months in advance was not available after a 14 hour journey from the uk! Although somewhat expected after various recent reviews.We had booked a standard room with 2 double beds to accommodate myself , wife and teenage child. We were offered an upgrade which seemed acceptable, however it was the same size room with a king size bed and a roll out bed, which didn't exist! We had a quiet chat with another receptionist, went for a walk till midnight to return to a room With a newly delivered bed with a poor mattress and no bedding! Another trip to reception and this was resolved along with vouchers for complimentary breakfast( value apprx 80 usd). Following morning I informed yet another receptionist that we expected our bags to be moved to the room that we had booked upon our return that evening. The error was resolved and the room we booked and expected was supplied, along with a further complimentary breakfast. Apart from early mishap, great stay, great location, good sized room, views over chrysler building and no noise from other rooms/corridors.everything clean and in order, breakfast staff excellent, doormen will magic you a taxi in seconds! Hotel is as busy as grand central station, continual functions/ conferences in reception areas, don't expect to be recognised after a few days as way too many people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room, limited breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Galfons
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is perfect (beside Grand Central Station). Room was small but clean and comfortable. Breakfast is not buffet, hence somehow limited if you want to take something not on the menu. Price is high, but in the average for such quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand ....Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Checked in with an 'upgrade'...the a slight larger room with no view. In fact, looking at the layout of this un-grand hotel, more than half of their rooms are each facing inside against each other with no view at all. Problem starts very shortly with the lousy house keeping...found out there is no shampoo and bath products even we checked into the room. Had to call the house keeping 3 times before they send the correct items to my room (and had to tip them for their mistakes as well). I kinda suspect that the previous person that check out didn't leave tip, so the house keeping don't bother to top up the tolietries. I did an experiment over the next 2 days... on 2nd day, I purposely didn't leave a tip (since they didn't do a good job when I check in anyway), the housekeeping did a very terrible job and didn't replcae any tolietries. On the 3rd day onwards, I left tips of a few dollars and they will then top up the tolietries, but the standard of cleaning is still very poor as I can still broken pieces of wood from their furniture left there for a few days. They say that a heary breakfast is a good way to start your day - but the breakfast there seems to spoil the rest of my day. First, very long queue for breakfast. They probably have less than 80 seats available for a hotel that 'boost' of more than one thousand rooms. Then the waiting staffs have bad attitude and still expect 15% tip for bring 2 plates of food and drinks that cost around 60 USD for breakfast!. To make it worse, they even charge us extra for items we didn't consume THRICE!!! The first 2 times I spot it and raised it the staff and front office to resolve. the 3rd charge , i only discover after I went back home and check my crdit card statment to see that they have charge me a second time for my prepaid breakfast. Just ridiculous that they overcharge me 3 times in 7 days! Coincidence that it is so careless so frequent ? Or just plain dishonesty? You decide... Also, there is rennovation noises throughout the day at the moment so please feel free to dine at their 'fantastic' resturant if you prefer drilling noise ...and also a likely chance to be overcharged by the bad attitude staffs there. And the rooms have this 'intelligent' lighting and cooling system that is actually soooo stupid. Not user friendly at all...and it beeps frequent in the middle of the night to ensure your sleep is disturbed further, as if spoling your day thorugh poor breakfast service and dirty rooms / horrible housekeeping isn't bad enough, To be fair, this hotel has a very good location and a few of the front office staff were quite nice. So I reallt think the management should seriously look into the house keeping slackers and the waiting staff for breakfast. Considering they are a 4 star hotel, the standards here is definately not up to expectations at all. I previously thought of booking this 'Grand' Hyatt for my honeymoon...but it turns out all the unprofessional staff there make help to turn this to a horrible moon :( Very Disappointing ! Wouldn't recommend this one at all, Especially for honeymoon and / or holidays..

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsmilleri
Reviews.Content: We booked as a package with flight. They upgraded us. Nice clean modern decor. Great location at Grand Central Station. Near everything and just a short subway ride to Time Sq etc.

Reviews.Title: “Imperfectly rendered luxury”
Reviews.Author: Bill350
Reviews.Content: A thorough renovation puts customary Hyatt luxury to the test. Results are mixed. As customary at Hyatt, the staff are wonderful. The beds are extraordinarily comfortable, the rooms quiet, the air system responsive and effective, the shower/tub design and materials accessible and secure, the elevators accessible and fast. This has the basic ingredients of a fine Hyatt hotel. Unfortunately, the excellence of this hotel is undermined by user unfriendly aspects of renovation design. Drawer space for clothes is insufficient, as are shelves and hooks in the bathroom. The toilet is dangerously close to other accoutrements. The hot water tap in the bathroom sink dribbled at best. The futuristic clock radio, while white, was an unusable black box. The light switches should come with a manual. The mattress foundation sticks out below the wonderful mattress and barks shins with its hard, pointed corners. The aesthetics of the renovation are dramatic and often interesting, but the predominance of white in rugs all over the hotel ends up displaying dirt as much as design. Although the hotel clearly offers alternatives to traditional check-in and check-out desks, the lineups for both were still enormous some times of day. The hotel solicited our use of internet check-in, which was then refused when we tried to use it. On manual check-in the room type confirmed was not available, leading to the need for housekeeping to provide alternative furnishings for the room allocated. The hotel location next to Grand Central Station on 42nd Street and across the street from airport buses on Park Avenue is superb, but the interface of the hotel itself with cars and taxis is both confusing and nightmarish. Lots of good food in the hotel and its surroundings.... For these positive and less than positive attributes, the Grand Hyatt charges the high level of room rates typical of upscale Manhattan hotels. Hyatt is typically generous in its senior citizen discounts, but the base rate is rising quickly in the Grand Hyatt, as elsewhere. The question is whether the attributes of fine hotels are being delivered more fully elsewhere by the competition. Renovations addressing the eye more than many user needs undermine unbridled enthusiasm in the merits of this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Not for people with small children - but great location!”
Reviews.Author: Keyamom
Reviews.Content: I guess in New York one can't expect too much of hotels, but with a brand name like this one I certainly had some expectations. The location was great, right next door to Grand Central and within walking distance to Times Square, 5th & 6th avenues, Top of the Rock, Central park etc. But service left a lot to be desired. The rooms were quite small even though we were at a super deluxe king sized one ( or so they told us). Housekeeping never answered the phone and the room and bathroom only got cleaned after 3 days and that too on my insistence. Amenities like shower cap, shoe shine, cotton, coffee maker etc. are only available on request (even b&b's in UK provide these). But what irritated me most was the refusal to heat up baby's food stating the reason that outside food is not allowed to be heated! Seriously, baby food?!!! We stated there for 5 nights. I didn't find the staff there very friendly or helpful, though I have to say that room service were quite efficient. I guess the hotel is ok if you are travelling there on business, but is definitely not convenient if you stay with a little one! or maybe it could be down to the New York culture...

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Karen D
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days about a year ago. The price was outrageous! Granted that they have the most breathtaking lobby, their rooms were not up to par. VERY average rooms for about $300 a night. I can get the same from a holiday inn. The location is ideal though, smacked in the middle of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Rooms, Great Location, Annoyed Bell Staff, Wonderful Concierge”
Reviews.Author: TastyTraveler7
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel the bellman did not offer to take our bags but after moving them out of the walkway as we paid the cab driver held his hand out for a tip. The entrance was strange and when we went up the stairs we found the lobby under construction. The decor is odd. I love funky hotels but the colors were dark and moody. The front desk staff was attentive and agreed to hold or bags for free until our room was ready. When we took our bags to the area to be held, again the assistance was less than helpful. The room was small, crowded and the bathroom extremely small. It felt as though it was trying to be a modern hotel with all the upgrades but just felt young and not inviting. The location is amazing right near Grand Central Station so you can literally get anywhere. Overall it was fair; if I was traveling for business its fine but all I wanted to do was get out of the hotel as quickly as possible. The best part was the concierge who was efficient, warm, thoughtful and patient and effective at getting us a great table on short notice.

Reviews.Title: “Mailroom magic!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my husband's 50th with our best friends, and it was fab - the staff were lovely and friendly - especially the marvellous guys in the mailroom who really kindly wrapped up a picture we had bought in cardboard and bubble wrap so it arrived home unscathed - thanks guys!! The rooms were great and the bar very trendy and the location is obviously perfect. Once the refurb is done it will be even better but it didn't affect us at all - would definitely stay there again, Thanks so much - brilliant weekend, Ruth, Simon, Pete and Sue

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CornishTraveller100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights in September on the 16th floor. When we arrived in reception, I could see a lot of refurbishment work was going on, but it didn't affect the experience of my stay at all. The receptionist was very friendly and gave us a free upgrade to a larger room which had just been refrubished. The room itself was very big and had a comfortable bed. There were also nice features like LED night lights. The maids we had were very friendly and also helpful when I had a couple of queries, as well as keeping the rooms clean! Additionally, the hotel also had a free gym and a food market to quickly pick up a snack or drink if required. As the hotel is right above Grand Central Station, I did however find a bigger food market in there which was also cheaper and had a larger selection, so I tended to use that instead. The only downsides were that there wasn't free wifi and the aircon unit in the room seemed quite noisey, although the former seems quite common in hotels from my experience. Overall, I'd quite happily stay there again. The location is very central and hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraMD
Reviews.Content: I am outraged that they charge for wireless Internet for each devise. at 15 a day for each device. Nuts. Dirty towels too. When I reported my outrage to front desk I was told why do you care given the company paid for you. In tried to talk o manager left a voice mail and got no call back

Reviews.Title: “Renovations ruined a once great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ksteinbu
Reviews.Content: Renovations of rooms, incomplete, while said completed, the shower looked like it was 20 years old. New furnishings too modern, hurt ourselves on some edge everyday and took away draw space. Service is as bad as new look. The doorman could not be bothered to get a cab. The only redeeming qualities were the location and the new lobby quickie snack bar.

Reviews.Title: “More Bub than Hub”
Reviews.Author: TOCazzie
Reviews.Content: When combining pleasure with business, sacrifices must be made...unfortunately. The hotel is finishing a major remodel, so all the mess will eventually fade. But what will remain is an ill conceived design that would better fit the Jetsons. Not even the upstairs cafe/bar provides a comfortable retreat. Our SUPER Deluxe room was spacious, yet, it too, was uncomfortable. The mattress lumpy, the chair/sofa hard, no natural light and a bathroom with a series of 3 semi opaque glass doors that divided the sink area, toilet and a moldy shower. Our business associates all agreed that the extended shelf over the sink provided an avoidable challenge to NOT knock yourself out when bending over to use the sink basin. On the plus side, the business/conference floor was lovely and provided very attentive service and provided quality food choices for cocktail events. And the location was great in its convenience to Grand Central, the Theater District, the NYC Public Library etc. Last time we stayed at St. Regis. Next time, we'll return...to St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: statestreet96
Reviews.Content: It is still, still under renovation. The hotel charges for everything including holding your luggage. So if you are at conference and staying at the hotel, the coat check at the conference/meeting rooms won't hold your luggage. You have to go to the bell captain who will charge you and it is only cash!!!!! The room is okay pretty quiet but hotel is so large that everything takes forever. Not cheap and not particularly comfortable. My room was adequate but fo rthe price not worth it. Many better options in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Expect Less Pay More”
Reviews.Author: joe k
Reviews.Content: My wife and i recently spent time in the Big Apple.Lots of shopping and attractions. This hotel is perfectly situated for this activity. The last thing anyone expects is RUDE hotel staff, FILTHY bathrooms and a AC unit that did not work. We attempted to notify the staff, only to have a shower mat thrown over the dirty shower and a Breakfast Voucher for two. This is not what we expected. Terrible Customer Service.

Reviews.Title: “A great 4-night stay!”
Reviews.Author: Babas
Reviews.Content: Our friends, who we were travelling with, booked this hotel on Priceline and got it for 1/2 price. We had a decent sized room, but no view. We didn't care as we were there to sightsee and the location made up for the lack of view. The hotel is attached to Grand Central Station which is really convenient if you need to take the subway. The room was very clean with no bedbugs. Yes, the hotel lobby was under renovations, but I sincerely don't see how this is such an inconvenience.
