It's not like you can hear the work going from your hotel room. I've read lots of complaints in previous reviews and sometimes I wonder how any of these people actually get to their destinations. Yes, the clock radio/Ipod station was flashing 12:00, but it doesn't take a rocket scientist to set the clock to its proper time thereby stopping the flashing. Also, the nightlight does flash in the bathroom, but again, if it bothers you, close the bathroom door! And yes, a ''room service'' pot of coffee and 2 croissants costs $25, but it is well indicated on the room service menu. We would pick up a couple of cups of coffee ($3.50/each) at the Market area in the lobby and bring them back to the room while we were getting ready to head out. There is also a small bar fridge that worked fine where we chilled bottles of wine. The location is perfect for walking or taking the subway. It is close to most attractions and there are great restaurants and shops in the neighborhood. Yes, we paid $2/bag to store them on the last day, but it enabled us to make the most of our morning (we checked out at 9:00) as we were only leaving the hotel around 12:30 p.m. and check-out is at 11:00 a.m. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Major renovations - ok room”
Reviews.Author: cavzmg
Reviews.Content: THe hotel has a great location with direct access from Grand central station, hence there is access to subway and regional trains. It is very near major tourist atractions and business and banking offices. there is a major renovation in the lobby so it is a bit messy, but the rest is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Mayhem and Money, Money, Money”
Reviews.Author: AmandaHenderson101
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the reception area it was clear to see that major renovations were underway, I had however been pre-warned about the building work in the lobby area so it came as know shock, there was a sizeable slow moving queue at check-in and when it was my turn I was pleased to find that I had been allocated a free upgrade to a suite but was advised that the cleaners were still preparing the lounge area and so the adjoining door would be opened later in the day. I proceeded to the bedroom which was very modern, nicely decorated, had a large TV and a sound system, I went out for a few hours and was dissapointed when I returned to find that the door to the adjoining lounge was still locked, I phoned the reception desk and they advised that they would send someone straight up to open it, I opened the door on the bedroom side in anticpation, about one hour later a male hotel guest walked through the adjoining door and in to my bedroom area, embarrassed he quickly retreated, I called the reception and about 10 minutes later a guest services rep arrived at my room to apologise and advised that the adjoing door had been opened on to the room on the otherside by mistake. The lounge was of very high standard with white leather sofas, wooden floors, large TV and an extra bathroom, however the movie channels could not be accessed from this TV (problem with the set-up I think). The next day the maid came in to my room twice even though I had the privacy button on and my note about the Movie channels not working was ignored. It also cost me $25.00 for 2 days internet access, breakfast (which is limited to a drink and ONE of the following; toast, cereal or croissants) was supposed to be included in my room, it wasn't, I ordered breakfast in my room and for $25.00 I got a pot of coffee and two of the smallest croissants I have ever seen, when I queried the inclusion of breakfast at reception I was told it was not detailed on my booking, after showing them my confirmation slip that showed I had booked the 'awaken package' they told me they would credit my bill with $15.00 towards the hotels market place food store (incidently the Awaken Package was not registered on my booking a couple of years ago when I stayed at a Hyatt in Dubai either, on that occassion the waitress chased me through a very busy reception area when she thought I had not paid and it was highly embarassing) the following day I received my check-out invoice and there was no $15.00 credit for breakfast I queued at reception for 15 minutes to go through the story again and get the credit, I then waited around 15 minutes to use the ONE PC in the reception area that you can print boarding passes at and then a further 15 minutes in the long queue to be seated for breakfast before deciding to give up and go to the shop and buy myself a coffee and croissant. Already feeling slightly annoyed by this point, I returned to my room to find that the maid had again ignored the privacy button and was stripping the bed even though I clearly had 1.5Hrs before check-out and my belongings were visibly still in the room, I asked her to leave and come back later which she did. When checking out I used the self-service portal because the reception area was chaotic, there are very few seats for guests waiting for taxi's etc...and if you want to store your bags while you wait it is $2.00 per bag which I feel is innapropriate when considering the cost of rooms at this hotel. Incidently every time I got in the lift I heard people complaining, mainly about the breakfast queue and being charged for items that were supposed to be included in their room rate, last time I was in NYC I stayed at the Casablanca Hotel, unfortunatley it was full hence I tried the HYATT but never again, at the Casablanca you get complimentary tea, coffee (it cost $2.75 a drink in the HYATT lobby area) breakfast and snacks all day, it was free to leave your bags in storage after check-out, the service was great and all of the facilities were perfectly portioned to the number of rooms in the hotel, the HYATT fails badly at this.

Reviews.Title: “Grand not as Grand as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: Traveltoomuchforbiz
Reviews.Content: This has been my go to property in New York for over two decades. With a recent remodel, I was excited to see the changes that had been made. But I was disappointed with what I could only term “Modern meets Mayhem”. There just seems to be a total disconnect with why they picked certain furniture. The bathroom is really the big disappointment – it is a shower only which is extremely narrow and can only be turned on when you are completely in the shower stall. The toilet is industrial meaning there is no lid to the toilet and the vanity sink is very small with no counter space. Typical Hyatt Grand amenities are also missing – thin towels, no bathroom extras like shower gel, very few pillows and no coffee/tea makers. With all of that though – this is still one of the best locations in midtown Manhattan, just not the most grand.

Reviews.Title: “Total Rip Off and terrible staff and service I ever experienced in any hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SZAYUB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Grand Hyatt Hotel, New York for one night along with my wife and my 2 daughters. One a 3 year old and other a 4 month infant. The stay was terrible just even from start. The moment I entered the hotel, and the bell boy got my luggage and I told him to give me luggage tags which he refused to give saying that I can't give you tags until you check in. It was hard to believe that once he got the bags, he was supposed to give me tags. Of course after that I have to check in. I had a 4 month infant with me so for her feed I asked for an electric kettle for warming water for her feed and was shocked to hear that they said they dont have electric kettle in hotel. They send me a coffee maker instead, which even wasn't working. At last I placed an order of a bottle of hot water at room service number and when I got the order w shocked to see I was charged $25 for that bottle of water, which includes water cost, delivery charges, gratuity. Then I placed an breakfast order for my 3 year old daughter, scrambled eggs and the lady taking order I told her I don't want bacon it it and when order came, it again had bacon along with the eggs. Upon complaining , it was replaced. For using business centre I was charged extra and even a black and White print out I was charged $1 per copy. Even when checking out, asked concierge to send bell boy to take the luggage down, he charged me $2 per bag, in total of $12 to take the luggage down, saying that we have been doing this practice for last 5 years now. Totally pathetic and total rip off hotel. I wouldn't ever stay in this hotel ever ever again. I would prefer staying night on roads rather than staying at this creepy and rip off hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: born2bowl2
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I stayed one night at the Grand Hyatt and it was a pleasant surprise. The location is great. You will be a short walk from Broadway, Rockefeller Center, the Empire State Building, Central Park, shopping on 5th Ave and much more. The staff was polite, friendly and helpful. The room was large and newly remodeled, even tho some of the finishing touches were overlooked. We had previously stayed at The Stay (47th & Broadway) and the room at Hyatt was twice as big and the hallways are large, well-lit and updated . The only slightly negative part of our stay was the $2 per bag we were charged to leave our luggage with the bell-hop. I would not hesitate staying here again. P.S. I was able to get a great deal on Priceline.com (half of the going price).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great service...”
Reviews.Author: johnnyfromtheblock
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt in New York with some friends. It was our first trip to NY, and the location of the hotel was great for exploiring (in a nice area of Midtown Manhattan, between Grand Central Station and the Chrysler Building. Handy for the subway and buses and walking distance to 5th Avenue, UN etc. The public areas of the hotel are undergoing a refit, but we knew that woudl be happening before we booked. The room I had was recently refurbished and was very nice. I had been told that ervice in the US was better than in the UK, but I didn't find this in the Hyatt. The staff varied from very attentive to bordering on rude. Little things annoyed me - like asking them to look after luggage after checkout, which incurred a $2 charge for each bag (I have never come across this anywhere in the world and found it ridiculous!), and asking for stamps at Reception for postcards, and being told that I needed to go to the mail room two floors up and wait for someone to come before I could buy them; being barked at by a woman at the front door on a wet day, who kept saying "umbrella" to me with no further clue as to what she wanted me to do with it. So overall I would recommend the Grand Hyatt for its location, but they need to sort out their customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Part of Our Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Britannialee
Reviews.Content: This hotel made me wish I had missed my flight. They failed to send me a car when I ordered one online through the E-concerige because they sent it to my travel agent not the email I had provided. No one helped me out of my cab with our luggage (2 bags and a stroller with a 8 month old). The room was small and very dirty duvet was stained by droll and had been turned inside out to cover it. The bathroom shower had tile that was poorly done so the water stood at your feel instead of draining. Our sink's drain was backed up (not good when you need to clean your baby's bottle.) All the ice machines were broken and tried to charge me $14 to get ice from room service. The wall paper was peeling in the bathroom and the paint job was fast and streaky. If I were them i'd get the money back from the painters! Hotel room didn't have a room service menu. Called twice for it and they said a manager would bring it right up. After a hour and a half I gave up and ordered blindly from room service. Three hours after I ate someone brought a menu up waking up my sleeping kid. We went to the concierge to rent a private car because getting a cab at that hotel was impossible. He wanted $111 an hour! They were under contract to rip us off, I guess. With the Ritz hotel I never paid more then $80 an hour. I went to the bell men who helped me get another car. The hotel elevator is a death trap and lawsuit waiting to happen. We tried to get in one and it started to close. My husband put his hand in, it failed to stop, so put his leg in... it clamped down hurting him. It took all my strength and his banging on the doors for it to let go. We had to file an injury report which they called us at midnight to give us the info. (So rude!) Next day we were getting on the elevator and the elevator car suddenly just wen up with the doors open! The positive of this hotel? Good location. The burger I had from room service was excellent. The bellmen at the end of our trip was great! They should run the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colin3160
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the name. This is no "grand" hotel. It is just average. The location is great but the hotel lacks atmosphere, the rooms are poorly and cheaply furnished and without taste. Expect a very small bathroom. Our bathroom had a basin way above normal heights. There was no side counters and only a tiny shelf above the basin. The whole atmosphere in the room was creapy!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but worth it, had a lovely time :)”
Reviews.Author: Viv10
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week holiday in NYC staying with the Hyatt. The Hyatt has always been our first choice as we had lovely times in Sharm and Hawaii with this hotel brand. The Grand Hyatt in NYC did not disappoint for a city hotel. 1/ Location: next to Grand central terminal so it was convenient for the metro and easy to find. It is only 10 mins walk away from Broadway/ Time Square. 20mins to Bloomingdales/ 5th avenue/ Penn station/ Macy's. 2/ Comfort: we expected a little room with miminal space but this was not the case. Our room was relatively spacious with a couch and a king size bed, plus plenty of room for suitcases and shopping bags :). Our room did not have a view but that didn't bother us as we were only there to rest and recharge our battery for the next day. Our room was recently refurbished so all was clean and fresh. The only downside for the ladies is that there is only one mirror in the bathoom. Lucky my striagtener cable was long enough for me to do my hair in front of it. 3/ Hotel service: Majority of the staff were very nice and friendly, thank you to Veronica who upgraded us for free of charge. There was one or two individual less helpful (friendly) at the concierge desk but all in all was very good. 4/ General: It was nice of Hyatt to give us 2 vouchers pp to exchange for tea/ coffee/ water at their store, this was a nice touch from them expecially after a long day of travelling, made us felt very welcome. There were 2 downsides: firstly; wifi. It is hard to believe a hotel like Hyatt does not provide free wifi when even Bloomingdales and Au bon pain (nice breakfast) do! The cost of wifi is $9.99 per day but for a couple like us, we didn't need an all day service, we just need to look up a few things on the iphone before we set off for the day. Secondly, luggage storage. The Grand Hyatt was the first hotel I have been that charges you. We checked out at 9am and our flight wasn't till much later so we left the luggage with them while we have our last day out in NYC. The cost is $2 per bag, we had a hand luggage and a suitcase each so $8 in total. The cost is not expensive but we were surprised at it as we've never been charged for luggage storage before. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel, we had a lovely time staying there. The cost to stay there was not cheap but well worth it. Don;t be put off by the renovation, it didn't affect us at all as most of the work we've seen was by the front entrance.

Reviews.Title: “A little too overwhelming for my tastes, but for some-- it's great”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: It's true, check in is like an airport. The front desk people are nice-- but they ask a few too many personal questions-- what are you here for? Why are you in the city? (again, reminding you of being in the airport!) The lobby is huge and goes on for floor-- and there always seems to be a million conventions. The lobby even spreads out into something like a mall--- with shops and more shops and this and that. Once you finally get to your room... I'm sure the rooms are different, but ours was fairly small. Not nutshell small like at Hotel 41, but notedly small in relationship to the Grand grand lobby and surrounding floors. Room was very simple, dark in texture and design. Not as quiet as hoped (aka, not as shielded with strong glass against street noise, but maybe that's being changed). It was an overall nice stay in the room, and there were absolutely no problems with staff. Once you hit the street, it's busy busy busy with lots of cabs and doormen blowing whistles and people rushing back and forth to work. It's right at Grand Central (and all the shops in there) so it's convenient in that way-- and gets you right in there to see the Grand Central ceiling (but again, if you're not a fan of huge spaces..... no good). The conferences really take over the hotel though-- and the conference rooms and areas are HUGE HUGE HUGE HUGE...and can be, in fact, quite overwhelming. If you're at all, let's say, phobic, about huge spaces, this isn't the hotel for you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Greay location and GREAT staff in NY”
Reviews.Author: Meleemel_10
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for locals and tourists alike visiting NYC. Went for just one night as we live close but knew we'd be out late so we got a room via Priceline. The hotel is under construction but it was almost complete and in no way impacted our stay - just some blocked off areas in the lobby. This is my third or fourth stay at this location and the newly remodeled rooms looke great - can't wait to see the lobby. The hotel has always been clean and wll presented as being connected to GSC makes it the perfect spot BUT this time I must mention a stand out staff member who knows what hospitality means. Upon check in we were asked if it was a special occasion and I confirmed we were there again for my birthday. Not only did Veronica at the front desk wish me a happy birthday - she had a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries sent to the room!!! This was one a priceline reservation too!! I was so impressed and not only the wonderful refreshments but more than that - there was a HAND WRITTEN birthday card from her as well. I am in the hospitality industry and have been a life long traveler - Veronica, you impressed me and the Hyatt is very lucky to have you represent them as their first point of contact with their guests!

Reviews.Title: “Not Grand”
Reviews.Author: SueW555555
Reviews.Content: Properties understandably need renovation. However, I don't understand making the customer pay premium for their renovation. There was No prominent employee direction, no sympathy for customers' dissatisfaction. Customers are not happy...EVERYWHERE you look. There is No lobby...only tarps and long lines. Everywhere you go on site, another line... at Check in, elevator, concierge, cafe...etc! Check in...13 pp in line with 3 attendees??? Elevator wait...7 minutes...too full...waited longer to get to the 31st floor...only far 5 elevators will get us there. Used the same 2 elevators for 3 days. Mess everywhere...no apologies anywhere; written or otherwise. Can't go into description about the room status. Moved 4 times. Called maintenance twice after placement. Too tired to move again. A/C still not operational, pits in bathtub, replaced fridge, dust hanging from a/c vents, alarm set to midnight by... (Maintenance department awesome! They really tried...however, unable to rectify.) Really...$399 a night?...cheaper on weekends! Hope you enjoy a better stay...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - Great Location, Newly Renovated”
Reviews.Author: asha123
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 1 night stay at the Grand Hyatt near Grand Central Station, NYC. Wonderful hotel, newly renovated, very clean and super comfortable and modern rooms. 250 sq ft in Manhattan - great! Staff was VERY friendly and professional, from concierge and front desk to the manager in the elevator we met. The fitness center was one of the top centers in a hotel I have ever seen - Bosu balls, kettlebells, lots of fitness equipment, filtered water and towels, TVs etc. The lobby is being renovated but would expect it to be at the high level the rest of the hotel is. Got a great rate through Priceline (Midtown East). Right next to Grand Central and all the subway lines, and a 10min walk from Times Square. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt is truly Grand Oct. 7-10, 2011”
Reviews.Author: Iceman41ak
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for exploring NYC. Yes, the lobby was under construction - but they don't work weekends, and so no noise while I was there. The good news is - the sleeping rooms have been remodeled and were very modern, clean and new. The only noise I heard at night - were voices in the hallway, which at 3am I found to be extremely rude. But it was a Friday night, and this is an "in your face" loud, large hotel, not a boutique bed & breakfast. I won an incredibly low rate on Priceline - so was hesitant to ask for a view room, but I did and the very nice woman (from Brazil) accommodated my request. We were on the 25th floor - overlooking Grand Central Terminal with gorgeous views of the city. The room was of decent size, bathroom small but clean. The shelf above the sink is placed so close to the sink, one needs to pay close attention when brushing teeth and spitting the rinse to not knock your head on the shelf. As others have mentioned, the TV reception was "fuzzy" on some channels. Not a big thing, but odd. The day we checked in, there were only two of five of the elevators serving the 24th floor and above level (there are also five for the 1-23rd floors) and the Hyatt had a staff member manually operating the lifts - to increase the efficiency and expedite service. Nice touch. I had drinks the ultra modern bar off the lobby (great, friendly staff there), used the mini-food station in lobby also - and they were priced as you'd expect from a lovely, corporate hotel in the center of Manhatten. We loved the underground access to Grand Central Terminal and I highly recommend the Oyster Bar there. A very unique restaurant with every type of seafood you could want. This was our first ever stay in NYC and the folks at the Grand Hyatt made it superb. The doorman offered the "company car" service to the airport - when I asked for a taxi. At $45 plus $6.50 toll was well worth it, the driver (retired Hyatt Front Desk Mngr) was execptionally pleasant and made our exit wonderful. Thanks Grand Hyatt staff - I really appreciate the fact "you get it". You understand guest service and provide it.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but the smallest bathroom seen for this level of hotel”
Reviews.Author: L0veCr0atia
Reviews.Content: I do not want to complain too much because renevations were underway at the hotel during our stay. This made it very unpleasant in the lobby area, but hopefully temporary. However the bathrooms is soo small that you actually feel clausterphobic inside it. For this kind of standard hotel it is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good with a few small issues”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreFrancophile
Reviews.Content: Location was great and the staff - except for one unprofessional and rude man who works in the coffee bar - was wonderful and accommodating. Room was a surprisingly good size for NYC. The bathroom had a strong mildew smell to it and the carpet in the elevators should be replaced. Also, I've never before had to pay to store my suitcase, but here you do. It was a nice enough place but didn't seem to be at the level of what you'd expect from a Hyatt. Maybe after the lobby renovation is completed it will shine more.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable visit”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodRobert
Reviews.Content: We came to NYC to celebrate our son's sixteenth birtday. We traveled over the Columbus Day weekend. The hotel lobby was undergoing a renovation but the registration went very smoothly and they had our room ready well before the 4 p.m. check in time which was awesome. The room was nice and reasonably modern. Climate control in the room was perfect and the shower was hot. We checked out by the 11 a.m. check out and still had time to sightsee before catching our train so the hotel kept our bags (for a small fee) until it was time to go to the train station. That was cool so we didn't have to lug it around while walking around the city. My only complaint was that when we turned the lights on in the room it caused intereference on the TV. Not a real big deal but should be investigated. I would reccommend the Grand Hyatt,NYC to others.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in many ways”
Reviews.Author: Daybright
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Oct, 2011 for 3 nights for business. It is right next to Grand Central Station, and the location is perfect for walking to a variety of hot spots in the city, from lux shops and restaurants to Union Square restaurants and shops. We asked for higher floor with two beds, and they accommodated graciously. The room was spacious, clean, and remodeled to feel like a cozy suite. A mere touch, like on an iPhone, can turn all the lights on and off, and everything was efficiently modern. The room was on the 25th floor, overlooking the statues of Grand Central Station. It was very quiet despite the remodeling in their lobby. 3rd Ave north of the 42nd street has some local low-priced breakfast places for take outs (we had done that to efficiently get ready for meetings, as well as to get revved up for meetings by walking on the street in the cool morning).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: kwb0723
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Grand Hyatt. They are still renovating the lobby but checkin went very smoothly and they even sent up chocolate dipped strawberries and champagne when they heard we were celebrating my daughter's 21st birthday. Very nice! Our room was on the 27th floor, newly renovated and lovely. I loved that we could open the window for some fresh air. We loved the location of the hotel, right next to Grand Central Station and within walking distance of Times Square. We did not eat in any of the restaurants but we did have drinks at the bar off the lobby which was sleek and super modern. The only negative we ran into was that it was very difficult to get an elevator down on Monday morning. They were all full so we ended up taking the ride up to go down. Not a big deal at all. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in an ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: Ianpudsey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in October 2011 and were impressed by the location and size and quality of the recently renovated room. The hotel is situated close to subway links to the rest of Manhattan and many of the mid-town sights are within walking distance. Check in was easy and we were given free coffee vouchers to compensate for the ongoing work in the lobby. The room itself was large with a walk in closet, two large beds, flat screen TV and sofa. The bathroom was adequate. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Rachel S
Reviews.Content: The staff members were amazing at accomidating us at this beautiful hotel. The location is perfect. They made my trip so great!! I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone & will stay there the next time I go to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the Big Apple!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelerLover
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - very convenient location and righat at the Grand Central Terminal. They are undergoing a lobby renovation, but it's not that big of a deal. They have redone their rooms and they are very nice - very impressive. The best part about this hotel is location! You are virtually on top of Grand Central Terminal - walk out the front door of the hotel and get to anywhere in the city! You are also within walking distance of Times Square, 5th Avenue Shopping and Broadway. Central Park is also close, but it is bit of a walk. When we checked in, I told them that we were in town to celebrate my daughter's 16th birthday. We were promptly given $100 credit on room service which we treated ourselves to our first morning. What a nice way to start our trip! Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and nice - it was a great trip. I would highly recommend this hotel based on location, decor, staff and overall value. I checked many other hotels in the area and the price was very reasonable for what you got and convenience to so many local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average accomodation”
Reviews.Author: walkabout55
Reviews.Content: If location is more important than it being high quality, then this hotel wil be fine. Our oom overlooked Grand Central Station and we were able to walk everywhere from here. The front desk staff were really nice and eager to make your stay as good as possible. The room itself was average; renovated small bathroom with good lighting but awkward. We noticed that the bathroom never seemed to be totally clean after housekeeping had been there, such as someone else's dark curly hairs on the floor and in the bath-tub. Was it not really cleaned or does her mop have the hairs stuck in it that consequently keep getting spread around? Also the counter was cleaned rather haphazardly, not the entire surface. The beds were very comfortable and we slept well. We spent little time in the room but the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Mediocre Overall”
Reviews.Author: RPhCAN
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated rooms are nice, with a decent square footage for a Midtown Manhattan hotel. The beds were comfortable and the room lighting was good, particularly with the bendable reading lights above the headboards. The room's best assett was its fantastic view overlooking Grand Central, 42nd Street and Park Avenue. Aside from initially having no hot water, everything was in working order. The bathroom, however, even with the recent renovations, was fairly outdated both in design and function. The shower curtain was fabric/cloth, which was neither aesthetically pleasing nor appropriately functional. While certain fixtures seem to have been recently replaced and updated, the bathroom came across as an awkward mix of old and new. While the bedroom area was clean and well presented upon arrival, the bathroom, upon closer inspection, had not been thoroughly cleaned. With regards to service, the Front Desk staff were very friendly and accomodating. The gentlemen working in the 'Market' in the lobby were also very helpful and polite. Small, but relevant issues for us were: having to pay for in-room internet (unfortunately, quite common with many hotels of this kind), and being quoted a $5+ delivery fee for the use of a knife and fork in the room (after cutlery was mistakenly not given along with a 'Market' meal by the lobby associates) which seemed incredibly cheeky. Value and a decent experience were maintained mainly with the hotel's excellent location, the great view from the room, and the friendly Front Desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, big rooms, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: villdre
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the Grand Hyatt for location. It is right above the Grand Central train terminal on 42nd street. Direct subway to battery park (for Statue of Liberty) and down-town NYC. Times Square is a 10 min walk. Fifth avenue shops are a 5 min walk. Positives: * Excellent location - see above * Good courteous service - they effortlessly upgraded our room when we complained about noise and gave us a $100 hotel credit because our bathroom was dirty * Decent food at the restaurant -- very large portions. A single cereal serving was more than enough for a full breakfast. * Decent Gym * All modern conveniences Negatives * Being central NYC, it gets noisy, even when windows are shut. If you are a light sleeper, you are in trouble. * Lots of light coming through from the corridor (through the sides of the door) at night - contributing to a low sleep quality * The rooms near the elevators get a LOT of noise from the elevators * Bathroom was dated and looked like it needed refurbishing - but not too bad. Overall tip: Ask for a room away from the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Small Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: lodoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt October 7-9. Our room was small but clean and comfortable. The bathroom has poor lighting and is very small but that is my only complaint. The hotel lobby is under renovation but it did not disrupt our time at the hotel. The market store in the hotel is very convenient for coffee on your way out in the morning and late night snacks. The location and access to public transportation is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, for NYC”
Reviews.Author: supergirl_sf
Reviews.Content: I don't usually review chain hotels, because I think that if you've stayed at one, you've stayed at them all. Plus, any number of others have capably described what they're like if you've never been to one. However, I am making an exception in this case, because I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms at this Hyatt, given its prime Manhattan location. Space is, of course, at a premium in NYC, and a number of hotels I have seen or stayed in call a glorified 150 square foot closet their deluxe room. Not so, the Hyatt. The room was long and narrow, as hotel rooms often are, but it was normal-sized by any other city's standards, and giant by New York's. It's possible that you get more space in the standard room with 2 queens rather than one king, so request that if you are concerned with space. The bathroom truly is the size of a postage stamp, but the shower's nice, and you don't spend that much time in there anyway. The decor is sleek and modern, with dark wood. The wood was a little scratched and beat up, despite the recent renovation, but I didn't care, because there's a window that actually OPENS!! I asked to be on a high floor on the front of the building for the view, and even though I was 33 stories above the street, it's a busy -- noisy -- street. (It's next door to Grand Central, after all.) It's quieter with the window closed, but so nice to be able to crack it open. The lobby is still under renovation, and while that doesn't look great, it will hardly inconvenience you as a guest. Beyond that, a Hyatt's a Hyatt's a Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura T
Reviews.Content: It had a huge room with everything you could hope for and gorgeous bathroom. We didn't use the bar or restaurant as went out every day. I could not fault the hotel as it was spotless. It is a huge hotel in a fabulous location right next to Grand Central. Everything is walking distance, very close to the subway, bryant park, central park, shops, restaurants. Perfect place to stay

Reviews.Title: “$33 per device per night for wifi- ridiculous!”
Reviews.Author: Tiderocks
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel for years. Always okay nothing special. Remodel on progress & rooms improved. Just logged on to wifi and astounded to learn that they charge $33 for every device you wish to connect. REDICULOUS! Highest price I have paid anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: sladerer
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt, NYC is located by Grand Central terminal, which I found convenient because my meetings were scattered north and south. The hotel lobby is currently undergoing a renovation, though the bar area was not affected. An indoor shopping area attached to Grand Central terminal sits under the hotel. My room was clean and comfortable, though was as small as any room in a major NYC hotel in which I have stayed. The staff was courteous and the lobby market place offered a selection of food and beverages. It was priced typically for bigger brand names in NYC, and given the location it was a decent value. I would probably stay here again given my company's travel policies, but otherwise am likely to look for a place with a bit more space.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: skisnowy
Reviews.Content: Second time at this hotel and even in a renovated room, this is a terrible hotel. You can hear everything through the walls and my "renovated room" was filthy. There was dust on everything and every time you moved the air was full of it. Had to use room service a few times and the food was about as boring as you can get and was cold. Even in NY, given the rate they charge, this hotel is a rip off. I will not stay here again, nor will I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “For $500/night you would expect bath towels.”
Reviews.Author: Azc1019
Reviews.Content: Imagine my surprise arriving back at my room at 1am after working all day and hanging out with friends to find no bath towels. There were no towels on the rack or under the sink. I left a tip for housecleaning which they gladly took. For $500/night this does not count as luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: travelmonkie
Reviews.Content: Our trip to NYC was around mid August during one of the busiest travel times. We took a red-eye in and arrived early in the morning so we were hoping we could possibly do an early check-in to get at least a room to fresh up. I called the hotel in advance to ask about it. They were very nice but told me since the day before we arrive was fully booked there was nothing they could do but put in a request for me. When we got there, we were lucky to get one room first and two other rooms later on the same floor. Very friendly and helpful staff. They also would hold your luggage for you for 2 dollar a piece after you've checked out of the hotel, I'm not sure if it's free when you're checking in. It was still under renovation when we were there but it didn't really bother us. Our rooms were new and fairly clean. I love the bed, one of the best beds I've slept in. Great location, overall everything was very good, only a couple things I didn't like, no free wifi (I mean even starbucks have free wifi), one of my friends actually paid ten dollars or more for a day of access. Also, there were no slippers provided, I know not every hotel would provide them but somehow I just thought they would but they didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Under Renovation-Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: casseekey
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this hotel. We have stayed at this hotel once a year for the past three years. We always stay in three different rooms. We stayed Labor Day weekend 2011. It was worst experience and we won't come back. They ruined this hotel. All four of us had the same experiences in three separate rooms. The lighting in the rooms are atrocious!! They are difficult to manage and difficult to use. In one room there was no separation between the shower and the bathroom floor and the bathroom floor was always flooded after a shower. The maids leave enough towels, shampoo and conditioner and soap for one day. I woke up one morning took my shower and left for the day. When I returned that evening they picked the dirty towels cleaned the room but didn't leave me clean towels or soap or shampoo or conditioner. All three rooms! Management told us that we would have to call housekeeping every day if we clean towels and toiletries replace. For a room fee of $500.00 per night that is absolutely unacceptable! One of the rooms also was not cleaned properly. We had breakfast one morning and they staff was not attentive. They had a beautiful bar and they closed it. The hotel lobby is not user friendly. In my opinion this is no longer a "grand" NYC hotel. This hotel is now an Art Deco hotel that belongs on strip in Miami Beach. We are so disappointed in this hotel. There is no need to stay until renovations are completed. However we wont stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room burglarized - HORRIBLE customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Meredith S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the GrandHyatt NYC on business travel last week. My room was robbed. The response from Hyatt staff was less than stellar. No urgency or apologies - seemed bothered to even lend a helping hand. Was overall a horrible experience and ZERO customer service. If you are a female travelling alone, I would avoid this property.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the center of things”
Reviews.Author: debralynn108
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location!!! You cannot get a better location if you want to explore all areas of NYC. Where you cannot walk, you can easily reach by trains which does not require you to go out in the weather. Although I had booked a standard room, a simple request to upgrade was fulfilled. The room was ample and very comfortable. The gratis breakfast was very generous and even I (a VERY picky eater) found enough Delicious fresh fruit and herbal tea to feel very satisfied for most of the day. The staff was EXTREMELY accommodating and responded quickly to request for anything we needed. The pillow chocolate was out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I would ever stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Andys89
Reviews.Content: I visited New York with a friend earlier this year. We stayed at the Grand Hyatt and although it was a bit more pricey than some of the surrounding hotels, I wouldnt stay anywhere else in New York. The Service was fantastic, Reception were friendly and helpful and cleaners were attentive. The Beds were amazing, it was some of the best sleep we got on our holiday, once you lay down you didnt want to get up. We were in a no-smoking 2-queen bedroom and had ample space in our room for luggage and other things. The Grand Hyatt is right next to Central Station which is fantastic since we used it a fair bit to go sight seeing, it's also a 10 minute brisk walk to Times Square/Broadway. there are some really good restaurants found close by as well! While this hotel may be a bit pricey, once you stay there you see that it is absolutely worth it. My only issue with it is that for the amount you are paying, you are also charged a fee to use WiFi which can be found free in other hotels in the city. I am travelling back to New York early next year with a few friends and we have already rebooked this hotel for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Stay at the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: GRAMMY911NewYork
Reviews.Content: I have to say that our recent stay at athe Grand Hyatt was amazing. We understood before we arrived that the lobby was under renovation so we were prepared for that...and besides, who comes to NYC to spend time in the lobby!?? We arrived very early in the day, around 10:30 a.m. We were using one of our free nights that we got from gettng a Hyatt Mastercard. We did not expect our room to be ready, but thought we would give it a try. We were met by Claudine, who was training a young man by the name of Chris. Claudine made a few phone calls and said our room would be ready shortly. To make up for "any inconvenience" she gave us two coupons for free breakfast the next morning (which isn't cheap, by any means!). They then gave us some coupons for free coffee/water/tea at the little market in the hotel. We got to talking and mentioned that we were in the City for our anniversary. Claudine made us feel like we were her best friend. Chris took time to talk to us and was so very friendly. I cannot imagine anyone complaining that the hotel staff here is impersonal! There was not one employee, from the housekeepers to the maintenance men, to men in suits and ties, to the restaurant staff, that didn't say hello to us and talk to us. Our room was a "deluxe king" which meant it had a little extra space. It was new and clean. It even smelled great. The bed was amazing. The linens were perfect. I have no complaints about the room. Yes, the bathroom is very tiny. There is no bathtub, but it was adequate for our needs. I will say that the toilet paper is a little hard to reach! There is something that looks like a clock on the nightstand. It may be an Ipod docker, or clock radio. We couldn't figure it out! We couldn't find the time anywhere. The alarm went off in the middle of the night (to some very, very loud music). We must have it the snooze button because it went off again. Finally, I had to unplug it. It would be nice if there some instructions in the room as to how to use the thing! When we arried back to our room later in the evening, there was a tray with crackers, cheese and some other goodies. There was no note, but Claudine must have picked up on the fact that it was our anniversary. It was pouring rain the day we were there and it's great to be able to access the hotel through Grand Central Station without having to go outside in the rain. This was one of the best stays in the City that we have ever had and look forward to returning to the Grand Hyatt the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WIsmalltowntraveler0
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Grand Hyatt, NYC. The hotel was perfect for my group of 3 girlfriends visiting NYC. The hotel itself was very clean and updated. A previous review noted issues with the lighting. We had no issues with it turning off automatically while we were in the room, nor had any issues with figuring out how to leave 1 light on for reading. As far as the clock/ipod docking station, we didn't use it but the time was correct - just on army time so had to get used to that. But really, most people have cell phones these days with alarms and the time on them, so not a big deal if the time isn't correct on the clock in the room. The hotel is still under some construction, but had no issues with this. The lobby is partially blocked off, but still plenty of room! In my opinion, you can't complain about a hotel doing construction, they are simply trying to keep the place in good condition. The location was perfect. The hotel is located right next to Grand Central Station, which made traveling to other parts of Manhattan a breeze - even for small-town mid-westerners who have never been to NYC before. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody visiting NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Misplaced priorities lead to poor experience”
Reviews.Author: Joseph K
Reviews.Content: I am right now in the middle of a 3 night stay at the Grand Hyatt; it is most of the way through a major renovation (and some challenges come from the fact that there is still space under construction). At the same time, two parts of the experience here lead me to recommend strongly against this hotel. First, the newly renovated rooms are highly unusable. The lighting controls are smooth soft-touch plates with markings on them (and various places to touch for "all on / all off" or "entry lighting"). These have all sorts of problems built in, including it being nearly impossible to set reasonable lighting for certain purposes (like turning off all the lights except a reading light and a light in the bathroom). Added to this seems to be a timer that turns everything off after a while (whether you're still there or not). They also put in a sophisticated clock/radio/ipod dock that was so hard to deal with that it wasn't set to the right time when I arrived (if you could even tell it was a clock) and at the same time had two sets of instructions in the room. Clearly this place is trying to look high tech, hip (very much like a W hotel), and cool, but in the process it has make it less warm, comfortable, and usable. The second part of my bad experience was related to having business meetings here (on the mezzanine level). Not only wasn't there a bathroom on the level, but hotel security wouldn't let several of us use the men's room on the next level (the ballroom level) because they were limiting access to badged attendees of another event (this was enforced at best sporadically, since others from our group weren't stopped), and I feel it is simply unacceptable to have no nearby rest room and then close access to the closest one (without notice).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, invisible staff”
Reviews.Author: Platinum2709
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for ten days. First of all how any half decent hotel has the audacity to charge for wifi is beyond ridiculous. They need to move on with the times! The Grand Hyatt has one very obvious plus point working for it, it's location which is adjacent to Grand Central. Ideal if you need to travel to Greenwich or Connecticut. The room we were given had a innocuous view, builders working on some kind of extension to the hotel. Not ideal especially when you want to open the blind to find some noisy builders looking in! The room was OK, it's New York, so guess we need to be realistic in terms of expectations of size. However, there is no excuse for a room to be kept untidy (found some bottle lid on the edge of the bed and hair on the cupboards). Lastly, they had the cheek to charge a fee to leave bags after checkout. That just seems petty and in a sense sums up the value they place on customers. Would I stay here again....I think there are better hotels that offer greater value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Ground Zero”
Reviews.Author: bilbo8
Reviews.Content: Rooms redone, modernist and functional (didn't have problems like the other reviewers) but no HD on the TV. Lobby redo ongoing now (9/2011) so no glamour, but lobby is really Grand Central Station so the world is your oyster! Out to an Army game from the terminal Saturday AM, niece comes in from CT that PM. Got a room for my niece (call the hotel direct, don't mess with even the Hyatt's online reservations, saved $50 per night) and we walked to Tiffany's, the Waldorf Astoria and then to MOMA, later jaunted through Central Park, then back home for some killer martinis (The Central Martini) at the hotel bar. Fair little gym but no pool (rare in NYC). I really had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, hotel was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Luana29
Reviews.Content: If you want to walk out the door and be in the midst of great restaurants, great shopping, the Chrysler Building, Grand Central Station, and the excitement of New York City, this is a great place to stay! If you will be satisfied that the high cost of the room justifies the great location alone, you will be happy. And, the room was very nice, spacious and clean, everything you would expect. If however, you expect the type of service that is synonymous with a Hyatt Regency, you will be disappointed. The front desk staff was nice, but I wouldn't say friendly or welcoming. When we walked past the security personnel on our way to the elevator, we were glared at by all three of them. We laughed about it the first time? We were there for three nights and we received the same cold reception each time. I think they were trying to be intimidating, but it just made me worry more for my safety. Is that all you got? When I asked the concierge about transportation options to the airport, she appeared bothered and more interested in helping the person behind me. This is a business hotel and perhaps they are bothered by the bumbling tourist. I will say that the business guests at the hotel were of better help than the hotel staff. Parts of the hotel were under construction and we were warned about it and were told it would not affect our rooms. We heard a hammer pounding before 7am, ugh. I will not bring my family here again.

Reviews.Title: “No human touch --except price”
Reviews.Author: omarzote
Reviews.Content: If you expect a personalized service, a warm welcome and a "home away from home" kind of hotel, don't stay here, Location is fantastic, right next to Grand Central station, the Chrysler tower, close to the Empire State Bldg. and many, many restaurants, shops and a long list of etceteras that we can expect from being at the heart of a great city like NY. However, the hotel is under construction, the lobby is like a war zone and resembles nothing like a hotel reception I have ever seen. I booked a room here, out of convenience. It was at walking distance from the business I was attending, plus I was staying for only 3 nights. I checked the reviews in TA and took the advice of requesting a refurbished room. The hotel is simply huge --I stayed at the 31st floor-- It has something like 9 or 10 elevators and it lacks completely of human touch. The room was in fact remodeled but the furniture seemed excessive for the small space. It was clean and cozy, but it could have been anywhere. I did not ordered anything from room service, and ate breakfast only once at the Hotel's restaurant, which needs urgent refurbishing. The staff was very nice though. I did not care much about the coolness, although it would have bothered me if I stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not-so-great room”
Reviews.Author: krazykane
Reviews.Content: Stayed in NY while attending the US Open tennis tournament. We arrived at the hotel very early in the morning but the woman at registration was willing to get us into our room immediately. She told us it was one of their deluxe rooms and was on the floor just below where they were doing renovations. At first we balked but was assured the work was done only between 8-5, so we took it. Room looked great when we entered. After figuring out the lighting system we got unpacked and comfortable. Nice flat screen TV. Bathroom was a little to be desired - frosted glass doors for privacy for toilet and bathroom, double vanity but little storage space, very low-flow shower head, water took some time to get hot. Then we discovered a water leak behind the toilet. Once we reported it to housekeeping, the leak miraculously stopped. Overall, the size of the room was great. And you can't beat the location of this place - Grand Central Station. If they could improve the bathrooms the rooms would be great. I probably wouldn't recommend staying given the rates they charge.

Reviews.Title: “What a Mess”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: This place is a mess. I am a platinum Hyatt member and just checked in the other day for 3 nights. They stuck me in a handicapp room. I have to kneel on the floor to hang my clothes up. When I use the toilet, my feet do not touch the ground. The room had no face clothes, no room service menu and the bathroom fan runs continuosly providing a water torture effect while trying to sleep. And this after their big renovation. I have tried to always stay at a Hyatt but now I am changing to the Marriott program as soon as I check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Nice Rooms-Very Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: swede52497
Reviews.Content: While still under rennovation as of 9/11/11, this hotel goes on without missing a beat. The staff - awesome. The food - excellent although a bit pretentious. The rooms - spacious with very comfortable beds. We were surprised how quiet it was. This hotel is in an excellent location for a decent price. There are no extras without a price...no coffee in the room, charged us $2 a bag to hold them until our flight, etc. Really?

Reviews.Title: “Short stay at the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: chriscVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from August 23rd till 27th , 2011. The main entrance was still under renovation and lots of people lingering outside the main entrance. The check in was very good, comparable to most 4 stars hotel. Internet is chargeable at a cost of about US$ 14.00 a day (24 hours period) TV programes was lousy. Room was very spacious. Room service was excellent. Location was fantastic, just next door to the Grand Central Station. Lots of food stalls ib there and some were close by. Didn't eat at the hotel as it was still under renovation. There was a restaurant on the ground floor, didnt try that either. DO NOT, i repeat , DO NOT ASK the hotel to book you a TAXI, i was told by the conceige that a taxi would cost me US$ 220.00 to go to the Cruise Ship terminal which was less than 15 miles away. I hailed a cab from opposite the hotel and it only cost me US$ 27 including toll. I couldn't be bothered to complaint to the hotel management about that silly piece of advice. My advice, if you need to travel alot on subways, trains.buses, BUY a one WEEK ticket at a cost of US29.00 It is worth every penny cost a single trip would cost you $2.25 you can buy multiple journey trips in one card and also for as many person as you like. You will need ot buy it from a clerk who man the booth near the subway entrance. They usually accept cash only. also, NO newspaper for hotel guest. Will I stay again? Yes if it is a good deal. BOOK early and you will get the best rates. I paid US$258 per nite and booked 4 to 5 months in advance. If you book last mint , expect to pay between $ 360 to $ 400 a room.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel under construction”
Reviews.Author: Magsy
Reviews.Content: Great location right at Grand Central... but needs help. I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a business trip for five nights in early August. We took a late flight from SF and arrived at the hotel after 1:30 am. The gentleman at the front desk was wonderful to get me checked in. However, I was surprised to find out that he was still figuring out what room is which. With my status with Hyatt, I was upgraded to a corner king, mini-suite. I really appreciated the extra space. Here were some of my challenges with the hotel: 1. Shower door didn't close properly. Therefore, water was being sprayed out to my tiny 48 square foot bathroom. 2. Light next to the TV in my bedroom doesn't turn off, not yet programmed into the room auto lighting system. Couldn't find the plug so had to wear an eyeshade all night. Thank goodness I had one. 3. The phone next to my bed was not properly installed so I had to go to the phone in the living room to answer the phone. No more wake up calls. 4. Service in the restaurant was SOOOO slow. Our server was almost non-existent. We were helped mainly by a different server. Hope he got the tip instead. 5. Charged for everything. What was worst was that each attendant quotes a different price... what is up with that? 6. Meeting space was outdated and had a funny smell to it. My challenges were mostly fixed the next day, except for the shower door. Hotel offered to move me but I didn't want to pack and unpack as I had the living room all set-up for my office away from my office. Aspects of the hotel I appreciated: 1. Proximity to so many things. 2. 24-hour Market Cafe on the main floor with reasonable prices 3. Elevators were quick. 4. 24-hour fitness center. Hope this hotel gets better after the renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location. We will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as a last minute planned trip with a few friends. From the moment we checked in, I was VERY impressed with the staff, location and service. We utilized the concierge for dinner and late night plans and was very pleased with the recommendations and priority we were given. The hotel also allowed a later check out due to us "enjoying" the city that never sleeps. The next time we need to stay in the city, especially midtown, we will look to stay here. Fell in love!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Storm”
Reviews.Author: DIGOBrands
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt New York City. Well over $400/night. TV doesn't work. No room service menu in room. Ordered the thing every good restaurant in New York has - salmon. They don't have it. Had them send up menu. Grilled Salmon on menu. Called down, they tell me that the menu they just sent up is the "old menu." Why do they keep on doing that, they say? Who is they? I wonder. They can't fix the TV. Wireless doesn't work. They give me a service bureau in India. When he fixes the problem, I get the screen. They want to charge me for Internet service as well -- and not a little! Check my iPhone to make sure it's still the 21st century. Yup, still is... I order Cobb Salad without blue cheese. "I'm lactose intolerant" I say. They repeat back the order. Salad arrives... with blue cheese on it! Soup is cold. Server is nice. Tech guy is nice. Restaurant people are nice. Service people are nice. They seem very used to and comfortable with complaints of this kind. Management should be ex-management. I don't say that lightly. I run a business and I know that sometimes things go wrong, but this is systematic. Or, the perfect storm ;-)

Reviews.Title: “No longer a "grand" experience”
Reviews.Author: JM1051
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated rooms are not user-friendly. Our first room was tiny even by NYC standards. The toilet seat was crammed into a tiny space from which it was impossible to reach the toilet paper. The sink had a narrow rim - the only space available to unpack toiletries. The first morning we had only scalding water coming out of the shower. Engineers appeared but could not fix it and we had to leave without a shower. The bathroom was also too dark to put on makeup. Lastly, the TV barely worked. The next day we were moved to a larger corner room. The bathroom (still dark) had a shelf for toiletries but I bumped my head on it every time I washed my face or brushed my teeth. Someone had left dirty underwear in one of the drawers and the ceiling had a leak which showered plaster onto the nightstands. Housekeeping responded promptly and we were given wine & fruit for the inconvenience. (A nice touch.) However the next day I asked about my Apple power cord that I had left in our first room. I was promised a call back and never received one. A 2nd request also resulted in no follow up. One night we returned to our room at 10PM and although it had been made up, all the towels had been removed and we were left with nothing - not even a wash clothe. It took 30 minutes and 2 phone calls before towels were delivered so that we could wash up and go to bed. Lastly, the hall outside our room was covered in debris and wasn't vacuumed for 4 days. The staff was always polite and friendly but rarely seemed to follow up. It seemed like no one spoke to anyone else. We've stayed at this hotel many times and like the location (especially during the US Open) but this visit was a disaster. The one part of the renovation I did like was the ability to shut all lights from the front door. However it was confusing when we wanted to shut off all the lights except one so that my husband could read while I slept. That took a while to figure out.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - no lobby, poor service”
Reviews.Author: DorkingBoy
Reviews.Content: I was severely disappointed with the hotel, we were travelling as a group and the need to rendezvous in the lobby and chat and plan is a pleasant aspect in these circumstances of sight seeing and planning trips. This was not possible due to renovations, no lobby area! Then we got news or Hurricane Irene and we needed to discuss and plan with much more urgency, it was now essential as we were going to be stuck in NY as the airport was closing. We sat in the wine bar area, discussing alternatives, but could not hear ourselves think due to loud music! We requested this be turned down, (or off) because of the circumstances, and the need to get alternate accomodation and use the laptop, (high charge for internet use BTW), we were told this was not possible! Something else is now not possible - me ever recommending this hotel. Only the Concierge staff showed a modicom of "good service culture."

Reviews.Title: “The not so Grand Hyatt hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Hi_Fi_Guy
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt was the "official" hotel for US Open 2011 but sadly they were not prepared for the USTA members or tennis fans. The hotel is undergoing renovations which means the restaurant is closed, there is scaffolding, plastic sheeting, dust, and debris everywhere, and noise, lots of noise. + Easy access to USTA events and US Open shuttle ($20 per person per day) + Good location near Grand Central terminal... not too far away from anything. + Clean room (except shower - see below). - Renovations = chaos, noise, & filth - Disgusting shower a breeding ground for biohazards and unsafe due to broken and chipped shower floor. - Rooms small, even by NYC standards, and electronics (lights, TV, radio) not working properly. - No on-site dining options... some snacks available at the bar or in-hotel store. Overall: I would not recommend this hotel unless you needed to stay next to Grand Central station or it was for a conference or event like the US Open... even then it may be better to stay elsewhere and spend your time and money on a transportation solution for a more enjoyable overall trip to NYC. There are so many better hotels within a 2-3 block radius.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: NOTTSCO_9
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in May 2011. First trip to New York. Could not have picked a better hotel for location. In between the Chrysler Building and Grand Central Station, everything was within walking distance if you decide to do so. Hotel was coming towards the end of renovations, but this did not impact upon us at all. We had a fantastic renovated room on the 23rd floor overlooking the front of the building. Room was amazing. Great decor, most comfortable bed I have ever slept in and great shower room. Everything was spotlessly clean. Hotel staff were always very helpful from front desk to concierge (who recommended a fantastic Italian restaurant named Becco) and bell boys. Drinks were a little expensive, but you would expect this in a central Manhatten hotel. Overall had an amazing stay in New York and found the Grand Hyatt to be a perfect base and would definitely recommend this to everyone and would definitely stay again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong but don't expect extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: LW23
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt is a very good hotel, perfectly located in the heart of Manhattan, which offers comfortable rooms, reasonable rates and typical standard of a four star, chain hotel in this city. My biggest complain is that it feels a little bit like a factory - it is huge, with many floors and hundreds of rooms and people. Still the service remains fairly personal and efficient. Rooms are comfortable, clean and well-equipped. There is no issue whatsoever with the noise from the streets even though it is just next to the Grand Central station. Serves its role as a perfect base for exploring the city. Although, recommended for business rather than tourism!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Grand Hyatt NY”
Reviews.Author: MMG1959
Reviews.Content: I initially chose this property because I was recovering from some knee trouble and wanted to be close to Grand Central to avoid a lot of walking to and from trains and subways. I had heard that the Hyatt was undergoing renovation and was really a bit leery about what we would get, but I was so pleasantly surprised. We arrived at 11:40 AM and were allowed to check in right away, despite the official check-in time being 4:00 PM. We were given a renovated room on the 28th floor and wow - what a nice, comfortable room! Fluffy beds, very cool touch light controls, powerful air conditioning (which was very appreciated in August), a fridge for our own use, a nice TV, iPod dock (which my daughter really enjoyed), sitting area, modernized bathroom... overall a very nice room. We heard no construction noise whatsoever. The attached cafe area sold cookies, sodas, sandwiches, coffee, etc for reasonable prices. We did not try out the hotel restaurants but everything looked very nice. The lobby was not yet finished when we stayed but we are looking forward to staying again near Christmas, when the attachment to Grand Central will be even MORE appreciated as it will keep us out of the cold!

Reviews.Title: “Not very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: GRIMS
Reviews.Content: Wantedf to upgrade breakfast but was not allowed and I had the Hyatt gold passport, porters tried to get me a taxi for an exorbitant price, and the room with a view was not what I expected. Renovations are going on nut should be finished soon and did not disturb me greatly as we spent most of the day out, INCLUDING HAVING BREAKFAST!! but we had a refurbished room which was quite and clean and spacious for New York standards. Excellent location. Gift shop not worth it and they said they were closind down (quite a New York scam it seems) Carpet on 29th floor needs claening or changing or something.. Not too bad but not one of the best hotels I have stayed in, and we have used quite a number of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved it and will be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: n_justesen
Reviews.Content: The service was super, and the room was perfect nice bed.... you couldn`t wish for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable nice decor and not frightfully expensive”
Reviews.Author: Aussiebab
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. Rooms were not too small for new York and the position was easy walk to times square. Cabs were easy to hail down out the front. Loved the restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Not again!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalNomadLondon71
Reviews.Content: Booked a long weekend break using Kayak - I basically chose a flights/hotel package on Continental's website (thru kayak - LHR/EWR/BOS/LHR) We chose this as the London US London flights were code-share with Virgin and I really like Virgin's Upper Class (we booked Business/First). Anyway given this is a hotel review I shall not rant on and on about Continental's appalling service even in First Class (a short flight EWR-BOS flight admittedly) So with a booking for 4 nights arrived at just after midnight at the Hyatt - could see that it was basically a construction site in the lobby. Checked in and was assured we had a "nice room". We arrived in a shoe-box with a window which overlooked the Park Avenue junction. It was a newly renovated room but there was no hot water. On calling reception was told that work was happening in Grand Central Terminus below and it was a one-off and hot water would resume in the morning at 5am. (The hot water the following morning finally materialised just after 6am.) We were tired after the flight and called up room-service to request some bottles of water - were told there was no one available and asked to go to the shop next to the lobby (I thought this was being unhelpful at best, probably bordering on rude). I also complained about how small and claustrophobic the room felt (after all we were paying in excess of £240/night (almost $400/night) just for the room with no extras). The woman at reception was generally helpful and said they would look into seeing if they could move us the following day. To be fair I did get a call the next day and went to check out a room on the 17th floor (I think!) - apparently corner rooms are bigger. This was and we moved. On to my next gripe - we made the mistake of ordering room service breakfast the following day. The food was really quite poor - the toast was cold, chewy and the rest of the food was barely edible. And they do not even offer a simple cornflakes or weetabix!!! And to add insult the bill for this breakfast for two was a whopping $119! When we complained about the quality, they merely said that no one else had remarked and that the food was fine. Breakfast at the restaurant seemed somewhat better the following morning. Also, the whole place seemed to be overrun by teenagers from some dance school/troupe for practically the 4 nights we were there - it appeared like there was some event. This merely added to the general feeling of chaos and poor customer service we seemed to experience I'm not sure what the service is like in other $400/night hotels in Manhattan is, but I'd like to think it can't be worse than this - especially the quality of room service food and room service staff I'd certainly not recommend this hotel for the price - it seemed a 3-star masquerading as a 4-star!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: kazfoodie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Grand Hyatt New York during our holiday in July. Upon check in, we were given a free upgrade to a larger, newly renovated deluxe king room. When the front desk staff found out it was our first visit to NYC, she sent up a bottle of champagne, chocolate coated strawberries and a lovely card to our room. A very nice touch indeed! The hotel is also conveniently located just next to Grand Central Station. We will definitely stay there again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: travelingcouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference. Staff isn't very friendly. Rooms are clean but very small. Location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room in good location”
Reviews.Author: USAtraveler077
Reviews.Content: The rooms have just been remodeled. Toilet is very difficult to get to fully flush and new tub /shower faucet was very difficult to pull out. Double sink faucets with one long sink bow - would not have enjoyed sharing if I had been traveling with someone. Electronic light controls are odd and bedroom always seemed dark with all lights on. Cooling system worked great. I called and asked for a 1:00 p.m. early check in. Operator was rude and said there was not way they could put me on a list or try to accomodate, yet every other hotel I go to always makes an attempt to accomodate. When I arrived at 3, they had roooms available and the front desk clerk was courteous and helpful, so this helped offset my phone in experience. Lobby remodeling is still ongoing, and some elevators are dusty and carpet is a mess in elevators. I had a corporate room rate, otherwise would have been a very high price.

Reviews.Title: “Joseph Hayes at the Grand Hyatt is the STAR of this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: pegstown
Reviews.Content: I travel weekly for business and had the pleasure of turning this business trip into some family time. I have been to NYC many times but this was my first time to stay at the GRAND Hyatt! It was just that GRAND!! From researching my hotel (we know this can be difficult) to speaking with the staff on the phone to finalize plans, this trip was "the best" by far thanks in great part by Joseph at the Grand Hyattt. We all know rooms are small at the hotels but this was nice and newly remodeled. The bathroom wonderful, location at Grand Central was perfect! The staff was wonderful for the most part, but this young man went above and beyond customer service! I will be coming back and thank you Joseph for all you did for my sister and I. You were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but service not up to par”
Reviews.Author: allanng2004
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Grand Hyatt right next to the Grand Central Station on the last leg of our three-week North America tour. While refurbishment work was still ongoing, we did not feel any inconvenience, although the lobby was partly sealed off for the refurbishment. Our room had been redecorated to a very high standard. The twin-bed room was large enough for the three of us. There was a two-seater sofa and a reclining chair, plus a long writing desk in the room. The walk-in closet was also very spacious so that when we spread our three suitcases we did not feel crammed at all. The bathroom was also beautifully done and brightly lit. For me, a dim bathroom was intolerable. While all the facilities/amenities were well maintained, strangely there was no coffeemaker (but there were several bags of coffee powder) in the room. I called up housekeeping and was told that as a matter of policy they would not put any coffeemaker in the room but will make one available to the guest on request. I asked for one to be sent to our room right away, and that was shortly after 8pm. Half an hour later, the coffeemaker had not yet arrived. I called up housekeeping again, and was told that they were handling quite a few orders at the same time and that my coffeemaker would arrive in due course. Eventually, it did arrive, at about 9:30pm. Frankly, I don’t think it is right for a guest to wait more than an hour for a coffeemaker. The hotel’s great location allowed us to explore Manhattan (especially mid-town) at our leisure, without any need to worry about transport or safety issues. Located at Park Avenue and 42nd Street, it was easy for us to walk to our shopping destinations on Fifth Avenue and other key points of attraction like the Central Park and the New York Public Library. Taking the subway to the museums and the Lincoln Center was also simple and easy. I do see myself coming back to this hotel, but I think they should reconsider their coffeemaker policy, and improve on housekeeping efficiency.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: n17ved
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay at this hotel over new years. The staff are so polite, hard to fault this place.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we return every year”
Reviews.Author: inahal55
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in the best location right in the heart of manhattan the rooms are comfortable and very clean the staff is always very helpful all transportation is readily available

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFansNH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt, 2 families of 4 with teenagers for sightseeing/shopping. The hotel is very nice and the location is excellent. Rooms were clean, newly renovated. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Renovations were ongoing but didn't disrupt our stay at all. Price was reasonable considering location and quality. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt Truly Delivers on its name!”
Reviews.Author: Moondogge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed the week between Christmas and New Year's Eve and what a great place. We booked the hotel using priceline and we were thrilled. When you walk in to the hotel you will experience probably the greatest lobby in Manhattan. The front desk staff was more than accommodating especially for as busy as they were. Our room was beautiful with a king bed and a great bathroom. I always will check to see if this hotel is available on my future trips to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Large Room, Classy”
Reviews.Author: Lazydoxy66
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt met and exceeded my expectations. Very classy and conveniently located next to Grand Central Station it lends itself to anything the traveler needs. The staff was very professional and knowledgeable. There is a 24hr 'market' in the lobby. Prices for most items were $8/$9. The coffee was good. You can get better selections in Grand Central's food court when it is open. It is connected via covered walkways. There is also loads of shopping there. Times Square is about 5 blocks away. NYC Transporter shuttle picks up/drops off across the street. Super Shuttle does this at the door on the first floor. The only minor complaints: While the room was larger than expected for NYC, the bath/toilet was cramped with a very generic utility-style toilet that didn't fit in with the classy decor and the shower curtain had mold on it. Overall it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central Station”
Reviews.Author: stammtravels
