Reviews.Content: This hotel is great and it is one of the few hotels in NYC that offers rooms with 2 beds. Most only have one bed, so this is great for 4 ppl. There is construction going on at the Grand Hyatt but once this is completed it will be beautiful. The hotel is perfectly located as it is within walking distance to all attractions yet far enough from Times Square to give you a bit of a break. The rooms are newly renovated. Beds are great and very comfortable. There is a small refrigerator in the room which is very nice as well. The bonus is being attached to Grand Central Station. After a long day or early morning you can venture into Grand Central and pick up a bagel for 1.15 at Hot and Crusty or pick up NYC's best Cheesecake at Juniors for just a few dollars, bring it back to your room and enjoy. Also, two doors up is Tim Horton's that has the best coffee and donuts ever. Will definitely stay here again the next time. They have a market inside the hotel, but I would highly suggest going into Grand Central for the bagels, cheese cake and other desserts. They are out of this world the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: teshaCalgary_Canada
Reviews.Content: My dad and I went to NY for 2 Yankee games, and this was a great location for a senior citizen. Hotel connected to Grand Central Terminal, lots of restaurants, shopping sights nearby. Hotel under renos right now, but almost finished. Rooms are small, but neatly decorated and adequate, as you wont be spending a lot of time in the room! Suggest Hop On/Hop Off Bus tour at Gray Line Bus tours to see sights if you are only there for a couple days. Suggest Market in lobby for breakfast, Oyster Bar in Grand central for dinners. Anyplace you can find a Cafe Metro for lunch or breakfast on the run.Tim Hortons one block West of Hotel. Just a great hotel - very pleasant and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: Karen P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a shopping trip with a friend and we wanted the hotel to be a part of our NY experience and we were not disappointed! Fabulous hotel almost next to Grand Central Station, beauitiful large room with 2 double beds, lovely bathroom all as standard. staff were friendly and helpful, have never slept in such comfortable beds! cant fault it, even the coffe shop was superb with an excellent range of drinks and snacks, would go there again and again

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: andymitcho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt New York for a week on a vacation, we usually stay in the Times Square area, however this time decided on something different. Our room was not ready on arrival, however the lady at the front desk quickly took care of that and assigned us another room, she and another front desk staff who was free at the same time were both VERY friendly and welcoming, gave us maps and advised us on good times for visiting certain attractions. During our stay the WIFI internet broke, when I enquired about this I was offered an immediate solution and apology, I also got a follow up phone call the next day to check everything was OK by a lovely and helpful lady called Carrie I believe. The guy who checked us out was also very friendly and polite even at 5am in the morning! Standard rooms are not huge, however they are a good size as far as New York hotels go, housekeeping did a great job on all but 1 day, the renovated floors were all very clean. The shop at lobby level is great for little food items you need to grab in a hurry I loved the location of this hotel, Grand Central Terminal is right next door, the 4/5/6 Subway lines are very quick and easy to use from here to Battery Point and uptown, also a very useful crosstown bus M42 stops right outside the hotel The renovations did not impact us at all, the lobby did get a bit busy at times but the construction workers didn't get in the way and you really don't notice much of an impact

Reviews.Title: “Good value, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: campfiar
Reviews.Content: I was issued a room that had been recently remodeled and was very pleased with the accomodations. The front desk and room service hospitality earned high marks too. The lobby was under construction during my visit, so I'm sure better things are to come. I attended an industry conference and found the meeting space and meals to be above average. My favorite thing about the location of this hotel is that you can catch the New York Airporter shuttle to and from the airports for about 1/3 of the cost of a cab and you get there just as fast. The round-trip cost from LaGuardia was $25 at the time of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations, big hotel, no special treatment.”
Reviews.Author: Fsanches
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay, with standard services, don´t expect much.

Reviews.Title: “Remodel serves this property well...”
Reviews.Author: Schaffnva
Reviews.Content: The newly remodeled Grand Hyatt at GCT is a far cry from its former dull self. The rooms are the hippest, yes I said hippest, European style I have stayed in throghout my domestic travels. The entire room has been reworked from its infrastructure to decor. Case in point is the electrical system. Now what is exiciting about plain old electrical, you flip a switch and there is light. Not in this room. There are no switches to flip just control stations to push and command the lighting scheme in the entire room and bath. One push and all lights are on or maybe just the bath or just your nightlight. It was a very nice feature once I figured out the schematic. The furniture was straight out of a European show room and the bed was very comfortable. Oh and how could I forget to say the room was BIG...huge by NYC standards. Plenty of room and even a nice entry way with full length mirror so all the beautiful people can look at their wonderful outfits before walking out the door. The room was also quiet. I have stayed at this property a number of times and glad to be back after this most recent remodel. Very enjoyable stay all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great remodelled room, superb staff, new lobby coming along slowly”
Reviews.Author: lilzeppelin
Reviews.Content: Our room was pretty spacious and open, overlooking Chrysler building and the UN over Lex Ave it had great light in the mornings. We usually request this location for the room in order to have some view. Although sitting over a busy street the noise does not bother us because the insulation is very good. More importantly the bed in a renovated room is super comfortable. It is more comfortable than their mid-town competition - whoever selected this kind of bed should be promoted!! I appreciate hotel's relatively new internet provider - no more numerous logins as before - just once would do and the speeds are close to 3Mbs. Another feature I love is the Geneva ipod dock and radio in the room. The sound is truly fantastic. If you like it too, one can get it from a MOMA store!! Apart from the new furnishings, renovated rooms also have touch-sensor lighting. I found it cool, to be in control of it from the bed. While the bathroom remained small, it feels much brighter and only has a shower rather than a tub. The only negative of the new design is a wooden shelf running above the sink and below the mirror. You need to remember of it if you need to wash your face with your eyes closed and need to lean over the sink not to end up bumping your head into it. Another negative is their TV system. While a flat panel TV is of a good size, their channel guide is hidden behind numerous screens, and some channels far from being hi-def have snowy view. Much prefer Starwood's TV system over Hyatt's: I don't need to browse for half an hour just so as to locate a channel a need. I understand that Grand Hyatt is not "luxurious" enough to provide printed channel guide in it's rooms, but I would be surprised if one of their focus groups have not specified to them about the importance of this. Personally I will stick to iphone steaming over the Geneva.... During our stay Club Lounge usually accessible for extra fee or to Hyatt elite guests was closed for renovations with the new lounge on 16th floor slated to open in September. Hyatt offered complimentary breakfast to Platinums in their renewed restaurant sitting above 42nd street. The restaurant decor is very nice, modern, airy and comfortable. Breakfast food, only available a la carte, was good, nicely presented and flavorful. Ordered crab omelet one morning, and was hard pressed to find any crab in it; a far cry from their old restaurant /menu which offered generous servings of crab in a crepe... Staff at the hotel are largely professional and largely a pleasure to interact with. Front desk is pretty welcoming. We will be back when we need to stay in mid-town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, on 42nd Street.. boring rooms”
Reviews.Author: Need_a_bed_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here. The hotel is located on 42nd Street at Grand Central Station. Free wifi in the hotel lobby. Great location with everything you could need nearby. The hotel is massive as is the hotel lobby which at times felt like a train station. Like most hotels in New York it is somewhat cold and impersonal. The front desk staff for the most part appeared to be powerless to action any simple requests and everything had to be referred to a Manager. Friendly and upbeat doormen however always offered a friendly welcome. There is a number of fast food restaurants nearby as is the Grand Central Station Food Court. Several pharmacies are nearby and a short walk will take you any number of "diners" for breakfast etc. There is also a coffee kiosk in the lobby. Bedroom was comfortable with practically no view. Quite a plain, nearly boring room for a Grand Hyatt. Very clean throughout wiht great quality linen and towels. Bathroom was large, well lit and clean with great shower pressure. One of the few hotels in New York that I have stayed in where after 11pm they actually check you are a guest in the hotel when returning from a night out. If you get a good rate go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Construction noise is miserable”
Reviews.Author: Dallas93
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here before when in town for business and always been pretty happy. This was a bad experience. I was awakened both mornings by 7 am with incredibly loud construction directly over my head. I called the second morning to say isn't there some way you can put this off until 8? Basic answer: Nope, your bad luck to stay under our construction. They were very nice about the fact that they were unwilling to do anything to make the noise stop, and offered me a discount (useless on a business trip) or some points. I took the points (would rather be able to sleep until 8 am), and later the same day needed to extend my NY trip by a day. Hotel sold out. I thought, well, supposedly they were sorry that they made it impossible for me to sleep after 7 am, I bet they can find me a room - that's something that would actually be helpful and not even cost them anything. Nope, we don't have a single room in the entire hotel anywhere that you can stay in, and anyway we gave you points. Last trip to the Grand Hyatt - my semi-regular business trips to NY are shifting hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at central NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyclatina
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt NYC for 2 nights in July for the conference company was holding at the hotel. The hotel is currently under renovations and rooms on floors below 30 have been re-vamped (the lobby has areas closed off due to construction). I happened to stay in one of the renovated rooms and it was lovely. Large room with modern furnishings, king-size bed, and a great bathroom. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hot. Loud. Run down.”
Reviews.Author: jeremy78Maine
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with my first stay at the Grand Hyatt. The entire hotel has the feeling of a place that is too heavily used & not continuously maintained. The hotel needs a complete renovation. We arrived during a heat wave & our room was sweltering. We immediately turn down the temperature as low as it could go & turned up the fan. We left for 6-7 hours & upon our return the room was still sweltering. Couldn't sleep because of the heat & woke up sweaty & dehydrated. We stayed on the 34th floor & thereist have been maintenance going on becuase starting around 7:00 a.m. It was outrageously loud. The only positive about the hotel is it is located next to Grand Central making it very easy to get to & around from. However, in the future I will stay At a nicer hotel that is less convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Remodel is starting to payoff”
Reviews.Author: Gpeden
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms through hyatt gold passport. The renovations very nice. The lobby was still under construction but they seem close to finishing. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: ericacarter
Reviews.Content: We took the train to the city for a long weekend. The hotel is beautiful, the room was very comfortable and the location was fabulous. We like to stay on the Upper West Side, but we got a great deal at the Hyatt. Having Grand Central right there makes such a difference, especially in the dead of winter.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected surprise”
Reviews.Author: Tommie22
Reviews.Content: The property is being upgraded and I had one of the new rooms. Very high tech and comfortable. Great bed and bath. Excellent breakfast and late night lounge. Next door to Grand Central. The staff was exceptional. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Brandsen055
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grant Hyatt for 4 days, the location is excellent, and the refurbished room was beautiful. The staff were very friendly. They were still upgrading the lobby, so that was the only negative thing, but it didn't affect our stay. The little market shop is brilliant. We enjoyed the bar with its great view on 42nd Street. We have great memories of our stay and will go there again. Loved the gym, and it was amazing to see the top of the Empire State building lit up at night while using the gym.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: SSC014
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt was in a great location -- Grand Central Station. It was easy to catch the subway to whatever we wanted to do. The room was small. The bathroom was not very clean. And the AC never cooled the room down for a good night's sleep. All in all it was so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Typical for 4* In New York - Good but not Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mkjr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for about 12 hours. Checked in late. Was on the 24th Floor in a renovated 2 double bed room. For New York, the room was huge actually. Not sure about the colour scheme for the renovation since it seemed to show lots of dirt on the tile in the bathroom. The room was very hot when I arrived at 11pm at night and took a while to fully cool down - I am not sure it ever actually cooled down. I never understand why hotels do not update the AC units when they renovate. Having the loud and non-efficient clunkers are not great although it does provide for white noise. Room was by the long bank of elevators and was very noisy. I would suggest that if people notice that they are close to the elevator and think it might be OK, immediately return to the front desk and ask for another room since you can hear the "bing" and hear the noise from persons getting on and off. I did not have a great sleep. Very limited noise from the street, however. That said, had a wake up call for 6:30 and so spent very little time in the hotel. I could see the location for visitors to the city being good. I can not comment on anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very busy and under renovation”
Reviews.Author: MNsota
Reviews.Content: Good central location, right next door to Grand Central. Rooms are good sized for NY, I was surprised. Hotel is under renovation, work starts at 7am weekdays. Could stand a good cleaning in the shower. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mag1carpetr1de1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the night at the grand hyatt during the recent heatwave and the hotel was a great place to escape the heat! Customer service reps were wonderful, the room was clean and even though the hotel is next door to grand central terminal it was very quiet. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: DRegehr
Reviews.Content: My family and I spend 4 nights at the Grand Hyatt, its central location is fantastic, Grand Central station was next door where we had one breakfast and one lunch; lots of family style restaurants with reasonable pricing within walking distance (McDonalds, TGI fridays, and Pasta, Pizza & More) it also has a convenience store close by where we purchased pop, water bottles and chips. The hotel was clean no bed bugs, service of staff was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel if you don't mind ongoing construction”
Reviews.Author: treffy123
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Grand Hyatt, but the first since the renovation. The renovation was still going on and the lobby was reduced to a couple of narrow walkways between boarded up construction zones. This didn't really bother me though as I didn't spent a lot of time in the lobby. But it could be a little awkward if you're meeting people there. If the new lobby will be anything like the bar, I'm sure it will be spectacular. I requested a renovated room away from the construction (thankfully, as my original room was one floor below a floor in the middle of renovation). The new rooms are very nice - spacious for a downtown hotel. My only real complaint is that instead of a desk and chair, the new rooms have an oval table with a love seat and lounge chair. I had to spend a few hours working in my room and found that this was not an ideal set-up - it's really not set-up for working on your computer or writing. The location of the Grand Hyatt is fantastic - it's connected to Grand Central Station and is a couple of blocks from 5th Avenue. The Grand Central market is really nice if you're looking for food or snacks. There are a lot of great restaurants nearby as well. They also have a new 24-hour snack bar type of place in the lobby. When we checked in we received tickets for free coffee or water for each day of our (5-day) stay. The lobby bar (don't know the name) is pretty spectacular. We had a couple of drinks there one night and it has a great energy - the design is really outstanding, looking over 42nd street. I would definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: feisknitter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night and found the hotel to be very satisfactory. The decor was beautiful, location was great-right next door to Grand Central Station. Our only complaint was that the air inside was a bit stuffy. We wished we could have turned the thermostat lower as it was a very warm night. The package we booked included breakfast which was delicious and the service was great. It was overall a fantastic stay. We would definitely stay again if returning to New York!

Reviews.Title: “A personal touch in the big city"”
Reviews.Author: tolmay
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is a smart, big hotel in a big city, but we were pleasantly surprised by the caring attitude so many of the staff members. We accidentally left our camera in the room on departure and that, for us, major problem was quickly and competently solved.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get enough of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartinBancroft
Reviews.Content: We stayed here January 2011 during our engagement trip, for four nights. Location - On the cross cutting 42nd Street, next to the Chrysler Building and Grand Central Station. We like this location because you are far enough from the madness of Time Square, but close enough to everything to fully enjoy all that NYC has to offer. Of course, the subway is next door at Grand Central Station, but a good rule of thumb for Taxis is that everything in midtown was around $10 away with a tip included. Room - I won't embarrass the staff by disclosing just how much they upgraded us, but simply say thank you and rate the room on the 32nd floor at 10/10, we were blown away. Staff - We were really looked after and can only highly praise the high quality staff at this location. In particular we would like to thank Mark Wagner for his very kind actions. 10/10 Food - we did not eat in the hotel restaurant, but regularly had a light breakfast from the mini supermarket in the main reception area. The quality of the produce here was of a good standard. Value - we have always found that this hotel provides good value for money when compared against other NYC hotels of the same standard, however this years upgrade took this aspect of our holiday to 11/10. When we were at this hotel, the main reception was partly through a refurb, not one that spoilt our trip in any way. Please let me finish by once again expressing our heartfelt thanks to Mark Wagner and the staff of the Grand Hyatt for an amazing experience that wholly added to our outstanding engagement trip (please feel free to view my profile for all the reviews relating to this trip).

Reviews.Title: “Are all hotel rooms in NYC this small?”
Reviews.Author: MomWithBooks
Reviews.Content: Got a convention rate so that was good. Hyatt does this email/smartphone check in process. They send an email when your room is ready & you scan your phone at the kiosk, which is supposed to speed up the process. Got my email that the room was ready but when I scanned the phone it said to go to front desk. Front desk said my room - with 2 beds - wasn't ready but I could have a king bed with a rollaway. They brought the rollaway right up but couldn't figure out how to leave it so I wouldn't have to climb over it to get out or use the bathroom. Luckily my husband figured out to put it on a slight angle (all there is room for) but enough to squeeze by it. Bathroom was doll house size. Had to close the lid of the toilet to reach the handle to flush. Hotel is under construction, as it was four years ago, the last time we stayed there. Service was good. Location is outstanding. Biggest problem we had was no wireless or internet in the room, only for each device. $10 per day per device adds up in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Hopefully construction will be worth it”
Reviews.Author: Vanc0uver_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel before in 2007 and miss the grand entrance with the waterfalls. Hopefully they’re planning something spectacular because right now the dismal white construction area is depressing. Location is great. We chose to get coffee at Starbucks around the corner, meals at Grand Central and munchies at Duane Read across the street. Our room was one of the renovated ones. I find paying for wifi in this day and age ridiculous and insulting. Plus was a big closet – huge by NYC standards. Bathroom could’ve been bigger and weird location of the toilet paper roll. You have to be somewhat of a contortionist to reach beside & behind you for tp. Odd. The light switches in the room are by touch which felt cool and modern for a few seconds and the rest of our 4 night stay just annoyed me. I could never quite figure out if I should hold my entire hand on the switch or punch the darn thing to get the lights on! There was a lot of rhythmic banging from some construction most of the night. We thought it was within the hotel but we also saw signs in Grand Central Terminal that they’re digging a new tunnel so that could also be it. I’d stay here again but only once the construction was completed.

Reviews.Title: “A remodelling for the worse”
Reviews.Author: Paul J
Reviews.Content: Having last visited the GHNY just a few months ago I was surprised to arrive to what looked like a very different hotel inside. Rather than the open space that welcomed me previously was some kind of internal construction that basically closed the open foyer almost completely. I was given one of the recently remodelled rooms that frankly just didn't have many finishing touches applied. The bathroom lightswitch, while touch sensitive, wasn't properly attached to the wall, the woode surround to door frames etc wasn't finished neatly, use of wooded soap dishes in the bathroom that already had a very used feel to them, etc. I was also pre-charged $100 for incidental expenses despite the fact that the only thing I purchased was a 24 hour wifi access. This led to an almost embarrasing situation the day I checked out as I had no idea this bogus charge (I'm told to be credit sometime in the next week) had been applied to my account. When I rang from the airport to complain the lady I spoke to at the desk kept talking over me to the point of exasperation! I'll make a point of checking that my extra change is returned and won't likely be returning to the GHNY!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location!”
Reviews.Author: Missmarymoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our choir group from Utah. The hotel was nice, will be beautiful once they finish the reconstruction. The ball rooms were gorgeous, so I can't wait to go back and see what they do to the lobby. The room was a nice size and had pleanty of room for four. The bathroom wasa little small, but we made it work. Had an acutal walk in closet, so that was nice for storing luggage. The beds were comfy, and when I asked for more towels and pillows, the housekeeping staff was great. The front desk staff was wonderful and Diane made our trip extra special with wine and chocolate covered strawberries! The bell staff would be the only bad thing about this place. They always looked like someone pee'd in thier Wheatys and were not very friendly, even though you were paying them to store your bags. It was like it was an inconvenience for them. My favorite spot at the hotel was the Market. What a great little shop! They had the most delicous pastry's and parfaits for breakfast and yummy cookies for a late night snack. Very reasonably priced for New York. I would stay here again, if I could get a good deal on the price. It was expensive, but you are paying for the location. To be right at Grand Central was so helpful for our tour.

Reviews.Title: “Fantanstic hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: 1971jc
Reviews.Content: We were surprised how large our room was, we thought it would be like London Hotel rooms size. Our room was spotless and very comfortable with everyting you could possibly need. The staff were extremely polite and helpful and one memeber even offered to take us out for a coffee as it was my partners birthday! Location is perfect for all the main attractions and the Chrysler building is right across the road and you are next door to Grand Central! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: Crusha
Reviews.Content: You don't even have to walk outside to get into the Grand Central terminal from the Grand Hyatt. That may not matter much in July, but you certainly appreciate it in January! This Hyatt is close to just about everything in Manhattan, and whatever isn't close enough is just a stop or two away via the subways. If you plan to do a lot of sightseeing in and around Manhattan, this hotel is a great choice. The rooms are slightly larger than average size for Manhattan, but they're still pretty small. Rooms are well appointed with flat screen televisions and a sitting area in most rooms. Beds are comfortable and inviting. The fitness center is small, considering the size of the hotel, but I've stayed here on more than one occasion and rarely have to wait for a machine. The Regency floor for Hyatt regulars is just a bit nicer than the rest, and the lounge, breakfast and snacks are available with a 24 hour conceirge. I find it to be worth the extra few bucks to stay on this floor, but the "extra" does vary with the occupancy of the hotel. All in all, this isn't a swanky boutique hotel, but my stays are consistently enjoyable and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed”
Reviews.Author: MKM44
Reviews.Content: First, I am a gold passport member with Hyatt, currently platinum level and have been diamond, and have stayed at at least five or six different ones. I was pretty disappointed with this one. It was clean and had the great little coffee shop downstairs and was in a good central location, but there were some serious service glitches and the bathroom was so small it was ludicrous for a room that is in the high three hundred range. I used points, but it took alot of them and in the past I have been treated much better in using my points. First, I was charged as a no show when there was a note in my reservation that said I was coming in on the red eye AND I had phoned the evening before to be sure all was in order with the late check in - I tried to check in via internet but for some reason that service was unavailable so I double checked by calling and spoke with a human who assured me it would be fine to show up the next morning and that everything was in the file. The first front desk person to check me in greeted me with a "you were supposed to be here yesterday." I pointed out there was a note in the reservation, and she gave us the room but I guess she did not correct the no show notation and it was not until I was checking my bill the last night that I caught the $163. charge. Luckily the woman at the desk that night had originally taken my reservation and she corrected it. But why should it take three tries to get something that simple right? Then, when I was shown to my room it was miniscule and recently renovated a horrible dark grey/brown. Really, it was back to the seventies and not in a good way. I went down and got a slightly better room but as someone else commented, the bathroom is the size of a tiny closet with no room to put toiletries of any amount - not enough for a couple for sure. No BATH. Just a shower. Really. Hideous mural behind the bed. The lights are some weird touch pad. My husband is a techie and I am not impressed by gadgets that don't work well. The lights were literally all on or all off, no in between which is difficult if one is sharing a room. The TV on demand channels did not work at all. The housekeeping staff were great. The concierge (male) was unhelpful. The doorman tried to strongarm me into taking a limousine when I had specifically requested a yellow cab and one was sitting right there - seriously, if I had not dug my heels in I would have paid twenty dollars more for the same ride with someone whose "marketing" was dubious at best. I felt that was a violation of the hotel's duty to provide a range of options that I was being steered so hard into a choice I had no intention of making. I had a friend come in from out of town and just told her to stay elsewhere. I even went down and asked to pay for a better room, but there were none to be had. No regency club rooms, no suites, nada. I think Hyatt should rethink this - I was just online thinking to book a room (at full price) at the Hyatt in Waikiki and there are no suites and the pool is closed due to renovation. I get that renovations need to be done, but save a few good rooms for your loyal customers, please! I am going somewhere else, kissing those points for the dollars spent goodby. It was that bad. I just don't want to repeat that. I should say I stayed at the Disneyland Hyatt when it was under renovations - they gave me a fantastic room and treated me beautifully, so it is not just that I am a prima donna who can't walk through a construction zone. Really, the management at this hotel needs to figure the staffing out for those behind the desks that we look to for help - the housekeepers, room service, etc. couldn't have been nicer but the chill on some of the the desk staff was difficult to shrug off.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here EVER AGAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: redneckromeo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under renovation's. Looks like thing where rushed and the rooms don't have coffee pots. The bathrooms are EXTREAMLY small. Ladies will hate them. I have stayed in a lot lower star hotels that where much better!!! King rooms are small! 28th and 27th floors don't have ice machines. For a so called high class hotel this place is very disapointing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Return over and over again”
Reviews.Author: ellenzelwell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here together many times...and individually on business. Although we love many NY hotels, we return here for the location and transportation - especially when the weather turns colder. There is nothing more convenient than staying inside, going through Grand Central, and catching a train or subway and getting somewhere fast! (Since we lived in NY in grad school - and through constant returns to the city - we know it well so subways don't daunt us and are less scary than NY cabs!). The Hyatt itself if generally very reliable and very gracious. Their security system is first-rate and this is a big consideration in NY. Room service is always excellent - and the food halls in Grand Central are fabulous for picking up just about anything (especially the fresh Market). We'll be staying at this hotel again in October.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location; HUGE room; Clean”
Reviews.Author: grothman
Reviews.Content: You can't beat a hotel where you never have to go outside to get to the subway. It's located at Grand Central Station so you can pretty much travel wherever you want around the city from here super easily. They have a kenneth cole and banana republic store next door which surprisingly enough had really good sales going on with "normal" prices. The restaurant was nice but of course you'll pay NYC restaurant prices there too. The concierge was very helpful and we bought our Empire State Blding tix there instead of having to wait in a line to buy them there. You're within walking distance of rockefeller center, Saks, fifth avenue & madison ave stores etc. Now for the room: We were on the 23rd room on the interior walls and heard NO outdoor noise. The ceilings were huge 12+ ft ceilings and the room was very stylishly decorated. My favorite part was that you could control the thermostat from a keypad next to the bed! You could also control the lighting settings aorund the room there as well...VERY cool. Nice LCD TV, couch, desk. The decorating was very contemporary. The standup shower was a really nice size...the sink space was a little smaller but probably normal NYC size. Maid service was very prompt and thorough. The prices at the snack bar on the main floor were actually not outrageiously priced...i had fresh baked mac n cheese there and it was awesome. Also, you can pay $2/bag for them to hold it if you want to run around hte city the day you checkout of the hotel. Also, there are great places for fast eating down in the lower level of the grand central station. I would recommend the hotel if $$ isn't an object. I think it was around upper $300/night??? oh btw the main lobby is under construction so it looks wierd but i didn't really care.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cazzaj81
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked on a whim and on offer at time, more than i had wanted to pay for the hotel but the location, right next to grand central terminal and a few mins walk from times square was ideal. Hotel lobby and reception were superb, very grand in design, reception staff were extremely helpful. Room's were massive and very comfortable, cleaned every day and a lovely view from the window. Cant say anything bad at all about this hotel, easy to find and perfect location to get to all the major sights. On leaving they offered a secure case facility where your cases were kept until you left, ideal for last minute shopping and sightseeing. Would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: K98
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Grand Hyatt in April with my daughter for a week. I picked this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and also because of the awesome location. Positives: 1. Fantastic Location: On 42nd and Park, 2 blocks from 5th Ave, a short interesting walk to Bryant Park/Times Square, Grand Central Station adjoining the hotel - can't get better than this. 2. Service was great: Friendly, engaging staff. They upgraded me to a bigger room on their own accord, checked me in much before their scheduled check-in time. House-keeping was prompt and cheerful. 3. Newly renovated room, quite plush and clean 4. Nice gym 5. The deli in the lobby, The Market, is quite useful - good variety of food and very reasonable prices. 6. Good clientele - important when you have kids with you. On the flip side: 1. There is no coffee machine in the room, you can either order in (room service is expensive) or get it from the deli in the lobby. 2. Bathroom is somewhat small. 3. Wireless internet is charged. 4. Hotel is under renovation. However, we were not inconvenienced in any way. Overall, we had a lovely stay. Great for staying in NYC if you have kids with you. Would definitely stay there on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “My Hotel at NYC ... GREAT !!”
Reviews.Author: SILVINILS
Reviews.Content: Once again at The Grand Hyatt NYC!! The hotel is under a complete renovation,so i was in a brand new room, 2515. The room was really nice, with beautiful colors , nice living area, with a very comfy sofa.All the room illumination was very modern,that works with finger touch. The bed was really AMAZING!! comfy with cashmere wool blanket,and the mattress is like being sleeping into cotton clouds! Thanks to the most efficient and kind person, the Employee of the year 2010!!!, who makes my Hyatt stays always perfect, since I knew him in 1995 THANKS JORGE LAZO!! Thanks DEAR JORGE for being always there, ready to help all of us. Thanks to Diane, for her compliments , so nice and kind. If you are planing to visit NEW YORK CITY, this is the perfect place and location, the Grand Station is beside, so you can take the metro all over NY, or simply walk, as I do, everything is around the GRAND HYATT!! Fifth Avenue, Shopping ., Restaurants, Museums, Parks!! Highly recommend this hotel and location. Thanks to all the Grand Hyatt Staff, and thank you so much Jorge Lazo for taking care of my reservations. My Hotel in New York, a perfect stay!! Will be back as soon as I can

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: McCall
Reviews.Content: The hotel has almost completed the renovation and we received a renovated corner room with a king bed. The updated rooms are beautiful and have the amenities that we like to have in a hotel room. The highlights of the room were comfortable bed, warm rich colors, high quality alarm that was IPOD compatible, quiet fridge, and walk in shower (a little small but much nicer than a tub shower). Compared to other NYC hotels the rooms are fairly big and you have plenty of room to move around. The bathrooms are small but still nice. The only thing we didn’t enjoy in the room was the automated light system. The main lobby areas are still undergoing renovations so I can’t really comment much about this area except that the hotel did their best to make use of the current open areas. I would suggest they turn down the volume of the music played in the lobby area a notch or two but that’s more of a personal preference than a real complaint. Overall the staff was courteous and helpful. Both the check-in staff and the concierge desk did an excellent job making us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but enjoyment soured by an offensive member of staff.”
Reviews.Author: winchesterman
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before. It's a great location in mid-Manhattan. The hotel hosts many conventions and the lobby can be very busy. The reception staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are well-appointed, clean and for New York, reasonably quiet (the higher the floor, the less traffic noise). We asked for a slightly later checkout and the receptionist said that was OK. About half an hour after official checkout time we were called and asked why we were not out of our room. We said we had been given a later time. The caller said there was no record of this and asked who authorised the later time. Her tone was most offensive. Behaviour like that hardly encourages repeat business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: NicoleBahrain
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights from 15 to 18 June 2011. I arrived early from the Middle East and was able to check in at 10:30am, and also got a late check-out (2:00pm) confirmed for my departure on Saturday. The room was very clean (with a tiny bathroom), and very well serviced over the 4 days. I had room service once, and was not disappointed with the food - very tasty. Most deserving of praise however are the staff at Concierge, especially Tina, who was always on hand with a smile and some excellent advice. When we go back to NYC, we will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awful don't book while under renovation.”
Reviews.Author: Landrysmom
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and was asked to wait for a good room. Public bathroom overflowing with trash. Staff hailing cabs inattentive. No cold bottles of water for the vouchers because "everyone has the vouchers," (maybe you should keep more of that brand cold...) but the worst is water was unexpectedly cut off from at least 4 -6 pm then brown and received a note in the night it would be off from 11 pm to 5 am. No kidding!,

Reviews.Title: “everybody that works in the grand hyatt are truly wonderful people. stunning hotel. a must see”
Reviews.Author: templesarah
Reviews.Content: these people will go out of there way to make sure you have everything you need. everyone i spoke to was so freindly. i actually loved the housekeeping ladies they were fab. i cant wait to go back to this stunning hotel and room service was to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Cherry on the cake that was NYC”
Reviews.Author: jazzy81
Reviews.Content: My husband an I fell head over heals in love with NYC. We were here for a week and we are ready to spend the rest of our lives there! Staying at the Grand Hyatt made the stay just that extra special. We were treated like royalty by the staff, it was so great to walk in from the hussle and bussle of the busy streets into our wonderful hotel. The check-in was super friendly, it was our anniversary while we were in NYC, which was not written anywhere, but the lovely check-in lady asked if we were here for a special occasion. Low and behold when we got back to our room from our first day out, there was a cake and champaigne and a handwritten card from the staff. Very special! The rooms are clean and nice. The hotel is a bit older (but this just means that they are quality built and you don't hear your neighbours or the street below). The decorations and everything was new however! Nice lobby and breakfast was delicious too. Loved staying here!!! - would have been nice to have free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Always a good option on the East Side”
Reviews.Author: cyberluddite
Reviews.Content: This was probably my 4th or 5th stay at the Grand Hyatt New York, and as always, it was a pleasant stay. What started out as a potential problem turned into a nice benefit: Upon arrival at about 9:30 pm, I was told that there had been some staffing problems and unanticipated demand, and that my room was not yet ready for occupancy. Before I could object, the check-in clerk asked if I had eaten dinner yet, and when she learned I hadn't, she offered to provide me dinner at the hotel's expense in the hotel restaurant, and handed me a $100 hotel voucher to be used in the restaurant--or anywhere else in the hotel. I had a nice dinner and including food and wine the tab actually came to a little over $100, plus the tip, and the hotel picked up the whole tab, including the tip. After dinner, my room was ready. As always, it was a nice room--very clean, nice modern styling, comfortable bedding, and quite spacious by Manhattan standards. To say the hotel is "centrally located" is an understatement--it's located right on top of Grand Central Station, and you can enter the station without even going outside if you want. Every sort of store, restaurant, and service you could want can be found within a block or two. Despite the location, the rooms are very quiet, even those that are on the lower floors. The sound insulation must be top-quality. Prices at the hotel are generally on the high side, but there are plenty of available discounts and deals on the hotel website, so depending on the day of the week and time of year you're staying, you can actually get a very nice price. Every stay I've had at this hotel has been pleasant, and this one was no exception.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly disappointing for a Grand Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: Will58
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hyatt for a week of business meetings and I was terribly disappointed. For a Grand Hyatt, the service was below standard - reception did not greet me upon arrival, two agents were talking to each other and it took a third (who was with a guest) to signal to them that they should check me in. I asked for a newspaper to be delivered but was told that I could not receive the New York Times. This was rectified when I went to the front desk to complain. I made a complaint about my phone being full of static but no one ever fixed it, even after two calls to housekeeping. I gave up. Laundry bags were not replaced after use and when I called to have another one delivered it never showed-up. After all of this, the hotel charges for delivery of packages to your room - a "mail room charge". I've stayed at many hotels and never been charged for receiving a package. It wasn't an elephant that I had delivered, but several small boxes. In terms of food, the lobby market cafe is a nice touch. Food was reasonably priced. However, don't get the room service. I asked for oatmeal in the morning and got a relatively cold, plain bowl. The description in the menu said that it comes with "fruits" but all that I got were some raisins, butter and sugar! On the more positive side, I had a renovated room which was nice, and the bed was comfortable. Also, when I checked-out, I told my story to the agent who was very apologetic and took notes of everything and reversed the mail delivery fee. I wish I had seen more of that while at the hotel. There are many better hotels in New York. The sister Andaz properties of the Hyatt are infinitely better - especially the Wall Street branch.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: sweetie1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel very well located,very nice hotel, staff very helpful and friendly. We were there in our honeymoon and get us champagne and strawberries..mmmm.. for sure a really nice hotel to stay. We would like to go back next year to celebrate our first year married and if we do we will book this hotel again!Thanks very much !!! I love NY and people are really friendly!just love it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and beautiful accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Josie1985
Reviews.Content: I was so glad to stay here the last night I was in New York. Best location, right next to Grand Central Station and only a 5 min walk to Times Square. The front desk staff were very nice and helpful. When I checked in they asked me if I wanted a smoking room which was very accommodating of them. The room was gorgeous and spacy. Nice decor and bathroom was trendy. I had a nice view of the street below. I would stay here again,probably my first choice if I am in NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: ExHyattMember
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not worth the money at all. The window blinds didn't work and so I was exposed to the city lights all night and couldn't get a good night's sleep. The TV remote also didn't work and there were bugs in the bathroom. When I called for service, they forgot about me altogether and I had to call a second time. There is no shortage of hotels in NYC and for the same money you can do much better!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: GAZBOW
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt last October for three nights as part of my birthday gift from my wife. Flew into Newark airport, caught the bus to New york and fortunately the last stop was a block away from the hotel (5 minutes walk) As a four star hotel, it certainly beats the Marriot Marquis (TImes Square) for comfort and hospitality. The rooms are very clean and ideal size for 2 with 2 sets of luggage.The bathroom is a good size, and there is adequate wardrobe space. My wife had mentioned a the desk at check in that it was my birthday, low and behold that that evening found a bottle of red wine, cheese and crackers on the table courtesy of the hotel! - Nice touch. . There is a nice 'Market' located in the lobby to purchase tea/coffee, hot meals, sandwiches, beer and wine. It's open 24 hours and does breakfasts,lunches, dinners and snacks. - We used the Market for breakfast , getting fresh fruit, yogurt, Danish and tea. The quality was good - no complaints. As mentioned, well located for airport bus stop, also sited right next door to Central Railway station (subway ), 5th Avenue, Times Square etc. . Local restaurants and many and varied for most palates There is a stand alone computer in the lobby linked to flight information/Airlines where you can print boarding pass etc for your flight.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sotirakisrules
Reviews.Content: great hotel, top location, very clean and safe. the stuff is very helpfull and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Vikki03
Reviews.Content: I went to newyork with my Dad for my 21st, November last year. We only had one problem whilst we was there which was that the locker was broke, service was okay... however they didnt have the availability for us to move rooms and maintenance were unable to come out to fix it. We used a safety deposit box free of charge for the rest of the holiday which was absolutley fine. Staff were pleasant... Location = AMAZING. Hotel is a terminal to grand central so getting the tube was easy. We basically walked everywhere... seeing the sights ect.... amazing!! Would stay here again!! we was told before we went that you could here lots outside so wouldnt be able to sleep!! i found it very peaceful to sleep... :-) definatly recommend this hotel and would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Location -”
Reviews.Author: AmigoJuan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt 4 nights (5/27 to 31). Nice hotel - excellent location; however, maid service was spotty. Floor not vacuumed first day; wash cloths not left second day; only two glasses provided and, a rather strange room (1843) configuration. Still, not a bad experience. There is a $9.99/day charge for WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: martinc1973
Reviews.Content: First impressions were the hotel looked amazing however that changed pretty quickly. We were told first that we didn't have a room with 2 queens but would be able to get a roll away bed for the first night and I asked why to be told the hotel was busy and even though we had booked 6 months in advance we were told that because we had booked with a third party (Expedia) there was nothing available for night 1. We accepted this due to having a long flight from the UK. On night 2 we had to eventually ask for the new room as the hotel weren't forthcoming with info. We were given a new room and i'm certain the beds were doubles and not queens as booked but I let this go. On the whole once setteled the hotel expierence was no more than ok but felt let down by the hotel aas it appeared that direct bookings had preference to 3rd party bookings even though Expedia are one of the largest tourist operators around. Would I stay here again? Probably but only if it was the cheapest option available as the service offered was not what I would expect of a large New York hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You can't believe this is a Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Jeffinbeijing
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in the hotel for our honeymoon trip. The hotel was in renovation and the entire experience couldn't reflect the shining Hyatt logo hanging outside the building. The receptionist only said 3 sentences in the entire check-in process, name, credit card and 'this is your room key, restaurant.....'. We couldn't feel any welcome and I am sure the Honeymoon was indicated in the system. We didn't expect more but a 'Congratulations'. The welcome letter was printed at the time of check-in which I doubt should be prepared in advance. The room was terrible. we were arranged a room which was really far away from the elevator, you need to walk '5 minute' to get to your room door. After entering the room, you could expect the disappointment. There was no minibar in the room. The smoke detector was falling on the wall, the electronic panel at the back of the TV was out of the place. The room was increditily small with a dusty air vent behind the bed side lamp which is hardly to find the switch of it. Other than that, the concierge seems tired and when asking a question, there was not enough information provided with his long face. At the main entrance, I realized that I didn't have match for my cigarrette. So I asked the doorman for it, interesting thing is the doorman asked me for a spare cigarrete as a give back. The server in the bar was very nice and we enjoyed the pizza and drinks there. She was warm and sincere and always came to ask how was the dinner etc. The location is definitely awesome, next to the Grand central, walking distance to the time square and standing around the office buildings. This maybe the explanation of poor service the hotel provided but it was still alive.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - all the hustle and bustle of New York - brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: bassettallsort
Reviews.Content: Just a five minute walk from Time Square, 10 minutes from the UN HQ and slap bang on top of Grand Central - this hotel was awesome! We stayed there on our honeymoon. On check in when the staff realised we were honeymooning, we were made a real fuss of. An upgraded room, overlooking 42nd Street and the entrance to the Station, champagne, fruit and chocolates in the room as well as a card from the Manager to congratulate us. The concierge was fantastic, sorting us out some very good seats to the Lion King on Broadway and also pointing out little hidden restaurants and shops to visit that most tourists miss. He also helped us book our onward coach to Washington DC. This was done with the minimal of fuss and very quickly. The porters were excellent and nothing was ever too much trouble. The bedroom was simple, but very clean, with very good quality bedding. Although we didn't use the room service (we wanted to try as many restaurants as possible) the menu was very varied and considering normal 'city prices' I thought was good value for money. There was a newly opened 24 hour cafe in the lobby, which did the best coffee (well it should, being New York!) and the staff there were very friendly. The bar was a bit expensive, but the quality of the decoration, the range of drinks and the ambience of the place more than made up for that. I can see why this hotel might not be everybody's cup-of-tea. It is very busy, very big and very brash - very American I suppose. That being said I loved it and next time I return to New York, without a doubt I'm staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and central to everything.”
Reviews.Author: wkr011
Reviews.Content: A great hotel and staff very courteous and the initial room was not satisfactory and they changed our room no problems. We were on 28th floor overlooking 42nd St and view was fantastic. The hotel is old but undergoing a facelift. We were not inconvenienced by any noise from building works and overall could not fault the hotel. Rooms were very neat and clean and beds very comfortable.The position is excellent as within walking distance to heaps of places and next door to the station is great when you don't feel like walking to far. Breakfast not included but in NY it's better to go out and find a favourite diner. We stayed 1 week in NY and would love to visit again and stay at same hotel. Easy walk to restaurants and theatres, and the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Pick a different hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleH80
Reviews.Content: There were pros and cons of this hotel, but overall, I was dissapointed with the quality of the hotel and its management. I was apparently lucky enough to have a refurbished king bedroom, but I thought it was the older model because the wallpaper was already peeling off and the ipod dock was broken. There was no coffee or complimentary bottles of water in the room. Another reviewer wrote not to forget to ask for complimentary coffee and water from the cafe in the lobby...but I never knew to ask in the first place, so I paid for mine. The main issue we experienced was that there were hundreds of teenagers staying at the hotel for the duration of our 4 nights in NYC. They were running up and down the halls, yelling to each other, and slamming the doors from 10 pm - 4 am. The last night of our stay, patience gone, we called guest services to explain the situation and asked for someone to address the other guests. A manager came up to speak with the teens, but never followed up to make sure that they stayed quiet (they did NOT), nor did anyone follow up with us to check on the status of the issue or appologize. If I were managing the hotel, I would have made sure to monitor the noise level at night on each floor. I mean, there were hundreds of teens staying at the hotel, sharing rooms! It would have only taken quick walk-throughs every so often to make sure things weren't out of control while the teens were in lodging. Instead, I paid over $1200 to stay at a hotel between business meetings...and felt like I was staying in a dorm room or hostile. The food at the hotel was also ridiculously expensive. If anyone has ever been to Seoul, I can only equate their food prices to there...which is the most expensive city (food-wise) that I've been to. If you eat at the hotel, you'll pay at least 2x, if not 3x what you'll pay on average in Manhattan. TIme for the positives! The bed was soft and comfortable. I was able to turn the lights off from bed...but only one of the 3 buttons worked. The shower head was large and the water pressure was good. The absolute best part was the location. Excellent location. I'd recommend picking a different hotel close by! Manhattan is AMAZING with tons of options for lodging...I am sure one of them is managed a bit better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central location right on Grand Central Station”
Reviews.Author: JillGreenfield
Reviews.Content: Service experienced - excellent. View from room was ok - but we were not paying top rate and were an easy walk to all the main attractions. Spotlessly clean and no bed bugs; this was my one worry before staying in New York. Liked the friendly, helpful staff who went out of their way to ensure we got all the tourist information we needed. Liked the location of the hotel the best. Didnt really have any dislikes.

Reviews.Title: “A dump. Avoid”
Reviews.Author: korokoro
Reviews.Content: One of those hotels that should be ripped down and started again, rather than undergoing a (noisy) refurbishment. The location is superb right next to Grand Central, but the grandeur of the station only underscores the draft, down-at-heel and plain scruffiness of the hotel. I had one of the so-called "upgraded" rooms - trendy with a bewildering array of lighting options, but it felt smaller than it was, and the corridors look drab even in their new garb. Also it is not good customer service to poke a note under the door at 2am telling me that my water was going to be cut off from 10am to 4pm the next day and hoping (ha!) that it would not disrupt my plans.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, central, they aim to please”
Reviews.Author: BobHLeverett
Reviews.Content: The high points of this hotel are (1) the convenient location, right at Grand Central Station, (2) the friendly and helpful staff, and (3) the comfortable beds. This was a business trip with use of some of the meeting rooms. When you check in, but sure to remember to ask for their vouchers for a free coffee or bottle of water in their little lobby market. Reception was efficient, and we were offered on of the newly renovated rooms with a king. It was adequately spacious and the bed was very comfortable. I had stayed for a few nights two months previously and found the same comfort level with the bed. Room lights are controlled by several touch switched and these worked rather will. It is nice to be able to kill the lights from the bed. We did have trouble with the bathroom light on our third day - we could not get it to go on no matter which switch combination was chosen. The shower head is a large (about 8 inches by 8 inches) with a lot of holes and it send you a nice blanket of water streams. Elevators are fast and there are two banks that overlap on the 24th floor. We never waited longer than a couple of minutes. We used two meeting rooms and found them to have very good climate control, good comfortable chairs and nice lighting. What they do not have is WiFi (apparently this can be had for an absurd fee), and the cell service (at least in the room we had) is marginal at best. Hotels will likely add free WiFi in the future as more and more people demand it and are unwilling to pay a lot extra for it. The food we had ordered for breakfasts and lunches was quite good, actually unusually good for a hotel. There is a restaurant adjacent to the lobby for breakfast and two days I ate there. The service is not fast, but adequate. The prices here are over the top and many folks no doubt hit the street and find something a lot cheaper. We had two eggs, with toast and a small side, juice and coffee and the price was something like $46. Welcome to New York. But, that said, an extra glass of juice (very good) was offered, and the coffee kept coming. And, instead of what is effectively hash browns, I was allowed to substitute. I substituted roasted mushrooms, which were plentiful and simply superb. A very fine and wonderful strawberry jam (no seeds) is served for the toast. The same area is open for drinks and the wines by the glass that we had before heading out to dinner represent a good selection. Probably pricey, but I did not cover that tab so I don't know for sure. All in all, given the location and the comfort level, we like this place and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but be wary of transportation.”
Reviews.Author: LeePulaski_Va_
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hyatt for two days for business. The room was perfectly adequate. The location was superb. Grand Central station is next door. I walked to the Empire State Building, the NY Public Library and Bryant Park, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Central park, and the UN building. Times Square is an easy walk down 42nd street. I have two reservations: 1. The business center requires a credit card to access a computer. I simply wanted to check my email, but I was unwilling to pay for it. I think that is somewhat ridiculous. You can print your boarding pass for free. 2. I took the bus from Laguardia to the Hyatt.( stops on 43rd Street) That was easy and cheap. When I was leaving NY I was short on time and decided to take a cab. The bellhop pushed me into a "hotel car." I ended up paying $60. This was primarily my fault for being such a hayseed. The driver barely spoke english and wanted to barter with me over the price. I got scalped, but I am sure more wordly travelers would not experience this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: blondeegal
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice 10 day stay at this Hyatt. The room was larger than we are used to in New York City, and the bed was very comfortable. Would definitely stay here again if given the great rate we were offered when we made the reservation. My only problem was the WIFI. I found there was a daily charge for this service once we were checked in. My own fault, I just assumed the WIFI mentioned in the room description was free. Convenient location if you are using the Subway or Train (we did both!), since the hotel is located right on top of Grand Central Terminal-a must see destination on it's own! Located just a couple of blocks from Bryant Park, Times Square, United Nations, the East River and more. We even walked to Central Park! Since there are so many things to see on the way, you don't realize how tired you are until you get back and have to nurse all the blisters you acquired! We had a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel, Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy1980_11
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights from Apr 20th. Had the most amzing stay and couldn't complain about anything. We were given a renovated room on the 19th floor (1938). As it was my first trip to New York I was prepared for a small room but was pleasantly surprised apon check in, the space and decor were fabulous and the wardrobe and bathroom also exceeded my expectations. We didn't dine in the hotel as we were busy sightseeing every evening but did have drinks in the bar. The staff were all so friendly and helpfull, particularly Anya, one of the hostess's. Overall, all the staff and concierge's we dealt with were efficient and friendly. The location is unbeatable, a 10 minute stroll to Times Square and attached to Grand Central for subway routes all over the city. I would definitly recommend this hotel and will return on my next visit to N.Y!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay at the Grand Hyatt...”
Reviews.Author: mds75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 8 nights this April, here's our experience of the hotel: The check-in procedure was fast and very friendly. We were allocated a room on the 23rd floor, a refurbished room looking out towards 42nd Street and the hotel entrance. The decor was fresh and vibrant with some attractive modern furniture and a very large comfortable bed. We had no complaints about the size of the room whatsoever, infact we found it to be quite spacious overall. The room offered some nice faciltiies such as a fridge and a good quality iPod/iPhone dock. We had no problems with the functioning or performance of the air conditioning and the room had an opening window. We had no issues with noise either outside or inside the hotel. With the window closed, other than the occasional siren, noise levels were completely acceptable given this hotel is in the middle of New York city and throughout our 8 nights, we slept soundly! We did encounter one or two dusty surfaces (shelves above the suitcase storage area) and my wife would have liked an additional mirror somewhere in the room where it's easier to use the hairdryer and apply make-up. We loved the Marketplace shop in the foyer, this was so useful and quite well priced. We used it a few times to grab a quick breakfast before heading out sightseeing. You can also buy a wide range of soft and alcoholic drinks, coffees, good quality snacks and confectionery, there's a great range of cakes and pastries and some hot food available too. We ate breakfast in the restaurant on our first morning where we had great service and wonderful eggs benedict! We also frequented the bar one or two times which was very nice with great views along 42nd Street. The location of the hotel is first class, away from the hussle of Times Square with easy access on foot to many of the attractions we wanted to see. And of course, Grand Central terminal right next door for attractions further afield. There was some refurbishment work going on in the already plush foyer, the space is already so large you'd hardly notice it! A nice feature next to the concierge desk was a PC allowing access to airline websites for online check-in and a laser printer to print your boarding pass. There was no charge to use this service. Outwith the hotel, across the street Pershing Square offered good breakfasts and dinner and there's an airport shuttle bus service right next door to it. We will definitely be back in New York city and we'd definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: katiefrancis
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue, we stayed here for 10 nights in January and loved every day of our stay. Room was finished to a very high standard. Located right next to Grand Central Station, but the room was so so quiet with a huge queen sized bed - meant we slept so well. Also the fastest elevator I have ever been in! Not much else to say, just loved staying here - spent most of our day out and about in the amazing NYC, but the hotel was lovely to come back to on a night, room was lovely and proximity to Grand Central - a HUGE bonus (the foodhall came in handy!).

Reviews.Title: “loud loud loud...”
Reviews.Author: ZaiZaiLv
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Grand Hyatt New York. First time was in year 2000. I was too young and to naive to complain about anything. Since I'm neither now, it's time to review. Likes: - Location location location: right next to Grand central Station. Very convenient. - While I normally am not a fan of Hotel bar, we ended up checking out the Hotel bar here after a flight from hell we encountered earlier. Amazing desserts!!!! Pricey, but what hotel is not charging you premium prices? - We got the newly redesigned room on the upper floor. The room, while tiny (typical NYC hotel size) is pretty. Normally not a huge fan of red walls, but it works quite nicely here. - A nice "welcome" drinks and fruits delivered to our room was a nice touch. Not sure if they do this for everyone, but I'm a Hyatt member, so perhaps that had something to do with it. - Comfy beds! Had a hard time dragging cousin out of bed in the morning. - Walk-in closet. Seriously! Not huge, but still, a walk-in closet in a tiny hotel room in NYC. Dislikes: - Construction construction construction. We didn't know about this when we made RSVP. Funny, we called in our RSVP. You would think they would inform us about this fact. They start so early and they end so late (or did they even end at all since I heard them in the middle of the night too?). Our room is on Floor 23, and we could hear the drilling. Is that even possible? Not to mention the dust.. gross! dust everywhere... - Our room was really really dusty. We were there for 5 nights and it got worse everyday. They came and cleaned our room but why didn't they dust it? Gross.. - This one is weird, but I absolutely detested the toilet. It's one of those toilets that you normally see in public restroom. There's no way to flush the darn thing without closing the top off. They spent all the money redesigning the room and bathroom, which is nice and all, they skimped on the toilet? For reals? - I guess this really isn't the hotel's fault, but I'm going to mention this incident and probably add thin walls under my cons list too. We were the lucky people who ended up with a neighbor from hell. For the last 3 nights, we ended up having to share the floor and the walls obviously with some weird dude. First night, around 1 AM, we were awoken by screaming match between him and some girl. The second night, at 3 AM, we were awaken by a drunken outburst; from the peephole, we saw him being escorted to his room by security people. Seriously, how much did you have to drink to have to be escorted back to your room? It's not Vegas, people! Third night, it was raining, so we stayed in our room instead of roaming round the NY street. We heard noises right in front of our door. We peeped and guess what we saw, our wonderful neighbor was leaving his food tray in front of our door. Seriously dude? Why can't you just leave it in front of YOUR door? It's your trash. Okay, maybe I was just PMSing but I was really annoyed and waited till he went back to his room and pushed it back to his door. Cousin and the Mr. were worried I was going to get caught and start a major fight, but I can move like a ninja, so he didn't hear me :) - no free WiFi. Seriously, Hyatt, when are you going to stop being stingy and give us the free WiFi already? You're supposed to be a business hotel. It'd be nice to be able to do business while staying in your hotel without having to be penalized for it (aka having to pay for WiFi). Thank God for the Mr's Adroid phone, he is a Hot Spot lol.. we were able to use the internet without having to pay for it. Overall, it was an OK stay, but for the price, you could probably find a better hotel with a better service and hopefully better neighbors. Another cousin was in town for pWc event at the same time, and stayed at the 70 Park Avenue at Kimpton. Loved the hotel and wish we had chosen that instead. It's worth mentioning that since we didn't pay a dime for our stay (thank you Hyatt points), I'm a bit generous on my 3 star rating. But if we had to pay the regular price, I would probably not be as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to all tourist sites and shopping”
Reviews.Author: wac01
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a very good friend of mine we had two double beds on the 22nd floor very clean and shower good no complaints. We found the staff very courtious and helpful although our husbands had arranged for flowers and champagne for us on arrival and was not recieved until two days later the staff were very apologetic. Our stay was lovely and wouldn't hesitate to come back you can walk to all major sites easily, take the bus tour for one day only to get off for the trip to liberty island the rest can be done by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; good amenities; OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: skohn
Reviews.Content: I traveled here for one night for a conference being held in the hotel. I booked at the conference rate so it was a better value. The lobby, staff and room decor all seemed to be hip and updated; but then when you actually starting using anything you could tell all the upgrades were just cosmetic. The bathroom was terrible. Tiny sink, dark shower, and no place to put your stuff. As with a lot of hotels in NYC, the building next door was feet away so you could look right into offices. (Be sure to keep your shades closed!) Overall it was pretty dark, but fine for a night stay when traveling for business. WiFi in room = $9.95. Fitness center pretty well equipped and at top of building so nice light. The lobby area of the hotel has a great little market/convenience store for sandwiches, gourmet popcorn, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Bart555_10
Reviews.Content: Very good location, right next to grand central station and the chrysler building. very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: ColoMoon
Reviews.Content: Several improvements are being made to this hotel..the lobby , rooms, eating areas...etc...so you may see some constructions through July I am told. I stayed in one of the renovated rooms, with the new decor and furnishings. The rooms are much more functions with access to at least 10 electrical outlets, and inputs into the TV. Speaking of the TV, there are flat screens, but now HD channels. The beds are extremely comfortable, great pillows too.There is also now a small refrigerator in the room as well. As with other stay in this hotel, the bathrooms are very small, barely enough room for one person to maneuver in (something that really cant be fixed)..more shelve space than the past but it blocks access to the sink, in order to rinse my face after shaving I had to get back in the shower...crazy stuff...The drawers in the cabinet are very small, and there is no suitcase rack that will fit a larger suitcase, so I had to use the desk chair. The couch in the new sitting area is uncomfortable, more for looks I guess I would gladly stay here in the future and expect to in late June, hopefully I dont get a room below a floor being renovated as that woke me up each morning at 7am or earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bluewoody50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 2 nights before going on a cruise out of Bayonne, New Jersey. We upgraded to the Hyatt as part of our holiday package. Ours was a very good experience. Although a very large hotel, check in was quick and very polite. Our room was on the 13 floor. The room had been recently refurbished to a very good standard and to us, coming from the UK, seemed a very good size. The room was very clean. The impression was that there weren't large numbers of guests around and the hotel was quiet. The foyer area is particularly impressive although some of it was being refurbished. The fact that Grand Central is immediately adjacent makes this a great location (we made our own arrangements for drinks snacks in the food hall on the lower concourse of Grand Central for inexpensive snacks / light meals). Times Square is about 15 minutes walk. We certainly would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...will be very nice once renovations are done”
Reviews.Author: nytraveling49
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing a major renovation. I would ask to stay in a renovated room...as I did. They were nicely appointed. Hotel lobby is very nice. There was a very noticable yellow stain on my shower curtain, which was a bit disgusting. I was surprised housekeeping would not change the shower curtain out, considering how noticeable it is.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: lcorcor
Reviews.Content: Have recently returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. There are currenlty building works going on so the outside apperance is not great however the entrance lobby is impressive. The room was an ok size, same with the bathroom; both were very clean & tidy & the bed was very comfortable. We had no view from our room which was disappointing & ladies be aware the lighting is not the best for applying make up, all too soft. The service we received was good, very polite & professional. Maybe a little overpriced but if you get a deal here then worthwhile. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Time at Grand Hyatt NYC”
Reviews.Author: Jamiexyz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in New York and stayed at the Grand Hyatt. Loved it! Everyone was so helpful and friendly. Our room was lovely and so comfortable, updated and NO BEDBUGS. It has everything you could want and is a great location in Midtown. We stayed on the Club Floor which was great as well as the elevator doors only open with your room key. Book in advance for a great rate and let the Hyatt pamper you!!

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: PJW22
Reviews.Content: The overall impression is that the hotel is tired. My room was no more than adequate and the bathroom small with a poor shower which is unusual in the States. I waited at lest 10 minutes to check in and the queue was grew much longer behind me. The dining options are very limited. Sound insulation between the rooms is poor. The location is good and the staff positive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Superfriendly Staff - Great Grand Club”
