Reviews.Author: travelmuc309
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a week in March for vacation. The staff was exceptional from check-in (room was ready at 3) to check-out. Whenever there was a question you got a reliable answer. Stay in one of the Grand Club Rooms - we were very lucky to receive a large corner room. Access to the Grand Club is really worth it, makes you feel as if you were staying in a nice small (boutique) hotel: Very nice breakfast on the same floor, coffee, tea etc. all day and cookies and appetizers in the evening. Not to forget the very friendly Grand Club-concierge (thanks Chris) and -staff (was it Mario?), going out of their way to make sure I got a special cheese every day for breakfast. Also thank you Silvia Z.! Mailroom in the hotel is a great service - no need to go to the post office. The other reviews have already mentioned the great location (both for walking and taking the subway, we always buy the subway weekly pass). The room was quiet and very clean (the only minor note - they sometimes use a bit too much airrefresher spray), great bed and the AAA-Rate was more than fair.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sunnyssr
Reviews.Content: We visited NYC for my son's birthday. This was a great Hyatt to stay at. It's the only one right in the city, and its location is perfect: right beside Grand Central, a few blocks from Times Square, Rockefeller Ctr, and all sorts of shops and restaurants. We had an easy time at check-in and check-out, and the staff was super-friendly. The concierge has maps of the local area that includes popular things to do/see. They also have a list of restaurants, but if you're looking for kid-friendly meals, do your own research; their list doesn't include kid-friendly options. We looked at the hotel's restaurant, but it wasn't for us, so we got room service instead, which was quick and tasty. Our room was clean, and we slept well. The hotel has a fitness room, but we didn't check it out; we were too tired from all the sightseeing while we were there. The Grand also has Regency club, which you pay extra for, but it's well worth it, especially when you have kids. We really liked this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone with a negative comment. You are wrong!”
Reviews.Author: ctsrealtor
Reviews.Content: I had the most positive experience. I just returned home after 3 nights on business. I was upgraded to a suite when I arrived, the bartenders remember your name every night and treat you like family. I left a bottle of wine in the cab, when I asked the concierge where a wine whop was, she sent a free bottle of wine to the room and told me to go relax. I was in AWE of the staff at this hotel. I HAVE NEVER, in all of my travels been treated so well. Marriott, Hilton, Inter Continental, you name it, I've been there. This Hyatt is TOP NOTCH. If you are a seasoned business traveler, this hotel makes your stay, a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “A bad experience!”
Reviews.Author: ChatVoyageur
Reviews.Content: Twice a year I travel to NYC, and for my 2 nights trip I decided to make a reservation at the Grand Hyatt Hotel The room was OK, good size, comfy bed but the bathroom was tiny and the shower curtain was so dark that when you were in the bathtube there was no light inside! The first night was terrible, I could hear what was going on in the next room, and I hardly slept! The big hall was always full of people who weren't hotel guest, resting and having lunch. Moreover I saw people prowling around the corridors as there was no security on the access to elevators. Overall, I think this hotel is acceptable and the location is great, but it just worth it if you get a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel -- Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Silvia6
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt basically is an average, convention-style hotel centrally located in the center of Manhattan. The best thing about the hotel is that it has a mini-market in the lobby, with very good food options, that is open 24 hours a day, which is very convenient if you want something quick to eat or a late night snack. The worst part about the hotel is customer service. It is abyssmal. It takes FOREVER if you order room service. And if you arrive late in the evening to check in, it often takes FOREVER to get a room--provided that the hotel has not given away your room notwithstanding the fact that you had a confirmed reservation which is what happened to me during my last stay. Because no rooms were available when I arrived at 11:45 p.m., the hotel gave me a parlor room used for wedding parties that had a coach with a pull out bed. (I'm serious.) I later got a so-called apology letter in which the Grand Hyatt's business travel sales manager admitted that "on occasion things like this take place." Next time I'm staying at the Intercontinental or Fitzpatrick, which are far nicer hotels in the same general area.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY, NOISY - Felt like a Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: mzimm
Reviews.Content: I had a room on the 16th floor, walked in and my room looked and felt dirty. Stains on lamp shades, bathroom smelled of smoke, the chair smelled of urine, and there was a big brown/red stain right above my head on the headboard. I called to complain, and nothing was done, no room change, no cleaning. I requested a fan to get the nasty air circulating. They delievered a fan that DIDN'T EVEN WORK! I turned on the TV and it didn't work (Had to call them again), then, about 20 minutes into channel surfing my remote dies, had to call them again. I have a lovely wake up call at 6am with a hammer pounding in the room above/next to me. I call yet AGAIN to complain and they say, Sorry sir, we are remodeling! YOU ARE STILL a HOTEL where people come to SLEEP first and foremost! Do your remodeling between business hours! 9am-6pm. What the hell!?! Then we are heading up to Connecticut for meetings and want have the bell hop hold our bags. Which I am more than willing to tip for, but he demands (as per hotel policy) a $2 a bag payment for bag storage. So after spending two HORRIBLE nights at the "Grand" Hyatt for over $300 a night, I can't even have the staff look over my bags for 4 hours without being Nickled & Dimed! This was truly the worst experience I've had at a hotel in NY. I travel there often and will never stay at the "Grand" Hyatt ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, great room & great value.”
Reviews.Author: Jasonohr1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in February for 1 night. The hotel in located next to Grand Central station and is in walking distance to many of the Mid Town attractions. The hotel is currently being renovated which did not affect our stay in anyway. The main reception is vast, but dated with brown marble, waterfalls and gold colums (which seems to be reflected in many building throughout Manhatten). The receptionist(s) were extremely friendly and welcoming. On the morning of check out I requested an extension and it was agreed with a smile, no questions asked. Our room was on the 25th floor and had been renovated. It was extremely clean, well presented and a great size. It was our Weddding Anniversary, so the hotel kindly left us a bottle of sparkling wine and strawberries dipped in chocolate. It was a nice touch and very welcomed. It has been mentioned on tripadvisor before that the rooms do have a lack of tea & coffee facilities. which is a shame, but there is a rather pricey coffee shop downstairs in the lobby that serves fresh food and hot drinks. All in all, I would fully recomended the Grand Hyatt New York......look past the dated areas as they are being renovated.....if you want a centrally located hotel, which is good value.....then look no further.

Reviews.Title: “great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAussieFamily4
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to NY we were after a good hotel centally located in Manhattan. I had read reveiws on trip advisor and my experience was consistent with the majority. Room-good size for 4, walk in wardrobe good place to store luggage. Bathrooms -small but clean,shower nice and hot with good pressure. A/C - good and responsive allthough condensation formed on window. Window was able to be opened Great Location-on downtown subway and short walk to Time Square, 5th ave , Central Park and St Patricks Cathedral. Short cab ride $ 10 to the Natural History Museam

Reviews.Title: “great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: pdaly05
Reviews.Content: first trip to new york and got a good deal for staying here, there were renovations going on at the time but we didnt hear or see anything. Staff were very friendly,room was lovely and spacious, we were upgraded to a junior suite a check in. hotel bar very expensive but only went there once. very good location walking distance to everywhere if you dont mind walking. very comfortable and clean

Reviews.Title: “Great location, impressive customer service”
Reviews.Author: EnglishBlondCat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a standard double room with two of my girly mates in late Feb 2011. NY followed crazy 4 days in Vegas so we were looking for a little R&R and a chance to catch up with some friends in our fave city. Booked through Asda travel, around £150 per night in total which we thought was pretty reasonable for 3 people midweek. We were allocated a room on the 25th floor. First with the positives: - Room very clean - Considering this was a standard double, I actually thought the main room was not a bad size for NYC (remember we had 3 adult women sharing). We had enough space for three large suitcases on the floor without killing ourselves walking about the room. Bathroom small but perfectly formed. - Hotel in middle of refurb and we were on a brand new floor. I thought it looked great and lots of nice decorations in the hallway. This did lead to our only complaint though (see below). - The one complaint we did make (see below regarding the refurb noise), was dealt with superbly - immediate unqualified apology and $100 comp'd to our room to spend on dinner. Nice touch and although the issue we had was very annoying - it was enough to help us forget about it and get on with the holiday. - Hotel is in a really great location. 10min walk to Times Square, right next door to Grand Central, and fab delhis on Lex. Really couldn't hear much noise from outside. - 5 Mins tops to check in and out and only a short wait to leave our luggage with the bell desk on our last day ($2 per bag charge) - Liked the buzzy feel in the very grand lobby - makes you feel like you're really in the thick of it which I think people look for in NYC. - Fab service in the restuarant at dinner - very attentive red head who was charming and provided fautless service - Nice view from 25th floor Now with the not so good: - Only one restaurant in the hotel and the food was VERY rich (a little too much for our pallette). I'm sure when I stayed here before there was more choice and a cocktail bar ? - Mattresses were so soft that two of us had bad backs in the morning. Our other friend who is the only one to sleep on her side had no problem. Guess bed firmness a very personal preference and dependent on the way you sleep! - Refurb work was being done on the 26th floor immediately above us. We were woken up on our first day at 7am and honestly thought someone was about to come through the floor. Sounded like very loud dragging sound and very noisy banging. It was continuous so we couldn't go back to sleep after 7am :-( Exactly the same on morning 2 and we'd had enough. I phoned the front desk and as I mentioned above - they offered what I considered fair compensation and if we insisted I think they would also have moved us. We said don't worry as we had to get up early on the last day anyway and were more than happy with the way they handled it. I really thought the service in the Grand Hyatt was great - I think that says so much more about a hotel than the official star rating. Have stayed here a few times now and would definitely go back - no question.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Don5617
Reviews.Content: A wonderful location and good-sized rooms made this hotel stay memorable. Make the best of the location by not driving - use the subway and the cross-town buses. Some good bars and restaurants in the vicinity, plus the magnificent market inside Grand Central Terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: 41Falcon
Reviews.Content: Exactly what we were lookign for. Location via subway was great to see all the sites. Best vacation yet.

Reviews.Title: “Made our holiday loved new York city and the hotel was a prefect base”
Reviews.Author: Dencroft
Reviews.Content: We are a family from the uk, and have just returned from new York. The hotel was amazing, in such a fantastic location! The staff were very helpful and friendly towards us. We got upgraded to the 24th floor (2451) our room had 2 double beds and a wonderful view over grand central station and met life. The room was modern, clean and the shower room was small but modern and clean. We were surprised with a lovely birthday cake, bottle of bubbly and soda for the kids! So kind of the hotel to spoil us! (my husband and I were celebrating our 40th and our son turned 13 while in NYC) The location of the hotel was spot on, could get to Times Square and Empire State and Rockerfella by walking in 10mins and the subway was easy to use. We ate breakfast at the Pershing Square (under the bridge) every morning, fantastic food and great people watching! We used the hotel bar, wonderful views at night down 42nd and staff very attentive. We thought this hotel was definately geared up for business/ conference meetings, didn't seem to be too many holiday makers. If we were to return to NYC we would definately return to this hotel it was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “hilton newyork - meets its standard expectations”
Reviews.Author: nitz032003
Reviews.Content: this was the only overseas trip i had to take in the year 2010. newyork has many hotels which gives you world class stay and comforts. but for now i totally recommend Hilton New york for travelers. it has its own class and standards. very happy customer of Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay..”
Reviews.Author: lisa2cars
Reviews.Content: Impressive lobby, efficient and friendly check in. Large room with a great bed and good size bath room. Views down 42nd street were great. Hotel location ideal for sights and access to subway via Grand Central terminal. Enjoyed a fantastic meal in hotel restaurant. Hotel currently undergoing refurbishment so can expect even better in the future. We found room service menu to be poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Run Down, No heat in room.”
Reviews.Author: sweetswededoc
Reviews.Content: The lobby is firmly ensconced in the 1980's. And it just gets worse when you go upstairs. This apparently was the first hotel that Donald Trump built back in the 80's and he was clearly working on a tight budget. The room was small, one of the tiniest I have ever stayed in, in NYC. The floor is covered with OLD and dirty indoor/outdoor carpeting. The bed had stained bedspread/pillows. The TV remote, of course did not work. The bathroom had the previous occupants hair in the tub (nice). And to make it extra comfy? NO HEAT. It reminded me of a combination half way house for heroin addicts/dorm room at a state college/nasty youth hostel. I do not think antone would be comfortable here.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: traveler24x7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in Mid-town with nice amenities. However, the rooms are very noisy. You can practically hear every conversation from the next room. When we stayed, we got a complain that we are loud, while we are just watching TV at normal audible range. At the same time we can hear a phone conversation from the next door Practically no sound proof. Bathroom door handle was found broken when we entered the room, which show a slack in maintainance. For the price, it is not worth it, even for Manhattan prices.

Reviews.Title: “not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: Riveroak
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night after arriving from California to NYC. The room was small; no view; arrived at 11 pm and all restaurants but take out already closed....staff sent us to another restaurant also closed...we walked for blocks to find something to eat. Staff not friendly or helpful. Often stay in other Grand Hyatts, like San Francisco, which are great...not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shopaholic1984
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Grand Hyatt in December 2010, and I have to say what a beautiful Hotel. The staff were extremely nice and so helpful. The lobby is very impressive, big and bright. We have two rooms on the 24th Floor with amazing views of Grand Central station. The rooms were very big with two double beds each, the bathroom is small but after all it's only a bathroom. The rooms are very clean, and the beds were comfy. There is a coffee shop in the lobby and they do an array of food and drink, it's a little bit pricey though. We also had dinner in the restaurant The Lounge, the food was great but It was very expensive, not too sure if it was worth it. Will definitely stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Building...”
Reviews.Author: Rob-AFCB
Reviews.Content: A very expensive Bed and Breakfast. The staff were a little abrupt at times. The rooms however were perfect...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing grand about the Grand Hyatt NYC”
Reviews.Author: Pabs_HK
Reviews.Content: The good: Friendly staff; speedy check-in and check-out; 24-hour gym; The bad: Noisy neighborhood, I've had better in Times Square; tiny bathrooms, I've seen better in some motels and lower classed hotels; no mini bar, never mind not having liquor but no water... The choice was to walk down the hallway and buy water via a vending machine... a vending machine!!! Not at all five star; room service menu was limited, and when I finally ordered something, it took 45 minutes to bring me the wrong item, it was replaced eventually but still....is room service really that busy; I was adjusting my body clock to the local time zone so i was sleeping in late, could not however because of the loud voices by the maid service, laughing and gossiping on the phone and with each other in the hallways; I choose this hotel thinking it was the Grand Hyatt brand, but I've had better product quality in lower star hotels, service apartments and some motels

Reviews.Title: “Bag Check Fee at a Grand Hyatt??”
Reviews.Author: linenhiker
Reviews.Content: Every experience at the hotel was fine, but we were appalled when the bell desk tried to charge us a $2 fee for holding bags for us for a few hours after we checked out. We've stayed in literally hundreds of hotels around the world, including many Hyatts, and ever encountered a fee for this basic service. Outrageous!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: bigbird01
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very central, easy walking distance to most things. Mix of business and leisure travellers. Nice lobby. Check-in was quick and easy, front desk staff were helpful and polite. Be aware that there the hotel is getting a major renovation just now. We stayed on floor 23 and could hear work being done during the day, not a major hassle but mild annoyance. In addition to room service the hotel has a "Market" downstairs, basically a shop with food and booze that you can buy and take to your room. Make sure you have your own corkscrew or bottle opener as there was none in the room and roomservice wanted $9 to deliver one for you to borrow. If you need anything else then the Grand Central food market is good and very close. Renovated rooms were quite nice, baisc rooms are decent but on the small side, also very small bathrooms. As the renovations are recent they seem to have forgot a few things, such as plugging the mini-bar fridge in and stocking it with booze etc. Slightly odd!! Generally all the staff were very polite and professional, with one exception. The doormen are idiots, they could not care about getting you a taxi!! They are more interested in getting their kickbacks from the towncar drivers who circle like vultures looking for an airport fare. Overall a good business hotel is a very convienent location, no pool though!!. Not one of the best Grand Hyatts I have stayed in but ok. Would not stay again, check out the Andaz hotel which is owned by same group. Good for breakfast or lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special for a five star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: montySydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I picked the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central station based on a stay at the Park Hyatt in Sydney Australia. The Sydney Park Hyatt is one of the world's great hotels. The Grand Hyatt NYC is not in the same league. I expected tea/coffee making facilities, a refrigerator and maybe a bottle opener in the room, but had to settle on trips to the shop in the foyer. This may be a matter of different cultures between the U.S. and other countries. The bed was good, the housekeeping passable , the room lighting too dim with underpowered eco light globes, and the position at Grand Central convenient. The rooms are so dimly lit that I can't blame the housekeepers hit and miss cleaning. It is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable lobby; disappointing in-room experience”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_Ballet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business for two nights in February. In general, the rooms were old and in desperate need of brightening and refurbishment, and the staff were uneven in terms of their friendliness (some were very nice and others, such as the concierge whom I asked for help with airport arrangements, were downright abrupt and surly.) The good: the T-Mobil hot-spot for in-hotel internet worked great; the bed was really comfortable; and the lobby was very pleasant for informal business meetings. The fitness center was fantastically well-equipped and even better than my gym at home. l sold good food. And, as others have commented, the location cannot be beat. The complaints: The heating unit in my room was broken (blowing cold air instead of hot, when it was 22 degrees outside), and it took three calls to housekeeping over a 12-hour period for it to be fixed (disclaimer: they did offer to move my room, but I was in between meetings and did not have time to re-pack, so I requested a repair instead). The room itself was dark, even with all the lights on (no overhead lighting). My toiletries were not replenished by housekeeping. Further, the rooms above mine were being refurbished, and the workman began at 7 am and continued through the day, which made working in my room difficult. I understand the hotel needs to refurbish their rooms, but I should have been advised at check-in that my room as close to those under repair, and I was not.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: radicalseven
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a meeting. Great location right next to Grand Central Station. It's a busy hotel which might explain , but not excuse, the inconsistent service levels. Reception staff showed close to zero interest. Rooms are ok but no mini bar or tea/coffee in my room which was a surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - perfect location for solo traveler”
Reviews.Author: Salyt141
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the GH twice during my 2 week trip in NY. I arrived from JFK on a Sat evening and stayed one night - the next 5 days I was attending a work function upstate and I returned for 4 nights in NYC before going home. Both times the service at the front desk was impeccable, I had a special request for a new room with a bathtub and the staff went out of their way to make sure my request was fulfilled. A late check out was request and organised with no fuss at all. The room size was very good for a mid-town hotel and the bathroom while small was very very clean. I like the casual Market Place food store in the lobby .. it was handy for a quick breakfast and a late night coffee fix. There was a fridge already plugged in available in my room but as it was -6 outside I did not use the fridge as much as I would have in summer time. The food at the hotel restaurant is excellent - not such great value for breakfast but excellent for dinner. The location is fantastic - mid town close to all the shops and major sites. I was never more than 10 mins away from anything. I would definitely stay there again for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL, FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: toff1991
Reviews.Content: Rooms- We had a standard Queen room and it was more than enough, bed was massive & very comfy, nice bathroom (good shower) Large wardrobe and a big flat screen TV. Room was cleaned every day and towels changed. Very good housekeeping staff!! We had a little peak at the newly renovated floors which look amazing! Although our room wasnt renovated i didnt see any problem with it! Staff- as i said cleaning staff were great, as were the rest of the staff we dealt with. Help desk is great, they will answer any of your questions. And as our flights were cancelled for one night the staff did a wonderful job in making sure we had the same room for that one extra night. Cant fault the staff all friendly and very willing to help! even the doormen were lovely. Location- I doubt anyone could fault the locaion of Grand Hyatt, it was perfect. Right next to Grand central station, 10 mins walk in one direction to Empires state building, 10 mins in the other direction is times square. 20mins walk to central park, and 5 mins to 5th avenue with all the good shops!! Thanks to all the lovely staff at Grand Hyatt especially the manager silvia who was a great help before our trip too!! Next time we go to NYC we will definately stay at the hyatt, no doubt about it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Nasty”
Reviews.Author: CorporateTraveler22
Reviews.Content: There is only one word that describes this hotel and that is nasty. I was put into a room on the 24th floor (which is newly "renovated"). The first room I was put in heaven only knows what the crud on the floor was. The front desk very obligingly moved me to another room on the same floor, this room had a layer of food crumbs on the floor, little twists of toilet paper near the toilet , a very thick layer of dust on the furniture and hair in the very old shower. I called the front desk and they again nicely asked me if I wanted another room. I suggested, perhaps getting someone up to this room to clean the room. How many times was I going to have to go down to the front desk before they gave me a clean room? A housekeeping manager and housekeeper came to the room. After the housekeeping manager directed the housekeeper to clean everything I pointed out, she left. I tipped the housekeeper in the hopes that she might do a thorough job cleaning the room. When I returned to the room there were still some crumbs and the hair was still in the shower. To add insult to injury I awoke the next morning to not a drop of hot water at 5:30. I was hopeful when the water turned lukewarm, but then want back to cold a minute later. The only nice thing I have to say about this hotel was that with every complaint ,the staff did try to assist with a resolution, but I am sure they are used to having to deal with such complaints. When I told the person at the front desk that the only word I could use to describe the hotel was "nasty", they did refund me a half a nights cost of my room. Seriously, the refund was no compensation for having to stay in a hotel that nauseated me. I would have left if I was not there with my company. The only regret I have is that I did not take pictures, because it is inconceiveable that the Grand Hyatt in NYC would have such low standards. Thank you to to the staff for being so understanding and accomodating, and to management please set the bar a bit higher.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: JSCrowe
Reviews.Content: A typical New York hotel. No complaints. We drove around Manhattan for hours trying to find a parking spot for any hotel and this one was the only one that we saw an opening....just to check in!!! Only $250 per night for a last minute trip to downtown Manhattan, I'll take it!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel with good accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Massnyse
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel very much... Very clean, organized space, and private...

Reviews.Title: “Quite Splendid. No Regrets”
Reviews.Author: Micklefielder
Reviews.Content: I liked the look of this hotel before I decided to book it and although there were one or two rather unsettling reviews prior to my arrival, I had absolutely nothing at all to worry about. There are renovations going off within the hotel, but there was little evidence of this during our stay. For first time visitors to New York City, there are few other hotels with better locations. Our room was larger than I expected it to be with a decent sized closet and bathroom and the bed was very comfortable. And, although East 42nd Street is one of Manhattan's busier thoroughfares, there was surprisingly little noise from the street compared to some other locations. This is a large hotel that some people may find rather impersonal, but I was impressed by the layout of the place, especially the very spacious lobby area. There is good security too, which tends to be kept at a low key. Yes, I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location but an Econolodge does a better job.”
Reviews.Author: danpri
Reviews.Content: Used my reward point from my many stays in other Hyatts, which have always done very well. The Grand Hyatt in DC was wonderful. The Hyatt Places are my favorite hotel concept. This one...not so much. Every step of the way it was a problem. Really, is it too much to have a backup roll of toilet paper. Should it take 6 hours and 2 trips to the lobby to get the internet to work. When notified at 4PM that the room phone is not working do they really have to take so long that we were all in bed at 11PM to try and fix it? The bathroom door handle was so poor we were afraid to latch the bathroom. On the other hand, every door opened and closed up and down the hallway was a loud crash. Poor picture on the TV. Bedside clock bolted tight to table so you cannot read it from the bed. How stupid is that? NO AMENITIES AT ALL. Even as a Hyatt Platinum member the only thing I was offered was on and off internet. Cost for a coffee refill...$3.00! When we checked out no one bothered to mention that the cars were delivered from the valet to a different floor than the front of house were we dropped it off. Waited for 30 minutes before a cabby told me the details. No thanks to the 3 hyatt guys working the curb. Alas, they lost the keys anyway so no vehicle was waiting for me. Thankfully I had a backup well hidden. I can best sum this place by my 20 year old college daughters comment on day two when we debated leaving due to impending snowstorm. "I do not want to get stuck in this [-]."

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: vlfair
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NYC and honestly, I don't see a better location. It is between Grand Central and the Chrysler Bldg. We took a shuttle bus from the Newark Airport that dropped us off a block away on 41st & Lexington (hotel is 42nd & Lexington). The subway is right there and from Grand Central you can go anywhere or grab a quick bite to eat. No trouble checking in. We arrived a few minutes before check-in but had no issues going straight to our room. We had used some points and were upgraded to a Club room on the 31st floor (and then given a lower rate!). The breakfast was nothing fancy but did get us started for the day. Being able to come back and relax for a few with a snack before heading back out for the evening was nice. Luzema the concierge was fantastic. The doormen were very helpful with getting a cab. There is a great little market downstairs to grab a bite and it wasn't too outrageously expensive. There are plenty of cafes around the hotel. The rooms are a bit on the small size (bigger than a European room but smaller than a typical American room). However it was more than adequate and this is New York where space is at a premium. Rooms were clean and appeared to be recently updated. Overall this was a great hotel and great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JeniU
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip in December. Booked with priceline and got a fairly good deal at $150 per night. Sometimes hotels give the priceline customers the smaller/poorer rooms but the Hyatt gave me a large suite which was very nice. Very clean room and comfortable bed linens. Didn't really use any of the other hotel facilities but as a place to sleep I can recommend it. Great location right over grand central.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: viajero_heyer
Reviews.Content: The high points of this hotel include a super convenient location and friendly staff. When we arrived around 1:30pm we were able to check in early with no problems. We were also given an upgrade to the club level which was nice to have access to for breakfast and coffee. Our room had no view to speak of (just the side of another building) but was very spacious for NYC standards. For a few dollars per bag the bell hops watched our bags after check out on our departure day, which was a nice service even though it wasn't free. Some of the airport shuttles drop you off at Grand Central, which is directly next door to the hotel. Room did not have a fridge or coffee maker but I imagine you could request them if you needed them. There was some remodeling underway but it did not hinder our stay in any way. I would stay here again if I wanted to stay in this part of the city in the future, especially if you want easy access to Grand Central Terminal and the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanfran_1000
Reviews.Content: I have been researching for my choice of hotel for quite some time before actually booking but I have to say that I was very pleased with our choice. We took the red eye out of SF thinking that we would get in NYC early and be able to enjoy the full day but of course once we got there, we were exhausted so all we wanted to do was sleep but of course check in is around 4pm That was not an issue at all because we got there at 8am and were given the key immediately and were able to check in. There were no lines at all and we were helped right away by a nice gentleman. We went to our room and at first I was a little disappointed in the outdated look of the room. It definately needs to be remodeled and they are doing just that but not on that floor just yet. We had a great view of 42nd street so I was happy with that. The room was clean and very roomy. I had an issue with the remote control on the tv and called the front desk and they sent someone up right away to replace it. The request of extra towels was also very quick. We also requested a small fridge in the room and it was brought up within minutes at no extra charge. We requested a late check out and that was done as well. Everything that we requested was done within minutes and nothing was out of the question. The front desk was great with all our requests and we really appreciated that. The hotel has a huge lobby and the elevators were very quick and did not have to wait for them. The location could not be any more convenient. Connected to Grand Central Terminal so it is a very convenient way to get around town and it is very safe. Had no issue walking around at night by myself, but I think that is the same way all around NYC. Would definately stay at Grand Hyatt next time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL I EVER STAYED AT IN NYC”
Reviews.Author: xnytaxi137
Reviews.Content: I can not put in words the way I was made to feel as soon as I checked in. But here goes . After flying for almost 24 hours and arriving at the hotel without my luggage thanks to the airlines, and my wife in tears. The check in staff could tell my wife and I were upset and immediately not only give us a beautiful upgraded room but also sent us a bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries. I will only from now only stay at this hotel when ever I come back to New York City. Thank You Grand Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Best located hotel we stayed at”
Reviews.Author: TackyTouristAdvisor
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal via Priceline and got to stay at this hotel for two nights. Like the first NY hotel we won before, the room was one of the smaller ones facing another hotel. We noticed a small stain on one of the sheets. We kindly asked for another sheet and the manager apologized and offered an upgrade. The next night we got the most amazing suite with a huge room and living room. The best part about staying in huge hotels like this is they have the resources to make sure you have the best experience during your stay. They also store your luggage for a small fee, so if this happens to be the last leg of your trip, it's still a perfect location to store your bags, go about town, and come back to pick it up before heading off to your next destination.

Reviews.Title: “Big Room, Small Bed”
Reviews.Author: BanitaBanita
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was nice with a great big lobby and large hotel room, but the bed was small as we requested a King and got a Double. Not enough room for two people. In a room that size a queen could have fit perfectly and maybe even a King if need be. Other than that it was good. Why use a double bed in a single room any way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Lobby and Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: MukulVerma
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, massive. Information desk for tickets, restaurant was a great help. Only downside was promised king size and gave double. Large room, small bed.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING I WOULD GO BACK RIGHT NOW”
Reviews.Author: loutoo
Reviews.Content: We got married on dec 28th 2010 and departed heathrow early on morning of 29th december to embark on our journey to NYC. Due to all the recent crazy snowfall we were so happy to be going as we really did doubt it! after a great flight with virgin atlantic we arrived at jfk, customs took about 30mins so that was good. The 20 minute trip from JFK to midtown Manhattan took 3 hours because the roads were so bad in Queens, NYC state, which we had to drive through to get to Manhattan. On arrival to our hotel we were greeted with a luxurious, well kept, enormous lobby. the decor was beautiful, huge vases of flowers everywhere and a cascading waterfall at the front rotating doors. The colour everywhere is gold. We were welcomed quickly by a friendly female receptionist, we told her we were on our honeymoon and she upgraded our room free of charge to a larger newly refurbished room on the 24th floor. The hotel is undergoing renovation at the moment and Virgin let us know this about 6 months ago, but during our whole week there we did not see one work man or hear any noise at all, you would never know it was there. The main hotel restaurant was closed for refurbishing and there was a temporary one there instead, to be honest i didnt even notice as it was done so nicely. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as we chose to eat out but there is a very convienient 24hour store called Market in the lobby which sells wine, beer, soft drinks, hot meals, breakfast, chocolate, crisps, cookies, icecream whatever you want and it didnt cost any more than the news agent in Grand cenral terminal nexct door Hudson News. Rooms gorgeous modern and new, nice shower and bathroom, king size bed awesome heaven to sleep in. large LG tv in room with about 50 channels, nice desk and walled in closet. Lifts were fast and well kept. Overall I would 100% go back to this hotel or any other Hyatt hotel.The hotel is sandwiched between grand central terminal and the chrysler building, it takes 10mins to walk to Times Square, 5 mins to walk to New York Public Library, 10 mins to Empire State. The subway is quick and easy to use and is good when going downtown to ground zero, statue of liberty and to the brooklyn bridge. Grand central terminal is awesome for food and breakfast in particular. There is a large cafe opposite the hotel called Pershing Square breakfast here is awesome, quite expensive but worth it. Overall NYC is expensive at this time due to the economic climate but it is still more reasonable than UK, as you get a lot more for your money. Going off the beaten track is defo the way for cheaper meals. PIzza by the slice in NYC is awesome, better than Italy dare I say it!! Ate once in TGI Fridays as we left it till 10.30pm to eat as decided to go to Rockafeller center top of the rockl after the xmas show at Radio City, it was probably the most expensive meal we had as chains in the USA are as overpriced as they are in the UK but my NY steak was awesome, cooked perfectly. If you want to see a Broadway show be prepared to wait a few days before you will get in and be prepared to pay a lot. We saw Wicked which was amazing, tickets cost us $114 each which is about £80 each so quite similar to west end prices, maybe even a little more. Those seats were the orchestra seats so thats good. Overall go to NYC and stay here you will have the time of your life.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: whu81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt from 16th - 21st Dec 2010 and were extremely happy with the hotel. We'd stayed with a Hyatt before in Maui so having had a good experience last time, and seeing a competitive price, we went for it this time. Upon arrival, we checked in instantaneously and were told that because we were staying for a while, they would upgrade us for free, from a Double to what I'm guessing was a Deluxe King - a huge bed, very spacious, sofa, desk, etc. And to top it off, right outside our window was the Chrysler building - couldn't have asked for better. As with the other Hyatt we stayed in, the room was nicely decorated, helpfully had some iPod speakers next to the bed and was generally very comfortable. And after a long day of sightseeing / shopping, it was just perfect to return to it. The only noise we heard, apart from the traffic which wasn't a problem, was a noisy neighbour. Down at reception, some renovation work was underway but disruption was kept to a minimum and it didn't distract from the attractive lobby, filled with Xmas trees. Location wise, you can't go too wrong with here. You have the Grand Central Station subway virtually below the hotel, that can take you anywhere you need and back again. On foot, you are 10-15 minutes south of the Rockefeller Center, 10-15 minutes north of the Empire State and 10-15 minutes east of Times Square. Fifth Avenue, Chrysler and Grand Central a lot less than that! We would most definitely stay here again next time we visit NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: MTL_Canada_080
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby, nice room, excellent location on the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing to the max......”
Reviews.Author: ts_boston
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC for Christmas of 2010, and stayed in Grand Hyatt at the Grand Central. Entrance was grand - no doubt about it. Checked in - took the elevator to the 18th floor to our room. Here are some observations: * Small size for a king size bedroom * Super small bathroom with shower only, old fixtures, not so clean * Carpet in the room -- had air pockets big enough to stumble upon * Heater - no matter what temparature you set it to - gets too warm for comfort * Windows - single pane - can hear noise from the roads * Bed sheets - clean however severly worn * Comforter - spots on it * Extra blanket - falling apart (ratty almost) * Room door -- once the lights in the room are turned off -- corridor lights clearly came through from all sides of it (first of it's kind experience!) Summary - location great, however, can't figure out how this is a 4 star hotel. Even some 2 star hotels are better equipped to accomodate travellers. Read later on that the renovated rooms are great - however, when a traveller is making reservation in a 4 star hotel, every room should be fantastic, renovated or not. Surprised that Hyatt does not have a minimum standard set for a "Grand" Hyatt. Extremely dissapointing. Was glad to be back in own home!

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: zoma1 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Exquisite room and first class service. the staff are very hospitable and polite. love the market on the ground floor-very convenient. Excellent location to all the great tourist attractions. Highly recommended and will surely stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, a really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 18Titles
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights a week before Christmas with my husband and two children. We booked a room that comes adjacent with a living and dining room. Very spacious for the four of us. Fabulous location and a really good hotel. Room was clean and recently refurbished. Check-in was smooth and quick. Doormen were always present and extremely helpful. We needed a big taxi to accommodate our luggages and they managed to locate one for us within minutes. The Grand Club staff were very friendly and accommodating. We walked from this hotel to Times Square, Macy's on 34th and to the Apple Store on 59th. All within 15 to 20 minutes walk from this hotel. We will certainly come back to stay here during our next visit to cool NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms are Truly Grand”
Reviews.Author: STEPHMARTY
Reviews.Content: Our last stay at the Grand Hyatt New York was 9 years ago, so we were familiar with the central location and proximity to Grand Central Station (which we like). This year, we stayed in two rooms on the newly renovated 24th floor from 12/15 - 12/19. I was very impressed with nearly every aspect of the Hotel and the renovated rooms. Upon check-in, we were greeted by the very pleasant and helpful Amanda who granted our request for two rooms next to each other, both with two double beds. The upgrade to the renovated floor was a nice surprise, and Amanda even gave our three girls their own Hyatt teddy bears. What a great welcome! As others have stated, the lobby is very large and beautiful. There is always a lot of activity there, and music booming in the bar area gives it the feel of a trendy NYC club. But the noise disappears when you step into the elevators--and there are a ton of elevators. We never waited more than 15 seconds for an elevator, and they move very quickly. Not even time to enjoy the television inside the elevator before arriving at our floor. The corridors and rooms on the 24th floor have a very chic, modern feel. The color scheme is sophisticated yet comforting. Rooms are very roomy by NYC standards. A few touches I enjoyed in the room included the iPod docking station/radio/alarm, flat-screen TV, the safe lighted from the inside with room for my laptop, the big "rainfall" shower head, chaise sofa, modern light fixtures and light switches, and nice size walk-in closet. Beds were plush, the room temperature always comfortable, and the bathroom amenities were upscale. Our window looked out over Grand Central Station, and we never heard any street noise. Hot water was plentiful--never an issue. Plenty of towels for the entire family. And no evidence of any bedbugs in either room after four nights. The tub was missing a stopper. We stuffed a wash cloth in the drain to hold water for baths. Housekeeping did a nice job cleaning the room but was inconsistent in leaving clean wash cloths and drinking glasses. And, as others have pointed out, a coffee maker would have been nice. My only other concern is the security of this hotel. There is nothing to prevent someone from coming in off the street and going up the elevators to the guest floors. I would recommend adding room card access to the elevators. Hotel personnel were usually standing by the elevator bank, but I never saw them question anyone. We had no problems, but I did see one person who didn't appear to be a guest go up and then quickly back down one day. I couldn't help but sense he was making some sort of delivery (hopefully a legal one). I could be wrong about him, but there is nothing to prevent this. The Grand Hyatt is a straight shot across 42nd street to Times Square--a 10-12 minute walk. Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral area is an easy 12-15 minute walk up Fifth Avenue. The New York Public Library and Bryant Park--where we love to ice skate, is a very short walk, and the Empire State Building is not far from there. Not to mention everything is easily accessible from Grand Central Station, where we also enjoyed cheesecake from Junior's every night. Tip: the iPhone GPS makes using the subway SUPER easy. It will tell you which train to get on and how many minutes until departure and arrival. Overall, I give the Grand Hyatt very high marks for location, comfort, and value. The staff was very friendly, though not intrusively so. My wife and I agree that we would stay at the Grand Hyatt again on our next visit to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Book double!”
Reviews.Author: HraPormestari
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights in the Grand Hyatt with our friends in December. On arriving to the hotel our friends were given a double room and we got a king room. After taking our luggage to the room we went to see our friends' room - and were astonished. Their room was almost twice as big as ours, and they had a nice view to the city compared to our view, which was the opposite wall! We went immediately to the reception to ask for a double room, and were lucky enough to get one. Especially if you pay the full price (which isn't advisable, by the way - use Priceline instead), don't be satisfied with a king room, when you could get a much bigger one for the same amount of money. In addition, the king rooms don't have a bath, only a shower. Due to a high floor, our room didn't have any kind of problem with the noise from the streets. The downsides of staying in a high floor are the elevators. There aren't enough of them for a hotel this size. Almost every time we had to wait for one, and on the way down they kept just stopping and stopping until they were crammed. Besides, our room was facing the elevators, and the noise woke us several times during the night. The hotel lobby is very grandiose, but otherwise the hotel and the rooms are more low-keyed and stylish. There is a indoor connection to Grand Central Terminal, which is very convenient: you get to the subway station in a couple of minutes. Naturally the location of the hotel is very good, but since there are so many interesting places to see in New York, you won't manage without a Metrocard - at least we didn't. Grand Hyatt is a relatively good hotel, but there are a few deficiencies, which a hotel of this standard shouldn't have. Firstly, there aren't coffee makers in the rooms. That might sound like a small failing, but we believe, that it's the small things that make the stay enjoyable. Secondly, Grand Hyatt charges extra for everything. In hotel lobbies the wireless internet connection should be free, but not in Grand Hyatt. Also the luggage storage sets you down a couple of dollars. Again, those are small amounts of money, but we think that these kind of things show, how much the hotel values their guests. Especially if the hotel is as expensive as Grand Hyatt, there should be some extra perks to cheer guests up. Thirdly, the young concierge clearly wasn't equal to his duties. He gave us inaccurate information of the airport transportation. He didn't know that the hotel had its own cars for the journey, and besides, he gave us a truly flawed estimate of the price of the cab ride. The hotel's transportation costs about $80, and is a good option, especially if you are travelling in a group and have lots of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyRuth43
Reviews.Content: My Sister and I stayed at this Hotel for her 40th Birthday, We e/mailed ahead to check if they had our booking and when we arrived thay had put 50 dollers on our room to spend in the hotel Ruth also got a birthday card and some Chocolatesdelivered to our room on the first night. We both liked this hotel as it is central to most things and Time Square is only 10 mins walk from the Hotel. Grand entral station was only next door and we used the subway most days from here. The room we got was one of the old room but it was still nice and was what we needed for our stay( who needs to be in a hotel room when in New York). I have read a few people were not happy with this hotel but we didn't have any problems at all. I would go back to this hotel again. Would just like to Thank Silvia and her Staff for making our stay in New York a brilliant one.

Reviews.Title: “club room benefits”
Reviews.Author: enjoytravelling_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed in queen club room. Room and bathroom was very clean. Bed was comfotable. Access to the lounge for breakfast, afternoon tea, etc. is a great benefit. The check-in agent was very helpful and pleasant. I couldn't help overhearing a couple checking out complaining about the original room and second room they were moved too. I must admit I started to feel some concern, in case my experience matched theirs. My experience was totally different. The only concern was the room opposite to mine going in and out of their room banging the door each time. Staff were very pleasant. The guest relation manager was very helpful and extended my request for late check out with no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chris_scott94
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from a five night stay in The Grand Hyatt East 42nd Street. Travelling with two family members we had one good sized room with two double beds and plenty of room to move about. Room was very clean along with the bathroom and had a large LCD tv with plenty of channels. Good sized cupboard with ironing board and iron in it. Safety deposit box in the room is a bonus. Included with your stay you have the use of the gym which has all the newest equipment, headsets and towels. The check in was quick and reception very helpful, you also have the two other desks for info and buying tour and theatre tickets. In the main reception there is a market with hot and cold foods for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Tea and coffee facilities, cold drinks, alcohol and snacks which are all very reason able and handy. Also the closeness of Times Square, Grand Cental Station with the markets and dining concorse, Pershing Cafe and Anne Moore's round the corner. Only bad things are the hotel Wifi. Not the speed that is the problem its that is costs $10 for 24hours use and the beds are not to everybodys comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced, Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: Travellover1869
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply nothing special. The rooms are TINY, lacking a coffee pot, mini fridge, coffee maker, ironing board, etc. The bathroom doesn't have a fan, so it gets really steamy in the entire room. We found someone's sleep mask on the floor, the toilet was cracked, and the floor didn't appear to be vacuumed recently at all. The tub didn't drain well so by the time you were done showering there were several inches of dirty water in which you stood, not to mention you had to hold onto the shower head or else it just sprayed straight down. The lobby was nice, as was the location. Practically attached to grand central, it made getting around on the subway a breeze. I didn't choose to stay here, the arrangements were pre-made, but I wouldn't stay here again. Nothing was really disturbing, just very lack-luster and way over priced at $500 a night for 2 double beds. Also parking was an alarming $70 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but wait until renovation is complete.”
Reviews.Author: dwnhllskiier815
Reviews.Content: Location is great, and staff helpful and pleasant. The only downside is getting one of the older rooms and still paying the same rate as those with new rooms or similar 4-5 stars hotels in New York. The old rooms are in no way worth the price, though I'm sure once the renovation is complete this will actually be a "Grand" Hyatt property.

Reviews.Title: “Very Large Hotel with a Grand Lobby”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on two occasions. It is a very large hotel with a grand lobby at a great location. The first time, we arrived early, so rooms were not ready. We were assured that we would get two separate beds in the room, but when we came back in the evening, they had forgotten of this request, and only rooms with king-size beds were available. They made amends by offering us complimentary breakfast vouchers, which was nice. The second time I stayed here with my daughter, and we were able to check in early, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. By the way, they have a $2 per bag fee, if you want them to store the bags prior to departure. Also, the bar/restaurant lounge serves nice cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, too many little charges”
Reviews.Author: amhOttawa
Reviews.Content: Traveled for a spousal conference. I was shopping/exploring. We had great service from dial7 from the airport. The hotel location was wonderful. I walked in a different direction each day. Hotel was OK. Rooms small but clean. Bathrooms smaller but clean. Shower didn't work but was fixed when I asked. Safe was locked on arrival..also fixed with a complaint. Bed comfortable. No fridge. No coffee. No newspaper (neither at the door or anywhere in the hotel). Internet charges really annoying. Hotel website advertises high speed wireless in room but they neglect to mention the $10/day charge. It is chintzy when the room charge is $500/night. Fitness room good. Will find something different next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near Grand Central, Rooms were small but nice enough”
Reviews.Author: Shareee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for one night in mid November and had a fun time. The hotel is literally next door to Grand Central and couldn't be more convenient. The lobby is active and bustling and the hotel is quite large. They told us many of the rooms were being renovated but we didn't hear any noise. Our room was clean, had a king bed and was pretty small, but certainly functional and typical for a New York hotel. The bathroom hadn't been renovated yet but it was perfectly fine. I've stayed at the Westin and Renaissance in Times Square and this was comparable to those hotels. We booked the room on Priceline, the same day, and paid $135 for the room. For that price, the hotel was fantastic. Some reviewers complained about the high prices and I can understand that, but if you can get it on Priceline, it's a bargain and quite nice. It is a very large hotel, but if you know that going in, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location Excellent, Service and Staff Outstanding - will be back”
Reviews.Author: priority86
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this wonderful hotel for four nights 27th Nov to 1st Dec could not have wished for more it was amazing the staff so helpful and nothing was to much trouble the check in was simple and efficient the staff tried their upmost to accomdate your every need so freindly and the lobby was amazing.Great location for getting around the city with Grand Central Station next door so Metro and buses nearby. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful as was concierge.The hotel staff were absolutely lovely and so helpful with our stay. They were very accommodating with holding our bags until we were leaving again for the airport and also very helpful with organising a cabs. The hotel is on 42nd street, you can walk to anywhere from there, but it was also great to go next door to Grand Central station and hop on the Metro. This makes getting around so easy and really useful when you are tired and just want to get back to the hotel. We did't miss a coffee maker or mini-bar in our room. There were some renovations taking place, but nothing to disturb our stay. It has to be the perfect location within the city.I could not reccomend this more highly go their you wont be dissapointed great location great room great hotel. I have to congratulate the management for their excellent running of this hotel we felt safe and cared for. Just wanted to extend my thanks and appreciation to Silvia Zese i think your customer service is excellent Such a commitment to great customer service is to be commended thank you so much you are a credit to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel. Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 1matron
Reviews.Content: Lovely room with 2 double beds. Bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. No kettle in room which we could have done with, so take your own travel kettle. I'd read that the rooms were small - ours certainly wasn't. Location was perfect. Right next to Central Terminal. Tourist information woman (Susan) in foyer was horrible. She tried to bully us into buying tickets for shows (obviously on a commission!) when all we wanted was information on bus tours and the Statue of Liberty. She was so rude. I would certainly book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bellasnan
Reviews.Content: stayed at this wonderful hotel for four nights 23rd to 27th Nov could not have wished for more it was amazing the staff so helpful and nothing was to much trouble the check in was simple and efficient the staff tried their upmost to accomdate your every need so freindly and the lobby was amazing I could not reccomend this more highly do go their you wont be dissapointed great location. I have to congratulate the management for their excellent running of this hotel we all felt so safe and cared for xxxx whilst we were there there was a wedding and the staff let us have a sneaky peak at the room whilst it was being prepared oh how i wish my daughter could be married there it was breathtaking x

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: iainwk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on our trip to New York. Great location for getting around the city with Grand Central Station next door so Metro and buses nearby. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful as was concierge. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sterling service”
Reviews.Author: Overlaid
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came in to NYC for a day trip, only to find at 10:30 at night our car was broken down and not driveable. This hotel is where we ended up - Ashley called around for rooms at less expensive places on our behalf, but they were booked in full. She then worked her magic and we had a place to stay for the night at the Hyatt, with a late checkout in case our vehicle wasn't ready. I just wanted to extend my thanks and appreciation to the Hyatt for going the extra mile for two stranded tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Torrich75
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality hotel that I stay in regularly on business trips to NYC. The location is very convenient for my workplace. It is a large and busy hotel. Decor is rather gaudy for my taste but is generally clean. I have always found the staff to be courteous and friendly. The rooms are hit and miss. If you get one of the newly-refurbished rooms there is nothing to complain about. I recently stayed in a couple of the older rooms however and I wasn't impressed. The carpet in one was damp due to faulty a/c...not nice The restaurant is pleasant enough. Breakfasts are better than the evening meals. There is no minibar in the rooms so even for basics like a bottle of water you have to purchase from a small shop in the foyer. They have a good selection but this is not convenient given the room rates. Final point to make is on the gym. It's on the top floor. Clean and I've always found there to be plenty of room. I find the selection of equipment rather odd. There are several running machines and cross trainers but only 1 bike and no rowing machines. In summary, there are a few frustrations with this hotel. But for business trips in mid town it's hard to beat for convenience and service

Reviews.Title: “comfortable beds nice staff”
Reviews.Author: lumsdenfamily
Reviews.Content: stayed in the hyatt for 3 nights , comfortable rooms with good service from staff in hotel , bit expensive on the food and drink side though , great location would go back and have recommended hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Small room and rude service”
Reviews.Author: fplaw52
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I have discovered using this venue to express my experience during my travels. I hope it helps others in their choice when traveling, either on business or personal. Now about t his hotel, my checkin was slow and the agent was so rude to me. He acted as if he was doing me a favor when I asked for a room away from the elevators. When I did get to my room, I could hardly move. This is luxury? I understand some hotels not having very large rooms but this is ridiculous. I will choose another hotel on my next trip here believe me

Reviews.Title: “A+ customer service at this fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: OverlandMT
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 7 nights here while my wife attended a conference at the hotel. This was our second stay at the Grand Hyatt NYC. No complaints about this bustling, big city hotel. Everything was to our satisfaction: comfortable and clean room (no bugs!), hot water, good climate controls, comfy beds, modern TV with a fine selection of channels, and fast elevators. We visited The Market several times each day - very nice addition since our last stay. We didn't use room service. We did't miss a coffee maker or mini-bar in our room. There were some renovations taking place, but nothing to disturb our stay. It has to be the perfect location within the city - central location next to Grand Central provides easy access to everything! The staff - front desk, concierge, management, and houskeeping - was top notch. Honestly, everyone we dealt with had a smile and a kind wordl! It's expensive, but a real value by NYC standards. We'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “OK For One Night, But Disappointing Considering the Cost”
Reviews.Author: sherful2008
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the recent negative reviews on this hotel. First off, I want to make clear that it's not that the hotel's quality is terrible, it's more so that the PRICE and star rating considering the quality is terribly deceptive and way off. This is considered (I guess) a four star, and runs over $400/night, and I would say it is really only worth $150/night. Secondly, the staff was really helpful in dealing with my problems. That said, if you really need and value a genuinely clean and modern establishment, these rooms might not be for you. Then again, it's a huge hotel with over 30 floors and I can't let my experience speak for all the rooms. The lobby looks like a palace, but the rooms were another story. When I checked in, the concierge was very polite and I happily went up to my room, only to wonder why the toilet seat was closed (they are typically open in a cleaned hotel room). I open it to find a huge amount of fecal matter and dark urine. I even decide I'll flush it and stay, but when I do that, it doesn't all go down and at this point I'd need tools to clean the toilet. So, I went downstairs and the next staff person quickly provided me with a new room. This second room was also not clean. The toilet seat was down, but I was in no mood for anymore surprises, so I left that alone, but noticed that the linens were out of wack, soap had been opened with the wrapper left on the sink, and the cabinet door underneath the tv was open. A pillow was misplaced on the other bed (it looked like someone was laying on it, not like the cleaning crew accidentally placed it on the other bed) and the vertical throws at the bottom of the bed was missing from one double bed and placed messily on the other. I could tell this had not been fully tended to and went downstairs for a second time. The woman I got was really apologetic and put me in my third room. She apologized and gave me a coupon for free breakfast and beverages from the hotel's Market. I checked in the third room which seemed OK (it was cleaned by staff). I went to the gym and when I returned, there were complimentary (and yummy) chocolate chip cookies, a bottle of champagne, and a card with a lollipop that apologized again for my situation. I really appreciated the attention and it helped make a frustrating night better. As for the room, I was surprised at how aged it looked (I know it's a historic building, but judging from the lobby and prices and reputation of the chain, I'd expected pretty on-point renovations). The carpet is sort of dusty looking and you can tell it's pretty old and kinda lumpy looking in spots, the bathroom is super small, and the doors (bathroom and closet) are old fashioned with a few small chunks of wood missing and paint chipped. I've stayed in much better non-chain, cheaper hotels that have been beautiful, overseas and domestically. There was no fridge, so I had to throw my leftover Chipotle away. There was no coffee machine either. I called the front desk to see if there was a fridge in the building for occupants' use, and was told that I could "rent" one for $20.00. No thanks. In the trash the burrito goes. I didn't take a shower because the shower floor looked a little dirty (not terribly, but I didn't feel good about going in there) and the drain was rusted. There was a piece of trash on the floor under one of the beds, so the floor hadn't been thoroughly vacuumed. My total was over $450 and this was under a reduced conference rate. I slept with the lights (and in turn, tossed and turned every other hour) on because I would bet bed bugs are in there and they tend to really come out in the dark. I expected free wifi, but the wifi browser was prompting me to pay. I could deal with it for one night on a business trip, but if I'd have booked this hotel for a week for vacation with friends, I would have been highly pissed and frustrated. This hotel should make more investment in the infrastructure of the rooms. I was on the 17th, 24th, and 29th floor and can only base this on my 3 experiences. Location and views are great, and if you are easy-going hotel wise and aren't going to spend much time in the room, it's probably fine for you. But, I'm sure there's better for less out there, nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel but good location.”
Reviews.Author: Expat_wife
Reviews.Content: Since we were only going to be NYC for a few days, we chose the Hyatt because of its central location and because the Hyatt is a reliable brand. We have stayed at beautiful Grand Hyatts around the world and were sure this would be the same. However, we had a unexpectedly mixed experience at this property. On our last day, our maid told us that the entire hotel was undergoing renovation and that our floor would be next. She said that we should come back next year to see a brand-new beautiful hotel. I wondered why it took a maid to communicate this bit of advice, why wasn't this information on the hotel website or elsewhere??? The positives: 1) Great location. Attached to Grand Central Station -- transportation around the city couldn't be easier. Plus being in mid-town means you can walk almost anywhere. 2) Good fitness room on the top floor. 3) We got good rates for our rooms. Now, the negatives: 1. The rooms (we had 2 rooms) were as ordinary as could be. The bedrooms are small and plain, the bathrooms were plain 3-star hotel style with a shower/tub combo, shower curtain and tiny sink. One sink was partially blocked and did not drain well. The door is not sound-proofed so we could hear anyone talking in the hallway. The amenities in the bathroom were not replenished after the first day. We had to call for more shampoo. There is a sign that you can request turn-down service, which defeats the luxury of coming back to your room and finding it all prepared for evening. 2. There was no refrigerator in the room. Not having a minibar probably saved us a lot of money, but I was hoping to store some snacks in a refrigerator. 3. The breakfast buffet costs $30 a person and we were required to pay BEFORE being allowed into the room to see the buffet. It was quite odd and the hostesses (there were 3) acted like they were blocking the door. Once we went inside, we could see why. It was a disappointing display of stale pancakes, a few half-empy bowls of fruit, some yogurt and pre-cooked eggs that were slightly grey on the edges. Again, we've eaten like kings at some Hyatt buffets but not this time. It was very disappointing. Luckily, there is a market in the lobby that sells fruit, yogurt, baked goods and granola that we took up to our rooms on the following days for a much better breakfast. 4) The water to both bathrooms was turned off when we woke up on Sunday morning. That was a shocker. Luckily the water came back on fairly soon, but with a nasty brown blast. The water wasn't clear until a few hours later. No apologies or explanations from the front desk. Early sightseeing was out as we couldn't take our showers as early as we would have liked. 5) In all of our dealings with the front desk, service was brusque. A couple of times, no one picked up the phone when I called from the room. I know this is New York, but really? The Hyatt needs to do some customer service training sessions. Overall, I was shocked that Hyatt is running a property so out-of-line with the rest of the brand. I am glad to hear it is undergoing a physical revamp, but it needs a lot of work in many areas before it is up to standards. If I didn't know it, I would have guessed this was a 3-star hotel. I think I would stay here again, if I heard that things were better. The location makes it a great place, and I recommend it because of that.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, bad ending (Financially).”
Reviews.Author: ddash302
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Central Hyatt on a guys weekend trip. The hotel and amenities were great as we had great service, breakfast buffett both days, and courteous staff who gave us great tips on the City. At checkout my room fees were zero as all we did was eat & sleep at the hotel. When I returned home I checked my bank account and the hotel had charged me $376.19 for incidentals (alarming) since this was not told to me. So after a call to the accounting dept those fee's were refunded immediately. Well after 2 more days another charge of $376.20 but this time it would take 3-5 days while all along overdrafting my account and causing me to be charged numerous bank fee's I called to try and get the hotel to re-imburse me for the $$$ to only be denied repeatedly, needless to say I'am still w/o the money and have no reason to recommend a hotel that robs it's customers w/o a gun. And I thought I would get robbed in the streets? All I had to do was check-in..

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous hotel with brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Ireland_ger_10
Reviews.Content: I travelled from Ireland to new York for the first time and ended up staying at this hotel on a recommendation from a friend. I couldn't get over the absolutel brilliant location. We were within walking distance of everything we needed. And we walked everywhere. The rooms were a great size and we were delighted that they were up good and high in the hotel so we got great views! I thought the beds were very comfortable and with two double beds in the room for my kids, it worked out very handy. The hotel staff were absolutely lovely and so helpful with our stay. They were very accommodating with holding our bags until we were leaving again for the airport and also very helpful with organising a cab which was for a party of four. I loved the decor in the hotel and the reception area was the biggest I have ever seen with loads of space. We ate dinner in the hotel on two occasions and they food was avery nice. We also ordered room service which was delivered with a smile. I hada wonderful stay and would definatly recommend this hotel to any of my friends which is why I am going back there again next month with a bring group of friends and family. I'm expecting a lovely staff with very friednly people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Young and the Not-So-Young”
Reviews.Author: adatheworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful location traveling with young children and their grandparents! My 5 year old son loves trains so being at the Grand Central Terminal was perfect! It was very convenient for three generations of us to enjoy the gorgeous decor, wonderful food and shopping, and easy means of transportation throughout the city. The Grand Hyatt is a very nice, convenient, and comfortable hotel for all 19 of us (ranging from age 5 to 88 years old). We had a very enjoyable 3-day stay before boarding our 7-day New England Cruise on the Princess Carribean. My in-laws had a terrific 60th Anniversary Celebration which began at the Grand Hyatt in New York City!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: OldBear
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of October 2010 for 5 nights. You have to carry your bags up an escalator from the front door, could be an issue for older guests or less able guests, I am sure the staff would be very willing to help. The reception is very elegant and spacious, lots of seating and very clean. Check in was good, rooms were good, we had great views of the Chrysler building, okay, the bathrooms are only small but it's a bathroom! You don't need a huge room to have a shower, actually the shower was really big. The room was a good size and very clean (and we had NO bites as one person mentions in earlier reviews there is nothing at this hotel as far as we are aware). The beds are very comfortable and good pillows too. The coffee shop was clean and really useful in the mornings for a coffee and breakfast croissant. We enjoyed drinks in the bar in the evenings even though they are undergoing refurbishment and there was only a limited selection available. All the staff we spoke to were helpful, polite and had good local knowledge. There are plenty of restaurants closeby and of course you can also get a cab outside if you wish. The hotel is on 42nd street, you can walk to anywhere from there, but it was also great to go next door to Grand Central station and hop on the Metro. This makes getting around so easy and really useful when you are tired and just want to get back to the hotel. Also don't miss the Market at Grand Central, Juniors cheesecake is great, there are also lots of other cakes, bread, fruit, cheese, meats etc. worth a visit. Overall we were very pleased with our choice of hotel and would stay here again if/when we go back to New York. You won't do better than this hotel for location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-nothing special though”
Reviews.Author: phillyphlyer40
Reviews.Content: As an avid (200+ nights a year) traveler, I have to say that the Grand Hyatt NYC falls way short of many other "Grand Hyatt's" in many ways.
