The only reason I gave it a 3 instead of 2 rating is due to the GREAT location! If you need access to transportation-this is the place to be. That said, the Grand Club had very skimpy offerings, service was slow (both check in and bell service), mis-information was given (2 different employees said both yes and no that the bar/lounge was open), and the rooms were tired. Two flaws that stuck out to me were:1-the HVAC in the room did not seem to be able to control the room temp very well. I needed a/c upon check in, and heat at night. It seemed as if my room was either HUMID and hot, or freezing! 2-the check in agents were taking customers out of the "regular" line (2 agents working that line) while Diamond members sat and waited in a line that was 4 deep (1 agent working Diamond line) for about 12 minutes. Spending 200 nights on the road I want quick check in! So many great choices in NYC, I would not return here.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dreama12
Reviews.Content: We usually take an annual trip to New York City just before Christmas. We usually stay at the Hyatt but have stayed other places on two occasions. However, we have always returned to the Grand Hyatt. The location is great being in close proximity to Grand Central Station and being within walking distance to many places we love to go is an added plus. The service is impeccable and the rooms are the right size to fit our needs. They rooms are always clean and our needs are met immediately. On this particular visit we were given an upgrade to include the Club room. This was an unbelievable experience. We truly enjoyed the atmosphere and the services provided there. When we travel to New York this year (Dec. 18 through Dec. 22) we will be staying once again at the Grand Hyatt. Unfortunately, the added price for the Club room was a litle more than we could manage. However, it won't stop us from enjoying the beautiful surroundings and the excellent service we receive at this wonderful establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tellurideskier
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the location of this property. It was within walking distance of the Broadway shows. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Pricey, which is how NYC is, but I had convention rates which got the price down to 'reasonable for NYC'. I will stay there again next year if I can get a decent rate as the location was so good. Very clean and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: HelenPD012
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right in the heart of NYC. It is well placed next to Grand Central Terminal and close by to the bustling Times Sqaure for evening strolls. Also within easy walking distance to the Theatres on Braodway, Empire State Building, Top of the Rock Observatory and the Chrysler Building. Reception service was impersonal but efficient. The lifts had us on the 19th floor within seconds. We had the 2 x double bed room. It was spacious and clean, although I have got several bed bug sores (cannot say from the hotel as I beleive they have been in stores and theatres also!). The room was cleaned and the toiletries replenished each day. The bed was very comfortable. There are plenty of different places to eat withing Grand Central Terminal for something qucik and cheap. You have to go to Pershing Square Cafe under the arch opposite hotel for Breakfast - excellent! The hotel will store your bag for you at the end of your trip for $2 per bag. The consierge was vey good getting us a taxi for our ride to Penn Station to get us to the Airport. I would definitely go to this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “You pay huge amount for the location”
Reviews.Author: javachampion
Reviews.Content: Paid $500/night here. It's Grand Central so I couldn't really complain. Everything in NY is expensive anyway. Rooms are small, again, typical NY hotel room. The layout is odd, the TV is in the middle of the room. A friend of mine was surprised when she saw the layout. Its really weird. Seems like they tried to cramp a lot of things in a small room.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, friendly staff and nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: tia029
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 4 nights it was very good. Ideal location for getting around New York, right next door to central station. The staff are very friendly, there was not any coffee machine in the room but when we asked for one it was left for us at no cost. It was very quiet at night and the bed and pillows were very good quality, which was a plus after walking miles aroung New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and overall good stay”
Reviews.Author: DC4ver
Reviews.Content: My biggest concern going into this stay was the concern of bed bugs. Happy to say that none of the rooms we had reserved had bed bugs. The hotel was busy--just made you want to be energized. The rooms were nice and I'd recommend the hotel to anyone--even though the price for rooms were crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: krazz
Reviews.Content: Great location- across the street from Grand Central Station. Buses from the airports run to Grand Central Station which is very convenient. Also close to many major subway lines. I am a Mets fan and the 7 train across the street runs directly to Citifield. The room is standard, but nothing special. Many people complain that the rooms are small, but it is in New York City so it is actually pretty average. Personally, I think you do not visit New York to stay inside your hotel room, so the size doesn't matter that much. More importantly. it is clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “the epitome of mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: shellscott
Reviews.Content: lame hotel. a business meeting factory; very impersonal. lots of high school-looking groups staying here. minimal countertop space in the bath. stayed on top floor; ice machine leaked into carpeted hallway...gross. very 1980s. NO MINIBAR!! not even a fridge...that "market" aka ripoff convenience store in the lobby is for the birds. who wants to buy a small jug of oj for your room--by morning it's hot and gross! not even a COFFEE MAKER in the rooms...who wants to have to get dressed just to get a cup of joe?!? gimme a break. only glad it was on the company's dime..would have been furious if i was paying. never again. trump international is the only nyc hotel for me from now on.

Reviews.Title: “I will never forget my terrific stay at this hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: luizaqueroga
Reviews.Content: The staff is great, really nice! The rooms are really cozy, and the price was just unbelievable low at our stay. And the location couldn't be better. I hope to stay there again in the next time in NY.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: bobbydon
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is perfect, our short two day trip was lovely. The staff are professional, helpful and very accommodating. We loved our room, it was the perfect size and had everything we needed. The location is perfect. Every amenity was provided for in our room, and had we wanted anything extra we could call and request. After reading some of the other posts to Grand Hyatt, I am always surprised at people who complain about petty issues, maybe someone needs to review you or your home. Hotels have a tough job in trying to please a multitude of personalities, people with quirks, people who feel entitled, and people who just like to complain. I think people need to write a private review (people who have valid issues) to management instead of slamming them on a public forum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Superb Location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: MeridaGal
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in NYC, and the central midtown location helped save us time and money. Being right next door to Grand Central Station was a godsend. Just a short ride to any destination in NYC - you gotta love that! The hotel’s staff members were all friendly and accommodating! My husband turned the big Four-Oh, and the wonderfully sweet reception clerk, Dewi, upgraded us to a corner room with nice views, sent up complementary chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of Cava! The staff is what really made our stay special. I must mention that the hotel is currently undergoing extensive renovations. So if you are a late sleeper, make sure you ask for a room far above or below the construction zone. With that said, you can also get an incredible deal on Priceline (we pd $175 per weekend night) as a tradeoff for the industrial alarm clock!

Reviews.Title: “Look at this hotel before the others”
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay at the Grand Hyatt. Staff were very helpful and efficient. Rooms were very clean (no bedbugs). Beds were very comfy but corridors and adjoining rooms were very noisy one evening ( there was a wedding on and lots of guests were staying) Concierge desk was staffed by a very friendly, knowledgable lady who booked show tickets and airport transport. Hotel is in an excellent location - half way between Macy's and Central Park. Empire State Building within walking distance. Try Pershing Square restaurant across the road. Excellent food and very attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Traveled with 2 year old...”
Reviews.Author: Roto3000
Reviews.Content: Great location. Traveled with 2 year old and found this hotel met our needs, except that from the main entrance you had to go up stairs/escalator and no elevators, so coming in on wheelchair or stroller required using a back entrance that often didn't work. Apart from that, great place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: pclcruiser
Reviews.Content: We requested a renovated room as we were celebrating a special occasion and were told there were none completed yet. Instead, we were given a room with a king bed on a high floor. We were not disappointed as the non-renovated rooms still had modern furniture, flat screen tvs, bright white down comforters and very comfortable beds. They also sent up sparkling wine and chocolate covered strawberries for us. The service was excellent, the location perfect for sight seeing. The room was average size for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “a lot of money for a mediocre hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: candaceg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hyatt many times. The location is absolutely perfect - connected to Grand Central Station, so it's in the middle of many subway lines, and walking distance to Times Square and many other attractions. I think it is completely overpriced for what you get though. For $500 a night, there should not be room service trays sitting in the hallways for more than 12 hours. Rooms have been renovated relatively recently, and are fine. They are small but normal by NYC standards. The hotel staff is very friendly. The gym on the top floor is well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel except for the Bed Bugs I brought home with me.”
Reviews.Author: veranda68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt NY on October 6th, 7th, 8th. The hotel room appeared to be clean but when I woke up after staying in my room I found bed bug bites on my legs. When I spoke to one of the room managers they told me that this would be investigated and they moved me to another room. I was very happy that they moved me to another room and appreciated it. When I was telling another person who was at the same conference I was at they told me about a bed bug problem they were having as well. I wish this hotel could have told me about this problem when I asked at check in. But now I am having my home treated at a cost of over $1000. Do not stay at this hotel unless you want to bring home bed bugs. Stay out. Also When you go to the market take a look at all the fruit flies in the glass cabients where the food is located. Yuck this hotel should be shut down.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location and a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: danioneill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in NYC for 4 nights for my husband to attend a conference. While the room was a little small it was in excellent condition and very tastefully furnished. We had a wonderful view of the imposing entrance of Grand Central Staion with its beautiful clock and surrounding tall buildings. I had been concerned about reports of excessive noise by other travellers, but the only noise heard was through the bathroom wall and it seemed muffled. The beds were very comfortable and the wardrobe space more than adequate. The hotel has a very elegant entrance and I certainly wasn't disappointed by the rest of the hotel as the hallways were wide, well lit and the carpets and paint work quite well maintained. On the negative side the bathroom was very small but it was well furnished. The other minor problem, but one that I often find with American hotels, is that there was no jug to make a hot drink and no fridge. The room service fees are excessive in NYC and it seems silly to not be able to have a tea or coffee without leaving the room. This is an excellent hotel with terrific conference facilities and is staffed with people who really understand customer service. Despite the minor problems I have mentioned I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay at the Grand...”
Reviews.Author: Ineedavactionnow
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Grand Hyatt. The location is fantastic! Staff were friendly and helpful, and the rooms are modern and beautiful! Looking forward to a return stay :)

Reviews.Title: “enormous hotel next to grand central station”
Reviews.Author: thekeone
Reviews.Content: The hotel is HUGE... felt as big as the casino hotels in Vegas. The rooms are nice, a step above regular hyatts but a major step below park hyatts. The location is good if you're only staying for one night, but there are better places to stay if you're taking a longer trip. the room was clean and comfortable. Room value definitely depends on the rate you paid, anything under $175, I would consider a good deal for this caliber of hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand, grand in many areas and not so grand in others....”
Reviews.Author: KariD
Reviews.Content: OK, we visited the Grand for 1 week. We(my and my 5yr. old son) met my husband who was in New York for work. PROS- Great location of Hotel, close to all Our room; we were upgraded (used a suite upgrade coupon) which was a very large room with sitting room. This was great so our son could sleep in a bit and we had 2 closets to store suitcases, etc.... The room was on the 18th floor, which is a bit misleading and is actually the 8th floor. ( I think they just want you to think you are on a higher floor than you actually are so they've added 10 floors to each level) Since we were on the 8th, our view was a large wall of the Grand Central Station and an office bldg. On the the 8th floor we were unlucky to hear the garbage truck come by a few times starting at 7am or so. (I've included a photo) Keep in mind, I'd rather have the larger room and deal with the not so great view and noise from the trash trucks, it is a city after all. The Doormen were very helpful, esp. the man who gave my son a huge lollypop everyday! It was always easy enough to get a cab with their help. BEST part of the hotel was the concierge (Chris) on the Club Floor. He went out of his way to make our trip the best it possibly could, he got us the most amazing tix to the Lion King, dinner reservations that were right on and he just had the best personality and I am sure represents everything Hyatt wants to represent in regards customer service. He even helped out with last minute passport problem we had! (same day passport was achieved) OK, the not so grand.... Design of the bathroom was in need of help. The sink was almost as small as a pedistal sink, there was no where to put any items. (though they did have a little shelf across the bathroom) I think they are updating/remodeling, if so I'm sure the bathrooms will be updated. We had a few problems with the room within the first few days: 1. the room was dark, (due to the view of a wall) and one of the large stand-up lamps was broken. I called to have an engineer come and fix, 4 hours later no one showed up. I had to call again and they lamp was broken, they did replace it. 2. 1/2 way though the trip the airconditioner went out (or would not turn on) in our main room with the bed. I also put a call in for that and never heard back. I didn't want to wait around for someone to fix it so I just let it go, it was not very hot anyway. 3. Our last night my son and I went to dinner (about 6pm) and asked the doorman for an umbrella (tons of rain), he said I need to go back up in the hotel registration and get one from the front desk for a deposit of $100. OK, that's fine..... I'm not going to steal the 4 foot bright orange Hyatt umbrella, but OK. Long story short no umbrellas! None, zip, nothing. Come on you should have more umbrelllas than you have rooms, it was not fun trying to walk down a city street with a toddler in the rain. The young man at the front desk (I'll withhold his name) was extremely rude....nice no umbrellas. Overall we had a great experience for a good city price.

Reviews.Title: “Made very welcome at this excellent hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Mart2706
Reviews.Content: We came to the Hyatt for our tenth wedding anniversary trip. From the minute we arrived we knew that this was the right choice. All the staff were very nice and welcoming, our upgraded room on the 28th floor was great (a treat for our anniversary from the hotel). The location was spot on to see all the sights in New York. The Hyatt made our trip and we'll certainly be back. Thank-you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Jamster6
Reviews.Content: Travelled to NY with my wife and Stayed at the Grand Hyatt in mid Sept for a wedding, Great Hotel, Great Service, Fantastic location with everything close by (Times Sq, Central Park, Bryant Park, 5th Ave, etc). Was our first trip to NY, I contacted Hotel prior to this to confirm our booking and recieved an upgrade free of charge!! Room was great ( Deluxe King) with big bed, ample bathroom, cleaned and serviced each day. Guest Experience Manager (Silvia Zese) was extremly helpful when organising some final wedding arrangements for the happy couple. Would definitely stay here again and would definitely reccommend this hotel to others. Hotel is ideal for couples. Take lots of money, NY is very expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: traveller8_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in mid september, this hotel was lovely and looks very grand as you enter, the lobby is stunning and is very refreshing after a long day of shopping. I did not know what to expect from the hotel but we were very impressed!! Staff were great and helpful helped us book all of our tours and were happy to help with queries. The hotel is located right next to the grand terminal which was handy and is a 5 minute walk from Times Square. A great location with shops around every corner you turn! Our room was the standard, which wasa decent size however the bathroom was a little small! Overall great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite "Grand" Hyatt !”
Reviews.Author: ANUJ_MITHANI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in September, 2010 - the hotel is located right next to Grand Central station on 42nd street, so ideally located for a short business trip (as mine) being in the heart of Manhattan. Check-in was quick, albeit NY style - which means few smiles or friendly banter and you're on your own to the elevator and onwards to your room. For the room tariff (and it seemed steeper than normal being an unusually busy time in NY), the room did come as a disappointment - it was small and dark, with no real view, limited amenities (no fridge etc.), an even smaller bathroom and an AC control that wasn't very co-operative. Breakfast was extra, and unusually expensive. The bed was, however, comfortable and clean - after a 16 hour direct flight that came as a real relief. Another unusual experience was that the hotel charged me $2 to hold baggage after check-out, which was politely explained by reception as a "union issue" (which the hotel ought to absorb, period) and the staff at the hotel gate seemed to expect a tip for merely hailing me a cab to the airport (not the most pleasant of goodbyes) ! Having been pampered to an extreme in my recent Asian travels, some of this perhaps re-defines hospitality - but hey that's just New York for you!

Reviews.Title: “our NYC wedding”
Reviews.Author: MrsHulme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for it location and price was reasonable for all our guests. Service was excellent throughout out stay. Staff were very helpful and attentive. Location was superb an ideal base to explore Manhatten and beyond. Rooms were a good size, clean and comfortable. Only disapointment was the bathrooms a little dated.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: tonyw1uk
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now and will be very happy to return anytime. Club rooms are fantastic value with food and drinks available most of the time in relaxed atmosphere. The grand is a very busy hotel even at 5 am with lots of people milling around but the staff handle all this with professionalism and efficiency. We had a small problem with our room and were comped $60 for drinks when there was really no need but very much appreciated. Close to everything and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jesscruick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to Time Square. The weather was so nice that we even walked the 18 blocks to Central Park. Grand Central station is attached to the hotel which makes riding the subway ideal. The hotel staff is so friendly and accommodating. There is a station set up in the lobby to print off your boarding passes. Had breakfast in the Commodore Grill in the hotel and it was really yummy. Huge portions! The room was ok but the hotel supplied toiletries stunk (smelled terrible). The room did not reflect the price of $400 per night but that is what you will pay in NYC. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My number one choice”
Reviews.Author: Carmenlilly
Reviews.Content: We went to New York as a group of three and chose the Grand Hyatt because of it's perfect location - Manhattan midtown, right next to Grand Central Station and because we good an amazing offer : $1800 for five nights. Usually the Grand Hyatt is a quite expensive hotel. We had a nice spacious room with view on the city with two King beds. Two of us had to share one bed, which worked perfectly alright. The room was modern and light. It also had a in-built closet with a big mirror-sliding-door. The bathroom was rather small but served it's purpose. Generally I was impressed by the room size which is comparatively big to other New York hotel rooms. The room was always clean such as the towls. There was also a desk and flat-screen TV as well as an extra comfy chair. The lobby is very impressive. The in-hotel coffee-stand is very ncie for grabbing a quick coffee and a sandwich in the morning. There are plenty of food-places all around the hotel too. Quick summary: Location: perfect for shopping, exploring the town - 10mins to Times Square, right next to Grand Central Station, 6 blocks from 34th street (Empire State Building), nice neighbour hood. Starbucks, Duane Read located right by the hotel Rooms: big rooms for NY-standards, nicely, modern furnished. Service: Staff was always helpful and kind Type of hotel: big business and tourist hotel The Grand Hyatt would always be my number one choice, if it comes for an affordable price !!!

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Hyatt--Just OK”
Reviews.Author: LocusPointBaltimore
Reviews.Content: We had an upgraded room at the hotel and it was far from grand. It needed updating. The bathroom was small and needed work. We visited 3 rooms and finally found a room that was OK. Suggest that you try another property.

Reviews.Title: “A motel at best”
Reviews.Author: IsabellePhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights with customers. What a shame to have brought customers here! The hotel is very far from the hyatt standard. The rooms need major remodeling. Very low key, paint chipped, dirty old wall papers. Nothing besides the bare minimum furniture. The bathroom was that of a motel. Super small with an old dirty tub and a tiny sink with nothing to put your toiletry on. Carpet in the room had not been laid down properly. Phone didn' t work. It took over an hour to get a stopper for the tub despite the hotel manager getting involved. We changed rooms twice hoping to get a slightly better one but ended up giving up as they were all as terrible as the others. Just a bad experience. Except for sleeping as beds are ok and it is quiet. Shame on hyatt for misleading customers thinking they are booking in a higher standard hotel. This is a motel at best!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: skm0803
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in July. Walls are paper thin so could hear the couple next door making love! Definitely not up to the standard of the Grand Hyatt in Melbourne Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Location..Location..Location..Add A Five Star Staff..This Hotel Has It All...”
Reviews.Author: IDesign4u_55
Reviews.Content: After Reading the Reviews of this Hotel, one of the things that impressed me the most was that that the hotel staff, or management took their time to comment, or answer most reviews found here (good or bad)...This tells me that I have found someone who DOES care about their business, and wants to offer a pleasurable experience -something rarely found in today's business environment. This hotel is located at Grand Central Station, and though I found this area filled constantly with hustling and bustling tourist, and locals It is just this, that makes New York City one of my favorite places to visit. When we arrived our room was not ready.Not to worry, we simply placed our bags in the capable Bellman’s hands, and headed off to view the sights of the city...On the way out We stopped and picked up a fresh croissants from a quaint little shop/bakery located right in the lobby…The Lobby is over the top with its fountain and seating area, there is even a small gift shop off the lobby that offers any toiletries that you might have forgotten. All these touches have been lost in the NEW MEGA HOTELS nearby... We did not take the time to dine in the hotel so I cannot comment on those amenities. The Hotel Front Desk Staff from Gino, to Blaire, to Mau(sp) all made us feel as though we had just arrived home. They couldn’t have been more helpful. We were offered an upgraded room. It was just perfect. We had NO view.But who needs a view when you have Times Square a short walk away?I am certain if you request a view ,THIS staff would do everything they could to provide it for you..!! They do have a Concierge Floor at this hotel- if you are a tier member of Hyatt…From the Early morning breakfast, to their evenings snack, the finger foods could not have been more perfect and delicious. It is staffed, so if you are looking for Theater Tickets, or dinner reservations, they are eager to help. Beware it was always busy during our stay.This concierge floor is worth enrolling in Hyatt. Com’s Gold Passport program and staying with the Hyatt hotel chain to gain your elite status. If you are not a Tier Member of the Gold Passport program don’t despair this hotel has a staffed area where you can make theater and dinner reservations right in their lobby…I used it twice during our stay ..To the Hyatt Grand Staff…I will see you again in late October….Thanks for a Memorable stay.!!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite so "Grand"”
Reviews.Author: answerer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 3 weeks and was not impressed. The room was a good size, but quite worn, with the carpet coming up around the edges. This is definitely a business/convention/tourist hotel which is evident from the lobby which is often as busy a mini Grand Central. Pro's: Good size rooms Convenient to Grand Central and interesting food choices Decent gym Con's: 0 room amenities - No minibar, no coffee maker Restaurant was very average Sloppy service - Laundry forms and laundry bag was never replenished Trash can was occasionally not emptied

Reviews.Title: “Good convenient safe place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nalu
Reviews.Content: I traveled to NYC by myself for a wedding & spent 2 nights at this Hyatt property. Everything was very clean & comfortable. Its a typical big city hotel--nothing unique or amazing about it, but I was there to enjoy the city,not the hotel! I asked for a room facing away from 42th street and they gave me the perfect room--total quiet. The ventilation system in the room was PERFECT (big issue for me) and the bed & linens were super comfy. If I could be a bit picky, I would say that the lobby area, although huge, was also on the dark side which was a little off putting at first. As a single woman traveling alone, I felt very safe at this property. The location cannot be beat! I walked almost everywhere I went. Quintessential New York Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to Hyatt name”
Reviews.Author: WBuddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business 2 nights and have 2 major complaints: - the walls are paper thin, I could hear people in the next room very clearly - the rooms are nice sized however the bathrooms were of 2 star quality! Very outdated and poorly lite, with very little amenities. The shower curtain looked years old and grimy. I got the hotel at a discounted corporate rate but would not justify the full price if I had to stay there again. I think I just expected more from the Hyatt name.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it so much already booked for same time this year!”
Reviews.Author: lakemurrayscfan
Reviews.Content: My husband had a CLE conference at the Hyatt last year and we enjoyed our stay so much we are returning again this year. We upgraded to the Lafayette Suite (now called an executive King) - the extra room was just what we needed so my husband could work when he needed to and I had room to store all my shopping treasures! My husband said the facilites for the seminars were newly upfitted and very comfortable. We loved being connected to Grand Central Terminal - made grabbing a cup of coffee during his breaks or lunch very easy. We walked everywhere from the Hyatt's great location - shows, shopping restaurants - the Grand Hyatt's e-concierge program was wonderful - we arranged car service, reservations and show tickets via email and everything was seamless. My only complaint was there was no bathtub in our room and after walking everywhere I really missed having a nice bath to soak in afterwards. As my title says we've already booked our return trip for this December!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gulianna1
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. the staff were very friendly and couldnt do enough for you. The lobby is very impressive with a beautiful water feature. We asked for an upgrade to the room on arrival which they did, free of charge, room was spacious, tastefully decorated, and very clean. Located next door to Grand Central Station, which is great if you use the subway, as easy to get around the city and back to your base.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt..... Not so Grand!”
Reviews.Author: chicagoshopper08
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt for free with our platinum rewards points, we got a great reception when we arrived, very friendly, and got upgraded to a larger room. But we were woken up each morning at 7am by construction/demolition work that was going on in an adjacent room, when we complained all we received from the hotel was a sorry they shouldn't start that early. Free internet service was worthless, they charge to make local calls and charge to keep your bags for the day after you check out, and the rude bell hop examined my $6 like I was trying to give him fake money. The location is fantastic but that was the only plus to our experience. I would not stay here again even if it were free!

Reviews.Title: “Grand! Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: RedRocks10
Reviews.Content: This was out second stay at the Grand Hyatt NYC. We are from CT so we love to take the train in to Grand Central which this hotel is attached to. From the moment we check in its clear that the staff is highly trained in customer service. All with smiles and pleasantries. On this occasion we had an issue with our bathroom door lock. It was a little touchy and would lock by itself. On our was out on the town we stopped at the front desk to mention it. By the time we returned a completely new lock-set had been professionally installed. This Hyatt has lovely recently remodeled, clean rooms. The location is perfect. You can get a subway right down stairs to get anywhere in the city or you can walk to times square or if you prefer a quieter experience you can walk in the opposite direction and explore the many restaurants and shops-which we did. No matter what you choose the Hyatt's fountains and relaxed, subdued atmosphere will provided a welcome respite for you as soon as you enter from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JaynoB10
Reviews.Content: Have stayed with my family twice at The Grand Hyatt NY, and both visits exceeded all expectations. The food (especially at breakfast and NYE) was fantastic, the service second to none, check in was efficient and informative, express check out was easy as pie and it has a lovely bar. Excellent location in mid-Manhatten and backing onto Grand Central Station and lovely decorations over the Christmas period on our first visit. Most importantly for me, the bed was massively comfortable!! Thank you for making both our vacations to New York relaxing and happy ones!

Reviews.Title: “Our room was dark & dingy”
Reviews.Author: threecats14
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and the lobby is spectacular. Our room was a good size for 3 people with a lot of luggage However it was very dark & dingy with no natural light at all Even with all the lights on, in the middle of the day, there was not enough light to read by. The shower enclosure smelled & overall the bathroom was grubby & needed a good overall clean ( Grout & sealant covered in mould etc ) There were no tea & coffee making facilities in our room which we found odd in this calibre of hotel The sheets were clean but had holes & rips in them

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, excellent Location, will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: conors1
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fantastic location, right next to Grand Central Station and we enjoyed exploring NYC from this base. Our room was lovely, we were upgraded which was a nice touch. The entrance and lobby area is very impressive with waterfall features and beautiful flower arrangements.The hotel is very clean everywhere and the food that we ate in the hotel was nice too. Shops, restaurants and cafes are all located within the hotel which is also ideal, but obviously there are plenty of these in the city itself too and right on the hotels doorstep. We found staff to be very helpful, friendly and polite. We are planning another trip to NYC and we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality beyond expectations, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rodz40
Reviews.Content: I take trip advisor reviews and other review sites seriously when booking hotels as I think they tell you as it is not what you get from the hotel itself. Went here for a weekend site seeing in NYC. To say we had the 'wow' factor when we arrived was an understatement. Foyer area is huge and states quality. We werent disappointed by the friendly reception staff who processed our reservation in seconds. We got a room on the 26th floor to the rear of the hotel. No view but you are compensated by some piece and quiet when you want it. The next building opposite is just as big but mainly offices so all quiet on weekends. The room was again beyond expectations. We where told NY rooms are small but this was a good size and more than adequate and certainly larger than some travellodge and more high end hotels Ive stayed in in London in my time. Bathroom/shower was the best ive seen, clean with no mould, wear, broken tiles etc etc. 42" Flat screen TV, Queen size bed, Internet keyboard, Iron/board,hairdryer, radio, ipod connection all standard. We didnt eat at the restaurants as there are plenty cheap eateries in the vicinity. For a quality breakfast i recommend the cafe/restaurant below the overpass outside the hotel directly opposite Grand Central Station. 'Pershing Central ' I recall was the name. Bit pricey at $48 for two cooked breakfast, coffee and juice but you got to do it once. back to the hotel concierge very friendly and helpful. Use them to find the best deals. It has a PC and printer in the foyer to do your check in boarding pass for flying out which was easy to use and quick. Staff will ehlp if you cant use it. The 'Market' shop in the foyer sells quick snacks, coffee, drinks porradge, cereals etc to take away or eat in. We used it for a coffee,hot chocolate in evenings and breakfast on last day. Quality food !. Check out was 11.00am but they have a bell service desk allowing you to drop off your luggage for the day as our flight was at 10.00pm so we didnt want to carry it around all day. $2 charge per item but thats OK. Overall hotel was beyond expectations and will recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great city”
Reviews.Author: HannahandJoe
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in this hotel and would probably never stay anywhere else in the city. The hotel is by FAR the best value for the same standard around the city and the location (attached to Grand Central, five minute walk from Times Square and 5th Ave) is unbeatable. Rooms are lovely, modern, clean, big and comfy. The first time we stayed in December 2008, we got an upgrade to the second level. When we went thesecond time we just had a standard room and to be honest the money isn't really worth it. The room is probably 50% bigger which is a good amount but is not really needed, the standard room is PLENTY big enough. The bathrooms are bigger to but again, not necessary, plus our view from the upgrade was of the roof of the building next door. The view from the standard room was of 42nd Street (Quite an inspiring view). The hotel has a new cafe that was opened in between our two stays and this provides croissants, fruit, cakes, cereal, crisps, chocolate and all hot and cold drinks you could want. It isn't 'cheap' but it is handy and great value. Alternatively the Grand Central Food Court (In the basement from the main Concourse of GC) has loads of cafes and is really cheap and very nice. And of course there is a Starbucks on every corner if you like a name. The lobby of the hotel is very nice as well which is always nice. The hotel is very cheap no matter how you book. The first time we booked flights and hotel seperately and it was around £750 for seven days, however we didn't take into account the taxes so it ended up costing around £800-£850. The second time we booked through Thomas Cook and for five days it was £750 so just shop around at the time you are booking. Location wise, the Tube is fantastic. Even better than London's to us because Manhattan is one narrow island. The Green Line goes North to South and can take you between museums on the Upper East down to Wall Street and Brooklyn Bridge. and connections on the tube can get you anywhere and everywhere. In the City itself, you must go to Soho as it is so nice. The atmosphere is really alive (Although don't go early as everywhere is shut... 12pm onwards is when shops open) and at night it comes alive. Really recommend Lombardi's Pizza, you will NEVER eat a tastier pizza. It's near Soho, corner of Spring & Mott Street (Get the Number Six Tube to Spring Street and go east two blocks) Anyway, on the whole New York is the most amazing city we have ever been to, and the Grand Hyatt New York is the ideal place to explore the city from. Can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: 255100Michael
Reviews.Content: Great location: 42nd Street, above Grand Central Station, just a few blocks from Times Square and Rockefeller Center

Reviews.Title: “very pleased with the stay. good service. perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissDee
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel for three reasons. First, the hotel has a super location. It is located right next to grand central station and just minutes away from 5th ave and the shopping. It was easy to walk everywhere, or take cabs since nothing was really far away. Second of all, the room was very comfortable. I don't mean the interior design. It was okay. When in hotels I seldom sleep good, but at the Hyatt I slept like home. The bed was super comfy (and I am really picky). The pillows were great. The room was facing an inner court yard which meant it didn't get a lot of light, which meant great sleep. There was a problem at check in (they lost our booking!), the next day the issue was resolved and the management did everything they could to make it up. The third reason I liked the hotel was the very friendly, kind, helpful and professional staff. They smiled all the time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very poor service”
Reviews.Author: HantsTourists
Reviews.Content: This is a good, huge NYC hotel in a cracking location. As a Christmas tourist location was very important, so being a few blocks from 5th, Empire State building etc was brilliant for us. The inside of the hotel is very dark, but grand feeling and constantly bustling. Whilst I probably would consider staying here again as the rooms aren't hideously expensive, I was let down by a few things. Firstly the service; I thought America prided itself on great customer service, it really wasn't apparent at this hotel with most staff not conducting themselves in an overly helpful manner (the customer IS king, remember!) and actually I wouldn't say they were understaffed, especially in the bar. Some of the staff at breakfast were very miserable looking it has to be said! Secondly, the expense of everything else. The rooms are a reasonable price, but $70 for breakfast for 2, you have to be kidding! $16 for a small glass of wine of average quality? $4 to "store" your bags whilst waiting for a taxi back to the airport!? Needless to say we didn't eat or drink at the hotel apart from breakfast and next time, I'm sure within a short walk we could find breakfast for less. Thirdly, the worst part of our stay, interconnecting doors between rooms and the general corridor noise. This is NOT a quiet hotel at all, which is probably to be expected for one of this size, but the interconnecting doors were a nightmare. Our "neighbours" seemed to enjoyed some slapping and rough sex at some ridiculous hours of the night/morning and was very tiresome. Due to the poor customer service, I couldn't be bothered to go down and argue my point as to why I would like another room as I have a feeling it would have been met with the usual "we can't do that", which seemed to be a common theme from reception staff to bar staff. All things considered, the rooms were spacious with good facilities, the hotel's location perfect and I would consider staying here again - if I could guarantee no interconnecting doors!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: smith551
Reviews.Content: cannot fault the hotel, we had a comfortable stay at the hotel could have done with a fridge in the room but the ice machine did the trick. i would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, will return”
Reviews.Author: Susana114
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed two nights for a work conference. I tried to do the online optional upgrade, but there was no record of that when I arrived, so I got a larger corner room at no added cost. (Thanks Anya at reception.) It had a good view and was very large for NYC. Location is PERFECT. Easy to catch the subway, walk to Times Square, shop Fifth Ave, everything you'd want in Midtown. Hotel room was extremely clean and well organized without a bunch of junky flyers all over. I recommend walking to Bryant Park Cafe for early dinner on the patio, then seeing Memphis. Loved it! This hotel was great and staff were super nice, always saying hello.

Reviews.Title: “mostly very very good”
Reviews.Author: shortwelshwoman
Reviews.Content: Check in has lots of desks, but not many staff. Staff acted 'normal' and not that awful over the top usual 'hi there!' cheesiness! were were in room 2447, 24th floor, looked across at another part of the hotel and no street view, but was fine, because it ws lovely and quiet all the time. the room had a very large walk in wardrobe room, with iron and ironing board, which we left up all the time. room was about 25msq, although it was an L shape. king size bed. good size bathroom, with shower over one of those baths thats only a foot high. only thing i didnt like about the room was the carpet, which always felt wet underfoot, but it wasnt wet. sticky and dirty, always wore shoes or just kept washing my feet. very good young man on concierge, who recommended getting taxis from the mezzanine level as they are several dollars cheaper. and we found they were, but not sure why?? verygood range of food and drink at The Market/deli in the hotel, which was good for breakfast on the go. yes, wish there were fridges in the room, but we coped. fantastic air-con in the room. it was too cold when we arrived, but easy to change it to what we wanted and it was quiet! room was serviced every day. so easy for using the subway and the M42 bus (takes you to the Circle Line boat tour) stops literally outside. instead of payig the huge taxi fee to the airport, we took subway (take 4, 5 or 6) one stop to 51st, change to the E (blue line) all the way to Jamaica. this costs $2.25 then you pay $5 to get on the Airtrain to the terminal. we would definately stay at the Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Extra friendly and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: ltwelves
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon, New York is the one place on earth Ihave always wanted to visit, so have been looking forwrad to this trip for about 1 yr! I must say the hotel exceeded our expectations, Once they found out it was our honeymoon they gave us a lovely big room with lots of space looking over Grand Central station, and the lady that checked us in on recpetion arranged for a bottle of wine and cheese to be sent to our room which was a lovely touch. All the staff we cam accross were so friendly and the guys in the Market Cafe down in the lobby were also great. Cannot rate this hotel enough, perfectly situated just down the road from the NY Libary and times square was only a 10 minute walk ... Hopefully we will get to visit New York again, and would definately love to stay at the Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: CocoHoliday1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central for 10 nights in July. We found it to be a fantastic base from which we could visit NYC. Location wise - it is in MidTown - which gives it walking distance to Times Square. But for those times when you didn't want to walk - the shuttle located in the Grand Central Terminal was a fantastic option. My husband is in the frequent travellers club - so we had access to the lounge every day and were able to have breakfast there in the mornings, and snacks/desserts etc in the evenings. We were able to get drinks (water/sodas/coffee/tea) most of the time there - which was also fantastic. Our room was lovely - the bed comfortable and the bathroom very clean and modern. We were not bothered by noise bar one night when some young teenages were staying next door and being very loud. We spoke to main reception and they sent someone up immediately to rectify the situation. The staff were lovely - but i felt not enough of them on the main desk for check in and check out. They allowed us to check in early at midday and gave a late check out at 1pm. Would happily recommend this hotel to people and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good But Could Use Improvement”
Reviews.Author: lj997
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time staying at the hotel, we had some problems with noise on a prior visit so made an effort to avoid that this time, mgmt seemed willing to help but the room we got was not up to par and we had to switch, the 2nd room seemed okay until we noticed how noisy the family in the room next door were, apparently they could not get two rooms with connecting doors so their kids kept running back and forth to their other room and each time the door would slam very loud, (the doors are very heavy and make a loud slam every time they close) we asked them to keep it down to no avail, so we switched again the next day, which was an inconveince since it interrupted our plans for the day but at least we got a quieter room. That room was not without flaws though as the bathroom had some chipped marble around the bath/sink and the toilet did not always flush completely. The maid on that floor was also not overly pleasant and seemed bothered when we asked for a remote for the tv as there was none in the room. Hostess in the restaurant downstairs was a bit rude when we asked to be seated for breakfest before they stopped serving. Overall, the stay was enjoyable but there is room for improvement, modern touches like the Marriotts have such as in room coffee makers and refrigerators would be nice and if a guest takes the time to make a reservation and contact the hotel about a special request well ahead of time, such as a quiet room or room with a view, it would be nice if the request was accomodated so the guest did not have to spend time resolving issues after they checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: CrazyDiamondEngland
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fantastic stay in the Grand Hyatt and would just like to wish all the staff at the hotel all the best for making our special trip all that better, from the moment we checked in to the unfortunate time we had to leave every body seemed to go out of their way to ensure that we enjoyed ourselves. The staff were professional and friendly without being over the top. The room was great (looking out onto the Chrysler Building) with plenty of space to put the wifes shopping, the room was always cleaned and was immaculate when we arrived back after a days sightseeing, with sore and aching feet. We had a couple of drinks in the bar one night and again was impressed by the relaxed and friendly atomosphere. Thanks again to the Management and staff. And boy...........wasn't New York hot????

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and hotel, just lacking in service”
Reviews.Author: Plymouthianwifey
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is unbeatable its walking distance to most attractions and next to Grand Central if you need the subway. The room was clean and comfortable although the lighting is poor which makes it seem a bit dingy. The main lobby is stunning!! It has beautiful marble flooring and a waterfall (although this was off when we were there but still looked lovely). The only let down was the service, we got the feeling the hotel was more aimed at business people, and as we were there for leisure purposes we felt a bit forgotten. We were in NYC to get married and were expecting a bit of fuss, (rose petals on the bed or something?!?) but there was no acknowledgement whatsoever. The hotel were aware of the wedding, as it was mentioned several times and everyone was taking photos in the lobby when I came down in my wedding dress!! The staff were mostly polite but not very helpful. The majority of the time there was no one at the front desk and we had to wait for them to come out from the back room. However the man who worked in the computer suite was more friendly than anyone!! He was happy to chat and very helpful about local sites, restaurants etc. I would recommend this hotel if you dont want much assistance from staff or if you're a business person.

Reviews.Title: “Met Expectations”
Reviews.Author: MFLetou
Reviews.Content: I wasn't going into this hotel expecting a lot, so it actually exceeded my expectations. Let me start with the positives: friendly staff, particularly for NY. I had a very positive experience at check in, with a clerk who actually took the time to care about my stay, gave me a few extra little perks and was generally helpful. Also, the people in the "market" store/cafe were very friendly and nice. Made an impression. The location is central--next to Grand Central. I had a deluxe king room, which was fairly roomy for NYC. The layout was a bit odd---sort of an L shape, with the tv as an artificial barrier between the entry and bed area--but it worked. Nice workspace. The negatives--the room was not very "fresh." Yes, it had a 37 inch LCD TV, and the decor was fine. But the carpet needs to go. It smelled sort of like a wet dog. It was purely a product of it being too old. Otherwise, the room was fine. The bathroom was very small--that didn't bother me much. The lobby was an happening place--for better or for worse. Its starting to look a little dated, also, I think--there's this waterfall type of thing which is fine, but its kind of got that glitzy Vegas in the 80s feel to it. The bed was nothing special. Not especially comfortable. For a NY room, though, it was quiet. Street noise was minimal, and interior nice was nonexistant which was a very pleasant surprise. I know this has been a problem at this hotel. At my request, I was given a room without a connecting door and I think that makes a difference. I'm picky but I didn't hear a thing. Overall, if the price is right, and you are looking for a "nice" hotel in New York--go for it. I do feel, however, that they are several million in updates away from being anything particularly special. Fix those carpets and then we'll talk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Seeing NYC!”
Reviews.Author: NeoNerd
Reviews.Content: As a header, we stayed here for a weekend visit as part of a longer trip to the US. We found it a great place to stay. I usually find it easier to break up the review, so here goes - Service Great. We were checked in quickly, and the staff were polite and courteous, without being overbearing. We experienced the same service from everyone in the hotel, which was great. Room We had two rooms, both on the 32nd floor. Both were large for NYC, one especially so. The bathrooms were a little small, but I didn't come to NYC to sit in the bath. The decor was fine, and both rooms were clean and had great views out over Midtown. The only downside was the placing of one of the rooms (the larger), which was directly across from the elevators. This inevitably led to a fair amount of noise, but there was nothing excessive about it. Location Really spectacular. No need to stress this any further. Right next to Grand Central Terminal, and within walking distance of pretty much anything you might want to see. Of course, if you need to take the Subway, then it's right next door. Value The room rate was good for the location, although the restaurant pricing was a little steep. Not excessive for NYC, but you can eat cheaper elsewhere. The snack bar/coffee chop in the lobby was great, though. Decently priced and the food was great. The Roast Beef sandwich I had really was excellent. Also, internet access was charged at $9.99 a day. Not sure why, really. So, to conclude, the hotel was great. We used it more as a base for exploring NYC, but it was an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel to SEE NYC”
Reviews.Author: RangerUSA1111
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and as Hyatt Platinum Members we were checked in less than two minutes. The Hotel is located right next to Grand Central Station which greatly helps with transportation in and around NYC. After checking in during a NYC heat wave 95 + degrees I noticed our room was not cooling to standard. I made one phone call to the front desk around midnight and a technician was sent instantly and fixed the issue in less than five minutes. Overall, the entire staff was excellent. I made the effort to talk with employees from almost all aspects of the Grand Hyatt operation. They all seemed committed to helping their guests have a great stay. In sum, the rooms were nice, the location can't be beat, and all our needs were met. They even let us check out at 1.00 pm, which was nice since we had to catch a train at 2.00 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: aftersometime
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is such a convenient hotel because the location is next to Grand Central Terminal near Times Square. The prices were excellent over the weekend; however, they sharply increased by $500 on Monday night. Other than that, the hotel was more elegant and approachable than the nightly rate implied.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: The_Family_M
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning after a long flight only to be told our room wouldn't be ready until 4pm, our children slept on the sofas in the lobby until we finally checked in around 3pm - not ideal. After all that our room was excellent with great views of the Chrysler building, there are no fridges in the rooms and the bathroom was quite small. This was our first visit to Manhattan and we were unsure if this was good location to explore from - as it turned out It definitely is right in the middle of midtown which is ideal for a first visit and that NY buzz, next time we will be in quieter less touristy district. This was the only hotel on our holiday that charged for internet access. The concierge desk is very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - Most Staff Excellent - Beautiful Lobby!”
Reviews.Author: TLD1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the 4th of July weekend. We received a great deal through Priceline for only $120 per night! The location was excellent...within walking distance to shopping, restaurants and entertainment. We had a smaller room, upon check in, but the air conditioner was not working. They quickly helped us into a larger room - no problems. The room was standard and smaller than what I was used to, but we did receive a great price through Priceline, so I could not complain. The lobby was beautiful and most of the staff that we dealt with were excellent! We drove in and the vallet staff was very helpful and made a few trips to our car to retreive additional items, when needed. The cafe staff was super nice and generous beyond expectation! The kids were fussing at one point, in the check-in line, and the desk staff gave them chocolate Turtles. My only two complaints were - First: that there was not a coffee pot in the room and there was a charge for coffee in the lobby cafe. We did receive two free coffee vouchers upon check-in, but of course, you need them daily, if you are a coffee drinker. Second: the bathroom was so small that you can actually hit your elbow on the sink countertop, which is also very small, no counter space, while trying to unroll the toilet paper. Guess this is normal for a standard room. For the price we paid, however, through Priceline, again, it was not a big issue. The subway and Grand Central was right next door - which was a huge plus, as we took the subway everywhere. Also, the concierge gave us great tips for a viewing location for the fireworks - for the 4th. He was very helpful and his advice was perfect! Wish I could remember his name. We never waited in line, we never met a rude staff member, we checked in quickly and easily, no noisy halls, quiet room despite hotel location! Overall, we had a great time! New York was wonderful! Hotel was very clean, great staff and perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Annoying at every turn”
Reviews.Author: kappatraveler
Reviews.Content: Check in lines very long. Used the kiosk for check in and the room was not ready. So went to check in my bag and the bellman said I needed my "check-in receipt." Let him know that the kiosk does not offer a check in receipt - he didn't care - "its policy miss." So I had to stand in line at main desk again for a check in receipt so I could store my luggage.....while I waited for my room. Once I got into my room - it was small but clean so acceptable. Bathroom sink has no vanity edge to it so there is absolutely no room to place anything other then a toothbrush next to the sink. Bed was comfortable and pillows fluffy. All was well until 1 am. This is a Thursday so not unexpected that party people would come back to the hotel drunk. They did. I called the front desk who did nothing to stop the screaming in the hallways. The party people went into their room - joy of joys - next to my room. Let's just say paper thin walls......and I'll leave it at that .... bring your earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DanielDP
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable: uptown or dowtown, you'll be happy to stay here, at just 2 minutes from subway and train station.. The rooms are not huge but they are nice enough. The service is very professional, like you'd expect at a Hyatt. I was looking for a minifridge in the room, but there wasn't any. Also, not sure if it was a malfunction but... in order to operate the hair dryer, you had to keep a button pushed on the wall appliance, so not exactly convenient. and the toilet paper holder was slanted and the toilet paper kept sliding out... but both of these small things didn't detract from an excellent stay. The bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel and exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: kathrichardson
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night for the 4th july celebrations, the rooms were spacious with 2 king size beds, the staff were very concerned that we were enjoying our stay , clean and bright, and good views, the only downsiee was that friends put their car in the car park and were charged $54 for one night, didnt expect that, and felt bad as we booked the hotel for them, but overall we would stay here again, my husband and i stayed last year and were pleased with it then, even better this year, would reccomend this hotel , be sure to use the complimenary shampoo and conditioner. lovely, use the hotel cabs or yellow ones and make sure you dont get ripped off with plain cabs at the airport, we were charged $140 from airport to hotel in manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous!!”
Reviews.Author: igasi
Reviews.Content: I liked it!! perfectly placed, luxe and great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowmarymartina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Grand Hyatt hotel for the first time spent 5 nights there and were very impressed. The receptionist was so friendly and helpful what a lovely welcome to our 2nd trip to NY, I cannot remember his name but he should be recognised for his customer service we stayed in room 1922 if his manager can trace him!! Our room was nice and well looked after by the staff clean towles every day would definately stay here again and recommend it to anyone. Lovely location in a wonderful city Bryantt park is a beautiful place for a carryout lunch and a rest. Loved south street sea port, the ride on the Shark speedboat staff lovely and Grayline bus tours great way to rest and learn about city. Can't wait to go back. Scottish family

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Genyi1681
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here during a trip to NYC with family and I have to say the Grand Hyatt is a mixed bag--not that fantastic, but not horrible either. First off, I think what you are really paying for is location, which is great--right next to Grand Central and within walking distance of a lot of NYC attractions. Also good was the lovely lobby, which has a little shop that sells yummy sandwhiches, drinks etc. However, there were a few negatives as well. There was a mix-up with our reservations-we had a number of rooms which we booked online to be on the same floor, so the whole family could be in the same part of the hotel. Ahead of time we were told this would be no problem. When we arrived we found this was not the case. This to me wasn't that big a deal, but what was a real hassle was the front desk staff, who tried to switch things, then couldn't, then said they could, then gave away some of our rooms by mistake, then tried to fix that, all while giving us the run around. It took much longer than necessary to sort out (hours), and I could tell the staff really didn't care one way or the other about fixing things. So if you are looking for great service don't come here. Also the many reviewers who said the rooms need updating are correct. I was surprised, after seeing how lovely the lobby was, that the rooms were really just average, outdated, and a bit on the small side (bathroom was tiny). However, we didn't spend that much time in the room anyway, so if you are looking for a simple base of operations, it serves its purpose. Did have some street noise and noise from other guests walking down hallways, etc. while trying to sleep, so I'd say it needs some soundproofing too. Also made the mistake of going to the bar one night and two drinks cost $30, which I thought was ridiculous, even by NYC standards. Overall I'd say the experience was average--not great and not terrible. It's up to you if you think the great location balances out paying a bit too much for a really average room and no-frills service.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: crdanuk
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Sofitel my previous time in NYC, I was expecting considerably more from the Hyatt. Admittedly, we only stayed here to use Hyatt points, but it couldn't even get close to the Sofitel. Although things may have changed, it's a very tired hotel - the rooms were definitely in need of being upgraded - they're quite dark and, although quite spacious, are a bit run down, with carpets fraying around the edges. Certainly when compared with the grandeur of the lobby, the rooms are a let down. The concierge was also not as useful as the Sofitel. Given there are so many places to eat in NYC, a bit of advice is helpful - the guys at the Sofitel seemed to really listen to what you were saying and help you choose exactly the kind of place you were looking for; here, it felt like the concierge were just working off a list - you want steak, go here; you want fish, go here. No consideration of price/location etc. Again, I expected more. Location is excellent though - about a 10 minute walk from Time Square, and being right near Grand Central station means getting about is really easy. In summary, there are surely many better in NYC (clearly I was a fan of the Sofitel!) given the price of the rooms. I'll try something else next time...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in all respects!”
Reviews.Author: jacko0892
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt New York for 5 nights over the July 4 celebrations. The hotel is in a fantastic location just 10 minutes walk from Time Square and the staff are all very friendly and helpful. The rooms were pristine and the beds were comfortable. I really enjoyed my stay at the Grand Hyatt and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, terrible service- many better options in NY”
Reviews.Author: sunahmad
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I live in New York but decided to stay in this hotel to just celebrate our 2 yr anniversary. He travels a lot and is a diamond member so we get great treatment at Hyatts. All but this one... First off, the rooms are nothing to rave about and the bathrooms are tiny. Our key card refused to work despite having it fixed twice. The snacks in the lounge are not good at all. This is the first time we have seen that you have to pay for alcohol in the lounge. The front desk told us that breakfast was till 11 and when we stopped by at 10:20 nothing was available anymore. The service is incredibly rude. This one lady at the front desk refused to talk to us because she thought we were not diamond members and when we told her we were she said "Oh, someone will be with you shortly" while she continued doing nothing. She did the same to the next person who got so mad he wanted to talk to her supervisor. Overall, for a tourist, this is a great location (and it has a nice gym), but honestly, for this price there are a lot of better hotels with great locations in New York. For someone looking for a special time, I would not recommend this hotel at all. Thanks Hyatt...my boyfriend tried to do something special for me and you ruined it. What a disappointment...

Reviews.Title: “Needs big time renovation. Very...”
Reviews.Author: jusmagk
Reviews.Content: Needs big time renovation. Very disappointing stay at Grand Club room. Smelly rooms, tiny bath rooms, outdated lounge set up. Said renovations are coming next year. Can't come soon enough. Should've stayed at the Starwoods.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a fab location”
Reviews.Author: l0uise67
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 nights at the end of feb. had loads of snow & central park in the snow was beautiful. hotel is in a really good location next to grand central station and near the chrysler building. was my 2nd trip to new york & would go back tomorrow & definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, OK facilities”
Reviews.Author: Netwiz
Reviews.Content: I'd give this 3.5 if I could. I stayed for three nights at a conference. I won't repeat a load of stuff, but the key points for me were Positive - friendly staff - big rooms - clean - coffee shop in foyer - Tmobile wifi in room - room service was efficient Negative and positive - seemed to be overcharged for room service, but the checkout staff sorted it out Negative - no coffee maker in room - no fridge in room - bath was very shallow, and very low down - room key expired even though I had late checkout

Reviews.Title: “Not what expected”
Reviews.Author: JUXPrague
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights in Oct 09, group of 3 people. Pros: great location, just opposite the Chrysler Building. Lot of restaurants, business areas etc, nice gym. Cons: The rooms are quite worn off. Not exactly what you would expect from Hyatt hotels chain. The service is not that excellent, again when compared to expectations that arise when you go to Hyatt hotel

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hen weekend!”
Reviews.Author: MarriedUk
Reviews.Content: We found a great deal last minute staying at the Grand Hyatt. We weren't expecting much but was pleasently suprised when we got there! The hotel looks very simple from the outside but very extravagant once you get into the foyer area. There are stairs but also escalator and I think there were lifts along the side entrance...check this if you need wheelchair access though. We were quickly checked in but although we were promised rooms together when booking, we were separated. Afetr we complained, we were booked into the adjoining suits which were wonderful! Bedroom sizes were decent. beds were a bit smaller then we expected (we assumed USA doubles would be alot bigger then UK!) luckily we were able to squeeze in. The bathrooms were very standard. thye had hairdryers, showers, no baths, showers were a little dated with thos dodgey shower curtains :( but did the job. Location of the hotel was fantastic. It was literally next door to Grand Central Station. A short walk away from Time Square and we were able to walk (a bit longer) to Central park. Grand Central station is wonderful for meals, has a few small shops and trains are easy to use to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Srikg
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Food is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -- pricey”
Reviews.Author: lmg1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family for a family vacation. I made reservations through American Express Travel Agency so we could use our points. Even with that, the hotel is expensive. We got two rooms, one for parents and the other for our daughter and her fiance. Our room, a double was spacious and with a good view of 42nd street. The other room, a king, was much smaller and with no real view. However, the smaller room was less expensive. Service at the hotel was very good. We had good experiences with the food mart, congierge, and wait staff. I travel quite a bit and felt they were very responsive. One of our rooms was on the "business plan" which included 1 breakfast, 1 bottle of water, shirt pressing, and wireless access each day. This is a good value. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is right next to grand central station, where you can get the east side trains and a shuttle to the west side trains. It is a 6 (long) block walk to times square. There is a good food court, an extensive food market, and shops in Grand Central station and good access to stores, etc. 1/4 block east on Lexington Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: WiscSunseeker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt during a recent trip to NYC. The location was fantastic, directly next to Grand Central station. The impressive lobby hustled with activity, with a large convention staying at the hotel. Interesting that there was a significant police presence outside the hotel. I'm not sure if this was due to the convention, Grand Central, or was the normal course in this location of NYC. But, you will feel very safe in this area. Rooms were nice, quiet and updated. Bathroom was small, but nice. Very nice fitness center. My only complaint would be the T-mobile wifi they use which kept booting me off the system. Otherwise had no issues, but am a very low maintenance traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Not the cleanest but good location”
Reviews.Author: wownorthants
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for my husbands 50th birthday and so I really wanted it to be special. We have never been to NY and expected better from this hotel. Apart from the Grand entrance there was nothing Grand about it. Our first room smelled so horrible that we asked to be moved. The second room wasnt much better, it smelled as though no-one had been in it for weeks. The bathroom was yuk! Moldy shower curtain and no fan even though there was no window to open. It looked as though it should be deep cleaned or re- decorated. The toilet blocked on the last day (thank goodness we were leaving!!) Overall very impersonal ,and we had to pay 12 dollars to leave our bags in the bell room for half a day. We have always left luggage in other hotels and never been charged. Would not visit this hotel ever again. On the plus side good location and so much to see in NY that we didnt have to stay in this room for long!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rickybarton
Reviews.Content: Good size rooms. Very clean. Lovely big foyer. Great view of Chrysler Building from our window. Comfortable beds. Next door to Grand Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; needs updating”
Reviews.Author: ssahi2007
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt in Manhattan- location is excellent; snack bar in the lobby is great; ballroom lovely. Amenities/rooms leave much to be desired. We were part of a group who were to be given special rates; we did not get these rates. The room was OK, bathroom too small and the toilet had an overflow problem. They really need to update the rooms and the elevator lobbies on all floors. Concierge pretty helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: JPDVLD
Reviews.Content: I am a long-time Hyatt Diamond member, and we were staying with points (hence the lack of a value rating). The hotel is overall one of the better places to stay in NYC, but has a few problems that I wish they'd address. One was the check-in duration. At other Hyatts, I am used to being at the desk just a few minutes. Here everything was in slow motion, including a problem with the reservation that inadvertently dropped the last night of our stay. It was eventually fixed, but only after about 20 minutes or more, including a trip to the back office to consult with a manager. Upon return, the receptionist mumbled something about a "new computer system". A second problem was the internet service, which was terrible. I am running a corporate laptop with Windows XP, and was losing the service every 5-10 minutes despite "excellent signal strength" on the wireless. I called the T-Mobile support number and was told that they have a known problem with XP, and that I should get some kind of adjunct wireless device from the front desk. I didn’t bother, since I was using it only a little while each AM before going out to sightsee, but if I had been on a business trip, and needed to get work done, I would have been furious. Since I have no problem with the same computer elsewhere in the country when I travel, I can only conclude that it’s their ISP or server set-up. According to Wikipedia, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Usage_share_of_operating_systems, 50 % or more of the computers connecting to the internet are running XP, so they shouldn’t be having these kinds of problems. Lastly were the elevators. They had an event Saturday evening which had a large grpoup tranisiting from the lobby to the ballroom floor. They had reserved an elevator with a operator for the event. This in itself was fine, except that the other elevators weren’t all operating. That same elevator was the only one returning to the lobby level, but regular hotel guests couldn’t use it. A long line of hotel guests trying to get to their rooms formed, and only after a minor rebellion did we get to board the elevator. It seemed at other times also that only one or two elevators were responding, which kept them unnecessarily crowded on every trip. Again, Hyatt remains one of my favorite hotel chains, and none of these problems are deal-breakers; they’re just little operational nuisances which a hotel of this caliber should fix immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Once beautiful.. what happened to the Grand Hyatt NYC???”
Reviews.Author: Ms.Me2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property several times over a few years...what happened?!?!?! The location is key - its attached/next to Grand Central Station. Valet parking was very quick and easy. Check in was easy - there is also a Web Check in option *(not sure if this is a gold passport only option or not?) Room #1 - disgusting. I do not understand how this room passed a housekeeping inspection. It smelled like moldy/mildew/old wet furniture, huge stain on bed, smallish room. If the bedding had a huge stain on it - who knows whats on the floor or IN the bed. Call to front desk moves us to room #2. Room #2 - smaller room - smelled better but there is a stain on the bedding. (cmon housekeeping...) Yucky stain on carpet near bed. The hotel has a new Market store in the Lobby. Its pretty nice - various beverages, sweets, to go pre packaged salads, quick sandwiches - as of right now its not 24/7.. Commodore Grill was good - food and service were problem free. :) In addition to the TV & traditional lobby check outs, you can do Web Check out as well. wow.
