Positives/Pros: The location location location!! Some employees are helpful. Web check in/out option. Some of the views are great. Negatives/Cons: Untidy rooms, elevators take a LONNNNNG time. Parking OMG!! $53 a night for valet! Some employees give you a vibe that you are disturbing their chat time. I'm not sure if this hotel is just hit or miss with the rooms. The hotel was definitely not sold out and the room was booked via Hyatt (not a 3rd party/priceline/hotwire). What a stay. I prefer not to stay at this Hyatt until they renovate or have a top to bottom professional cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: sm405
Reviews.Content: I recently had an amazing stay at the Grand Hyatt New York just a few days ago. It was a very special occasion and the hotel went out of the way to make the stay perfect. The room was very clean and reasonably posh. I am a Diamond member (stay 50 nights+ a year at Hyatt) of the Hyatt Gold Passport program, and so the hotel manager was very kind and gave me a complimentary upgrade to a suite...amazing considering its in new york city! That aside, even if you're not a Diamond member, this hotel is amazing. Their staff is the best, the rooms are good, and they want to make your stay perfect. The location is amazing. You're right next to Grand Central Station, in the heart of NY, just a mile away from Broadway (about a 20-30 minute walk, a few minute taxi ride). For those people with access to the Regency Club (you can pay a little extra for access)...it is well worth the additional cost! The breakfast has a wide spread, the afternoon snacks and desserts are simply wonderful. My keys died a few times, but that was such a small issue. The staff was very apologetic when it happened. Quite frankly, I didn't care about this. The hotel staff was so wonderful. They also give free black&white cookies around 3-4pm (which is check-in time)... a nice touch. While I didn't use the concierge service, I have heard that it is very good. Many elevators, so even in a full hotel you don't have to wait too long. As someone who stays over 50 nights a year at hotels, overall, this is one of the best hotels I have ever had the pleasure of staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - it is in a great position”
Reviews.Author: davidandhannah
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and very helpful, clean, good sized room, bathroom a bit tired but adequate. Excellent location for sightseeing, 10 minutes walk to Times Square. Best hotel if you are travelling in by bus (New York Airport Services) as it stops opposite the hotel. Also, there is a PC in reception linked to all airline websites that allows you to check in your flights home and print off boarding passes Recommended for all travellers

Reviews.Title: “Beyond belief”
Reviews.Author: ZurichDaniel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights this week. When checking in, I specifically asked for a quiet room. What I got given was a room facing the main street (42nd street if I am not mistaken) with a connecting door. This door was so badly isolated that I could understand every word spoken in the next room door and this went on for the whole night. The overall appearance of the rooms (while spacious) was not inviting, no minibar, dated furniture and finishings and I just wanted to leave again. When I finally got up at 5am because the noise was so bad, I went down to the lobby but there was nobody staffing the lobby until about 0605am. At least they immediately gave me a new room which was quiet enough this time. I did however find a huge bug on the bathroom floor (dead already) so I think this room wasn't used in a while. Also the smell of the room was so bad that I had to open both windows upon entereing. All in all this hotel is one big joke and I have never felt so *not at home* in any hotel anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “New York City "For The 3rd Time" :)”
Reviews.Author: MandyA1
Reviews.Content: After visiting New York City twice before and staying in Times Square, we decided to stay in a different Hotel "The Grand Hyatt" This hotel is amazing. Upon arrival we were greeted by pleasant door men and the interior of the Hotel is beautiful. Very quick check in, Very Big, Comfy & Clean rooms. Excellent views of the Chysler Building, Empire State Building and within 5 min walk to 5th Ave!!! Plenty of Pizza places over the road and TGI's is within 5 min walk. Times Square 10 min walk, Macy's 20 min walk. Going at this time of year is lovely as you get to still see the xmas decorations and Central Park is breath taking around 5pm!! I love this City! A must for all travellers. I would definately recomment this hotel!!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for our first NYC trip!”
Reviews.Author: Tigerlily2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in April with 3 friends. We had two rooms both on the 32 floor which had great views of the city. The location is superb esp for first time visitors as it's so close to the subway and you can also walk to a lot of places with relative ease. Rooms are very nice - clean and comfortable. No mini bar or tea and coffee facilities but you could eaily get a Starbucks in reception. All in all this was a great choice and I would reccomed it. We got a great deal through hotels.com about £900 per room for 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry but not such a Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: look4more
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 4 nights and we were not impressed. The hotel is located at what I would consider the commercial part of town so minimal shopping and attractions but is very convenient (next door) to Grand central station. Check-in was smooth, check-out was, well, we had to talk to the check-out machine and I do not think this is how you should check out of a Grand Hyatt hotel. The room was large but dull, the bathroom was very small and didn’t have a bathroom mirror. If you wanted to use the internet you had to pay for the access (you’re better off going to McDonalds). It would appear that the hotel is too large and lost it’s professional and personal touch. If you are looking for somewhere with a bit more activity look around Union Square and Times Square. Overall a very expensive and disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: shopkitten
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Central Hyatt for 4 nights with a group of female friends for a 30th birthday trip this April. It is one of the oddest hotels I have stayed in. It is a massive hotel, very impersonal -I didn’t speak to a member of the hotel staff during the entirety of my stay (I was delayed so my friends checked in without me.) The lobby is more like an office reception/conference centre than a hotel. However it is well located and rooms were large and modern. The bathroom could have been cleaner, but overall it was acceptable. If you get a cheap rate – go for it, overall better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service & value”
Reviews.Author: RackRate
Reviews.Content: My bride and I stayed for five nights during recent anniversary trip and had friends also staying during a portion of the trip. The hotel location was ideal (it is next to Grand Central Station after all) so we could either easily walk or conveniently catch the subway to anywhere we wanted to venture. The lobby and common areas are very nice and appealing, as were the restaurant and bar. Service was very prompt, accomodating and friendly from the doorman to check-in throughout our stay. Only ate breakfasts at the hotel but they were really quite good, though pricey if not included in the stay. Given the traffic both within and without the hotel, I found it amazingly quiet at night and was able to sleep well. The only negatives were that the room was small and somewhat tired and the toilet was definitely a two-flush minimum. Given the overall product, I found the price very reasonable and significantly lower than lesser hotels I have stayed in NYC. I would stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but needs a good cleaning”
Reviews.Author: cober6711
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a result of being trapped in NYC due to a cancelled flight. The lady who checked me in was very friendly, and gave me a very large corner room on the 30th floor. I thought all was well, until I got to the room. The room had all kinds of nasties in it. The toilet was dirty, there were hairs in the bath tub, and there was even a Haagen-Dazs lid right next to the bed. I asked to be moved, and was given the key to a much smaller and much less desirable room. I ended up asking for the old room back, but that it first be cleaned up. This was done, and an hour or so later a bottle of wine showed up at the room, which I had to politely decline due to me being a little too young to drink at the time, and exchange it for a breakfast certificate and a few bottles of water. Despite this problem with the cleanliness, the room itself was good. Not to mention the breakfast buffet was very, very good. Next time, I'd probably stay somewhere else if given the choice. The cleanliness aspect left a sour taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best: an oasis of professionalism and warmth”
Reviews.Author: hobbyistravel
Reviews.Content: As someone who travels a lot for business and as much as I can for pleasure, I think this hotel is one of the very best I have ever experienced. I’ve stayed here several times ~ alone on business, with colleagues for a conference, and most recently, together with my family ~ four stays in the last couple of years. What makes a great hotel? I would say consistency of excellence. For us, this hotel has never failed to disappoint. The staff are absolutely first-class. At check-in, you always see a line of smiling Hyatt check-in agents. Yes, sometimes, at busy times you might have to wait. But when it’s your turn, you aren’t rushed. The staff gives everyone the time they need to ask questions, they explain about the hotel’s amenities, and they are unfailingly cheerful and polite. They help with finding you the right room, discussing with you what’s more likely to be quiet, or to have a little extra space. As a tripadvisor member wrote when s/he checked in early, the front desk agent told her they love early check-ins because it gives them more time to get to know you. How many times have you been told this when you’ve checked in early? And they absolutely mean it. In the executive club lounge, if you are lucky enough to be on that floor or have access through your status, again, you encounter first class staff who do everything they can to give you a great (relaxing) experience during the daytime, and to speed things along so everyone gets a great breakfast in the morning. The food and snacks in the lounge have always been very high quality as well – gourmet deserts you’d pay a fortune for if you were outside the hotel, for example. Every room I have had has been spotless, the amenities reflect Hyatt’s high standards, and whenever I see housekeeping staff they invite me to have a nice day. I haven’t had service like this, first rate on every level, at any hotel, and over the last few years I've been Diamond with Hilton as well as Hyatt, and stayed in big cities all over North America and Europe (although I haven’t traveled much in Asia where I hear the hotels are also a cut above). As a final word, for a recent visit, I mentioned to the manager (Mike), that it was my mother’s 70th birthday and I was a repeat guest. From that point onwards, nothing was too much trouble, from allocating us the perfect room, to treats and amenities, and a genuine concern to make sure that my mother had a great trip and we were all really well taken care of to the best of their (considerable) abilities. For example, at check-in, the front desk agent (Diane) showered us with kindnesses, from fruit & wine for my mother, to t-shirts and cookies for my daughter, as well as coupons to try out their excellent new Marketplace in their lobby (a great addition which has high quality ready prepared food and snacks you can grab and go, in other words, bye bye expensive room service - why don't more hotels do this?) And did I mention the location? You can’t finish a review of this hotel without saying that it is superb- well, you can see that throughout the reviews – what I wanted to add was that in NYC, famous for its brusque service, this hotel is an oasis of professionalism and warmth. I will never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Will definatly stay again on my next visit!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenem19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Very stylish, modern rooms. Perfect location for all the shops on 5th avenue!! Staff very friendly and polite. Bar and hotel lobby were gorgeous. We took the Hotel taxi back to the airport and the chauffer was 5*. A much safer and more comfortable ride then the yellow cab from the airport!! Will definatly stay here again when i return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Big Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next door to Grand Central Terminal. It has a massive lobby, filled with tourists. I found out that I had to bob and weave to get by these folks every day. The hotel has no club floor. As a platinum member, I was given a free card for water or coffee only. I thought I was to get breakfast. Service was fine...they were great about the late check out. The room was average in size and quality. Nothing wrong. I think I prefer the Marriott down the street. I love their club lounge that you get at the highest level. It was really zooey at this hotel, though really convenient to get on the train and home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel top location”
Reviews.Author: ineedacompass
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to Grand Central on 42nd, a perfect location for exploring Manhattan. Staff all over the hotel from the reception staff, bus boys and cleaners were extremely friendly and helpful. A really nice hotel too, very modern and huge reception. There's always someone there. It looked like the majority of people staying there were business people but there were people with babies and young and old people from around the world. Our room had two (small) double beds in it and was a good size for two people, it was also cleaned every day. I would recommed this hotel to anyone coming to New York for either business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ceilidancer5
Reviews.Content: Traveled to NYC with mom, daughter and sisters for a "girls weekend." The hotel staff we encounered were all friendly and accomodating: from the people at the reception desk, to the concierge who recommended a restaurant and made reservations for us, to the lovely woman who cleaned our room each morning. The rooms were clean well appointed and modern. The hotel is located at Grand Central Station making transportation by subway very convenient. In addition, there were always doormen willing to flag down a cab if you needed one. The lobby is beautiful and since it was Mother's Day weekend the hotel had giant cookies for all the moms. It was a fabulous weekend and much of the success was due to the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaddyBadger
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel after a some what traumatic episode at the airport we were suitably impressed with out 1st impression of the Grand Hyatt as we walked through reception. Fab reception area with quite special water feature. To be honest it just continued to get better. When we checked in we were automatically upgraded to larger room and given some complimentary vouchers for drinks in the coffee shop. Got to our room as were more than happy with the size of our room after reading so many reviews about small rooms in Manhatten. On 3 occasions we called upon the Concierges recommendation for dinner and Christopher did not disappoint, TOP MARKS!! Location is Great, 10 min walk to Time Square, 2 Second walk to Grand Central. Only downside with the hotel was our aircon wasnt the greatest, but other than that I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: HannahGotobed
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days on a winter trip to New York. Perfect location, right next to grand central station and near to Times Square. First night I had to stay on a camp bed, but we got free breakfast for the rest of the stay as a result which more than made up for it. Breakfast were great - the egg chef made great omlettes!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and service.”
Reviews.Author: RSM40
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels and this is the first time I have been compelled to write a review on tripadvisor. The Grand Hyatt NY staff was extremely nice and helpful and the location could not have been better. The room was clean and spacious. The bathroom is about an average size for NYC. My wife was very happy to spend her birthday weekend there and we will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for 3 Night Stay - What Else Could you Want?”
Reviews.Author: clairebear22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of April for our first trip to NYC - we expected the bedroom and bathroom to by TINY - we had the most basic room type and expected nothing major. Well when we arrived the location was great as we expected - the checkin was quick - the lady gave us a few vouchers to get a free drink from the little coffee shop in the lobby - got some bottled water which was much needed! We were on floor 21 and our room was a perfect size for 3 night stay. Desk big bed and desk. Window with view across road - and tall building but we didn't expect a room with a view so fine. bathroom not bad - adequate size sink, and bath with shower in it - fantastic - OK the bath looked half hight but never used it anyway - just showered. No complaints although we did not eat at the hotel. I used TA before we went and used the advise given - we went across the road the pershing sqaure (think thats right)which was great - went there every morning - lovely to watch people and the world go by. We walked all over - and went to the lovely bar in the grand central station right next door. Location as everyone says is great! Booked night time visit to empire state building with concierge which were helpful, offering us advice for jazz places etc too. Hallways looked new and clean and although rooms seem to have had touch up you can tell the bathrooms need abit more work, and the ceilings in the bedroom etc - but maybe they are next. All in all would go back to this hotel - had a drink in the bar one night and it was VERY dark in there - but found that in NYC generally - the restaurants etc are all quite dimly lit - took us a while to adjust our eyes! Book this hotel and go - good service and only complaint would be could hear some noisy guests who were in the corrider 1 morning early - and 1 night very late - but I blame the unthoughtful and rude guests rather than the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Musty, dank, outdated, busy, crowded”
Reviews.Author: garyfong
Reviews.Content: Check in has a computerized kiosk. When I checked in at 10pm, it said, "your room is not ready yet". So the bellman directed me to the long lineup (10pm) and they found me a room. I'm an Amex Centurion, so I got the upgrade to a corner suite. OMG it was awful. A parlor suite, one TV wasn't working, it smelled like mildew and gym shoes. The bellman said it was that the air conditioning wasn't working. Of course, then the air conditioning didn't work until you turned it down to 62 degrees, and after about half an hour, it was freezing. Room service was HILARIOUS. I got the sirloin steak (nice piece of tissue, thanks!) and it was over sun-dried tomatoes that were drowning in gravy. It was so bad I put ketchup on it! Calls to the front desk were a minimum of five minutes. I did not read tripadvisor before I went there. I should've.

Reviews.Title: “grand by name grand by nature”
Reviews.Author: Tess03
Reviews.Content: Just got back from new york after stopping at the Grand Hyatt on 42nd street. well what can i say absolutly fabulouses. cannot knock this hotel. from entering into the lobby which is 2 stories high and with a grand water feature. its right on top of grand central station so theres the first thing you do after exploring the grand hyatt hotel. we where booked in for a five night stay, and the reception desk which has at least 8 reception staff where more than welcoming after a long journey from newcastle. asked if we wanted papers delivered to our room. Complimentary of course.. our room was on the 219th floor but they have five lifts to the 19th and five to the top so plenty of lifts no waiting about. the room is very large in comparision with some of the new york hotels i have stopped in. a kingsize bed with Marble night tables. theres a table with lamp on it a plasma tv and even internet computer, at a cost of 10 dollars for 24 hours use. safe inside the cabinet which has the tv on it. double walk in wardrobe with mirror doors. iron and board extra blankets and cushions. the bathroom is well equipted with toiletries including toothpaste. shower over the bath (small bath but this is usual in new york). towels which are soft to the touch and replaced every day. the maid come every day and the place is nipping clean. at reception theres a mini market with fresh bagels and muffins with boxed salads to go and the usual stuff like chocolate and drinks. we only had one drink each at the bar which cost 18 dollars for two pints of lager.( bit on the expensive side). theres a ballroom if your into this kind of stuff and loads of other stuff which we never bothered with. theres even the gym on the top floor. as i said grand by name and grand by nature. i would defo recommend this hotel to anybody travelling to new york. once you get over how nice this place is its only 6 blocks up to times square and all the usual new york hustle and bustle. enjoy it i promise you will.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: RemembertheAlamo
Reviews.Content: We went to the Grand Hyatt for a birthday weekend. I would probably rate the experience a 3.5 star, but I will admit I am pretty picky. I will share the good and the bad for us. The Good: #1 - Location, location, location!!! Just very central to everything. We walked to the theater, walked a lot on 5th Avenue, walked to Central Park, walked to the Empire State... You get the point. You can not beat the location. Subway is directly underneath the hotel which quickly takes you up and down Manhattan to anywhere you want to go. What else: The lobby is very nice and spacious. The air conditioning is very pleasant (it was hot in NYC). The staff is professional and courteous. The bed was very comfortable. And did I mention location? There are a lot of options to eat nearby. So for breakfast we would just find a local place and at. Grand Central Market, which is very nice, is right there! The Not so Good: Our main complaint is around the room itself, which was "average" to say the best. - The hotel is pretty worn. Our room looked dated. - Bathroom was very small and had a lot of wear on it. It needs some serious updating. - Bathroom had no tub, and we were in an apartment suite! - The hotel does not get much natural light, so the rooms tend to be a bit dark. - A lot of hallway noise at all times. The other problem we had was getting good advice from the concierge. They were very nice and polite, but the advice they give is very generic and super-conservative. For example they told us to plan for a one hour ride to La Guardia and to be there two hours before due to security. We did that. It took us 15 minutes to get to LaGuardia (it was a Sunday) and there was nobody in the security line. So we waited at the airport for over 2.5 hours. The hotel prices for food are insane. $9 for drip coffee!!!! But this was easy to solve as you just walk half a block and there are options everywhere. Overall it was fine and the location was great. The room is just to sleep. But as a hotel we have to say our expectations were pretty high as this is the "GRAND Hyatt", and we did not find it very Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: travel_nut10UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in February and it was amazing! The hotel was beautiful - right in the centre of Manhattan. It's a bit pricey to eat in the hotel but there are loads of other places around Times Square etc you can eat. Can't fault the place - you even get free Starbucks in the mornings when you sign up to their website! Totally fantastice - great time :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: wendy1461
Reviews.Content: Just spent 8 nights in New York (first visit to the Big Apple) at the Grand Hyatt. Nice size room & bathroom and a very comfortable King Size bed. Location is great. Walking distance to most central attractions....but if you want to use the Subway...Grand Central Station is right next door. For those who haven't used the New York Subway...it's very safe and user friendly. The Hotel....despite being in the City that never sleeps...is fairly quiet except for the Emergency Services who love to use their sirens. The Gym is well equipped and the restaurants are first class. Down in the lobby there are several stores including a coffee shop for a quick breakfast. Well worth the stay. Thank you also to the wonderful staff who made our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Air Shaft Overnight”
Reviews.Author: PaulusHookJC
Reviews.Content: I booked the Grand Hyatt via Priceline and paid about $140 for a Friday night (I had to stay late at work and return early, so the hotel was booked entirely for sleeping). The check-in/check-out process was great. I used the kiosk. The only suggestion I would have for the kiosk, would be to have the opportunity to see a map of the floor when choosing a room. I chose a room on a high floor, but when I got upstairs, I was disappointed to see that my room was not only directly across from the ice machine and employee room, but it was also overlooking an air shaft. And it was LOUD. The room had a strange off smell (something of a smell covering up another smell). I was surprised that the television has limited over-air channels, rather than access to cable. So other than NY1, I couldn't watch local news. Ultimately the bed was comfortable. The bathroom, while quite small, had everything necessary. There was only a stand up shower. Fine for me, as I can't imagine who would ever take a bath in a mid-range NYC hotel. :-) Of course, the location at Grand Central was perfect for getting to and from work on the 4-5-6. I think if I was going to come to NYC for vacation, I'd stay farther south in the city for a bit more breathing room.

Reviews.Title: “Fab 1st time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: lou2765
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for location, close to Time Square, Grand Central Station, Central Park and the beautiful Bryant Park. The hotel was clean and staff very curious.We found the bedrooms a little small for a family of four but to be honest we didnt spend much time in the rooms as we spent our five days out sightseeing from 8am to 6pm each day, but we returned each day to a hot shower, plenty of clean towels and a comfy bed. An added extra, tea and coffee facilities in the room would be nice. Our holiday was to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday, which the travel company had highlighted in our booking, but this wasnt recognised by the hotel, some sort of upgrade or even a basket of fruit would have been a nice gesture and greatly apprecited. Overall we had a fantastic time in NYC. We would love to return one day, and wouldnt hesitate in booking this hotel or recommending to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel, but not a luxury one”
Reviews.Author: Drayster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the third night of our volcano-enforced extended stay in NYC. The Grand Hyatt is really well located, in an odd little raised bit of Park Avenue and with a 42nd st frontage just above Grand Central Station (views of the Chrysler building etc. and midtown manhatten all around you). The lobby has a vast marble fountain and lots of gold, and my first impression was that it would be one of the really splendid Hyatts (such as the one in Johannesburg). Well, it was all right -- our room on the 23rd floor was quiet, super clean and very comfortable King bed etc. -- it was a fine business hotel but not a luxury one (I measure that by the impersonal attitude of the staff-- efficient but nothing extra -- and the fact that the fitness room while well equipped had no sauna or steamroom or changing rooms, let alone a swimming pool, and there were none of the amenities such as bathrobes in the rooms or minibars that you'd expect in a first rank hotel. The room price was not exorbitant for Manhatten ($300) but still a little high, but then you are paying for the brand and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: shubz81
Reviews.Content: It is awsome place in new york ....... located well center. you will get best rates aswell if you book in advance

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: leonGreece
Reviews.Content: Very good price,very nice service and the best location in NY for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Good and clean but a bit loud.”
Reviews.Author: prldecivic
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean, location is great, employees were very nice, comfy bed, nice lobby, near subway, taxis available in front, Cons: No fridge, bathroom is pretty small, Noise through connecting doors. If you are a light sleeper you may have problems sleeping at night due to the connecting room doors, most of the rooms have connecting doors and the noise from the room next door can be heard very loud through the door. The first night was perfect, the room next to us was empty, the following night we could hear a couple laughing and talking next door until about midnight, the 3rd night we could hear a couple making "love" (yes you could hear all the moans and noises) for about 45mins until close to 1am. Very uncomfortable, imagine if we had kids with us? It was a good stay minus our loud neighbors. I believe if the hotel would just get rid of the connecting doors the rooms would be a lot quieter. If you are a light sleeper make sure you ask for a high room, we were on the 28th floor and could still hear the sirens through the night slightly, i can only imagine how loud they were on the lower lvls. I'd like to point out that the concierge desk had very helpful and nice people, the front desk staff was very polite and the housekeeping staff was very thoughtful, first day we had the TV on and the housekeeping staff didnt even bother to knock, they just skipped our door as we could hear them knock on the neighbors doors. The next day they knocked very lightly saying housekeeping in a low voice and i said busy and they moved along. So many housekeeping staff in other hotels knock very loud, banging on the door yelling HOUSEKEEPING and you can hear them all the way down the halls. The rooms were clean, but you can tell its an older hotel. They are starting to look worn down and will need to be renovated soon. The room did have a LCD tv though which was good since i had seen some pics with tube tvs. Location was great, couple blocks from 5th ave. for shopping, about a 20min walk up 5th ave to central park, times square isnt to far either. Central station is right next door. Overall it was a good stay, we booked through priceline so our room cost half the price of a normal $399/night price. So was great value for us. I'm not sure if this hotel is worth the $399/night price though.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at this hotel from the 9th...”
Reviews.Author: Ukgoodadvice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the 9th April to the 13th and never in my life have I felt so disgusted with the service, and how clean the place was. We arrived from the uk at 2pm to be told there would be a 4 hour wait for our rooms (check out is at 11am). When we were finally given our rooms we were so upset. 1 room had a huge red stain on the carpet covered up by a chair and a cigerete burn on the sheets, and an inch thick of dust on the bedside tables!!!! The 2nd room was smelly and dark with black stains on the bed sheets. The bathrooms inboth rooms smelt of mold and the shower floor was that crusty it had gone yellow. There was no extractor fan or ventilation In the bathrooms so when hot water was used the steam was a nightmare. We complained right away and was given a look of different rooms which were slot worse than ours. The hotel then offered to deep clean our rooms and they gave us breakfast as means of an appoligy. ( breakfast for 4 people would cost $160 without tip. The service is that bad they don't diserve a tip) also after the deep clean the rooms did not appear any cleaner! Also on 9 separate occasions we had to return to the loby to get our keycards reactivated. Not a huge problem I know but when there is only 2 memberes of staff at the desk and a line of people almost out the door it gets a bit annoying. Sure thus hotel has a great location but so do many others it just wasn't worth the money and agro . My advice to anyone with any sense who wanted to stay here would be DONT! It's a big city out there. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “This is a Grand Hyatt?”
Reviews.Author: shanghaianji
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights with two children. The first two nights we could hear the chatter of young women in the next room. The next night a couple checked in and we could hear them "doing the deed". In other words, the walls are extremely thin. As far as the other comments about the bathrooms being small... what about the mold in the shower stalls...yuck!!! Also the wall paper was sagging in on the wall opposite the toilet. The staff at the concierge desk was just so so.

Reviews.Title: “PLANNING TO STAY THERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: kittytraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my mom. We had 1.5 days to explore NYC, and this was a great home base location, right next door to Grand Central Terminal, and a 10 min walk from Times Square. The Airport Express shuttle bus leaves you practically at the Grand Hyatt's doorstep, and that in itself is a tremendous asset. The outside of the hotel is gorgeous silver mirror glass, and the hotel is sandwiched between Grand Central Terminal and the Chrysler building. If you love architecture, you'll enjoy this location. The lobby decor is a little outdated, lots of brass and gold colors, like from the eighties, but it is very clean and beautiful. The front desk staff was super-friendly. In the mornings there is a little "coffee shop" in the lobby that serves Starbucks, pastries, and fruits. This is super convenient for taking something up to the room instead of opting for the expensive room service. The corridors and elevators are, again, a little outdated (not damaged, just older), but the room decor is modern, bright and crisp. We had a room with two double beds that overlooked another wing of the hotel and the Chrysler building. The room and bathroom were on the small side, but I hear that this is normal for the midtown area of NYC. It is still larger than the rooms I have experienced in France and Italy. The room was clean, fully-stocked, and everything was in working order. The beds were comfortable and the room was quiet at night. Overall, I would totally recommend this hotel if you are looking for a GREAT location, and a clean, safe, classy, predictable hotel (with good coffee). This Hyatt was not as pristine as other Hyatt hotels I have stayed at, but I can't complain about it either. In fact, I am planning another trip to NYC in 2 weeks, this time with my husband and toddler, and I plan to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: ibanez29
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at 7:30PM on a Tuesday night, I was greeted with a 27-minute wait to check-in. Once I reached the check-in desk, I was not offered an apology for the unacceptable delay. Rather, it wasn't until I specifically inquired about the topic that I was told that the hotel was implementing a new computer system that was delaying all patrons' check-in processes. I was offered no compensation for this debacle. While the room, itself, was tidy and acceptable by Hyatt standards, the bathroom was the size of a small closet and the sink area did not have enough room to fit the few toiletry items that I brought. THIS HOTEL IS CHEAPER THAN AREA COMPETITORS FOR A REASON!!! STAY ELSEWHERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Essex62
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on Expedia for this hotel. When we arrived at midnight we were disappointed that we had to queue but were pleasantly surprised when we received an upgrade to the “Club” floor as my boyfriend was celebrating his 50th birthday! Room 3141 was quiet as it next to a stairwell, it was large though dark as it faced into the centre of the hotel but we heard no road noise. The bathroom was small, the room had an iron & board, large flat screen TV – we requested a TV channel listing but didn’t receive one. If I was being picky then there weren’t enough clothes hangers and the mirrors weren’t in a well lit location. The club lounge offered free food & non-alcohol drinks during the day including a good continental breakfast, and savoury snacks in the early evening – you could also request an alcoholic drink from the waiter. There was a concierge present in the lounge that checked us into our return flight and printed our boarding passes. The location of the hotel was perfect – next to Grand Central station on 42nd Street where you can catch the subway. It was also convention to walk to a number of sights and next to the Chrysler Building. A good tip I picked up from a previous review was to pre-book “Reserve” tickets to the Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island as it allows you to “jump” the queue at Battery Park – I preferred Ellis Island as the security queues into the Monument & Crown at the Statue of Liberty were very long. Tickets can be booked at http://www.statuecruises.com/ferry-service/tickets.aspx

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: luvtraveling00
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hyatt after determining that most boutique hotels could not accomodate a family of three in one room. The first room assigned to us at the Hyatt was postage stamp sized, but we were allowed to move to a bigger room....though we knew they were full. Front desk staff - exceptional as was Joe the concierge. Location was awesome, near Grand Central, and near but not on, Times Square and all the theatres and crowds. Only complaint was with the maid service. Woken up by banging on our door each morning at 8:30. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: “A Haven in the Big City”
Reviews.Author: familyfunMA
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a long weekend in NYC to attend an event and take my two children to their first Broadway show. We had an excellent time and found this to be a spectacular destination in the city! After a long drive from MA my children arrived cranky, exhausted, and unhappy. The front desk immediately checked us in early without hesitation, offered my daughters complimentary scanks and bottled water which quickly won them both over, and sent us on our way, handling our luggage for us. The concierge was extremely knowedgable and offered wonderful family friendly suggestions for dining, entertainment, and the best hot chocalate in town (Serendipity.) I was extremely impressed by their ability to relate to the interests of young children! We were personally greeted by both conciege and front desk each time we passed by, and my children were enthralled by everyone's eagerness to inquire about their day. The room was well kept, spacious, and comfortable. We were also pleased with the ability to block out the majority of the street noise, although we did still hear cars honking. Housekeeping respected our do not disturb signs which was a relief and did an excellent job cleaning up after my darling but at times untidy children. I would like to note however that the noise level between rooms could be a bit quieter, due to no fault of the guest but more likely that the walls are just too thin. Otherwise we were very pleased. The door man was a great help fetching taxis despite the cold weather and did so with a smile on his face. My children adored him and his antics! It was nice to see the staff here take such an interest and it proved that they are truly enthuiastic about their jobs. A wonderful stay and a great weekend in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: LennetteN
Reviews.Content: Rooms and service impeccable during this busy time of the season. The breakfast was less than desirable for the price. Better places to eat away from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Aberfitchfish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights before I boarded a plan to the Bahamas. Stay here if: You aren't as familiar with the subway system, and want to be close to 5th ave shopping, close taxi ride to central park, and other attractions. I personally am use to the subway and would have preferred to stay at a more unique, non-chain hotel instead. Nonetheless the hotel is nice, but the bathrooms are tiny. The staff is not very personable compared to other 4 star hotels. Watch out for valet parking: It cost us 160 dollars to park the SUV for 2 nights. Big bummer :/ YOU ARE AT GRAND CENTRAL & NYC: There is cheap food (more breakfast/lunch style) in the terminal at grand central, don't fall for the high prices of food service. Plus there are tons of restaurants everywhere in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kirk123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in December. When we arrived we were confronted by a 30 minute wait to check into our room and even then somehow our reservation was for one night although we paid for three. Once this was resolved (30 minutes later) we finally went up to our room. The room was modern, clean and quite large. However the only bad comment is that the bathroom was tiny. On the first morning we had breakfast in the hotel restaurant which was OK but was pricey and the service was pretty average. The location of the hotel was fantastic. Was close to the subway and walking distance to Times Square, Broadway etc. If anything I would recommend the hotel for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the other bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: diluv2ski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on March 20th. We were visiting New York to see the Michael Buble show at the Garden. Our friends got this on priceline for $150.00 a night. After reading all of the bad reviews, I was afraid of what the hotel we were going to be faced with when we got there. The hotel was very busy in the lobby area. Our room was not available upon check in. We checked our bags in the lobby and walked to Times Square. When we got in our room, I was pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean and naturally, the first thing I did was check the bed. It passed inspection. I would definetly go back to this hotel. For the pice we paid it was very nice. I thought the people that we delt with in this hotel were more than accomdating. Don't let those bad reviews fool ya.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, not so great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Family_w_2Kids2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of Hyatt properties and what this has going for it is location, right next door to Grand Central. This stay was complimentary, thanks to a promotion. Top of mind - the best things going for it is a central NYC location, easy access to public transportation and being able to walk to Times Square and back. Really nice lobby, with a cascading fountain. Great staff make for a pleasant stay, too. The room was reasonably sized for midtown Manhattan, but the bathroom was very small. Staying on a high floor gave us very nice views of Midtown. The roomm had in room climate controls and a small window that actually opened, too. The in-room HDTV seemed also to only have analog signals which did not make for good viewing. Staff throughout the hotel were very friendly and helped us whenever we needed help. Housekeeping responded quickly and nicely to our requests for a crib for our toddler and a coffee maker (usually standard in most Hyatts I have stayed in). The concierge was very helpful, too. Some things which may help other travelers driving to the city - valet parking was $57 + tip for a 24 hour period. But once you park, it is easy to take local transport every where. Central park cab fare (no traffic) is $5.70 and the subway is terrific and right next door. In all - a very good hotel thanks to its location, staff and customer service, but not "great" due to its rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to discover New York”
Reviews.Author: B_JDerbysire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt with a group of friends for my 40th Birthday, and as nearly all of the reviewers have remarked the location of this hotel is superb. It is a few minutes walk to all the attractions. Grand Central Station is right next door so there is access to both the overground rail and subway systems. We stayed on a room only basis, and did not eat in the hotel, as it was quite expensive. The Hotel itself ,although a little dated,had everything you needed and was kept clean, with a change of bedding and towels every day. Our room was a deluxe, and was really quite big with a King sized bed, walk in wardrobe, arm chair, desk, massive flat screen TV and window looking out onto 42nd Street. There are loads of places to have breakfast in the area, ranging in price from ok to expensive, but the best we found was a place called "Scottys". A really proper NYC Diner full of local people with great food at a great price. It is located on Lexington Ave, a few blocks south of the hotel. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt, you can do better!”
Reviews.Author: OaklandJeff
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this hotel. I usually like Hyatts. I couldn't find much to like here. Pros: - Fabulous location - Decent-sized room by Manhattan standards Cons: - Condition of room and common areas. Many things are just too worn or sloppy. For example, cracked tiles and peeling paint in the bathroom. An HVAC unit that looks like it could have flown on an Apollo mission. A clock radio that refused to display the correct time. Thin walls. I could go on... - Indifferent service. P.S. If you bring a car, the hotel will charge you $50/day to park it. Welcome to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Location great, hotel very dated”
Reviews.Author: timur_uk
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring New York, couldn't really be better. We're Hyatt Diamond members due to a lot of business stays in Hyatts in the UK and quite frankly, this is the worst Hyatt we've ever stayed in. We were upgraded on check-in and had access to the club lounge, standard for Diamond members. Staff were friendly and helpful. The entire hotel is very dated (80s I'd say) and is dark, not very welcoming, not very cosey and needs a lot of renovations. There are some nice touches, coffee bar in the lobby for example, but there's not many places to sit, the bar/ restaurant is hidden and a bit boring. The club room is ok, breakfast there was terrible. The bread and pastries were stale and old, really nothing to rave about. There was also only a small selection of food and they charged for alcohol, which they don't do in the UK. We didn't find the benefits of being a club member were great in any way. One morning we brought our leftover bread from Balthazar's from the brunch the day before. That was fresher than the food in the club room! If you're just looking for a room to sleep whilst exploring NY it's probably a good bet, but it's not great if you're looking for somewhere you might want to hang out for a drink, relax after sightseeing or work, etc.

Reviews.Title: “ugh--we called it the Grand Dump”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth_7
Reviews.Content: We had a supposedly deluxe updated room. Bathroom was so small it could have been on an airplane. Floor was never clean. Even in the rehabbed room, the tub fixtures were old and didn't work properly. Room was lacking in furniture--had more open space than furniture. Only one small window so it was very dark and had to have all the lamps on all day. Noisy. The windows aren't insulated so you hear the sirens all night long. Restaurant--shabby rug, shabby furniture, very overpriced. I guess it's handy but it is absolutely nothing special. There are so many wonderful hotels in NYC. This isn't one of them. If they didn't have convention business I think they would go under.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: CJ40
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is in such an excellent location for any New York visitor. It is situated right next door to Grand Central Terminal with all the attractions within easy walking distance. The hotel is comfortable and the rooms were spacious. The rooms were cleaned every day, and you clean linen and towels are available that often too if you want them. The restaurant serves a range of breakfast options and is a good size so waiting for a table isn't a problem usually. Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No so Grand”
Reviews.Author: trvlNstyle
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying I am a Hyatt Platinum member and generally a big fan of Hyatt Hotels. Second, this hotel is in a GREAT location attached to Grand Central Station and close to all of Manhattan. That is where the compliments end. This is a really old hotel that was refreshed with new furniture and beds but they did a half fast job. The walls needed to be ripped to the studs and redone from the 1980's stucco but they didn't even bother to repaint. Doors and walls were nicked and in bad need of paint. Next, the hotel bar was a cave and not a nice place to sit and order $17 drinks (although they are building a new bar. I was staying on a free promotional night so I can't totally complain but I was disappointed at free so I would ahve been annoyed to pay the $300 nightly rate for a Holiday Inn equivalent. It is really disappointing that this is the only Hyatt location in midtown. I expected better from Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional holiday”
Reviews.Author: janetb06
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to New York and we had stayed in another hotel previously which was very nice however the location was a little too much out of the way. We were told that the Grand Hyatt was an exceptional Hotel and the location was ideal by the Dial a Flight advisor. When we booked there was an offer of a free nights stay which we took advantage of, apparently this is a regular feature of this hotel so it is always good to ask!!. On arrival the staff were excellent and we were upgraded which we didn't ask for. The rooms were very spacious, clean and well maintained. The hotel restaurants were very expensive however there are plenty of places to eat all around the hotel. The location was excellent just a short walk from 5th Avenue, Time Square, Empire State Building and Central Park. We attended the Thanks Giving Parade and it was a lovely sightseeing event. The sales were amazing some high quality designer shops had upto 70% off which explained the amount of people in New York. The weather was glorious even though it was the end of November. All in all we couldn't have asked for a better holiday and we are looking forward t going back to the Grand Hyatt in January 2011 for our 25th Anniversary and we would recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: canEHdiancouple
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice, mainly because it was pretty central to a lot of things. We could walk to broadway and other places or take a cab which was also easy. Also, attached to grand central which was nice. The service was good, the room was clean, but basic - I was hoping for it to be a bit nicer, especially after seeing the great lobby at the hyatt, but oh well...and it was a decent price at Christmas time! My major complaint: the room we had (don't know if they all do) had paper thing walls, so for the 1st half of the trip we could hear our neighbours yelling (there was a family of 4) the whole time!! Other than that, it was great. I stayed at another hotel in NY and this was way better. *Side note: I recommend going to NY at xmas - magical, much better than in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt have a better location to explore NYC”
Reviews.Author: Cookie376
Reviews.Content: Booked this as a gift for 2 x 76yrs, me, hubby and 17yr old. Arrived at JFK and used the airport shuttle service $17 each return great value waiting for us, although could not select the time to leave hotel so maybe next time would use taxi. But JFK to Manhatten is a good 2hr journey at peak times. Check in was smooth and my pre request was given (high floor). The hotel rooms were nice but bathroom a little dated and hotel not as nice as The Helmsley 200yards away. Did not eat or drink in hotel. But the foyer is beautiful. Have stayed in NYC many times and although this hotel is nice The Helmsley is better, although if you can get a good deal, we paid £600pp with expedia for 12th dec, it was worth it. The hotel is adjoined to Grand Central Station and literally a 10min walk to times sq, 2 blocks from 5th av and very central. The oriential garden cafe opp grand central is a must for breakfast the queue looks big but goes in minutes, well worth the wait. The whole xmas thing was fab and Uncle Jacks steakhouse was amazing!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Gthorpe3
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in a very good position, Grand central station on one side, Chrysler building on the other. The airport bus stops just around the corner too! The hotel itself is a large, clean modern affair and although the rooms are not overly big the one we stayed in was large by city centre standards. The waterfall in the reception area is a real jaw dropper the first time you enter the building. I can't comment on the food as we booked room only and as the hotel is connected to Grand central stations food court via a tunnel we prefered to eat there (as it was a whole lot cheaper!!!!). Overall I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for a short stay in the big apple!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone--great location.”
Reviews.Author: NorthEndBos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night only. Got a great deal through Priceline. Had a late arrival (11:30pm). Staff was extremely friendly and helpful in providing insight for the area. Room very pleasant and bathroom spotless. Great location for shopping, food, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: charmelly
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with clean but small rooms. Lots of elevators so you don't have to wait long for one. Lobby was very pretty and clean and there is a coffee shop there for your convenience. Location is great. You can walk a few paces to Grand Central Station where there is plenty of food places and some shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great apart from the rooms”
Reviews.Author: lovegetinaway
Reviews.Content: Great lobby , my check in was not the best , the guy checking me in did not have a good grasp of english which can be annoying after a 28hr flight from australia so i had to reapeat everything 3 times , the room was a club room , on the top floor , it was big but substandard , i felt i was in a cheap motel , the door to the bathroom could not close , the bed was nice , the club facilities were good had some great sushi in there , the bar was good , location was awesome to see all of what NY had to offer , the staff were great , its just ashame about the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Could be a 5* but for a few small things!”
Reviews.Author: halllmsdn
Reviews.Content: After a fantastic first impression - door staff, check-in staff, location, the room, facilities etc - all good. The hotel is clean, well equiped and all geared up for a 5* destination! It seems a small thing to moan about but it was a little irratating that you could not get a hot drink in your room - (coffee bar in lobby) but at 6am in the morning you just want a drink there and then. There was no mini-bar and the room service was average. We choose not to do breakfast in the hotel as the 'very helpful' man on reception felt it would be too expensive for us !!! - we thought he was a bit cheeky... there are however loads of breakfast outlets nearby - nobody does breakfast better than NY (except the Hyatt that is)... Excellent value for money overall - 5 nights - $1000 or £750

Reviews.Title: “Quick and Easy”
Reviews.Author: Katana5997
Reviews.Content: Quick and easy access to train and subways. Price reasonable. Room service expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: Lindaamb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in February 2009 and again in February 2010. As other reviews have mentioned the location is just perfect, right next door to grand central station, its so easy to get from the airport just jump on one of the many buses or trains that leave directly from the airport there's no need to hire private transport (as I have done on previous visits to NYC). Your only a few blocks from several of the main sights and indeed TImes Square, Broadway, Central Park, Empire State, 5th Avenue etc. etc. are all within comfortable walking distance. The lobby area is well finished and there's a nice bar area, a grill bar and a more formal dining resturant. Room service is good too. Check in/out was seamless and the staff are friendly and helpful. There's also a lovely antique shop in the lobby area which is worth a visit. I stayed in one of the club level rooms which was basic but comfortable (lets face it you spend very little time in the room when your in NYC)!! If you get a change try Pershing Square (www.pershingsquare.com) for breakfast. It's just across the road facing Grand Central Station I can throughly recommend it for a varied and inexpensive breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TODDISGOD
Reviews.Content: Situated right next to Grand Central and the Chysler building, this could not be a better location for exploring New York. Easy walk to Time Square and most theatres and Empire State Building, Subway or walk to Central Park. We even walked down to the Statten Island Ferry from the hotel but subway or Taxi may be better ! Hotel itself was amazing, from the fantastic loby to the reception staff and the cleaners. The Hotel Manager, Mike, was also fantastic and very accommodating. All staff VERY friendy and helpful. I would certainly recommend this hotel and hope to stay again if we return to New York. Thanks again to Mike and his great team Steve Franklin Bristol

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: LotusH
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel. They were filming in front of the hotel, so I got a glimpse of Denzel Washington. It's a great location right by Grand Central Terminal, and Bryant Park, which is minutes away from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Filth and More Filth”
Reviews.Author: gvlv77
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Grand Hyatt having read the hotel had a bed bug problem. Upon entering my room I checked the mattress to discover enough hair and stranged debris to call house keeping. I was moved to another room where I checked again and founf toenails and more hair under the mattress in addition to starnge brown staining on the bed skirt. I was assured the third room was clean. The mattress pad in room #3 was covered in hair both pubic and head. I was eventualy moved to a room that was a prorotype for future roms. This room had water too cold for a proper shower and NO thermostat. I was willing to over look all of the above until I asked for a late departure. The front desk manager told me she was doing me a favor by allowing a late check out. No joke...a favor after 3 filthy rooms and a final room with that had thrid world worthy water temps and constant cold air blowing. I went to the front desk to speak to the manager but had to wait. The folks ahead of me were presenting their hospital bill as the wife had awoken covered ina stranged rash and bites. This stay will end my relationship with Hyatt. This hotel is filthy and the front desk manager is oblivious to anything presented to her

Reviews.Title: “It grows on you”
Reviews.Author: RallyMonkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt on business during February. The rooms are a reasonable size, but a bit spartan, but perfectly adequate providing you are not expecting luxury. There are a couple of negatives :the bath is so shallow that it is virtually impossible to immerse more than half of your body and no mini-bar. The latter point irritated me at first, but Hyatt to provide vending machine on each floor with drinks available at normal prices and a Starbucks in reception. This certainly keeps costs down, and Starbucks coffee is much better than the coffee you normally get in the room. The main plus point is location, next to Grand Central Station, and close to the shops. Reception is quick and efficient at all times. So yes, I may stay here again, and it is worth considering unless a long soak in the bath is an essential part of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel I'd stay at in NYC”
Reviews.Author: badcook21
Reviews.Content: I rolled the dice and won big time when my bid got accepted on Priceline for the Grand Hyatt. I entered $120 for a 4-star hotel near Times Square, and was pleasantly surprised that I was saving approximately half off! I did not have a single problem during my stay here ... from the time I called ahead to request that two beds be in the room (and wasn't charged extra, unlike many NYC hotels) to being able to check in hours early without even having to ask first. The best amenity about the Grand Hyatt is its location in Grand Central Station. An earlier review was indeed accurate: Visitors can indeed go into the station without stepping a foot outside. This was incredibly convenient for my trips in Junior's! The Grand Central location makes it easy to figure out which subway stop to get off at. Also be sure to take the airport buses that are across the street ... carrying luggage on the subway is uncomfortable and taking a taxi is too expensive. Bus tickets cost $12 for LGA and $15 for JFK. The rooms were small -- like any NYC hotel -- but were spacious enough. I was impressed with the quality of bathroom amenities, especially the name-brand travel toothpaste.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Nath85
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, great location you literally on top of Grand Central Station, If you have been to New York before then you will know how good that is. If not stay here, we stayed in July with great weather so walking was great. Taxis are just a rip off, get the tube to the airport if you have small bags for a few nights. The hotel was really clean, massive and great for a visit to New York

Reviews.Title: “Official Trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: naminimmi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was too big and very nice hotel. My room was at 22nd Floor. View is very cool from 22nd floor. Best Hotel in this world

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: Christine92
Reviews.Content: We have just returned for this Hotel having spent 4 nights there. The Hotel is a really nice and the staff are polite and very helpful. We had a really large room and it was tastefully furnished, although the bathroom was tiny. We enquired about phoning home and the receptionist explained to us we could get a mobile phone from them and call anywhere in the world for just 39 cents a minute to a mobile or landline we did this and found it great. The hotel is right beside Grand Central Station so its ideally situated if your using the subway. The only fault I found with this Hotel is the fact that they charge 2$ per suitcase or bag if your leaving your bags there after checkout, it not much but considering the price of the rooms per night I think this should be free of charge. We found a lovely Irish Bar called the Long Room, the barman Fintan was great and gave us loads of tips, ie. areas to see, how to get there, restaurants and bars to try and his help was really appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fair accomodation”
Reviews.Author: TaijTaij
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I would stay here again. The location and staff make up for this hotel's shortfalls. That said, you should know about the shortfalls... it's not 100% on the cleanliness side of things. There were hairs in the bathroom, and the second day we came home to find a dead fly on one of our pillows. Granted, it appeared to have died of natural causes, but it was still not something that makes you confident about their standards. The hotel was nice enough to give us a free breakfast voucher to compensate for the incident. The staff was extremely helpful with tips about the city, theatres, restaurants, and attractions. The location was ideal, right beside Grand Central; it was also an easy walk to Times Square. These points definitely helped to overshadow the cleaning issues. For an NYC hotel, I'd say it's a decent hotel for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt New York Shifted my loyality to the Hyatt Chain”
Reviews.Author: DubaiBizTraveller
Reviews.Content: I am a regular guests at the Hyatt Chain, and my last stay was in Hong Kong Hyatt Regency, and before that was at the Grand Hyatt Bangkok which was amazingly beautiful. However, when I stayed at the Grand Hyatt New York, I was so disappointed that I decided to shift to another chain of Hotels which at least keep some kind of standards throughout their chain of hotels. In this Hotel, there were some good and bad points: let’s start with the good, the location is excellent if you are there for business or pleasure. The hotel is connected to the Grand Station Shopping Strip which has many nice shops including a gourmet food store which had a lot of nice stuff, Starbucks, and other coffee shops were very close, transportation was easy, just one thing, DON'T rent a car in New York. I did, big mistake, I rented a mid size car for 79 USD/a day, the parking for 4 hours was more than 48 USD at the Grand Hyatt where I was staying. Imagine if I left the car over night!! Oh the Valet Parking attendant took more than 30 minutes to bring my car, so much for Valet!! If you are not familiar with New York roads, forget your GPS help, it simply just does not work in Manhattan because of all the tall buildings which obstruct the satellite reception, you will be completely lost. Just use the Tube or Taxis and save yourself money and time. The staff at the Grand Hyatt were really friendly, the club lounge was always busy, a bit small for a hotel of this size, but had a good selection of hot and cold drinks and some nice snacks but not a place to have a quite business meeting, one thing was very annoying was that they closed the Club Lounge for cleaning between 1 pm to 2 pm so if you were in a business meeting they politely asked you to leave!!! The Rooms view were not so great, all you will see is buildings around you, but the reception staff went out of his way to please me and upgraded me to a junior suite to make me happy. That was nice of him, but all the rooms which I say (more than 3 rooms) the interior was horrible, plain walls, plain colors, plain fabric, just like a standard 3 star hotel. Clearly not what I was used to in the Hyatt chain in Asia. Room Service very expensive, regular filtered coffee cost about 15 USD. Never had breakfast in the hotel, so I don't know much about that. Oh, get this, no mini bar drinks in the room because there is no refrigerator, and when I asked why, the reception lady said “Sir we have more than 1,000 rooms, can you imagine how much work it would take to maintain all these refrigerators? I felt at that moment I was in a motel not the Grand Hyatt. But she did offer to give me a refrigerator if I want one, I told her, ahhh, I just checked out I wish you guys offered me this when I checked in!! The lobby was too busy, a lot of people going and coming, it was more like a mall not a hotel lobby. In short, find another hotel, New York has a wide selection, and get better value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Mrs.”
Reviews.Author: jo913
Reviews.Content: Everything & everybody was so nice, close to everything. Easy check and check out. Will hold luggage for you. Great rooms and views.

Reviews.Title: “New York City Trip Grand Hyatt, right next to Grand Central Station”
Reviews.Author: skindy02
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pricey, but definately worth the price. I would definately stay there again. It was small, but clean and nice. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice midtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mactoki
Reviews.Content: We have a rate here and I paid about $218 which is good value for this part of midtown. Room very well appointed and recently refurbished by the looks of it. Slept very well. The corridors and rest of the hotel could do with a bit of modernization, but on the whole no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Mitchell100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly placed for exploring New York city, about a 20 minute walk to Times Square. Like most city hotels it is quite clinical and impersonal but all staff were friendly and helpful. Room was very clean with a great view. Noise was a problem, from within rather than outside the hotel, but you cannot blame the hotel for very noisy guests. I would definately recommend the Grand Hyatt as the perfect hotel from which to explore the amazing city of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Smelling smoke in a non smoking room...”
Reviews.Author: DanB4
Reviews.Content: Flashback to the 90's, smelling my parents smoked in living room.. Just make sure that you get a non smoking room otherwise nice service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: jenncraig
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Grand Hyatt was great. The hotel rooms were modern, clean, and spacious by NYC standards. I was very pleased with my selection, with the exception of the noise. I was unfortunate enough to stay at the hotel during some sort of kids dance competition, which meant I was surrounded by obnoxious pageant moms and unruly kids. Despite the great room, I encounter challenges sleeping each night thanks to guests who did not realize other people were staying at the hotel. My sleep was continually interupted by guests in the hall talking at all hours, kids running up and down the halls, a conference call first thing in the morning in the room next door, and people yelling from room to room at one another. I highly recommend this hotel as long as you feel you can sleep through anything. On another note, I would like to pass along a word of advice that the taxi driver from the airport shared. I flew into LGA, and the taxi driver told me to make sure I pay roughly the same price on the fare into the Hyatt as when I leave. He said many doormen and drivers have quite the scam going in the city for tourists. I definitely encountered this with the doorman I dealt with at the Hyatt. I specifically asked for a Yellow Taxi. He quickly shuffled me into the taxi who had been waiting in a 'no standing zone'. The driver explained my fare would be a flat rate of $37... $12 more than it should be. I aked him to explain, he said it is always a flat rate on the way to LGA, and that meters are not used. Do not be fooled this is completely inaccurate. I promptly hopped out, grabbed my luggage and moved on to a taxi that was driving by. I was told AGAIN this is one of the many scams taxi drivers and doormen pull on unsuspecting tourists. He also encouraged me to report the driver, as he can lose his lisence. Needless to say my fare was $25.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Clark_W_Griswold
Reviews.Content: Checked into room # 2220 on January 30. Check-in was smooth and there was no nasty sneering because we had booked via Priceline. We are Gold Passport members and although our stay would not earn us points (understandable) we were allowed to enjoy the other GP amenities including coffee each morning and the WSJ, etc. Our room was spacious extremely clean, and every single of member of the staff we had contact with was polite and cheerful – very refreshing (and none of them were texting on the job!). The bed was comfortable, there were enough pillows including an extra in the closet. We did need to change rooms mid-stay due to a chatty neighbors that talked very loudly into the wee hours of the morning. Rosa at the front desk was more than accommodating, and moved us to #2215 with very little disruption to our day, she also profusely apologized for the 2 very early wake up calls we received that morning that were not ours! Internet access is expensive here and in this day and age, I'm not sure why - it isn’t a novelty anymore and service is relatively cheap. Our room was cleaned well each day and the towels were spotless, plentiful and fluffy. The Portico White Ginger bath amenities are THE BEST! Not a ton of room around the vanity in the bath to put your things, but a shelf below the sink and a small shelf unit on the on the wall offer additional space. Very good water pressure in the shower. Plenty of room and hangers in the closet to hang your clothes, and a few small drawers in the TV cabinet. We had a wonderful stay and hope to go back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but in a good location”
Reviews.Author: janetteBradford
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Hyatt for 4 days 25th to 28th January 2010 with my husband. Nice looking hotel, reception and foyer quite impressive. Staff okay. Location central and easy to sightsee from here. Within walking distance of Times Square for example. We were told before we went that it was going to be a 5* hotel. If that is what you want then don't stay here. This is definately no 5*. Not a lot of anything in the rooms. Not much room to put your belongings, especially in the bathrooms. No restaurant open this time of year, only the hotel bar and a small dining room. Must admit didn't eat there as saw the prices and decided against it. All in all a hotel which was neither good nor bad, but paid a lot of money for a hotel which will not be remembered. You decide? Only recommended by me because of location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Hyatt!!!”
Reviews.Author: CitizenKane001
Reviews.Content: Hello fellow travelers! My girlfriend and I just made a 1week trip to NYC and we chose the Grand Hyatt. First off I selected some options from TA (Trip Advisor) from the reviews (which was not one of the best!) and the narrowed down to price. We made reservtions from Hotels.com. it Worked and was simply easy to do everything. We prepayed our hole stay at the Grand Hyatt. the service offered by hotel staff since checking in to check out was really great. People had smiles on their faces all the time. They were very helpfull. We had room 3421, on the last floor. It was a simple King bed. Someone told us later that rooms in the 34th floor were somehow bigger than the other standart rooms. (?) Upon arriving, i have to say, the room looked huge! We had a very big bathroom, it had doors in the shower, and not those curtains as seen on some pictures of the hotel. There were lots of space around the sink. The room featured a desk with a nice office chair, a small couch with place to lay your feet, and a good size closet. The closet had an iron and iron table. A very nice 42'' lcd. 2 telephones.and an in-room safe. The King Bed was perfect! Very comfortable and nice sheets and great pillows. LOCATION was the best! The hotel is located right beside the Grand Central Terminal. Its in walking distance of all the sight seeing. And for those who do not want to walk could easily use the subway. It was very cold in new York when we were there, and with cold winds in our face made it even colder. So we decide t use the subway sometimes. The hotel has a direct entrance to the Grand central.,and form Grand central we had subways to all prime locations. There is Shuttle to Times Square every 5 min, and a nice subway line going down-town and up-town on lexington Av. Its very nice to use the subway. This helped us a lot! The hotel didn't provide free wi-fi. They charge $10 a-day. If you stay in all-day i dont think its expensive, but it was not our case, we used only 1-2 hours max from the wi-fi. So I thought the cost/benfit of the wi-fi a little bit over rated. Other than that, The Grand HYatt New York is a great place to stay! The rooms/bathrooms are larger than usual NY hotels. It is very beautiful hotel. Great Location. And it should not be placed in #146 of the TA hotel New York City List. im sure that no one will be unsatisfied staying there. Fantastic Stay at the Hyatt! tip. Small coffee place inside the lobby has great coffee and small variety of food! Good for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the business traveler - awful amenities”
Reviews.Author: dara09
Reviews.Content: This hotel advertises itself as a business / conference hotel. However, the amenities are nowhere near the level that a true professional traveler would expect. Internet TV in the room is a joke (clunky and keyboard doesn't work, forget about logging in to your company's email). Wifi is unreliable. Computer at the business center costs you $30 per hour (yes, that's per hour), computer is old with outdated software, printer does not work and per a hotel employee, there is no color printer in the hotel (not even for them). Wow. How can anyone who needs to actually do work get anything done around here? Location is great, and the employees are very nice so far. Ambience is ok, it's quite nice (they've updated recently) but they still can't shake that 80s corporate feel.

Reviews.Title: “the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: 1Mella
Reviews.Content: I'd like to give my advice about this Hotel! I've been there 2 years ago . It was my first time in the US! Anyway I really loved it. The people were so nice and the sevices were all working! It's a vvery big building , above the central station. The room was very clean aand nothing misses in it! u have a big flat tv and a big HUGE wonderfull GREAT bed!!!!! I was the best bed i've ever slept in! the bathroom was clean and the wadrobe was very wise. the breakfast buffet was very full of any kind of international food! i really loved it. It's pretty close to times square and to the empire state building! i really appreciated this hotel! i reccommend it to you ! thanks for you attention! best reguards,

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: aedrbf
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying we recently returned from the Grand Hyatt in Beijing and the Hyatt Regency in Hangzhou China. Absolutly fabulous hotels!! The first thing we said to each other upon entering the Grand Hyatt New York was..well, this is nothing like the Hyatts in China. That being said, I will now review. We drove into the city and pulled up to the hotel on 42nd street about 10pm on a Thursday night.
