Not sure we were in the right place as no doorman approached the car, no valet could be seen and no bellhop was around, I went inside. In that lower lobby, there were no hotel personnel so I went up to the main lobby and asked. Yes, they would send someone down to valet the car and yes it was the "main entrance". We had reserved a queen bed non-smoking room using a free night earned while staying in China under some promotion Hyatt was having....pay for so many nights and get one free. Can't beat the price but that doesn't mean the attention to detail should be lost. We had just spent 12 nights in China at their hotels, each time upgrading to the concierge level. We were not asked if we wanted to move up to that level....maybe because we were there for free but I still thought it strange that it was not offered especially since you have to pay for it. Our requested room was not available...we could have a smoking queen or a non-smoking double....not good. A king was not offered as an alternative until I asked. Yes, there was one but it too was smoking. So we took it. There was also no mention at check-in of the restaurants in the hotel and the health club availability. Our room was smal, decorated in neutrals, with a nice desk and one chair with ottoman and a large flat screen TV. Far from the elevator and ice machine. The bathroom had the usual toiletries including toothpaste. Small bathroom. We were there on a very cold night. The window was ages old and leaked cold air like crazy. It also did not do much for filtering out New York City noises. Internet is an additional charge. The location of the hotel is excellent. Sitting on Grand Central Station you have easy access to all trains and subway. You are in the midtown and can easily walk to Times Square, 5th Avenue shopping, the Flatiron district, etc. Upon check out, we retrieved our car on the upper level and voila, there were the valet and doorman. If you do arrive on the upper level, you will walk into a very plain lobby and will need to go down the stairs to the main lobby area. It's an odd set-up but probably because of space limitations and the fact that it sits ontop of another building.....Grand Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: gmm1974
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hyatt 12-22-10 and checked out 12-24-10. We had stayed at this hotel previously and were very happy. The lobby decorations are absolutely beautiful at Christmas time, and the location is great! It's nice to be able to walk downstairs and grab coffee, danishes etc. at grand central station. The hotel is older and there are some issues, but the customer service is excellent! We were due to check out on the 24th of December and we had a late train leaving that night. My daughter got sick the night before and we contacted the hotel the next morning to see if there was anyway we could stay in one of the rooms until our train departed that evening. We were willing to pay to do this, but we were told that it wouldn't be an issue and there would be no charge. I was able to stay with my sick daughter in the room while the rest of our family went out and explored the city before we departed that evening. I would like to say thank you to the staff at the hotel that we dealt with, you couldn't have been more gracious and understanding! We will definitely be staying with your hotel again when we come back to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: DarrenBailes
Reviews.Content: We visited New York for New Year 2009, and got a deal through Expedia - £700 per person for 4 nights - which considering it was for new year I thought was amazing. Becuase of the low price, I did not expect much from the hotel, but I could not have been happier. The location was incredible, slap bang next to Grand Central Station, next to the Chrysler Building and a few moments walk from Times Square, I was so impressed with this place. From entering the impressive foyer, to the brilliant receptionist who was just the right level of friendly, you know, not over the top? We has asked on our booking for a recently renovated room after reading a review on Tripadvisor, and asked again at the desk. The receptionist took her time finding us a room, but when we got in, we could see why - it was really really nice, very impressive, with an incredible street view. The place was immaculatly clean, bright (the Christmas decorations looked amazing) and every bit a top class hotel. If anything, the room service prices were through the roof - big deal - just dont use room service! I have since recommeneded it to everyone who I have spoken to when I came home and will continue to do so - Thanks for a great stay, and to this day, I still think we robbed you on the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern decor + great location + fantastic service= Grand Hyatt New York”
Reviews.Author: erl4453
Reviews.Content: Beautiful brand new looking rooms- terrible view. Surprisingly, that was the only thing that i could find that was wrong. I am a huge critic of hotels, you can take it from me that this is worth going to. Price was worth it, average. I found the table in the huge lobby where a kind attendant who books broadway show seats very helpful. The location is great, in the heart of NYC and you can reach 5th Avenue for shopping purposes in minutes. Right below is the Grand Central Terminal where they have amazing food stands of every type. (If you go, there is a fantastic gelato stand that I recomend.) It is not for the "I'm going to New York so that I can relax and not see any sites" type of person, you have to be willing to go see some culture, do some shopping, and not go to a spa. It ain't a resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Grand Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: allenandstef
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 8 nights at the Grand Hyatt during Thanksgiving week. It was our first trip to NYC and we selected this hotel intentionally after reading many online reviews, guidebooks and talking with friends. And we weren’t disappointed. The Grand Hyatt met our needs perfectly and was exactly what we were expecting. It is expensive, as is every hotel in NYC. On this point, you can’t fairly compare it to the costs of hotels in other parts of the US. However, compared to other hotels in NYC, we think it is fairly priced and is somewhat of a value. The Grand Hyatt is not a 5-star hotel, and doesn’t claim to be. It’s not a resort destination. So don’t go with those expectations. What you will find, though, is a clean comfortable place to stay. The location at 42nd & Lexington is right next door to Grand Central Terminal. There’s even a walkway that connects the hotel to Grand Central if you don’t want to walk outside. It’s very convenient to many subway lines, which makes getting around the city and returning to the hotel very easy. The area right around the hotel isn’t especially scenic or touristy. It’s in the middle of a very bustling area of Midtown Manhattan. But it is very safe. We even walked back to the hotel around 1am after leaving the top of the Empire State Building. It’s a very short walk to Bryant Park and Times Square. (Or an easy subway shuttle ride to Times Square.) You’re minutes away from everything Midtown has to offer – Rockefeller Center, the Empire State Building, Fifth Avenue Shopping, Central Park, Macy’s, Theater District, etc. And if you decide not to walk, cabs are plentiful and the subway is also very convenient. Though its location next to Grand Central is very busy, it doesn’t compare to the frenetic pace of Times Square. You can walk there in about 10 minutes from the Grand Hyatt, but we found the Hyatt to be a nice respite from the 24-7 madness of Times Square. Check-in was very fast and easy. The clerk was personable and friendly. The lobby is very big and played host to a couple of different events during our stay. Our room was just as we expected – small, but functional, clean and comfortable. From what we understand about NYC hotels, they all have very small rooms, compared with other parts of the country. So we weren’t disappointed in our room size. It provided ample space for the three adults in our room. And both the closet and bathroom were, again, small but adequate. As tourists, we weren’t in our hotel room much, anyway. We were out and about everyday, only using the room for sleeping and showering. Everyday, upon returning to the hotel, our room had been serviced. They were prompt about filling requests such as extra towels or hangers when we needed them. We did not eat at any of the hotel’s restaurants. Other food options were plentiful, from the wonderful dining concourse next door at Grand Central, to cafes, restaurants, coffee shops and more nearby. On some mornings we’d pop into Tim Horton’s about a block away for a donut or muffin for breakfast. Other days, we’d go to a nearby coffee shop or diner for a more hearty breakfast. From our room, we could see the top of the Chrysler Building on the next block. But I think it’s safe to say that few of the rooms (if any) provide any really scenic view. The Grand Hyatt is surrounded by other high-rises on most sides, and because the streets are so narrow, there doesn’t seem to be much of a “view” from any of the rooms. We were on the 30th floor, so street noise wasn’t an issue at all. We heard an occasional siren, but nothing that disturbed us. The Grand Hyatt is obviously a hotel that caters to business travelers, thus the high prices for room rates, room service, Internet connection, etc. But it also provided us with everything we needed and were expecting from our NYC vacation, and gave us a great base from which to explore the city. There are certainly more elegant and refined places to stay, more hip and modern hotels, and more budget-friendly locations around the city, but we plan on returning to the Grand Hyatt for our next trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but....”
Reviews.Author: kseitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a long weekend in January. There are several kiosks in the lobby allowing travelers to self check-in and avoid the line at the desk. We took advantage of this and is was quite speedy. Our room was on the 16th floor, the 2nd or 3rd floor of rooms. The room was small, but not too bad for NYC standards..a closet just inside the door, a small hall with the bathroom off to the right, and the bedroom. CONS: Our view was of the roof of the lobby area. Cobwebs on the floor lamp in the room. Lighting in the room was poor and it was difficult for both of us to get ready at the same time. The only mirror in the room outside of the bathroom was in a closet with a dim light bulb. Walking back and forth from our room to the elevator during our stay, we noticed the same room service trays/dishes outside other rooms on several trips. We brought drinks up from the bar and our glasses were in our room for two days. Internet - $9.99/day for T-mobile Hot Spot (SLOW connection). There was no lobby bar, but instead a small bar in the back of the lobby level. We had drinks here one evening...strange vibe - dramatic paintings of Spanish guitar players and flaminco dancers with loud techno house music. We did not eat at the restaurant - also seemed small for the size of the hotel. There was a restaurant just above the lobby with fantastic views, but it is closed. Room service prices were ridiculous...bowl of oatmeal $15 plus tax and delivery. PROS: Location, location, location! The hotel is connected to Grand Central Station by a small hallway. At Grand Central are many, many restaurants and shops and access to all trains and subways. Many sights are within walking distance - Chrysler building (just next door), New York Public Library, Bryant Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , Rude and Greedy Doormen.”
Reviews.Author: Epidural
Reviews.Content: Arrived by cab and the doorman took the bags, he then took us to reception and refused to leave until we tipped him, not a problem but I had not checked in, got my room or even said hello to reception. After we tipped him we had to carry our own baggs to teh room. The door staff operate like the Mafia, They take payments from Cabs and only let Cabs who pay them near the hotel. They wanted $50 - $60 dollars for a yellow cab the port, they made it very hard for us to call our own yellow cab 25 dollars, and when we did they tried to get cash from our driver. God knows what other tricks there up to. Anyway, after that the hotel is Great, Fantastic location next to the main station and all that goes with that, easy subway connections and buses all over New York, Yellow cabs are inexpensive in New York compared to london and the drivers are great. The Hotel sits on top of the Grand Central Station , there are literally 100s of places to eat and drink in the station there is a major food Hall, My Daughter went out for Starbucks and Bagels each day for breakfast, she is 15 but it was so safe in th area I was not concerned. Shopping nearby is supperb, 5th Avenue, Empire State, all a short Walk, New York is fabulious, Food is expensive wherever you go, a meal for 3 without drinks was about £100, even pub food ended up at about £60 for 3. Drinks cocktails in an average bar £10 each, all over so go to an expensive bar it the same as a cheap one. The hotel is a Hyatt so standard brand and very impersonal, this was fine we were on the 29th floor, there is a tiny gym, no pool, but we got great rate £80 per night, its well marketed so shop around.... and for New York this rate was great.... also join Hyatt Club for free and get free coffee, the Lounge is ok, but not worth the extra 80 dollars,,,, Enjoy, New York is the most amazing place.

Reviews.Title: “Location great... but not "embraced" as Diamond member ;-(”
Reviews.Author: traveller1969
Reviews.Content: Spent one week in NYC during Year End. Used GP points as Diamond member and was a bit shocked on how the whole welcoming turned out. At check in a highy unmotivated receptionist checking us in, no informations given to us on where we can find what in the hotel and left us alone with our luggage. Got a fairly large room (for NY standards) facing backyard and absolutely zero amenities (water, fruit, ...) at all. We looked forward to the Grand Club (knowing this is normally always a very nice extra) and the next disappointment was born. Felt like everybody got access, way too many unempowered staff running around in an already overcrowded club. We experienced this way better before in other Hyatts around the globe. The building is old, need renovations desperately and they charged us for WIFI access (normally free for Diamond members). The biggest benefit is the location. Next to Grand Central and you are in the middle of Manhattan. Can I recommend this hotel? Clearly better ways to redeem hardearned GP points... no doubt. If you are used to Hyatt luxury I would say NO. Just want to be in NY and have a very central location to start your city discovery YES.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Central Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Conluceo
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here for 4 nights over New Year. The check-in was swift and we were given a room on the 29th floor. The room was clean and spacious, however we felt it was a little noisy and so asked for a room change – which was sorted without any fuss. The room had a large flat panel television and iPod dock/alarm clock. The lack of a mini-bar was only a minor inconvenience. It is difficult to fault the location of this hotel. It is situated next to Grand Central Terminal (there is a link corridor from the hotel into the station). The hotel is only a short walk from many of the major tourist sites, including; Times Square (15 mins) & Empire State Building (20 mins). The hotel is also only a one minute walk away from the drop-off/pick-up point for the airport shuttle buses – very convenient. We never ate in the hotel as there is so much choice on the doorstep. We tried a café in Grand Central Terminal and later found a great diner called Pershing Square (directly opposite the station). The diner had a buzzing atmosphere and did superb breakfasts – an ideal start to a day exploring the city. The hotel bar is cozy with attentive bartenders and, unusually for a hotel bar, a good atmosphere. There is a PC in the lobby where you can check-in for flights and print boarding cards. The concierge was friendly and helpful and gave us a restaurant recommendation and reserved a table. I can’t say anything about New York City that hasn’t already been said. All I will say is that the Grand Hyatt comes highly recommended – enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: givanildobs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the grand hyatt for two nights, the rooms are a good size,clean, this hotel have great location, near grand central station, from it you can know the city ( midtown) by foot. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Internet paid.

Reviews.Title: “Never take young children......they are not catered for!!”
Reviews.Author: ClassyLadyYork
Reviews.Content: If the stay had been just for myself and my husband I am surethis hotel would have been prefect. However I took my whole family (7 of us) which included an 18 month old and a 5 year old. The first problem was ebven though we ordered a cot (crib) we had to wait some time before one was delivered to our room. We explored New York after our babys nap and then returned to sleep...bt the room they had given us was right next to the lifts and the walls were paper thin. As it was the party season we were all woken up with druken people getting out of the lift all night long. In the morning we complained and were moved to an upgraded room on the 8th floor. That seemed good enough to me................but again when we got to our room...no crib. The same wait. If we had a crib in the old room..surely we would want one in the new room. The rooms werent that much different but after i enquired if breakfast was included they said yes. I was appeased. In the morning my son and his girlfriend (still in their original room on the lower floors were asked to join us for breakfast and when i got to the "special lounge" i was told they would have to pay 100 dollars. it was a continental breakfast with not a cooked thinig in sight (unless you count toast you did yourself)!!!!! The lady conceirge in the "special lounge" was quite honestly blunty rude. As a part of 7 there were no large tables...in fact no tables at all...and sure as hell no high chairs!! Babys NOT welcome. So....I complained to the management about her attitude. We left the "special lounge" and went to breakfast down stairs where infairness the maner we coplained to did not charge us for our breakfast. So...the manager did well. Some of his staff are very rude (i include the porters too). I said to him that i felt babys were not welcome...his reply was .....this hotel is really for business people and i think you are right as we dont really cater much for small children. So........If you have small kids...this is NOT the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough”
Reviews.Author: sullific
Reviews.Content: We stayed here right before Christmas during a blizzard. We booked the room on a discount site so we dd get a very good rate. The room was tiny with no view, but for NYC, it sufficed. Didn't lke the cockroach that came with the room, and it really annoyed me that there was no cffee maker in the room. I did find the fact that they actually provided tothpaste with the amenties an idea whose time has come - wonder why more hotels don't do it, especially with cuirrent travel restrictions. Staff was helpful for the few things we needed. I was gong to order room service for breakfast but did not as it was, without a doubt, the most overpriced room service I have ever seen. I recently ordered room service at comparable hoels (Fairmont, Marriott) and while pricey they were nothng like this. I believe atmeal was about $15.00 (plus tax, fees etc.), Unbelieveable.Most breakfasts were close to $30.00.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelingmares
Reviews.Content: The rooms are so spacious. Beds are super comfy. Room service was timely. Location is superb. Gym was large. Totally recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: NorwichScot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year so the hotel was very busy although because it is large and spacious it never felt crowded. We had a corner room on the 29th floor so it was nice and quiet - in terms of street noise that is! Walls are paper thin so you do hear your fellow guests some times and doors banging shut can be a nuisance. Room was large and spacious, very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. No fridge, mini-bar or coffee maker though. Bathroom is small but adequate. Location is great and because there are so many eating choices close by, we didn't actually use any of the restaurants in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to stay over Christmas in NY”
Reviews.Author: emdavis
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here for 8 nights over christmas in new york city. Fantastic location, right on grand central station. Walking distance to Bryant park (ice skating), times square and a 24 hr supermarket on the corner! A couple of disappointments - each time we received room service the glasses in our rooms would disappear and were not replaced. we regularly had to request for glasses to be sent up. Also, christmas lunch menu was slightly disappointing - the main course was lamb. As were were not from the states, we wanted the traditional turkey lunch so we wound up going to the intercontinental hotel buffet around the corner. Concierge was great, gave us great advice each day on things to do, where to go and how to get there. The fitness centre was also very nice, and very popular one early morning I went up for a jog! Overall, a good stay in new york.

Reviews.Title: “NYC”
Reviews.Author: KeeganK
Reviews.Content: The place we stayed was awesome. Two Beds and a good central location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Tigghogg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Grand Hyatt over Christmas and New Year, the hotel itself is amazing, beautiful lobby was really taken back by it. We had a lovely room, looked out over the front of the hotel. The rooms are a good size with a nice TV. The movies like any other hotel you get charged for but for normal tv is free, so you can watch to your hearts content. The room didn't have tea or coffee facilities so this can be expensive. Dont order coffee on room service $9 each plus service charges and tax. We also found the coffee shop in the lobby expensive but there is a lovely coffee shop called Joes in Grand Central station and you dont even have to walk outside to get it. We had dinner in the restaurant and it was of very high quality, but again we mostly relyed on outside food. If you are to go downstairs in Grand Central Station to the dining concourse there is many take away joints, we managed to get most hot meals for under $10 and because of the portion sizes that would do both of us with some left over. The gift shop i'd miss just for the rudeness of the ppl oh and the price's are way over the top. Take a walk down fifth ave and you'll find plenty of gift shops for half the price. Over all the hotel was really good, with a great location and in walking distance of most sites to see! Oh and get a Metro weekly ticket you'll be suprised how much you use it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Gem”
Reviews.Author: Mazc84
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge, and with the amount of guest you see coming and going throughout the lobby, we'd expect it to be very noisy and staff give poor customer service - well, that wasn't the case. The staff were so friendly and helpful, nothing was too much bother. Once in your room you couldn't hear a thing!! We read reviews of this hotel before going, and I was honestly worried about having this itchy little old fashion room. Once again this wasn't the case... we had book 2 rooms and were given interconnecting rooms 2644 & 2645 and they were HUGE!! If we looked at the bedroom doors along the other side of the corridor they had 3 bedrooms in the place of our 2... so I can see why some people complained about the size... but there was no compliants from us :) You have a large swivel LCD TV which good channels. The huge waredrobes and cupboard space was very useful, as was the iPod dock (only compatible for Nano tho) I must say the only thing the hotel rooms really need is a kettle and fridge - the type of hotel it is, I can't see why they don't have it... you get a kettle in basic hotels!! Don't even bother buying coffee at the hotel or using their room service unless you have your company credit card paying for it!! Its much similar and cheaper to go to Grand Central Station or to the local Starbucks The location can't be beaten, it is less then a minute walk away from Grand Central Station and really easy to use!! Very similar to the good old London tube. All in all.... a lovely hotel.. Just get kettles and fridges in the room please!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: DarinaRussia
Reviews.Content: Old hotel, very noisy, sanitaryware items is broken, towels is dirty, bad smell in the room, no slippers and bathrobes in 5 stars hotel!!! No minibar in the room and no compliment water. Newer return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “room needs makeover”
Reviews.Author: das_ubersoldat
Reviews.Content: first we got a queen room but it was right next to an ice machine (very noisy). we then asked for a room change and we got instantly a king room on a higher floor away from any machines/elevators good: - very good bed - quite big room for NYC - good location not so good - old bathroom - no view (we saw only AC machines from the window) -> room is dark - big tv without any hd channels (very bad quality) - thin walls (if you are sensitive to noise take earplugs) - lobby is noisy because of waterfall and renovations - in my opinion overpriced as other Hyatt hotels offer much better experience

Reviews.Title: “great hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: burnsideUae
Reviews.Content: We had a great 5 day stay, booked directly through the hotel and got a 2x double bed room for $200 a night. Quick check in/out and great helpful staff. Huisband used the gym each day and said it was good, they are also linked to a health club where you can use the pool but you have to pay a reduced daily rate, didnt try it though. The hotel had a slightly dated feel - lots of beige! But was spotlessly clean and in immaculate condition. Decorated really nicely for christmas with carols playing while we were there! Our room (2958) was a good size for the 4 of us, the two kids shared a bed, we had great views down 42nd street over Grand Central Terminal. Only negative about the room was no coffee and tea facilities which was shame. Wifi was $10 a day and good basic TV free. The location is perfect, nice and quiet as just of the main times sq area, but really close to the sights. Right next to Grand Central Terminal for the subway/ buses, only a 5 - 10min walk from most attractions, 5th Avenue shops, Times Sq, Broadway, about 15min lovely walk to Central Park via the Rockafella centre (def do Top Of The Rock for views)and 5th Av, 2mins to Bryant Park (craft market fab hot choc and ice rink). We didnt eat in the hotel there was no need, Grand Central Terminal is literally next door and has an amazing food market and lots of great restaurants (mexican, pizza, oyster bar, sandwhiches, bakery etc) , we got bagels and coffee there most mornings and also can recommend Hale and Hearty soups which warmed us up after a chilly day exploring. There's a great diner, Blooms, about 1 block south down 42nd street for some calorie laden breakfast goodies, the french toast with maple syrup and crispy bacon was perfect - dont expect to lose weight on your visit!! The doormen are also great to ask for advice on where to go. Another great restaurant worth making a trip for was Blue Smoke (27th st) with amazing burgers and ribs and the kids got to decorate their own cookies which were bakes while we ate, the food was delicious. We would def stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tkitcalif
Reviews.Content: The room was actually good sized- we had been warned NYC rooms can be quite small. The hotel was beautiful, location was excellent and the service was too. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimonAdam
Reviews.Content: The positive far outweighs the negative for this hotel. Great, central location and very convenient for Grand Central Station, as well as the JFK and Laguardia airport drop-off bus, which stops and leaves almost opposite the hotel for $27 return (1 hour journey time each way). Very friendly and accommodating staff and a concierge who offered to get a product that we couldn't find from her local shop before coming to work the next day - cheerful and attitude-free staff. Very comfortable and clean rooms, but beware of thin walls - at one point we thought a noisy family were actually in the same room as us. Toiletries provided, but no fridge or mini-bar. There was an ice machine and a basic soft drink dispenser on our floor. Importantly, there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, which is one area the hotel falls down on. People generally want a hot drink in the morning and offering a room service coffee for $9 + taxes + service charges is quite criminal.There is a small Starbucks in the hotel lobby area, but the queues were often 15+ people long in the mornings, with generally one person serving. With jetlag I was often awake by 6am and I found this was a good time to run down to the lobby Starbucks before the crowds. The hotel is very, very busy generally, which means long waits for check -in and check-out, not to mention the lifts at peak times - be warned and time yourself right! The rooms have wireless internet for a charge and a business centre offering internet access for 50 cents a minute by swiping a credit card. There is also an airline boarding card and check-in machine in the lobby (most airlines are listed), but again the huge numbers of people at the hotel often means queues for the one machine. The hotel gym is probably one of the best hotel ones in town. Clean, modern and with a range of machines. Plenty of cardio machines, a water cooler and towels. No changing rooms or showers in the gym area, however. Check-out is quite early at 11am, but the staff were accommodating at allowing a late check-out at 1pm, which we requested 24hrs in advance. Beyond 1pm will normally incur a charge. The hotel charges to hold bags after check-out ($2 per bag). All in all a recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfy Room in an Unbeatable Location with Value Pricing”
Reviews.Author: GloriaWandrous
Reviews.Content: I picked this Hotel through Priceline's "name- your-price" feature and was not at all disappointed! Our room (which was available several hours ahead of check-in time) was small but perfectly clean and attractive with a very comfortable, king-size bed and crisp, cotton sheets. The bathroom was also small but had an abundance of fresh towels, a strong shower and suitable bathtub. I have no doubt that more well-appointed rooms are available, but for less than $180/night, over Christmas, this more than sufficed for what was a vacation meant to be spent outside of a hotel. Grand Hyatt would have earned my praise any other part of Manhattan, but the location pretty much ensures a top recommendation from me (if you can get the discount rate, of course). I was initially afraid that the location would be too busy/hokey/touristvictimy but, even adjacent to Grand Central, it felt perfectly safe and welcoming outside. And being adjacent to GC is a-maz-ing. We were able to take a bus from the airport, and take a bus or train anywhere we wanted to go after we arrived without worrying too much about negotiating subway stops. This A. Allowed us to spend more money on fun stuff rather than on cabs, B. saved us from that awful feeling of "how do we get back to the hotel, again?" at the end of a long day/night. The concierge/front desk staff was friendly and helpful with suggestions about where to see live music or get my handbag fixed. Considering the hotel is ENORMOUS, the personal attention was a great attribute. If I can get the same price, I would not hesitate to stay here again and again. What Hyatt may lack in character, local color or neighborhood charm, it more than makes up for in convenience and value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, Location, Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravDave
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in New York and had a great stay at the Grand Hyatt. There were many things that we enjoyed about the hotel. 1. The Room – The room was a VERY NICE room which was very clean and well appointed. Our King size bed was very comfortable and we slept very well. The living area had a couch, table and chair which added a lot of space to the room and was a very nice place to relax when returning to the room. The refrigerator was a good size and very useful. The flat screen TV was a great size and swiveled to be seen in the living area or the while in bed. The room had a walk in closet that gave plenty of room for our clothes/shoes/dirty laundry and purchases that were made while visiting NYC. In the bathroom, details such as cotton balls / swabs / Q-tips in the bathroom were noticed by my wife as a nice touch. The shower / tub has a temperature dial, and the shower gave an amazing amount of water. What my wife and I liked the most about the room was its serenity from the city. We could crack open the windows to allow fresh air and a little city noise, but we could also close those windows and shut out the busy city. The view was very nice and gave us the great feeling of the NYC experience. We loved the high floor location of our room, and all that we could see. 2. Staff – The staff was very kind and professional. We were able to check in quickly and had help getting our luggage up to the room. The Bellman introduced the hotel on our way up to the room and told us a lot of useful information such as how to gain access to Grand Central from the hotel, and about the available restaurants. In our room, he gave us a tour and showed us features of our room. He showed us how to work everything and offered to hang our garment bag for us. He got us some ice and was very attentive to us. We had questions on how to get to Lincoln Center and how long it would take, and he was very helpful with recommendations and suggestions on how to get there quickly. We also had a great experience with our room attendant. She was very kind and refilled our ice for us too. The room was always very clean. Everyone that we came in contact with at the Grand Hyatt was very professional and went out of their way for us. GREAT SERVICE. 3. Location - GREAT LOCATION. The location of the hotel was a big plus. Outside temperatures were in the 20’s and we could get a deli sandwich or do some shopping at Grand Central station without bundling up. Because the hotel is attached to Grand Central, we were able to go from our room at the hotel all the way to the Natural History Museum on 81st and back without ever getting out into the cold. There was also a point when my wife and I were sick of bundling up, so we put on light clothes and went down to Grand Central to do some shopping. It turned out to be one of our favorite times. Everyone around us was bundled up, but we were dressed like it was 70 degrees out. We strolled through the shops and the Grand Central Market. We ended up getting something to eat and taking it back up the room. Ultimately, we had spent a couple of hours in the terminal and the shops. We wouldn’t have been able to do that if the hotel wasn’t attached to the Terminal. When we were out and about in the city, we could do some shopping and come back to the hotel to drop off bags, or get something to eat, or take a nap before heading back out to the next venue. There were also plenty of drugstores and/or restaurants all around this location to be able to run out and get some quick toiletries or food if needed. This Hotel is the tops in location. I would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel to others. We stayed here for a 5 day anniversary trip to NYC and we VERY pleased with our experience. My wife and I would like to say thank you to EVERYONE there that made this trip for us possible. We will see you next year. GREAT EXPERIENCE! See pictures for better detail.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay--Better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: sfnative_2
Reviews.Content: The reception was not so great. We needed 2 doubles and they tried to pawn a lesser room on us, saying there were no more double rooms available. This was complete BS as 60 seconds later a room was available. The receptionist never once looked me in the eye which suggested he/she (not sure which) was aware of his/her deception. Which brings me to the snooty concierge. We asked about a place to eat. He was busy filing some papers and never looked up at us. We got the impression he wanted nothing to do with us so we stepped out and walked around until we found a place. Luckily, there aren't too many bad places to eat in NY. The room was clean and sizable for a NY hotel. The bathroom and sink area were all one so we had to wait for someone to finish up in the bathroom before we could brush our teeth. Lastly, you get charged for leaving your bags for the day after you check out. For $350 per night, you'd think they would hang on to our bags for us at no charge. Parking was $55 per day! Luckily we took the train in. I'll try somewhere else next time....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Big_Blackbird
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights from 20th Nov 2009. The room was spacious, clean and well serviced. Because we arrived early from the Queen Mary 2 and left late for JFK airport we needed to park our baggage. The Bell Captain's staff did a first class job both arriving and leaving. We did not use the Hotel for food, there is no need at all to pay 25 Dollars for a sandwich in NY. In fact for good quality snacks the presence of Grand Central station's dozens of food and drink stalls next door was very convenient. I would use it again as it was very convenient for the midtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: PaperGirlTX
Reviews.Content: If you're going to stay in Midtown, you cannot do better for location than the Grand Hyatt. There is an airport shuttle stop across the corner, and of course the hotel is attached to Grand Central Station. I stayed in late October, and reserved with the additional instant-upgrade option. Upon check-in, I was placed into a lovely suite, with a separate sitting and desk area (practically palatial by NYC standards). My only two minor disappointments were the length of wait to check in (apparently the hotel was quite full the night before, and my room wasn't ready, necessitating a couple hours' wait. As Hyatt GP Diamond I am accustomed to getting into my room right away. ), and the lackluster service in the bar, which otherwise had a very nice atmosphere. The lobby and public areas of this property are gorgeous, and while I realize other reviewers have had room complaints, my suite was perfect and recently remodeled. I would definitely stay here again if I were traveling on business or for leisure and needed to stay near Grand Central.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Is Uneven Franchise”
Reviews.Author: sanders101
Reviews.Content: This New York franchise hotel is large and has a decent midtown location, but very uneven service so "value" depends on what you need. Dollar cost is high relative to nearby locations, playing off location and familiar brand. Value is relative to other mid town NYC locations, not absolute relative to London, Dubai, Singapore, etc. (which are all highly superior hotels). No water glasses in a business class room, the concierge, Tina, was not well informed and couldn't handle pressing a jacket. Stay at the Waldorff, similar location, much better quality staff and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for this quick stay - nice room”
Reviews.Author: Dalsemer
Reviews.Content: Along with my wife and son, we stayed one night as we had a Black Tie event in New York. Nice room with opening window on the 25th floor. Not large, but decent size for New York standards. Everything was clean. Needed to call housekeeping for towels on Sunday morning. After waiting about a half hour, I found an abandoned housekeeping cart on the floor and helped myself. Other than that, no complaints. On Saturday afternoon, we stopped off at the bar for some snacks and drinks. Wings and Nachos were about $16 each, and drinks ran about $10-$12 per. It was a nice place to catch some football and relax. One concern I had was parking, because we needed to go In/Out, and the hotel's website clearly stated that it was about $60/night with NO in/out privileges. I wasn't sure how to handle, but I lucked out by finding a metered spot on 43rd Street; Only about 50 paces from the entrance to Grand Central. We had to go out later that night to the affair, and when returning, the same spot was available, so it turns out aside from the cost of the meter, I parked free in New York. Shocking. I would recommend, but not necessarily make it a point to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for location and easy metro access”
Reviews.Author: honey012
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for location as its right next to grand central statiion. Also only walking distance to time's square (2 blocks), fifth ave,(3blocks). There is also a bus service across the road that takes you to airport if you need one.. Found the hotel was very clean, rooms spacious with clean towels daily. Staff were very nice and helpful at all times. Only one disappointment was that we found the drinks bar was quiet expensive, other than that it was a great hotel and one i would definatelly return to again . R.....Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Probably top notch in the Eighties”
Reviews.Author: ScorpioLondon57
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights, the hotel has an excellent location. That would be the main consideration to stay here, I would say. Staff are friendly, concierge service in main lobby is extremely helpful. Rooms are ok, clean, small bathroom, the standard 2 double beds were comfortable. No tea/coffee making facilities or water provided. No internet facilities to check wheather, check in your flight etc. Only at extortionate prices. Two bowls of porridge and two teas at breakfast sets you back $58! Good gym. I found it an impersonal experience. I stayed at the Giraffe hotel some 4 years ago and this was a much better experience in terms of value for money, service and quality of room.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt = Grand Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: jamesdawes
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt in New York is fantastic and I cannot recommend it highly enough. We stayed for 4 nights and were suitably impressed by the friendliness and knowledge of staff, all amenities and the quality of rooms. The rooms are an excellent size, and the en-suites larger than you might expect. Ask to be put in the refurbished side of the hotel and you won't be disappointed at all. For a large chain like Hyatt, service can vary wildly between hotels but the Hyatt have this nailed. We were welcomed and looked after at every stage of the trip. A tip - for breakfast head over the road to Pershing Square which is a great place to get an all-American breakfast in stylish surroundings. The proximity to tourist hotspots like the Empire State Building, Times Square, Rockerfeller etc is unrivalled. You feel close to the main places, without being on top of them. I'd have no hesitation in staying here again - in fact I would insist on it as the Hyatt is that good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Thanksgiving in New York”
Reviews.Author: timbolester
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for six nights during Thanksgiving week. Overall it was a nice hotel, with just a few minor glitches which in no way diminished a wonderful week in New York. Upon check-in, the front desk agent informed me I had been upgraded to a "Lexington Suite". It was a nice big room overlooking Lexington Ave., and the Chrysler Building was right next to us. Beautiful view from room 1926! The bed was absolutely wonderful; comfortable and luxuriously soft. I normally have trouble falling asleep in a strange city (especially New York with all the horns honking 24/7), but no problem in this bed. There was a nice flat screen TV which swiveled so you could either turn it to face the bedroom or to face the TV area. Great touch. Other nice features were an in-room safe, an iron and an ironing board. The bathroom amenities were also unique and plentiful. The following are a few minor problems I noticed during my stay: The walls are thin (but aren't they all in hotels these days?). My next door neighbors (room 1925) were a bunch of loud guys who were banging around and yelling at all hours of the day & night. To make matters worse, they were smoking up a storm in the room. The rooms are non-smoking and the smell permeated the hallway and sometimes even came into my room. Nasty. There was plenty of hot water but it takes FOREVER for it to come out [hot] of the faucet. I had to let the water run for several minutes before it came out hot. I guess it had to travel a long way. After a long day of sightseeing and walking, my back hurt, so I decided to take a "sit down bath" to relieve my aching muscles when I realized the tub stopper didn't close. I tried and tried but it didn't work. So I used a washcloth to plug the drain (but it didn't work very well!). I didn't bother reporting it to maintenance since I didn't plan on taking any more baths. Oh, and wireless internet is $9.95 for 24 hours. I used it and the connection was fast & easy (T Mobile Hot Spot). Don't bother eating in the restaurants or using room service in this hotel. I cannot comment on the quality because once I saw the prices I stayed away. Nine dollars for coffee (for one person only)? Thirty-Four dollars for French Toast? Really, that is ridiculous, even for New York. And these were the restaurant prices, not the "jacked-up" prices for room service. Do yourself a favor and grab breakfast (or any meal) in Grand Central Station. It is right next door and you won't even have to go outside to access it. Just take the corridor on the lower lobby level and make a right. It will take you directly there. There's also a Starbucks in that corridor which is actually less expensive than the "coffee cart" in the lobby of the hotel. My favorite place was called "Hot and Crusty". I was able to buy 2 large coffees, a bottle of OJ, a bottle of milk and a wonderful croissant for a total of 8 dollars and change. Honestly, I don't know who would ever pay those extravagant hotel prices. I am still in shock! Here's another money-saving tip: If you are coming from an airport, go online and book Super Shuttle. Yes, it is a shared van that makes several stops, but it is a lot less expensive (and easier) than a taxi. My ride from La Guardia was only $13.00 plus tip (16.49). I also used it to go back to the airport. You can save a few more bucks if you book it round trip. Overall a great hotel, just a little bit away from the major noise and crowds of Times Square. I would return, especially now that I know how to get around the pricey add-ons.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bex2683
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great if you are looking to do upper and midtown new york city, also easily connected to elsewhere via grand central station. Not the cheapest hotel to stay at but it is a very grand building. The staff are a credit to the hotel and are really helpful, polite and friendly. The rooms are adequate size and very quiet with a good view from all sides. I would however agree with a few of the other reveiws on here saying it is very business focused. The conference and business guests seem to get slightly preferential treatment whilst in house.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: RonJon949
Reviews.Content: The proximity to Grand Central Station and the Newark airport shuttle stop made this hotel a very convenient location. Front desk was busy, but I was helped quickly and checking in early wasn't an issue. Initially I was put in an extremely small room, but after noticing how much larger other rooms were, I called to request a change, which was denied. But after speaking with a different front desk agent in person, I was given a slightly more spacious room. Furnishings were above average and public areas seemed clean and well-maintained. Overall an excellent business choice for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “huge room, clean, quiet hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: shepherd09Ireland
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights recently. We were able to check in early which was great after a long flight! Our room was on the 26th floor and was extremely quiet, no noise from ajoining rooms. the room was clean and nicely decorated, and it was massive!!! Throughout our stay the staff we met were extremely helpful and friendly. It was close to Times Square and we were able to walk to all attractions. We enjoyed our stay and would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “ITS TRUE HOTEL IS MAINLY CONFERENCE WEDDING & BUSINESS PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: wingirly
Reviews.Content: Great hotel but not really made to feel welcome, so busy you are lost in the crowd, weddings seem to take over the hotel, we were told not to use lifts until around 300 wedding guests had used them. Also business meeting sometimes makes you feel like a second class citizen, did not attempt room service as it was $9,00 for a cup of tea, I think I would try another hotel when I return to New York

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: ronyag26
Reviews.Content: Having read a few of the comments on this hotel I was slightly apprehensive as they seemed quite negative, however we need not of worried. We were greeted by very pleasant staff on the front desk and were made to feel very welcome. My mother and I stayed in the Hyatt for 3 nights and every one was without complaint. The room was lovely and bright. Cleaned to a very high standard and the view over GCT was brilliant. The added bonus of being able to check in on line for our return flights meant we could leave later for the airport and squeeze in abit more shopping. The hotel was really well situated for all we wanted to do - visit Central Park. Bloomingdales, Times Sq, Empire State Building, Rockerfella Centre and of course just shopping. On the Sunday Madison Ave was closed to traffic and a HUGE street market opened which was lovely. Bryant Park which is just along to the right of the hotel was a real hidden gem. We spent lots of time just sitting and watching the ice skaters and looking in all the little units that sold everything from christmas decorations to novelty soap. It was a great place chill and just get away from the hustle and bustle for a while. Also the toilets were beautiful and so well looked after by a lovely lady, who really takes pride in her job. She put Starbucks at the Empire State Building to shame, DON'T use the restrooms at this coffee house as they were the most disgusting I have EVER come across (a 2 foot high pile of USED toilet tissue on the floor under the baby changing unit) and the most worrying thing was that the staff used them too??? We found the EuropaCafe on Madison Ave to be excellent for breakfast and lunches - Great value for money. And Mulldoons Irish Pub on Lexington served great meals in the evening. All in all a fantastic but very tiring trip, lovey hotel with great staff, and some brilliant memories.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: MattH4
Reviews.Content: Staying here for the week. The hotel is in an excellent location that's hard to beat. Got a great deal off the internet that couldn't be ignored. Had a great first night, until what sounds like a room of 8 drunken boys moved into the room next door that played rap music, cursed and shouted into the small hours of the morning, despite my plees for them to quieted. So don't get room 2971 if you want a quiet night! Rooms are immaculatley clean with everything you can need from a iron to a ipod dock. The TV is a bit oversized for the room, but some people like that. I hear people say that they find the bathrooms here to be too small, but it's not. I've seen smaller bedrooms. Lobby is amazing, I want a waterfall in my home. Not to keen on all the brown marble and precarious looking giant flower vases, but it gives the place some class. Food is so expensive here it's a experience to just read the price list to make sure it's not a mistake. Which is why, I can guess, that noisy rabble in the next room feel they have to go outside buy a buffet and then get most of the population of NY into their room for laugh, giggle and snort all night. It's all so cheap outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, don't use the room service”
Reviews.Author: CanvasTraveller
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic in between Grand Central and the Chrysler building, was lucky enough to get a conference rate which made it relatively cheap in new york terms but still in excess of $600 for 3 nights. Its a big place and tries hard but it is rather soul less, clearly designed for business travel. Didn't come across many of the staff as used auto check in and check out facility, lady selling the sightseeing bus tickets and theatre tickets was very helpful, concierge did his job but felt like he was doing me a big favour when asked to reconfirm shuttle booking back to airport. Room was large enough well presented and clean, bathroom was tiny but functional. Good fitness centre, used it each morning and wife and I always managed to get a running machine for 25mins at peak time. Don't be tempted to use the room service, sky high prices for mediocre food used by the corporate suits on expense accounts, probably bankers spending our tax dollars because they are too lazy to go next door to the wonderfull Grand Central Food Court and Lexington Passage Market (also in Grand Central). The only way these large chains will get the message on their overpriced room service menus is if we all stop using them, so come on suits, walk next door and sample Grand Central. Would stay again as it is a great location, walking distance to many of the key attractions (especially the theatre district)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: christie79
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Hotel is very well located in the heart of Manhattan and just by Grand Central Station. The check-in and check out process was painless. The hotel lobby is huge and just very grand! Our room was on the 18th floor. We didn't have a view but didn't care as we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. The room was of a very good size, the double bed was big and very comfy. The bathroom was clean with some toiletries provided. Can't fault this hotel and would happily stay there again. The room service is very expensive but with so many places around for food, you don't really need it. Oh, and by the concierge, there is a computer where you can do your online check-in and print your boarding passes for free, very useful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good Priceline price!”
Reviews.Author: bryntrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a Friday and Saturday night in September. The location can't be beat--literally inside Grand Central Station. We had a quiet room that was well-decorated and comfortable for our stay. And we only paid $150/night (plus taxes and fees). Hotel valet parking is expensive but there is street parking available (on weekends at least) in residential areas within 5-7 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Room was not not clean”
Reviews.Author: Elliejam
Reviews.Content: Got a room that had dirty towel and washcloth on the floor of the bathroom. Bed was a bit rumpled also. Called houskeeping who kept promising that within th next 1/2 hr someone would be up to clean. 1/2 an hour turned into 2 hours with me calling them about 4 times. Seems I was begging them. My collegeage was checked in on the same floor so I did not want to relocate. Otherwise I would have gone back to reception and requested a room change.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good overall, great location”
Reviews.Author: TCK33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights and after some scathing reviews, was pleasantly surprised. Check in was fast, room was good. The refurb is tasteful and stylish. Bathrooms are small but there is enough space on the wall shelves to put things. Good location, connected to Grand Central and so close to Bryant Park. The walls are paper thin so you will hear nice. On two mornings the people next door had fairly loud music and lots of coughing and it was like they were in your room. To provide a kettle and some tea bags/coffee is so basic and happens all over the world, yet this is not the case here and to be honest seems cheap. I paid a fairly high rate for this hotel as a 'Grand' Hyatt but not even a tea bag. The worst part though was the strong smoky smell. To me this room was definitely a smoking room previously and this spoiled the experience totally.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of NY. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beqbeq
Reviews.Content: Great location, fantastic staff and awesome rooms. I loved this hotel so much and would definitely stay here again! The staff all over the hotel were amazing in particular the bar staff. They were so friendly and helpful and made staying there that much more enjoyable. The Grand Hyatt is perfectly located to see everything only a short walk to Central Park, an even shorter walk to awesome shopping in particualr H&M which is just down the road and there are also really lovely restaurants nearby. I thought it was great value for money and would recommend it to anyone. New York is an awesome place and I am sure you will love it no matter where you stay however if you want a centrally located base which is great value for money then you really should stay here. I will stay here again for sure :). TIP: make sure you go to the Hotel Gansevoort roof top bar - it is amazing and the crab pizza is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Mojo8
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location in midtown. The rooms were nicely remodeled. I was not a fan of the stall shower only room, however, the size of the bathroom was adequate and the furnishings of the room were nice. I was happy with the free coffee or water coupons received upon checkin given the lack of coffee making abilities in the room. The service was accomodating given my early morning check-in and the rooms were overall quite sound proofed. Given this was only 4 blocks from my conference, this was a great choice. Plus, the bus to Newark being a block away, was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “great priceline hit!”
Reviews.Author: johnnieb
Reviews.Content: I like to use Priceline for the best deals in NYC. Having stayed at the Grand Hyatt in the past, and knowing that Priceline customers do not get the "prime" rooms. For 150 dollars a night, we got a room with 2 doubles, clean and acceptable, Having experienced their far better rooms (at a much higher rate), This is a well located property that is getting a little worn around the edges..but bedding was great, and everything worked. Even though our room was opposite the elevators (remember this was a priceline win)..it was quiet. This is a good hotel in a fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: EdgeofExistence
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to try Priceline in an attempt to find an affordable deal to NYC for the Halloween weekend. Not only were we successful in finding a deal, it was to the Grand Hyatt no less! The hotel was absolutely superb - very grand, true to it's name. I loved that it was situated over the station and that the central market was right beneath it. Our room was nice, well kept, well decorated. A glance at the breakfast menu is enough to make anybody's jaw drop to the ground, but the situation was remedied by a quick walk in any direction to a more afforable eatery. Although we try to be budget travellers, for the most part, this hotel has convinced us to simply book it from now on whenever we go to NYC. It's a comfortable, clean, well-located hotel, with a level of quiet and luxury that was pleasantly surprising.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: fishie2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location making it easy to get to times square etc ........, We travelled with our two children aged 10 and 12 and found the room to be of good size for all of us. The rooms were clean and looked ok. We didn't eat at the hotel as it was really expensive - especially the room service. Overall a good hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsobellaEngland
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel as part of a package trip to New York, through Thomas Cook. So I am not sure of the exact price I paid for the accomodation. It really is in a fantastic location, especially if you can work out the subway system. The hotel is situated between Grand Central station and the Chrysler building.The Empire State Building is a 10 minute walk around the corner. Time square is a 15 minute slow walk, plenty to see on the way though. I was in New York with my two daughters aged 16 and 21 and although initially worried about walking at night need not have worried as there are plenty of people around. The hotel room was a good size and the beds were very comfortable, on the 28th floor we were not disturbed by traffic noise. I agree with previous comments that the rooms are tired( but only in the yellowing of the paint work) and the bathroom is on the small size but both were clean enough, if you don't look too carefully in the corners and above door frames (grout could do with a little cleaning too.) The meals in the hotel are expensive but for breakfast we followed previous advice and went down into Central Station food court (you can either eat down there or take it back to your room.) There is not a kettle in the room and despite e-mailing the hotel before hand to ask if I should/could bring a travel kettle I did not recieve reply from them. However in the hotel lobby there was a drink station for use on a morning, the prices there were not too expensive. There is a booking desk in the reception area where you can buy tickets for the bus sight seeing tours. This was helpful as I did not like the idea of getting my credit card out on the street to buy tickets off the vendors. I would not buy theatre tickets from there though as you can buy them after 3pm for that nights performance, at a ticket booth in Time square for up to 50 % off. (Unfortunately we had already bought tickets for Shrek through Last minute before we went. It was a brilliant show but we could have got them cheaper if we had waited in the line at the ticket booth. ) However, I think tickets for shows such as Wicked are more difficult to get hold of, so my advice would be to book up with Last minute a couple of weeks before you go to avoid disappointment. All the staff in the Hotel that we met were helpful and polite, having said that I didn't really have any contact with them apart from checking in and out. We had a late return flight and the hotel will mind your luggage for $2 per case after you check out at 11AM, this is also helpful. I would stay at the Grand Hyatt again but I would take my travel kettle and teabags with me next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: AltaMales
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt where I attended a conference. I've stayed at several Hyatts worldwide, and this was the first to disappoint. On the positive side, the location of the hotel is hard to beat. I appreciated the easy access to the subway, many major attractions, and the excellent food court at Grand Central station. The bed was extremely comfortable with a great mattress and excellent quality linens. Generally, I found the hotel shabby for a Hyatt. The public areas were dark, my room was long overdue for an update, and the bathroom was dingy. Most of my experiences with the staff were positive, but it took me over a day of chasing down house keeping and front desk staff to finally get a non-functioning safe in my room replaced. Usually, I'm willing to pay a premium for a Hyatt hotel because I'm confident I'm getting a quality product. This hotel did not meet my expectations for this brand, and I've stayed at much less expensive hotels in Manhattan that far exceed the standards of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoGold
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt week of Oct. 12, 2009. Beautiful Hotel, friendly staff, comfortable beds, excellent location. The location made our trip so much easier to get around and see the sights. Loved that Grand Central Terminal is connected and that we could go to the food court anytime to get reasonably priced meals, try Junior's restaurant to get great cheesecake and sandwiches. Would stay at the Grand Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: Tiiti
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2008. We had a very large double room with a walk-in closet. The space was really appreciated because of all the shopping we did. Bathroom was kind of small but it did not bother because it was nice and clean anyway and that is more important to me. Location was great also as always in midtown NYC. We had a great deal from Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, Should be Hyatt Flagship hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Windsurfer147
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights on Hyatt Points. The best of this hotel is its central location, just at Grand central Station. The lobby is massive and impressive but everything is a bit outdated. The hotel needs a massive renovation and could and should be Hyatt Flagship Hotel. We stayed in Long Island a few days later and our Hyatt Regency was much better! The room are OK, Small bathroom but as always with hyatt, the bed was good. As a Diamond member i had access to Grand club where I could get free breakfast, snacks and a dedicated concierge : This was excellent. Overrall if you get a good rate it is a very good and comfortable place to stay in NYC as you are not likely to stay a lot in your room ! The room was okay, Bathroom very small

Reviews.Title: “Good location - shame about the let downs”
Reviews.Author: Malohalmightyone
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hayatt is in a great location. The public areas are impressive (if you like fountains in the lobby). The staff were mixed. Ulysses in the bar was excellent. Simone as the breafast greeter was rude and surly. The rooms were very dark. It was as though they either did not have enough bulbs or were using very low energy ones. The food was expensive. There were no tea/coffe making facilities in the rooms so you either had to order room service at $9 or wait for the coffe eshop to open in the lobby at 6am (as this closed somewhere between 2pm and 4pm it was not much help after a day walking the city either). The hotel seemed geared up for Corporate business with fat expense accounts paying. We would not choose to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, perfect location, poor value”
Reviews.Author: ebennike
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at this hotel in conjunction with attending a conference in NYC, and I was somewhat disappointed with the value. The price was around 320 USD per night, and especially the room standard did not live up to this price. The room was small, dark, and the bathroom in a disappointing standard. The guest rooms could definately need som refurbishment. When asked whether I had had a nice stay on checkout I stated that I had been somewhat disappointed, and without hesitation the woman at the fronk desk without hesitation credited me some extra points on my freqent guest account, which I found was a good gesture. It was not all bad though, staff was overall very friendly and helpful, especially at the concierge desk, where everyone we spoke to seemed to have enourmous amounts of information to share with guests. Furthermore, don't get me wrong - the hotel is still quite ok, it just seems more like an average 3* hotel rather than how I would normally regard hotels under the Hyatt brand, and then the price is not in line with the standard. What is definately the best thing about this hotel is its location. A few blocks from 5th avenue and shopping everywhere around, this hotel is the perfect location for visitors to NYC. Actually, just the location might be enough for me to stay here the next time i go to NYC, especially if the hotel would rent out rooms for just slightly cheaper prices.

Reviews.Title: “Not entirely a Grand Hyatt...maybe a moderately OK one.”
Reviews.Author: stevekub
Reviews.Content: One of the most amazing things about a regal NYC hotel is its lobby - and admittedly the Grand Hyatt has a beautiful and ornate lobby. However, all of the polish and glamour soon wore off when we experienced the front lobby staff. As we were unable to use the kiosks, we had to make way to the front desk to be assisted by a human being. What we received was a flash of hatred only experienced as an American youth traveling to Communist USSR in the early 1980s. Instead of assisting us, the front desk agent went back to her keyboard, clacking away while her knitted eyebrows told us that we were almost to the point of death should we bother her with our measly request of checking in to our hotel room. About five minutes later, a second front desk staff member arrived, reassuring us that this was indeed the front desk, and this is where we check in. We were given our room assignment, confirmed my Hyatt Gold Passport Platinum status, and directed to the elevators. Soon, we were on our way to room 1971. As part of Hyatt Gold Passport Platinum status, I'm supposed to get the best room available within the category booked. To all my fellow travelers, I sincerely apologize. Based on the state of my room, I would surely suggest that your rooms were scarier. Room 1971 featured a lovely cracked closet door, mold (not crown mold) around the door of the bathroom, and a toilet wedged between the shower and sink that required the strength and acrobatic skills of Cirque Du Soleil to use. Additionally, for all of those that dislike adjoining rooms - you had not one, but TWO adjoining rooms - one on each side of the room. Nonetheless, the King-sized bed was comfortable, and the desk area along side the TV was useful to complete work on my partner's laptop. The room also had a functional A/C and Heater, and the noise levels (as you faced 42nd Street) were almost inaudible once the window was closed. Our further interactions with the hotel staff were just as cordial as our knitted brow friend, showing us that customer service is indeed on life support at this hotel. When we called to inquire about the correct method to use to obtain free internet, the response was "If you're Platinum, you should know." Yes, because all hotels are the same. As a FYI, When you access the T-Mobile hotspot, and enter your room number, it apparently is automatically removed from your room charges. Bell staff were courteous, and unlike many other NYC hotels, did not tout their friend's town cars or expect tips for helping with bags or hailing cabs. While tips were appreciated, there genuinely seemed to be some helpful staff outside of the hotel. Directions and help with getting our navigation straight was truly appreciated. This, honestly, was the saving grace of service at the hotel - otherwise it would have been a terrible experience. With hotels fighting each other to keep in business in this economy, abusive service and rooms with cleanliness issues do not win repeat customers. Would it cost that much more to have someone fix a crack, kill some mold, and coach your front desk people to smile? The Hyatt Grand Central NYC has not won a repeat customer here.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean, slow service, not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: bonbongirl99
Reviews.Content: While I was excited to be staying in such a great location, I was not impressed by the hotel. Many areas of the hotel were not clean, including the room, and service was exceptionally slow. On more than one occasion it took HOURS for them to deliver the extra towels we had requested for our room. I would not recommend this hotel, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the center of mid-town NYC”
Reviews.Author: alabama12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central Station for a wedding in July 2009. The hotel is beautiful and is nicely located. We were fortunate to book the hotel early and saved about $100 per night. The rooms were a nice size, although we had to change rooms after the first night because they initially put us in a room right over 42nd Street, which was extremely noisy all night. The second room was very large and quiet, with a nice bathroom and walk-in closet. The beds were comfortable, with good pillows, which is always important! The only thing I need to mention is that if you're hoping for a cozy, quaint hotel in the city, this is not the place for you. There were massive numbers of people going in and out of this hotel. The hotel is very large and can accommodate an extensive number of guests. We did not have any problem with noise from within the hotel though. Overall, we had a very good experience at the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel... great location”
Reviews.Author: ctm1000
Reviews.Content: The lobby was beautiful and extravagent but the rooms were fairly small and ordinary. We arrived 30 minutes early and were not allowed to check in early. Also, there is no coffee in the rooms. If you want a great location though this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jibbyjit
Reviews.Content: We needed a place near Grand Central. Priceline got us there for $195/night and the quoted price at the hotel was over $550. Midtown - East for business, this was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Ideal Location Spotlessly Clean Large room”
Reviews.Author: marimontStirling
Reviews.Content: Next door to grand central station across street from Chrysler building perfect location. Walk north up 5th ave takes you to Central Park or walk south down 5th ave takes you to Stattan Island Ferry port you could not be more central. Hotel was great lovely big room, 2 queen beds, 32" plasma, bathroom big enough with bath, spotlessly clean maids in everyday, quiet room not ajoining overlooking chrysler building, although buildings are really close together. Room Number 24-24. Good street market just outside hotel on a Sunday. Hotel Expensive for coffee and food but plenty diners and starbucks around grand central station. Advise getting Hop on Hop off Double decker guided tour bus, we got the $86 for 3 days includes ferry ride to Liberty Island and Empire State building (or) Top of the rock observatory. Observatories open at 8am go early to avoid queues. They are both great views but make sure it's a clear day when you go up? There are other tours available if you don't have 3 days. Its Impossible to walk it all. Century 21 or Loehmann's for designer shopping at half the price. Expensive for taxi,s from airports they wanted $70 from Newark international 20 miles away so we used public transport. I went onto New Jersey Transit (trip planner) website put Itinery in and they found the quickest way and cheapest $11.25 pp 20 minutes on train and two subway stops could'nt have been any easier. Hope you have a brilliant time we did it's a magical city and we felt very safe police on every corner.

Reviews.Title: “Service doesn't live up to their stars”
Reviews.Author: kleisch
Reviews.Content: At check-in, we were assigned a room with a queen-size bed, and the clerk told me they couldn't change it to a room with 2 doubles because I'd booked with "a 3rd party" (I used Priceline). Seriously? They only make changes for people who book directly with them and don't use a travel agent or a travel website? I wasn't even asking for a more expensive room or a free breakfast -- just a room with 2 beds so we could sleep more comfortably with our 2 small children. I suppose this is a warning to me not to use Priceline if you're traveling with kids, but also, I would have thought better of a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: cjsims
Reviews.Content: Is there a better location than Grand Central NYC? No! Hotel lobby was impressive and room was huge. Bed was super comfy (great for jet lag). Really enjoyed my stay here!

Reviews.Title: “It's simply not clean. Great location...dismal service. Unclean hotel that could be much better,”
Reviews.Author: Jeannepaul
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Friday afternoon for a medical conference. Our rate, for four people in a room (two teens and two adults) was $499/nt. Astronomical rate and they would not budge from it. Since this hotel was where the seminar was held, we really didn't have a choice. We will never again attend a conference at this hotel. Check in was smooth. We were ushered to room 1602. Directly across from the bank of elevators. As it turned out, the room was huge and the elevator noise was not a serious problem. The room itself was in poor condition. On the bedskirt on the bed nearest to the door there was a huge liquid stain of some sort. Disgusting. Every single lampshade had holes and was bent crooked like a brawl had taken place at some point. The carpeting was ancient. Ancient to the point of pulling away from the walls and cobwebs and dust and food had settled into the cracks. I was VERY happy I had brought my slippers. This is the kind of hotel that makes you cringe everytime you look into a nook or cranny. Behind the tv set? Thick with dust and crumbs. Most unfortunate was the fact that this room was connected to other rooms on both sides by reed-thin doors. Forget about getting a decent night's sleep if you have a neighbor who likes to watch television. We were kept up until 3am on a Saturday night by our neighbor's television. The Grand Hyatt touts their E-Concierge service. They have a link to it on their website. However, I sent two different requests to their E-Concierge before we arrived and both requests were completely ignored. The first request was for dinner reservations. Ignored. The second request was for extra towels in our room....an option that their E-Concierge offers. That request was also ignored. We had to phone housekeeping for the extra towels. Every single day. We were promised a coffee machine and a fridge in our room. We had to phone housekeeping for those as well. The maid refused to stock the coffee maker with coffee and cups after the first day. Forget about getting any glasses in the room. We were drinking out of our hands from the bathroom tap while brushing our teeth. If you would like 2 wine glasses delivered to your room the charge is $6.
