Close to Times Square and all the major attractions. Staff was extremely helpful and accomdating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: manicsfan
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here 12th May and had no problems at all. We had stayed once before and everything was fine but there have been some mixed reviews so we were a little concerned - we needn't have worried. We were a little early for check-in but this wasn't a problem. We were checked in quickly and efficiently by the hotel staff. Our room was large, very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a little on the small side but again, not a problem, it was perfectly adequate. We had room-service during our stay - the order was taken by a very helpful lady and was delivered quickly. The food was great if a little expensive (£20 for a club sandwich and fries) The best thing about this hotel is the location - Grand Central Terminal is quite literally on your doorstep. We would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Grand Central Hyatt in NYC”
Reviews.Author: pegan7700
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to a conference we attended on site, but added a few days before it to see the City and visit family. It's conveniently located for Subways and easy walking in Midtown East next to Grand Central Station. Even though I obtained very good deal using hotel's internet site (paying in full in advance and nonrefundable), upon check in the staff gave us a quiet room on high floor away from elevators. Standard rooms are small (250 sq. ft.) but comfortable. No coffee pot or mini bar but had a big flat screen TV. Its restaurant menu was limited and the dishes uneven but very pricey as is everything in New York. Best deal was bar food in adjoining area just beyond restaurant and though portions were small the meals were surprisingly good. Had stayed here several years ago and enjoyed this stay much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location disappionting guest room”
Reviews.Author: DoctorKeo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights on the 15th floor of the hotel. The public rooms were very nice, a great shame about the guest rooms. The room was quite large but had a tired feeling to it. The bathroom was very small and dirty. I complained about the mould growing in the shower cubicle, they came and removed half – why half? I complained about the TV with a serious picture fault and alarm clock, wrong time and no instructions to change the time, while we were out that turned the radio on the clock on but still displayed the wrong time and turned the TV on – I don’t think the maintenance team quite understand maintenance. The noise from the street was loud and we were very surprised to find the windows single glazed. The breakfast buffet was good.

Reviews.Title: “good stay at the grand”
Reviews.Author: deltaguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt April 11 prior to boarding the QE2 for England on the 12th. Check in was a bit chaotic but the staff very efficiently resolved our wrong room assignment. Not enough bellmen at check in; lobby is quite a distance from the entry and on a different level. Concierge had already arranged for a car and driver to meet us at JFK via email request. Hotel has an awesome concierge, Joe. He booked our car and driver to get to the cruise terminal on the 12th, got fantastic restaurant reservations on the spot, and even designed us a walking tour before dinner. Staff was efficient and courteous. Our deluxe king room was very spacious, had a walk in closet, but was very dark (lighting) and the bathroom was tiny. Great view from large window, though. Room and bathroom were very clean and bed was supremely comfortable. Location just can't be beat; connected to the Terminal and just steps away from Park Avenue and Madison Avenue. Forget breakfast from room service; $21.00 for two eggs? Go downstairs to the coffee bar and get super pastries and coffee for minimal money. Overall, a good stay and I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AnneCGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at Grand Hyatt, New York. Great location, quite impressive lobby, express check in, and check out, available. Comfiest beds, some voices could be heard from the bedrom next door but not intrusive. Dont drink in this hotel the bar is expensive - even more expensive than the Campbell Apartment, in Grand Central Station. For its location I would certainly stay here again, bedrooms were spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: toddling40
Reviews.Content: I went this past weekend to New York as a surprise trip for my partner for his birthday/our anniversary. I got a great flight rate, so I decided to Priceline for a 4-star hotel in New York, and I wound up with the Grand Hyatt. I should have known I was in for a bit of a rough ride. And mind you, I definitely know I got a good rate. I would, however, be rather more unhappy if I had paid full price for this place. First, I e-mailed a request to Hyatt e-concierge to see if I could pay extra and upgrade to Regency Club. Mind you, I have done similarly in the past with Hiltons, several Starwood properties, and a couple of Marriotts (the ones that don't close their #*$%@ club lounges on weekends). It's never been a problem. I have also made simple bedding requests of other Hyatts, and I have been treated well. First, I got a flat, "No". I then sent an executive e-mail carpet bomb to a few Hyatt higher-ups to see why in the heck I couldn't at least try for something so simple--I wasn't asking for free, I was asking to pay for an upgrade. I actually got a phone call within 2 hours from the Vice-President of the GH New York, telling me the reasoning, and promising that he would check availablilty for me and get back to me. Needless to say, he never did. When I arrived at the Grand Hyatt, I was greeted with a rather gruff young woman who was basically shooing a young couple away when they were asking to change rooms. Uh-oh. I decided not to even ask about the potential upgrade. The young woman in question was fast, but she was cold, demanding, and borderline rude. Great 4-star reception. The room was not clean; there was even trash in the bathroom trashcan from the previous guest. The bathroom wall tiles are plastic, the grout is dirty, and the general feel of the place is very, very tired. The room size is actually pretty big for New York, but the layout was a bit odd. And, as previous guests have noted, the noise coming from adjoining rooms is borderline intolerable. Oh, and our next door neighbors left their room service trays in the hallway the evening we arrived, and they weren't carted away all day until, of course, we were actually drifting off to sleep the next evening. I knew the exact moment, as they made as much noise as humanly possible taking them away. Room service, by the way, is hand over fist the most expensive I have ever seen, and we travel a lot--yes, even to New York. A base price of $23 for a continental (not even including service charges) which is juice, coffee for 1, and a croissant, muffin, OR bagel is kind of, well, insane. Luckily, there are plenty of reasonably priced options within a 2-minute walk in either direction right outside the door. I filled out their survey during video check-out. I did that once at the airport Hyatt in Orlando with a so-so experience, and they CALLED my room within 30 seconds to ask how they could make it up to me. I gave this place a pure thumbs down and heard nothing. Here's the main problem I have. I got a 3-star room, 1.5 star service, and I was pretty much made to feel as if I didn't matter. If I had paid for a 2-star room in New York, I would probably be thrilled. However, this place is supposed to be 4-star, and it just isn't. In any way except for the pretentious lobby. No more Priceline for me in New York. I'll stick to my happy favorite, the Hampton Inn Times Square North. There, I get good, friendly service, a free breakfast, big rooms, luxurious beds, and a stress-free time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: boston_tripadviser
Reviews.Content: Overall, a very pleasant stay. I got a king room via Priceline for $150 and initially I was a bit concerned after reading some of the negative reviews here. Fortunately, my stay turned out to be great. The room was relatively small, but that is to be expected from a NYC hotel in the moderate price range. Other than that, everything was perfect. Room was in great shape, clean and attractive. TV with tons of cable channels, including HBO. The iPod docking station and radio clock combination is great. Very small bathroom, but with all the necessary amenities. And as noted in other reviews, no mini bar. The location is perfect, right on several subway lines and in walking distance to most of the tourist things in mid-town. Every staff person I came in contact with was extremely helpful, and upon request, I was granted a late 2 PM checkout, which is pretty generous in a busy hotel. Again, I would highly recommend the hotel for a quick stay in NYC, although the standard room rate of about $300 seems a little high. But if you can get a deal, it’s a perfect hotel for business or sigh-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Not a very good experience”
Reviews.Author: momofmuch
Reviews.Content: My husband had called and made this reservation and used his Hyatt points so my niece and I could stay 2 nights for free. He had asked for 2 queens and a non-smoking room. When we got to our room, it had ONE double bed and smelled like smoke. We called the desk and they informed us that there were NO rooms available with the 2 beds but did move us to a King non-smoking. They told us they would try to fill our request for the next night but when we called the next day, they said there was still nothing available. We had checked in early in the day and my husband had made the reservation months in advance. We also had a bit of a problem with room service when we ordered a dessert and they brought 2 spoons, one of which had coffee on it! The rooms and bathrooms are quite small also. The lobby is impressive but probably will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand central was grand and central! Beat our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: monkeygirlcalgary
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much but were pleasantly surprised. Room was large, clean, very quiet, bed was comfy and the hotel lobby was great. Right by Grand Central Station, walking distance to lots of attractions. Would definitely stay here again. Tip is to watch their website as they post lock in specials which saved us about $100 a night. We were in a deluxe King and would probably stay there again. Great market, pharmacy and Starbucks right there as well (you will need bandaids for your feet!). Walk, walk, walk!

Reviews.Title: “mother/daughter weekend”
Reviews.Author: traveler08Nc
Reviews.Content: Room/bath were as advertised/pictured and worth its cost, but acceptable by many NYC hotel standards. Daily room service was inconsistent (bed covers left on floor one day, wash cloths not replaced one day though all towels were which seems wasteful when occupants do not put towels on floor/in tub indicating desire for replacements). Luggage storage fee unacceptable for such a large chain. Hotel restaurant/cafe unappealing, but wonderful restaurants, delis, pubs, etc. nearby. Hotel staff quite friendly and helpful. Easy to access Grand Central subway, though would be much better to have La Guardia more readily accessible by subway and not having to use bus service...NYC taxi driver did not use EZPass toll lane upon departure (reported to transportation authority).

Reviews.Title: “Costly fork!”
Reviews.Author: maincourse
Reviews.Content: My husband is in Manhattan one week of every month, couldn't get into his regular hotel so booked the Grand Hyatt. He worked late one night, so when he returned to the hotel he was tired so decided to have a cup of soup for dinner. He asked at the front desk for a spoon or fork. She said they would send one right up. My husband said okay, although he hoped just to be directed to a plastic spoon or fork somewhere so he could go to his room, have the soup and go to bed. When he got to the room, housekeeping called to say they would be right up with the fork and it would cost $6.00. That is $6.00 for the use of a fork!!! My husband was paying over $400.00 a night for the room and he couldn't get the use of a fork for free???? He did not use their fork (his soup cost under $1) but quietly borrowed one off a room service tray and washed it himself and used that. Things are out of control when $400+ a night hotels charge for the use of a fork!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Sunsal
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend night at the Grand Hyatt New York. This is not the type of hotel we would ordinarily choose, since we prefer smaller, boutique style hotels, but we were traveling with a group and the hotel was chosen by others. Still, we were pleasantly surprised. The staff was very friendly. When we were inadvertently given a smoking room after registering for non-smoking, the front desk clerk upgraded us to a deluxe king on the 25th floor which was really nice. I was prepared for noise after reading the reviews here, but our room was perfectly quiet and the black-out curtains did their job so well that we slept later than usual in the morning. The bedding was super comfortable, and the room was very clean. The location on 42nd Street was great. We walked to Times Square, the Theater District, and the shops on 5th Avenue, and it was an easy subway ride from the train station next door to Chinatown for dim sum. The bellhops managed our group's luggage with remarkable efficiency, and we ended our short stay with an outrageously expensive but worth-every-penny drink in the 2nd floor bar before pulling out on Sunday afternoon. If you like big, busy, glitzy hotels, this would be an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mmgohoos
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt New York is a great hotel with a great location in a great city! Our room was not as large as some I have stayed in, but we were on the 28th floor, it was quiet and perfect for staying in Midtown. The hotel is connected to Grand Central Station which makes getting to your train (Subway or commuter) a breeze. The location was the best part about the Grand Hyatt. We walked to Rockefeller Center and it only took about 20 minutes. We could have walked to Times Square but chose to take the Shuttle from Grand Central instead. The staff was very helpful including giving opinions and advice on what to wear and places to eat. If you are looking for a hotel in NYC with a great location and quiet with a beautiful lobby, perfect for a romantic weekend, the Grand Hyatt would be the perfect place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Service, but called security TWICE”
Reviews.Author: mykidssherpa
Reviews.Content: I was at the Grand Hyatt from Wed April 16-Sunday April 20th. My parents were in the adjoining room from Wed April 16- Monday April 21st. This is at least our 6th stay at this hotel because we love the location and the excellent customer service. I regret to report, however, this was by far the WORST trip we have had in this hotel. Thursday night shortly after midnight a large group of high school/college students who were performing Carnegie Hall entered the next room and began laughing and talking loudly enough in the room next door that the sound was traveling right through the wall, against our headboards. I called security at 12:40 am and security came up quickly and the room immediately quieted down, to their credit. Then the next night, a large group of young women, possibly from the same group, stood in the area around the elevator and were literally shouting with laughter, starting at 12:15. This time I called security within 15 minutes as it was clear they were going to use the hall as a social area. I realize that as a hotel return business is important and the large annual traveling groups are a dependable source of revenue. But we are seriously considering moving to the Hilton, at least for our Springtime trips, if this is going to be an annual, on-going situation. It is absolutely unacceptable to pay $300+ a night and have to tolerate a situation akin to a college dormitory. The kids were walking around barefoot in the hallways, wearing their flannel pajamas, carrying smelly slices of cheese pizza on Friday. I would have overlooked this if they were not so noisy after midnight. Otherwise, our stay was wonderful, as usual. Staff is polite, well trained and responsive. The location is superb, and the hotel is literally on top of 6 subway lines, with a Delmonicos 1/2 a block away and several chain coffee shops for a midday break. I love this hotel but I am not going to stay here in the Spring unless I get a guarantee from a manager that they will give me a room away from the school kids in April. (We did ask for a room change but they could not give us 2 rooms adjoining with double beds and we had already moved rooms to obtain the adjoining rooms shortly after check in Wed.)

Reviews.Title: “Really a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sandeliza
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of April/08. Check in was excellent and fast. Front desk clerk offered a $50 credit on our bill for a Sunday Hotel promo as advertised on the web. I was a little worried about some of the reviews, but when we arrived , we were pleasently surprised. Very nice hotel, modern room, amenities, great lobby area and within walking distance to restaurants, shopping etc., including Times Square. I thought our room was excellent. King deluxe, GREAT BED!!! and QUIET!!! Lots of space, large closet and sitting area. Bathroom was average size, but who cares, how much time do you need to spend in there? I have stayed @ the Belvedere Hotel NY also, which was also very nice but you can't beat the value from the Grand Hyatt in location, and all this hotel has to offer.We have stayed in 4 star hotels elsewhere such as Las Vegas and this place was right up there. We will definately recommend this hotel to our friends and will most likely stay there again. LOVED, LOVED LOVED IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Good But Not Grand”
Reviews.Author: travelingguy7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the beginning of April. I was given a room on the 25th floor. It was spacious for two people but no more than that. I noticed there was a bit of mold on the shower curtain in the bathroom. Secondly, the elevators seemed to run a bit slow. The best thing about this hotel is the LOCATION!!! It is connected to Grand Central and is only blocks away from Times Square and the Empire State Building. When I made my reservation I had requested an early check-in, which was granted by the staff. I highly recommend this hotel to first time visitors to the city. I have stayed in numerous Hyatt properties throughout the country,this is was not my favorite. For being the only Hyatt property in the city, I feel they need to improve the cleanliness of the rooms and modernize the furniture. Do not stay here for more than $300 a night!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: bay_girl2
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews of this hotel, we weren't sure what to expect. What we realized is that there are a lot of pretentious prats out there who simply like to moan. This hotel was fantastic. A perfect location for tourists, a five to ten minute walk to Time Square, located directly over Grand Central Station, and a block away from 5th Ave. The lobby was lovely, the rooms clean and very average in size. The bathroom, (despite what several moaners have said) were average for a hotel room and clean. It was amazingly quiet with the most comfortable bed, which, trust me, you'll need after all the walking. Although the price of food and room service was laughable, the Cafe Metro up by MacDonalds on 42nd was decent for breakfast, but there are lots of little cafes all over the city as you walk. We found that any eateries around the hotel tended to be pricey. The pizza place in the food hall of Grand Central made the best pizza we had on the trip! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing more than human warehousing”
Reviews.Author: fenwayman
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the Hyatt near Grand Central Station because for some reason the rate I found was better than my usual choices, which are the NY Hampton Inns. Expecting Hyatt to be a full service, top choice, I was extremely disappointed. Other than receiving a clean room, there was nothing good about this stay. From check-in to check-out, the staff were at best indifferent. Half a dozen bell/valet staff stand around in front of the hotel looking bored. They watch people with bags try to get in and out of the revolving doors. They watch people walk out of the hotel and look lost. They certainly did not seem interested in helping me out when I needed directions and struggled with bags on my way in. I specifically asked the desk clerk for a non-connecting room away from the elevators, and lo and behold, I got a room with connecting doors on both sides, directly across from the elevators. I was told that that was all that was available of my room type. I heard everything that went on in both rooms: the connecting doors are not soundproof or light proof. If the room had not been so dark (very little light wattage is provided) I'd have had to shove towels under the door to block out the light, as I did the front door. I also heard the elevator bells, but think they may have turned them off at night. During the second day the water to my room went off. Not sure what happened, but I did call and it was resolved. The water after was brown for a few minutes. Never an explanation or an apology. The room was large and clean. I had room to exercise. The bathroom is small but the water pressure was good. Amenities in the bathroom were nice. There was no coffee maker in the room. Bed was new and very comfortable. Television was the old blocky kind but reception was clear and volume control worked well (to block out the noise from the televisions in the two adjacent rooms). No reason to stay there again. Lots and lots of better and probably cheaper options in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hyatt in the United States”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug88000
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hyatt Hotels all over the United States. The Park Hyatt in Washington D.C. and the Grand Hyatt Kauai, Hawaii are probably the best the chain has to offer, however Hyatt has some pretty shabby hotels including the Hyatt Regency Miami, Hyatt Regency Atlanta Downtown, and the Grand Hyatt New York takes the cake, I don't even know how this hotel could be in the Hyatt chain. The lobby is out of the 80s, with it's marble and mirrors, guest rooms are the absolute pits, rooms are dated and have a drab, dirty feel to them, most rooms have a queen or king size bed, but don't expect much bathroom space, you can't even turn around in the bathroom. I had a problem with mold and mildew in my shower, so I complained and received a credit on my bill. I would have rather had a clean room that didn't require flip flops to be worn in the shower and around the carpet, but since I was there only a few days I didn't make a fuss. I must say that in a city like New York, I would think that Hyatt would want to represent itself better than this, they should consider getting rid of this hotel. I got a significantly discounted rate of around $200 a night on priceline, normally that room sold for $419. I pity the person who spends $400+ a night on this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: tmartinez03
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt with my family for 3 nights. The location was excellent right next to Grand Central Station. We could do a lot of walking from there and pick up any metro or train next door. The rooms were big, clean and furnished with good taste. Most hotel rooms in NewYork are very tiny but these were just right. I would definetly stay here again. I had done a lot of internet research before booking my stay here and I was looking at hostels and 2-3 star hotels but they were as expensive as this one, so it's really not worth going to a crappy hotel for a few dollars less.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not so grand!”
Reviews.Author: ssoPlymouth
Reviews.Content: There were 3 adults and one child in our party. We were told we would have 3 beds, however on arrival there were only 2 double beds, (English doubles) and therefore 1 adult had to share with a child, which was not ideal. We were told no other beds could be put in a room because of health and safety. The room was small and it was crowded with 4 of us, however we did not spend much time in our room luckily. On showering early in the morning we had no hot water, and the water was only tepid on other occasions. What we missed most was there there were no tea and coffee making facilities, and we really needed a drink first thing in the morning. However the location was excellent, could not fault it, and we made use of Starbucks in Grand Central Station. Previously we stayed at the Waldorf Astoria, would prefer that if went again, it did at least have some character.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but nice”
Reviews.Author: labtest
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 4 nights in early April '08. Our room was on the 25th floor and overall was OK. Big comfy bed, small but useable bathroom ( although the more generously proportioned guests may struggle for space when... er...sitting down!) Noise level from the street was practically non-existent which was good. Mind you a motorbike grand prix or a NASCAR race would have had difficulty registering above the noise from our neighbours! It wasn't their fault - all they were doing was talking, laughing and watching TV. But those walls! Any thinner and you could wave to the folks next door. That said, the rest of the experience of staying at this hotel is good. Staff are helpful, check in/out is speedy and the location excellent. So, do consider the Grand Hyatt but remember your ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: ceflondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located with many sights and shopping opportunities in walking distance - Grand Central Station, Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Fifth Avenue, Macys etc... However, the hotel itself is very dated in decor with a dark imposing lobby in browns and shabby bedrooms. I found the staff to be rude on occasion and the general management did not seem like that of a big name hotel like the Hyatt. I agree with one of the other user comments about the noise - due to the interconnecting rooms you hear EVERYTHING from your neighbours plus lots of doors banging and general noise from the corridors. The rooms do not have mini-bars/fridges so no water or snacks without going down to the vending machine on each floor or paying a ridiculous amount for water on room service. If you want a basic hotel with a recognisable name in a good location then it may be a good hotel, but I personally wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Grand”
Reviews.Author: EuroLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a while ago, but forgot to put up a review at the time. Don't come here expecting the same standard as say, a Grand Hyatt in Asia (e.g. Shanghai or Hong Kong), because it's completely different. Apart from the size of the place, there's nothing grand about it. Tried to check in at 3pm, but the room wasn't ready, so had to hang around one of the cafes in Grand Central. When we got to the actual room, it was a bit underwhelming - dingy. The walls, as many other people have said, are paper thin. Hard to sleep if your neighbour is watching TV. The bathroom was a decent sixe, but there wasn't much hot water on the first night I was there. Service alright, but nothing special. Overall, give it a miss. it seems unfortunate that this is the only Hyatt offering in New York City. Yes, New York hotels are expensive, and what do you expect $350 per night etc, but this place is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced NYC!”
Reviews.Author: gooner1711
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt for my 40th in NYC. The hotel is a "typical" NYC hotel - big, lack of real character and overpriced. The location is excellent and just a short walk from most of the major highlights and close to the Subway. The hotel lobby is very large and always busy, check in was swift and efficient. We had booked a Regency Club Room and on the Regency Club Floor we were allocated. The room had an interconnecting door which was like having tissue paper in between the walls - as thin as that! We had the Royal Snorter in the room next door and she made so much noise each night that we hardly slept...if she ever reads this - you know who you are! The room itself appeared to have no advantages over a standard room. The bathroom was quite small and little "space". The Regency Lounge was a bit of a disappointment. Breakfast was satisfactory, but unlike other Regency Lounges around the world there was no "Happy Hour" which was a bit of a disappointment. Drinks prices were standard NYC prices and offered no reason to have a drink before going out. A lack of decent restaurants also left you with little choice but to go out. Overall, the Grand Hyatt was not so grand.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoPedestrian
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel a lot for the location and the clean, comfortable, spacious rooms. We even had a nice view. We walked everywhere from here. The Met, Guggenheim, Moma, Central Park, Union Square, Washington Square, Columbus Circle, Times Square, Restaurant Row, the Brooklyn Bridge. But if you don't want to walk, Grand Central Station is right next door. We covered nearly all of lower Manhattan on foot from the Hyatt and had a fabulous time. It was great to be able to come back and have a nice hot soak in the tub with the hotel's provided soaps and lotions and then go downstairs to the bar or one of the many nearby restaurants. "Restaurant Row" is less than 2 miles away. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Manhattan who doesn't necessarily need a good night's sleep. As others have mentioned, the heavy doors slam, and during our first two nights we had very active neighbors. On the Friday and Saturday night of our stay I didn't sleep at all and had such huge bags under my eyes I refused to let my husband take any photos of me. There's a great little coffee kiosk in the lobby area. We got lots of excellent "insider" tips from the concierge desk, and there are some great local brews available at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: fencepost
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Grand Hyatt. It is a very pretty hotel. Our room was overly large with a nice big shower. The beds were very comfortable. It was nice that the windows opened. Our a/c didn't work, only the heat would come on making the room very stuffy. We just turned it off and left the windows open which did the trick. We stayed on the 19th floor and had no problem with noise. Sure, the doors closing were a little loud but it didn't bother us. A lot of school groups use this hotel so the elevators were full quite a bit of the time. We had no trouble with the groups though. It was nice too that the hotel is connected to Grand Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “good with some minor annoyances”
Reviews.Author: dr-gumby
Reviews.Content: The room was very large for a midtown hotel. The renovations looked very nice and added a nice modern feel. As for the annoying details: - I think it's silly that a 4 star hotel charges $10/day for internet access while places like Holiday Inn Express provide it free of charge. - Mediocre water pressure - As others have said, the self-closing doors slam very loudly. The convenient location and large room size make this worth consideration. FYI, I would rate it 3/5 if I paid the full amount (I used priceline).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: earz
Reviews.Content: Location at Grand Central Station was very convenient in NYC...our room was large enough with a very large bathroom. Staff were helpful, although when we checked in, they asked us to change from a room with two double beds to a room with a king and a roll away, which was fine with my daughter. However, the roll away was supposed to be delivered in the afternoon and ended up getting to our room at midnight, after no less than 5 phone calls then the housekeeping person came with attitude to deliver the bed. There were a number of groups staying at the hotel and getting an elevator was a problem. We were on the 34th floor and the elevators were very quick when you could get one, but we often had to wait 3 or 4 elevators. The common areas of the hotel are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Give this hotel a wide berth”
Reviews.Author: Yellandrock
Reviews.Content: This is like a lot of so-called 4-5 star New York hotels. Swanky foyer and lobby area but pretty shabby rooms. I booked a Regency Club room over a long weekend in March 2008. It cost around USD 380 per night which was outrageous on reflection. The staff at reception were unwelcoming, the booking was screwed up and there was a long check-in queue. I got it sorted but not without demanding to see the manager and I am truly not a normally difficult person to deal with , but this was not my problem - it was their problem which they only accepted with bad grace. The room was so dimly lit it was difficult to see anything in the wintry light outside. The bathroom was tiny and the handbasin cracked with mildew around the bath area - not good and why should you accept it at those prices!! The towells were worn out and paper thin. The Regency Club itself was small, faded and crowded. True, you got a continental breakfast which was OK, but there were virtually no staff, no available tables and nobody to clear tables when people left, apart from one much put upon poor soul. This was truly a hotel which was overpriced and overrated. I would not recommend it and I would not go back. RCP

Reviews.Title: “Great for weekend visits, but would not stay for business”
Reviews.Author: sir_warren
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. I have had two distinctively different experiences here. A couple months ago I stayed for pleasure and it was a great hotel for that purpose. Central location, nice rooms, good view, etc. For business I had a poor experience, the walls are very thin and I was woken up by another room's alarm clock. On a Sunday this would likely not occur. If you need the Hyatt points this place won't kill you, but I'd stay elsewhere if given the option.

Reviews.Title: “very lovely”
Reviews.Author: guscla
Reviews.Content: had a very nice room on the 27th floor. 2 fullsize dbl beds - great for friends sharing and nice seperat closet for coats and shopping to be stowed away in. Bathroom not so big, but all very nice and clean. extremely pleasant in all aspects

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: travelallover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 4 nights in March 2008. I booked two rooms through Priceline and received a great rate. I felt I was not treated any differently than other guests who booked through the hotel (I not given the broom closet, for example). The Hyatt employees were excellent, all nice and ready to help in anyway they could. The rooms were nice and clean. The city noise was surprisingly very minimal, however the noise in the hallways was a little loud. No big deal. The only thing I would note is don't try to take a shower around 5 PM, that is apparently when everyone does and the hot water vanishes. I did eat at the hotel and the food was average/good (The Grill, the Sky Bar and room service). The fitness center upstairs was perfect for me. Also, very clean. Overall, the location is great, the rooms are clean, and I would stay at The Grand Hyatt again..

Reviews.Title: “Better places in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Farnham_Flyer
Reviews.Content: Yes, great location. But there are better places nearby - The Library, Dylan and Roosevelt for example. For the price, the Bryant Park is far better.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: charlegirl
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt has an impressive lobby, a wonderfully convenient location for shopping, and your typical hotel amenities. Although this is not a huge selling point, I always enjoy hotels that provide movies in the room (for an additional charge) and I was more than happy with the selection available. An added bonus is the handy dandy electronic check-in and check-out- great for people like me who dislike those tedious routines that come along with traveling. The staff were friendly and even approached us as we were checking out (electronically) to ensure that we enjoyed our stay. However, if you're seeking a uniquely NYC experience or that delightful gem of personalized service, comfort, AND sophistication I would strongly suggest that you look elsewhere. Not surprisingly, the Grand Hyatt's room lacked the coziness or luster that the magnificent lobby (and website) would lead one to anticipate. Although they have attempted to modernize the rooms they came short of accomplishing anything truly impressive- I would even go so far as to say the decor comes uncomfortably close to being tacky. Nevertheless, it is what it is... a standard, generic hotel room. Despite my negative assertions above my experiences at the hotel were nothing less than satisfactory- I was even startled to find out that the room was slightly larger than I expected. Also, my companion traveler and I were without our luggage (I have more than a few unkind things to write about Continental Airlines) and the hotel provided us with 3 kits full of deluxe-sized toiletries. If you're traveling to the city for business, you're not celebrating any major events, and/or you aren't intending on making your hotel one of the highlights of your stay in NYC, then I would definitely suggest the Grand Hyatt to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Ask for a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: DrJJBaltimore_MD
Reviews.Content: Large, busy hotel with a great location. Access to Grand Central Terminal and subways without having to go outside (very useful on rainy or very cold days). The east side location with quick access to the shuttle subway (S train), which allows direct access to Times Square, makes this a very convenient location for all midtown locations. Rooms are large by NYC standards. I have stayed in this hotel three times in the past year and have always asked for and have received a renovated room. The rooms were well designed and very comfortable. In contrast to some other posters, I did not notice any noise problems. The hotel does cater to large groups and the check out lines can be long. However the lines can be avoided by checking in with a credit card and then checking out by phone, TV or by using the computer check out in the lobby. Negatives include very high ($60.00 per night) valet parking without in and out privileges, as well as high fees for internet. However this is typical for NYC hotels.

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was nice”
Reviews.Author: wellermdfan
Reviews.Content: Won a really good bid on priceline. Pros: Arrived around 10:30 and got to check in early. Stayed in nice sized King room. Because there was only 1 bed there was lots of floor space in the room. Never heard our neighbors while we were there. Good thermostat control of heat in room. Nice shower pressure. In room safe. Clean iron and ironing board. extra pillows in the closet. Really dark window shades for sleeping in late without the sun shining in your face. Front desk staff was nice and they implemented a checkin line with a person directing the line - this was new since the last time we stayed there and it helped the line move quickly and elminated people from skipping into the line ahead of others. They also have a phone checkout system now in addition to the check out kiosks in the lobby which was nice - just call and leave your name and room number, leave the keys in the room and you can leave. Convenient location with good subway access and lots of cabs everywhere. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Cons: Not enough towels, really slow elevators and they stopped on every floor on the way down. No fridge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: sara_scarlette
Reviews.Content: I lived in Manhattan for about two years, and this is where I would stay with my family when they came to visit me. People staying here after visiting other hotels (perhaps even other Hyatts) may be shocked at how small the rooms are. What they should realize is that Manhattan is a tiny island that is full of millions of people - rooms are small everywhere. Maybe if you pay $800 a night on the Upper East Side you will have more space, but for $400 a night in Midtown, this hotel is amazing. The rooms are quite small, but are lovely inside. The beds are very comfortable and all the furnishings are new and elegant. Don't expect much of a view, but there are few places in Midtown that will have a fabulous view. There is far too much to do in NYC to worry about a small room with no view. Just be happy there are no cockroaches. On that note, I will mention that the entire hotel is beautifully clean at all times. The only meal I ever ate here was breakfast (again, in New York there is just so much choice - why eat at the hotel??). The brunch is quite nice - if you go at peak times, expect to wait in a rather long line for a table. The restaurant is generally full of businessmen, and they are in and out quite quickly. The food is above-average buffet fare. The service is nice, although the wait staff can get pretty busy. All-in-all, after some of the places I lived and stayed in and around Manhattan, the Grand Hyatt is really a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly reasonable”
Reviews.Author: ItinerantLondoner
Reviews.Content: Plenty of other views on this hotel, so in brief - Positives - - Location (Midtown) - Good size, reasonably equipped and clean rooms - Overall good price (provided you go for the internet rate a few weeks in advance) - Chain miles/points etc Negatives - Chargeable internet access - a scandal with chains now you can get it in the nearest independent cafe for free - Surly staff In detail - If what matters to you in New York is a decent base in a good location, then provided you can get a competitive rate this hotel is for you. This is not a hotel with particularly memorable spaces (bars, restaurants etc) but it is pleasant and the rooms are well sized and equipped. The location is very central, and decent venues are a walk or short cab ride away. On the negative side - it lacks the personal touch you would look for if this was for a special occasion (for a utilitarian tourist visit it is fine). I also find extortionate charges for internet access particularly counterintuitive given the number of independent locations offering it for free. Would definitely stay here again, though depending on the occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: ohxela
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference, so it was a little of a "no-choice" situation. Having said that, it was better than we expected, although it was expensive (close to $300 per night) but I guess that's Manhattan. The room we had was on the 30th floor, so it was spacious, with a walk-in closet. It was cleaned everyday, but it was looking a little tired and worn out, especially the carpet. The front desk staff were polite and efficient, and we were checked in really quickly, despite a long line and this being a huge hotel. The location of this hotel is fantastic, being right above Grand Central Terminal and the subway lines. It was an easy walk to everywhere else - Bryant Park, Times Square, the United Nations. Lots of stores nearby too, if shopping is your thing. My quibble with being in a Midtown location is the lack of great restaurant choices in the vicinity. Lots of delis and take-out places for people to eat on the run, but not too many nice sit-down restaurants. Another problem with the Hyatt - they do nickel and dime you for everything. There is no coffee maker in the room, the internet access is not free, nor are local calls or toll-free phone numbers. So if you have an expense account from your company, all this wouldn't really bother you, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “great location, remodeled rooms great, but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: cj_minneapolis
Reviews.Content: So the positives - this is a great location in NYC. You are right at Grand Central, so you are at a major transportation hub in New York as well as to/from the Metro North. I highly recommend Michael Jordan's steakhouse, which is right there in Grand Central. For a fun pub that is close, I would recommend Annie Moore's on the back side of Grand Central. It is a 12 minute walk to Times Square, or you can jump on the train as well. I had stayed here before but never been in a remodeled room, and I was really impressed. It was twice the size of other 4-star hotels in NYC, had a huge bathroom, and very nice amenities. SUper clean! There was a TV in the center of the room that swiveled so you could watch it in bed or at the desk, which came in handy. The new bed was comfortable, nice sheets, etc. These things may seem small, but in NYC hotels can really be spotty, particularly 3-stars. My biggest annoyance was the walls were PAPER THIN. I could literally hear my neighbor's every single word even in quiet conversations, and the TV in their room sounded like it was right next to me. The hallways were equally loud. This is a huge hotel that always draws large groups - so check-in and check out can be very crowded and long. The lobby seems to always be filled with the 100-person groups. Overall above average - ask for a remodeled room - and don't stay here if you are a light sleeper!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: leftwing
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Grand Hyatt was very nice. Even though the hotel is "grand" in size, it retains a cozy feeling. Our room (2667) was not small. Not huge either, but a comfortable size. The bathroom was lovely, although I have to say I don't really care for the scent of the white ginger soap and shampoo. The beds are very comfortable. The woman at the front desk who checked us in was friendly and welcoming. We used the fitness center on the top floor, which was adequate, but the temperature up there was hotter than I like. The only disappointment was the loud noise of doors shutting in the hallway. Other than that, it's a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: nishnish2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is very nice, very rich looking and grand. The room itself is average. People have said the room is really small, but I had a corner room 1625 so I don't think it was all that small. The room is kinda depressing however... didn't think it was a 4* as the rating suggests. The bathroom was small but pretty nice - again for NYC standards this is normal. The countertops were nice, the bathroom was clean and the lighting was nice. I just thought the room was very depressing looking... hardly any paintings on the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: missdouglas
Reviews.Content: I was at the Grand Hyatt for 4 days the first week in January. This is a beautiful hotel. The location is awesome- Grand Central Station is next door. The in-house restaurant and bar is very elegant. If you have a chance, try the organic bread they serve before dinner- it's exceptional! The only down size is the size of the rooms, they are rather small. I realize that it is New York, but for the price, the room was small. Overall, I would certainly recommend the hotel and I would return myself.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand time in the Hyatt!!”
Reviews.Author: JojoCountyDurham
Reviews.Content: We went to New York on 30th December to stay for New Year and stayed for 4 nights. Our flight was delayed and when we arrived at the hotel it was 12.30am and our room had been booked out to other guests! The hotel was full! The manager couldn't have done more to put this right. He booked us into another hotel for our first night, paying our cab fare. He upgraded our room for the next 3 nights we stayed, gave us vouchers for a complementary breakfast, left a bottle of wine, cheese, crackers and chocolates and an letter in our room, apologising for any inconvenience we had been caused. The room was lovely, the staff very friendly and the rest of our stay there was first class. We would definately stay there again. The location was ideal, right next to Grand Central Station and a short walk from 5th Avenue and Saks, Tiffanys etc. The doorman, Marty, was a mind of information on where we could eat, find jazz music or best times to view the sites. We would certainly recommend this hotel for anyones first visit to the 'Big Apple'.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WeeLuv2Travel2
Reviews.Content: A great location right above Grand Central station. The lady at check in was extremely nice and helpful. The room looked like it had been recently renovated and it was very nice. It wasn't a huge room but it was perfectly adequate. We did eat in the hotel one evening and the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Travlin_Man525
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent 5 nights at the Grand Hyatt in the second week of February and we thought it was excellent. The rate was between $250.00 and $350.00 depending on the day and considering what New York costs, that's pretty much the average for a 4-star hotel. Good things: great location for the theater district, Grand Central Station. A great staff that were very helpful with many things. Very nice fitness center. Not so great: no mini bar, no bath robes (a drag when room service arrives!). Also, the breakfast buffet was a bit over priced. $30.00 for the full works...OK, fine I guess. But if you just want fruit and pastries it's still $25.00. That's nuts! But we enjoyed the hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt New York City an OK experience”
Reviews.Author: GosiaW
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Grand Hyatt New York in January 2008. Booked via Hotwire for an amazing $174/night! They say it is a $400/night hotel which was surprising to us as the hotel seemed to be a bit worn down. It was listed at 4 stars but in comparison to other 4 star Hyatts we stayed in was on low end of that rating. I understand though - "this is New York" :) Hotel is hugue, 20+ floors, with huge, over the top lobby. We traveled by car, was a bit hard to get to the front door to drop off the car but after doing couple of around the block circles we made it. Hotel's site did not specify that we should go up the ramp from Park Av. for easily accessible valet parking. Anyway it worked out. Registration was quick, we were upgraded to king size room. Great size of room with king size bed, writting desk, TV armoir and big comfy reading chair. Bathroom was small but adequate and comparable to other Hyatts we stayed in (Toronto, Calgary). Maid service was good. I was happy with the hotel for what I paid. Hotel's location was perfect, just on top of the Grand Central Station, with access to subway, tons of stores, places to eat, coffee shops etc. One night we ate dinner at the mexican place - good experience. At the Station there even was a market place where we picked up fres fruit, cheese and bread for breakfast one day. There is a great breakfast place two blocks from the hotel (Lexington & 39th) called Bloom Cafe. For $20 for both of us we hhad huge breakfast every day that kept us full until early dinner :) For dinner one night we went a bit more south on Lexington (up to 37th I think) to a small italian place called Fagioli. Good food, freshly prepared, at very reasonable prices. We took subway a lot, found it fastest and most economical way to move around. The metro transit map we got from hotel concierge turned out to be our "best friend" and took us efficiently from place to place. Only once we took the bus but it was later in the evening. We bought multiple trips metro pass which worked like a charm. Hotel services were fine and met our needs, the checkout was swift however we waited forever for our car to be brought by the valet.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: skinnypuppy420
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a rate of $185p/n through Priceline. If I had paid the full price shown for the room, I'd have thrown up. Luckily the room was worth the rate, but that's about it. The emergency doors that connect adjoining rooms acted more like amplifiers so we could hear what was going on inside them. We were kept up to the wee hours of the morning listening to our neighbors televisions, conversations, pornos and sex. Definitely a POOR set up. The staff was lack luster. The room service pricing outrageous. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay at the grand hyatt”
Reviews.Author: jejita
Reviews.Content: Nice, big room, tiny bathroom. I was afraid it would be very noisy but it was not and the fact that it is above grand central station is a huge plus. Nice breakfast place across 42 st. It was a nice stay. We did not pay the 500plus rate and for that amount of money I guess you could and should look for a better hotel but if you get a good rate (250-300) it is well worth that. We did specify we wanted to be away from the elevator banks and we had a room close to the ice machine and it was ok. Bad view though, just the hotel roof.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: bristol-blondie1986
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days during december with my dad as a present for my 21st birthday. We arrived early in the morning but the reception team kindly let us check in. The concerige team were brilliant with our luggage and full of local knowledge. The room was big with 2 double beds and plently of storage space. The bathroom wasnt very big with a small bath/shower. Had great toilettries and lots of flufffy towels. We had breakfast each morning, was quite pricy at $38.00 each but had plently of variety. The breakfast staff were more than helpfull taking interest as were from the uk which was sweet. Didnt have any other food as we wanted to explore the city more. The hotel is a perfect location close to shops and right next door to grand central station. The guest services team helped with maps and directions and also any problems with the room. The very kind lady on the tour and ticket booth helped us book tours we stayed at the hotel was so funny. The overall look and feel of the hotel was very nice and sophistcated. The only down point were the elevators, there were 10 of them all going to different floors of the hotel and you had to wait ages for the one you wanted. Would deffently stay again!1

Reviews.Title: “Worts Hyatt Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: CHICKLET93
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hyatt hotels from east coast to west coast and this has to be the most disappointing Hyatt I've stayed at. It lacked a mini bar, coffee pot, there were no wash cloths 1st night and 2nd might no hand towels. I was in the room when they cleaned and she did not even give clean drinking glasses! They reused the same glasses. Does this mean they don't change them from guest to guest??? Just rinse them out ???? The bed was like sleeping on a rock and the pillows were flat and useless with no additional ones to add. The Commadore bar was the best thing about this hotel. Too many good hotels in NYC DON'T STAY at the Grand Hyatt!!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleGray
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 5 nights in New York Grand Hyatt. It was amazing! The hotel is huge and the rooms are nice. There was 3 of us sharing a room, there were 2 double beds and plenty of room for us to get ready. The bathroom was also spacious with big mirror to do your make-up in. The lobby is grand and is constantly busy. We had continental breakfast included however we upgraded for 3 dollars and were allowed fruit, cheese and ham. the bagels are amazing and the wee waiter will toast them for u. The hotel is attached onto grand central station which is handy if you want to go travelling around. It is centrally located therefore u can walk to all the major shops like macys where we spent the whole day shopping like mad!! Its graeat and i would recommed a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Perfect Weeend...Ever!”
Reviews.Author: SteffiH
Reviews.Content: Had the most fanctastic time!!! First time to NY, and was totally amazed. The hotel was perfect; the best location, the room was clean, comfy, modern - all i could ask for. Concierge were extremely helpful, as were the doormen - even remembered that we were meant to be going on a shopping excursionand asked how it went. It really was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: nickitasf
Reviews.Content: the hotel is conveniently located, and is perfect for business travelers. the hotel is nicely decorated, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. the rooms are typically small for a new york city hotel, but are nicely decorated, and the beds are very comfortable. the cleanliness of my room upon check-in could have been better with hair in the sink and tub, and stains on the bed skirt. also, the room lighting is very dim, i could have used some extra light. a nice gesture of the hotel is to deliver the ny times to every guest room in the morning. thinking of the environment however this is an enormous waste of paper, as a lot of people don't read the paper or don't have time to do so. i would have much preferred if the hotel let guests choose at check-in if they want the paper delivered or not.

Reviews.Title: “Meets all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Zanzie
Reviews.Content: Clean, updated and decent-sized rooms with a comfortable mattress and fabulous location next to Grand Central Station in mid-town. Staff is extremely courteous and helpful. We stayed there as tourists but there were many business travelers there from all over the world. Elevators were fast, the lobby is grand and coffee was free from the lobby kiosk every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - do not worry!”
Reviews.Author: NCLindaB
Reviews.Content: Just returned tonight from 3 nights in NYC. This is the first time we did not stay at the Crowne Plaza - couldn't/wouldn't do the 375.00 a night they wanted. So, after a lot of research, I used Priceline and ended up with The Grand Hyatt. I was apprehensive from the bad reviews but in the end, I'll say that I would stay again in a minute. We arrived at 1pm and were in our room (early) by 1:10. The front desk was extremely friendly. The room was fine - beds very comfortable. Everything clean and pretty. The room was cleaned every morning on schedule. The bathroom was not large but certainly adequate - I have smaller bathrooms in my own home so no big deal. Concierge was very helpful along with the bellhop and the men outside the hotel who helped us get taxis. Nice to walk over to Grand Central Station without going outside to get a quick snack or lunch. Starbucks there too! Can't say enough - for less than half the price of Crowne Plaza - I'll stay every time.

Reviews.Title: “ok but not worth money”
Reviews.Author: chip1784
Reviews.Content: having stayed at hyatts many times it seemed a sensible option for new year in new york. It was not cheap but new york over new year is never going to be. The location is great but having upgraded to regency club i was not over impressed . Usually the upgrade is worth it but not in new york . The selection on offer in the regency lounge was limited and did not include alchoholic drinks something i have come to expect . The lobby is spectacular but the rooms were nothing special. I am not fussy in hotels but i expect value for money which i know i could have stayed at better in new york for the same or less money even over new year. Also noticed room service trays and trolleys left for many hours outside rooms . I would stay again if i got a good deal but would not upgrade to regency club. Before i went i was suprised how low down on trip advisors ratings the hotel was. I am not now. On the plus side the rib eye steak i ordered on room service is the best steak ive ever had and i have had some good ones before. New york itself was great especially the helicopter ride at night up the hudson river.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TPXB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the first weekend in January and it is our third time in this hotel. Overall this is a very good hotel and I had no problem with room or hallway noise. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms were pretty big by NYC standards. At check in I tried to use the self-check in machine and that did not work, but the young lady at the front desk checked me in quickly. You can nit pick about some little things about this hotel, but its not really worth it. Overall its a great location and nice place to stay. Keep in mind I am not a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic- Please Don't Worry About Other Reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: NCJC
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to location and then spent months reading some quite bad reviews about it and I was dubious. My review goes out to holiday makers who may be swithering over it........ I arrived on the 29th Dec 2007 for 4 nights and was delighted when I walked in the entrance, lovely waterfall, grand decor. No queue at check in, girl was lovely and even though we were 3hrs early our room was ready. We got a king deluxe. The room was clean, bed was comfy and luckily our view was excellent (chrysler building). The cleaners were in everyday, bed was changed, towels replaced, bathroom cleaned all the usual, plus as a bonus a paper (New York Times)was left every morning, no charge. The only thing I would say about the rooms are that the walls must be very thin its quite easy to hear next door and prob vice versa however this was not majorly offputting at all and given everything else who cares cause what more could you want, seriously, your in New York, how much time are you going to spend in your hotel room if your on holiday! Staff were very friendly throughout, we didn't eat in there but had a drink at each of the bars, expensive, normal for hotels, but comfortable...(theres a lovely cafe 'Pershing' across the road to the right for great breakfast)...there are a couple of shops in the hotel which we discovered last day! (should you need the usual keyrings etc before you go please try the gift shop before you leave the lady in there is lovely!) To check out you can do this self service or use the 'human' which we did and was fine, plus gave us a chance to say how happy we were with everything. So should you be pondering over the Grand Hyatt, please don't. If you want a lovely hotel thats close to everything (next door to grand central station for every subway you need, five mins walk to bryant park, 10 mins to times square) then go for it! (ps - If you are flying into Newark the bus from the airport stops just a street away, we found the hotel really easily and did same coming back)

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but they nickel-and-dimed me a bit much”
Reviews.Author: snoussi
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for a weekend company retreat. While I applaud their organization and execution of the company events (catering, meetings), I felt that for the price (even if I was not paying) the charge for additional services (phone, baggage storage) was excessive. Perhaps I don't know New York hotels, but I expected a bit more in this regard. Particularly the phone, which cost me $35+ for only four connections. On the plus side, the hotel was very well organized for the company events, and the fitness center was well-appointed, clean, and modern, if not a bit small for so many rooms. The rooms are comfortable and modern, although not entirely cozy. One final negative point was the business center, which is closed Sundays. I wasn't thrilled by this, especially considering that Sunday might be the only day for many business travelers to get work done! Location is good, very central, easy to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, spacious and comfortable, great fitness center”
Reviews.Author: xtos
Reviews.Content: First thing to mention is that I did not pick this hotel directly, but rather got it through priceline, so our rate was very good. I am giving it a 3 rating because it is just about what I would expect of an average 4 star hotel in NYC in that price range. I would give it a 4 rating based on our discounted priceline rate, but I think it is only fair to review it based on the published rate. The Hotel is so conveniently located within Grand Central Terminal that if you arrive by train, you never have to even step one foot outside before reaching your hotel room. You can also get to almost anywhere else in the city from there. We took the train from Stamford (just 45 minutes to Grand Central) and within 5 minutes of arriving at Grand Central Terminal we were checking into our hotel. The line wasn't too long, about a 4 minute wait. There are many electronic check in kiosks, but we opted to check in directly since we prefer a more personable check in, and to make sure that we are happy with the room they selected. The front desk was very pleasant and found us a very nice room on a high floor with a King bed. Views in this hotel are very limited since tall buildings surround it on all sides, but we were able to get a decent view of the Met LIfe Building. In the end it hardly mattered, since we were not in our rooms that often and when we were, we had little interest in staring out the window anyway. The Hotel is very large with a beautiful Lobby. Unfortunately the large marble waterall/fountain was out of order, but I can imagine how beautiful it must be when it is working. As some other reviewers mentioned, you can hear some hallway noises, conversations, and televisions from the neighboring rooms from time to time. It was not unbearable, but perhaps it is worse when the hotel is at full occupancy. Hard to know. Some better soundproofing would be nice, but this is fairly common in large hotels. One noticeable plus was the over sized walk in closet. Not sure if this is standard or if we just lucked out, but we had a walk in closet that was almost twice the size of the bathroom. They had an ironing board in there, which is also a huge plus. You need to pull it out to iron, since there are no outlets in the closet, but it wasn't an issue. The bathroom is a bit on the small side, but perfectly fine. It was very clean with marble and granite and very nice Portico bath products and a hairdryer. The shower pressure was decent, with a large Speakman shower head. The towels were a bit rough, likely from countless washes, but fine. Some reviewers mentioned that there was no toothpaste offered, but from my experience at many hotels, toothpaste is almost never offered unless requested. I'm sure if we needed it they would send some up, or you could easily go down to the hundreds of shops in Grand Central Terminal and pick up any supplies you need. There is a convenient ice machine and vending machine on the floor just down the hall from the elevators. There is no mini-bar in the room, but this ended up saving us a lot of money in the end. There are plenty of delis and stores all around the area, so you can get outside food and drinks easily. We did not order room service or eat in any of the hotel restaurants. The fitness center is better than most NYC hotels, with plenty of Life Fitness brand machines and towels, water, and full cable television programming on the ellipticals, treadmills, etc. At first I was sorry I didn't bring my own headphones, but soon I realized that they supply you with free headphones near the towels. The only downside was on our second day when there was some error with the red emergency phones within the Gym. At one point during my workout, about 2 Hotel security guards and 3 NYC police officers stormed in to the fitness center to respond to an emergency call that (apparently) no one had placed from one of the many red emergency phones within the gym. The Police came back a couple times during my workout, creating a distraction and speaking in a very loud and accusatory tone warning us all not to touch the red phones or they would shut down the fitness center. It was very uncomfortable. I was close to finishing my workout so I decided to cut it short. I have no idea how it ended. Either way, I felt the Hotel security could have handled this situation much better by putting a security guard there after the first incident or having better surveillance cameras. I'm sure there was a technical problem with the phones, which should have been their first consideration before assuming it was a prank or somehow intentional. On the bright side, if there ever is an emergency there, at least you can be assured that the authorities will arrive within seconds. The cleaning staff was very efficient and left our room spotless every day. We had a small problem with our in-room security safe. The safe was already closed and locked beforehand, so we could not use it. We called the front desk and they sent a security agent over (within minutes) but they could not fix it since they needed special equipment to drill it open. They apologized for the inconvenience. It was fine, since the Hotel is very secure anyway. Overall, it is a very nice hotel and we slept very comforatably each night, which is the most important aspect of any hotel. The beds were very stylish and comfortable. The rooms were spacious for NYC standards. Because it is such a large hotel, I realize it is often hard to get personable service, yet we had many positive experiences with the tour desk, cleaning staff, and other hotel representatives. It did take a bit long to get the front desk to answer the phone, but it varied depending on the time of day and how busy they were at the time. At one point we were on hold for over 3 minutes and I just gave up but on another day they answered it right away. The most important thing to remember is that if you smile and are pleasant and nice to people, they will usually smile and be nice back. You can help make your own experience better by having a positive attitude. If you are uptight and demanding to anyone then you are unlikely to be treated well and will be unhappy with service anywhere. Contrary to several reviews on this site, no one within the hotel staff was ever rude to us during our stay. Everyone was very pleasant. If you can book this hotel at a discounted rate, it is an excellent choice. On the other hand, if you have money to burn and want complete pampering and perfect service, then I would suggest a higher end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Drab, service zero, location fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ruchirabajaj
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt, is at the perfect location, right next to Grand Central, Time Square, Cabs, and all the other fun placed to be in New York, if you are a tourist. The rooms are horrible, the sheets had holes in them. There are no extras provided in the room, no iron, no coffee machine. The bell service also charges money per suit case. The rooms are small, if you get a 2 queen bed room, there is hardly any room to put your luggage if you have 2 large suit cases that I had. The lobby is very Grand. Railway Station bathrooms are much larger than the ones at Grand Hyatt. Not a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Big Hotel, overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: Jacquio
Reviews.Content: Very Big and Busy Hotel. Rooms are clean and well kept but with tones of black and white and somewhat sparsely decorated somewhat cold. You get the overwhelming feeling the hotel is trying to get as much money as they can out of you. No water or tea making facilities, or internet access in rooms. Even things like toothpaste are available "for purchase". When I had breakfast they hovered over me to make sure I only availed of the Continental one which came with the room rate!!! Overall a typical US hotel in terms of cleanliness and facilities but it's too large, unfriendly and has a pervading sense of stinginess!

Reviews.Title: “Greart Lobby -- Weak Rooms”
Reviews.Author: zonemanDanville
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt on the way to St. Maarten from California. The location is terrific --- close to Time Square, shopping, restaurants, etc. The lobby is beautiful, and we enjoyed the lobby bar (great cheese platter and martinis). The rooms need work. The bathrooms are drab, but Hyatt bathrooms usually don't make the top 10 list. Our carpet had stains which looked like an ax murderer has been a previous guest. Bring your slippers --- they are a must. It was so cold that our windows had ice on the inside, despite setting the heater at 68 degrees. Since we only were staying one night, the room was tolerable. The location is so great that it is too bad Hyatt doesn't undertake a massive refurbishment of the rooms. Next time I will stay at the Four Seasons, especially if I forget my slippers!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt is Not a Good Buy-It”
Reviews.Author: bernielogano
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location location location - right next to Grand Central Station. Excellent area from which to see the rest of Manahattan. Check-In staff were friendly. Hotels were speedy but crowded. Lobby was spectacular, which first made us suspicious since we've noticed that hotels with huge spacious lobbies are often trying to make up for other deficencies. Cons: Room were extremely small. Bed was clean but pillows were uncomfortable. Shower and toilet were fine but nothing spectacular. No wireless worth mentioning. A random room service tray must have been outside our door for at least a day. Herds of drunken people seemed to stampede past our door at all hours of the night.. Walls were like paper mache - trust me, its not very fun hearing couples 'express their appreciation' for each other' all night when you have jet lag. All in all, a hotel like this is worth under $40 a night in most other places.

Reviews.Title: “NYC Trip”
Reviews.Author: stephy26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I have stopped in, it is in a great location just down the road from Times Square, near Maddisson Square Gardens, next door to Grand Central Station, 10 minute walk to Empire State Building. The Hotel itself was very modern, clean, large reception area. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable. I will only stay in this hotel everytime I come to NYC

Reviews.Title: “$400 and no shampoo”
Reviews.Author: BizTravlr08
Reviews.Content: Three nights (Orlando, Atlanta, and New York) at three Hyatts in a row and the one at Grand Central was pretty much 'the most for the least.' Sure, I could have called down for shampoo had I noticed it missing, but for $400, why should I need to look for it first? On the good side, the lobby was impressive, the elevators fast, and the staff pleasant. I also found the breakfast buffet too expensive (by any international standard) and did not appreciate having to pay $2/bag for them to baby sit it for later transit, $10 for internet, and too many 'officiou$' bellmen. As a gold member, the nickel and diming got to me after the shampoo went missing. FWIW, I enjoyed the Buckhead and Denver Hyatts. Tampa had issues. Hyatt Orlando (in-airport) is great once you shut off the noisy room A/C.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in NYC ,is it worth the price?”
Reviews.Author: 68braveheart
Reviews.Content: To be fair, the Priceline bid rate of $270 during Christmas week is a great price in midtown Manhattan. The Grand Hyatt has a super location at 42nd and Park aves, and is adjacent to Grand Central Station. For check in which we chose to use the kiosk which was perfect,swift and convenient. From the time we handed the car keys to the valet, to entering our room on floor 16, it only took about 8 minutes. The lobby is impressive,clean and busy with people moving in and out , so this is a great place for people watching. The staff was helpful and smiled even with a full house! Room- This is the major downfall of this hotel. It has nothing to do with the size of the living space or the bath. It is all to do with the cleanliness, which I have to give a 2 on a scale of 1-10. Moldy shower tiles, bath floors which look as if they have not seen a clean mop in years, dust and "stuff" all over fixtures,window sills and with no exaggeration, years of dust under end tables and by heat fixtures. This would lower my rating to a category 3 at the very best. We ate out, and I suggest using Open Table, a internet reservation site which can aid you in finding a great restaurant, not only by category,but also by neighborhood. I found this site about 3 years ago and it is priceless in most cities. You can find restaurants on very short notice and eliminate the waiting game. Reviews are linked to this site,as well,so you should be able to find the right food at whatever price range that you choose. We did eat breakfast at the hotel, which has only one restaurant open in the am and encountered a long line. After about a 30 minute wait, we ate the buffet (at $30 per) which did have a decent amount of choices at typical NYC rates. HINT: Go downstairs into Grand Central Station which has a huge dining,floor with many,many dining choices. Real restaurants, as well as fast food in a historic setting. There are loads of stores underground,as well,so do not miss this detour! Overall, if you are looking for a great location and can live with questionable cleaning of guest rooms, make sure you get a great deal. If not, try to stay at the Intercontinental or Waldorf which are within a couple blocks! This hotel has so much going for it, but the cleaning issue is scary!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, not excellent”
Reviews.Author: chotuman
Reviews.Content: Most reviews about this hotel are quite damning, and it makes me think that the expectations of these customers are far too high. Given that, the value for money at this hotel was appalling. Stayed at the Grand Hyatt for one week. Compared with other properties we stayed in at New York, this one was in an excellent location. Next to Grand Centreal means that transportation was incredibly easy. We were also within walking distance to 5th Avenue Shops, and Central Park wasn't too far away. We had three stay in a room, and we were comfortable. Whilst it wasn't big, it was adequate for our needs. Try get a room away from the lifts. The beds were fantastic, and the decor was clean and contemporary. The bathroom was ok- many have complained that their wan't enough surface space. We didn't notice this. Also, we received bathrrom soaps/ shampoos and creams. The room could have used a few more lights, but we could still read with it. Our stay was good at this hotel. It helped make our New York experience unforgettable, and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Too grimy for me!”
Reviews.Author: sierrashoo
