Reviews.Content: Hotel location is terrific! We were in town to see Young Frankenstein with our teenage boys. Walking distance to Grand Central station, Times Square, Rockefeller Center. Lobby is spectacular. But I'm afraid that's all I can say was pleasant about our stay. We had trouble with check-in (they gave us a king when we clearly stated 2-doubles); however the front desk fixed that pretty quick. We were charged "going rate" despite the fact our reservation through Expedia was at least $100 less when we booked. Still working on getting that hashed out. The biggest problem is, the hotel is just plain dirty. I travel alot and am used to some level of the hotel "scroungies" but this one really was bad. Granted the hotel is in the heart of the city, but there's really no excuse for unswept/unwashed bathroom floors, peeling/stained wallpaper, or other people's left-behind hair clips (in the middle of the floor -- not even squirreled away under a bed). Rarely do I require my kids to wear their shoes 24-7 when walking on a hotel floor, but this was one hotel that we did. It was a rainy night on our visit, so we opted to head to the hotel lounge for a nightcap. The couches in there were dirtier and more stained than those in my son's baseball clubhouse! Seriously! The tables were not wiped between visits so we got to "enjoy" the person before us leftover french fries and salt mess -- both on the table and on the floor under our feet (lots there!). Next time we're in the City, I'll definitely look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite NYC hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Newlyweds_May26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to NYC at least once a year and we 've started our tradition of going up at Christmas time. The location can't be beat and is within walking distance to Times Square, Herald Square and with Grand Central Station right there it is easy access to anywhere in Manhattan. The rooms are a little small but see if you can get a corner room which is a little more spacious and quieter. The bars and restaurants are nice but it you're looking for something a little less expensive and quick, there is a Starbuck's and the dining concourse at Grand Central Station that is perfect. The only downside to this most recent trip was the heat. We could not get the room to cool off, no matter how low set it and spent most of the time with the window open.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: Honu_Ohana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 2 nights right before Christmas 2007. This was our third or fourth stay at the hotel, which we have adopted as out NYC "base camp." It's convenient to Penn Station and to the areas of Manhattan we like to walk to and we accrue Hyatt points for use later. I booked the room a couple of weeks in advance via hyatt.com and got a deluxe king for $259 plus tax (about $300/night total). Our room was on the 16th floor and appeared to be fairly recently redecorated; it was the nicest room we've had there and its decor reflected the hyatt website photos. The bath was small but OK, bed was very comfy. TV was in good working order. Windows opened but had view of air shaft (not a concern for us). Room was very quiet EXCEPT that sound in the halls comes right through the door, so we'd hear guests' conversations late at night as they walked by. This seems to be a problem in many hotels and I'm not sure there is much they can do about it. Overall, hotel floor was populated by quiet guests so it was not a real problem. (If you are worried ask for a room away from the elevators.) No minibar or in-room coffeepot. (Coffee was $4 down in the lobby--usually Hyatt gives Gold Passport guests free coffee but not here, apparently.) The workout room on the top floor was adequate, with a number of machines. Everything was clean and well maintained. Only service glitch was room service showing up at 12:19 AM -- not our order and woke us up. Overall, the Hyatt does not lavish service on you but you are taken care of with reasonable good humor and courtesy and that's impressive given the holiday rush and the huge size of the hotel. (Maid comes once, no turndown, but supplies are replenished and housekeeping is good.)

Reviews.Title: “not what we hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: billglea
Reviews.Content: We went for a suite and were very dissapointed for the price... very impersonal from the computer check in to the smiley insincere "did you have a nice stay " at the end...There wasnt even a proper bath and no mini bar!! I asked for another room immediatley we arrived and was fobbed off with the promise of maybe something will be availalable tomorrow..nobody ever came back. The cocktail bar wasnt open and the bar out the back was ludicrously pricey for the ambiance it provided. My advice is dont pay these prices for whats on offer... the only positive was the location...right next to the first JFKbus drop off In summary an overrated overpriced,tired and impersonal experience...we wont stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Never again at those prices!!”
Reviews.Author: mercypa
Reviews.Content: I am from NYC originally and was staying at the hotel for a conference. I was so disappointed!! For almost $500 a night I expected more. The room was too small for 2 people. There was a desk but no table to eat. There was only one comfy chair and the desk chair. There was no coffeemaker or fridge in the room which is a problem if you want a fresh pot or to save leftovers. Of course, even if you save leftovers, there was no microwave. The choices of food from room service are so limited. The ac did not work no matter how low I turned it and the filter was absolutely filthy. All that said, the area was convenient to local attractions and to public transportation. The staff were friendly and helpful. They also provide scheduling for a masseuse to come to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Valet service stole my iPod”
Reviews.Author: calvin20874
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency, Grand Central. The valet service parked my car. (Guests have to use valet service as there is obviously no parking at the hotel). I made the mistake of leaving my iPod in the car. I realized the iPod had been stolen from a compartment in the car a couple of hours after we had checked out. Since then, I have made many phone calls and sent many email messages to the hotel but have gotten the run-around. The valet company says that they are not responsible for damage or theft to the car while in their possession. When I called hotel security, they would only forward me to the valet service which is an independent operator. A hotel manager told me the valet manager would call me but that did not happen. I find it unfortunate that an expensive hotel like the Hyatt Grand Regency would allow a con operation to run their valet service. The cost of parking is about $50 a day plus whatever they want to take from your car. They seem to have a license to steal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colleen S
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel for a week in July. Not only is it in a great location, the staff was very helpful and quick to answer requests. My husband and I booked a standard King with a rollaway bed for our daughter. When we arrived every one was ready to help us check in. We arrived a little early and I was worried the room would not be ready for us... which it was not, however they upgraded us to a King Deluxe at no extra charge. The room was nice and big even with the extra bed in there, we still had plenty of room to move easily. The bathrooms were not the biggest, but not the smallest either. You had the Grand Central Station connected to the hotel so you didn't have to walk far for the subway and Times Square was just a few blocks away. Also we were there for the 4th of July and we were in walking distance- again a few blocks away from the river they shoot the fireworks off. It was a great location, and great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: conzd09
Reviews.Content: When my family and I arrived at the Hyatt we were nothing but excited. The hotel from the moment you walk in is beautiful. They have beautiful set up from water falls to chandeliers. There's plenty of elevators. We stayed on the 24th floor. Considering ive been to New York several times and being from miami the hotel rooms were super small. When I walked into this room to my surprise it was about 565 sq ft. We paid about 1700 for 5 nights. It was worth every penny. There was nothing better than knowing I was sleeping on a nice comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was rather small but hey what do you expect. It was clean, the sheets were clean and at least a 500 thread count. Feather pillows. The best part was the subway on the first floor. You didn't even have to go outside to get a cab to the subway. There was plenty to eat downstairs. nice inexpensive breakfast. The hotel had room service but I refuse to pay 32 dollars for breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel. great location, great service, great room

Reviews.Title: “Dark room but over-ridden by great location”
Reviews.Author: BaliDreamer
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the Grand Hyatt in NY for 3 nights having good quite a good deal on lastminute.com. We had a room with 2 queen size beds on the 18th floor and there was plenty of room for the 3 of us although we didn't have a view out the window at all (we faced in to a load of buildings that looked like offices) so I'd request to be facing the street if I was to book again. The biggest annoyance about the room was the lighting. Even at 2pm it looked like night time in the room as the only light was from one bedside lamp, one desk lamp all the way across the other side of the room and a light by the door to the room. We had to keep the bathroom light on and the door open to see anything - there was no main light at all, which, for 3 women getting ready for a night out in the city, was really annoying. However it has to be said, the fantastic location of this hotel outweighed its problems. We walked to 5th Ave and Rockerfeller in no time. The hotel is right between Grand Central Station and the Chrysler building and if you want a cab there's a rank when you turn right out of the hotel so no problems. We didn't book breakfast and I'm so glad we didn't as right across the street the Pershing Cafe was excellent - great food and fresh orange juice and open from 8am - beware this place gets really busy on the weekends in the morning - there were big queues as we were leaving and we got there as it opened. I wouldn't pay top dollar for a room at this hotel due to the room itself but I'd definitely look for a hotel near this one when go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: chicagolandgirl
Reviews.Content: Hi Stayed at this hotel on 12-1-07. We took the train to NYC and arrived at 1000am, we planned to just drop our bags off at the front desk and than come back and check in at the 3pm check in time. We were very happy when they said our rooms were ready. Room and bathroom were small. Bed was very comfortable, and room was clean. We were on the 19th floor. I had been searching for hotels for about a month and most of the prices were over 400.00 a night. I did Priceline on the Wed before our trip and got the room for 225.00 per night. Hotel is connected to Grand Central Station. Here you can catch a subway. There are lots of shops here too. We went to the bottom floor of Grand Central Sunday am and there were many stands open selling breakfast foods.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt - Trump”
Reviews.Author: Mrscore
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days for the ThanksGiving weekend. This would be my second stay at this hotel, the 1st one being in Aug of 2003 for 5 days for the US Open tennis. My second stayed, compared to my first one, was a real quiet and pleasant one. Booked via the hotel website and in doing so, have the priviledges of being in the higher floor and quiet room. The rooms are much nicer than before, before the hotel renovation ( yes, folks, i paid much more that most of you....so, hard to please people, quit complaining !!...:( Ordered room service ( breakfast) came in a timely manner and was prepared attractively. The Manhattan Sky bar was great for people watching, before and after business work and sightseeing. The female blonde bartender ( cant remember her name ) is still up to these days, nice and warm. Compared to my 1st stayed, the staff, provided "extra" attitude with the service...." Youre paying this much $$$$ for this room?" or have the Do Not Disturb sign infront of my door but managed to wake me up 4 times to cleaned up.....But my second time here, there was none of that !! Matter of fact, they went out their way to accomodate me, doorman came and got me a cab and said, 'good morning!'. I was sitting in one of those chairs inside the lobby waiting for a phone call when a staff came and asked me if i needed a cocktail drink, I said, 'no, thank you!' but came back 5mins later with a drink and said, 'its in the house, sir!'...... WOW!! where do you get that in NY !!! I gave this hotel second chance, they delivered. and I will stay here again....until that brand new (hyatt) ANDAZ on 5th avenue opens.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: dianacolombia954
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel November 23-26,2007. I called a week in advance and asked for an early check in and they said they would try to make it available, I also asked for a room away from the elevator. I got to the hotel around noon and my room was not ready. They told me to come back at 3pm which was check in time. I went to out and had lunch in the city, came back around 3pm and my room was ready. I got a room on the 26th floor with a good view of the city. I was also given a room away from the elevators. Housekeeping would call before they came to my room and asked me what time would be best for them to come by which i thought was nice. Overall the hotel is really nice. The service was good. If I needed a cab all I did was go outside and one of the people who worked there would get it for me. I am planning on visiting this hotel in the future. Everything you need is around the hotel. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: dbh2
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Grand Hyatt from Nov. 16-19, 2007. This was our third time at this hotel. The location is perfect. You are in the middle of it all and connected to Grand Central Terminal. You don't have to go outside to get to a subway station, so if the weather is not perfect, you don't have to deal with it until your destination. The room was great, although the bathroom is rather small. But for a few days, you can deal with it. Love the Regency CLub for breakfast and dessert in the evening. We will definitely be staying here during future visits.

Reviews.Title: “OK Experience, but 'Grand'”
Reviews.Author: voorheesians
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the Grand Hyatt New York City with our two children. It was a "complimentary" stay earned from Hyatt's GoldPassport system, so I suppose beggars can't be choosers. Overall, we had a pleasant time, but it wasn't quite what I expected from "Grand Hyatt." The Good: Very friendly and attentive front desk staff, bell staff and front door staff. As opposed to some others here who've found the assistance less than great, we were very impressed both days with the "people" component. I also thought that the "StayFit" fitness facility was quite nice - clean, well-stocked, with very modern equipment. Very impressive The OK: The room was clean and well-kept. The desk space was workable and the TV was functional. The closet was good, and there was drawer storage. But overall, the room was very, very SMALL. The ice bucket and hotel information menu had to be placed on the window sill because there was no other place for them!! I've been in comparable "standard" rooms in midtown Manhattan at the Marriott Marquis, Marriott East Side and Millennium Broadway - and they've all been larger, with larger bathrooms. The Grand Hyatt room had two "double" beds (as requested). I didn't have my tape measure, but the beds seemed even smaller than a standard double. My 10 year old and 12 year old were cramped in one... we won't even mention me and my wife. The bathroom was clean and well-stocked, but also minuscule - no room on the sinktop for much more than a toothbrush and toothpaste. The Bad: Room Service was a disaster. I'd made arrangements for a surprise - "Milk and Cookies Package" - to be delivered at 8PM for my kids. I did this via the E-concierge. Upon arrival, there was no record of the request (despite my e-mail "confirmation.") The front desk staff tried to help re-arrange things, but room service called to confirm a "New York Survival Package" 30 minutes after we got to the room (4PM). I straightened that out, only to have the "Milk and Cookies" sent right away (at 4:15PM). The people in Room Service were unhelpful, surly, and I sat on hold for long periods of time. When it came time for breakfast, let's just say that we dispensed with both Room Service and the $30/per person breakfast buffet and went to the food court in Grand Central Station, where we had a delightful breakfast from Zaro's Bakery for $25 for all 4 of us. 'nuff said. I e-mailed the NY Grand Hyatt's "Quality Control" office about the room service stuff, and we'll have to see if they respond. I'm supposed to stay there in December with my wife as a pre-Christmas treat, but we'll have to see... I might try to switch to another hotel. (...especially considering I'd already ordered the "Champagne and Strawberries" package for that visit... but who knows, a "New York Survival Guide" might be nice??)

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: ClaireR
Reviews.Content: Having just recently returned from a stay at the Grand Hyatt in NY I've very little to complain about. The hotel has a great location and it's very easy to move around the city from here. It's a big conference hotel and has a very buzzy atmosphere. The staff at reception and the concierge desk were very helpful and friendly at all times. We had booked a twin but at check in discovered there were none available. A roll away was put into the room and my colleague slept soundly on it for the 3nts we stayed there. The bathroom was a little small but it really wasn't an issue, the overall size of the room was spacious for NY. The only negative point was that the day we checked out the left luggage was full to overflowing, part of the reception was sectioned off to hold more bags. It was taking about 40mins to drop off bags and queue was consistently long, given that it was taking almost as long to collect the bags and we only had about 3hrs before heading to the airport we ended up babysitting our luggage during this time. The weather was a bit poor so it wasn't too bad, however, we were fortunate that we had no plans for our last day as this would have severly hampered them. I appreciate it was close to Thanksgiving and the hotel was full but given the size of the property & number of rooms you would imagine they should have an adequate left luggage facility. Overall a good hotel in a prime location and a very enjoyable stay. I would definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler691
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is crowded by conventioneers and isn't oriented to the hotel guest. Lobby is crowded and often diverted by conventions in the lobby area. Rooms are nice, but lack any luxury suggested by the Hyatt brand. Noisey hotel, with noise originating from the hallways (slamming doors and noisy convetioneers) and the street (noisy taxis, sirens and buses). Overall, I would not choose this hotel again due to the lack of guest orientation (front desk stated she was surprised my employer would allow me to stay there), noise and crowded environment.

Reviews.Title: “For sure not what it should be”
Reviews.Author: GlobetroterCostaRica
Reviews.Content: We did stay for one week end of October to the first week in November in this hotel and must admit we have bee very disappointed. We booked this hotel because it was supposed to be a Grand Hyatt Hotel and we both know Grand Hyatt Hotels from Asia; this so called Grand Hyatt Hotel would not meet the Service Standards required to be even considered a 3 Star Deluxe Hotel in Asia. The rooms are equally sized as the Match Box, Room Amenities such as Mini Bar, DVD, Make up Mirror and so on do not exist and the Bath room amenities are of average Quality. Over all the Room Rate from over 600 USD does simply not met the value of the Product. Employees attitude here foremost at the Front Desk was unhelpful, unfriendly and for sure not as professional as has to be accepted from a Leading Player in the Hotel Trade. We did upgrade to their Club Floor however looking back to at it now, it was not worth the additional payment. The Restaurant and Bar Service was equally uneasy in respect to serve you as a Paying Hotel Guest. When I asked to check the Btl. of White Wine I did order as we both were of the opinion the wine was spoiled; rather the taking care of the matter we became a free of charge wine lesson and were told the wine was fine. To be honest the most awarding of all services in the Hotel was the Food Quality in the main restaurant, the portions were on the large size however well done and very tasty. We are both very disappointed with the kind of services delivered, the overall hotel product in all respects and are simply unable to rate this property on a high scale keeping the price value in mind. This has been the most disappointment stay in Hyatt world wide for the past 20 years.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Divertirsi
Reviews.Content: We have just moved to New York and needed a week’s accommodation before our apartment was ready. We didn’t have a choice of hotels, as it was organised by my husband’s company. When our car arrived at the Hyatt, there was no porter there to meet us, in fact, I had to go searching the large hotel to find someone. This wasn’t ideal, as we had so much luggage and had to put it on the hotel trolley ourselves. Eventually, a porter came and showed us the way to reception and waited expecting a tip - having literally just arrived from a 24 hour trip from Australia, we had some US cash but not broken down. Ordinarily I would have gone out of my way later to find the porter and give him a tip, but he was so unfriendly, unwelcoming and not that helpful that I didn’t bother. On the other hand, we found the reception staff generally helpful and concierges great. We were upgraded to a suite, so had a big room with a separate sitting area with was great for our baby. This was unexpected and made a one week stay with a jetlagged baby much more bearable. In terms of our requests, the hotel did do everything that they could to assist. Location is good, being so close to all of the shops, Grand Central Station, not too far to walk to Times Square, Rockerfeller Centre, Central Park, Bryant Park and Empire State Building. It is a very touristy and business hotel, so great if you have a conference or work close by or want to see all of the NYC sites – not a luxurious nor a romantic hotel. A couple of things that we would have liked was a mini bar and a coffee and tea maker in the room. If you are a Hyatt passport member, they give you coffee and tea cards, which was good. Another thing that was unpleasant, was that we had a few items of my son’s clothing taken from our room and a credit card. Although the initial service was questionable and a couple of things taken from the room, the overall service experience was very good and we ended up leaving feeling pretty positive about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sterile and uninviting hotel”
Reviews.Author: elynchking
Reviews.Content: I live in a suburb of New York City but decided to use some Hyatt points to stay with my family in the city for a Friday night. I splurged 18,000 points for a Regency Club room as I travel frequently on business and enjoy the amenities of club floors when I can. This is the first club lounge I have been in that doesn't have free drinks at cocktail hour - cheap! The selection of "hors d'oeuvres" was okay but certainly nothing special. Basic cheese and crackers and some sushi rolls. Good Starbucks coffee and a decent continental breakfast but the space is too small for the number of guests. The real downer was the room which my husband and I likened to a room in a minimum security prison! We usually enjoy staying in hotel rooms as a family but frankly we did not want to spend a minute more than necessary in this depressing box of a space. I think they hired some homeless people from around Grand Central to lay the carpet - it is unraveling all along the baseboards and doorsills. The door frames are metal but some untalented interior designer decided it would be a good idea to paint them to look like wood. It just looks like a bad imitation of wood. There is no artwork on the 3 main walls and the lighting is terrible. The bathroom is small but serviceable. The bathtub has some newer marble tiles but a little Tilex and a good scrubbing are in order. The temperature control wasn't working properly and none of us slept well because the room was so hot. It is possible to open the windows but this is New York so our choice was street noise but "fresh" air or quiet and hot and stuffy. A good hotel room should invite you in and provide a home away from home. This room does not. I could have used the same number of points for a night at the Park Hyatt in Paris and I'm bummed I wasted them on this hotel. For a chain hotel in New York try the Westin instead.

Reviews.Title: “4* = what a joke!”
Reviews.Author: Notapplicable
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very sub-standard for a 4* - concrete monstrosity with no atmosphere. Front desk service was poor - I have had a ongoing issue with this hotel regarding the bill for the last 3 weeks - they cannot resolve it on their side. The staff are not only incompetent but also happy to say anything to get rid of you. I have booked the Sheraton for my next business trip - what a disappointing experience at the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Did not experience the problems of other reviewers”
Reviews.Author: mwood19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a business meeting and found it to be a nice stay. I would not rate it as top tier but close behind. The room and bathroom seemed large by standards of other prime hotels I've stayed at in NYC although the toilet was oddly placed in the bathroom. All staff I encountered were quite courteous. I would welcome the opportunity to stay again based upon this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: jl251972
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at Grand Hyatt in midtown Manhattan. The location is amazing - right above Grand Central. The room is nice enough. But I especially like the bed. It is so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “So sterile and generic”
Reviews.Author: JaneEMorgan
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel for a business trip. I selected this hotel because of its proximity to a very early meeting that I had the next day. The hotel lobby is dated and had an impersonal feel that is characteristic of other Grand Hyatts. I paid $419 for a king room with a shaft view. That's what I get for using the self-serve check in kiosk! I should have asked to switch but was already late for dinner. Every light in this hotel was a compact fluorescent, which made it appear dim and unattractive. The corridors were very plain and dingy looking as a result. The room itself was roomy for a New York hotel, with two windows, and a regular TV that seemed rather outdated. The decor was very plain, masculine and univiting. There was one giant unadorned wall at the end of the room that really needed some artwork. The worst problem was the compact fluorescent lighting everywhere, including the bathroom. The bed was comfortable enough, and the water pressure in the shower was good. The room service breakfast was good. I had cream of wheat which came with a nice size portion of fresh berries. This place was servicable for one night, but it not at all warm and inviting. There are far better hotels at this price range and I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and nice room”
Reviews.Author: Mark2211
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. Whilst I agree with some of the other reviews saying that the service was not as friendly and hospitable as other hotels outside New York, I still enjoyed the experience of staying here. Right on 42nd Street, the location is fantastic (15mins walk to Time Square). The lobby is very grand and the room that I stayed in was spacious, clean and relaxing - the bed was fantastic. The only negative was that there was no mini-bar, but then at least this saved me some money! Whilst not cheap or 5*, this is an excellent choice if you are just looking for a comfortable, clean and central stay for your trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: waynecom7
Reviews.Content: Yes the location is convenient but I found the hotel awful. It has a beautiful lobby. My room as small, had no natural light, old yellowing paintwork and a tiny bathroom. Facilities in the room are limited and the guest information provided isn't helpful. It is very noisy - the walls, as others reviewers has stated, are paper thin. The staff would shout at each other in the corridors from early in the morning without any consideration for guests so a lie-in after 8am even at weekends is not an option. Service was abrupt and rude. The only exception was the waiters and waitresses in the breakfast room - where service is adequate. The supervisers though, were terrible. They'd call guests over as if they were hailing a cab. I had a phone call at 12.40am about a room service order that had been delivered hours before - without a word of apology for waking me up when I was working the next day. Room service - which is a relatively limited menu given the size of the hotel - arrived every evening cold and limp. Service in the Bar was patchy. The hotel is expensive - I paid about £300 per night. Mineral water was $12 or £6. London is generally more expensive and for that kind of money I would have had a beautiful London hotel, great service and decent food. I didn't get any of that here. The Grand Hyatt didn't nearly meet the standards of the other NY hotels I have stayed in. I'd avoid it in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Normal Hyatt in a good location in NY.”
Reviews.Author: corevel
Reviews.Content: Normal Hyatt. It was nice, not to noisey, and clean. I got a good rate, but I understand this hotel can get pricey. As the name states, Grand Central, as in central and easy to get to anyplace in the city. Oh yeah, internet is not included which is a disapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Central Location”
Reviews.Author: CPUK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and so was a bit concerned at some of the recent reviews. I can only speak from my experience. My main reason for returning is the location. As a leisure traveller it is within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park and the Empire State Building. Alternatively it is within the Grand Central Station complex so a subway train is on your doorstep - 'buses also pass the door. The entrance area and lobby are very impressive. I arrived at 10 pm and was attended to immediately. The room on the 28th Floor was comfortable, clean and had all amenities but lacked a minibar or any special touches. It was supposed to be a kingsize bed but seemed only a standard double and my booking was changed to a Deluxe King "on request" but this did not materialise. I did not complain as I was paying the lowest available room rate. It was also very warm and the air con didn't seem to cool it (although the window did open). It is expensive but then most hotels in New York are but a tip I would pass on is if you catch the airport non stop 'bus from JFK this terminates just opposite so you can save some dolllars on cabs/other transportation. Breakfast is a varied buffet - around $37 with a 15% tip, but there are alternatives in the area (I tried one 2 blocks down Lexington where a cooked breakfast with coffee, juice - & a bigger tip! - was $12) I asked for a late check out and was given 1.30pm which helped as my return flight was 6.15pm which saved the $2 charge for luggage storage(?) At check out the very friendly staff gave me a voucher for a coffee knowing I would be waiting for around 1 hour. So, overall, the location is fautless for the tourist; the hotel is comfortable and clean but extras are expensive and can add up; be warned!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst Hyatts anywhere”
Reviews.Author: bryan4134
Reviews.Content: I spend my life in hotels, probably 150 nights per year and many of these are spent in Hyatt properties around the world - I am a platinum member of Hyatt and I volunteer this only to evidence that I am usually a loyal supporter of the Hyatt brand. Without any doubt this is the worst Grand Hyatt I have experienced anywhere; indeed it falls far short of many of the Regency's and lower branded hotels. It is hard to know where to begin. Arriving at the hotel there is nobody to assist with luggage - yes there are bellman standing around but not one appeared to be looking for or helping guests. Having negotiated the escalator to the upper mezzanine lobby one is greeted by a row of surly uphelpful reception staff - 'come back at 3pm and a room may be ready for you'. Having finally been allocated a Regency Club room at 4pm I am able to begin the Grand Hyatt experience. A tiny room, hardly bigger then the king bed it contains - the bathroom is pathetic and not worthy of a two star hotel rating - minimal accessories provided, thought it appeared to be clean. The room as no minibar, bottled water or any other facility always found in hotels claiming to be five star standard. Laundry prices are ludicrous - it is cheaper to buy new clothes than use the service. I was invited to partake of the Regency Club's "cocktail hour" from 6pm to 8pm - this is a traditional service found in all Hyatt's as well as the best hotel groups. One difference at this hotel - you have to pay for the cocktails!! In my 40 years of travelling I have never heard of this. This has been a very sad experience - I would love to hear from Hyatt how they dare to call this property a Grand Hyatt - clearly money has changed hands somewhere. If you want value and service for your $500 plus per night do not consider this property. It is over-rated to an extent that it is hard to conceive. A truly horrible experience and one I shall not be foolish enough to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great for NYC”
Reviews.Author: colou
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the Hyatt with some friends this past weekend. The hotel is definitely business oriented and huge. If you want warm and fuzzy do not book here. But they are fast, curteous and the staff does their job. The rooms were clean and the stay was enjoyable. We had a club level room booked and the girl at the reception desk upgraded us (without being asked)from a regular room to a suite. The club level is always a nice amenity especially after running around Manhattan, it's great to get some picky food and drinks before showering and running on to your next event. You know the city... go ... go ... go. The hotel is conveniently located if you know how to use mass transportation and even if you don't there are many cabs always out front. If I could have changed anything, I would have made the sheets a little softer, but for one night - I could deal!

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: vidigital
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt because they had a special rate for a wedding we were attending. The building was very impressive as was the lobby. There was a slight wait at the concierge to check-in, but the service was friendly and helpful. We had early check-in, and sure enough our room was ready. Our room was 2117, and as we approached through the hallway, it was littered with room service items. We figured since people had just checked out and housekeeping was just getting around to cleaning it up, but for the duration of our stay there was constantly trays outside. Luckily our room was well appointed with the updated linens and decor. The room was bigger than I imagined with a king size bed, tv with cable. The bathroom was definitely New York sized though, and I didn't feel like it was the cleanest hotel bathroom I've ever been in. But it did have nice Lemon + Lavender scented toiletries. As well as a so-so hairdryer. Our biggest complaint was the noise. The walls were paper thin and we could hear the guy next door sneezing and coughing as well as people talking in the hallway. Another complaint was the price of room service. Yes, this is New York, but $8 for a cup of coffee + $5 delivery charge + 15% gratuity + 2% tax? We're talking almost $15 for one coffee. I don't know who was able to afford all the plates of food we kept seeing in the hallway. Our checkout went smoothly, and we opted to do it through the concierge to avoid any strange charges to the room or whatnot that come with travelling. Then we left our bags with the Bell desk, which cost us $2 a bag. All in all, it was an average stay. I've never stayed in a hotel in NYC as I've always stayed with family, so it was my first experience. I'm hesitant to say if we'll stay here again, but for the price ($269/nt) I guess it was good, and it is definitely centrally located right next door to Grand Central Terminal and 2 blocks from 5th avenue shopping, and our shuttle to the hotel was right around the block. Apparently a cab to Laguardia is $20 from Grand Central and the shuttle we took with the New York Express Shuttle Bus cost us $12 a person one way. Depending on how many people are travelling together, a cab may actually be cheaper, but we were happy with the shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Geat Room - Not So Great View”
Reviews.Author: Westcott
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff are top notch. I had a junior suite with a view of an alley. If you just want a place to crash out, this is fine. But if you want a terrific city view you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Scarybird
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its central location which could not be criticised, but as “tourists” we felt it was more suited to business travellers than what we were looking for. The atrium entrance looked impressive on the website but did not deliver and this continued throughout. The first room we were offered was inward facing yet when we complained we got one overlooking Lexington Aveune, better but still “only a room”. Overall we felt we were just part of the numbers with little genuine wish to impress. That said we ate in the main restaurant on our first night having got in to NY late in the day and although it was late and most diners had gone, the staff were helpful and we were very pleased with the quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: qb20
Reviews.Content: This hotel really annoyed me. Here were my problems: ~The room sucked. So dark! Horrible horrible lighting even in the bathroom. A "view" of some section of the building 2 ft away. No minibar/fridge, no coffeemaker, and an empty flower vase that seemed to mock me with its lack of flowers. The comforter was stained. ~The bellmen charge $2/bag if they store it!!!! I guess this is a function of its location next to Grand Central but I can't believe that a 4-star hotel would nickel and dime its guests like this. ~Internet is not free, in the room, in the lobby, anywhere. ~I did not get the type of room I requested. When I asked for at least a free internet connection instead, this was denied. ~The lobby was very busy and very loud - not at all relaxing. ~rude check in, impersonal bellmen, mediocre service. I asked for the day's paper, the front desk directed me to the bellmen who directed me to the concierge who directed me back to the bellmen, but then told me he would have it delivered to my room. It never came. Later on, when I got in my room I realized that I didn't have a complete set of toiletries; I called front desk, and it took about half an hour for the new set to arrive. The fact that they have automated "e-checkin" kiosks like the airports do now should tell you something about their "personal" touch. On the plus side: ~the gym is awesome and has 24 hr access. ~the bed was comfy ~the decor in the room was tasteful The location is very central - literally right next door to Grand Central, but it is not very relaxing because it is always so busy and packed. I would prefer to be a few blocks north on a side street. I bid $205 on priceline and got it, so I wasn't too disappointed with the value, but it is not worth the normal listed price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: trishmitch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous, rooms were a great size (much bigger than I expected after reading the other reviews), fantastic location (4 blocks from Times Square). We also had a problem with a couple next door having a very noisy, almost violent argument (threatening to strangle one another) but security came up immediately after they were called to sort it out. Rooms were really clean, only thing missing was tea-making or coffee facilities but i beleive this is typical of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Would not choose this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: owe1
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for only one night. A couple of weeks earlier we had five nights at the Marriott Marquee. I am just thankful the five nights were at the Marriott. The room was small, bathroom even smaller. The bathroom was smaller than bathrooms on cruise ships. Not a very well lighted room No lights in the dressing area and closet . There was not a coffee maker. We've had many stays at other Hyatts and found them to be much better. On the positive side, the bed was comfortable and our room was on the 34th floor so very quiet with the exception of hearing other doors closing. The staff were friendly and helpful. Check in was very quick. The lobby and reception areas were large and lovely so it was a real shock when we opened the door to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Best location- but not as nice as it could be”
Reviews.Author: kiara_renee
Reviews.Content: Walking into the Grand Hyatt, you are greeted by a gorgeous lobby- which makes you set your hopes high that your room will be just as nice... The check in staff were friendly enough- but when we got to our room, we were slightly disappointed. The room is small (but it's New York, so I was expecting that)- but it had room enough. There is no ceilling lighting! Only lamps- which don't illuminate the room very well. The bathroom has a ceiling light, but it doesn't really light up enough to apply makeup. The famous Hyatt bed is fine- but EVERY set of sheets they put on each of the beds was torn! Not major rips or anything, but lots of little holes- they were just old and worn out. The towels were old and thin. Clean enough, but old. The bathroom didn't have an extractor fan- which I think it quite common in North America, however, there was mould on the door and doorframe, (a lot of mould), which was not cleaned off the entire time we were there. (Yuk). On the good side- the hotel is in a GREAT location. It's connected to Grand Central Station, which is useful. It's also walking distance to Times Square, Chrysler building, Empire State Building, Central Park.... Lots of great eating places nearby. The room was nice enough, the location was great- if they cleaned it up a little (new sheets and towels, and cleaned the rooms a little more thoroughly), then this would be a 4.5-5* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a great location!”
Reviews.Author: gmrb
Reviews.Content: I was worried about our stay after reading some of the previous reviews. I had a room on the Regency Club level which worked out quite nicely. Since the room included the club we ate a great deal of our food there. It certainly helped save on the expensive food costs in NYC. The room was a double and quite nice for NY standards. Bathroom could of had more counter space but they do provide wire shelf below the sink. Staff was polite and friendly. The location is great, especially next door to Grand Central Station. You can access the GCS without leaving the hotel. GST has a 3 minute shuttle to Times Square that works out nicely since that is where you can pick up many of the city tours. I would surely stay there again.!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: MoBeans03
Reviews.Content: first time my gf and i went new york so, we stayed at the Hyatt due a to a friends recommendation, our room was small but than again we weren't there for much of the day, come night time we were probably some of the loud people some of these reviewers were complaining about :) the most important thing to us was the location which was great, the service which we have no complaints about, nice bed! it was very nice/comfy which is the reason why people get a hotel in the first place. so all in all the hyatt was cool, not grand but i would stay there again. good price aswell.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevstersped
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 5 nights at the end of July-early August as part of a graduation present for my daughter. It turned out to be an outstanding experience, even after an ominous start. We requested an early check in besause our flight from Detroit was due in at 10:30 AM. However due ro numerous flight cancellations and delays due to weather and personel problems, we did not arrive at the Hyatt until after midnight. At this point expecting another disappoinment, I was not. The woman at check in was extreemly nice and empathetic getting us through that and to our room very quickly even recommending a late night deli nearby if we were hungry - which we were. Let me say that the lobby is gorgeous, the hallways very tasteful and our room was a beautiful sight! It was large for NY standards, clean, smartly decorated, not tired and worn, and had a spectacular view from the 29th floor overlooking Grand Central and 42nd Street. During our stay, everyone at the hotel was courteous, helpful and pleasant from start to finish. The only negative I have is that we ran out of toilet paper one day when we returned from sightseeing, apparently not refilled by housekeeping that day and had to wait 45 minutes after 2 phone calls to get more. The coffee stand in yhe Lobby is great and convenient and the food at the hotel is excellent but very expensive. However there are many good restaurants nearby that are reasonably priced. Our favorite was called Annie Moore's on 43rd Street about a 1/2 block past Grand Central. The Grand Hyatt's location as everyone says is perfect for getting just about anywhere around New York. We all had a memorable experience here and would most certainly return on our next visit to the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the centre of New York City”
Reviews.Author: so3003
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Grand Hyatt New York in July 2007 for 5 nights as part of a holiday to New York (and Philadelphia). I was travelling alone. I booked the hotel via Hyatt.com, and got a special rate using a code from the Travelzoo website. My stay happened to coincide with the steam-pipe explosion in New York, which happened 1-2 blocks from the hotel, so my experience of staying there was probably a bit abnormal, but nonetheless I enjoyed the 5 nights I spent at the hotel. I arrived in New York by air (from Philadelphia) and made my way to the hotel via the New York Airport Service bus, which drops off at Grand Central Station, next door to the hotel. You can enter the hotel either from the street or directly from Grand Central Station. The lobby interior is extremely well done, and if anything is a little over-the-top! Access to the lobby from either entrance is by escalator or stairs; I'm sure there must be a lift too, but I didn't see one. Check-in was hassle-free, though I arrived at midday and my room wasn't ready until 3pm (as advertised). They stored my luggage free of charge (there's a $2 charge per item if you store luggage after checking out) leaving me to go out and explore the Big Apple before getting into my room. The hotel is ideally located right next door to Grand Central Station, in Midtown Manhattan. If you're unfamiliar with New York the main city is on Manhattan Island, with largely residential areas on Staten Island, Brooklyn and the Bronx. Uptown Manhattan has Central Park, while downtown Manhattan is home to the financial district. No prizes for guessing where midtown is :-) It's a good idea to use the metro to get around, and don't even consider driving - the traffic was absurdly bad! My room, when I got into it, was on the 20th floor of the hotel. It was large (I'm told a boxroom is the norm for a hotel in NYC, but this room was very spacious) and featured a small walk-in wardrobe, a comfortable King bed, a desk / working area, a small couch and TV, and a small but well equipped bathroom. (My room was at the end of the corridor so may have been slightly larger than others.) I was surprised to find there was no tea/coffee making facility in the room, nor was there a minibar (or an empty fridge). Perhaps I'm too used to traditional British hospitality... There was a fitness centre on the top floor of the hotel and though I didn't use it, it seemed fairly well equipped with weights / cardiovascular machines etc. It gave a great view over the city too. I only ordered room service once; returning from a Broadway show I had a craving for chocolate cake and milkshake, and it was delivered to my room within about 10 minutes of calling downstairs (at 1am). It was fairly expensive at almost $30 including tip etc, but worth it!!! I think there was wireless internet access in the public areas of the hotel, but I'm not sure if there was (free) access from guestrooms. The 24 hour business centre provided internet access at a hefty price - I think it was something like 50cents / minute, which to me is very expensive considering the cost of a room. As I mentioned above, the first night of my stay was when the steampipe explosion occurred in New York - scary, to say the least. For the remainder of my stay (until I was leaving for the airport!) the only access to the hotel was via Grand Central Station, but there were plenty of hotel staff around to provide directions and so on. Check-out was relatively hassle-free but I did have to wait in line for 5-10 minutes before diong so, which was quite annoying. The hotel has around 1000 rooms and I think you can check out by phone or with an automatic machine too, but I chose to wait in line with the 999 other people ;-) To be fair the desk staff were very fast at processing the queue, and my bill was in order when I was served. Overall this is a comfortable hotel in the heart of New York City, but I think with such high room rates the business centre should be free, or at least much cheaper than it is. If you need internet access like I did, head for Burger King at Times Square - it's only $5 for almost an hour!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: rtrusik
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on 7/24/07 - 7/28/07 - about a week after the steam pipe explosion. It is very well located because it is right at Grand Central Station. When you walk outside there are lots of people around and you do feel safe. We also saw quite a few police officers which was good. Right up the street is the soup man restaurant or the "Soup Nazi" as Seinfeld called him. They do have great crab bisque. There is a great japanese restaurant about 3 blocks away called Riki which had amazing sushi & the best fried rice at reasonable prices. Back to the hotel - we found the rooms to be upscale, well kept, and clean. Our bath was also clean. The lobby is nice and the gym was also. The gym was free which is unusual for most upper class hotels. We paid about $211 per night plus tax which is very good in NYC. We felt that it was a good rate for the hotel & location. The concierge was helpful finding places for us - told us about Riki. They were very busy so sometimes you had to wait a little bit before you got help. We would definitely stay there again. You are 4-5 blocks from Times Square and you can catch the S train shuttle which only goes from Times Square - Grand Central Station and back. Very convienant to use the subway & bus. We bought a week pass for $24 each and you can use it for unlimited subway & bus rides. Well worth it and saved us plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: DiPede
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July 2007 for an extended weekend getaway. The hotel is quite nice with a very welcoming lobby. The hotel is very clean, and the staff is very helpful. However, the truly great part of this hotel is it's location. It is connected to Grand Central Station which allows you to hop on the subway and practically get to any part of the city. As a group of all females, we also felt quite safe in the area at all times...especially at night. All of the sites of NYC are within a good walking distance, with some obviously being closer than others. For most people, the walk to Times Square and surrounding areas is quite easy and takes only about 10 minutes or so. Overall, I would definitly recommend this hotel to people visiting NYC who want to be centrally located and get a beautiful room at a relatively good price.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good gym facilities!”
Reviews.Author: DrMSydney
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in New York, and had asked for an early check in. They did manage a 12pm check in (3 hours early). The hotel has some sound issues (we could hear our neighbours in the adjoining room quite easily!) and everyone out in the corridors too! Tip: stuffing a towel at the base of the door does dull the noise somewhat. We discovered the business centre (helpful staff) and gym (surprisingly well equipped and we used it 3 times in a week!). The lobby is a bit of a disappointment. It is probably the most crowded hotel lobby I have ever seen and it was difficult to find a place to sit waiting for our lift out to the airport at the end of our stay. Having said that, it is a minor point. The hotel is well located, the beds are comfortable and when the curtains are drawn it is pitch black and great for a good sleep-in (if you ever want to do that when you're in New York!) The rooms are as advertised on the website we booked through and we have a photo of them in the photos section here.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: alusa
Reviews.Content: Great Location as it is connected to Grand Central Station. Lobby and hallways are dimly lit. The interior decorating looked cheap with alot of brass and silk flowers. Bathroom was extremely small and there was a bit of mold in caulking in bathtub. Housekeeping person was great. All in all, there are alot of better choices in NYC. Marriott Renaisance was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay- Outstanding!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kiddbucci
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great from start to finish. We arrived at 10am, checked in, had to check our bags until our room was ready which was way ahead of schedule (12noon, not 3pm), went out for lunch and came back picked up our bag and went to our beautiful and very quiet room. It was a fabulous stay. The concierge was amazing, setting us up with a great dinner at Salute before we headed to The Police concert. Everyone was more than helpful. We didn't hear anyone in any other rooms, it was just a wonder overnight trip with my husband. Would definately go back. Perfect location! My guess is with the other reviews I've read here, if you're nice to people, they are nice back. Go and have a great time at the Grand Hyatt. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kezabelle23
Reviews.Content: Aa a travel agent I have high standards for accomodation and I loved the grand hyatt new york we stayed for 5 nights , our room had looked out onto the crysler building,what a view!!. The hotel is in a great location for exploring the city and as 2 girls travelling we felt really safe, around the hotel. All though a little pricey the hotel is worth it and with grand central station attached your never far away from great food and a spot of people watching!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MJSSJM
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for three nights and had a wonderful stay. The lobby is reason enough to stay at this beautiful hotel. The room was on the small side but don't expect anything different in the city limits. Everything was clean, friendly staff, and great coffee stop in the lobby! Grand Hyatt's location is wonderful as well. The train/subway station is right next door so getting around is easy! Definitely will stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: BCGobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Great location right next ot Grand Central Station but this is the only thing that would make me think of staying here again. The quality of the room was not equal to it's 4 star status. We found it small and decoration was not out of the ordinary. There was no mini-bar service or even a two pot coffee maker for conveniences. We tried breakfast the first morning but the cost was outrageous and the food cold. We ended up eating across the street at Pershing Square where the food was great and reasonable. Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing fiasco”
Reviews.Author: ilkkar
Reviews.Content: I visited at Grand Hyatt New York with my fiancee during our well deserved holiday on July. We have previously stayed at Hyatt locations in Europe so we had high hopes for our holiday accommodation. Our regret is to let you know that our stay at Grand Hyatt New York was a terribly disappointing fiasco. During our check in, after we had waited in the line for a long time, we were appointed to an awfully worn smoking room with absolutely no view at all. The room smelled so terrible that my fiancee got a migraine headache. When we requested a room change, we got downgraded to a lesser room which we accepted, because it did not have the smell, and we also could see out of it's small window. The television in the room was useless because we could not find it's remote control, although we searched the room as well as we could. The room did not even have a minibar. We did not mind the weariness of the property, but because our room was not cleaned properly, especially the bathroom was disgustingly dirty during our visit. This we could not expect in supposedly high class hotel. The service was generally inefficient with a careless attitude towards the service. We had to wait for three days before our laundry bag was collected after 5 phone requests. Once in the evening when we were ready to go to bed, we noticed that our bed linnen were changed into dirty sheets with stains in them. At this point we were so tired that we desided to not call housekeeping and just slept without the sheets. Also, the communication with the staff was sometimes quite difficult, because only few spoke english. The concierge service could not help us even with the most general questions, so we had to find out everything in the town by ourselves. For example, when we requested whether it is possible to find a swimming pool in Manhattan, the concierge told us that it is something that people do in Miami and is not possible unless we are guests in some other hotel. So we went to a beautiful rooftop swimming pool located at only a couple of blocks away from the hotel, which we found by using the Google internet search. The hotel's restaurant was vintage from the 80's. The service was unprofessional, for example when we ordered a glass of champagne, we got a glass of cava. After complaining we were told that the restaurant does not serve "the real champagne". The only thing high class was the restaurant's pricing. The staff's only talent seemed to be getting tipped even if there were no service what so ever. We had to pay all together $25 just to get out of the hotel with our bags, which we carried by ourselves. A taxi that the bellboy arranged for us took us to the airport with a fixed "taxfree" fee which was much higher than a metered fee would have been. The arrangement was not told us before got to the airport when we requested a receipt for the trip. We never received our complimentary morning beverage, which we are entitled to because I am a Gold Passport Platinum member and although we stayed at the hotel for six nights. When we checked out, we received 57% reduction of the morning beverage price which was in total $160 and we ended up paying because of the confusion. Also, I did not receive the Gold Passport bonus points that were offered to me for the stay. The customer service did never reply to my letter and I never received any compensation for the room downgrade, although I had prepaid for a deluxe room. We will never stay at Grand Hyatt New York again and I doubt that we will stay at any Hyatt location again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A bad experience from start to finish...”
Reviews.Author: travelingirlUsa
Reviews.Content: I generally stay at Westins and this is one example of why I'll choose other hotels over a Hyatt. Even the Hilton at Rockefeller Center had better service than the Hyatt at the Grand Central Terminal. From the moment we arrived, I knew this was going to be a disappointing stay. When our Towncar pulled up at the curb, two valets eyed the car, neither one of them stepping forward to open the door. Once our luggage was lined up on the curb, again, neither man offered assistance. Nor did they point us in the direction of the front desk. I'm a Gold Passport member and, despite the fact that my profile specifically states that I prefer quiet rooms away from the elevator, the room we were assigned was directly across from the elevator (noisy as hell during a conference, btw). When I asked for a room change, I was given a tiny room--literally, when you walked into the room, you almost tripped over the bed. Considering how small the bathrooms are--and the vanity has absolulely NO space for toiletries--we needed a second mirror in the room. So we stuck with our initial room, which was a step up from the tiny cave they offered us when we requested the room change. No amenities in the room--no coffeemaker, bottled water, refrigerator or mini-bar. I've had better amenties and customer service at lesser brand hotels. And what is the point/benefit of being a Passport member, anyway? The customer service was awful. I asked the tour hostess for a map and she literally threw it on the counter as though she was annoyed that I'd interrupted her (doing nothing by the way...). The food was nothing to write home about. The drinks were seriously overpriced, even for NY, and again, the service... horrible. After all that, they double billed me. And the amounts didn't even match. When I called Passport Customer Service about this, they referred me to the hotel, but couldn't even give me a direct phone number. I won't stay here again. Nor will I choose a Hyatt in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Reited_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for five nights beginning July 10, 2007 at a nightly rate of $359 plus tax. The Grand Hyatt is a large, nicely decorated hotel attached to Grand Central Station that is frequented by buisness and leisure travelers. It's location is hard to beat if one is planning to use the NYC subway as a means of transportation. The room I stayed in was a smoking room on the 29th floor with a decent view of 42nd Street. Unlike many high rise hotels, the window actually opened. The room had a pleasant recently updated decor and comfortable beds. The room was clean and the maid service was good. The bathroom was small with little room for personal toiletries. The wi-fi service worked well but cost an additional $9.95 per day. The hotel restaurant only serves a breakfast buffet which with tax and tip cost $35.00 per person. It was good but not that good. More reasonably priced restaurants are available across the street from the main hotel entrance. The food court in Grand Central Station can also be acessed without going outside and has many very reasonable food options. The lobby coffee stand is an another option but it also charges NYC hotel prices. I had problems at check in. I had reserved a room with two double beds. The first room I was given was a beautiful junior suite with one queen bed. At 4:00 p.m., I had to wait more than an hour for a room with two double beds to become available. The hotel provided a $100 food and beverage credit for my inconvenience which was nice. Overall it was a pleasant stay in a reasonably well appointed room. Was the room worth $359 per night? No, but few if any NYC hotels are worth their nightly charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scott80127
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hyatt Grand the last two times I have been in NY. I found the rooms to be comfortable and quiet. I stayed on the higher level floors to minimize street noise. It is great having it right above Grand Central Station. I took an Express MTA bus from LGA direct to Grand Central for $12.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with sticker shock”
Reviews.Author: Travelvagabond
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is centrally located next to Grand Central Station. You can't get much better than that for accessibility to all points in the city. It made getting around during my four days in NY easy and stress free. The hotel staff is warm and extremely accommodating. The rooms are moderately sized, although the bathroom vanity has little to no space for toiletries. We resulted to doing hair and makeup via the mirrored closet door. My room had little above the standard bath amenities. No water, no coffee maker, no mini-bar or in room fridge meaning to driver visitors to room service where prices were wildly high even for NY standards. Save yourself the luxury and rather than a $23 pot of coffee via room service, head to the coffee stand in the lobby for a more reasonable cup..or better still hit one of the many food vendors in Grand Central Station attached to the hotel. Restaurant and bar are small and cozy but suffer the same inflated pricing. The breakfast buffet was adequate but I had it included in the price of my room and didn't pay the charge. Overall a good stay, great friendly staff, and fabulous location. Just don't stay in the hotel for meals..use that time to soak up the ambiance of NY and sample the great restaurants around. (or the vendors that line the street at night)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: caleut
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was great location for getting around. Right next to Grand Central Station. The staff met all of the requests that we made in a timely manner and were extremely fast with check in and check out. We had a corner room which was larger then the average room and it was clean. The bathroom wasnt too big but we had 4 people in our room and didn't have any problems. I will definately stay at the Hyatt again. A++

Reviews.Title: “Update your bathrooms! Please!”
Reviews.Author: docwatson_236
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC frequently on business and this is the second time I've had to stay at this hotel -- I say "had to" because it happened to be the business meeting hotel, otherwise I'd have stayed elsewhere. Both times I reserved deluxe rooms. Both times I was disappointed. First, the good points: Number one is location. It's easy to get to, right atop Grand Central Station. Number two: the lobby's pretty nice, with a massive indoor waterfall. Number three: if you've booked it for a large business banquet, they do a good job feeding massive numbers of people with better than average banquet food. The bad points: good god, the BATHROOMS are gross. Tiny little spaces with cheap fixtures. I've seen better bathrooms in cheap highway motels. Ours smelled strongly of mildew, and there was no fan, no window, so you had to leave the door open to air it out. THE ROOM, although generously sized, was missing a number of amenities that I've come to expect. No in-room refrigerator! No hotel stationery. And our room was missing any TV remote. Finally, it was dark as a cave inside, with only one small window, and even with all the lamps turned on, I had to strain my eyes just to get any paperwork done. I had breakfast only once at the hotel, then decided to head for the much better breakfast place across the street, at Pershing Square (under the bridge.) Overall, I only go to this hotel when business meetings demand it of me. Otherwise, I'd much prefer to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Embarassed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nikita49
Reviews.Content: The reservation desk did not reserve the type of rooms I requested . I requested adjoining rooms because there were minors with us. So we asked to speak to the MOD (Manager on Duty) and she told us there is no guarentee Hyatt would be able to give us adjoining rooms. So I asked her what is the sense of calling ahead of time. She did not answer. We ended up with adjoinging rooms on the 27th floor directing opposite the elevators. I loved hearing the elevator bell at 3:00 in the morning. I also preordered extra pillows, cookies, milk, and a fruit arrangement that never showed up. Of course, we were charged for it. We refuted the charge and the front desk clerk deleted the charge. The rooms do not have bureaus for clothing storage, a phone did not work , the bathroom floors were not washed in ages, there was a clomp of hair in the shower drain. Disgusting! Hyatt charges for TMobile service and still charges you for unknown hotel taxes. Ridiculous! We were traveling with school friends that is why I was totally embarrassed. Never again. We are sticking with Marriott. Good riddens Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Grand Here”
Reviews.Author: Malie
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel, but to be clear, this is not one I would choose voluntarily. Check-in was simple - no problems there. The room was decently sized but definitely run down and not well cared for. There were stains on the walls. The full-length mirror on the closet door was filthy. I had them bring me a new desk chair since the original one had a large stain on it. Overall, none of the employees was especially personable. The bed was comfortable, but there were a variety of stains (black marks, what appeared to possibly be makeup, etc.) and holes on the worn sheets. A few random hairs were spotted in the room (on toilet, between sheets, etc.). The bathroom was small - not enough room to place your toiletries on the vanity. The bathtub in my room needed to be reglazed - it appeared quite dirty and I'd recommend that anyone who stays here bring flip flops to shower in. The towels were worn, clean, but quite used and there were one or two towels whose stains bothered me so much that I chose not to use them. I requested extra towels all three nights of my stay. The first two nights I requested towels all went well. But the third night, the man who delivered them seemed a bit bothered and barely grunted a greeting when I opened the door. Daily housekeeping was not great - it looked like someone rushed through the room on a tight time schedule. You could see the wipe marks on the faucet and you could also see spots on the vanity that the housekeeper missed. Given the details that were overlooked, I wondered if the housekeeper assigned to my room might have been cleaning the room with her eyes closed. The concierge was helpful in identifying a spot for dinner one night, but not too detailed in giving directions. This was quite a lackluster experience overall and I have to say given my recent stays here and at the Grand Hyatt DFW and the one attached to the airport in Chicago - I can't imagine that I would choose the Hyatt for any type of a vacation stay. The best feature of this Hyatt is its location. There's a Duane Reade right across the street if you need toiletries. There's tons of shopping close by (Ann Taylor, Kenneth Cole and much more) as well as good food and touristy features like Times Square. Another note, two of my colleagues also had complaints. One needed to be moved to a different room. The other one said that the sheets on one of her beds appeared to be dirty - so she ripped them off to make sure they put new ones on the next day. There was simply nothing grand about this Hyatt…

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but lacked personal attention”
Reviews.Author: Suzfriedman
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a girls' weekend (my daughter, sister, niece and I) in NYC and stayed at the Grand Hyatt at Central Station. The location was wonderful as my sister/niece were able to take the train directly to the station from Boston, and I was able to get a shuttle directly from Laguardia airport for $21 round trip with my daughter free [--]. In addition, we were right above the newly renovated train station, which could easily get us anywhere around the City without even going outside the hotel. Also, easily walkable was Times Square (about 10-15 minutes) and Rockefeller Center (easy 10 minutes). We had arrived early at about 1pm on a Saturday and I had previously requested an early check in. I am a Hyatt Platinum member, so Hyatt usually does the best they can to accommodate me when I stay at their hotels. The receptionist immediately told me they did not have a room and seemed a little bothered. He would not even give me an idea when one would be available. We decided to stay in the area for lunch and checked our bags with the bellman. We returned about 2pm, when another receptionist told us they were sorry, still no rooms--again not very helpful. We were pretty frustrated as we wanted to change clothes and head out for a bike tour (great time--centralparkbiketour.com) through central park and we were killing most of the day. About ten minutes later I went to another receptionist who miraculously came up with a room for us when she did a little further computer research. We got a double room (no view) on the 17th floor, which was very nice and actually pretty big for NY standards. The bathroom was on the small side and very plain, but all was clean and comfortable, especially the amazing Hyatt beds. Other issues with the hotel were that there was not a coffee maker in the room. We did get tokens for coffee downstairs, but one of us would have to get dressed and run down there each morning. In addition, it seemed like the walls were very thin and we could hear everything in the rooms next to us. Overall, we still had a good experience as the location was superb and the hotel had the Hyatt comfortableness. Another great plus was this wonderful food court in Grand Central station that had amazing fresh foods, deserts, breads, soups, seafood, etc. Another area of the station had an awesome gourmet market and wine shop, with a great selection of chilled bottles--all easily accessible directly from the hotel's lower lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BillClo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Hyatt in April and I would return here everytime. The rooms were a good size especially for NY and the cleanliness and service could not be faulted. Being situated at Grand Central Station was ideal for getting round the city. Only one complaint, the buffet breakfast was way over priced so do what all the New Yorkers do grab a bagel in the lobby! Fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt at Grand Central Terminal”
Reviews.Author: ChazDP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property to be on site for a meeting. Average property, excellent location if you are looking for a place to stay and want to train it in to the city-just walk up stairs. If you drive as I did, it is a bit of a nightmare to get to a place for valet parking. The hotel is a vertical hotel..ride the "stairs" or elevators. I think it is a below average hotel for a meeting-so much going on things get lost in the noise. Don't eat here-poor quality and over priced. I ordered a sandwich-BLT at the bar and it was "poor" quality at $25.00 but its NY, and I was not shocked at the price. Room was decent, average, good size and clean. As a hotel when traveling by train, go for it...all of the good stuff in NYC is outside of the hotels anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Worried at first, but turned out to be an excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: cr8zymike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on an east cost trip and were booked for the Grand Hyatt. From previous reviewers on this site I was a bit worried because of the negative reviews but it turned out better than I had expected. We drove from Toronto, Ontario, Canada that morning (3am) and after a few stops and being stuck in notorious New York traffic, we finally got to the hotel by 5pm. I was tired and cranky and was greeted by a very profesional front desk worker. I didn't make it a big deal but it came out to the discussion of why we were in NYC so i told him it was the 1st wedding anniversary for my wife and I. Without saying anything me, i was told that I was being upgraded to a king size corner room. I was very delighted because during my stay in NYC 5 years ago, I stayed @ another hotel (same class) in a room that was very small and cramped. To make things even better, he set things up so when my wife and I returned from dinner, we had an evening selection of food and choice of beverages (alcohol and non-alcohol) waiting for us. Needless to say, my stay was very very good! The room was clean, there was very limited noise from other rooms, and everyone in the hotel were very friendly and very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julian1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend for a couple of days and had a more then great stay. We picked this hotel cause we wanted a good Hotel in a good central location and it was everything we expected it to be. The Hotel has a great allure, and a wonderful huge lobby with nice staff. The rooms were large, nicely decorated, really good beds and always clean. The Hotel's location is probably one of the strongest arguments to pick this hotel, cause its right where you want to be and its hooked to Grand Central Station, so if you wanna get some food or drinks its yours to catch (unless you want to order expensive roomservice), If im going to visite New York again i will definitly book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Should be a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christiano
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my partner after a long journey from London, tired and tattered, looking forward to relaxing and settling into NY. Checking in was speedy and efficient.
