When I entered our room I was shocked, the room was very, very small (I know space is at a premium in NY but this was $520 per night), dark and dirty looking, no views whatsoever, tiny bathroom with no work/ storage surfaces, no mini bar, no tea & coffee facilities, 3 coathangers and a large ugly box tv that took up most of the space in the room. Within a minute of being in the room and seeing the state of the place, I rang down and requested a room change. I was given another room,. Agan unsatisfactory, same as before, shocking!. Again I requested another room change. I was shown two more, and settled for the one that had the better bathroom, a decent sized workspace for putting toiletries on. Still this room was inadequate for a 4 star hotel. The air vents very thick with grime, the towels worn, tired and dirty. I have stayed in Hyatt hotels before in London and Belgium and found them to be first class. The grand Hyatt NY is a blot on their portfolio and I would never stay there again. I wish I had read the reviews on this website before checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: AviD42
Reviews.Content: Great location, small comfy clean room, best price/value ratio, best coffee in NY in the lobby, you can't miss the small vendor with a line 1 mile long, his late's or espressos has Starbuck's beat any day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: blanco1
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned when I read some of the negative reviews for the Grand Hyatt. We got a great deal on the Grand Hyatt with priceline for a four day stay from June 21-24. It was wonderful. The room was beautiful, the location was the best, the fitness center was excellent. Fitness centers are essential for me and this one had plenty of treadmills, elliptical machines, stationary bikes, etc. Most of the machines had individual TV attached. It was never crowded when I was there. Yes I suppose some can complain about a smaller bathroom, no bathrobes, a less than perfect view and no coffee/tea in the room. These things did not bother me. I joined the Hyatt Gold passport on-line for free and received coupons for tea/coffee every morning. I chose a room with less of a view but without a connecting door since I had stayed at the Hyatt before and could hear the people in the next room. The service in the room was fine and the staff was friendly. We had a wonderful stay and would stay again at the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “no towels...no robe...no housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: saratoga4
Reviews.Content: I made a quick business trip to New York for an investor conference and stayed at the Grand Hyatt, which was the location of the conference. I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt several times in the past two years, and generally find it is an acceptable business hotel. They have large meeting facilties, so many of the New York investment banks hold Investor Conferences here. This trip I arrived to find I had been upgraded to a larger room than normal. The room had a large entry area that was separated from the bedroom area by a credenza with a TV on it that rotated to be viewed either from the bed or from the entry area. The room was clean, but it smelled like it had previously been a smoking room that they had sprayed "clean" to use it as a non-smoking room. There was a large desk, which made working convenient, along with a comfortable chair near the bed. The closet was large, but the bathrooms in the Grand Hyatt are extremely small with virtually no counter space for sundries. However, the rooms were remodeled in the past few years, and are reasonably nice. Also, the beds, pillows, and linens are very comfortable. I used the fitness center, which has a good collection of cardiovascular equipment with individual TV's, and a small amount of weight equipment. The fitness center also has a nice view of the city. I ordered room service, which took almost an hour to arrive, despite the 35 minute claim. The food was delivered hot. My only complain was with housekeeping. When I arrived, I called to ask for a robe to be sent to the room. I then went to workout. I returned to the room 90 minutes later, and there was no robe. Housekeeping explained that their deliver had not come yet, and they would send one up as soon as they arrived. After showering from my workout, I noticed there were no bath towels in the room. I called to request bath towels, and a few minutes later, the robe I requested was delivered. Then, I called again for towels 30 minutes later, and a second robe was delivered instead. I called again, and finally the bath towels were delivered. I haven't had this problem with housekeeping on prior stays. I am in New York every 4-6 weeks for an investor conference. Some are held at either the St Regis, the Mandarin Oriental, or the Four Seasons, which are all superior hotels, albeit more expensive. The largest conferences are often held at the Grand Hyatt, which is essentially a very solid business hotel--no frills, no great service, but generally solid. The location is very good, right at Grand Central Station, for those who will be touring Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Ingu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the "Grand" Hyatt for 2 nights at the beginning of June. I chose the hotel since it was the venue for a rating agency conference that I was attending. Its always nice to stay in the same hotel as the conference, as it cuts out the travel time and one can always nip to the room during boring presentations. But I made the wrong decision. This is one "tired" hotel. The rooms are musty and dirty. The bathrooms are ok, but have sub standard towels. It just felt, smelt and looked old. Its not worth the money you pay (I paid $319 per night, a corporate rate). There was litter in the hallways of the hotel, that no one seemed to pick up and was there for both nights I was there. And worse still, the service was terrible. It took an hour for the room service to be delivered, and that was bad too. I also lost my keys in the hotel room and e mailed the "lost and found address" on the bill to ask if they had been found. You guessed it- no reply from the lost and found address. I would stay away from this hotel- if you are travelling on business, pay slightly more and stay at the NY Palace. Its well worth it. The Grand Hyatt is definitely not Grand and not worthy of the Hyatt brand.

Reviews.Title: “Below average in its class”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler95
Reviews.Content: Below average experience in Hyatt. Very small room with no natural light as it was facing the other wing of the building in a corner area. Bathroom had only small shower. Room was superficially cleaned. Valet parking a disaster. It took more than an hour when we needed the car. It was total chaos - very poorly organized overall. They had no idea if the hotel has already accounted for the daily fee at the time we checked out. Breakfast was just OK but definitively not 4*. Overall a 2.5* experience at best. We stayed in many other hotels in New York City in the past - this was below average in its class.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed, would not go back”
Reviews.Author: PlanesTrainsAutos4
Reviews.Content: My friend and I go to NYC frequently and have stayed at many different hotels and we both agreed that the Hyatt rates at the bottom of our list. My friend booked our rooms (we each had another guest with us) directly w/ Hyatt as she is a frequent business traveler and has stayed at their hotels in other cities. We asked for two doubles and each got a king and had to have roll-a-way beds brought in. In addition to that, they also had our rate incorrect by $30. They corrected this but then wanted to charge an extra $20 for the roll-a-way since they said two doubles was not a guarantee unless you want a room on a smoking floor. Frankly, I think this tactic is an insult. So as far as what we got... What was great: the property location. What was good: the bed comfort and the room size (until we had to accommodate the roll-a-way). The bad: the rooms do not have a coffee maker (although we got a complimentary cup upon checkout), no refrigerator (can't bring any drinks or perishable food to your room) and there is no full length mirror. The only mirror is the one above the sink in the bathroom. Not good when two people are trying to get showered and dressed at the same time. Also, the bathroom does not have a fan so it gets pretty steamy in there. We all had cold showers or the water would run cold then suddenly become very hot, then cold again. The towels were rough. Also, this is the only hotel I've ever stayed anyplace that charged guests ($2 a bag) for storing bags at checkout so we could spend more time in the city. We're not cheap... we always tip the staff for this service but does Hyatt really need the extra money from their guests? I know this hotel has been around a long time and is a huge old property to maintain BUT... we're talking Hyatt, one of the biggest names in hotels around the world. They should do better. One other note: the staff was friendly and apologetic. I felt bad for them, we heard complaints from fellows guest as well. I would NOT recommend this hotel unless location is the only important preference.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Deviljmg
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Grand Hyatt in NYC left some things to be desired. Probably the biggest complaint is that the hotel's high speed internet access is wireless only and they have few working adapter kits - so I was unable to connect my laptop during my stay. I hope for better from a business-class hotel. There were also a couple of issues with the room itself. The airconditioning was somewhat inadequate. Despite cranking the temp down fairly low, I was never really able to get the room properly cooled off. Also, the sink drain didn't work properly and the door stuck on closing so you always had to remember to close it behind you by hand. Somewhat minor quibbles perhaps, but for $350/night, I expect better. The upshot is that if you have a conference in the hotel, the convenience probably makes it worth staying there, but otherwise I think there are better choices for your dollar in midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Amazing city”
Reviews.Author: Cath333
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on the site I was apprehensive but had no need to be. Room was big with 2 double beds, bathroom small but had huge shower. Great location. Taxi rank outside and Grand Central Station Metro (subway) linked to the hotel. Bought a week metro card for only $24. When we checked out had a bill for $110 dollars for food which was not mine. Sorted out quickly and wiped off my credit card. Statue of Liberty breathtaking. Well worth a ranger trip around Ellis Island. Empire State queues big but had to be done. Did Rockerfeller Centre in the night and noticed they did a special pass to go up in the day and night on the same day. Views from helicopter out of this world. Brooklyn Bridge - well worth the walk for the view but don't bother with Brooklyn Ice Cream Factory. Shopping in Macy's better than Bloomingdales. Guggenheim and Met both excellent. Movie tour well worth it - never thought the Friends building looked like that. What an amazing place. Can't wait to go back. Will be booking the Hyatt again too.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Grand”
Reviews.Author: jsp3
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on rare occasion for over 25 years. As a wide-eyed teenager in Manhattan for the first time, it was truly Grand to me. As a forty-something business executive, the Grand Hyatt leaves a little to be desired. The lobby is fine, but it's basically the same as it's been for 25 years. The entry stair/escalator from 42nd St could use a major makeover. My room was high on the 43rd floor. The hallways are nicely remodeled with rich looking carpeting. The room itself though, while adequate in size, offers nothing Grand. There's no bath robe. Not even a bath mat in the very small bathroom. Not that I use it often, but there's no mini-bar. The "flat screen" TV is flat, but it's not a thin LCD or plasma as in newer hotels, just a basic 25" box. The one bedroom feature I really did like though is the iHome radio with a dock for my iPod. It charges the iPod and the controls on the stereo operate the iPod. Beyond that, I can't give much to recommend this place, unless you need to be near by. For my money, I would much rather stay closer to Broadway in the W or one of the other fine hotels over there.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodations”
Reviews.Author: KateCConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Booked via Priceline for $135. Despite some negative prior reviews, we found this hotel quite comfortable. We agree that the common areas (lobby, hallways) still have some remaining '80s touches, but who cares? The reception was friendly, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and for this price, we got a great bargain in the heart of Manhattan. Yes, the bathroom was on the small side, but nothing unusual for Manhattan. The bedroom was on the larger side for a Manhattan room. We requested a higher floor and ended up with a perfectly pleasant view. We have stayed at some very nice hotels, and based on the reviews of this one, we thought we'd be disappointed, but we were not. This is in walking distance of everything, lots of cafes, restaurants, and shopping nearby . . . really cannot complain about anything! After our night at The Hyatt, we agreed that this will be our affordable, go-to hotel when we want to spend the weekend in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Newton66
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Grand Hyatt twice and both have been great! The first time was August 2005, we walked in off the street and booked a club class room. The room had the usual extras included - welcome chilled bottle of wine and nibbles in room, breakfast, unlimited coffee etc throughout the day, early evening light snacks, the security of knowing only club guest can access these floors and a great view. The second time, Sept 06, was with a girlfriend booked through Expedia. We had a large room which was great but didn't open the blinds cos the view was the pits - offices and a large generator looking thing!! Did join the Hyatt Rewards Scheme before we went which costs nothing and received a stack of 'free coffee' vouchers to use at the kiosk in the foyer which was really good! We found the staff extremely helpful, particularly in the bar, the ones who served us as well as the ones who drank with us!!!! The lovely man who welcomed us and then took us the back way through the hotel to a secret door into Grand Central when we couldn't find our way!! All round we could not have asked for anything more! (Also 'Strawberry' a store below has some good bargains!!)

Reviews.Title: “What an awful place!!”
Reviews.Author: PinkCV
Reviews.Content: I was unfortunate enough to be here on business. The place is a hell hole. Is it a vast, noisy, classless, soul less place and the staff have no idea of what customer service entails. I arrived at around 3am. To my surprise that was a vast queue of people waiting to check in. The staff were slow and acted with no sense of urgency, that at 3am guests might want to get to bed ASAP. The hotel lobby is a disaster, it looks as if is hasn't been renovated in about 25 years. It is dated and makes you feel like you are on a station councourse, is it impersonal and unwelcoming and has the tackiest flowers ever. Don't even get me started on the room/room service: *I asked for a twin, I received a double; *mouldy, tiny bathroom; * no water, no mini bar; * room service was slow and the waiter was rude, when it did come, the milk was served in Starbucks cup; * my room service tray was not collected for 12 hours even though I left it outside the door; *I ordered breakfast at 11.30pm (by hanging the order sheet on the door) and no breakfast arrived the next morning; * the room was so noisy I couldn't sleep and I requested a room change the next day. When I called to request a late check out the phone rang and rang until I went via the swtichboard. I was charged $4 for the bell desk to look after my bags for three hours after checking out. On checking out, when I mentioned that I had not enjoyed my stay to the reception staff they gave me a blank look as if to say "whatever, what do you want me to do about it", which is far from acceptable. Generally I found the hotel to be failing on many levels. I would not recommend anyone to come here. The location is great, but there are plently of great htoels that are only blocks away and at the same price. Do not waste your money on this dump. I was sorely disappointed as I had come from the Park Hyatt in Washington DC and I had a fab stay and would recommend that hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt, not bad”
Reviews.Author: yankeesfanz
Reviews.Content: Overall, great location, good sized room, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: Karen_White
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Flairview Travel and there was unfortunately a mix up when we arrived. The reception desk were very unhelpful as were the porters and this continued to the remainder of our stay from Thursday to Monday. The walls are paper thin and we frequently heard the room next to us talking. We were even called on by a security guard to keep the noise down. My mum, sister and myself had just come back from a long day out and were hardly making any noise...but he insisted on coming into the room. If you need assistance don't expect a lot from the front desk. My sister lost her glasses in the hotel and they were extremely unhelpful. Good points: Great location, lovely relaxing lobby, quick route to the subway (you must try the Oyster Bar in the Terminal) and the guys outside getting you a taxi were great. Cocktail bar, inc service was lovely. Bad points: Rooms were pokey and the bathroom was very small. Service in all other parts of the hotel apart from the cocktail bar - terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Ted_NYC
Reviews.Content: I tend to agree with previous reviewers about this property. The location is great and service is pretty good. The property is lacking, however, in several key respects. I stayed here unexpectedly for 2 nights in April as weather prohibited me from returning to my home outside the city. I secured a reasonable corporate rate ($249 for a deluxe room) First, the rooms are older and dated. The first room I was given reeked of smoke, although it was a non-smoking room. Housekeeping sprayed some air freshener which helped. In addition, there was mildew on the ceiling of the bathroom and smudge marks on the surfaces and furniture in the room. The television was an old fashioned clunky TV (weren't all Hyatts - especially Grand Hyatts - supposed to have flat screen TVs soon?). My second room (actually checked out after one night but had to check back in due to continued bad weather) was in better shape but nothing special. The beds were comfortable in each room. Next gripe: cost of room service. A tuna sandwich, soup, and 2 small bottles of Diet Pepsi cost $63 including service, fees, etc. Even at NY prices (remember I live here) that's a rip off. Decor: Overall it's pretty icky - the lobby reminds me of an Atlantic city casino (not a good thing). I spent many nights in Hyatt hotels last year as a Diamond member. Even the most basic (ie, lower tier) Hyatt properties are nicer than this property. The location is great; everything else is lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking”
Reviews.Author: ms711
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the last review, the furniture seemed worn and dated. The room was not up my standards of what I consider being clean. With a AAA rate of $308 for Deluxe King Room, I did not expect to be placed in a room directly across from the elevator bank. And with all that being said I still would not have complained until the next morning when my husband was ironing his clothes and I was blow drying my hair and the electricity in our room went out. I contacted the front desk and was told an engineer would fix the problem. 15 minutes later still no electricity, I called again and was hung up on. I called again and another 15 minutes later the engineer finally showed up and fixed the problem. I complained to the front desk at check out and they took off $75 off the bill. That made me feel a little better, But I will probably never go back to Grand Hyatt in NY again-

Reviews.Title: “Dark Rooms dated decor but wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: roar_03
Reviews.Content: You have to pity the excellent staff at this hotel. Their good work is let down by the quality of the facilities. Every encounter with the staff was pleasant and all my requests were fulfilled. The decor was at one time excellent - 1988. The room i got was dark and the bathroom was small and smelled musty. There were no light fixtures in the room - only lamps. The room felt worn and dated. I could see the dust in the carpets around the doors. The elevators had worn call buttons and the corridors leading to the rooms, although wide were dark. I was there on a business conference. The conference facilities were very good. The staff managed food and beverage service very efficiently. The quality of the food was also quite nice. Stay here if you get a really cheap rate or your company is paying for it. There could be no complaint about the location.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel, Great location, Uneven service,”
Reviews.Author: TANSTAAFL1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in March, 2007 as part of a group; effective room rate was about $175. Our room was spacious, bedding new and comfortable, furniture upscale (if a bit dated); our friends' room (same group, same rate) was quite cramped, but with identical appointments. Freestanding vanity in bath area was too small and lacked shelves or drawers to keep toiletries handy. Room cleanliness was just average - e.g. carpet corners had accumulated dust from spot vacuuming, where a thorough cleaning would have caught this; this was an unpleasant surprise at a "flagship" property. Corridors were noisy; I had to ask a gaggle of housekeepers who congregated outside our room door (with DND sign clearly visible) to take their loud early-morning conversation elsewhere. Public areas were opulent. "Soundscape" music in main lobby masked traffic noise outside, but was sometimes overbearing in its own right. Front desk, door and concierge service was prompt and professional. Surprisingly, evening dining options in the immediate vicinity (Grand Central Station next door!) were quite limited, with Grand Central food court and upscale restaurants closing early . . . but Times Square is only a 10-minute walk or 5-minute cab ride away. At rack rate, I'd be more critical of the minor irritations with the hotel noted above; for the price paid, in Manhattan, this was a pretty good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt - would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: SY1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Room was very spacious with 2 Queen sized beds, ideal for family of 3. Although bathroom was small, it was clean and functional. Room was serviced every day and standard of cleaning was excellent. Compared with previous hotel we have stayed with in New York, this was far superior. The only thing lacking was in-room tea/coffee making facilities but I guess you can't have everything! Restaurant food was over-priced but they often are - leave the hotel there are plenty of places to eat within easy walking distance to suit all budgets. Would recommend and we will certainly book here again!

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom too small”
Reviews.Author: michelehei
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 spent four nights at the Grand Hyatt. The room was very nice and very clean as was the bathroom however the bathroom was a bit too small. There is no place to put anything...including toiletries or even if you are taking a shower there is no place to put your clean clothes. Whoever designed that bathroom didn't have a clue about functionality for the guests. The walls are paper thin so you can hear everything going on in the room next door. Anyways...that being said....the service was lacking because we did not have our room cleaned two days in a row. The first day they apologized and gave us a $100 food and beverage credit and the second time I went to the front desk at 4pm and had to have them call housekeeping to clean the room. We paid $305 a night and had two rooms so I was expecting a little bit more in the way of service. The restaurants in the hotel were absolutely ridiculously overpriced. We had tuna sandwiches and a margarita pizza appetizer for lunch and paid $126. Don't eat in the hotel. There are plenty of places right outside the hotel that are delicious and priced right. With all that being said I really liked the location of the hotel. You are right at Grand Central Station so you can hop on the subway and go anywhere. Although we found that taking a cab for the 5 of us cost almost the same as taking the subway. If we would have paid $125 through priceline like the previous person paid then I would say this place is worth it, but for $305 a night I expected a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “First time in New York”
Reviews.Author: MidTransplant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt because our daughter's school was staying there (She was with a tour group.) The Hyatt was okay - really nice beds but it was a small room - I was hoping that by joining Hyatt's Gold Passport it would get us a perk but it didn't. The hotel was nice enough for the purpose of sleeping but for eating or finding something to eat - forget it. The hotel has a mini/mini snackbar in the lobby - which was closed in the evening, soda machines and a very expensive breakfast buffet (Try $29 per person!!) We did not eat at the buffet because I did not want to shell out $150 just for breakfast for our group of 5. I wish the hotel would include a small refridgerator in the room because if you needed anything to drink or eat you had to leave the hotel. (Of course I could have paid the extra $25 for a refridgerator in my room but I was already paying $225 per night and we would just make do with the ice buckett. What I did discover on the last day was that 2 blocks south of the hotel was a very good and inexpensive restaurant called Cafe Metro (or was that Metro Cafe) either way for $3.00 you got a good hot breakfast. (To find this restaurant - exit the front lobby - turn left, at the first intersection, turn right and cross street, go about 2 short blocks and you will see Cafe Metro) I didn't have any other issues with this hotel. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable. Everything worked and there were no surprises - a short walk out the front door to Grand Central Station - I know they say there is a direct entrance to Grand Central but some of the time it was closed off. (or else we would get lost in G.C.S. and end up on the street in front anyway) I just wouldn't stay here again because of the food & beverage issue. (It is just too much running out of the hotel morning and night for juice or milk) Yes I know there was room service - but who knows what a couple of glasses of milk would cost!! If your on the business plan with food included then this would be a perfectly nice hotel to stay at, If your a family with young children - pack a cooler!!

Reviews.Title: “Gold Rated”
Reviews.Author: MartinQ
Reviews.Content: The frst time i stayed in NYC it was a very basic hostel, this time i wanted a bit more luxury. The Grand Hyatt is a great location, i found that weekends were much cheaper, than midweek - due to it being quite full of suits there on business! When you book your room, join the hotels loyalty scheme, it is feee of charge and you get a few little extras. When we arived there was a very long queue at check in as you can imagine. As i was a "loyal customer" i went to the gold check in desk meaning i didnt have to wait at all! the room was a good size, and very comfortable with 2 double beds for us - i love america for this reason! i have to say the shower was great, and the toiletries - white ginger shower gell and soap was sooo nice that i took them home with me. In all had a great stay - i would say that the hotel did cock up, when i checked in they asked for a credit card nu,mber which is common practice. i said i was paying cash and not to charge anything to that card or the card i used to make the reservation earlier that month. On checkout they charged the original card- which was'nt even mine, so my friend at home was charged for 3 nights accom. This was my only gripe. Enjoy your stay any questions just ask martin :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, large room, not so clean corridor...”
Reviews.Author: Swiss_Aloha
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative statements I was afraid of what we would have to expect, especially as we booked 7 nights at that place... First of all, the location is definitely great, it's just about an 8 min walk to Times Square and due to neighboring Grand Central Terminal it's quite easy to get coffee and donuts if one doesn't like the hotel coffee... or doesn't want to spend a fortune on room service ;-) The room was very spacious and yes, it was clean. The bathroom, as mentionend in other reviews, is absolutely the smallest bathroom I've ever seen in a GRAND Hyatt but due to the fact that one normally doesn't live in the bathroom, it was okay :-). What I disliked was the bad lighting in the room! Thanks to the big window we had enough light during the day, but in the evening I found it quite dark because there were no ceiling lights. We only had the bedside lights, a small and useless desk light and something of a floor light which was everything else but not bright. I also missed a fridge or at least a minibar... and the advertised Ipod-thing-stereo was in every brochure but not on my desk... Bed was really comfortable, 32inch TV (no flat... hm...) and the fitness center on 24floor is very good equiped! The a/c helped us to survive the cold nights, really, the heating is perfect. I would like to differ the cleanliness of the room and the rest of the hotel. It seems that housekeeping does just the rooms and nobody is responsible for the floors; especially leftovers (food) remained for hours (some for more than 24 hours) on the hallway. As a conclusion: even if the location is just perfect, I found it quite expensive (above 390/night) especially if I compare it to the Westin where we stayed 2 years ago. And, I don't know why a city hotel as this one can firm as a Grand Hyatt, this title should be reserved for the really great resorts (Kaua'i...).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: yahama88
Reviews.Content: My King room was HUGE by NYC standards and overlooked the front of Grand Central Station. They have done an excellent job of sound proofing OUTSIDE noise; however, the walls are as thin as paper, so expect to hear your neighbors quite clearly. No coffee pot in room. The bed was very comfortable with high quality linens. Also expect high quality bath products in your tiny but completely functional bath. The lobby is opulent and immediately gives you a grand Manahattan feel. The bellman was quite courteous; I found the desk staff a little unfriendly when I checked in at a late hour. Perhaps they'd had a long day, too.

Reviews.Title: “Well done”
Reviews.Author: AlastairL
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous about staying at the Hyatt after reading some of the reviews posted - however these fears were totally unfounded. We checked in late in the evening and everything was ready for us, and the process itself not particularly arduous. We had asked for a quiet room, and were given a large corner room on the 22nd floor. Gave us a view of 42nd Street below which was nice and the room was very quiet the whole stay. Furnishings in the room were fine, and the bed was very comfortable. All fittings were great, particularly the large desk and seperate armchair and table. One of the best things about our stay was the proximity to Grand Central. This was excellent for our moving about Manhattan and was a useful midway point during the day if we had been shopping (particularly after Bloomingdales) as we could drop stuff at the hotel and then move on again without having to go out of our way at all. Grand Central was excellent for grabbing a quick breakfast or supplies (eg wine or cheesecake from Juniors!) Overall our entire stay was very pleasant and helped accentuate the fantastic experience we had in our ten night stay in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey46
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just spent a "Girls Weekend" in NYC and stayed 3 nights at the Hyatt. We had a great room rate (under $200) and our room was lovely with a view of the Chrysler Bldg. We walked to Times Square nightly for shows (it's only 1 subway stop to Times Square as well from Grand Central) and thoroughly enjoyed the area. The hotel was very busy with large groups, but we had great service and really enjoyed the breafast buffet. The room seemed to have been freshly remodeled (the photos on the Hyatt website are accurate!). We had 2 double beds. The lighting in the room is dim, but that's what the bathroom is for. It's called "ambiance"! The beds were incredibly comfortable, especially after the miles of walking we did all over the city. The rooms were clean, modern, and well-appointed. I give this hotel an A+!

Reviews.Title: “Grand location, grand price, not so grand deal”
Reviews.Author: BTT
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a long weekend last month. Very good location. Literally steps from the Grand Central. However, this is the only thing "Grand" about this hotel besides it's "grand" rate starting at $350/night + ~15% tax. It doesn't even have a pool. Since it's on Park Avenue, I'd understand it belongs to one of the Park Hyatt's brand, but Grand? It's about 10-15 minutes walk and two stops on Subway from Time Square, which is where we went for the Broadway shows. Unlike Time Square, there are not many places still open after 10pm. It's an older hotel with very well maintained lobby and meeting facilities. The rooms, well, are really showing their age. The paint on the room doors start to peeling off. I intended to take a picture of the door, but forgot to do so when checking out. The King room we got is big and has modern decoration, while the bathroom is extremely small, comparable to those in 2-star motels such as Sleep Inn. We requested a quiet room which was facing inside. No view, but it is very quiet. No coffee maker in room. We got vouchers for two 12oz coffee/day at the shop in the lobby. It's really good coffee, so is the napkins.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: drink_wine
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights in February. Location is great. I had confirmed the day before arriving my request for a non-smoking room. Checked in at 7pm on a Sat night and of course there were no non-smoking rooms available. The front desk promised me that they would contact me the next day and move me to a non-smoking room. They never did. Fortunately the room did not smell of smoke. The room was clean but smallish and dark and a number of electrical outlets did not work. My view out of the window was of an exterior wall. Room was relatively quiet. Beds were too soft for my liking. With a food court and numerous restaurants around GCT, I didn't eat in any of the hotel restuarants. The front desk had perpetually long lines so I didn't attempt to get a non-smoking room. On the last day, they agreed to a late checkout of 2pm. I would probably stay there again but it's more for the location than anything else. The average daily rate was about $250/day which was fair considering it was Manhatten.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: moose4580
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt for valentine's weekend. It's just an outstanding location right above Grand Central. The service was good and the room was very nice (we were upgraded due to Gold Passport membership).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: catherineUK
Reviews.Content: stayed in feb 2007 and it was a great hotel. our room was 23rd floor (though actually, from counting the number of flights up we were, actually 14th, how does that work), with a view and a very large room with 2 large double beds. Bathroom was a bit small but fine. beds were very comfy. location was great. never got my free newspaper for being a hyatt preferred guest but did get 2 lots of coffee from the coffee stand (though 1 day it just wasn't open at all) greta price through priceline and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndyTheGameInventor
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights for the Toy Fair (a show at the Javits Center) and found the hotel very nice. This was our first time staying on the East Side. Elevators are super-fast, public areas are very nice, hotel is quiet. Our room was quite large, perfectly clean. Bathroom was nice but not quite up to luxury hotel standards. For some reason the heat woudn't turn off the first night (until I turned the heating system off). I didn't get around to complaining about it, but it just basically worked fine the rest of our stay. Hotel is a bit pricey by US, but not NY, standards. Room service menu for breakfast was jokingly expensive ($27 for pancakes, plus 18% servce charge, plus $4.75 delivery, plus NYS sales tax - come on!) Fear not - Grand Central is 3 minutes away and has a ton of places to eat. The hotel is right next to Grand Central station, with an indoor entrance to Grand Central that does close around 10 pm but the point is that even in the winter you can get to Grand Central without your coat. If you haven't seen Grand Central since the renovation 10 years ago, you haven't seen Grand Central (and you should!). There are many shops and restaurants, plus of course a subway entrance. One disadvantage, if you are going to the Javits (convention) center is that crosstown traffic in NYC is VERY bad at rush hours, so the west side hotels might be a better choice (or take the subway crosstown and then walk or cab it). Staff was generally very good, except that I had difficulty finding a bellman, and the bellman that takes your bags from the cab only goes as far as the desk, where another bellman takes it to your room (ie. two folks each wanting a tip). Doorman worked hard to get cabs, even in the blowing snow. A very nice, if somewhat pricey, hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Regency club floor is fine”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here three nights in the coldest part of the NY winter. Reception was good, and our room on the Regency Club floor was well set-up and serviced. Eating meals (except lunch) in the lounge is convenient - even if the food is mostly light. The hotel's location is superb for many of Manhattan's attractions - although Central Park, Upper East Side and the Museums are more than a walk away. A warm place to stay when NY is cool!

Reviews.Title: “Grand lobby, horrible room”
Reviews.Author: shakergrandma
Reviews.Content: When I first entered the Grand Hyatt Hotel in NYC I was very impressed. There was a beautiful waterfall, a wonderful lobby, little shops, a coffee bar and an inviting atmosphere. Also, the hotel was connected to Grand Central Station. Unfortunately, it stopped there. There were bellhops—but, I guess they were on a break, none of them offered to help with our luggage. And the coffee bar, no one to man the espresso machine either. Oh well, with a Starbucks on every corner, we decided to get coffee elsewhere. Since we were staying on points, we opted to upgrade and stay on the concierge level for a few extra points, we figured we were pretty safe—you know, a little extra TLC. No, wrong. First off, our room was the size of a walk in closet; our bathroom was so small that when trying to blow-dry my hair, I kept hitting my elbow on the door jam. And forget about taking a relaxing bath, there was mold in the corner, and random hair on the walls and floor, so I decided to shower instead. It was quite disgusting. And the beds were not that comfortable. I am very glad that we didn’t stay more than 1 night; it just might have ruined my trip! Now I’ll say something nice. They did serve Starbucks coffee and the food was pretty descent. That’s about it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Grand Central - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AJWSydney
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about this hotel having read some of the reviews but found my concerns unfounded. The location is sensational especially as Grand Central has been revamped and has excellent restaurants. The bathrooms in the hotel are small but compensated for by the lovely Portico toiletries. The rooms have been redecorated to a very acceptable standard with enormous, comfortable beds and pleasing furnishings. Don't expect much help from the staff - the front desk is extremely busy but it's so easy to find your way around the city that you probably won't need more than a street/subway map. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: trip4u22
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night in Feb 2007. The room was a little smaller than we are used to, but we didn't care since we were only there to sleep. We booked because of the location and we were very pleased. The closet was huge, bed comfortable, staff friendly, and since we named our own price on Priceline, very affordable. I would definitely recommend it for a weekend, but probably not for business or extended travel, since the room and was a bit on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central”
Reviews.Author: halldm
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Grand Hyatt in New York was a pleasent surprise compared to where we stayed at our last trip in New York. We visited for two nights arriving on 2/9/07. Check in time is not until around 3 pm. We arrived at the hotel at 9:30 am and was going to leave our bags with the bellman until we could check in and just go do some sightseeing. To our surprise, our room was ready at 9:30 am. I have taken many vacations and stayed in many hotels over the years, good and bad ones so I have learned some hard lessons and now before I travel and choose a hotel I do my research on sights such as this. I chose this hotels based on it's locations and reviews. I booked our hotel and flight together on Travelocity ($1000.00 for roundtrip airfair for 2 from Detroit, 2 nights hotel and transportation to and from airport ). Our room was an Executive Queen on the 21st floor. I could not believe how big this room was compared to other rooms in NYC, and the bathroom was not too small either. Could not hear the traffic or any noise from the street. Maid service was great. We ate in the hotel restaruant for dinner one evening and ordered calamari and lambchops. Some of the best lambchops weve ever had. Just disappointed because the dinner took an extra long time to come out and we had a show to catch. We let our waiter know our concerns about our time and he apologized letting us know he would take care of us. The manager came over and comped the entire bill for us. Then when we woke up the next morning there was an envelope slipped under our door with 2 vouchers that would comp us for breakfast in their restaurant. (which was nice considering the breakfast buffet is almost 30.00). You can't beat the location of this hotel either. It is connected to Grand Central Station, lots of restaurants and shopping. If you like oyster bars, the one in Grand Central Station is a must, cant say enough good things about it. The staff was also great at this hotel. Next time we visit NYC this will be the hotel we choose.

Reviews.Title: “absolutley perfect”
Reviews.Author: missblazyn13
Reviews.Content: We booked our weekend at the Hyatt one month before going. Priceline gave us an amazing price. When we arived the staff greeted us and were very friendly. The lobby was gorgeous. They upgraded us from an Executive Queen to a King, without us even asking. So of course, that was a big plus right from the start. When we walked into our room we were so excited. The room was clean and big, something we didn't really expect especially for NYC. Bathroom was a good size. Our view was absolutley amazing, 42nd street looks beautiful at night from 24 floors up. I couldn't have asked for anything more. We love the Hyatt and will stay there everytime we're in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine, Except For The Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: 1seattlewriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights thanks to a priceline rate of $110/night. Location is great, service was fine. Room was small, but stylish and functional for the most part. I had 2 problems with this place. 1-No ventilation in the room-kinda stuffy. Take a shower and the room stays humid for days. 2-Bedbugs. Funny, I checked this site and one person complained about bedbugs but I thought it was just some disgruntled employee. I can confirm that this is not the case. I was bitten all over my lower legs, causing severe itching and tiny red bumps (and some bleeding) for a week after I left. I understand that New York has an infestation right now, so this problem is probably not limited to the Grand Hyatt. I would've given this place 4 stars if it were'nt for these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Location saves it”
Reviews.Author: athtrasna
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through priceline for $120 a night so was pleasantly surprised when we checked in to find out we'd been given a corner room on the 26th floor. The room was huge! Massive bed (could have slept 4 very comfortably) and room was very well furnished. Bathroom was tiny (as expected in NY) but I would have loved some counter space for my stuff. No magnifying mirror either, which is unusual and made putting on makeup difficult without my glasses. I would have thought the 26th floor was high enough not to suffer from traffic noise from 42nd st outside the window but I was wrong. The traffic noise was almost as loud as if we were standing outside in it. The window wasn't double-glazed so as well as noise it let in the cold, some mornings there was solid frost on the inside of the window. The room had a/c to heat it up but it was so noisy we could only use it when we were out to heat up the room. 2 electrical sockets in the room were faulty and we didn't report them as we soon learned housekeeping took hours. We requested a sewing kit, and gave up waiting after an hour. One morning we called at 9am to mention that there were room service trays from the night before in the corridoor, they were still there when we returned at 2pm (we called again) and 5pm! These weren't our trays but the smell in the corridoor wasn't pleasant. Housekeeping was very inconsistent, the number and quality of the towels varied every day. Hubby spilt tea on the sheets one morning but they weren't changed that day. The bathroom floor wasn't mopped once during our week, we watched the bootprints add up. The other negative is that the escalator from the lobby to street level broke on Sunday night and they didn't have it fixed until very late on Wednesday night (it was still broken at 7.30pm but working at 1am when we returned). The desk staff were very helpful and the concierge made great dinner recommendations. Complimentary newspapers were delivered to your door weekdays. Having mentioned a lot of negatives, none of these are enough to stop us returning, the location beats them all hands down. All of New York was at our doorstep in Grand Central Station. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Brown”
Reviews.Author: flygirl1304
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, just between 5th and Grand Central Station. Couldn't have got any better. Hotel is huge, and very brown, glass outside is brown,lobby is brown, lifts are brown, carpets are brown, rooms are brown, the list goes on!! However the rooms are big for New York, have stayed at The Time Hotel and Marriot before and our room was twice the size, really pleased to see a bath!! Bed was amazingly comfortable and great cable. Only had a couple of negatives, concierge always seemed to busy to help. They were always on the phone and it took ages to get there attention. Other thing was having to pay $2 per bag for storage after we had checked out (our flight home wasn't until the evening) Slightly disappointing after paying for a room for 4 nights. Left a sour taste. The other thing was reception would not change anymore than $200 travellers check (and just gave me two $100 bills). However I would recommend this hotel on location and bedrooms alone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with problems”
Reviews.Author: merrytraveler5
Reviews.Content: There are many great things about this hotel...location, accommodating staff, pleasant lobby with amazing water feature; and some real problems...we were moved from our room because of "pipe" problems; the second, "an upgrade" was a handicapped accessible ADA approved room that hadn't been thoroughly cleaned and fixtures were loose on the walls. No hot water the next morning, so we finally got a third room in 2 days; no hot water the second morning either. To ease the pain, staff gave us food vouchers but that did not compensate; the convenience vs. price ratio was off the chart, and we would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not quite a Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: hjmover
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my stay at the Grand Hyatt. I got the room for $110.00 plus tax and fees On Priceline. It is a very good deal for this property but I do wonder how this hotel got the Grand Hyatt name. It's a nice hotel but nothing like the Hyatt Grand Campions or the Grand Hyatt on Kauai. I called a day earlier to request room 2235 based on an earlier review I read on [--]. Also I gave my Gold Hyatt passport number. The clerk was very kind and mentioned I would get points for incidentals only. There was no mention of Priceline I arrived at 10:30 AM for my two night stay and the clerk said Room 2235 was blocked for me but was not clean. I signed my folio were I saw the Priceline prepay price of $251.00. Again, Priceline was never mentioned. i was pleased with my bid after seeing the prepay price since my $110.00 bid came out to $266 that included tax and service charge for my two nights stay. The clerk offered to check me in and told me to place my luggage with the bellman. I was told to come back in a few hours. That was fine with me since I had plans to visit some friends. I returned at 9:30 PM and the clerk said my room was 2236. When I balked anf said I reserved 2235 she apologized and said an error must have occurred. I took 2235 and went to the large bank of elevators after picking up my luggage from the bell capitan. When I got to the room, which was across from the ice and soda machines, I opened the door to an unclean room. Back I went to the desk for a new room assignment. After a bit of going back and forth I got room 2335. That room was incredibly spacious with a sitting area, large king size bed, a walk in closet, and decent size tv. There was no mini-bar or coffee maker. Furniture blocks the bed from the sitting area and provides for spacious accomodations. I think the 35 - 41 rooms are some of the largest so I would recommend trying to get those. Remember the room may be large but the bathroom is small. Really, really small. Paramount small. You get a sink, toilet, and bathtub/shower. There is barely room to move around and forget about storing toiletries since there is no counter space, The Hyatt should be ashamed of the bathrooms. Products in the bathroom were not replished - half a shampoo bottle, no new soap, but its hard to complain if that was the worst of it all. I found the bed to be very comfortable, the tv full of enough channels, the sheets of good quality, and the towels abit thin. Finally, I got a NYTimes every day by my door. The negatives about this hotel: impersonal service thin bath towels no coffee maker no mini bar two dollar charge to store luggage ten dollar charge for wireless internet small,small, small bathroom there are many pluses my room was large it was quiet shower had good hot water and lots of pressure nice beds and comfortable pillows fast elevators good location - close to times square and in grand central station great price for NYC if you luck out like I did and land the $110 special on Priceline. I did not use the healthclub since this was such a busy trip for me nor did I use room service. There are plenty of deli's and things nearby and in Grand Central Station. There is a great bagel place in Grand Central and tons of small deli's for breakfast and sandwiches. I was happy with my stay and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NaomiSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Grand Hyatt for New Year and had a lovely stay. The room was clean and comfortable and we actually had a fairly good view from our window! The buffet breakfast was amazing, a really good selection of fruit, yoghurt, cereals, cold meats and cheeses, cooked breakfasts, cakes and pastries, pancakes and omlettes. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The hotel is also in an excellent location, it's very easy to walk to many of the sites or you can just jump on the tube from Grand Central Station which is right next door to the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel and we would stay here again if we went back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: peterfurness
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel. Stunning grandure but not snobby. Very helpful staff. Rooms very well kept and cleaned everyday. Brilliant central location. Reasonable prices for a Manhattan hotel. I would recommend this place to anyone and will definately return asap!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Birgy
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through a travel agent who told us that this was a four star hotel and rated very well. I did my research and checked trip advisor to find majority of the reports to be negative. Well im glad to stay our stay was great! The room was a good size, two double beds and a good sized bathroom, definitley nothing to complain about. The towels were changed daily and toiletries were updated daily also. The only complaint i had, minor as it was, was that having a room with an adjoining door is not good. We could hear everything that went on next door and luckily for us the people were realtively quite, so imagine if they were people who stayed up all night watching tv and talking, we would have had not sleep. So overall i would recommend the Hyatt no worries. Clean, neat and spacious enough for a family of two adults and two kids, and that was just a standard room. A good place to eat was just around the corner on Madison called Burger Heaven. Great for breakfast and cheap too. the Pershing Cafe was recommended by many, but it may serve good food, but its not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom MOLD!”
Reviews.Author: CTTravelman
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 1/20/07 -- it needs another makeover!!! My room was updated but the bathroom had Black MOLD on the ceiling, shower tiles, and door frame!! An exhaust fan needed in the bathroom. The bed sheet felt like sandpaper, the heat shut off in the middle of the night so that the room was cold! No internet access in the room -- go figure! Plus, a mirror is needed someplace near the bed so one person can get dressed while the other is in the shower! This is a 4 star hotel??? I doubt it! More like a low 3 star -- the only saving grace is the location!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but definitely not luxury”
Reviews.Author: al100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend break to NYC and found it to be generally OK, but if you are after somewhere even slightly impressive or with a hint of luxury then this is not the place. As you enter the lobby it looks very impressive - it's huge with cascading water-features and high high ceilings but on closer inspection everything looks rather tired and worn. The tired theme continues throughout the hotel really, from the dented elevators to the chipped paintwork on the door of every room, to the antique shower in your room. You get the sense that this place used to be really nice, about 20 years ago, but no one can be bothered to even give it a lick of paint. For Hyatt Hotels this surely must be a flagship - I mean it's their huge hotel in NYC, but they've seemingly forgotten about it. Staff are friendly, the room was much much bigger than expected (and bathroom much smaller), the room decor is OK and the bed extremely comfortable. However the room temperature controls didn't work and there were a few things missing - room service menu, tea/coffee maker, mini-bar. A bit odd for this class of hotel. Oh and the hotel bar closes at 1am. Location is the best thing - you're right in the middle of where you want to be, but then again there are a number of large hotels in NYC that can boast that. The hotel always seems to be absolutely teeming with people so I don't expect it'll get the facelift it desperately needs in the near future judging by the amount of business it gets. If you get a good deal then try it, if you don't then go elsewhere, there's a lot to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Pt_Fwd
Reviews.Content: This is an upscale hotel with the main benefit being its location -- right next to Grand Central in Mid-Town. A couple of specifics that may be helpful. 1. Internet connection is by wireless only. 2. If the check in/out line for the counter is long, Hyatt has a nice option of checking yourself in/out using several kiosks scattered along the lobby. I used this for the first time during this stay and I was able to generate my key card (without standing in line) in about 2 minutes. I was also able to check out quickly and print out my receipt without any problems. 3. There's a counter right in front of the escalators that have a PC & printer that allows one to check into a flight on-line and print out the boarding pass before getting to the airport. 4. Breakfast buffet at this hotel is quite good, but pricey by any standard -- about $30 plus tip. 5. Taxi ride from JFK is a flat fee of $45. Make sure they charge you this rate and not use the meter since the distance + traffic could make that price much higher.

Reviews.Title: “not what I expected from a luxury hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jennesy
Reviews.Content: The location is good, but that's about it. You're literally in Grand Central Station, so there are tons of restaurants, bakeries, and a Rite Aid right there. Plus you don't even need to go outside to get the subway. Our room had a very awkward lay-out, the sitting area in our deluxe king room was located behind the television. The lighting was terrible, the only lights in the room were the 2 bedside lamps and a paper-covered lantern in the corner of the sitting area. There was no desk lamp, which is odd, since the website says that they offer "enhanced workspace lighting". No overhead light, either. There's no coffee pot in the room but there is a kiosk downstairs where you can get free coffee or tea in the morning. Our room didn't have any literature on hotel amenities, NYC events, etc., not even a room service menu. Drinks at the bar were overpriced - this is NYC, I know, but it was excessive - and the bar wasn't that great to begin with. Hyatt advertises special iPod stereos, we just had a regular clock radio in our room. The window was very drafty and didn't seem to close properly. The room was extremely dry and always either too hot or too cold, the thermostat didn't seem to work properly. There were scuff marks on the walls and wallpaper was peeling in some spots. We were told that since I'm a Gold Passport member, we would get a free NYT delivered every day. Instead, I had to call the front desk and practically beg for a paper. I was told that since we didn't get one for the first 2 days of our stay we would get one on Sat. and Sun. even though they normally don't deliver on weekends...but we never got the weekend paper. One of the benefits of being a Gold Passport member is a late check-out, we were not allowed to check out late because the hotel was booked for the next day. The front desk staff was very unresponsive. I called the desk around 6pm and it took about 5 minutes for someone to actually answer the phone - I stopped counting after 30+ rings on my first phone call. The housekeeping staff was very pleasant, but the concierge was unhelpful. I had a stamped envelope that just needed to be dropped in the mail, but they wouldn't take it. They told me that I had to go to the business center on the other side of the hotel to mail it. The gym was nice and looked like it was recently renovated. I would *NOT* pay full price for this hotel. Only stay here if you need to be right next to GCT or if you get it on Priceline. I wouldn't pay more than $100/night to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: mseibert
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels the wife and I have ever stayed at. The location was perfect. We arrived early and was given a room early, right around noon. Very friendly staff. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, service, and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MLD31
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive after reading the reviews. I was pleasantly surprised by how awesome this Hyatt really is. To start, you cannot find a better located midtown hotel for the quality. It is next door to Grand Central, literally just steps!!! You can easily walk to Times Square and 5th Ave. Madison Ave is also manageable walking distance. If not, you can take the subway to wherever you go. Subway station is outside the hotel door!!! This hotel is always crowded. HOWEVER the staff is amazing for the amount of people they have to deal with on a daily basis. The staff at the bell desk is so helpful. The lobby is breathtaking, MUCH better than the Waldorf! I went by myself and stayed in a room with a queen bed. I found the room to be spacious for NYC standards. If you want to talk "small", try the W on Lexington. Bathroom is small but totally adequate. If you want a huge bathroom, go to Vegas and stay at the Venetian. The bed, sheets, pillows, and furniture in the room are very comfortable. For a hotel to be in Grand Central, I find it to be very quiet. I have had my best nights sleep in NYC EVER here!!!!! Now the BEST part of this hotel (besides the FREE coffee in the morning which was great!) is that you can actually PRINT your boarding pass in the lobby. Saves plenty of time for me at JFK. Hyatt really tries to cater to its customers. So if you want to get a great place when you go visit this great city, stay here and make Hyatt your hotel of choice. I did!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with unhelpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: gazeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt 4th Jan for 4 nights, on arriving at the hotel the staff seemed friendly and we checked in quickly. We had a lovely room on the 18th floor with a good view of Park Avenue. Our friends stayed on the same floor but there room was smaller and they didn't have a view or a bath just a shower. The hotel was in a very good location and we would definitely stay there again, the only problem was the staff, they were extremely unhelpful and rude, the concierge was rubbish and only recommend very expensive restaurants and hairdressers and made you feel like you were putting them out if you asked for there help. The bell staff were also rude. The hotel bar was very very expensive too.

Reviews.Title: “A near-perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: dougie-w
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Grand Hyatt, despite a couple of issues. The location is perfect, not far from Times Square and 5th Ave., next-door to Grand Central Station, and across the street from a stop for express buses to JFK and LaGuardia. At check-in, there was no mention of the fact that we had booked the room through Priceline, and I was granted my requests for a king-size bed and a non-smoking room. I was pleasantly surprised that we were on a high floor, and the fact that we were on the 24th floor had an advantage in that it's a floor serviced by all the elevators: those for the higher floors as well as those for the lower ones. We enjoyed the room's contemporary decor, and it was very clean. The bed was also quite comfortable. One problem was that our room adjoined with the next one, and the doors were not sound-proofed. There appeared to be several high school groups staying in the hotel, and the students staying in the room next to ours were arguing, talking loudly and squealing past midnight. We heard it all much too clearly and called the front desk to complain. The other problem was with the climate control in the room. We stayed during a January warm spell, and we couldn't get the room to cool down our first night. It was as if only the heat was working. But when the maid made up the room, she apparently noticed that we had the fan going full tilt and had opened the window, because when we returned things seemed to be fixed, and the air conditioning was working our second night. The positives far outweighed the negatives, and I hope to stay at the Grand Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JUSTINELOVESCATS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The staff are friendly enough and were always happy to help. Our room was on the 19th floor and was of an OK size. The bathroom was a little gruby and I dont think they vacumed very often. I requested a quiet room and got exactly that apart from when a teenange dancing convention arrived for the weekend ( I am sure they were all on our floor) still this did not dampen our spirits as we were so tired from the sighs and shopping to notice much. We did not eat in the hotel as it was much more fun looking around for somewhere to eat. We did however find a great cafe ( I think its called Pershing Square) just under the Park Ave bridge accross the road from the hotel which did a great breakfast. We did have coctails in the hotel bar which seemed expensive at $14 each but you would only need a couple as they were very strong!! All in all we had a great time at this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone for location alone. My one tip would be to go to the Top of The Rock instead of the empire state. I have been to New york before and went up the empire state building which took about 2 hours in line! This time i tried the top of the rock and I was at the top within 5 minutes of buying my ticket!!! I could not believe the views, they were even better than the empire state building. Granted i went on a very cold and windy day and there were only 2 other people up there with me but I never saw a line all week.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: RitaMcCabe
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at the Grand Hyatt on 42nd Street New York. We booked 2 rooms with our Travel Agent who assured us this was one of the "better" Hotels in New York. Cannot say I would agree with them. The Lobby is beautiful, that's the only part of the Hotel which is. The rooms King Doubles were small and cramped, you could hear complete conversations of the people in the next room. You could hear their shower and toilet at all hours. The bathroom has got to be the smallest we have ever experienced in all our travels. The decor was dreadful with damp stains on the walls. No tea/coffee making facilities. No bathrobes. One of the sheets on the bed actually had a hole in it. Food and beverage prices were outragous. $15+tax+tip for a glass of white wine, $8+tax+tip for a small beer. Stayed at the Hyatt in Boston in Dec 2005. Supposed to be a lessar * rating than the Hyatt New York but in our opinion a far superior hotel. Would never stay at a Hyatt Hotel again after this and would not recommend it for even 1 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, watch your stuff though!”
Reviews.Author: Adam1982
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short break in NYC, checked in on 3rd Jan 07, arriving around midday, and therefore expected to have to wait for our room. It came as a plesent surprise that our room was ready. Overall we found the location very usefull espically when fifth ave is a 5min walk from the front door. The room we had, high up on the 21st floor, had reasonable views to the west on 42nd street, was clean, spacious and had a very comfy king-sized bed. Bathroom served it's purpose well, although there was a tiny bit of paint that was required in one of the corners on the ceiling (not really a major issue then!) One problem we did have was with the adjoining room, as our "neighbour" was very loud, not only on the phone, but also with his snoring. However the adjoining rooms, if you have children, are a godsend! We once had an issue with the small safe in the room not letting us in, yet that was quickly sorted by a delicate feminine touch by one of the members of staff, much to the amusement of her male collegues, my partner and I! I used the fitness center a few times and it again ticked all the right buttons, with the exception of only having one conventional cycling machine, yet lots of treadmills, although would advise against going at very early each day as that tended to be when the middle-aged guests were there taking up all the equipment. Biggest problem was with the trust concerning housekeeping, where my girlfriend had bought some clothing, the bag had fallen on the floor and we had forgotton to pick it up, and cutting a long story short it went missing from the room, we eventually recieved the money for the item, but had to work harder than we should have, having been offered vouchers for food in the hotel, yet we had eaten and it was our last night. Having been initally told they were not a bank, and couldn't give us the cash, after we suggested a taxi/car back to JFK, we were told cash would be dropped off to our room, much to our confusion yet happy to have the issue resolved.

Reviews.Title: “3Cs - Cozy, clean and convenience!”
Reviews.Author: wingkie
Reviews.Content: I got the bid from priceline for $109/night. Grand Hyatt is way better than my expectation, not only they provide what I've asked for (non-smoking room and king bed), they upgraded me to a bigger room on 30th floor. I don't think they have any bias to priceline customers in this case. Room is clean and nice, very comfortable linens. Smooth and friendly check-in, check-out services. My only complain is housekeeping is not doing much of good work by filling shampoo, conditioner, or shower cap. But as soon as I called the front desk , they send someone to bring them up. Oh, gotta check out their 'Stay-Fit' fitness center on the top floor, up-to-dated equipments. Great locations with subway downstairs and convenience store across the street. I give two thumbs up to Grand Hyatt, keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect ANY customer service, much less a crib for a toddler.”
Reviews.Author: parisc3
Reviews.Content: We brought our 20 month old daughter into the city for a night to check out all the holiday decorations. I'm a gold passport member and used Hyatt's e-concierge to book a crib one week prior to our arrival. Upon check-in @ 5:30pm, I confirmed the crib and was told that it was not yet in the room but would be sent up shortly. We left the room at 6pm and the crib had not been delivered but I assumed it would be there upon our return. At 8pm, we returned to our room and there was no crib in sight. I immediately called housekeeping and explained the situation since I had a 20 month old in desparate need of sleep. I was told it would be delivered right away. At 8:30pm, there was still no crib and I called housekeeping again. This time, I was told that they were very busy and would try to get someone up with it. At 8:50pm, still without a crib and an exhausted baby, I called to speak with the hotel manager on duty who apologized and said he would call housekeeping right away himself. Finally, at 9:50 - more the four hours after check-in, an hour after speaking with the general manager, and a total of three pleading phone calls later - a crib was delivered. This was completely unacceptable! It should have been delivered hours earlier! We travel often and never have I experienced such problems. If the crib is not waiting in the room upon our arrival, I have never waited any more than 10 minutes for it to be delivered. The Grand Hyatt NY failed completely in the customer service department and I doubt I'll stay at a Hyatt in the future as a result of this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Rossichick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt over Christmas. We loved it, we arrived early and checked in using the automated kiosks in the lobby. This was great and no hassle at all. Our room was on the 26th floor facing the Chrysler Building which was fantastic and the room itself was clean and just what we needed as a base to explore the city. This is the best way to treat your stay, your hotel room is somewhere to sleep and that's about it, so as long as it's clean that is sufficient! We never eat in the hotels we stay at in New York there is just no point as there is so much choice throughout the city and always local to where you are. The location of the Hyatt is great as you are central to everything and can jump in a cab easily for uptown or downtown. We checked out using the automated kiosk once again and found it simple to use. Having stayed at many hotels in New York, we would definately stay at the Hyatt again and recommend it, we loved it!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location but lousy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pamperedtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April 2003, but I think not much has changed since. If not for the location I would never stay here again. You're basically paying for the location as it's situated right in the heart of the city. The room we had was simply dowdy, ugly, run down and in need of refurnishing. Our package comes with buffet breakfast. The selection and quality of food were fantastic. The staff were proactive and the service was very good. That's the only good thing I can say about this hotel. If you want location, I'd say go for other hotels in a similar area. This one is simply a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Ain't so Grand - Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: YPAnow_dot_com
Reviews.Content: One stays at a particular chain because of supposed consistency. Hyatt is known for better than average service...and at a hotel...it's mostly about service. This hotel's management can't even SPELL "Service". I won't bore you with the deails but if you expect even a low level of service and guest satisfaction....you won't find it here. Oh...and then would you believe $75 for room service eggs benedict, juice, coffee? $9 for a bottle of water? Call to have you room cleaned and it won't be cleaned? Shower curtains that are filthy and stink... This place has a great location but if you expect service....you shouldn't even stay here if it was complimentary! I won't. Room are small but nicely decorated. This place is simply very poorly managed....if you could it "managed" at all!

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: Symbill
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend in this hotel and was somewhat disappointed. Very small bathroom as other reviewers have noted, with no ventilation and all the signs of damgae from humidity (mold on the shower curtain, peeling paint on the wall) and this in an upgraded room. Would I stay again -NO - there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Again”
Reviews.Author: motheroftow
Reviews.Content: We booked our flight to coincide with a reasonable check in time, after 3p.m. We did not get into our rooms until close to 7 p.m. We booked 2 rooms, got into one. Didn't see the other room being cleaned, so I called housekeeping. They said the rooms were cleared and ready by 4p.m. I WAS FURIOUS! The manager told us the previous people there were checking out late, and they were being charged for 1/2 day more, and charging US AS WELL!!! We went last year, when the transit strike happened. We had better service then, than we did this time around. Housekeeping was great and very patient with us. The room service...forget it! $35 for a kids meal with a drink. By the time they charge per person, delivery, etc....And we are on vacation not thinking about the food part of it, but this was ridiculous. Our bathroom was cleaned daily, but the fixtures were all falling apart! Mold, broken tile behind the toilet. The bathtub drain was pulled out and not functioning. The Hyatt is basically a pig with some lipstick slapped on it. Do yourself a favor, and go to a more reasonable hotel that is fixed and not moldy.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt did right by us, again!”
Reviews.Author: Voyagereuse
Reviews.Content: Staying anywhere in New York is all about expectations. The city is like no other in the world, and neither are the hotels because the cost of real estate is so high. (Want sunken tubs? Try Vegas or the Poconos, bathrooms in NYC are functional and meant for business.) For posh decor and design with a touch of luxury, then 5* hotels are for you. They include The Ritz Carlton, Trump Tower, Mandarin Oriental, and arguably The Palace and Four Seasons. There are several 4* showhorse hotels that wannabe 5* so they try hard. They include The Intercontinental the Barclay, the Michelangelo, The Carlton, and The Plaza Athenee. Then there are the 4* workhorse hotels. The ones designed for business travelers looking for a nice place to stay in New York convenient to transportation and featuring business amenities. The most well known of these are the Sofitel and NY Hilton and Towers. But The Grand Hyatt is another. I like, I mean Sally Field reaaally like, the Grand Hyatt. Because it is geared towards business travel, weekends are often discounted. And I love a bargain. We were able to snag two rooms on the very busy 12/9/06 "blackout" weekend for $200 a room. We checked in at 10:30 a.m. That's correct, a.m.! We got two rooms with king beds. Very clean, very comfortable. The rooms look exactly like the photos on the hotel's Web site. Despite the hotel being very full, we never heard a peep all night. And the bed was almost too comfortable to leave. If you want a posh-type hotel this would not be for you. But for a comfortable, convenient, often-discounted 4* stay, right next door to Grand Central Terminal, this is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: shall13
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from NYC. Due to the time of year (the holiday season) - we had a hard time finding a room in our price range for the weekend. We originally booked the Hotel Wolcott (still $260/night - ouch) since we wanted to save some money for shopping - but a week before we left I read on this site some reviews on it that included bed bugs... so in a scramble I started trying to find another hotel room. So I tried Priceline - and named an offer for four star hotels at $250/night (this same offer did not work earlier that month - but I thought I'd try it anyway) and it was accepted by the Grand Hyatt.
