We were so happy to be paying less than our budget hotel and to be bed bug free. The location was awesome. It's right beside Grand Central which made getting to places sooo easy. We took the subway to and from dinner and down to Soho for shopping. The valet service was easy getting in and out - although pricey at almost $50 per night. We requested a non-smoking room in a quiet location. They put us near the end of the hall on the 26th floor - and it was quiet as promised. We didn't hear any street noise or anything which is amazing for New York. We had two double beds and the room was perfect for two people - but the size of the bathroom and the room would probably be uncomfortable for more than two (which I assume was the case for some of the reviewers on this site). Everything was very clean in the room although the hallway carpet was sort of dingy. Our only complaint about the room is that the heat/air unit was pretty weak - we turned the thermostat down to 49 trying to get it to pump some cool air - but ended up having to open the window to cool it down. If your feet cannot take you any further at night - do like we did and eat at the bar at the Commodore Grill in the hotel one night. Although very expensive ($20 for a burger) - the bar staff was very friendly and full of useful information. They even gave us vouchers for the full breakfast at the hotel the next morning ($35 each value) which was sooo nice and very appreciated. Overall great choice for a hotel - we would definitely stay here again - especially for the priceline price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,”
Reviews.Author: lavar2
Reviews.Content: We were guests are your fabulous facility the first part of December. The accommodations were great as well as the food. The concierge henry was very nice with us and location was wonderful. Everyone was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A big let down”
Reviews.Author: AllisonWonderland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt as the last stop of our honeymoon. Having spent 2 weeks prior in fantastic hotels on the west coast we were looking forward to staying at the Hyatt (which was about 3 times the price as any other hotel we'd been in). At first sight the Hyatt is impressive with a busy lobby full of christmas decorations however this luxury was not reflected in the rooms. Firstly, we arrived in the early hours of the morning due to a cancelled flight - I rang them to let them know that we would be this late. When we checked into our double room we found ourselves in a twin room - not so good for a honeymoon couple! I rang reception to ask if we could change to a room with a larger bed and were told they would ring us back - which they didn't. I went down to the lobby to ask and was told there was no further availability but to check again in the morning. When I went back to the room we realised we were also in a smoking room, despite all of our booking information requesting a non-smoking room. In the morning I requested a room change and was given another room - this time it was non-smoking but was still a twin. The rooms have minimal amenities (i.e. A TV, a closet, a safe, some toiletries) and there was mould in the bathroom, ingrained dirt in the tiny bath, and loose light fittings in the bedroom (see photos). We paid an awful lot of money to stay at this hotel (over £300 per night) and, whilst I am aware a good proportion of that money was because it was New York and it was Christmastime, I still think that the price was extortionate for what amounted to a room which wouldn't look out of place in a cheap B&B (and there are a lot of hotels available in New York for the same price which would have been far better value for money). On the plus side, most of the staff were reasonably friendly and knowledgeable, the location is fairly good for shopping etc, and there is a shuttle bus which goes from a stop just outside Grand Central to JFK airport every 20 minutes. I think the Hyatt is in real need of a makeover and it would be nice if they spent as much attention on their rooms as they do on their lobby - having said that, the hotel was very busy so I guess they don't really feel like they need to make the effort. I personally wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone unless they had money to waste.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: SusaB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt from November 24 to November 27 (3 nights) and we were totally pleased with our whole experience. I got the hotel through Priceline and after reading some reviews I was a bit nervous about the hotel. We have stayed in a variety of hotels in NYC, including the Plaza, New York Palace, Hilton (Avenue of Americas), Parker Meridien, and the Drake Swissotel. The Hyatt ranks right up there as among the best. I have also stayed in the Hudson for business (great location, teeny tiny room). Prior to our arrival, I called and asked for a nonsmoking room and I also gave my Hyatt gold passport number even though I know no points are given for Priceline bookings. When we checked in, we were assigned a Queen size bed, and when we asked for a King Size bed, we were switched to an Executive King room, a bigger room than the original Queen Deluxe we were assigned. The room was big, nicely appointed, and had a large walk in closet. As some have reported, the bathroom was a little small, but that was not a problem. One night the sink drain would not open up and we called housekeeping and someone came up immediately to fix it. I also asked for another bath towel and when we returned that night, we found additional towels on the bed. The lobby is beautiful, the elevators are fast, and the location can't be beat. This is our first time being so close to Grand Central and that was really nice as we could use the shuttle to Times Square and/or walk. For those who complain there is no coffee maker, that seems like a strange complaint as most upscale hotels do not provide coffeemakers. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone, whether traveling for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt Grand Location”
Reviews.Author: kevforfun
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location next to Grand Central station, walking distance to Times Square and the theater district, easy to get a cab or take the subway. Storage of bags is $2 after checkout, which is convenient when your train home leaves from Grand Central. The room was large for NYC, clean, queen bed comfortable and the elevators were fast. Iron and ironing board new. safe. clockradio with CD player. TV. Wireless internet access is $10 a day through T-mobile. My wife and I never ate or drank in the hotel restaurants so I have no opinion . Room service is available. Starbucks around the corner. Grand Central has a gourmet grocery store next door . Booked through Priceline. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: dmkhowell
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 13-year-old daughter, and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt from November 22 through 26 for our Thanksgiving trip. After reading the many negative reviews on this site, I was very nervous about what we would find when we arrived. As recommended in a forum discussion on this website, I took the precaution of calling the general manager a few weeks before we went to tell him of our trepidation after reading negative reviews online, and he assured me he would handle any problems if we were not satisfied upon arrival. I'm happy to report that contacting him was not necessary. Our Deluxe King room (we had booked a regular guest room) was more than adequate -- lots of square footage for our luggage (and purchases!), and a huge walk-in closet with tons of hangers, and even an ironing board and iron! The bathroom was typical of an older hotel -- not the endless expanse of marble and granite that you may find in newer hotels, but certainly adequate -- and much larger than a cruise-ship bathroom, as one unhappy reviewer stated! I can only imagine that people who pay full price for this hotel may be disappointed. But with all the avenues available for finding a reduced rate, there's really no reason to pay full price. The lobby was beautifully decorated for the holidays, we were warmly greeted at check-in (no lines!), and check-out via voice mail (just one of several options) couldn't have been simpler. Best of all, the location is absolutely unbeatable. Having its own underground entrance to Grand Central Terminal makes this hotel ideal for any traveler who intends to use the subway. We encountered some very inclement weather, and this feature allowed us to move around the city without any trouble at all. Once the weather cleared, we walked several times to Times Square, the Empire State Building, and even the Upper East Side. The doormen are wonderful, cabs are plentiful, and yes, the elevators are incredibly fast. We all agreed our hotel was perfect for our needs, and we would recommend it to anyone -- especially if they were willing to take the trouble to find a reduced rate!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Gaelicman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt on our honeymoon for 5 nights in early November. As we were going to be late arrivals at the hotel, arriving at approx. 1 a.m. in the morning I called the hotel to say that we would not be checking in until 1 or 2 a.m. on our first night. However on ariving at the hotel exhausted after a 6 hour flight we were told the hotel had double booked by 30 rooms. We had two options at 2 o'clock in the morning, 1. sleep on a pull out bed in the living room of a suite or go to another hotel. We chose the other hotel but that invloved getting another taxi to another hotel a couple of blocks away in the rain. On our return to the hotel the next morning to check in we had to wait nearly 3 hours to get our room. We were not at all impressed. We were given breakfast vouchers for the remainders of our stay and although the staff did seem to try their best to help us, their efforts did not impress us. The room supposedly specially picked for us was small and very basic. The only thing this hotel has going for it is its central location. I would definitely not spend over $400 on one of their rooms again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Convenient, Good for being Discreet”
Reviews.Author: gypsy23
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this for someone that is not going to be in their room most of the time. I was there for a trade show at the Javits center and it was perfect for a business trip; convenient location. Service is what you would expect of a 1,000+ room hotel. Great conference and meeting space; love the ballroom. GREAT COFFEE--Illy. I stayed in a Deluxe King and the space was great for New York. Linens and bath amenities are average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SLIKWILL
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel! My wife went last year and had a great experience. We didn't eat at the hotel, so I can't say anything about the restaurants. The rooms were very clean, smelled great and were decorated very well. The location is prime. The second day we went, the transit strike took place. We could walk to everything. Also, being connected to Grand Central Station, gave us great dining options. The hotel treated us great, even as the strike negotiations were happening in their facilities, they made every effort to accomodate our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money... avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: stephantravel
Reviews.Content: While I got a "decent" deal from priceline (decent by NY standards) for this hotel (USD 300 a night) while the hotel's quote was 400-500 USD, it still wasnt worth the money. It would not have been much different staying in a 3 star for less. First of all, the hotel is derelict and badly in need of refurbishment. The room was like a shoebox (with the door giving directly onto the room - which increases your exposure to the corridor noise) and the bathroom small. The window was small and there was no minibar - very surprising for a hotel like this one. Worst of all, the room was dirty (see attached photos). In addition, they charge you $2 per piece of luggage you want to leave with them after checking out... why that? I have never seen that before. This should clearly be included in the price like in any normal and decent hotel. The location is one of the few strengths of the hotel - but then there are many others in good locations too. The service was ok - no major problems on that front and that's obviously important. But do go elsewhere if you can, unless you get a great deal for the hotel, which may be possible depending on the season.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel -- But It Is What It Is”
Reviews.Author: rwoody
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly fine hotel in a very convenient location. Some of the negative reviews here seem to be from people who somehow expect a huge business/convention-oriented Hyatt to be a five-star establishment with a high level of personal service. If that's important to you, then you need to find a nice upscale boutique elsewhere, but if you just want a clean, comfortable reasonably sized hotel room with the usual amenities (though admittedly no in-room coffee) this will do just fine. While this is not my favorite NY neighborhood, the transit connections just next door at Grand Central Station make it easy to get just about anywhere in Manhattan and beyond via subway -- you'll save on cab fares. Check-in and check-out were quick and painless. Can't comment on the fitness facilities or restaurants as I didn't try them. However, if you don't like the hotel restaurant offerings, there is no shortage of breakfast and lunch places in the neighborhood, though I might venture a little further afield for dinner. The area is bustling because of its proximity to Grand Central, but I heard no street noise at all from my 20th floor room. Again, you have to understand what sort of hotel this is, but if you're OK with that I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Out of date.......”
Reviews.Author: bckrSTHLM
Reviews.Content: GREAT LOCATION! Tacky lobby, crappy rooms, digusting bathrooms........ far too expensive. Out of date.......... however.....GREAT LOCATION! The Hyatt should have a total makeover to come up to todays standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: LeoLion69
Reviews.Content: Just back from our stay in New York at the Grand Hyatt. As like a lot of reviewers I began to wonder if this place would be a mistake, but was very relieved to find it to be a great place to stay. The lobby is magnificent with a beautiful granite waterfall greeting you upon entering the hotel. Very upscale and perfectly decorated. Check-in was a breeze, even with our Trainee Desk Clerk, who was very polite and efficient. We stayed in a Lexington Suite which we booked directly on the hotel's website for $329 per night under the Senior Citizen Discount rate. Our room was 2550 and I would highly recommend requesting this room, or similar number, if you love a quiet room. This is it! During our four night stay we only hear noise two nights and those were sirens one evening and some type of beeping noise from a truck backing up on the street below. Other than that the windows did an excellent job soundproofing the room. We didn't hear street noise but as soon as the windows were openend you could really appreciate how quiet the room was with them shut. I really was amazed and had expected to be kept awake with street noise. Pleasant surprise! Lexington Suite has two seperate rooms. One sitting room which was on the small side, but held a loveseat sofa, table, desk with nice ergonomic desk chair, dresser, and flat screen TV. The closet was in this room as well. A small hall lead to the bedroom which was located far away enough from the room entrance that we heard absolutely no noise from the hall which was another plus. The bedroom had a wonderfully comfortable King size bed, two granite nightstands, a chair with ottoman, another dresser with a flat screen TV. The suite decor was very stylish and up-to-date. Carpet looked new as did the bedding and furniture. My only small complaint was the lighting as there really was no good reading light in the evening from the lamps in the room, other than lying in the bed. However, we came in late enough each evening that all we did was crawl into bed. As stated hundreds of times the bathroom is small. Smaller than any bathroom I've had on a cruise ship, and that's telling you something if you know what that's like. The shower was decent sized and tiled with trendy granite slabs. The sink was also granite. There is basically no room on the vanity, however, but there are wall mounted shelves to use. I just took all the toiletries off the wall shelves and then used the shelves for our toiletries instead which worked fine. Housekeeping could use a bit more training as the toilet wasn't cleaned two different days and I don't think the floor was ever mopped while we were there. One day the maid took all the supplied toiletries from the room and didn't replace them. If anything the bathrooms should always be cleaned completely every day as that tends to disgust me if not done. Otherwise the room itself was clean and comfortable. And like other reviewers I will say that the location is superb. Room service prices will make you laugh, if not from shock at the prices. Basic breakfast items priced well over $20. There are all kinds of small cafe type and deli type places to grab something to eat at a fraction of the cost. We found an excellent place called the Grand Cafe in a tunnel between 45th and 46th, between Vanderbilt and Lexington. Excellent made to order omelettes and other items, all priced under $4. You can't beat it and the food is terrific! Great coffee, too. Doormen were a big help getting cabs especially during rush hour. Just flash a couple of bucks and they'll work hard for you to get you on your way. Big tip - if you're going to a show reserve a restaurant near the venue. Trying to get a cab between 7 and 8 p.m. is impossible as everyone is heading to the theater. We found out the hard way our first night and almost missed our show. Eat by the venue and then you don't have to worry about cabbing it. Just walk! Bottom line is book on the hotel's website, use the Senior Discount if you can and spend a little extra for a Lexington Suite, prepare for the tiniest bathroom you could imagine and then you won't be disappointed. Overall, I recommend the Grand Hyatt and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mercurystar999
Reviews.Content: Well i can't beleive some of the negative posts. This hotel is quality. It is sandwiched between grand central terminal and the chrysler building. Both are probably the nicest looking buildings in the city. The location is superb being so close to grand central it is a quick subway ride to anywhere in manhatten. It is also only a short walk to many of the main sites in New York. It even has its own entrance to grand central. Rooms are large, and i mean large it was a clear 5 or 6 steps to the granite desk. There is a large comfy chair and an office chair at the desk. A walk in wardrobe, an iron and ironing board is also provided. The bathroom is an adequate size for what you need to do in there. Although the bath is not very deep but that maybe the way all American baths are. The bed is amazing to sleep in, probably the most comftable bed ever. The photo's on the Grand Hyatt website are just what the hotel is like, unlike allot of other hotels i have stayed in. Check in was quick and there was a room ready even though we were early (11:00). Staff at concierge were polite and very efficient, they could not of been any more helpfull. In fact my only gripe is that they charged us $2 a bag when we needed to leave our bags as we had a late flight home. Surely a hotel of this quality could provide this service gratis? Obviously this is my own experience of the hotel, this hotel is huge so there is obviously going to be some problems. It is just a shame that negative comments are written more than positives.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your $$$$$!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DCluffs
Reviews.Content: My mother in-law booked this hotel through her travel agent for our honeymoon. When we got there the hotel looked more like a shopping mall. It was packed w/ people checking in and out. The carpet in the lobby was dirty and out dated. I could barely open the door to our room because it was so heavy and the handle was a piece of crap. The bathroom was dirty. There was urine dried up on the floor around the toilet. The bathtub was the smallest one I've ever seen. There was no mirror in the room besides, behind the door in the closet. Not good for putting on make-up. The room was tiny and they didn't have anything you would expect in a hotel room such as a coffee pot or mini fridge. Room service was over priced!!!! And you had to pay for every outgoing phone call whether it was local or an 800 #. My mother in law said she paid $400.00 a night for this room for five nights, you would think these little things would be included. The walls are paper thin. I could here the woman in the next room having conversations on the phone and she left her TV on all night. I could here every word! I didn't sleep well. I could here the vaccume running in the room above us in the mornings. And of course being on our honeymoon we would have liked some privacy. We couldn't enjoy ourselves because we felt like everyone could here us. I read the negative reviews on here and just ignored them. I didn't think the Hyatt could be that bad, but it was. I don't recomend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt was Great”
Reviews.Author: HolidaymakerfromHove
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the Grand Hyatt for 5 nights in October 06 to celebrate my 40th birthday. I wanted to stay somewhere special and this hotel lived up to my expectations. The hotel is located between Grand Central station and the Chrysler Building. The lobby is beautiful - very spacious and special. Our room was on the 25th floor overlooking the Chrysler - although I had to lie on the window sil to see the top of it! We had two double beds which was fine for a family of four. The room was very clean and the bathroom was small yet functional - nice toileteries!! The hotel is a ten minute walk to Times Square and about 15mins to the Empire State Building. We visited the ES firtst thing on our first morning - we arrived at 7.45 as it opened at 8 and were at the start of the queue. It was excellent!! Our first two days were taken up doing the uptown and downtown bus loops (red sightseeing buses) which I would highly recommend. We went to the theatre and saw Tarzan with tickets booked through the hotel theatre ticket booth. Breakfast in the hotel was expensive so we opted for the cafe Metro over the road (next door to Mc Donalds) which was excellent. There is a coffee bar in the lobby that opens at 6 a.m. I would recommend the Hyatt to anyone wanting a central location. We felt very safe and welcome there. Go to NYC, take your family and stay at the Hyatt!!

Reviews.Title: “Try It, You'll Like It!”
Reviews.Author: Shaymus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of 4 choices from a prepaid travel package. I had some doubts after reading some of the reviews, but it was very nice. My room was ready even though I arrived at 11:00 AM. The room actually looked like the picture on the website. A king bed, desk, chair and ottoman and still plenty of room to walk around. Decent size, especially for NY. The window actually opened - fresh air and the sounds of the city. The only negative was no in-room coffee, which is not unusual for NY. There is a coffee bar in the lobby, also the hotel is connected to Grand Central which has more than enough places for coffee, not to mention a great early morning atmosphere. Or go across the street to Pershing Square for some great coffee and a good and very fast breakfast. The hotel location is great also. Walking to distance to Empire State Building, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, etc. Or you can catch the subway from Grand Central. I highly recommend the Grand Hyatt and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Complete rip-off”
Reviews.Author: IETRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt this is the worst hotel that we have ever stayed in. We stayed here from 19th to 24 October 2006 and paid EURO 2450 in total for the privilege. I travel apx monthly for work & 3 times a year for leisure. We have stayed in many hotels and never experienced such complete lack of customer service & standards which you would expect from five start hotels. The rooms are Small and in serious need of renovations. Lack BASIC amenities that you would expect of a Five stare hotel. No tea/coffee in room facilities, no fridge/mini-bar, no dressing gowns/slippers. In fact we had to call the room service every evening to have basic toiletries replaced. Internet is charged at USD0.50c per minute and is not available 24 hours. The biggest joke of all was being charged USD 2 per bag per hour to leave our bags with the Bell hop before our Late evening flight home to Ireland. Staff are Rude and completely un-interested in any enquire you make with them. The public areas of the hotel are dated, carpets are dirty and in need of replacement. The bedroom doors are Heavy Grey dull pained METAL doors. In-fact the hotel actually feels more like a hostel around the bedroom floors. The hotel was pretty much filled to capacity during our stay . With this in mind I would believe there are many very aggrieved guest floating around out there. Avoid this hotel at all costs. A complete RIP-OFF

Reviews.Title: “'Grand' Hyatt is very misleading”
Reviews.Author: AtlanticFlyer
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have stayed at a Hyatt, and it will certainly be my last. The location is central, but pedestrian traffic to/from Grand Central make the sidewalks outside the hotel very busy. It is a short walk from the NYAS Coach stop for services to LGA and JFK as well, which is convenient if you are trying to avoid using taxis. The hotel is expensive however, paying over $250 a night for what is an appalling hotel. I wouldn't want to stay in a regular Hyatt if their upscale property, Grand Hyatt, is anything to go by. The room, whilst relatively large, was poorly designed and did not use space efficiently, which resulted in an absolutely tiny bathroom. As some other reviewers have stated, you could barely move in there. Although there were two windows, due to the room looking over a courtyard/alley, there was very little natural light in the room, and the old, dull decor further assisted in making the room very dingy. The staff didn't respond to our numerous requests for maintenance assistance either. It is also a very loud hotel. We were woken up numerous times on several nights at 2/3am when groups of people returned to their rooms shouting loudly in the hall ways. But the creme de la creme has to be the $2 per bag charge when leaving your baggage with the (rude) concierge after checkout for a few hours - having just spent $1500 on your room bill, this is disgusting. With all the hotels in New York, there are plenty which are far superior to the Grand Hyatt New York, in fact, probably most New York Hotels. Don't waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: TaylorPeat
Reviews.Content: There is really nothing nice about this hotel. the lobby is old and very dated, the corridors and lifts are even more dated and the rooms are grotty and smelly. This is a 2 star hotel with outrageous 5 star prices. This hotel has been left rotting for years with no investment whatsoever and It is a real pity because with some redecoration it could be restored to the great hotel I can only assume it once was many many years ago!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Joggermom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a conference which was held at this hotel. Initially we were excited and looking forward to the Hyatt as we were paying over $300 per night for the room for three nights and were anticipating high quality which the Hyatt advertises. The bathroom was super small with door in your backside when at the sink (I am 5'6 115 pounds). Sink had no room to put your things and tub was so small, I used the shower. The worst thing was the cleanliness of the bathroom and room in general. There was and probably still is feces or vomit on the underside of the toilet (room 2628) which I saw when I was trying out the narrow tub. Also hair on the floor in the bathroom which was there upon our arrival. The lighting in the bathroom was shadowy and the lighting in the room was dim. Since we both needed to get ready simultaneously, it was impossible for me to put makeup on in the room since there was no mirror near the desk or anywhere that I could place my small make up bag (the mirror in the room was on the sliding closet doors near the door i.e. no place to set anything down to use the mirror). The best thing about the hotel was the bed. Certainly not worth the money. Never will I stay at a Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucy123456
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through priceline which worked very well. The hotel had a classy feel to it, while at the same time being very functional. You can use an automatic check in and check out. Our room was very clean and stylish with a view to 42nd street. The street was a bit noisy on Fri night, but it is at a central location in NY, so you can expect some traffic noise. We loved being close to Grand Central which is a fun place to have breakfast or lunch, and even to do a bit of shopping. Time square, Empire state building, Macy's, Madison Square Garden etc are close and ok to walk to. We particularly liked the atmosphere of Bryant Park. It is a park and yet it is in the middle of everything. You can stop for a cup of coffee on the way to or from sight seeing or shopping. I can recommend the Grand Hyatt to friends and family and would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: petsya
Reviews.Content: Was a little scared about booking this hotel after reading some of the reviews, but I went and did it anyway. Spent three nights there from September 8th - 11th. Got an awesome room - check out the pictures. I think I was soooo fortunate because I booked the room through the hotels website and I joined the rewards club too. Room had two huge beds, they were the most comfortable i've ever had. Through the webiste I was able to book a "quiet" room and they didn't disapoint. I would have to say this was probably the biggest room I have ever stayed in. I was also able to check in by phone on the morning of our arrival. This was a very friendly and helpful service. The operator did ask us if it was alright that our bathroom would only have a shower instead of the bath/shower, and since we both prefered those type this was no big deal. The proximity to everything is awesome - with the Hyatt having its own entrance to Grand Central Terminal made getting around NY very easy. We ended up taking the subway to and from JFK which is kind of a scarey experience if you have never taken the subway before....just make sure to pack light. This Hotel is within walking distance to everything in the mid town area llike the Empire State Building, Central Park, Times Square. And then everything downtown you just take one airconditioned subway and everything is within walking distance down there too. It seemed that the subways that run North-South are a lot better than the ones that run East-West. I plan on staying here next time I visit New York

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: bjorkebo73
Reviews.Content: I have been many times to New York and travelled extensively both in really expensive hotels and really cheap ones. But this is the least value for money i have ever had. 609 USD plus taxes for a room where the color in the ceiling of the bathroom is falling off, a bathtub dirty and rusty "hole". The wall paper was coming of the seam broken. Dark dungy carpets. Do not stay here. Lousy service at concierge desk unfriendly. The positive was a comfortable bed and central location close to everything. If you want to stay close to good restaurants and fun bars stay in Meatpacking District or Lower East or somewhere in SoHo, Tribecca. This is for tourist with too much money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Location”
Reviews.Author: Chief_Illiniwek
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Grand Hyatt. Rooms were quite large by NYC standards, the beds were very comfortable, and my room was extremely clean (especially for NYC standards) Of course the lobby is impressive. What makes the clean room even better is the central location of the hotel and the ease of getting around the city. I actually enjoy taking the subway around the city and this hotel at Grand Central is very convenient for that. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and the priceline value was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “This is the 'best' location for any first time visitor!”
Reviews.Author: Lisaonthegoco
Reviews.Content: A first time visit to New York City was greatly enhanced by the great location of this hotel. We came in from La Guardia after a flight from Denver,CO and grabbed a $21.00 round trip bus ride on a New York Airport Service (NYAS) bus which dropped us off across the street from the hotel. Note: you buy this ticket from a uniformed person standng by the sign advertising this service at the airport. After your direct ride, you walk through Grand Central Station and out the other side for the short walk to the hotel front entrance. We had a 24th floor room with 2 windows but no view except the alley and other tall buildings but it was so quiet and our bed was so comfy. We programmed the safe and left the other half of our airport ticket s in the safe. We used the express elevator to go back downstairs where we asked the Concierge (she used a Zagat guide) to help us find a "bistro" type restaurant for lunch on a Metro (subway) line. We walked out the front door and headed just a short walk back to Grand Central Station where we bought 7 day passes ($24.00) called the Metro Card. We were all over the city all week and when we stayed out a little too late to catch the Shuttle subway betwen Times Square and Grand Central (service ends at midnight for this line) a cab was easy to find and cheap ($5.00). A cab to the theater district was also only $10.00, we saw "Wicked" at the Gerschwin. Our only disappointment with the hotel was the Concierge service. The staff member was not at all friendly but merely perfunctionary . Play tickets and tours were handled by a separate company in the lobby. They only staffed one person and no-one while that person went to lunch. We did buy play tickets here and were glad that the tickets were capped at $199 as they were going for $250 on Ticketmaster. The red openair tour busses also pick passengers up across the street from the hotel. $50.00 bought a 48 hour pass on these busses. The tours are uptown, downtown, Brooklyn daytime and a nighttime downtown and Brooklyn loop. The daytime is hop on, hop off. Be advised to ride the tour and then do some hopping on and off or your may miss the sights as the day time touring was over at 5pm. As an additional note: we saw police and transit police all over the city and felt secure on our weeklong visit. Can't wait for a second visit to NY and appreciated how clean and pleasant the lobby was to come back to and the cleanliness of the room.We didn't use or see much else of the hotel but the location was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is Relative”
Reviews.Author: goodwig
Reviews.Content: Hyatt hotels are a safe choice as long as you behave like a smart traveler. The Grand Hyatt is in mid-town and obviously convenient to attractions in the area. It is a bustling site on top of Grand Central Station so expect to walk out of the hotel into the midst of clamoring crowds and noisy street scenes. Negotiate for a room on a high floor and emphasize your desire for a pleasant room but do not expect more than a partial view of anything since the hotel is surrounding by high-rises. The exercise room on the top floor is accessible with a room card and nicer than most hotel gyms The bathrooms are small but the rooms are Hyatt-quality and the hotel deserves its high rating. You can't go wrong with this facility especially if you are paying discount rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: myb8089
Reviews.Content: I booked the rooms through Priceline, paid $115. I got a lovely man Brian to check me in. When I mentioned that we were there to celebrate our anniversary he upgraded up to a Junior suite. It was very nice. ok the furniture was quite scratched (worse than what my 2 toddlers do to ours back home) but the living room was large L shaped, desk at one end, couch and coffee table and another sofa in the other corner. very spacious esp considering it was NYC and compared to the bedroom size which was rather tight. We had a king sized bed, not that much room to move considering there was also an amoire in the room, nearly touching the bed. When i asked brian at checkin for a fridge in the room, he said some suites have them some don't, if we don't have one i shoudl call done and he will have one sent up. of course they was none there. when i called front desk to have one sent up, the phone just rang and rang, and when i asked brian he was not to be found. i figured i would go down to the front desk and see if i could locate him. he was not there but another gentleman rather snobbishly told me that seeing my booking was done on the web (!) there was an additional charge of $25. i said brian never told me that and went back to my room figuring i would try to reach brian on the phone. no luck seems he had left for the night. i told the woman who answered that the rooms was rather dirty (certain surfaces had so much dust i began to wonder when they were last cleaned!) and the furniture looked rather dumpy, i was prepared to overlook it if she could please send me up a fridge. she checkedt with the supervisor and sent one up. Overall - room lovely, albeit a little old and dusty. Bathroom - tiny but clean and nice toiletries. Location - phenomenal, right in the hustle and bustle Parking - horrible, be prepared to pay ALOT ! But I would definitely stay there again if i could get the right price!

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt was Grand!”
Reviews.Author: thedfamily
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Grand Hyatt in New York. It's a great hotel. We had a terrific room on the 22nd floor - two double beds with space to move around in the room. We even had a mini-fridge to keep our snacks cool. The bathroom did not have much counter space, which is an issue when you are traveling with a 14 year old girl - but it was clean and well-stocked. And the beds were incredibly comfortable. Everyone in the hotel was very friendly and helpful. We were greeted by a manager on arrival, who helped us get checked in and made sure our reservation was correct. When I needed to use a computer to check my email and the business center was closed, the concierge let me use hers so I wouldn't be late to the show. There was construction in front of the hotel, but our room was very quiet. The windows really opened, which was great for short periods of time. We walked to Times Square, the pier, Macy's - it was all close. We will definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt on our next trip to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt was great!”
Reviews.Author: smiles_4_me
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt New York was great! We stayed there from 7-30 to 8-1 in a one bed room and it was everything that I expected. The room was clean and very spacious for New York. It had a huge walk in closet that could easily fit a twin size bed (just imagine!) The bathroom was small but very clean and presentable. The bed was very comfortable. Every morning when we opened the door, the New York Times was at our door. This saved us a trip to go and buy a newspaper. Our check in staff was very helpful and polite. The only rude person was the gentleman who was supposed to open the door for the handicap guest who never seem to move an inch when this lady was trying to get in. My husband and I had to open the door for her. The hotel is a little far (about four to five long blocks) from everything, Times Sqaure, Rockefeller, etc. It is close to the Grand Central Station which is right next door. This made it comvinient if you plan to take the subway which we did and loved. I would definitely go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: baylorbear14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 3 nights at a price of $110/night. Definitely worth the price. THe lobby is large and pretty. The rooms were OK, but honestly, we were hardly in them, being that we didn't even get back to our room until 3am-4am every night. The bathroom has to be the smallest space I have ever seen. The location was great, and I would stay there again if I could get another great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Economical luxury”
Reviews.Author: jabez06
Reviews.Content: July 20, 2006 My family went to NY for the first time and stayed here, it was a very comfortable hotel. Location was excellent , within walking distance of major tourist attractions. We would definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt again!!! Travelers tip: Do not book ground transportation through Golden Touch transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at The Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: gcowan4
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at The Grand Hyatt. Everthing about the hotel was excellent. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The room was spotless and was cleaned the minute we went out. The location is great, you can grab a cab in 1 minute out front or be on the subway in Grand Central in 2 minutes.The room size was actually pretty good for NYC. We would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt was ok but not a great place to eat at all”
Reviews.Author: kygalfromprospect
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a weekend. Food way toooooo expensive for the quality. We ate elsewhere after one meal. The theatre staff on duty at the hotel were very helpful with booking the shows we wanted to see. All in all it was an ok place to stay. However, if I were to go again for theatre only I would stay in a hotel closer to the venues. Ohter staff not as helpful to us as the theatre people.

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding me?”
Reviews.Author: Delphian
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay thru Priceline, so had no choice on hotels. Just wanted to be sure we got at least a four star, to make sure our trip was enjoyable and as problem free as possible. The price was ok, I've seen higher and lower prices for the same hotel, so no complaint’s there. What I can complain about was the cleanliness of our rooms and the noise. The room itself was sized well enough but the bathroom was not. It is way too small. I’m 5’7” /140lbs and found it a bit annoying to move around. There is little to no space to put your bathroom essentials and there’s a considerable amount of mold and mildew in the shower and on the ceiling above the door. Apparently the housekeeping staff isn’t trained in correctly cleaning bathrooms which is evident by the abundance of dried urine around the toilet. Come on now people, everyone should know how to clean a bathroom, especially if you’re getting paid to do it! No ventilation fan, so you might want to shower with the door open, but that leaves you with a host of other problems doesn’t it. The Grand Hyatt creates the illusion of a larger room by doing away with furniture. The window ledge acts as a table for the ice bucket and glasses. Feel free to call and request a mini-fridge at $25.00 a night, if your phone works which ours didn’t, along with several light bulbs, oh the list could go on and on…Let’s review: •Extremely small bathroom •No ventilation fan in bathroom •Mold and mildew abundant •Dried urine around toilet and on wall •Broken room phone •Lack of space to put your things •Several burnt out light bulbs •Dirty sheets (what surprised?) •Mini-fridge for $25.00 per night based on availability •Thin walls, Mr. and Mrs. Next door discussed in depth their itinerary for the weekend and upstairs seemed to be practicing for a demolition derby •Location was ok, but if your staying anywhere in Midtown Manhattan – your close to everything, period. The hotel staff was courteous but was not about to go out of their way to be helpful. Not what most people would expect from a four star hotel. Lesson learned: you get what you pay for. Next time, I’ll go with the TripAdvisor Hotel Rating, before buying.

Reviews.Title: “What is everyone complaining about?”
Reviews.Author: LiveInNYC
Reviews.Content: I live in NYC, but wanted a quick getaway from my apartment, so decided to spend a night at the Grand Hyatt. I booked the room through priceline, so did not actually choose the grand hyatt, and after reading reviews, I was expecting a less than perfect evening. Fortunately, I was pleasantly surprised! The room was spotless, and not exceedingly small by NYC standards. The bed was so comfortable and the sheets and towels were clean and smelled freshly washed. Service was prompt and courteous. My only complaint is that the walls are thin, and I could hear conversations of our next door neighbors. Thankfully, they were not around much. Perhaps reviewers are not used to the limited space that New Yorkers are used to living with. Yes, the rooms are small relative to what you would find elsewhere, but that's to be expected here. Also, room service is so expensive, and there are far too many delicious and relatively cheap restaurants in the area for anyone to order room service. I actually ordered food from a nearby restaurant to be delivered to my room and had no problems. I had a wonderful stay and would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, The only positive things were the location and the lobby. But the rest of the hotel was the worst I've ever been in New York. This was my third time visiting New York but the first time staying at the Hyatt. I thought I was getting a 4-star hotel but it was more like 1.5 to 2. The problems were, but not limited to, small room, very small bathroom, very thin walls (could hear our neighbor sneeze and snoring), the towels were OLD and smelled horrible like they washed them in plain water with no detergent, the internet was not free, there was no refrigerator in the room (strange); the staff was not very pleasant (not much on customer service), and the elevators were super slow!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - But Very Busy and Crowded”
Reviews.Author: maxheadway
Reviews.Content: Overall, I liked the hotel. But there were definite pros and cons. Pros: Great location. Adjacent to Grand Central Terminal (Station). You don't even have to walk outside to get to the hotel. Nicely designed and decorated. The fountains in the foyer have a calming effect. Cons: I paid rack rate, and ended up in a tiny room the first night. I asked for and received a much nicer room the next night. But I was disappointed with the room assignment the first night. There are a number of elevators. Half go to the lower floors, half go to the higher floors. Only one elevator was working one evening and it took a long, long time to get into the elevator and to my floor. Very crowded. There were lots of tour groups and conference attendees at the hotel. That added to the strain on the elevators and public areas.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: ckarp73
Reviews.Content: After reading some of these reviews, I was a bit nervous about staying here. All my worries disappeared once we walked into the lobby - it was beautiful. The hotel staff were super friendly. We were able to check in electronically and although there were no lines - it was most convenient. We were able to check in at 11AM and our room was clean and cool. The bathroom itself was small but clean. The vanity area was huge and well lit. The room-service menu prices were absolutely ridiculous but who needs room service in NYC?! Just walk outside to find just about any type of food you could want. The hotel's location is convenient to everything and you can catch the subway next door at Grand Central. Very very nice place. Be sure to check out Pomme Frites in Greenwich Village for the best french fries ever.

Reviews.Title: “I shall return!”
Reviews.Author: ButlerIV
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended the Grand Hyatt for my family’s summer vacation to NYC. After shopping online for the best rate, I actually found the best price calling the Grand Hyatt direct and made the reservations months in advance. As the time approached for our vacation, I continued to monitor “Trip Advisor.” Several of the reviews caused me to question our decision, after reading of others’ bad experiences. We stayed with our choice and are we glad that we did! The lobby is impressive and my kids were immediately impressed with the TV in the elevators. Our room was larger than expected and very clean. The bed and linens were very comfortable. Although our time in the room was limited, it was very enjoyable and restful. I appreciated the obvious and not so obvious security that I observed. Once entering the lobby after 6pm, guests were asked to show room keys, prior to entering the elevators. The woman before me was offended and felt inconvenienced by this. I did not and was thankful for the screening. I found that the staff was very accommodating. I needed to print an airport shuttle confirmation for my group of five. I used the business center, finding the staff very friendly and willing to assist. Although there are additional charges posted for the internet access, etc., I was excused of any fees with a great smile and a “have a great day” send-off. On our last night, I conferred with the Concierge on a pizza delivery suggestion. The recommendation was made immediately with menu in hand! In 30 minutes time, my family was in agreement; it was the best pizza that we’ve had in a very long time! The Grand Hyatt assisted in making our summer ’06 vacation one of the best ever! I shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Grand Hyatt. There wasn't much of a view from our window as we were about a foot above a part of the hotel's roof top. We weren't in the room during the day and the blinds were shut at night so that wasn't that big of an issue. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms. We had 2 adjoining rooms, one with a king sized bed and one with 2 double beds. We had a roll away bed in the king sized room and there was still plenty of room. The biggest plus of all was how comfortable the beds were!! We're still talking about those beds! We found the staff very courteous and accomodating. This was an excellent location and was the biggest bang for our buck by far. I know that the next time I'm in NYC, this hotel will be the first I call. I can't say enough about how pleasurable our experience was. I highly recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: italybound314
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate on this hotel on Hotwire, and I'm pleased what we wound up with! $215/night in early October on a weekend. We were only there for 3 nights, so we had to jam in our siteseeing.....the location of the hotel couldn't have been any better. We took the Subway to all our destinations. We arrived on the redeye from SF and the hotel held our bags for us at 7am until our room was ready...and they let us into the room at 11am! Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay/Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice, both times from Priceline ($110 and 170). I usually take the train in but did drive in once, the parking is 50 a night, which is in line with some other hotels (except the Holiday Inn in the Financial District $24 a night!!). The room was quite large one time, another was smaller, more NY size. I went to a Mets game, so it's nice so close to Grand Central and the 7 train. Easy in, easy out. Tons of places to eat nearby, just head north on 2nd ave. Overall nothing wowed me, but still a nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for price/quality”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidfromMontreal
Reviews.Content: Best thing is the location. Next to Grand Central Terminal for catching the subway, a Duane & Read drugstore at the 42nd St. intersection (for bottled water, etc.), Starbucks around the corner on Lexington Ave. for a cheap, quick breakfast. Midtown location means $25 fare from LGA Airport; you can also cab it for a relatively cheap fare whether going Uptown or to Theatre District. Arrived at 9am and we were allowed to check in so this was much appreciated. Room with a king bed is good size. Room with 2 doubles is smaller but okay. The bed is the best thing about the room. The firm mattresses, down comforter and bed linen are truly wonderful. Bathroom is small - the basics are there but there are no extra towels, no luxury toiletries. The a/c unit makes a terrible racket all night long - like a gurgling, babbling brook - but at least the cool air was comfortable. Poor lighting in the bedroom so forget about reading your guidebook at night. No coffemaker or teas, but you do get a free newspaper every morning. There is no privacy as you can hear everything outside, which means people can hear you inside your room... Service at front desk ranges from friendly to indifferent, depending on who serves you. No better, no worse than other hotels. The Sky Bar was never open. Didn't eat here so can't judge the restaurants. Some people have mentioned Pershing Cafe for breakfast. Yes, it has ambiance and great decor but for better value, go to Jane's Deli at 43rd St. (corner 2nd Ave.) where a hot breakfast costs less than $4. It's also cheaper to pick up drinks and fruit here than at the Grand Central Market but beware, Jane's is open only Mon-Fri. Many parts of the hotel look worn and faded so the Grand Hyatt is not great. However, thanks to its location, location, location, I would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great”
Reviews.Author: Terry9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located adjacent to Grand Central Station, so its location was great for a day of sightseeing. Parking was valet only and $50. That may be close to typical for NYC, but it was very inconvenient to get something out of our car that we needed. It was also hard to communicate with the staff--they had a hard time understanding our questions in English. The lobby of the hotel is impressive, but we weren't completely satisfied with our room. The bed was very comfortable, but the room's lighting was VERY dark. That may have been to add atmosphere, but maybe also to disguise the fact that it didn't seem like things were being maintained well. The decor seemed up-to-date, but it still felt like the room was heading towards "run down." The bathroom was clean, but the bathtub had a large crack that wasn't repaired well, and there was a mildewy smell in the bathtub area. We got this room at a good rate from Priceline so felt okay for the value. Otherwise, we would have been pretty disappointed. We were disappointed to see that this hotel did not appear to be making any efforts towards conservation that every other hotel we've stayed at recently is making. There were no signs about having a choice for our sheets and towels not being changed each day.

Reviews.Title: “I Have Stayed at nicer Holiday Inns”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was small. The Bathroom was tiny. Who gave this hotel a 4 star rating? Very overated

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the centre of NYC, close to everything. Our room was really nice, one of the best hotels we have stayed in. Yes it is very expensive to eat or drink in this hotel, so the simple answer is dont ! There are plenty of deli's around, and of course you are allowed to bring back a take-away to your room or even have it delivered. The staff are fantastic, so eager to help, they want you to enjoy your stay. Close to Grand Central station, so you dont have to walk that far for the subway. Please do NOT travel with Virgin Atlantic, our flight was delayed, the cabin crew so rude, they are so arrogant, overheard one of them refer to ecomomy passengers as cattle ! Do NOT catch the red eye flight back to the UK, the cabin crew rush the service in order for them to sleep the flight away, amazing how they gety away with such poor service. The cabin crew must have to pass a how to be rude exam to be so stuck up If you want to enjoy your trip to NYC then the answer is to AVOID Virgin Atlantic if you have any sense. I will stick to flying BA or an American carrier in future.

Reviews.Title: “So terrible we left!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganBlue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room in the Grand Hyatt in March of this year. We were going to stay 3 nights. Upon arrival the room wasn't ready. We were told to explore the city and they held our bags for us. The lobby was very nice with water falls. After spending some time shopping we returned and our room was ready. As we were being taken to our room I noticed that the hallway had a terrible stench. I thought it may be food but I could smell it through out the hallway as we were walking to the room. The room was very, very disappointing. First of all, it was extremely small, even by NY standards. The room was smelly. Maybe it was because it was smoked in, but it was strong enough to make me ill. I've never experienced a smell like this and I travel a lot. I wasn't going to be able to sleep with that smell. In addition, the carpet, furniture and curtains were worn. The window ledge inside the room was dirty. It looked like it wasn't cleaned for quite some time. We went down to the lobby to let them know that we were leaving. They didn't even have an apology for us-----very poor customer service. They did, however, offer to move us to another room. We were afraid the condition would be the same so we left. We had to pay a nights stay anyway. (This hotel is very OVER-priced!) We went back to stay at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers to stay. We stayed at that hotel back in 2003 and had a wonderful experience so we knew it would be a safe bet and it was! Do not stay at the Grand Hyatt New York. You will be very disappointed ! I highly recommend the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers instead.... it is a very clean and classy hotel, great customer service too!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced no matter what you pay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through a conference. $649/night plus NY and NYC taxes means more than $700/night. No internet service, so I called the front desk and was directed to the business center. Stand in line there, but then told that the front desk handles all wireless problems and go stand in line again at the front desk to to get the TMobile hot spot device to plug into my computer. $250 billed to my room; refunded when I return device. Back in my room, I spend 15 minutes getting signed in for $10/24 hours and do some email. 2 hours later, service is off and demanding another $10, so I have to spend another 15 minutes on the phone with the hotel and TMobile to get reconnected. Was in and out of first room several times from afternoon to evening and realized that I was sneezing and getting a headache whenever in the room. Finally looked up in the bathroom and realized that the top of the bathroom door frame and part of the bathroom ceiling was covered -- and I mean covered -- in heavy black mold. Call the desk. Would I like to move? Well, duh, yes. They send up a bellman to hand me a key to a new room. Move myself upstairs and find that I am now in a room with a broken lightswitch, two burned out lightbulbs in desk and table lamps, and an especially attractive cigarette burn on the toilet seat. This level of "service" and amenities was insulting. Next time I have to stay mid-town, I'll just stay at the Affinia. About the same level of service and amenities, but at least they're candid about it and it's about $450/night cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MadRulfe
Reviews.Content: After a really dreadful flight with Virgin Atlantic (an over rated airline) the comforts of this hotel were most welcome. This was our honeymoon, so we were praying our stay went well, and it did. The room was fantastic, the maid service was super. The staff are a credit to the hotel, always friendly and warm. A spotless and clean hotel, situated in an ideal location. If you are looking for a trouble free place to stay, then you will not go far wrong at the Grand Hyatt. We spent 7 nights and would return again. But NOT with Virgin Atlantic, the return flight back to the UK was WORSE than the outward leg. Delayed flight, rushed service on board, rude ignorant stuck up cabin crew. If at all possible choose BA or a US airline.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Grandy Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Callaway99
Reviews.Content: PROS: Excellent location, steps from Grand Central Terminal, easy walking distance from all midtown Manhattan locations. Clean and spacious, our room also had a nice view of the 42nd Street entrance to Grand Central with plenty of daylight. Very roomy by NYC standards. The service from both the front desk and conceierge was excellent. I'm usually suspicous of recommendations from the Conceiege for restaurants, but we had excellent recommendations. The beds were very comfortable. Price was very reasonable. All the staff we encountered during our three night stay were cordial, friendly and professional. The lounge was cozy without being cramped, with small seating areas for a small group to gather on a couch around drinks at the end of the day. The modern decor was also nice. Windows in rooms open! CONS: High speed Interenet service through T-mobile did not work. We weren't given enough towels and had to ask for more, but they were delivered quickly. The modern decor in the bathroom is attractive but at the cost of essentially no counter space around the sink. For some reason, the chambermaids felt it necessary to remove the bathtub drain. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant is very expensive (about $25 minimum per person as I recall). Good if you're on an expense account. If you're on vacation, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not so grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: MarkHastings
Reviews.Content: I am an experienced traveller, for both business and pleasure – both international and domestic. I have stayed at the “Grand” Hyatt properties in Asia. If you think you will be coming close here in New York, think again! This is a very tired property that is living off the location (the ONLY good point) and the name. The rooms are small and dreary with tiny windows located along long sprawling corridors that reminded us of a rundown mega-hotel in Las Vegas. This property has over 1300 rooms, so if you are expecting any semblance of personal service forget it… in fact if you are expecting the operator to answer the phone you are probably pushing it. There are no fridges in the rooms, and room services prices make a dinner on the town look reasonable. (Glass of OJ $8.00, Eggs and Bacon $22.00). The bottom line is simply this. If you have another option in New York take it. If you don’t then set your expectations accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Superb all around”
Reviews.Author: george17
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the end of May 2006. Reserved a king room, on-line a month in advance and checked in early to find just what we requested. The room was very large - apparently a deluxe room,. Small bathroom with tub and toilet and sink/vanity outside. Perfectly clean and fine. Large desk with lamp, a reading chair with ottoman, two windows, a large almost walk-in closet with a mirror inside the door and an ironing board. We ordered a roll away bed which fit nicely in a corner of the room and didn't disrupt the traffic flow at all. Service was excellent all around. Management very responsive. Friendly staff. Friendly concierge who arranged a last minute birthday celebration in the Commodore lounge and cake on-the-house. The elevators are super sonic speed which I found extremely helpful. The only drawback: don't get the breakfast buffet in the Sky Bar unless you're on an expense account. $30 a person! And one of our party only drank coffee. But there are lots of other options for eating in the neighborhood. The location couldn't be better. The Giants baseball team was checking in as we were checking out, so I take that as a bit of an edorsement. And the price? $197 a night. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DM123
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's location on 42nd St within 2 blocks of 5th Ave and 4 blocks from Times Square. We booked 2 rooms directly through the Hyatt web site. We specifically booked rooms with 2 double beds and requested non smoking rooms in a quiet location. When we arrived we were told that our room type was not available and that we would have to go into rooms with a single king size bed. This was a bit annoying especially as the web site lists the rooms separately when you are making your booking. We were then provided with rollaway beds which took up a fair amount or space in the rooms. When we got to our rooms one of the rooms had a very strong smell of smoke so we had to move. The rooms themselves are very large with a seating area, and desk. Given the size of the room the bathrooms are surprisingly small. The sink unit in particular is very small with very little room to lay your stuff down on. Breakfast was pretty expensive so we went out . The Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel is only a couple of minutes away from the Hyatt and provides an excellent full irish breakfast for $15. Be warned that Grand Central station is currently being renovated. Our room on the 17th floor looked out onto the side of the station. On the first night of our stay they were sandblasting the building until 3.00am, so much for the quiet room ! Luckily as it was a holiday weekend they did not work for the remainder of our stay... Being close to Grand Central proved to be useful as the station has a really nice market selling fresh produce and gourmet foods, lots of shops, and a nice dining concourse. The Grand Hyatt is a very large impersonal hotel but it's location cannot be faulted and the rooms are large.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: BeingGreen
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five-night stay in this hotel and would highly recommend it. I read all the reviews on this site before making this my destination for a recent trip. The room was much bigger than I expected it to be (28th floor--king non-smoking). In addition to the bed and two nightstands inthe room, there was a desk with chair, an additional fabric covered chair and ottoman, a television atop a wooden bureau containing drawers, shelves, and a safe. The closet was long and narrow and the bathroom contained a tubwith shower, a single sink and wall shelving to hold makeup, lotions, etc. There was also a wall-mounted hair dryer in the bathroom. There were three or four elevators serving the floor and I rarely had to wait to go up or down. There was a single window in the room and it opened and had some sort of shading so that you could not see into the room from the other rooms making it possible to keep the shades up and the window open but still maintain privacy. The window ledge held an ice bucket and a large red vase. There were two phones--one by the bed and another on the desk--and a clock-radio CD player. The decor was khaki and white with black--very smoothing and certainly pleasant. I had room service on several occasions and found it very overly priced even for New York standards--$23 for pancakes that I could buy for less than $4 at the Grand Central Station food court. The room service menu lists a three-egg omelette for $23 and I ordered it for breakfast one day. I knew when I signed the bill that the total was much higher than I expected and I assumed I had mis-read the menu and there was a per charge fee for ingredients. I decided to check the menu and saw that there was no such fee so I decided to eat and then call to complain. That was when i realized they had sent up three omelettes and charged me for three!!! I called room service and told them that when i read "three egg omelette" off of the menu I was placing an order for a single omelette with three eggs not THREE OMELETTEs. They removed the charge and were very gracious about it. Another time they left the toast off of my order but they quicky sent it up when I complained. All in all while the price was very high, the food was good and it was worth the splurge on those days when i wanted to get ready to go out and yet do so in a leisurely fashion. I ordered a B and B one night and the person did not know what that was and asked me if I wanted a bread and butter plate. The girl who delivered the drink later told me that the guy who took my call did not drink and had never heard of a B and B, but that even the bartender said he had only had requests for two or three ever-- I did not expect the request to merit such discussion! When I returned each day the housekeeping staff did a great job of cleaning the room. In other visits when I have used the blanket kept in the closet or shelf of most hotel rooms the staff has returned it to the closet or shelf each evening requiring that I pull it out and re-do the bed, but at this hotel they made up the bed each day with the blanket--something I greatly appreciated and I had also removed the heavier bed covering which they left off of the bed as well. I appreciated this attention to detail. The hotel was quiet except for the last night when a large group of college students stayed on the floor and were up and down the halls. I could hear them each time they talked as they walked by my door, but never heard any noises from the adjoining rooms and very little street noise when i closed the window. There are vending machines on every floor--two dollar sodas. The great thing about this hotel is that you can get to the subway without going outside so it is very convenient to getting where you need to go. There is a great market in Grand Central station with lots of pre-made food so if you want to take it easy and eat in the room you can find every sort of take-out food from the market that is ready to eat. Likewise, there are great choices in the food court of the station. I found that most of the places there would prepare food for take-out as well. The concierge was great about locating movies and tickets and providing advice on the fastest most economical way to maneuver the city. The bell staff is less helpful. When I needed a taxi to leave they were so busy talkig to each other that I ended up hailing thre cab myself. When i arrived at the hotel no one moved to assist me with my bags. I would have gladly paid a tip to have assistance especially since upon entering the lobby one must go up an escalator or stairs to reach the registration desk. All in all, I would choose this hotel again. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Fab city”
Reviews.Author: Sharon1402
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt for4 nights. On the 3rd night early morning of the 4th we had a fire alarm go off at 4.45 am which because of a malfunction was not able to be silenced until 8.30! We were told we would get a refund for the night but are still waiting for this ! Other than that the room was ok - fab huge comfy bed, but was a bit disappointed with bathroom.Saying that we did not spend much time in room as NY is such a fab city. No tea or coffee making facilities in room either which was rather disappointing also. To say this is a 4* hotel it was a little disappointing. The reception and entrance area is far grander than the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not grand!”
Reviews.Author: An0nym0us
Reviews.Content: We booked a "lexington suite" which we were told was more spacious than the basic double room. What we found was a very small bedroom, a postage stamp sized bathroom with no tub and no space to spread personal items out around the sink. The advertised square footage was made up by a nearly totally separate "study" which had a desk with no drawers, no paper or pen/pencil, and a very weak desk lamp. The wireless internet was an extra charge as is common at 4-star hotels, but it was not their own service but rather T-mobile, so one had to compete for bandwidth with the rest of the neighborhood, which meant basically dial up speed. No housekeeping service was received during our 2-night stay. The air conditioner blew directly onto the head of the bed. The lighting was poor all the way around. There was no mirror in the bedroom. Only one bathrobe was provided in a room booked for 2 people. When we checked out and tried to leave our bags with the bell desk, we were asked for a receipt, which we did not yet have -- I read that another Trip Advisor member had the same problem. Whe we retrieved our luggage, the bellman dropped my computer bag on the floor hard and did not apologize. They also didn't offer assistance getting our luggage downstairs to our limousine at the front door. In short, neither the room nor the service was four-star. This was our second stay at this hotel and we will definitely never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-Not so nice staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! Not a nice staff at all. Visited just one night. I am a travel agent got a good rate on the Regency Club level. The staff in the Regency club was rude and acted as if we shouldn't be in there. Requested 2 beds got one king and a rollaway for 4 people. As an agent would not recommend to anyone that would like to stay at a nice friendly hotel. Next time will stay at a Marriott property!

Reviews.Title: “Ruined NY trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had booked two rooms with two double beds, months in advance of trip. When we arrived had two rooms with king bed in each room. Extremely rude manager said no other rooms available. We asked for rollaway beds were told by someone at front desk that our request could not be accommodated. Cleaning staff employee got us a cot, but asked us no to tell management. Manager told us that if we had made reservation directly through Hyatt instead of Expedia we would have gotten the rooms we requested. I am originally from NYC and had friends from SC with me for a long weekend, our weekend was basically ruined, with three people in one room and four in the other sleeping on rollaways, all the time paying for two double beds we didn't have. The rooms were also very hot, and we couldn't see out the window because of the mold.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel has direct connection to the Grand Central Station - great if you use the Subway, very convienient. Stayed in King Room, comforable bed, large walk-in-closet, and decent bath size. Beautiful decor. Cleaning staff did a good job. Concierge was not too helpful though, was disappointed about that.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic luxury hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 01ellis
Reviews.Content: From the moment I saw this hotel I knew it would be something special. The taxi pulled up and I was welcomed by a friendly baggage man dressed in green who escorted me to the reception, the sound was amazing, water crashing down down the lobby waterfall a spectacular start to my stay at this hotel. When I checked in, I went up to the 26th floor where my room was situated on the bullte lift. The moment of anticipation, what was my room going to be like, I swipped my room card and the room oppened. First of all I went to the window, WOW what a view, the sounds of the fire engines squeezing through the traffic, the bright yellow cabsmoving about. The bedroom was good, a huge king size bed, an adequate clean bathroom and a huge wardrobe with an ironing board. I felt a need to use the free safe provided as the Mexican and Porto Rican cleaners looked a bit dodgy. The bed was very comfortable and when I woke up got dressed I decided to head up for the gym, where I was told under 18's need parental supervision which I found disgusting considering I have to pay a full adult fare, so anyway I got my mum and I had a work out. Coming down from the workout I came across very false whiney American women eating their breakfast. When I arrived back at my room I had a shower changed my clothes and headed out to get some breakfast. PLEASE NOTE, EVERYTIME YOU COME INTO THIS HOTEL IT STILL SEEMS SPECTACULAR. PLEASE NOTE, THE STAFF OF THIS HOTEL EXPECT A TIP FOR EVERYTHING. Written by Louie aged 16, ---

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Perfect Location and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt New York for seven days including Easter weekend. We arrived on Good Friday and was able to check in at 9am. Room was a good size for a NY hotel ... bathroom as well. Stayed on the 25th floor. Windows open so we were able to experience fresh air in the evening ... streets too noisy to open the window during the day. Had a wonderful time ... we will stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: jopinky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights over the Easter break. We had a wonderful time and did not have any complaints regarding the hotel. We had to wait about an hour to check-in on arrival despite requesting early check-in after our flight from London but we didnt mind to much as they honoured our other requests for a nice view and a king bed. The room itself was spotless, much bigger than I was expecting and lots of draws and cupboard space. Bathroom was fine. I think the hotel has refurbed recently but only cosmetically. The bath/shower could do to be replaced but the bathroom in general was very clean and spacious with plenty of towels. We had excellent maid service each day and definitely no bed bugs! The location is pretty good. Walking distance to most areas including Time Square and Central Park. The station being next door is also a bonus. We also ate at the hotels steakhouse which was pricey but well worth the money. Drinks were very expensive but we found this everywhere so we didnt mind. I would recommend this hotel and definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & room-Poor Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: TravelerLosGatos
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt New York. The location is GREAT! We were upgraded to a huge suite as well as the Regency Club because my husband is a Diamond member of Hyatt.
