Our suite was furnished very nicely and updated. The only fault I could find at this location was the housekeeping. When we arrived there was hair all over the floor in the bathroom. The next day when housekeeping came to clean, the hair was still there! If it wasn't for that, I would have rated this hotel as excellent. The room, location. and the staff in the Regency Club and hotel front desk were excellent (except for housekeeping)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Matthew27
Reviews.Content: Spent Easter in New York at the Grand Hyatt right next to Grand Central Station for my husband's birthday. Could not fault the hotel at all, staff very helpful and friendly, great location, room was lovely, huge big bed, very clean. New York was brilliant, first visit to New York, been to America many times before. Weather was great, really warm, did all the usual tourist sites, one of my favourite places was Grand Central Station, especially the Oyster Bar, just call in and have a drink at the bar, it really is worth it. Will definitely go back to New York, even though we were there four five days there is still a lot to see.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: floridalover95
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughters and I stayed at the Hyatt on April 21-22 for one night, I was a little hesitatant about the hotel after reading mixed reviews. Good thing I didn't read the one about bed bugs. Our stay was a pleasant one. I did check the beds for bed bugs upon arrival, it's one of my fears, they appeared to be clean. The beds and linnens were comfortable. The room was small and the bathroom was also small but anyone who has been to NYC knows that's pretty standard unless you upgrade your room and spend more money, that wasn't important to us. The location was central to our needs, I could do without the congestion of Grand Central Station. The restaurants in the hotel were too pricey, the Pershing Cafe across the street was great for breakfast. For dinner Tony Dinapoli's in Time Square was great for families good food and great prices. Overall the Hotel was a safe clean place to sleep at a resonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Zadok99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in April and simply have to rate this hotel as execllent. The decor may be a bit aged but the service was simply outstanding. The recognition and service was everything one expects as a top tier gold passport member. This hotel is outstanding. Hint: When the Grand Hyatt is fully booked an alternative is the Hyatt Regency Jersey City just across the river in New Jersey. A one stop $1.50 ride on the PATH train from the WTC station gets you there and it provides a different but spectacular view of the Manhatten skyline and a very much reduced price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: berryhappy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at the Grand Hyatt. Overall our stay was good. We arrived at 5pm and our room was ready. We went up to our regular King size room and after looking around the room discovered that it really wasn't clean, rice on the floor, jelly beans in the corners and hair on the bathroom floor. My husband called and we were immediately changed to another room plus given breakfast coupons $60 value. Upon entering our new room we discovered that we were upgraded to a Deluxe King. The bathroom was twice as large and the room was bigger too, two windows instead of one. The remainder of our stay was great. The proximity to GCT is great. We took advantage of the restaurants, market and subways. Getting a taxi was never a problem, if there is a line, walk a 1/2 block and flag your own.

Reviews.Title: “Generally a great hotel..”
Reviews.Author: LondonMrs_B
Reviews.Content: My finace and I have just returned from 5 days in New York, staying at the Grand Hyatt. We flew with Virgin once again and had no problems at all with flights, transfers etc. Everything very well orgainised. The hotel is massive, with large lobby and check in was very easy. We were not so impressed with the room, although it was very clean and tidy. As the other reviewers have said, the bathrooms are tiny! No space to put anything around the sink etc, and we bought quite a lot of bits! And having a bath was like sitting in a washing up bowl! Our room was interconnecting which was a bit of a pain. On the first night, after a long flight, we had to endure listening to our neighbours yapping away very loudly, hearing every word as if they were sitting next to us, so by 1.30am, I had to go next door and ask them to keep the noise down, so after that it was fine. There is a lovely bar on the lobby level, and breakfast (buffet) was great every morning too. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The hotel is a great base. Near all the attractions - walking distance from the Empire State Building, Central Park, Macy's, 5th Ave etc. The shopping is fantastic - spent a fortune!! We also had a lovely meal at Planet Hollywood in Times Square and jumped in a taxi to Ground Zero which was very eerie. We would personally try a different hotel next time, but would still recommend the Hyatt to others for service and location.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt in December on our honeymoon. We were very impressed with the Hyatt, and we will definately stay there again! Our room for big for a NYC hotel room, and it was always well cleaned and stocked up with the necessities. The lobby was beautiful, and we never waited more than 15 seconds for an elevator! The concierge was extrememly helpful by finding us great restaurants and making reservations for us. You can't beat the location of the Hyatt! We were there during the Transit Strike, so we were happy to be within easy walking distance to Macy's, Time's Square, Rockefeller Center, and 5th Avenue. Highly recommend the Hyatt!!!

Reviews.Title: “I have no idea why all the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews. I have read tripadvisor reviews for years though. I was very apprehensive about this hotel after the reviews here and the reason I write now is to put others at ease who may feel the same way. We had an excellent experience at the Grand Hyatt New York, winning our room for $150/night on Priceline. I signed up for the Gold Passport and emailed my preferences per the PL website directly to Hyatt. I was told that PL customers were assigned rooms with one double bed. However, I was also told that they would enter my request. The Hyatt customer service agent who emailed me was courteous and helpful. The day of check in we were flying all day from the west coast so I called in the morning on 1-800 CHECKIN, asked if possible to request two beds. I was given my room number and when we checked in, it took all of three minutes to get the keys and find that indeed our request had been honored. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. We asked a maintenance man to point out where the walkway to Grand Central was and he physically walked us over there so we knew exactly where it was. The room was perfect. Two double beds, the most comfortable either my daughter or I had ever slept on in a hotel (and we travel ALOT!), gorgeous view of the Chrysler Building, and clean. This is New York people - rooms are SMALLLLL!!!!!!!!!! Bathrooms too! If you travel much to NY, you know this. Upon checking out, we stored our bags with the bell desk with no problems whatsoever. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is in a perfect location to reach all the highlights of the city. If I had to find a negative, it would be that there was a tiny bit of mold on the ceiling in the bathroom. That's it. Otherwise, the experience for us was wonderful. I hope this review helps some of the apprehensive folks like myself who keep reading the reviews that pick this place apart. When I get a $400/night room for $150/night, I am happy.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice at the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: VacationPlanner
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to New York City and our first time at the Grand Hyatt. I was well aware of some of the shortcomings of this property from previous reviews, but we managed to obtain a very good rate, so we decided to give it a try. Upon arriving we were impressed with the lobby area and the bank of speedy elevators. Our room was a deluxe king and was sufficient size wise for NYC. With a rollaway it was comfortable enough for the three of us, not large but sufficient. Decor was nice and the room was very clean. The location of the hotel is probably the best thing going for it. Right at Grand Central Terminal for easy access to the metro system and a convenient walk to many midtown locations. Service from the front desk and housekeeping was professional. We received coupons for free coffee from the kisok located in the lobby which was great in the morning Negatives as noted in other reviews are the tiny bathrooms with no counter space, lack of a refrigerator and the noise from adjacent rooms, you can hear just about any conversation next door, ours were from two sides. I think if I were paying rack rate I wouldn't be very happy here, but with our discounted rate it was perfectly fine and I would stay again under the same circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Very overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Never having stayed at a Hyatt before I was expecting more for the money. Granted there were four of us in a room, but for the amount of money you pay at least let's have a decent size bed - there are double beds and double beds it would seem! (do they think we are all slim and short?). Apart from not having enough towels, shampoos, soaps etc where on earth do you put your clothes and suitcases for four people!! You get more room in a youth hostel. Also felt the room was not cleaned that great. Being treated by some rude Hyatt personnel when putting the suitcase in storage for a couple of hours also added to an overall feeling of being treated like 'just another Jo from out of town'. Of course I am sure if you can afford one room you are probably treated like royalty. The splendour of the entrance/foyer should be cut back and more put into pleasing people (us regular Jo's)and the 'Amentities' on the Hyatt web site is a bit of a joke - nothing different than what you get in a Sandman Inn! (isn't a hairdyer, clock, table, TV etc the norm?). Overall, disappointed. oh yes - the shower fell apart as well. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms, poor design and service”
Reviews.Author: Elodie&Nicolas
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel, close to Grand Central and just a few blocks from Times Square. Rooms were clean and spacious. Bathroom OK, though there was mould on the ceiling, which is quite unexpected in a Hyatt. New furniture (the hotel management seems very proud of the side-tables and the bed-frames), but in an old room (wallpapers need to be changed). Lack of service (no bathrobes, we had to carry our luggage to our room, etc.). OK but not more (for a Hyatt).

Reviews.Title: “good base for shopping”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hyatt for three nights the staff were very helpful the room clean and the bed was very very comfortable . It is right next to Grand Central and a great place to use as a base for shopping and sight seeing at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year”
Reviews.Author: 12singlemum
Reviews.Content: As a single mother with 3 well behaved children this trip to New York was a big thing for us all especially as my son has Downs Syndrome. The first thing that struck us when we arrived end of Dec. 05 was the beautiful entrance and waterfall and all the wonderful Christmas decorations. Very impressive. Everyone was very kind and helpful. It was in the best situation ever with many of the sights within easy walking distance and the station right next door. Because it was a city I wasnt expecting the grandness of rooms one would expect from a beach hotel of the same rating and I guess it was a little basic. I was told that the hotel had sold our room to someone else when I arrived so would not be getting a room with two double beds but a room with an extra king size bed instead. I was not too happy about this as I did not fancy sharing a bed with 4 children the eldest who is bigger than I am but then I am only 5'2". She ended up on a folding bed and found it very comfortable and where it was placed she recieved her privacy. Room was cleaned beautifully and so was the washroom. Happy all round. When it came to my sons special needs no staff could have been nicer. Happy memories.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: QOE
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay and I look forward to staying there again. The best thing about the Grand Hyatt is it's location - close to everything and attached to Grand Central Terminal - which makes for easy travel if you're taking the subway and offers shopping and dining choices galore. Note: there is a subway shuttle from Grand Central to Times Square which is heaven sent in bad weather. The staff were polite, helpful and accommodating, even when we called to complain about the temperature in the room. The rooms are small by my standards but more than adequate with comfortable beds and a large closet. Our room faced the Chrysler building and the East river and we appreciated the opening window. Room service is prohibitively priced but the Pershing Cafe across the street provides an excellent breakfast, as others have said. We did eat the breakfast buffet in the hotel($29) once and it was very good but not worth doing every morning. The business center was very helpful and the internet service ($.50 per minute) was very good. Final cudos for the hotel: we checked out at 3 am and had no trouble at all getting a bellman or a desk clerk or a doorman (who stayed with us until our car arrived!). A good choice for New York City tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: pinky7654
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt has bedbugs!! I realized that after my fiancee and I stayed there in Sept. and I developed dozens of red welts all over my body. Later I find out that they were bedbug bites and they got into my luggage and in my bed at home!! $1,500 in exterminator fees later, here I am. DO NOT BOOK HERE EVER!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: LesleyHk
Reviews.Content: Bland best describes this hotel. Rooms are basic, no mini bar or basic refreshment facilities in the room. Vending machine on the floor did not work either. Small windows, dark rooms. Just very ordinary. Definitly not five star, more like a 2 - 3 star suburban hotel. One upside though ... the new beds are VERY comfortable. So if the only thing you want from your hotel is sleep, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Employees Ruin Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Meursault
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to the hotel after a prolonged flight, I approached the check-in desk late at night and was met by a dumb-founded woman employee who only stared at me, said absolutely nothing and gave me a "New York I'm tougher than you look". I asked if I could check in and she was startled. I went up to my room with a bad impression of the place. The rooms themselves are quite comfortable, although small, being decorated in a dark tone. The bathroom is very limited as well but one really gets used to the entire place after a few days. Beds are big and very comfy, a small desk is nearby as well. The problem I have is the "stand offish" attitude of everyone who works there, most notably the "goon squad" security who wear leisure suits and squeek to each other with ear piece devices every time you walk up the escalators. I didn't even eat there or hang around the lobby to not arouse the 'suspicion' of "paranoid' employees. In all, the location is very good and the rooms are functional but the service is a big let down and I will always remember that I was not greeted.

Reviews.Title: “A solid B grade”
Reviews.Author: 285WAS
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed there Presidents Day weekend. I don't think you can get a much better location in NYC for under $200. Yes the hotel is huge and somewhat impersonal but I expect that in properties this size. We had a standard room with a king bed. I love the beds at Hyatt hotels and this one was no different. The room was good except two things. The bathroom was so small I felt crowded in there by myself. There barely enough room to put your toothpaste down the sink was so small. The other problem was that it was on the north side of the building and while it was quiet as can be, it was also like living in a cave. You basically had to get next to the window and look up 10-15 stoies to see if it was sunny out. Monday morning we cracked open the window and were overwelmed with the smell of food from what I think was the banquet kitchen. We parked a few blocks away and payed about half of what it would have cost to park at the hotel. We did not eat at the hotel but like previous reviews state, you can walk right down to the Grand Central food court. We hit the Starbucks down there all 3 mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 stars!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A great location, however, the walls are PAPER thin and we could hear every word from the adjacent rooms. The location is great, but there were a few problems. We stayed on March 1-3, the temperature outside was in the 20's, and the HEAT WAS TURNED OFF from 11 pm to 4 am for pipe maintenance. WE FROZE. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Not a 4 star. If you are able to book a room for under $150 , it might be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: teech83
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel up on PL for $130 a night and was slightly worried by some previous less than enthusiastic reviews. Was knocked out by this place. It was fabulous. Room we got was on the 28 floor facing inward so street noise was no problem. Daylight was in short supply as the quad of space outside was quite narrow. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel especially if you can pick it up for <$150 on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Hyatt is very Nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: uncletony
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Grand Central Feb 9th - 14th with my wife and 29-year-old daughter. Booked thru Expedia and paid in advance. We were put in Room 2266 which was furnished just as I'd booked, two double-beds. The beds were lovely and the linen clean and crisp. But in the nooks, crannies and behind the easy chair lots of fluff, dust and half-chewed childrens candy! Couldn't have been vacuumed for ages. Bathroom was good and clean - washstand is kind of small, but the towels were nice and fluffy. Plenty of hot water. Housekeeping was OK, but with a different lady on duty on alternate days. One was physically so small she wasn't able to reach the bathroom shelf to put new face cloths, so on her duty days we didn't get any! Bed-making techniques varied between the ladies, one gave us sheets so tightly tucked in it hurt your toes, the other made it so loose that everything rolled off the bed within minutes of getting in! Good size TV in the room with plenty of channels and pay movies. The room has a window that we could actually open and there is easy access to the room climate controller. Disappointingly there was no coffee/tea making facility or an in-room fridge (mini-bar). Two telephones. Don't know about internet access. The lobby was busy all the time we were there - several conferences and meetings on going. We had breakfast once in the restaurant - comprehensive buffet style but expensive (about $30 each). We bought our breakfasts from the Dining Concourse at Grand Central and brought them back to the room. At checkout the bill is slid under the door the night before. Checkout can be done via the TV or in the lobby at the desk or by computer terminal. Very efficient. For a limo to the airport see the Taxi Captain at the front door (the guy with the biggest hat!) - he fixed a price of $60 + tunnel toll + tip to JFK. You'll have to allow about hour-and-half minimum, longer after 3:30pm, to get there. Entrance to the hotel is on E42nd St next to Grand Central Terminus and very close to the Chrysler Building. It is probably the best located hotel in mid-town Manhattan. Would we go back. Yes, 100% for sure. uncletony, aberdeen, Scotland, UK

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not Grand - just OK”
Reviews.Author: 1WelshDragon
Reviews.Content: If you like your hotels big, bland and Corporate then this place could be for you. Having arrived from a stay at the Intercontinental Hotel in Chicago the change in service level was immediate and never improved. Its not that the staff were rude - it just seemed that they couldn't be bothered. The room however was very good, it was clean with adequate bathroom facilities. I had requested a quiet room(mine was on the 20th floor)which seemed to work as the room was quiet with no interconnecting door to the next room and traffic noise was not a problem. The decor on the way to the room was awful - dirty brown walls,dirty brown carpet and dirty brown door to the room - come on Hyatt cheer the place up!! By the time I'd asked for an extended check out time on the last day when the bored answer came back that we are fully booked today - by then I couldn't be bothered to argue and myself and my colleages just booked our bags later into the bored bell staff. Having read all the reports on this hotel on Tripadvisor I knew I should have changed our reservations there does seem to be a theme in a lot of the reviews. In conclusion this hotel does have a great location and if you get a good or discounted room rate - go for it and it will be OK. I'm going back to New York hopefully in a months time and will not be staying at the Hyatt. Happy Travelling

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Thad
Reviews.Content: his is a very good hotel. It looks like a grand New York hotel, with lots of marble and grand open spaces in the lobby. The staff was helpful, professional and friendly and had no problem with letting us check in early and check out late. My wife and I stayed for two nights and had no problems. The room is small, probably under 200 square feet, but it was clean and furnished on good modern style. The bathroom was fairly spacious. The hotel doesn't believe in giving much away free, so beyond the off-brand soap and shampoo there wasn't a lot available. No coffee maker in the room, but that coffee is usually awful in hotels, so I didn't miss it. And food in the hotel restaurant is pricey, but you can get to the Grand Central food court without going outside if you object to paying $15 for a bowl of oatmeal. As other posters have note, the rooms get very hot, but the windows open to help cool you down. Wi-fi is $10 a day and they charge even for toll-free calls. Great location, very good hotel. No real complaints, and I was there during the biggest blizzard to hit New York in years. If the staff can handle that with grace, they can handle anything.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me”
Reviews.Author: DanBrown
Reviews.Content: I hotwired a rate at the Grand Hyatt at the beginning of February for 4 nights. My rate was around $120 before taxes. For this fabulous internet rate, I expected the room that I got, but it was not bad. I was on the 28th floor in a room across from the soda/ice machines. These machines could only be heard faintly in the early evening. I had an interior room that looked onto other rooms. The room was small, but clean and perfect for 1-2 people. The linens were nice and the furniture new. I as there for a tradeshow, so by the time I got back to my room, I was exhausted and settled in for the night. There were lots of food options in Grand Central including a fresh market on Lexington that I visited every morning. I would stay here again if I could get that rate.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: dan_pablo
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in NYC for a solid month. A customer was paying the cost so I should not complain too much. I had trouble sleeping. They installed very strong door closing springs in the door hinges. The springs are designed to close the doors HARD. I can't sleep through the noise of doors getting slammed shut every 10, 20, or 30 minutes. I'll try to avoid the Grand Hyatt (and other Hyatts). -moi

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: Phil2016
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Grand Hyatt. Room on the 22nd floor; huge. Largest room I've ever had in Manhattan (though like most hotels I imagine there is a spread of what you get there). Bathroom was small, but not abnormal for NYC standards. Great location; very close to Grand Central. Pershing Square restaurant across the street provides a good, laid back meal option. Best part of the hotel is the fitness center. Sufficient treadmills and bikes, machine and free weights (dumbbells) even at 5:30 when I would go each night. What was amazing is that it is FREE! Talk about a rarity. Only three complaints: (1) The bathroom never really got cleaned to the standard I expect, especially from a Grand Hyatt, at arrival and during my stay. (2) As someone else mentioned, if you get an adjoining door room, you will hear everything next to you, and that means they can hear you too. (3) I thought the doormen were below par for NYC. Not very engaging or outgoing, and sometimes non-existent. I should point out that I won the hotel through Priceline for $130/night. Quite a bargain, and yet was still given a nice sized non-smoking King room.

Reviews.Title: “Everything that you could need”
Reviews.Author: georgiebest7
Reviews.Content: This was my third ocassion to stay at the Hyatt on business and I have to say I love the place. The reception staff are effecient and pleasant, bell boys very friendly, the hotel public areas are clean, the bedrooms spotless, room service was acceptable (45min wait on 2 nights, but I wasn't in a hurry anyway) and the restaurant was exceptional (great service, hot food and a very tasty meal). Their business services are excellent, T-Mobile Wi-Fi actually works effectively unlike other hotels and all in all a fantastic location matched by a superb product. Not only will I be back, but I'm actually looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time At the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our arrival in NYC coincided with the transportation strike. We had a great time nonetheless. We vacationed there from Dec. 20-24. Through it all, the foks at the Grandy Hyatt worked extremely hard to keep everyone happy though they were short-staffed (We saw managers helping clean rooms). As it was, one of our breakfast waiters had walked into work, starting at 4:30 a.m.--and he was as excellent and as good-humored as could be. We thought the hotel was beautiful and the rooms nicely done, though not huge. We had two double beds in our room--for myself, my wife, and our two daughters, ages 8 and 9. We walked most everywhere we went anyway, one of the benefits of the hotel's location. We had purchased Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular tickets through the hotel, whose staff were extremely helpful in the process. The girls loved going with me to the fitness room (it took the sting, for them, out of the fact the GH has no indoor pool). We had a lovely, and historic, time in NYC and would go back and stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “shady booking practices”
Reviews.Author: lovesevlis
Reviews.Content: This hotel has always been my hotel of choice in NYC. However, the past few times I have stayed here, I've had problems. In March '05 booked a double room, only to find four of us in 1 room with one king size bed. Managemetn sent in cots that crowded the room and were uncomfortable, even for my young children. Upon arrival I valet parked my car (less 2000 miles on it) w/the hotel attendant. When it was returned to me, the back quarter panel was smashed ($1300 damage.) The parking attendants insisted I brought the car in that way. I sought the hotel manager who told me the hotel wasn't responsible, parking is handled by an independent company. The company insisted we did the damage. No one was interested in this problem. We had a paid reciept showing THE GRAND HYATT NY was paid for this service, not another company. My husband wouldn't lie down and eventually (2 months later) the hotel reimbursed us the $1300. I felt they (albeit after a lot of phone calls and pushing) did o.k. by us. Went again Aug 05 and had no problems. The last visit we had the same issue with the bedding. Four of us arrived and we were given a king room. I insisted at the front desk and was told there were no doubles to be had. I ended up paying for a second room so we could sleep comfortably. This hotel doesn't guarantee bed type. It turned out this past weekend that all the double rooms had been booked in Oct for some dance recital/workshop. Why they continued to take reservations for a double room is beyond my understanding, but they did. The cost was pushed onto me and my family. They did nothing to help defer it. In fact, they suggested if cost and a double room was an issue, that I stay in Jersey City. Give me a break and give me a real solution!!! My final conclusion, after multiple stays in this hotel, is that they're tightening their belt, taking in all the cash they can and they've implemented some shady practices. As far as the room itself goes,it could have been cleaner but it was fine. I'm sorry that I didn't take a picture of the cot so I could post it here. But if you've ever slept on a springy cot, you'll know it's like. If there are four in your party, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not so grand...”
Reviews.Author: kmhogue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, right next to Grand Central Station. However, I booked a non-smoking room with two double beds. I received a room with a king bed and had to ask for a roll-a-way. The rooms are small. Also my non-smoking room smelled extremely smokey! I complained when we checked in, but they said they were all booked up. I then asked them to send up someone from housekeeping with some air freshener. They said okay, but no one ever came. I think the housekeeping staff was smoking in the room when they came in to make up the room, because it smelled worse every night when we returned to the room. Also, on two occasions I tried to call the front desk and it rang 10-15 times and the operator would pick up and transfer me back to the desk. Upon transfer, it would ring 10-15 times again, then back to the operator. Overall this hotel looks nice in the lobby and is rated 4 star, but it really does not have 4 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a really classy hotel. As guests we were treated very well. The room was quite sufficient for our needs and surprisingly roomy. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. It is in an excellent location as almost everything is in walking distance. It is located next to the Grand Central Terminal. The only complaint is that the walls are thin and you can hear conversations of other guests. Other than that we would stay at this hotel in an heart-beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: audreydoll
Reviews.Content: We booked the Grand Hyatt for a weekend stay and were very pleased with the results. We arrived around noon and requested a non-smoking king room. There were none available but they let us check our bags (at no charge) and said they would register us for this room type as soon as one was ready. The clerk was very friendly and we saw no negative attitude because it was a Priceline reservation. When we returned around 5:00, they gave us a very nice room on a high floor. The size and cleanliness of the room and the bathroom were great. On the day of checkout, the bill was slipped under the door and we used the video check-out, very quick and easy. Overall, the Grand Hyatt and its staff exceeded my expectations and I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Hyatt is GRAND!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 enjoyed Christmas 2005 at the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central Station in NYC. The streets were hustling and bustling, and construction was in full swing outside the hotel, but once we entered...pure opulence and peace and quiet. The room was very lovely, and extremely clean. The lobby was absolutely magnificent!!! We were able to walk to many sites from the Grand Hyatt, and would highly recommend it to everyone - book early for the best deals!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, no temp control”
Reviews.Author: TravelingRoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. I was surprised to have to grab my bags out of the taxi myself and schlep them in on my own. Usually I am always greeted by a doorman who will help. They just stood around and watched. So for service - none. I was very impressed by the bedding, down comforter, which I didn't need because the room was hotter than #*%@, even with a window open and the thermostat set on 60 degrees!!! The bathroom was very clean, towels soft and fluffy. Excellent location next to Grand Central and can easily walk or take the shuttle to Times Square. Be sure to visit the Grand Central Market for excellent food that can be taken back to the room and there is also a wine shop around the corner. A good stay if you don't mind the sub-par curb service.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please make sure that you take note of my review on this hotel. Booked a room with 2 double beds, only to arrive and find that I was getting one double with a small camp bed being added later in the day. The room was small, bleak and not even big enough for two people let alone three. Actually complained and got a larger room but still with a camp bed. Kids running up and down the corridors in the early hours of the morning. The hotel staff are not friendly and the housekeepers can't add up. Everyday, only towels for two people where left in the room. You open the windows and get the smell of cheap street food from the little stands on the streets below. Our best day in this hotel was the last one when we where going. Just listen to my advice! Stay away from this hotel and you won't go far wrong and you'll save yourself plenty of money. Bye New York!

Reviews.Title: “Not so impressed”
Reviews.Author: Joshuauk
Reviews.Content: Did not like the room small, had a bad in ceiling leak from above which had mould. Connecting door noisy neighbours and no view, extremely small shower toilet. We were there for 2 nights so complained on checkout which fell on deaf ears. Staff friendly and helpful, great location but very dissapointing, would not stay there again unless a bigger room and better view. Restaurant extremely expensive use farmers market in Grand Central and bring some truly lovely food back to you room or get breakfast in a diner or Grand Central.

Reviews.Title: “Decent service, outragous parking, small room”
Reviews.Author: skadujiddra
Reviews.Content: The room: decent, small, comfortable bed. horrible view, The service: room service was poor. the check in was very unfriendly - by nyc standards. The concierge excellent - warmly recommended The parking BEWARE. $48/day. made the mistake of not moving the car immediately. live and learn Price / value 7 (max 10) I might return, but will not actively seek this place

Reviews.Title: “it is the grand hyatt”
Reviews.Author: gazzam1311
Reviews.Content: just spent three nights at the grand hyatt .a fantastic location right next to grand central with a fabulous lobby,the rooms were large ,very clean and the beds were heavenly,just beware of having a room with a connecting door to another room because if you get someone noisy next to you you can hear everything.this happened to us but they moved us straight away.but this could be a problem if the hotel was fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Grand-- January 5-9, 2006”
Reviews.Author: aneedrummergirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to stay at the Grand Hyatt New York for our first trip to the Big Apple. We purchased a package online and got a pretty good rate for our flight and hotel. Our flight from LAX was a red-eye, so we got to the hotel a little after 7AM. The doorman greeted us, took our bags, and directed us towards the front desk. He informed us that check in was at 3PM, but we could always try and see if there was anything available. Luckily, there was a clean + vacant room ready for us. We took our bags to the elevators and went up to the 16th floor (the 6th floor, actually-- floor numbers 1-13 are skipped and there are 3 levels of convention rooms before the guestroom floors). Our request for a king bed was accomodated, but our request for a view was not. Not a biggie, though. We were just happy to have a room at 8AM so we could nap. The room itself was big enough for the two of us-- there was a desk (with phone), a TV center (below the TV was a armoire with drawers and a small safe), a chaise, a closet, full bath (vanity/sink area was a little small), 2 nightstands (each with a lamp, one with a phone), and of course, the bed. I found the bed to be quite comfy-- my boyfriend thought it was too hard. The computerized wake-up calls were always on time and reliable. New York Times newspaper delievery is on weekdays only, so we only got one paper during our stay. Housekeeping was sufficient-- our room never lacked any toilettries, towels, etc. The AC/Heating system worked fine. We never had any technical problems with the room. My boyfriend ate breakfast in the hotel once (at the Sky Bar). If I remember correctly, the breakfast was a buffet with 3 price ranges: $15 for pastries, milk, juice, etc. $18 for the stuff previoulsy mentioned plus a little extra (continental breakfast). $25 for omelet station, cereal, oatmeal? Not sure on the details. I wasn't in the mood to spend $15 for a croissant and muffin, so I headed down to Grand Central Terminal's food court and grabbed a quick bite to eat there. Odd thing about the Sky Bar-- with a name like that, one would think that it would be on a high hotel floor and... be a bar, correct? Nope, it closed everyday at 2PM and was on the 2nd floor. I was looking forward to having a place to get a few drinks with a nice view-- unfortunately, the Sky Bar was not the place. We did get a few drinks in at the bar for Commodore Grill, the hotel's full service restaurant. Drinks were a little steep ($11 for Baileys on the rocks, $11 for vodka tonic [Absolut], and $8 for a pint of Guinness), but nothing out of the ordinary for a hotel bar. Our bartender was nice and we talked baseball for a bit (He was a Yankees fan, we rubbed in how the Angels kicked their butts). The hotel operators need to cheer up a bit-- or at least pretend that they don't hate their jobs when they take a call. No one would help us print out boarding passes for our flight (Concierge + the Business Center were closed, but alternatives were not given to us at all), the Mailroom wanted to charge me $0.49 to mail out ONE postcard... domestically! They claimed that there was a "seasonal" rate of $0.44/postcard... plus, since they had to "run it through their machine" a $0.05/postcard fee would be charged as well. I just walked to a nearby store, bought some stamps, applied them to my cards, and dropped them into a mailbox. The morning of check-out, we had a $353 charge for room service... something that we didn't order. Upon further investigation, the Front Desk adjusted off the fee. My boyfriend was charged $1/half-minute for internet services in the Business Center, but at least we got our boarding passes taken care of before we got to the airport. Overall, the hotel was OK. It was in a good location (connected to Grand Central Station), the lobby was nice, and most of the staff was nice as well. I would probably stay elsewhere for my next visit, though.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 nights over xmas and new year and I must say that it really was an excellent hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times. The room was very large and the bed extremely comfortable. Room service was rather expensive, however you would only really need it if you really didn't want to venture out at all as you could easily nip across the road to pershing square for coffee or food or down to the bar for your own drinks if you didn't want to pay the rather large service charge. As this hotel is attached to central station it is very handy for travelling anywhere in the city and also has the added bonus of having all the station shops etc right on your doorstep. Don't ever eat breakfast here though! Go to pershing square across the road as the hotel breakfast is not only expensive but it is also not very good (buffet!)

Reviews.Title: “GRAND HYATT -- NO - NO- NO - JUST DONT DO IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Devski
Reviews.Content: I took 3 of my good friends to the "5 STAR"?????? Hyatt for some pre-Christmas shopping - I have been to New York several times before but stayed at 3/4 star places - I thought this time I would push the boat out! This place is a nightmare and the staff are the rudest people on earth! We booked our visit 4 months in advance and booked an executive suite with 2 double beds (we are two couples)... I emailed the concierge explaining I was coming to show off the worlds most amazing city to my very excited friends... they confirmed all the details ( I also rang just incase and they confirmed the confirmation!)... We arrived to find that the hotel was overbooked and they only had 1 room with a kingsize bed left for the 4 of us to share... when I suggested that as we were 4 adults this would not do, the Front Desk Manager suggested we take turns to sleep on the floor... there were 8 people at the desk with the same complaint!! We were advised that we would be put on a waiting list for a twin double and as soon as our name hit the top we would be moved - it turned out that there were 38 names on the list - some staying 7 nights (God Bless them).... When I explained that this just was not on he said he did have another room that we could have if we paid him an extra $200 per night... He laughed in our faces when I explianed I had twice confirmed the booking and advised that they did not have anywhere for me to access my email account to show him the confirmation mail... This hotel is not 5 star - it is the worst place I have ever stayed and I would advise anyone to think very carefully before booking into this sham of a place.... I do, however, still LOVE NEW YORK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Devmcc
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel ever - the staff are the rudest people I have ever encountered! Booked a room - all confirmed twice - turned up and the place was overbooked - we had to go 4 to a room with 2 of us taking the floor - what an absolute joke - Desk Manager and receptionist laughed in our faces! Thirty people all in wrong rooms - all complaining .. all being laughed at! Happy Holidays! Trays in all the corridors - can't believe this has any good reviews... must be okay till you have a problem... First time in New York - Last Time in the Hyatt! Please dont book this for anything special.

Reviews.Title: “The worse price quality relation I ever had.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to NY to spend 4 days of my honeymoon, booked Grand Hyatt because I tought it was first class hotel, big mistake, expensive (over $500)and doesn't worth the money. The worse price quality relation I ever had. The hotel is old and the housekeeping is bad. I had three rooms in 4 nights. First room 5 minutes, the sheets were dirty. Second room one night, similar to the first, had 2 comunicating doors it seemed that I had someone inside my room. Third room ok, old as the others but big. Housekeeping bad, fortunately the carpet is dark and you can't see the dirt. Dont trust the concierge they are arranged with some limo companies, I had a problem with the transfer, I asked for help and they told me they had nothing to do with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas in the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Olandea
Reviews.Content: Christmas 2005 was going to be different in our book!! We were going to New York with our 'not-so-young' children.... We looked at hundreds of hotels in NY and picked out four possibly suitable venues. Reading through the reviews with Trip Advisor we were impressed with what we read about the Grand Hyatt. I made contact with one of the Managers before our arrival and requested a high floor and large adjoining rooms. We were not disappointed... we were placed on the 28th floor and our rooms were really very spacious.[From what I read this is unusual for NY] We found the staff helpful, the lobby was beautifully dressed for the occasion and our Christmas dinner was as traditional as you wanted. It is perfectly situated with access to Central Station within the building, offering shopping and a wide variety of restaurants. 5th Ave and so much more is just a short stroll away. There were only two negative points; 1. We had requested two beds and a roll-out in the childrens room... there was a king bed there on arrival but they did provide a roll-out for our daughter on request and the king bed was big enough to accommodate the two boys. [The room was so large there was no problem adding the extra bed] 2. The Sky Bar, which they advertise in a big way was not open during our stay. We feel that these were minor problems and did not stop our enjoyment of our 'Christmas with a difference'. We had a wonderful holiday and would certainly return to the Grand Hyatt and all it has to offer. O'Dowd Family, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “A good place to start”
Reviews.Author: cook0005
Reviews.Content: We managed to get two adjoining rooms at this hotel at a reasonable price by booking much earlier in the year. We turned up on the last day of the transit strike to find the negotiations going on at the hotel itself- the camera crews were not for us! The entrance lobby is impressive in size and was decked out for Xmas. Checking in was swift (get one of those gold passports, they really do help). The corridors are drab and faceless, and really let the place down. The rooms were adequate in size, and the beds extremely comfortable. No problems with room service. Didn't eat or drink here, too pricey. Grand central is right next door and a great place to start the day with breakfast. Nearly everything tourists want to see is on walking distance, and those that aren't easily walked to are accessible by the nearby subway. Overall, a good place to stay and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location good VFM”
Reviews.Author: Mark&Nic
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt New York is the best of the three hotels that my wife and I have stayed in in the city over the past 5 years! It's location is it's best attribute, it is right next to Grand Central station, with all of the transport connections that you could want. Trains, Subway, Taxis, Airport shuttle, busses all terminate at the station. It's central geographic location in Midtown is perfect for Times Square, Empire State, Maceys, And the newly opened Top of the Rock at the Rockerfeller Centre. (Much better than the Empire State) Reception was excellent, however, despite the xmas decorations, the lobby looks dull and uninviting. Concierge was excellent and directed us to a superb pizza place. Bell hops were a bit up themselves and almost grabbed your bags and held them to ransome for a tip! I'm English and I did not like that! Stuff was going off over new year and one of the bars seemed to be closed for private partys for our entire stay. I thought that this was a bit off for a 5 star hotel and would have liked to have a drink overlooking 42nd street just once during my 4 day stay. A wedding on closed the bar again on new years eve, even though it seemed to be empty for the whole evening. we failed to get into Times Square and resorted to the back bar for a few drinks and had to suffer the lack of seats, dark environment and very high prices. OK for one drink but not good for 5 hours! Room was smallish, but excellent. We stayed on the 25th floor and it was very quiet. Nice bath/shower combo and marble tiles. HVAC was a pain, we had to set it at 40 degrees or it cooked you. We even had to open a window one night. Massive TV, good phone system, NY Times every morning. Everything was spotless, except the lobby toilets that really needed a clean, especially after new year. Did not eat in the hotel as the prices are steep! We reccommend the station next door for a cheap excellent breakfast, or the Pershing cafe accross the road for somthing a bit special in the breakfast department. (pancakes are the best in the world as advertised!) All in all, great hotel, not too expensive, in the most perfect position on Manhatten. Cheers. Mark, Nic, Jon & Helen. Nottingham UK.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from the 16th December, went with my wife. We both absolutely loved New York and the hotel, the hotel is walking distance to all attractions, Rockefeller centre, Times Square, Empire state building, Central park (we had a ride in the horse carriage too, very romantic), Fifth avenue. The hotel itself was great, the lobby was massive had waterfalls as soon as you walk in, checking in and out was no problem, the room itself was big for a standard, had massive bed, heating was ok, big TV, shower and bath good, had a safe too. Being right next to Grand Central station was a bonus they do very nice food in the food court. Also New York just seemed very safe to be walking around at night, never felt uneasy walking around late at night. Our flight was at 11pm so the hotel had a service to check in luggage, if you use this service a good tip would be to go downstairs with luggage before 11am as it does get busy. We will be going back to New York again soon and will be staying at the same hotel, no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: TexAg_83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I selected the Grand Hyatt for our third annual trip to NYC based upon location, price, and the reviews on this site. Overall, we observed: Location: Overall good. A bit more walking distance to some attractions when compared to other hotels that are located west, closer to 5th Avenue or Times Square. Very convenient to subway at Grand Central Station. Good selection of restaurants within easy walking distance including those in the terminal itself. Room: Very good. Spacious by NYC standards, clean, and comfortable. Wireless T-Mobile internet was a big plus for me. The bath was a reasonable size although counterspace was limited. We were on the 29th floor and there was no real view out the functional windows. Heat/Air worked fine - no complaints. Common areas/lobby: The lobby is large and attractive with waterfall and various seating areas. There are two bars, one of which was closed during most if not all of our trip. There is also a restaurant. We enjoyed our one meal there and frequented the bar on most evenings as well. They offer a good selection of draft beers but be prepared for NYC pricing here - $7 to $8 per beer. Service: No issues. We were checked in and out without difficulty or delay even considering that were we there during the week before Christmas and during the transit strike. Management offered daily updates on the strike with our complimentary copy of the NY Times. Overall: For the amount we were able to book this trip (major internet travel website), the hotel was an outstanding bargain. I have paid almost three times the amount and was less satisfied. For those (including us) that prefer to spend a little less on the room and a little more enjoying shows, shopping, etc., the Grand Hyatt is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Why is this hotel rated in 3 digits?”
Reviews.Author: travelpjean
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why this hotel isn't rated in the top 20 of places to stay in New York. We got the hotel on Priceline for $120.00 during the Christmas holiday for 6 nights. I was concerned because of the low rating on Tripadvisor but, was so relieved when I entered my room. We had a Gold Passport card so, we asked for an upgrade and recieved a deluxe king room.We also, got coupons for coffee and recieved a newspaper everyday. I do recommend getting that Passport before your stay. The deluxe king was very spacious and had a spacious bathroom. The rooms are well appointed with two windows. The TV is a flat screen with several channels to select. I was there during the Transit Strike and did appreciate their update memos they sent keeping us informed of the strike. We were close to most attractions so, it wasn't a bother at all to walk to shows , Rockefeller Center, Museums etc. The bed was so comfortable and I think I had the best sleep I've had in years. We stayed at the Swissotel Drake a few years ago and although we enjoyed that hotel too; I think we liked the Hyatt better. It was so convenient to go down to Grand Central , eat , shop and grab a train(after the strike ended of course). We hated to leave and felt the Hyatt was our second home. I will stay here next time and highly recommend it. It was certainly a 4 star hotel without question.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location”
Reviews.Author: dazaler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excelent location for seeing all the sites. Busy location which added to our sense of security when walking around (which we did a lot of due to the transit strike) All that walking gave us a much better apreciation of new york and to be honest waliking isn't a problem provided you are resonably healthy. To get an idea of where you are goto times square and get a grey line bus ticket for two days. This allows you to hop on and off all day long at all the sites. Once you know the area walk. The hotel was better than expected from some of the reviews I have read. The room was large and we ahd a bath and shower combo thing. Room was clean and located to the rear so very quite. The hotel lobby was beautifully decorated for the holidays and all the staff were welcoming. Did not eat or drink in the hotel as it was expensive and the room didn;t have tea and coffe facilities which I thnk it needs. Having said that there are some great food places under grand central station and large Tea was around $2 and they were open from very early to quite late. On a return to NY I would definately stay here provided the price was right which it usually is on priceline.

Reviews.Title: “3 Canadian Girls in the City!!!”
Reviews.Author: WVMom49
Reviews.Content: I had low expectations of this hotel before I got there. I had expected tiny rooms and no service (sometimes with big "chain" hotels you get next to no service). I was pleasantly surprised. Larger rooms than expected. Service was good. The bathroom was updated. Hotel bar/restaurant was pleasant. Concierge wasn't all that knowlegable, but we found our destinations on our own! All in all a good hotel for the money and very well located. That is definately the best thing about this hotel. The LOCATION! Grand Central Station is connected to the hotel and is in within walking distance to most attractions and shopping. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: AJSGILLAM
Reviews.Content: Although difficult to arrange aspects of our stay over the internet and telephone, on our arrival the reception staff at the Grand Hyatt New York proved very helpful. This hotel is very well located particularly for a first trip to New York, when you probably want to travel all over the city. Many of the sites are within walking distance and those that are not can easily be reached via the subway at the adjacent Grand Central Terminal. On arrival we found that we had been allocated a large room on the 31st floor - large enough for visitors from Europe and from what we understand unusual for New York City. The room allocation also brought certain upgraded benefits which helped to make our trip very enjoyable. We ate ocassionally in the Hotel mainly light meals which were fine. On the occassions that we went to the bar it was difficult to get served and the staff here were a little indifferent. It appeared to be frequented by business types who hugged the bar making access for others very difficult. The room cleaning was o.k. but could have been improved, and the maid rarely left sufficient toileteries etc. On the whole the room was clean and the bed very comfortable although extra lighting would be an improvement. We were allocated a room at the rear of the hotel which was quiet. Some members of the Concierge service staff were very helpful and this is what sets a good hotel from a great hotel. Overall a very good hotel which we intend to stay at again and which we would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, one of the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife had never seen New york, and I hadn't been back for 26 years!! It was a Christmas present for my wife and I wanted it to be something special,and I wasn't wrong with the choice of hotel. When we first walked in,it was marvelous to be greeted by an enormous Christmas tree in front of the fountain, although late in the evening the reception desk was extremely helpful and polite. At first they had reserved a room with two single beds instead of a double, when we went to change rooms the next day, after walking around New York, I hadn't even had time to show my room key when they greeted me by name and issued us with new keys, this was indeed top class service. The condition of the rooms and the cleanliness is first class. I will return to this hotel without a shadow of a doubt and can thoroughly recommend it to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very Busy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 2 nights in December 2005. New York was very busy and the same applied to the hotel. We have stayed in the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong and it was truly superb. The same can't be said for New York. We stayed in the Regency Club and paid more than in Hong Kong. We did however not get more. The room was O.K but nothing outstanding. It was clean and serviced each day although very superficially. Breakfast and early evening canapes were included in the room rate. Alcoholic drinks were not included and this had been the case in Hong Kong. It is difficult to understand why the same hotel chain can have such different ways of working. The hotel was in a great central location and ideal for accessing Times Square and the centre of New York. Very large hotel however and not for those wanting a personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hyatt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we have just arrived back from ny.my husband has taken me there for my birthday for the last few years.we stayed at the grand hyatt in a lexington suite.the lobby looked very grand with beautiful xmas decorations.when we checked in our room wasnt ready-person was late checking out,so we were told they would store our luggage.we had to ask when it would be ready but she wasnt sure and gave us another suite-fantastic view opposite chrysler building.suite large and very clean-grat shower,only downfall was no coffee machine.only ate breakfast in hotel great service and very friendly staff.great location for nyc.can be a problem getting a taxi of an evening-very long queues.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good....”
Reviews.Author: mollyschmolly
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Grand Hyatt, I was impressed by their courteous staff after a long walk from 52nd Street and 11th Avenue. Our room was a little tight with 4 people, but who wouldn't be cramped with 4 adults? The contemporary decor was pleasing, and our window even opened to let in some fresh air...a rarity anymore. The temperature controls never did work right. The bathroom was small, but the shower pressure was good and we always had hot water. The hotel is really attached to Grand Central Terminal, so catching the subway was really convenient. We were part of a group tour, and everything was handled very well. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for touring NYC”
Reviews.Author: Sandwich_Sue
Reviews.Content: We were unsure what to expect having read some pretty unflattering reviews but were more than happy with our stay!!! Considering that are over 1300 rooms (wow!) - we obviously weren't expecting cosy/personal service! What we got was a massive room (no. 22-27) very comfortably furnished with a small but adequate shower room (fab shower!). The thing we missed was no hot drinks tray - who wants to wait/pay for room service?! So we took our own travel kettle/tea/ milk!!! (Sad Brits, or what?!) As for location? Couldn't be beaten!! Right in the middle of town and perfect for the Subway (underground system!) - very easy to use - just make sure that you don't get the Express train if it doesn't stop where you want to go!!! New Yorkers very helpful and friendly and we felt very safe. Only ate at the hotel once - breakfast for one which cost $33 - ouch!!!! Don't bother! Go to the Dining Concourse downstairs in Grand Central Station - fab muffins/coffee/pancakes etc! More than happy - well done, Grand Hyatt! :o)

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: brodyboy
Reviews.Content: We had a chance to stay here over Halloween weekend for four nights. The staff was extreamly friendly and helpful, the rooms had been nicely redone and the location was increadibly central to all of NYC. We had a great breakfast twice in the hotel restaraunt courtesy of a very nice front desk person. She was making up for the fact that I had requested a high floor and there were none available with the bed size we wanted. She even called to check when we got to the room to see if we were OK with it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, recommended”
Reviews.Author: Flipper080
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in an excellent location. Corridors a bit drab but room functional and well maintained. Staff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel i ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: hope1970
Reviews.Content: Genuinely, this is the best place I have ever stayed. Friendly, incredibly competent staff, a gorgeous room overlooking grand central station, all for a hundred pounds! The room had been newly refurbished, and they have clearly spent a lot of money. Big very comfortable bed, for once a proper high end exec desk chair (I was working). Can't comment on the food as I ddin't have any. Location is excellent too, whether for shuttles, subway or local amenities. The best bit: sitting on the big wide windowsill 28 floors up, at 7am, watching the sun come up and shine across Manhattan's skyscrapers.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days and 3 nights. I got this hotel thru Priceline, and thought that since I paid half the rate my room would not be as nice. I was WRONG. The staff was super friendly and very knowledgeable about where to go and what to do. Even the valet parking attendants were very helpful. The room was so spacious and the bathroom was huge. The shower and the toilet are separated from the sink, so more than one person could occupy the bathroom at once. The location was fantastic as well. It is right next to Grand Central station and a couple of blocks from Times Square. Loved the entire hotel experience and would recommend all to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “spacious room for NYC”
Reviews.Author: jgodic
Reviews.Content: we were very pleased with our hyatt experience. i usually try to stay away from big chains, but since NY hotels are so expensive, we resorted to priceline and ended up very happy with the results! we didnt actually spend much time in midtown where the hotel is located, but it was a good spot to get to other places. less than a $10 cab ride to most of our destinations both uptown and downtown. i was travelling with a friend and on check-in we were given the option of one or two beds and were pleased to get 2 double beds in a very roomy space- by nyc standards. everything was clean. although the hallway and people next door were pretty noisy, earplugs solved that problem. the beds were comfy and thankfully had white duvets - not those scary patterned ones designed to hide stains. if you can get a good price for this hotel i would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Caradog
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastically located for nearly all sightseeing parts of New York. Within walking distance of the Port Authority (the bus station to everywhere), Times Square, Broadway theatres, etc. It's next door to Grand Central Station! with the Chrysler building on the other side. The hotel itself was fab. Our only complaint was that the aircon only worked on occasion and was very noisy and the room was very dark, but we were on the 28th floor with buildings all around us so was to be expected. The staff was helpful and friendly. I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and will stay there when travelling to New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Anne69
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location - handy for all main tourist attractions but far enough away from the madness of Times Square. Staff at the concierge desk were helpful. Room was pleasantly decorated - lighting a bit dull. Beds very comfy. Room requested was non-smoking but certain room we had was a smoking room. Bathroom - very small. Impressive lobby but thought hotel was expensive for what was offered regarding accommodation. Not value for money. Would probably try another hotel if visiting New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference in this hotel recently, so I accompanied him to NYC & we stayed here so he would have easy access to his conference. We had a late flight in, so when we checked into the hotel, they informed us they had a SMOKING room only. It is very upsetting when you book a non-smoking room & are then told there are none - they should have told us this when we booked the room! They told us we would be moved the following day & gave us complimentary breakfast, but offered no room discount. We went to the room & found it absolutely disgusting. The smell of smoke was ingrained in the carpet, bedding, wallpaper, & furniture. We were told someone would be up to "freshen up" the room when we checked in, 2 hours later after 2 phone calls, housekeeping finally arrived. She did change our entire bedding which allowed us to be able to sleep on the bed, but we slept with the windows open the entire night listening to the horns & sirens of NYC in order to breathe. After calling to complain again about how bad the room was, they gave us $100 off the room. I cannot have imagined paying $400 for that room - we would have been better off in a Motel 6. The following day, we were moved as promised, but only after 2 phone calls & persistence. To their credit, we were moved to a very nice room on the 31st floor (the regency club level) & received wine & cheese that night in our room. After e-mailing the service dept. with my complaints, I received a telephone call & an e-mail reply which speaks well regarding quality control. I'm just still frustrated this situation occurred in the first place. Our eyes burned for 2 days after being exposed to so much smoke. For $400/night, this just shouldn't happen.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Average Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: S&Dx
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a 5 day visit to New York, staying at the Grand Hyatt, I found this to be an average hotel (given the price tag) and pretty noisy overnight. On the plus side, the location is excellent and the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant two night stayat the Grnad Hyatt NYC”
Reviews.Author: HinduMystic
Reviews.Content: Try and not be put off by the previous reviews, this is a superb hotel!! As you enter, the imense lobby shows you why this is Grand hotel, the marble waterfall is really cool and kind of soothing plus it drowns out the noise from outside. We stayed for 2 nights in begining of October, when we checked in I asked for a room on one of the higher floors, the Receptionist gave us several different options, in the end she gave us a corner room on the 16th floor. I mentioned that we were celebrating my birthday that day, and as a treat, we had complimentary breakfast throughout our stay Our Room was big by NYC standards and the bed was one of the best hotel beds I've slept in, and boy did we need sleep after a full day of site-seeing and shopping!! The bathroom was a bit small and could have done with a lick of paint on the ceiling, but if you are in NYC how much time do you actually spend in the bathroom right? There was no problem with Hot Water as mentioned in a previous review. Breakfast was your standard buffet, but we were informed that we could ask the Chef to cook us any type of eggs/omelette that we wanted...so we did!!! The Location of the Hotel could not be better, right next to Grand Central Station A short walk to Times Square or you could catch the No. 7 train and get to the heart of NYC. At the rate we got this hotel, I dont we could have done better and this is definately going to one of our first choices next time we stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not much more”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Regency Club floor for two nights in September 2005. We arrived at about 8 pm after being on airplanes all day. No staff person offered to help with our bags or offer any assistance getting into the hotel which was very congested due to the UN being in session and many of the countries seemed to headquarter at the Hyatt. The first room they gave us reeked of disinfectant trying to overcome smoke (in a non smoking room). It was also on the street and we had requested a quiet room off the street. Went back to the front desk and was told there was only one other room in the entire hotel available (hard to believe) so we moved into a tiny room opposite the ice machine, but at least no smell. They promised to move us the next day. The following morning they were able to move us to a nice roomy room with a view of other rooms (which was fine as it was quiet). Our relatives were travelling with us and stayed at the Sofitil and said it was very nice and in a great location (as was the Hyatt). Would I stay here again, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not bad, but they didn't have free biscuits or hot chocolate in the rooms. They also only provided a basic breakfast for 'second-class' guests, and the rooms were tiny. Quite frankly, the Hyatt in Birmingham (a small town in the midlands of England) was better than this 'grand' hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Fraud”
Reviews.Author: PabloARG
Reviews.Content: I might be the unluckiest man alive, but everything that follows happened to me and my fiance'e. To begin with, we had booked a package which included breakfast, and had requested a high non-smoking room with a view. Everything was fine so far.. we were given a room on the 21st floor (which I thought was high enough), but noticed the trip on the lift was rather short. It was then I realised the hotel had the Lobby, Conference Room, 16th floor, 17th... 21st. In the end.. we were no higher than the 10th floor. As we walked into the room, we found out the room stinked out to the scent of cigarettes, and that our view was.. well.. there was NO view. If we opened the curtains, we would see another guest. The concierge (Mr. Jason) was useless. We were about to leave the hotel. Next morning, we went to have our breakfast. Unfortunatelly, we found out the hotel had 80 seats for about 500 people trying to get breakfast (which was just OK). After waiting for about 35 minutes and answered what room we were staying at, we got a table, and enjoyed the breakfast. But as we were about to leave, we got haulted by hotel security for trying to leave without paying. As I tried to explain the maitre'd we had breakfast included, he kept yelling at me in front of almost 150 people... so it became a yelling contest. I won :) and got him call the front desk, and his apologies, which I rejected. I was asked to get the beakfast vouchers (2005, and they cannot use computers). At night, as we returned to the hotel, my finace'e went to the front desk to get the vouchers to avoid a scene the next day, as I got to our room. It was not after 15 minutes when she arrived at our room crying, as she was accused of "taking advantage of the Hotel and claiming for more vouchers than you are (we were) supposed to have", out loud (looks like hotel's policy to yell). This was the 2nd. time in 14 hours the hotel had accused us of thieves. I got dressed, got to the front desk, and asked for the manager. Guess what? THAT was the manager. I asked him to provide me with the name of the person who he alleged had given us the vouchers, and to show me the voucher numbers, my signature receiving them or any document. As he was making SUCH SERIOUS ACCUSATIONS, I would have guessed he would have had AT LEAST one proof. To your surprise, he did not. After about ten minutes, he said he would "make an exception" and give us the vouchers, to which I replied there was no exception to be made as this was the first time the vouchers were being handled to us; he would just be doing his job. In the end, we stayed at a lousy room, with no view, the service (or lack of it) of a $10 hotel, a totaly incompetent staff, and a flash light that came from the fire alarm that blinked every 4 hours (strong enough to wake you up). Two great things were the bed, and the location... but I'd much rather stay in many other hotels for the same price than returning here... no wonder they are ranked 167 in tripadvisor... PS: on our return, I wrote an email to the Hyatt Customer Affairs and Hyatt Quality, which was replied by the hotel's Assistant Rooms Executive who stated: "we believe that there was no disrespect intended by any of our employees". If being haulted, yelled, and being called a thief does not show disrespect, they really need to learn their business.

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy lobby but everything else pretty basic”
Reviews.Author: Jazzlover23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights recently with my husband. We had a room on the 20th floor facing the front of the hotel. Initially we were assigned to a room 2 floors below but it was so dark and drab in there given the price were paying, I knew that they could do better. Our stay was just okay. The worst part about the room is that the walls are pretty thin, we could hear everything that was going on with our neighbours next door including a nasty fight they were having at 2 o'clock one morning. The room was spacious by NYC standards but the bathroom was woefully inadequate with very little if any place to store our toilettries and it was a hit and miss in terms of getting hot water in the shower. We did not eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel so I cannot comment. The location of the hotel is first class and that is probably its best feature. I definetly do not think this hotel is value for money when paying full price, and the only way I would stay there again is if I copped a deal on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sambo1969
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt. Their adequately-sized rooms are nicely decorated with a very comfortable bed. The staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LV_Traveler_88
Reviews.Content: I stay at this grand hyatt because I've got a good price from priceline. Maybe I got used to the larger room in other places, I think this grand hyatt room is small. Everything is very good, it is clean, down comforter is soft and warm. AC is quiet. Grand central terminal is right under this hotel, it is very very convenience to reach other part of the city by subway or other public transportation. One complain was the water was leaking from the shower door, after everyone took a shower, I can see lot of water on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Midtown choice”
Reviews.Author: TxsChick
Reviews.Content: I visited the Grand Hyatt NY Sat 8/28 and was very pleased with the experience. The bed was very comfortable, the room was large, the staff was both friendly and accomodating, and the location couldn't have been better. My only complaint was the occasional noise from the hallway and room next door, but that's common in most hotels. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: nikiw2
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hyatt. A good friend and I went and were a bit concerned about safety, being 2 females staying in a hotel and walking around the city. We stayed on the 27th floor. Our room was nice and quiet. Maid service was wonderful. We needed extra towels and they were to our room in 5-10 minutes. Bathrooms aren't big but they meet your basic needs. Beds were comfortable. The hotel was busy but all the hotel workers took time to say hello and see if you needed anything. We got some great advice from Concierge regarding places to go and a great Italian restaurant (Salute). The hotel is connected to Grand Central and this makes taking the Subway very convenient. In addition, taxis were always available outside the hotel. We felt very safe in the hotel and walking around the city. Overall it was a wonderful experience and I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late June, after a successful bid on Priceline for under $150. Wonderful, wonderful value for the money! PROS: **Beautiful entrance and lobby **Location couldn't be better! Being adjacent to the Grand Central station was extremely convenient... only minutes from SoHo, Harlem, Financial District, Times Square, etc ... (There's also a nice food court in grand central) ** Large, clean, spacious, well-appointed modern rooms with very comfortable beds. **Right across the street from Duane Reade (a convenient store) ** Many restaurants/shops in walking distance CONS: **None really ... If I had to say something, I'd say that check-in took longer than it should have

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed with the hotel. The lobby was gorgeous, the staff friendly and helpful. Rooms were lovely and the bed was extroadinarily comfortable, which was very important to me since I suffer from severe back problems.
