Anytime, I asked for something, the hotel staff brought it immediately. This was my first trip to New York City so I didn't know what to expect. If I am lucky enough to return, I will definitely stay there again and am recommending it to friends and family. Thank you Grand Hyatt for a wonderful stay in New York City!

Reviews.Title: “Eh.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big fan. I've stayed in several hotels of this "class" in NYC and this was, by far, the least impressive. Lobby was nice, and location was good. Front desk staff was less-than-interested. The room was larger than expected for NYC hotels but was almost an "inside cabin" with one window in a corner looking directly into another room. It was very dark, and did not smell or look particularly clean. There was a large wet spot on the carpet by the door. In the morning, the chamber maid did not knock, and simply came into the room TWICE. Bathroom was nice (though not too clean), and bed was confortable, though all of the sheets came untucked during the night (and I'm a quiet sleeper!). Overall, it was "eh". I probably wouldn't stay there again, since there are much nicer spots in the city for the same amount of $$$. Oh well, live and learn!

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RaceTraveler
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to express my level of satisfaction with the Grand Hyatt New York. The location is superb (adjacent to Grand Central Station/MTA Subway and mere blocks to Times Square) with excellent accomodations. Upon arrival, I was greeted with a beautiful lobby with self service check-in kiosks. This was a great time saver as I had no line to stand in after a long day of travel from New Orleans. My room, which was located on the 27th floor, offered a great view of 42nd Street and Midtown Manhattan. The room was spotless and spacious, a great attribute for a NYC downtown hotel. While it is a large hotel, the staff was pleasant and housekeeping was on the ball. I would surely recommend this place to anyone who appreciates the quality of a Hyatt hotel and the greatness that is New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation trip -- great location”
Reviews.Author: gpmtrixie
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four (kids 10 and 8, mom and dad) who stayed here 7/8 - 7/11 and it was a great choice. We got a great rate on Expedia ($179/night, plus taxes) by using the "flexible date" option several months ago. The location was perfect with Grand Central Station right downstairs. We had breakfast in Grand Central lower level every morning. Easy access to subway to get you anywhere in the city, but also fairly close for walking to Times Square, Rockefeller Ctr/St. Patrick's and Empire State Building, all within a mile or so. Room was nice and clean with 2 double beds, a desk w/chair, chair and ottoman. TV had many choices for kids when we were resting between our trips out and about. HVAC was good and not noisy. Our room was right across from the elevators, so we did hear some noisy girls a couple of nights late at night who ignorantly decided to have loud conversations in front of the elevators. Bathroom was a little on the small side, but the shower was fairly strong and had plenty of warm water. Front desk staff and concierge were always helpful with directions to get to various tourist spots. Luggage storage was offered for beginning and end of stay since we arrived before normal check-in and left town after check-out. On check-out there was an error on our bill, but it was correctly quickly and efficiently. Lobby is very attractive, but very busy...there always seemed to be some convention going on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt in Manhattan on July 8-10 and had a really wonderful time. The service was absolutely terrific and we couldn't have been treated more nicely. Our room was ready very fast, even before the early-checkin time, and the staff was really helpful with arranging everything. The view from our room - The Chrysler Tower - couldn't have been more beautiful. The location is just spectacular as well...Grand Central Station on one side, the Chrysler tower on the other - just blocks from all the best shopping and Time's Square. We have arranged a reservation for a nice restaurant through the hotel's concierge service and were treated like kings when we've arrive with complimentary drinks from the hotel and etc. Would highly recommend the Grand Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: natalie93
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend trip to NYC- great hotel. The room was quite spacious for a NYC hotel. Our package included a breakfast, which was an amazing perk- there were many options. The lobby is impressive too. Great central location in NYC. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Much more Grand than Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay June 30 - July 3, 2005. The hotel and staff were wonderful. We called the hotel to make the reservation. The room and price quoted, is what was presented on arrival. They could not provide us a coffee maker in the room, but gave us vouchers for coffee in the lobby. Our room had two comfortable full size beds, a desk and chair, an accent chair with ottoman, a nice size closet, big bureau and night stand. The bathroom was okay, not too small, old pipes, but no problems. Everyone on the staff were very helpful and friendly. I traveled with my 17 year old daughter, and my 79 year old father. We were able to walk to all of the attractions that we were interested in seeing. (Empire State building, Radio City Music Hall, Times Square, Shubert Theatre, Cental Park) Check out was very quick and easy, with choices on how you want to check out. (by phone, tv, at the front desk) The bellman held our luggage, at no additional cost, so we continue touring New York. (we had a night time flight) There was always, at least one taxi cab waiting outside the hotel, and shuttle service to the airport was just around the corner. This was our first time staying at this hotel, and it would be my first choice the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Grand stay at the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: matt_tx00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for five nights in late June 2005. After reading the reviews on here I was a little worried about my stay, but my fears were alleviated quickly. I was very satisfied with my entire stay at the Hyatt. First off, the location is second to none. You are adjacent to the Grand Central Terminal. So what, you say? Well, the 4, 5, 6, 7, and S subway lines are about a 5 minute walk from the hotel lobby through completely indoor corridors, bypassing a couple of coffee shops, bakeries, and newstands on the way for added convenience. Very nice to have, especially in the morning, and especially when its raining outside. From the hotel lobby, you can be in Times Square in 10 minutes, and in lower Manhattan in about 20 minutes. If you'd rather take a cab, there was always an employee ready to hail a cab for you right in front. I never waited more than 5 minutes for one. Another positive - the rooms had been recently renovated as the Hyatt website mentions. My room had a king size bed, large TV, trendy furnishings, and plenty of space considering it was a Manhattan hotel room. Unlike other reviewers have mentioned, housekeeping did a great job on my room - left it in great shape every afternoon when I returned from sight-seeing. Even though I booked the room through Priceline, I felt like I was treated like a Hyatt club member through my entire stay, right down to getting a copy of the New York Times every morning. The only negative I can think of is the lobby was always mobbed with people. This is a HUGE hotel and there were lots of conventions going on the weekend I was staying. However, on my floor (17th), it was very quiet and I never encountered a noise problem from the street, from the lobby, or from other patrons. Another negative is the hotel charges for internet use: 50 cents a minute. I guess I didn't get the most "one-on-one" service I've ever gotten in a hotel but in all honesty I never needed it because my stay was so great. This hotel deserves to be ranked MUCH higher than the #165 rating it has commanded on Tripadvisor. Top 100 for sure - possibly even the Top 50 when you consider some of the other hotels that are ranked there. Granted, I wouldn't pay Hyatt's normal room rate of $400/night to stay here. But $210/night rate through Priceline was a very reasonable for a stay in this type of hotel in NYC in peak season. I've read that off-season bids on Priceline for 4-star hotel can get you at the Grand Hyatt for even less than that. I would stay here again in a heartbeat for the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Hotel at Above Average Prices”
Reviews.Author: kolowalu
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a wonderful location for going in almost any direction in NYC. Direct access to Grand Central Terminal puts the subway and trains just a few minutes away. This is important because catching a taxi on 42nd street is difficult because the street is gridlocked all hours of the day. We sat in our taxi on the way to the hotel for 15 minutes while just 1 1/2 blocks from the hotel. Go up the escalator from the lobby to the Lexington Street exit where the taxis are plentiful and actually move. We had a nice large corner room that was clean, quiet, and comfortable for the most part. We had a walk-in closet with enough hangars for both my wife and I to hang a week's worth of clothing. The lighting was not the best so I had to sit by the window to get sufficient light to read. The TV was fixed on a dresser--it did not swivel--so we couldn't watch TV from the bed, only from the one chair, plus a hard desk chair. The small bathroom lacked the usual amenities that a Hyatt typically offers and each day the housekeepers forgot to replenish at least one item: one day all three hand towels were missing, the next no new soap, no wash clothes, etc. All of these are small irritants but they do make you wonder about the place. Two other annoyances that bothered us: (1) There is a nice coffee kiosk in the lobby for those who want a quick cup and a pastry. We found out when talking with others that guests were given coupons when checking in for a free cup of coffee. We did not get any and marched down to the frontdesk to ask why. No reason was given, just a shrug of the shoulders, but two coupons were offered. (2) After a long day, we wanted to go to the lobby lounge and have a drink but found it closed for a private reception. This happened four out of the six nights we were at the hotel. We did go to their other lounge--at the Commodore Grill--which was fine, but our best find was the outdoor lounge of Michaels Jordan's restaurant at Grand Central Terminal which has half-price drinks for several hours. The food is pretty good too. The staff at the Hyatt are nice, but clearly harrassed. The two staff that we talked with at the tour desk were very helpful in recommending the best and most economical ways to see the city. I am glad that we stayed there but be prepared to have your senses assaulted by the hectic pace--both in the lobby area and on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: lawahoo2001
Reviews.Content: Probably the best things about this hotel are the location, the lobby, and the conference facilities. Stayed at this hotel for the first annual NYSE conference. I requested a quiet room, which I got (on the 27th floor), although they only had one available with 2 beds (no kings available). This was fine, since I was traveling alone. The hotel is clearly an old one that has been refurbished--you cannot tell that from the lobby, but it is quite evident in the rooms. The decor in the rooms is modern and nice, but you can tell that the hotel has seen better days. The bathroom is tiny and not very much up to par to Hyatt standards (the new Hyatt in downtown Seattle has a bathroom that is as big as the room with a separate tub and shower; it is sparkling clean). Anyway, the worst things about the stay were that there was barely any hot water in the shower and my door lock/handle kept sticking and I had to practically break down the door to get into my room on several occassions. I would only return to this hotel if the NYSE conference is held there again, but I would not return for a non-business trip. I will try something new in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: hops4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Hyatt. We would recommend everything about this hotel. The staff was friendly, the hotel was very nice and clean, the location was perfect. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Not a bad place to stay, although Bell Captains can be very slow, but besides that all was well. Location ideal. Would recommend although I believe there are better values out there.

Reviews.Title: “very nice but no housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: nycgoer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt over the Memorial weekend. It was very clean and the lobby was nice. Alittle slow on the check in. Also the second day we came back to our room and housekeeping had not touched the room. It was 4 p.m. So we never got our room cleaned up. I feel one pays for that. Fresh towels, sheets. Other than that I was pleased with the location and the new renovations. The fitness area is nice also and open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel, no personal attention, they ignore your requests”
Reviews.Author: Happy_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: Good location. I had Room 2967 from June 6 to 11 for a weeklong business trip. Good value for corporate rate. My flight was delayed until after 4 am and room was held for me with my Amex guarantee, albeit with two beds. Fast service, other than room service which could use some more efficiency. I ordered my 2nd night and got the wrong plate and decided to eat dinner before returning the other nights to avoid a 45 minute wait for someone else's order. What annoyed me is that when I checked in, I noted my room was dark and had a very large burn mark on the carpeting (a foot long). I did not care as I was exhaused and it is a business trip. However, my safe was also locked and I had to call Security to open it for me so that I could use it. When the security man arrived, he saw the burn and asked me what I did very accusingly and rudely. I told him I had been at the hotel for less than ten minutes and it was a sign of poor maintenance by the hotel and he should report it so that he problem could be fixed while I was working on Tuesday. No one ever came to fix it, communicate to me about the problem, etc. This, after a hotel employee accused me of burning the rug. I was just a faceless guest and I had no time to waste at the front desk, etc. On my final night (5th night), I had a voice mail from a desk clerk calling me by the name of another guest asking if my room was OK. As I was checking out in less than 8 hours, I did not bother to return her call. I liked the voice mail checkout as whenever I am in NY, I take an early flight out and the cashiers are never ready in any hotel for me. Odd - no mini bars. Room service trays that I saw at 7 pm were still in the hallway at 8 am, little attention in the evenings to cleaning. I would stay again if the New York Palace, where I prefer to stay, is sold out again the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice beds but service lacking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Grand Hyatt for 4 nights over Memorial Day weekend. Great location. Easy to get to, Grand Central Station is right next door. Plenty of food choices. Close to Times Square and most tourist activities. Rooms are average size with okay air conditioning. Plenty of elevators and a nice fitness facility. Beds are great! Overall, generally clean. Service is another matter! Had to complain twice to the front desk to get our slow draining bathtub fixed. Once fixed, housekeeping never cleaned the bathroom floor. Ran out of hot water on Saturday morning and had a lukewarm shower. My friend needed a pair of trousers cleaned. Hotel did not offer Saturday cleaning services. The Concierge directed her across town to the hotel's dry cleaners when there were many closer to the hotel. Overall expected more service from a Hyatt hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in NYC and got a GREAT rate at the Hyatt. I had read some reviews here that made me slightly nervous but we were really impressed and delighted with our stay. Check in was friendly and efficient. Our room was terrific- we loved the modern decor and I found it to be big given NYC standards- we were expecting something much smaller. The location is excellent- we could walk to Times Square in about 12 minutes or take the subway- which we caught in the Grand Central Station attached to the hotel. The lobby is beautiful and public areas we found to be well maintained. We did eat in one of the restaurants - Commodore Grill- and had a nice meal there- good value for the money. Room service was a bit overpriced- but most room service is and food mediocre so I don't really hold that against the Hyatt. Would definitely return to this property- we had a first class stay at a reasonable price!!

Reviews.Title: “Average NY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PacificAndyLa
Reviews.Content: A big corporate convention hotel, not bad but just average. Stayed 4 nights and room was nice and the hotel is nice but very large and unpersonal. Close to many things, a short walk to Time Square and many NY landmarks. I didnt understand the load music at the entry of the hotel going all night and day and the food was fair. Most of the staff was just doing their job and not to helpful. Be aware of the automated check out. I checked out a 5:00 a.m. and when my CC bill arrived I was charged for additional 3 nights at the hotel. According to the hotel I did not check out, but I received an invoice and "thank you for staying" on my bill. Had to fight hard to have the 3 night taken off, really really hard. A mess.

Reviews.Title: “Briiliant Location”
Reviews.Author: EmmaCTorquay_Devon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in April, the hotel service was excellent, the rooms were clean with 2 double beds, a good size bathroom, tv, guide books etc etc. The hotel had everything you could want from a city hotel. The location is excellent for getting out and about. I would definately stay here again. No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Great service, professional, no problems.....”
Reviews.Author: strollingbonez
Reviews.Content: The staff was professional and helpful. The rooms were average size hotel rooms. I found the room clean, each day it was cleaned and every day except for Sunday a newspaper was deliveried. The location is excellent. I had noted reviewers with problems with noise or poor lighting. We had neither. Room Service was quick and above average.

Reviews.Title: “a very good stay”
Reviews.Author: bolsachica
Reviews.Content: we just got back from a four day stay at the grand hyatt. we had a wonderful time! the hotel is in an unbelievably great location, right next to grand central station ! we were able to get everywhere with minimum hassle. alot of major sites/attractions of nyc are within walking distance. we enjoyed our room, thought the minimalist/asian decor was pleasing. the bathroom is a little small, but functional. the front desk and concierge were very friendly and helpful. would definitely recommend it especially if you can get a deal off priceline.

Reviews.Title: “It's the city”
Reviews.Author: kranky
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED. NYC is known for noise, small and strangely shaped hotel rooms and sometimes poor customer service, the Hyatt is no exception. Check-in was via the automated computer. Rooms vary in size. Ours was larger than normal for New York and looking at hotel floor map rooms varied in size/shape, renovated in the last years. Modern furnishings, a window that opened and bedding was top quality, nice desk and well lighted. Bathroom was smallish but nicely appointed with tile and granite and fairly well lighted. On the downside, the doors are the problem - they carry noise. We had hallway noise as well as heard occupants in the next room (our room having a connector door). We didn't engage much with the staff, but addressed our needs (this isn't Iowa don't expect charming boutique responses).

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: SBA44
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Grand Hyatt last week, and like others, was impressed by the lobby. The first impression is a good one - beautiful fountains and marble entry way greet you. Room is just ok...lighting is definitely bad and room seemed musty. Decor is nice...granite counters in bathroom and on nightstand, but the room definitely seemed old. The location is accessible to just about anything, and is the hotel's best assett. The service at this hotel is incredibly bad, however. Nobody has a smile on their face. Called guest services last morning there with a request for a razor. Took 3 phone calls and 1 1/2 hours later to have this delivered. Each time I called, someone blamed the problem on another person. The person who finally delivered the razor did so with a bad attitude and no smile. Really rubbed me the wrong way. I have stayed at the Marriott Marquis before and for the same price. I would definitely recommend the marriott Marquis over the grand hyatt any day. I will not return to the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for NYC”
Reviews.Author: PaulTravels
Reviews.Content: We live near NYC but very often book a room for a weekend night in the City when we plan to see a show or the sites. We have stayed at most of the mid town "big name" hotels over the years and we would rate the Hyatt amoung the best. We shop heavily on the web for mid-town hotles and pick the best deal. This occasion was my daughters 16th birthday, she wanted to celebrate it at a show in NYC with 3 friends. We shopped the web but then called the Hyatt directly to make the reservatons. We were very happy to learn that a second room for kids under 18 could be booked at a very very reduced rate, this was not offered on any of the web search engines. So if this is your circumstance (two rooms) check out the hotel directly. Both rooms were on the Regnecy Club level which was a huge savings for us. Between the free soft drinks, food, etc.. we more then saved the difference between club and a non-club level room, especially with the teenagers (who thought going to the club for free food and drinks was the greatest thing since sliced bread). The rooms in all NYC hotels are small, we would say the Hyatt was about average for NYC, but, big difference, the Hyatt, at least the 31st floor rooms we were in, were recently renovated, so the rooms had a "new" feeling--you do not always get that in NYC, even with the "big name" hotels. The hotel sits over Grand Central Rail Terminal is is extremely convenient to everything the City offers, very safe, and centrally located---we felt good about where we were staying and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Grand Hyatt NYC”
Reviews.Author: luvtravel2
Reviews.Content: Positives: Friendly, helpful staff. Very clean room. Modern decor. Very comfortable beds with high quality linens, down pillows, down comforter and pillow top mattresses. Quiet. Flat screen TV with lots of channels. NY Times delivered in the morning. Great location. No wait for elevators. Negatives: My room was not ready for check-in until late in the evening. (However, the reception clerk offered 2 coupons for a breakfast buffet for the inconvenience). Water pressure weak. Water temperature not hot enough. Dim lighting- not bright enough for comfortable reading. Minimal amenities (no lotion, no coffee maker). I will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: CouncilmanK
Reviews.Content: Hyatt is definitely business oriented, but an excellent hotel if you can get a deal online through Priceline or Hotwire on the weekend. Was here for the Gates exhibition. Great location next to Grand Central Station and the buses to/from LaGuardia, Liberty-Newark, and Kennedy were practically across the street. Internet access available for minor cost in the business center. Rooms standard size for NYC, comfortable beds, nicely done renovation. Would definitely stay here again for anywhere to $170 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt was a Grand Experience”
Reviews.Author: TVSeay
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to give this hotel an excellent review, however, our original room was small. Especially for two adult females. (The King room had much more room tham we originally did.) With that said, the service was great. The free breakfast was a fabulous addition. And due to hotel construction, we were able to change rooms in the middle of our stay and the 2nd room was perfect. All their double rooms should be that size. If this is your 1st or 2nd time to NYC and you don't want to stay in Times Square, The Grand Hyatt is perfect. Besides Grand Central Station being attached to the Hotel, 5th Ave shopping is only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt is just so so”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with all the above reviews: fantastic lobby, great location, comfortable bed, however, tiny - very tiny- bathroom, bad lighting. One thing i'd like to add is the smell of the room, it has a funny smell, like mold. The A/C doesn't work very well. I still think this hotel is overrated and i wouldn't come back. Also, the bellmen/valet parking staff are not very friendly nor helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Bed in NYC Hotels”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTraveler58
Reviews.Content: The bed was great....the best hotel bed I've encountered in NYC & I've stayed at the Westin, Swissotel & Sofitel in NYC. The decor was very nice...no "mod" dark colors that are so depressing like the Tribeca Grand & the Westin. The a/c not so good...kept adjusting it down but no cooling, finally opened window.....room was excellent, bathroom was disappointing, small with shower no tub. Check in was fast & courteous. Only real problem was no room service menu in room the night I arrived & when I called I was transferred repeatedly to same extension that only rang without answer. Finally gave up on room service for the night. I would definitely stay there again because in the end a wonderful bed is the best thing about a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Mystic
Reviews.Content: We booked the Grand Hyatt two days beore we travelled via Hotwire. The hotel is perfectly situated next door to Grand Central Station putting all areas in reach via the Subway. Times Square is less than a 10 minute walk away. First impressions of the hotel were excellent, a very impressive exterior which was surpassed by the fantastic lobby. We had a room on the 17th floor (quite why it is called the 17th floor confused us as it was only the 8th floor when compared to other buildings). Room was adequately sized for NY with a very comfortable bed. Check in and check out were both quick. We arrived two hours before the standard check in time this was no problem at all. Due to a late flight we left our luggae with the hotel for the day following check out again no problem. The only comment I would make is to agree with the previous reviewer who commented upon the poor lighting within the room. Other than that the hotel was very clean and welcoming. Would definately return again.

Reviews.Title: “All that glitters....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt from 16th March fro 5 days- Yes- its an extravagant hotel to work into- but you WILL be disappointed when you enter your room & the magic spell disappears- the double rooms ( supposedly enough for 3 people are incredibly small ( question whether this is possibly the tiniest hotel room in the big apple- the lighting is also terrible in. Re: the service- It was ok- nothing to give a generous tip about- for instance, we ordered some take out to make for a change and requested if we could possible borrow some plates from the room service- they were incredibly unhelpful & said it would be at a cost of $4.95 per guest- I find that absurd- just to borrow plates. Luggage rules are also very inconsistent...we rang prior to arriving to confirm that we could leave out luggage in the hotel whilst we took a trip down to Miami for a few days- this was said to be ok- until the morning we were due to check out when all of a sudden it wasn't ok & it wasn't the bell desk's responsibility or the Hotel manager's to deal with our request...which was wholly unhelpful when we had a flight to catch.. so be warned- you will be wowed when you walk in- but what you get in reality is below par room size & service. the luggage situation is one persons experience- but there is no getting away from the small poorly lit rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but great location!”
Reviews.Author: BLGAW
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples, each traveling with a teenage daughter, staying at the Grand Hyatt, March 19-25. We got our rooms for $190/nt. through priceline.com. Since it was Spring Break, we thought the price was okay. The hotel lobby is beautiful and the rooms are understated. Beds were very comfortable with down comforters. Bathrooms were a bit small but water pressure was good. Our first night we had a king with roll-away. Our room never quite cooled off, so we slept with the window open all night since it was cooler outside than inside. Both couples asked to be switched to double/double rooms and the hotel accomodated us the next day. The thermostat in our new room worked fine, but the tub and sink drained very slowly. After informing the front desk the next day, problem was fixed. Staff was very friendly throughout stay; no New York attitude here. Hotel is located between Chrysler Building and Grand Central Station. It is a great location. There is a passage that leads from the hotel to Grand Central Station as well as the subway. There is also a subway shuttle that runs between Grand Central Station and Times Square (the "S") only, so even though Times Square is only a few blocks away, you can ride instead of walking. Plenty of restaurants in Grand Central Station (including Starbucks and several other coffee bars). There is a "Duane Reade" drugstore at the corner if you want to pay reasonable prices for sodas or other sundries. (Sodas from hotel machines were $2/can!!) The only thing we would have liked was a refrigerator and/or coffee maker in the room. We would stay here again. Location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “What A Setting!!”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days: half business, half vacation. Virtually part of Grand Central Station, easy walk to Times Square. Excellent service, NONE of the reputed "New York Atitude" everyone talks about. Not cheap, but made a great experience for us. John.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from New York for a long weekend March 4-7. I found the Grand Hyatt to be a very nice and clean Hotel. The staff was very pleasant. The location is right next to Grand Central station. We had a suite with a couch and chair and a desk. The bathroom is quite small, but had nice water pressure. Everything was nicely decorated and new. I would stay there again for sure. I did not come across anything else that looked more inviting. The subway was right out the door too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Craigtown
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for three nights and had a great time on our short break. Got the room on priceline for $145, about a week in advance, and we were delighted with our 34th floor room facing the Chrysler Building. Check in was quick and easy, check out was even more straight forward (TV) and in between we hardly saw the hotel as we were out and about. Definately a business hotel, don't stay here if you want pampered - but ideal for tourists with Grand Central just next door. Having said that the staff were very friendly and always asked how we were if we met in the lift or on the corridor.Room was big and modern, with a huge TV and really comfy king size bed - Two thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charliesmum
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this hotel is in a great location sandwiched between the Chrysler Building and Grand Central Station. There is walkway link from the lobby directly to the station, which has a great market/deli area, along with lots of decent restaurants and bars. There is also a handy drugstore on the next block. The hotel lobby is impressive, but our room was rather a let down after the grand entrance. As we were travelling with our 6 year old son we had twin queen beds, which didn't leave space for much else in the room. The poor lighting made the room look drab and dim, despite being recently refurbished. The bathroom had peeling paint on the ceiling and the bath plug didn't really keep the water in the bath. Although we had read it in an earlier Tripadvisor review, we were still surprised to find that the room didn't have tea/coffee making facilities or a fridge. We enjoyed the big buffet breakfast at the hotel Skybar (and so we should at $25 a head). The hotel is primarily a conference venue and most of the guests were business people, consequently the hotel services are very much aimed at business travellers, making it very impersonal with few leisure facilities. Fortunately my husband was at a conference here so we didn't have to pick up the tab - this hotel is certainly not worth the rack rate. If I were making my own travel arrangements there are plently of hotels I would choose before this one. All in all, the hotel is fine, but not worth the rack rate and not over-exciting for tourists/leisure guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: jlhmdh
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight with two children and the place was really nice, we booked thru priceline and paid $120 a night and they threw in Breakfast, We went to Central Park to see The Gates. The hotel had a great atmosphere and the room was clean and roomy, would stay at this hotel again, It was in walking distance to alot of attractions. Check out was easy and storing the luggage was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “I concur - Good Hotel & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week of our honeymoon here. It was a superb location and since this hotel has been renovated it looks really well. Not dated like some previous posters had suggested. Rooms were a good size, quiet and very clean. Couldnt fault it in any way.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Hyatt is a great choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt for two nights for our first trip to New York City. I chose the Hyatt after weeks of searching for the "perfect" city hotel. I am incredibly picky and didn't want to stay in a tiny, out-of-date hotel room. We were more than pleased with our room at the Hyatt, to say the least. The room was exactly as I requested: king bed, newly renovated, non-smoking, high floor with a view. Plus we got a great AAA deal - $179 a night. The room was very large, even for New York standards. The decor was relaxing, the room and bathroom were very clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. It was very quiet, our room was right across from the elevators (which there are many of) and we never heard them, we couldn't hear the rooms next to us either. I felt very safe in this hotel, it's in a great area - so convenient as it's right next to Grand Central Station, shopping and Broadway- and there were hotel staff waiting at the door every night making sure hotel guests were the only ones coming into the hotel. The staff was very professional and friendly, we bought theatre tickets through the hotel, which was so convenient and we ended up with front row, mezzanine seats the day of a Saturday show. I would suggest this hotel for anyone going to NYC, just be sure to request a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: The-Georgia-Longs
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay, clean and good sized room. We found it to be a good walking location for most areas. Easy to get a cab or limo out front.

Reviews.Title: “good deal for bargain bid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got a Friday night room with 2 hours notice through Priceline for $100. Room was lovely, great bed, good TV, nice bathroom, beautiful lobby. Super simple check in and out via kiosk. Never a line, never spoke with personnel. Room was noisy however due to a group of card players next door until 2 am. Ultimately it was fine and I suppose I could have phoned a complaint. Good location but very few grocery or late delis in the immediate vicinity. Stock up on snacks elsewhere because room service is grtoesquely expensive. Nice bit of luxury for 100 bucks though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLT19701
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a very nice hotel... It didn't wow me, nor was it bad. My only complaint is that the walls are very thin... You are able to hear anything and everything that is said with your neighbors. Luckily, our neighbors were a group of ladies who were complaining about their husbands that they left back at home. It's still annoying though.. For the money that you pay for a NYC hotel, you would just expect more. The hotel has a great location and is connected to Grand Central Terminal- which has Michael Jordan's Steakhouse- GO, it's was soooooo good. Overall, not bad, not great, just a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: Cfarley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt from 12/24-12/27. The location is great, you can get anywhere in Manhattan from Grand Central by subway. The only thing I didn't like was that there was no fan in bathroon and I could hear my neighbors t.v. through the wall but they didn't stay up late, so it was o.k. Got a $140 a night rate through Hotwire, so I felt I did well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCKA
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four who booked a last minute five day trip to NY for New Years. We chose the Hyatt based on availability and reviews from Trip Advisor. We booked thru the Hyatt web site. The hotel was an absolutely perfect choice and very good value for money. We received our rquested King room and a room with two doubles and were able to check in early. Both rooms were nice size, very clean, recently remodled, but most of all quiet! Additionally, the beds were the most comfortable we have found in a hotel. All of the staff we dealt with were friendly, helpful and accomodating to our requests and questions. Great hotel in a location that can't be beat...made our trip a 5*.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rsnsooner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 12/21-12/23. Can't beat the location to Grand Central. Lobby is very nice and the service was very good. Small rooms but that was expected. The fitness center on the top floor was good. There's a small pizza place (Ray's I believe was the name) that is right around the corner on Lexington. Excellent pizza. I will stay there again when I return.

Reviews.Title: “ok for price we paid but definitely not 4-star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked two standard rooms for Christmas Eve from Priceline and got this supposedly 4-star hotel for $122+taxes per room. The hotel lobby was nice and they allowed us to do an early check in (1pm instead of 3pm). We were assigned adjacent rooms in the 26th floor which did not have good views of Manhattan. The hallway looks clean but room doors all look like they were made from worn metal. The rooms were small, had no refrigerator (which for me is standard for a 4-star hotel), and had small bathrooms without exhaust fans (which can make the whole room stinky if you know what I mean). The beds were very nice though and we all had a good sleep. All in all I think it was worth the price we paid. However, it was Christmas Eve and we wanted to spend it in a real 4-star hotel, never mind if it costs a little more... in this aspect, we were extremely disappointed! This hotel seemed like a 3-star rather than a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from a 4-nite stay (12/26-12/31)”
Reviews.Author: kokoa
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I'm writing a review to share our hotel experience, as I've appreciated the reviews I've read when I was researching hotels. We stayed at the Grand Hyatt which is located on the corner of Lexington Avenue and West 42nd Street. The hotel is connected to Grand Central Station. The location is wonderful. There is direct internal access from the hotel right into Grand Central Station, to catch a train or to take the subway. We loved it!! The lobby is very nice, all marble and waterfalls. A standard room is somewhat small. No coffee maker in the room; however you are given free tokens for coffee or tea at a beverage stand in the lobby, which serves Starbucks. We didn't really use many of the hotel's amenities as we were always on the go. The hotels during this time were quite pricey (for my wallet), but then again we were staying during the last holiday week. Overall, we were pleased, most of all with the location. Hope this helps someone who plans to travel there. It was our first trip to New York and I absolutely loved it and New Yorkers are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Funfilled Stay in the City!”
Reviews.Author: asweeney7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt NY for two nights. I picked this hotel because of the great reviews on this sight and was not disappointed. The hotel lobby is truly "grand". The rooms were beautifully decorated, clean and pretty roomy for NY. We were nervous that our request for 2 double rooms would not be accomodated, but they were. They concierge desk helped us on many occasions finding restaurants, subway directions, etc. The location of the hotel is great. We were right at Grand Central making subway rides a snap. Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Empire State Building, etc are all 6-7 easy blocks away. We are a family of 7 with kids ranging from 7-17. We thoroughly enjoyed this quick trip. They luxury and proximity of this hotel helped make the trip a "10"!

Reviews.Title: “A one-night-stay has won my return business...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very chic, yet very small room....double bed, non-smoking. Great moderm furniture and a large flat-screen TV. Clean and quiet on the 19th floor. The bath towels were a bit small and rough feeling, but that is my only complaint. The Pellegrino sparkling water on request was a nice surprise...and it was on them. The beds have awesome sheets and comfy pillows. The breakfast buffet is $25 pp, but let's not forget what the room rates are. In summary, I will be back and it was everything I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Lousy Serivice”
Reviews.Author: danielleco
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in the Grand Hyatt NYC for 2 nights. For $500/night, I was very disappointed. The only great thing about this hotel is the location. It is fantastic and in walking distance to a lot of great locations. However, our room was quite rundown. It was clean, but the wallpaper was peeling in the bathroom and the bathroom was not that clean. The beds were very comfortable though!! While the rooms were just ok, the lobby is gorgeous! My problem with this hotel is that we had no hot water. It was freezing cold. We complained about it in the am, but at night, nothing was done. We called down to the front desk and they said it was some valve. They offered no solutions (trust me after walking around NYC for a day - a shower is a necessity). They would not transfer us to another room, even though other floors had hot water. Finally, they said that we could come downstairs (22 stories), pick up a key to shower in another room and then return the key afterwards. Furthermore, then next morning, they wanted us to do the same procedure; rather than switching rooms or keeping the extra key. When we checked out that day at around noon - they offered us breakfast coupons at the hotel restaurant, even though breakfast was over and we were checking out. Finally, they gave us a $125 credit. To top it all off, the bell hop practically rolled his eyes along with his audible sigh when we asked him to hold our luggage for an hour. Not what I expected from a Hyatt at all. I would NEVER stay there again, not for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and great service”
Reviews.Author: Hymanez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt in December 2004. We booked online at the the hotel website and booked a suite with the Honeymoon package - which included a bottle of champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries. The rate for the suite was nearly $200 less a night than a regular room at some of the nearby luxury hotels. Check-in was easy with their new kiosk system and when I needed service at the counter it was extremely friendly service with a smile. The newly-renovated hotel is beautiful and the room was elegant and big by NYC standards - with a nice sitting area and soft bed. When I realized I'd accidently booked just one night, instead of the two I'd intended to book, they easily agreed to allow us to stay one more evening. My only complaint was that we didn't have hot water during our stay. It was lukewarm at best. When we complained upon returning, we received a speedy email apology with an invitation for a free night's stay on a upcoming visit. I was impressed and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Hyatt Experience”
Reviews.Author: Storm2301
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here over Thanksgiving for 3 nights. Overall we enjoyed the Hyatt experience. The best feature is the entrance lobby which looks especially nice now with the Christmas decorations up. Our room / bathroom was a little small but this was our first trip to New York so we have nothing to compare to!. The location of the Grand Hyatt is superb. All methods of transport are easily accesible from here. Mostly the hotel staff were friendly and helpfull, although one or two were a little brusque but I think this is a New Yorker thing!! We would stay again and would definately stay around this location.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel -would definately stay again.”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaTraveller
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in the Grand Hyatt in April 2004. We had booked into the Thirty Thirty Hotel with a company called BestAtTravel, but when we tried to check in we were sent to the Grand Hyatt as the company had double booked the rooms. When we walked into the reception area dressed in our jeans and t-shirts and saw the fabulous water feature and fantastic marble entrance we felt slightly underdressed. The staff in the hotel were so friendly and nothing was too much trouble, our room was really quite large (compared to rooms you normally get in manhatten), the room was cleaned daily and you can borrow hairdryers/irons etc for free. The ice machines on the landings meant you could have a cool drink whenever you wanted (in April the temperatures reached 80 degrees), and you were left a complimentory newspaper everyday. The hotel is right next to Grand Central Station, so you have easy access for transport, and the staff in the hotel also gave us lots of info about sightseeing trips. They gave us information about a shopping outlet called Woodbury Common, this is about 1 hours busdriveand is a must for shopoholics - you can buy designer clothes at bargain prices. This hotel was just fantastic - ten out of ten

Reviews.Title: “They call this 4-star service?”
Reviews.Author: frozensky
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my guy friend March 2004. I told them it was essential we get 2 beds (I"m a girl), but they said there was none, so my guy friend had to sleep on a roller bed for 4 nights. Some floors were newly renovated, but we got the floor that was not. The room was tiny and run-down. It felt more like a 3-star. Then there came the smoke. The room next to us had people smoking like chimney and the smoke came through the door that link the two rooms together. This happened almost all four nights. I asked for another room, they said there was none, so I asked for an air filter. They sent a guy in with a air freshner and just briefly sprayed the room. Excuse me, they call that a solution? They want me to inhale the smoke along with synthetic fragrance! So at last, I had to just open the window while it was snowing outside. Staff aren't all that friendly, maybe that's a New Yorker thing? The hotel has a good central location, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “MY FIRST TRIP AND LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We Stayed here onSeptember 16 AND 17TH. It Was Our first visit to New York City and we could not have been more pleased. They let us check in at 10:00 A.M. (we got the hotel on priceline for $90 which was a great bargain). It was a beautiful room, exceptionally large for NYC and as clean as any 5 star hotel we have stayed in. We had 5 people in our room and were very comfortable. Staff was efficient and courteous. Would recommend this without reservation and hope to stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt from the 23/09/04 - 26/09/04 for the last part of our honeymoon. It was a very pleasant stay in NYC an esspecially at this hotel. We booked through Priceline but that was never mentioned. As we told them about our honeymoon they gave as a very large corner room on the 26. floor which was lately renovated. The room was very clean with one very large king-bed, a flatscreen TV, a desk and a big closet. Only the bathroom is a bit small and and I`m not sure, if the shower was also fully renovated. The bed was very convenient with a double-mattress and we slept very well after walking all day long through the streets of Manhattan. As some reviewer mentioned the fire alarm on 25.09. at 3.15 am: Yes there was an alarm and it wasn`t very nice to be woken up at that time. But in my opinion it`s better to once have an alarm where there`s no fire as no alarm when there`s one. Safety is extremly important, especially in such a large building. The direction of the hotel sent a letter of apology in the morning in every room. I would highly recommend the hotel. The rooms are very nice (the largest in our whole vacation) in some asian-style, the staff was very friendly and with the gold membership we could get a free coffee and newspaper each morning. The location ist also terrific - short walk to the times square, great food at Grand Central, the bus to the airport leaves across from the hotel and every express subway stops at GC. The lobby ist very impressing and as there`s some much security staff we allways felt very safe. Great Hotel in one of the best locations in NYC !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night ($120 through Priceline). Truly enjoyed my stay. All worked as should. I would gladly stay there again. Also, very much enjoyed the dinner at Django (Restaurant/Bar) which is close by (480 Lexington Ave).

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay! Great staff and rooms. Hotel is lovely. Couldn't have asked for a better location. Would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than earlier reviews would suggest”
Reviews.Author: OilersRule
Reviews.Content: The management at the Hyatt appears to have taken heed of some of the awful reviews on this site, as our experience with this hotel was excellent. I booked the Grand Hyatt via Hotwire, and was not aware of where we would be going until after I had committed. Earlier reviews of the hotel on this site had me concerned, but our stay was excellent. The location was as good as you could hope for in mid-town. Our room was very large by New York standards, and everything worked perfectly. Our check in was a breeze, and our limited interaction with the staff was all very pleasant. The four star designation is appropriate. For the right price, I would come back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here from Sept 28th thru Oct 1st, for 3 nights. The room was booked through Priceline, and we got a good rate. Check in was quick and easy. The lobby is large and fantastic, and really looks slick. There were a lot of convention attendees, but that is normal there. The room was great. Very large for NYC standards. The room had a comfortable queen bed, a view of the Chrysler building, and was on the 18th floor. The room was very clean and had a huge walk in closet. The TV was very nice, and had HBO and many other channels. The elevators were very prompt. The bathroom was pretty small, but very nice nonetheless. We also asked for a late check out on our last day, and they gave us an extra hour... which was perfect! All in all, I would absolutely stay here again without a doubt, and feel that the convenient location is also a plus. You can get to pretty much anywhere quickly from the Grand Hyatt. We will definitely be back to this hotel, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand the fuss????”
Reviews.Author: indiecritic
Reviews.Content: I, like many have read the previous reviews posted on this site. I also paid attention to the hotel's position based on reviews. This left me some what nervous as to what to expect..... I aquired my room from priceline--- at £50 ($90) per night. I stayed 3 nights on 11th August. Of course the rooms aren't large but they are certainly clean and free from the troubles of the previous reviews on this site. The hotel has grandure and more than suitable for the discerning traveller. The location couldn't be better. Visit the website. It is what you see, put your mind at rest.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for one night August 22, got a great deal through Priceline...our room was quiet, and very clean. I was only disappointed in our corner room with absolutely no view, but that was fine, it made sleeping easy with no noise or light to wake us up in the morning. The hotel is conveniently located in midtown right next to Grand Central Terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Grand Hyatt from August 11-15. We got a great deal via Priceline and the hotel was nicely updated and our room comfortably appointed. The staff was very helpful and the location is perfect; excellent access to subway and subway shuttle to Times Square. I would stay at the hotel on my next trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marge106
Reviews.Content: Went to NY with 2 adult daughters on vacation. We were there 3 nights July 26-29. Greeted warmly by all staff. We stayed on the Regency level. Room had 2 double beds. Both room and bathroom spotless. This hotel was just renovated. It looks like a brand new hotel. Perks... on regency level, in their club, breakfast is served, and from 5 to 7 there are Hors d'oeuvres. Well worth the extra money to stay on this floor. Lobby has great atrium and a Starbucks. Great location, near Times Square, theatres, and shopping . This hotel is attached to Grand Central Station. Only drawbacks to this hotel...... l. Not enough drawer space and bathroom has little space to put toiletries. 2. Lobby very cold. Too much air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed there for four nights, checking out august 2. we booked through priceline and got it for £70 a night. check-in was quick and staff pleasant. room was newly-refurbished and very comfortable. have stayed in a lot worse for a lot more money. location is great for exploring on foot and subway is underneath for sights further afield. recommended

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!”
Reviews.Author: ResortSpaLady
Reviews.Content: Ok, I have stayed here twice and both times it was dirty, dirty, dirty. Ugh. Yes, the lobby and the restaurants are very GOOD. Even the front desk and management are tops. One of the best concierge floors anywhere with great service and food. Nice fitness center. Great location but the rooms were just old and I dreaded returning to sleep. There are such mixed reviews on here that I wonder if there are some areas of the hotel that are renovated and some that are not? Unfortunately I got the worst both stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of the Big Apple!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a great location and recently renovated. Not sure what all the bad reviews are about. Our weekend stay (June 18-21) was fantastic. Service was great and staff were both friendly and helpful. Received a free newspaper every morning outside our room and free Starbucks coffee at the lobby coffee bar. ( For Gold Passport members). The hotel is right next to Grand Central so getting anywhere in the city is a breeze. We would definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hyatt's definition of "renovated" seems to be "lots of camel and beige paint" slapped onto a small concrete box of a room - it all looked a bit out of date actually (but maybe it's retro). Somewhat surpirisingly for an allegedly renovated hotel, broadband access is only available from 4 terminals in a rather seedy business center. I was here for a conference (and we all worried about the sparrow which had somehow made it to the ballroom for the duration). It is literrally next door to Grand Central (so it is easy to get about town). The staff were efficient, friendly and helpful. Restaurant and room service menus looked expensive and unexciting and if you are on the upper floors, you might need to wait a while for an elevator to arrive. This hotel is definitely geared up to the Corporate/conference attendee. The new beds are comfortable, the rooms are clean, but the place is just dull for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt was great. It was at a great location, close to 5th avenue and times square. It was beautifully decorated and very clean. It also had great service. There is also a starbucks in the lobby which was great as well. I dont understand how people can complain about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Grand Hyatt the first week of June. We had a great room, it was clean and pleasant. The maid service was excellent. We enjoyed the lobby, visiting with friends and just watching people. We had a grand breakfast every morning before we started our day in the city. Thumbs up for the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: LangStonR
Reviews.Content: I bought my room off of Priceline back in 2002. I had never heard of the Grand Hyatt before taking my family there. Everyone from the Valet attendant, to the Check In receptionist were polite and helpful. We stayed on the side right next to Grand Central Station. Not only is the hotel nice, but its right in the middle of Mid-town Manhattan. Right down the street from Times Square, but far enough that you have to deal with all the crap. I'd love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: july27th
Reviews.Content: I was anxious about staying at the Grand Hyatt after reading the reviews but the only negative comment I have is the smell of fresh paint at the RENOVATED room (which I strongly requested, by the way) on the 24th floor. Besides that, the location was perfect, the staff was friendly, and with a good deal I got from Priceline, I was quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Lame!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room with 2 double beds. When we checked in they gave us a room with one queen. I told them I'd reserved 2 beds and the lady was so rude - saying they didn't have any. She finally put us in a room with one King. We were early and couldn't check in yet - so we dropped our bags and when we came back later to pick up the key - they moved us back to a room with one queen. I complained again and they finally moved us to a room with a King again. I was staying with my Mom - I love her - but this was NOT ideal! The staff was totally rude - the room had a huge stain on the carpet, a yucky shower, trash in the garbage can (that wasn't ours). The only thing this hotel had going for it was the location.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure which hotels that others were reviewing, but after reading the negative reviews I feel as though we stayed in a different place! The Grand Hyatt exceeded our expectations. We got it for 93 dollars on Priceline. We were given a renovated corner room (after intially being offered a nonrenovated room-- request this politely at check in). It was gorgeous and spacious-- marble shower, down duvet on the king sized bed. Parking is expensive--40 dollars a day, but efficient and courteous. All staff were terrific. I would gladly stay here again, and recommend it enthusiastically.

Reviews.Title: “stay away from the hyatt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hyatt for 5 days in March and we thought the hotel was horrible. The hotel was clearly ONCE a grand hotel but is now in shambles. The carpet is full of holes and furniture in the lobby is very shabby. The front desk, door men, and bell boy were all rude. We booked it on Priceline for $150. For New York, that's cheap; but I would rather pay more and stay somewhere nicer. Our non-smoking room stank of cigarettes. The room, like the lobby, was in shambles too.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I had expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about our stay given the reviews I had read but I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in a great location and we found the staff very polite and helpful. I agree the corridors are a little sterile but what do you expect from a hotel this size? Our room had everything we needed, was roomy and comfortable. The hotel was busy during the weekend but the room we had was very quiet. All in all we had a very enjoyable stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, grubby and old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: BigDave40
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so dirty. Plaster falling off the room walls. Used toilet paper on the bathroom floor. Hair in the sink. We got a free upgrade and the replacement room was just as bad. It was awaful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't count on this being a Grand Hyatt facility!!”
Reviews.Author: Beardad
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment!!! Being a Hyatt Platinum Passport member I can honestly say that this is by far the worst Hyatt facility I have ever stayed in! This is by no means a four star facility. I had requested early check-in and a renovated room, which I was assurred had been set aside. Needless to say, upon arrival I had to wait until late in the afternoon to get my room, which was not renovated and looked like it had been decorated back in the 60's. Their Regency Club level was closed for remodeling, which they did not reveal at the time of booking. The room was very used in appearance, and housekeeping was spotty. The reception on the majority of the channels was unwatchable, and forget depending on a wake up call. Temperature controls are their obviously for decorative purposes only. Service at the desk was surly and an attitude in general of "who cares" was what they felt was proper service. To apologize for the inconvenience I was given some coupons for Starbucks. This is one Hyatt that will never see my business again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend to my worst enemy”
Reviews.Author: JudyColo
Reviews.Content: What a horrible property. My room was worn & dated, the sink did not drain, the shower had mildew and at 3:00 AM the battery in the smoke detector started chirping (apparently the hotel does not believe in preventative maintenance). TV reception did not work for channels 1-9 (including local networks) and the service was surly. I wouldn't wish this hotel on my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “How does this hotel ever rate 4 Stars?”
Reviews.Author: BostonGolfer
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Grand Hyatt a number of times because of the location, but this was the absolute worst. Groups of teenagers --packed 4 to a room -- take over the hotel on weekends. Even though the kids this weekend seemed nice, teenagers do party into the night and up and down the halls. We are Hyatt gold passport members, and not there on an internet rate, and they gave us an incredibly small room that had a really awful smell. The mattress was lumpy and the sheets were hospital quality.They are renovating, and that should help, but for now, I will look for something else in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got this room for a bid of $75 on Priceline for August 2. It was our anniversary weekend. While the hotel lobby was beautiful, after going down the hallways and into the rooms I sort of can understand everyone's complaints with this hotel. HOWEVER, I think that this place is fine to stay at, I just don't think it is worth the 4* rating. The halls were dingy, definitely needed some paint and re-hab. I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the room....nice size by NYC standards. The hotel was clean and staff was very pleasant. Location was great. I don't think that I would choose to stay here and pay the going rate, HOWEVER if I got this hotel again for a bid of $75.....I would absolutely be happy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt last night, and what a dump. We requested a non-smoking room and received a smoking room, which reeked of smoke. When we asked the front desk to change our room they refused, saying that it was a non-smoking room, but they have ashtrays in case someone wants to smoke. That is the most ridiculous thing I had ever heard. The staff was rude and could care less about helping you. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “No Big Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt was just okay. We stayed between Dec 29 - Jan 2. I am used to wishy washy hotels and this one was very middle of the road. The room was okay. We upgraded to a king sized room and it was not much bigger than a large walk in closet. The rooms were clean but it looked well worn. The corners of the room were a dust mites' playground. The bathroom is EXTREMELY small. This is a small thing but it always annoys me if a shower does not have a shelf or somewhere to store your shampoo or shower gel, needless to say my shower gel remained on the floor. The staff was friendly, which made the experience a lot better. FOOD: Room service is outrageous. A bowl of cereal for $8!!!! I think the hotel has a deal with the local restaurants and they kept recommending a bar down the street, which was okay but you will have better luck finding food on your own. (Try the diner on 47th and Lexington...excellent breakfast all day. Also, RAFFLES on Lexington is good too!) It was not bad but it was not good either. I would try a different hotel the next time I am in New York.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrissy077
Reviews.Content: I found the grand hyatt to be a very good hotel, the staff were all friendly and helpful should you need anything, the rooms a little basic but due to have a refit about now, but the lobby is gorgeous with eating breakfast with the waterfall by the saide of you was excellent. We went between christmas and new year and although one of the bars were closed due to quietness i presume there was more than enough places to eat and drink. Only thing i would mention about food is it was a bit pricey, i recommend unless you havent eaten all day try the kids menu cheaper and plenty of food. Cheesecake is to die for superb.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Hyatt New York
HotelInfo.Address: 109 East 42nd Street, Park Avenue at Grand Central Terminal, New York City, NY 10017
